author: {'steamid': '76561198062039171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1495, 'last_played': 1517434868}
review: Игра Супер но у нее есть огромное НО ! Игра очень сложная в осваении так как в начале есть очень короткая обучалка по типу как делать бинты и как соберать цветочки! а важных подсказок как сделать бронь или сковать что либо сложное уже нету! Если находиш какое либо обьяснение то оно напичкано научной или промышленной терминалогией " Игра только на Англиском " Игроку с базовым , средним или даже с розговорным англиским делать тут нечего, хотя с розговорным ещо можно попытатса когото словить чтоб он тебе все обьяснил, если он конечно захочет. Игра Смесь Ультима онлайн и Скайрим! Если б была Русская локализация то я б всех своих друзей на нее подсадил а они своих! Игра своим затворничеством тихо умерает а могла б получить сотни милионов игроков всего бывшего СНГ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199202649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2987, 'last_played': 1496765035}
review:
IF YOU WANT YOUR INFORMATION ON THE DARK WEB, go ahead and play this game... BUT you were warned. The game seems okay except for some basic crap such as: OVER - POWERED / over leveled characters (probably squeakers) going to the starting areas just to kill noobies trying to learn the game, some pretty stiff learning curves, and a few bugs, etc...

BUT the main reason I don't endorse this game is that my personal information was stolen by hackers because of the lack of security in this game coding. My username and password ended up on the dark web because of this game. I only found this out because of the identity service that I use contacted me about it. I had to change my passwords/usernames for a few things. I normally don't use the same one on all accounts, but have specific ones for this type of 3rd party scenario.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082743750', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 3336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1652252043}
review: Ignore the amount of hours I have here. I played back before it came on Steam and this is truly my favorite Sandbox MMO regardless of its optimization issues. I have had some of the best MMO memories here. Time for Mortal Online 2 to rise!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011709936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 27181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23619, 'last_played': 1587820350}
review:
This is one of the games that gives me massive anxiety to think about. Not because the game is hardcore, but because of the exploits, hackers, and the lack of GM's timely responses, you can lose thousands upon thousands of hours of work as an example, in a relatively short amount of time, and nothing will be done before or after that has happened. 

It has SUCH potential but falls completely flat on it's own face.

Also, the /rather/ toxic community does not help. (trust me, they're super toxic in their own special autistic meme-y kind of way. on purpose, there's no defending these people, like, hey, oh, well it's just role playing.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197994917853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 115486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109512, 'last_played': 1582520416}
review:
The hours speak for itself.

It's a first-person sandbox game similar to classics like Meridian 59 and Ultima Online.

The learning curve is ruthless and the player base is ruthless so bring some armor, a weapon, a few bandages and a little ambition and see what you can do to change the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280660985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 220140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184560, 'last_played': 1598300986}
review: I'm a PVE player, but the opportunities to PVP with a guild is fun. Plenty of PVE options in both islands. Gold and materials are plentiful for a support player like me. Theres a guild for everyone, every flavor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062946315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7115, 'last_played': 1573562764}
review:
I won't cherry coat it - I am lost. I am often confused. And I feel like I haven't even done anything at all... But I am having fun learning. The Haven community so far has been FAR more friendly and helpful than the Tindrem community was on my first attempt at playing! 
This game does NOT hold your hand at ANY point - but that doesn't have to be a negative.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022436414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1814, 'last_played': 1575319160}

author: {'steamid': '76561198263623485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 12336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10640, 'last_played': 1573284431}
review:
Игра исключительно не на русском языке. Эти бездельники, обслуживающие и обсасывающие эту игру, за столько лет не удосужились перевести её со своего убогого английского языка на Великий и Могучий Живаго Рускiй Язык. 
А потому, вы будете вынуждены знакомится с содержанием смысла каждой этикетки при помощи гугл переводчика, тратя на это своё время, пока остальные становятся сильнее. 

Баги и лаги - И того и другого в игре встречается много. вражеские НПС ходят через стены или вовсе исчезают, при этом нанося вам урон из неоткуда. Вы можете провалиться сквозь текстуры, а когда от бессилия выбраться убьёте себя - потеряете всё содержимое и коня, которого, пока вы лагали и багались - съели волки или какие иные звери, а вы его качали и кормили 4 дня или и того более. И восстановить своего коника у вас не получится. Удачи смелым.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097087526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1461219553}

review: I like the vast world, creatures, and other players that you come across. How everything you have can drop as you die adding more suspense and more fear to the game. The battles as guilds vs guilds is a blast! I highly recommend this is not a solo game. You need to band with a group, and don't travel alone unless you have the guts to do so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199629730', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4822, 'last_played': 1588129612}
review: This game is so awesome just wish i had more time to play the game and more friends to play this but i think with the new update the game will grow again 100/10 for me

author: {'steamid': '76561198060371483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1441169307}
review:
Don't waste your time with this shiny turd.  As soon as you leave the starting area, end game players are waiting to gank you until you decide to just log.  The mechanics are decent, graphics are okay, and the overall concept is really good.  However, without any kind of controls to prevent elitist pricks from griefing newbies, the game loses its luster in the first 30 minutes of play.

If you don't have friends who already have high-end gear to help protect you (you lose all loot and gear if you die), this game simply isn't worth it.

If you want an open sandbox MMO with lots of PvP...go play Black Desert Online.

review: To be honest you don't need a subscription at all, since the limitations are very minimal. The game can seem very confusing at first, reason being that there isn't anything to guide you, but other players are very helpful. Stick with it for a couple hours and you will LOVE it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988035103', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1076, 'last_played': 1572463966}
review:
I did not play this game in the vanilla days but instead started playing this week.
Im fascinated by the level of detail and things you can do and get better and from a sanbox rpg perspektiv, skills that you can get better at are for example Meditation, combatmanuvering, momentum, breathing skill, and diffrent types of crafting skills like fishish, woodcutting etc. Ive only seen the realworld and been in it for a short while before the patch but the haven world is big and lots of stuff to explore and learn. If you like a game with questhelper, arrows and directions exsactly where to go that either makes it more practical or straight up dumbs down the experience this is not a game for you. You will have to give it time to learn and use the compass to be able to navigate in the game. The combat is good but not great, the mecanics are okey with the parry timing and deppending on where you cut or spike you do more dmg. I heard that pvp is one of the  fun parts though and i havnt tried it yet. Since its a unique game with full loot you will need to contact some of the vets and reach out joining guilds i think to be able to manuver around the game saftly, you will have a bank to save your stuff in but ones your not a flegdling the game can be pretty brutal and you either like it or not. It has no questlog which is a bit strange but you kind of improve and make favours later i think, you think alot by yourself what to do, so to speak, and lots of things you can do to make gold in the game. I liked that it i felt that your learn skills and get better at it, thats how it is with most games but this the devs I guess really wanted to you feel that you start with nothing and get better and better. You can craft armours and name them.You craft both right and left hand not couples.

I have a pretty decent computer with geforce 1070, i want to max it but i had to bring some things down abit cause otherwise the combat lagged sometimes. Also the game crashed ones but I think they can work on that, haven is more steady now then in the beggining. Besides that i actually think that atleast in haven some places are beautiful with the sun and enviorment, animals etc, hope they will have the attention, effort and money to make Mo2 good and not rushed then it could actually be one of the hitgames of 2020-2030.  Some things are abit too much sandbox I  think, for example I was trading with a merchant, and I wanted to buy a pickaxe and it  was denied so i thought it was a bug but I had to press "I" and put the money inside the "sell box" then put the pickaxe in the buy box. Sure in real life you take up your wallet and give the shopkeeper or whatever money they dont take it out of your wallet but I had to ask the helpchat cause i didnt know. So etiher make it clear that your mental for the sandboxRPG aspect and thats how it should be or let the trade happen automaticly like other games.

There are some balances that they have to attend to i heard like mounts being op to fight from and boring to fight with so lets see how it progresses. 
It has no skins or such so they deppend on subscribers and i think it should be some ethical way to buy skins or pet skins that does not remind you around every corner that you should buy it but the option should exist to support them with smal one time fees if you like the game and give it time but still dont want to subscribe.

If you are intressed or like some of the things I said its definitly worth trying, the community was nice to me and a discord exists also.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008462824', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 64536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55546, 'last_played': 1582585261}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032196407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 976, 'last_played': 1571025053}
review:
I enjoyed myself playing game alot.......untill i found out a few things.

I guess most of this is more personal.....game breaking for me,but then again what are reviews anyway so..........

My first issue (and the biggest for me)  
The game is limited with remapping your controls.  I use the arrow keys to move so I like to use right shift and ctrl .....it is closer to my fingers than the left ones hahaha   
not in this game.....you try to use thos keys it defaults it back to left.
I can NOT use the extra keys on my gaming mouse.  Sure the game tells me I have mapped something to them but no matter what gets mapped to them....they do nothing

this alone is game breaking for me

the second issue I have.....
the subscription and char slots have NOTHING to do with each other.each is payed for indavidually. 
I for one like to have many toons that do diff things.....im not paying 9$ each to do that.......then the subscription fee. 
I know I dont have to pay for the sub.......however if i want to compete in PvP (the game is for the most part open PvP) with equally skilled/geared player (and when lucky better player than myself) then them 40 extra skill point matter.

not game breaking ......however......nickle and dimming your player base is just a shitty thing to do.

some games get the micro transactions right.....others dont


if some day they correct the key mapping issues ill come back and play this again.......ill even spend money doing it , but I cant play a game i can set the controls where i want.    I know the game is a few years old but not so old where this should even be an issue

author: {'steamid': '76561198003818180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1599, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1570553679}
review:
Mortal Online is a hostile game in every way, so if you do not have patience, time and, above all, money to pay for the subscription, it is very likely that you will not get hooked.

Being "free to play" you will not lose anything to try it (well yes, time). I think that in general and although I can't particularly place myself at any of the extremes, it is from those games that you either love it or hate it. And if you love him, you can love him very much. It is not my case, although I do not hate it either. I simply believe that evil outweighs good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010264007', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 6113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1570704411}
review:
This game is stupid but so funny.

Imagine a world of god like people and you're just an average fantasy joe. Trying to pay your fantasy bills. You as a free to play player; Will spend most of your time in and around the slums, gardens or graveyard sleeping on the cold ground and getting pick pocketed by other players "SOBs" while you are sleeping because they have nothing better to do. You want to go outside of town? Well good luck ever getting back with something valuable, because people camp the gate and KoS like MF.

Proximity voice chat is filled to the brim with classy communications and worthwhile conversations that will make want to rip your eardrums out and dull your faith in humanity. 

The material processing and crafting is pretty legit, I'll give it that.

I rate it an 8/8 because It's gr8 b8 m8

author: {'steamid': '76561198013310016', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1550684099}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057311340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 34171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26533, 'last_played': 1586075551}
review:
I would not recommend this game, yet. It still has a long way to go before it's deserving of money or time spent in it. The game is fun, but the bugs and poor scripting just overshadows any fun or interest the game can offer. The AI exceptionally terrible, enemies will run 30 feet away from you just to swing and hit you from that distance. 

The support team is nonexistant, I paid for a month of game time and enjoyed it but when I went to pay for a second month it said it could take anywhere from 2 hours to 2 days to complete the transaction IF the payment was successful. It was not and there is no way to cancel the payment, nor is there a way to actually purchase another month. I contacted the support team 3 days ago about it and apparently they do not care about making money because it still isn't resolved.

Overall I give the ideas and originality of the game an 8/10.
The implementation and creation of the ideas get a 3/10.
The staff get a 1/10 and they should be happy they even get that, if they even exist. I haven't been able to contact anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086133719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1565183652}
review:
Ci ho giocato a casa di un mio amico poichè per arcani motivi il mio computer non riesce a farlo andare questo maledetto gioco.
Eppure soddisfo pienamente i requisiti minimi, non avrei alcun problema, ma dopo 9 minuti di bug mi è passata la voglia e ho disinstallato il gioco.
Sì, ci ho giocato in altre occasioni, ma purtroppo la mia esperienza è questa:
QUESTO GIOCO PENZOLA!
E' PIENO DI BUG, IL MOUSE SI BLOCCA SEMPRE, LA TELECAMERA FA SCHIFO, I MOVIMENTI SON SIMILI A QUELLI DI UN TRONCO ESTIRPATO DAL SUOLO.
I COMANDI, UNA TRAGEDIA.
L'HO SCARICATO PER GIOCARCI CON AMICI, IL RISULTATO E' CHE TUTTI LO HANNO DISINSTALLATO.
E' FREE TO PLAY MA PAGHI 12€ AL MESE PER POTER GIOCARE.
PAGANDO SEI DIO, MA NON PER SCHERZO.
LA GRAFICA POTEVA ANCHE ESSER MIGLIORATA, MA NON ME NE FREGA DELLA GRAFICA SE UN GIOCO FA CAGARE FIN DA PRINCIPIO.
PER NON PARLARE DEI BUG DURANTE I COMBATTIMENTI, GIOCATORI CHE SI IMPALLANO, CAVALLI CHE VOLANO, DAMAGE HIT DA 5 METRI, TU CHE TI RIPARI MA GLI AVVERSARI TI COLPISCONO LO STESSO, NON TOGLI UN CAZZO DI DANNO EPPURE LI COLPISCI.
MERDA PURA, SE FOSSE STATO FATTO CON GAME GURU LO AVREI ANCHE PERDONATO, MA E' STATO FATTO CON UNREAL E MI PREOCCUPA STA COSA.
E MI PREOCCUPA IL FATTO CHE CONTINUA AD ESSER AGGIORNATO, MA I SERVER CONTINUANO AD ESSER FALLATI.
IL PEGGIORE "MMO HACK AND SLASH NON SO COME DEFINIRLO" CHE ABBIA MAI PROVATO.
E IO PENSAVO CHE REIGN OF KINGS FOSSE BUGGATO, MA CASPITA... QUESTO LO SUPERA DI GRAN LUNGA.
E MI DOMANDO COME FACCIA AD ESSER ANCORA GIOCATO.
AH NO, NON CI GIOCA PIU NESSUNO.
DA SPUTARCI SOPRA AD UN GIOCO DEL GENERE, UN GIOCO FALSO PROPRIO

review:
i downloaded , agreed to the terms, then launched the game..the game directed me to the game owners website to set up an acct. and then i got this :  Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead

Firefox detected an issue and did not continue to account.mortalonline.com. The website is either misconfigured or your computer clock is set to the wrong time.

It’s likely the website’s certificate is expired, which prevents Firefox from connecting securely. If you visit this site, attackers could try to steal information like your passwords, emails, or credit card details.

What can you do about it?

Your computer clock is set to 7/22/2019. Make sure your computer is set to the correct date, time, and time zone in your system settings, and then refresh account.mortalonline.com.

If your clock is already set to the right time, the website is likely misconfigured, and there is nothing you can do to resolve the issue. You can notify the website’s administrator about the problem.   

oh well...20 minutes of downloading, 5 minutes of reading terms and conditions...and now, the uninstall begins . SAD

author: {'steamid': '76561198106120410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 97789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72724, 'last_played': 1694861568}
review:
[strike]Diverse crafting, a gigantic world with open world dungeons. There are no loading screens apart form the one that you have when entering the game and when you go to the other continent. I stronlgy urge you to play this game

Warnings:

"Free" in this game means unlimited-limited trial. That means unlimited time, limited abilities. Or infinite limited trial if you'd like. Your skills are capped at 60 as a free 2 play. You cant craft good weapons, so don't. Paying for this game is somewhat expensive, but it is pretty worth it. Well, it would be if the game had more than 100 or so players.

Apart from the skill caps: theres barely anything else that a subscription does. Only other things would be thievery, wich makes it so you can steal shit from other's inventories like gold and jewels etc. You also get to own a house when you sub.

This game does not hold your hand. It's not for pussies, low-effort-mmo players and the like. Full loot system means you lose everything upon death.

And you will die.

And again.

And again.

And you will cry, but that's okay.

This game ain't pretty, and it's full of bugs, but there's nothing quite like it out there. Give it a try, will ya. Community is pretty supportive of new players. (Seeing as we need new ones because the game is barely holding up.)[/strike]

conclusion: dead game. dont play. staff don't know how their own game works. let it finally go to rest

author: {'steamid': '76561198080219664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 18730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7447, 'last_played': 1689750798}
review:
To start, let me say this: mortal online is not a game for everyone. This is a game that will punish you for small things, and a game that will make you truly work HARD for what you want, especially as a f2p. 

I have been playing since mid 2k15. It definitely took me a month or two to decide I liked the game, and it's taken me years to learn everything I should know about nave. 

Before you continue reading, I recommend trying the game first, rather than taking others experiences as the best route.

Yes, many rumors about this game are true, such as a fairly unresponsive staff and a few *minor* bugs (a friend of mine crossed the bridge and ended up in belrim lol), and an extremely toxic empire known as RPK has ownership of ~70% of the map. However, these things often don't matter when you and your friends are genuinely having a blast killing giant grasshoppers.

Now for the subjective part of the review:
This game truly is wonderful, once you get around it's, uh, quirks. This is true open world freedom, there are no official restrictions, you can do as you wish. There are many guilds you can join in order to band together with others, dozens of character builds, and hundreds of hours of gameplay in the exploring alone, let alone dungeons, grinding, bosses, PvP, and crafting. This is the best game I have played, and I have decent amount if games on steam alone. Best of all, if you really know what your doing, p2p or a sub isn't even necessary.

Just download it and try, play a few hours. Don't let the pkers steer you away, there's always a way out of a situation in mortal online. Thanks for coming to my ted talk

author: {'steamid': '76561198378801238', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1650595982}

author: {'steamid': '76561198253550666', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1295, 'last_played': 1596833905}
review:
Dead? Not quite
Bad? Down to Opinion
Buggy? A bit
Fun? Hell yeah
Good Graphics? It's better than Oblivion but worse than Skyrim
How Difficult? Think of this as the Dark Souls of MMO RPGs. It's hard to learn, you die Easily, and if you don't take your time and get very angry at the game quickly, you'll end up in RPK or quitting the game because of how shit you became. This game requires time and patience to learn, you may not be fast or Strong at first, but if you level those skills you'll not complain about them any more. Or you could gram a Mount.
Is it grindy? Kinda, you need to grind certaint actions/read books to get better at the game and to get better Materials but you can take it at your own pace as there is not a single quest in the entiraty of the game
How's the Community? It's not Toxic if you're in the right part of the map. Just watch out for people with RPK under their name
What is the Games Possibilities? You can be a Necromancer Archer who crafts armour and then the Next day Be a Tamer who is a Expert at one hand. My friend also became death
All in all I'd recommend it for people with time and patience.  Fun game that's hard to learn

author: {'steamid': '76561198096418739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1558065628}
review:
Games r getting more deceiving as time goes by

Didn't even see it coming until I had already downloaded the game, watched a video for beginners cuz apparently this game doesn't hold ur hand, all hyped up and shit

Finally launched the game, got redirected to site cuz I had to make an acct from there. Which is fine by me
Put my name, password, email and whats this?... 
First name, sirname, birthdate? I wonder what those are fo- oh.. a subscription, wonderful

No where was that ever made known to me that you are restricted as a free player until you cough up money for a paywall
I'm sure it was definitely my lack of research and not the games fault for not making that information known until the last second, there's no way they tucked it away on purpose knowing it'd drive players away

I'm not asking for money to grow on trees, for unicorns to vomit rainbows with a pot of gold at the end.
I would rather buy the game for $30-$50 and just have it, than to know I'm subscribed to it and not be able to play it for most of my day, just as regular people with lives and jobs can't

Nothing worse than feeling chained down to an anchor that leeches off your wallet

review: This is the only MMO I play anymore.  After playing MO, I found all others child's play.  Expect the complexity and depth of Eve Online and the ruthless players community of pre-Trammel UO and Darkfall.  I actually have about 5X the number of hours played shown on my Steam chart on this game, having started connecting via Steam only recently.  Players population is low currently, but expect it to bump up when the newbie island is released.  Actually, it is a good time for new players to join and learn the game right now, with lot fewer gankers and griefers hindering your progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027261823', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 29055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28951, 'last_played': 1601051096}
review:
Ok ~ So I Looooved this game.

Keep in mind however, I spent most of my time PvEing


All these people saying "You need to subscribe" are all shenanigoons.
I have Hundreds of hours and I've never subscribed.

----------------------------------------Things you need to pay for -------------------------------------------

-Creating a guild

-Building houses/keeps

-Pickpocket other players

-Top Tier Armor/weapon crafting

-You can only level skills to 60, but I see this as almost a blessing It only really affects mount speed/stam
                                                   (I'll get more into this later)

-Being a super late game mage that knows every necromancy spell and can change the weather


-------------------------------------------Things you can still do as FTP-----------------------------------

-Join a guild (YES even if you're free to play you can still farm hunt and tame animals, they would LOVE to have you)

-Explore the game and fight the majority of enemies, I've been in many guilds and have seen a LOT of the end game content.

-Kill other players, even if they pay to play. (This takes a bit of skill and knowledge however, I will explain later)

-Become rich----You might not make as much gold as some of these top tier craftsmen, but taming animals and adventuring for materials (Animal hides, plants, drops ect.) can make you a fortune. 

-Having a house---You might not be able to build a house, but I've been in guilds where they've made a guild shack where I wanted that I could use pretty much the same way as a house. 

-Have sweet pets--- As a FTP tamer I've tamed/dominated bears, demon dogs, wolves, crazy ride-able lizards, mammoth rhinos, yaks and a bunch of others.


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

                                                          FREE TO PLAY TIPS

So, first off your skills... as a Free to play your skills cap at 60, which definitely limits you but at the same time opens a whooole world of crazy possibility.

For example every player F2P or P2P has the same amount of points available to spend. So while a P2P might have 100 in maces and 100 in riding and 100 in armor you know what they don't have ? 

60 in taming
60 in swimming
60 in magic
60 in archery

But you don't have 100 riding or riding stam control which really sucks, I say put points into swimming(No one has swimming) and fight near water 

ect ect...

So you just need to be sure to lock your skills at 60 !!!!!
With all those extra points you can spec into many different things. Pick whichever you like :)



--But in all honesty if you want to join the big PVP guilds and just do team deathmatch all day you will probably want to pay.
--They do wars, and as a F2P most of your PVP will be 1v1 - 3v3 in the wilderness type stuff



Now To make money as a FTP early game can be tricky. Taming animals is definitely viable, there are donkeys which can get you started but if you don't want to tame you can:

---Farm heads like a pleb to get your skills up
---Get to meduli and pick up Bor, seadew and Cactus and whatever else you can find in the area just south by the water

---Once you get enough gold buy some armor and a mount, maybe read a skill book or two then go adventure and explore!!!



                       -----If you are afraid of getting ganked head into the desert------

--Go south of Tind and Meduli near the coast and go across the bridge to the Desert. Head to the Big ass tree in the distance and then go north west. 
-You will see a huge desert town, outside of the town and all around the desert there are Toghair plants, they are stalky and full of pink orbs you cant miss em
-Gather and sell those. Once you get enough gold for armor and a mount start practicing mounted archery on deer(springbok) until you can hunt the Ratzar workers
And just go from there killing different mobs. (Ratzar hunters will wreck you until your skills are maxed, they have nasty range)

If you die in the desert it's okay ! just ghost to the desert town and respawn there. I've almost NEVER been killed by another player in the desert you will be safer.

Except you may be eaten by Ratzar... or Die to heat exhaustion... I personally like it more than the mainland.

                  -------But there is SERIOUSLY so much to do even as a free to play---------
               
              I'd say at least try it, It feels to me like a multiplayer Oblivion without Quests

review:
정말 재밌는 게임. 

일정 수준 영어를 구사할 줄 알아야 원활하게 플레이 할 수 있음. 
정보 공유가 잘되는 게임은 아니지만 게임사 포럼 참고하면 기본적인 캐릭터 빌드업 가능.
신뢰할 수 있는 친구를 만드는 게 핵심적임. 절대 혼자서 상위 던전 플레이나
안정적인 PvP 못함.
PvP를 위주로 플레이 하기 위해서는 성향 맞는 길드에 들어가야지 레드 플레이어로도
기본적인 상점 이용가능함.

포럼에 따르면 곧 MO2 나온답니다. 출시하면 MO1 서버 밀꺼라니까 지금 시작할 분들에게는
권하지 않습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095264283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1558067155}
review:
I played a tiny bit at launch off steam and lost interest because of life happenings. Went back recently and kicking myself I didn't stick with it years ago.
 It really fills that hole for needing a hardcore MMO that doesn't hold your hand. There's a very active community once you leave the starting areas. Some will gank you, others are excited and willing to help newcomers get a foot in. 
If you're sick of WoW clones that only care about graphics, copy/paste Rust and Ark survival games, all Battle Royaled out, and need something that is actually both challenging and rewarding, I'd suggest giving it a try. 
It's basically what you would get if Darkfall and Ultima Online had a dark bastard child.
Combat builds are complex and in depth. Crafting and farming is labour intensive but worth it. Crafters actually matter a great deal in this game unlike current "sandbox" games. *cough* Archeage/BDO *cough*
Also an actual sandbox MMO where tamers are highly warranted and needed, which means you can make a living off of hunting out rare mounts, taming, and selling for a lot.
Join the Discord and chat with the vets. There's actually quite a bit of new players to get in with right now as well.
If you like "old school" type of games, you'll enjoy this one a bit.
If you're a cry baby, you probably won't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198817543647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 157048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32704, 'last_played': 1682642493}
review: Give the game a try, It's not for everyone, though it is my favorite game. If you like hardcore gaming this is it. Fairly realistic game play though very buggy at times. Outdated and somewhat abandoned the game is truly immersive and rewarding if you put in the effort. The start is somewhat slow especially if you've never played this genre. Though with time and patience you will master your skills or get wrecked in the process {all part of the game}. Biggest tip i can give you is do not get attached to your items. This game is a sandbox mmorpg where you lose your items on death though you can get them back if they haven't been looted. Some times it may feel dead, which i am not denying, but at certain times especially the weekends you will see a decent amount of people online. i Play almost everyday and usually have someone to play with even if i just meet them. Don't be afraid to explore though i would recommend starting in the city of Tindrem and reading some books first and build up a bit of your stats so you have a fighting chance against creatures and players. Tindrem is an interesting place and i believe it be fairly populated and you will have just about everything you need to get started. You can become a thief, fighter mounted and on foot, you can perform ranged combat on horseback as well on foot. Magic is in this game though it's a little pricey for reagents though the starting books are cheap. I also recommend you complete the tutorial. You get to choose a "class" though its not locked. It just gives you a book and a weapon depending on what you choose will determine the book and weapon. You will also be given 50 silver which can buy some books as well. Books will continue to be read even while you are off line. You can level other skills while reading books.The combat is similar to the Mount and Blade series. As well as The Elder's Scrolls series, more like morrowind and oblivion imo. But online and more buggy :). In total i would rate this game 7/10. Reason being that the developer's have abandoned the game almost. They do have a small team working on the game though if i'm being honest they don't really fix much instead add unfinished items or mess something up while trying to fix something else. The game has been around over 10 years now and is not as populated as it once was and some of the people who do play are not the most noob friendly though there are more who do than don't almost everyone you meet is not out to get you though  i would not turn your back until your certain they are your friend and even then always helps to be careful. I would recommend this to any player who has patience and is seeking to have adventures of sorts. Very fun game especially when you realize how huge the world is. I've been playing around a year and haven't even seen 20 percent of the world and i know players who have seen close to the same who have been playing far longer than i have. I'm always learning new things in this game and cannot get enough sometimes it is bad hehe. Go ahead and give it a try it is free do if you don't like it it wont affect you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039074246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9652, 'last_played': 1513897559}
review:
The entire concept of this game is great, and if it was executed right it would be amazing. The right amount of punishment (it could back off, rn it's too easy to grief new players,) and the right amount of player intervention in the map. Some player factions can do things like block off passes with their walls, if they made walls harder to make this would have been a great idea. PvP and PvE could have been slightly better, but understandable for the scale they were trying to push. 

However the issue was with the hacking and breach against the developers that had all our account info stolen. On top of that, none of the issues above are being pushed at all by the commanders. This game could have been one of the best hardcore survival MMOs. The gaming community needs one, but this one couldn't pull it together. Hopefully one comes in the future, one like this one that punished death just as hard, and had a world that you could explore. Only local chats, etc etc. The whole premise of this game was great, just turned out to have so much bad shit against it. (Another annoying thing was mounts getting bred to the point that they were too glitchy, should have been caps on speed being insane, would have totally been fine with getting trampled by massive mounts.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197965505159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 11444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11145, 'last_played': 1482556840}
review:
(tl;dr at end)

Successful gameplay requires trusted friends to prevail, yet the community is toxic because there is more to be gained in the short term from killing a friendly player than from helping them. This has created a large group of players who treat the game like a death match where everyone is kill on sight. The end result of this division in community creates an exciting and rewarding experience for loyal guild players but a steep entry for new players.

Fair warning: I put a lot of my time into this game, expanding and leveling my abilities, equipment and character build and I tried recommended pve and pvp builds yet I never felt powerful or sufficiently rewarded for my effort so when I stopped playing this it left me wondering why I wasn't playing something else. The sense of accomplishment in this game is definitely ethereal and heavily fleeting, much worse than the same from any other MMO I have played.

tl;dr: This is EVE, for fans of Game of Thrones, who also enjoy anatomically correct naked bodies. A solid 5 out of meh. More fun than a chat room. Great fun for and easily won by a team of friends which is why I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072316304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4466, 'last_played': 1551608375}
review: Hi im not going to pretend i know everything about the game because i dont. i just think this game gets an awful lot of negative comments for silly reasons. yes the game can be unstable yes it can be severely brutal to new players especially. but once you get a little bit into the game there is literally a mountain of skills to learn and increase a vast crafting and in depth crafting at that. It has a house building and guild territory and war system. i agree it is incredibly tough to get to grips with all aspects of the game but at least try it i mean its free right? i have started ad stopped this game for many of the reasons people complain about but i recently started it up with a friend and next thing i know im 40 hours in with a ariety of pets and a large knowlege of hoe the game works but like i said it DOES require time to take it all in. Basically all im saying is dont just judge a game on its faults judge it also on its possitives. i know im probably gonna recieve a hell of a lot of hate but i really dont care as someone who was a hater of this game after getting a lot further in i generally cannot recommend this game enough for people who dont just want a generic mmorpg game with constant kill this creature return to questgiver crap as thats (in my opinion) repetitive. S yeah mortal online gets my vote its now up to you people to decide ti try it or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148654473', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2428, 'last_played': 1571368152}
review:
Man, this game is a mixed bag.  

I've been on and off with this game for a long time now, back in 2014 and before playing on steam originally so my hours aren't fully reliable.  This game can either really love you and give you something unique that no other game or MMO can give you, or it'll abuse you and make you frustrated.  The game itself is pretty great, they've also fixed a bunch of problems from the past and they've been trying to keep the game alive and fresh, and the PVE content is fantastic.  

Here are some good examples.  You have various dungeons all over, the fighting of enemy mobs is simple but rewarding and once you build yourself up you start feeling like a somebody, rather than some homeless man that can't do anything.  The skill system is another nice feature that lets you actually feel like you developed into what you were aiming for, as crafting and focusing on trade skills will develop yourself into a actual smith or miner or gatherer or builder or whatever you want.  You can for example be a butcher, which you start off by butchering animal carcasses you kill, selling the products of what you get from the carcasses, make money, purchase carcasses from people after putting a buy order up, then slowly build yourself up as you make more money and improve, then that smith will use your materials to do the exact same thing to make armor or weapons for people or to put on the broker as a source of income.  The economy is fantastic, it forces players to help players and it brings the community together in a way.  Everyone has their role in the world, and adventurers and explorers are also valuable.  

The big part that really brings the game down, but not too much, is the PvP.  For example, you can get looted whenever after death by anyone due to it's full loot system.  Now that isn't bad, and it does promote pvp which is good, but the pvp itself can be a little messy.  You have to block at the right time in the direction someone is swinging to parry the blow, and then hit them, meanwhile both of you are running around and the game itself isn't too good at managing what's happening because of the map nodes and just server lag.  Yet again that's no reason to really stop playing as you can always rebuild in the game and come back.   You just have to be prepared to get griefed hard and fast by players that only care about killing people because it's fun to them.  For example there's a certain guild, probably the biggest one called RPK that focuses on killing people, because they love having the freedom to do whatever they want, especially killing people.  It's a noble in a sense as they believe you should do what you want, but it's often only to kill players for no good reason.  You could be watching a duel going on and be completely naked and still get killed.  Does that mean you should give up? Nope.  

The bottom line is that you should come in expecting the wildest encounters, as you can meet some really funny people and have some great experiences that you wouldn't expect, but you should also understand you'll get abused hard, even if you're a cautious player.  Don't get me wrong, not all RPK is bad, or other guilds that focus on PVP, as I've met a bunch that were pretty cool, but there's always going to be that one guy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198217202181', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 828886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684664, 'last_played': 1614123306}
review: Not a hold your hand game, if your looking for Skyrim here keep moving. That being said the GAME is a good game, a new experience from other types of pvp games seemed way more personal than anything with some good rivalries and great pvp moments. It's more set around group play but can be done solo but your gonna need some friends or the grind will be slow. Mortal has one big flaw when it comes to the open market that is easy to grief players who wanna be like salesman some prevail but many fail exp. Crafting bad stuff price flux and renaming books have plauged the market. Also the map reasources are just randomly scattered with no real thought to player economy. Map is also pretty empty some town lack uniqueness and are dull lack of events town champions or any kind of real ownership is killing it. The pvp is nice it seems quite skillful as a game can get what some people fail to understand it's hard to balance weps in games cause in real life these things were never balanced to match your opponent you just found a wep better than your enemies and smashed em with it. Now there are some just dump truck stuff they hauled in but for the most part I think it's fairly balanced with the weps. now the magic is a whole half rejected half admired thing in the game they have balanced it at one point and then destroyed it another fat mages are class I don't think was fully intended these are mages that go over weight scraficing movement for Max intellegence and psyche resulting in being hit 70 every 5 seconds  from range on a mounted horse so that movement penalty means dick pretty much a op character. Alot of fixes need to be made but the game they have can be iconic just hire bigger team, outsource advertise, listen to community. Ez win thumbs up cause its a GOOD game. Is it a GOOD dev team... Yet to be seen..

author: {'steamid': '76561197985956528', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1420, 'last_played': 1606774013}
review:
I will not say that the game is bad, dead or anything like other players saying, since everyone knows that they are true. 

We all know that the game is for hardcore gamers. And we have to accept that. 
The thing that I want to ask you is to try and persuade the developers to make it free. They don’t understand that this game will have a lot of potential if they make it free. Nowadays people are not used to play this kind of games and won’t spend their money easily for subscription. They will play a free game and pay for in-game items (I don’t mean pay to win items).
So, about the review.

Monthly Subscription.
The game is free, this is plus point right? But wait.... You develop your skills up to 60, You can't build houses. You can't use thievery. And of course, like the developers said "Every player gets one free character slot, and you can purchase additional slots up to a maximum of four". 
So, I would say thank you about the one-character slot, you are so generous.
You are kidding me, right? Paying 9$ for every slot plus a subscription which allow me to tell you that the price is EUR 14.25 (incl. VAT EUR 2.85) while World of Warcraft or other companies have their subs in EUR 12.99 (in $ its 16,25$ for MO and 14,81$ for WoW). Include also what possibilities each company offers you in-game.  So, another gold digger company I would say. And for the last let me tell you that there are a lot of people who are using hacks. And some of them are here with the "recommend comments"

About The Graphics.
The game has one of the best texture graphics that I have seen. Being an old player and checking a lot of games I can say that the game has one of the best "world" graphics. 
The character graphics, physics, and animations are bad but if they improve their engine, they can make them one of the best. Describing the towns and scenery in my opinion I have to say that they are one of the best out there. For players who come from other games I can tell you that the "world" textures are similar with The Elder Scrolls Online.

Let’s skip the part of creation of character which you need a lot of in-game time to choose what race is better for what you want to do. 

First Time Log In.
The game is not very understandable since you are thrown in the game and you don’t know what to do at the beginning. The tutorial is poor so not worth mentioning. If you are waiting for other people to help you.... naaah the help system is so bad but, there is the 1% that are helpful. This is very bad because the game basically is moved by the players (quests, jobs, market). So, after many hours (not kidding) you will find your way.

Since I said about the way I have to mention that the game has no map (You can find one online but it’s not updated with resources or creatures or staff like that).
The stats about every item are not understandable and you need a lot of reading to understand them and of course craft them. Recipes like another reviewer said are sold for real money (That’s how you understand that one game is destroyed).

Physics.
Physics of mounts and players are bad. Seriously sometimes mounts are bugged and will not stop from running that you have to press repeatedly R button to dismount or run towards an obstacle (also with equipment and skills).
I love seeing new people dropped from their mounts while they are repeatedly press to stop or run faster. The animation is so ridiculous.
NPC sometimes will hit you from too far with melee attacks and after that they will come closer (believe me I mean it when I say that they hit you from far with melee attacks). Their hits are not visible but after some time you will learn to parry them with fantasy since first comes the damage and random it shows you the movement.

Last but not least I have to say that the game is worth trying out ONLY for FREE.
I don't recommend paying for this since there are more worth games out there to pay for them.
The only thing I want to ask from developers is for better improvement of the game like I said before and make it free at last after almost 9 years. In these 9 years they resolved some bugs but after 9 years the game is the same. Absolutely the same game with no graphic changes, not improvements. Only they added some staff like building. What they worth if the peak online population daily is around 40 people?
For other developers I have to ask them to make the same game with these changes.
I believe that if they ask for donations to make the same game from the beginning with better all the above people will support them because they need games like that.
I hope one day we will have one worth Mortal Online. 
Have a nice gaming life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117610146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3926, 'last_played': 1547117107}
review:
The game is dead. Not because nobody plays it, it's dead because everyone in it is no longer human. I, the co-founder of the CockFighters, can not take it anymore. We created a guild to rival the imfamous RPK, but by the time we created a base. RPK struck us down like animals. Deeeeee, my cousin, was the legend of tindrum. He fought for the good, and me and him raised and guided armies of 1000s to fight for our cause. Everyday, RPK would raid peacefull villages and leave nothing but blood. We fought for Tindrum in the most world changing war MORTAL ONLINE has ever seen. The Great War of Mortal, it was called. Deee and I fought RPK at the gates of tindrum, saving millions of lives. Commanded Ships, sent groundtroops, even invented spells to grant us victory. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ht5Z7Ls0CBA&list=PL09S7DfMeH2ATrST7DKC47F93mPuEMTgj
....RPK has won, taken our armies apart. And with that, we were alone once more. The world of Mortal will never be the same. In our last efforts, Deeee and I invaded their mainbase as an army of 2. We were able to take down 2 Navy Commanders, and one wargod. But before we were able to take down RPK's King, we were caught on the headgod's bridge. We fought bravely, but after taken several arrows to the head. I fallen into the river. As I slowly bleed out, Deeee's anger emerged as he saw his cousin die. Tears ran down his face, as his worn shortsword began to glow. The blade his wield, transformed to the legendary weapon the SWORD OF TEARS. He took two slashes and whipped out half RPK's Army along with their airborn and navy fleets. He fell into the river behind him, and sank down. Legend says the Deeeee's amulent and My cape is still at the bottom of the lake. The amulent granted the user the strength of 1000 men, and the cape was said to give a man a power of the gods. 
If you are listening, you are now cursed with the mission to stop rpk for good.
Long live Tindrum
-Herorim (phil)....signing out.
#TheLegacyisDead

author: {'steamid': '76561198227569632', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 24105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23740, 'last_played': 1547117037}
review:
This is a game where we lost many good men and women. I believe that one day Mortal will find the hero it deserves... Deeeeeee and Herorime were unsuccessful in their journey. However, we will never forget their legacy. One day, the people of tindrem will gather and work together in order to stop RPK. But, this is a tale for new upcoming hero, who will lead the people and perish all evil in their sight. I believe that we should learn from Deeeeee and Herorime's legacy and learn that helping eachother makes a difference in stopping what is going on in the land of Mrylin. No more being selfish and cold hearted... it is a new era of heroes and people! We MUST make a NEW CHANGE to this corrupted world! That is all. 
                                                                                                                                       - Deeeeee signing out #TheLegacyisDead

author: {'steamid': '76561198084653084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 2700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1614725101}
review:
基本的にグラフィックにこだわる人には、一切お薦めできない
「正しく遊ぶためには有料月額性である」

ちょっと昔話を
今では既に大昔、UOは転換期を以て純然たるスキル制から逸脱した際、「UOの３D版が出る(誤」と大いにヘイヴンを沸かせたのが「ResonanceAge」現在のMaster of Epicである。それをもう少しハードコアにした感じが、このMortal Onlineだと言える。

3Dに関し、粗削りの度を越え正直手伝ってやりてぇと思うぐらいフィールドマップやら何やらの作りはひどい。スタックしないのが驚きだと考えれば、「MAP造形に関しては、貴方にとって過去最悪となるだろう」と断言できて仕方ないだろう。ハッキリ言って「これに興味を持つ日本人」にはMoEをお薦めする。

だが、制作陣からは、少なくともこのMotalが全盛だった時期の制作陣には、あの時代のUOの、現代風に言い回すのであれば「SAOに近いあの匂い」に対する強烈なオマージュを感じざるを得ない。解る人にしか解らない事を言っている自覚はある。

あの未成熟だったNETの混沌とした空気の中で、臨場感と出会いとそれらを取り巻くアクシデントと、半ばPK発祥の時代のあの悪意と、そこに纏わる善意や温かみ。何を以てそれを語るかと云えば下らない、「全裸が標準実装」と云う中学男子の悪意を掻き立てるには十分すぎるフレーバーだろう？と、我ながら警告なのか煽りなのか定かではない事を突き付けて見たくなる。

その点から女性には8割の強さで「勧めない」と言いたいが、「女性のハードゲーマーの求めるリスキーさ」と云う物はあいにくと私自身が男なので、その存在を認識こそすれ、理解の埒外であるとしか言えない。とは言え、強者のフレに囲まれ姫プレイ(或いは騎士プレイ)の真骨頂を構築し得る世界観であるのも事実ではあるだろう。

また、馬鹿正直にスキル値で殴り合うだけが勝負ではない。中学生や高校生の英語力であれ、社交(権謀術数)や利害関係が罷り通ると云う事は伝えておいて損はないだろう。努力する価値はあるよ？これこそが洋ゲーに於ける日本の弱点なのだから。

私自身、もう何時からだったのか思い出せないほどのゲーム全般に於いてソロプレイヤーなので、これ以上は言える事は無いが最後に、価値はともかく仕様(臨場感)として「所属50名に対し、安定期のアクティブは凡そ10名なんて普通だ」と考えるなら、割と気張った移住は価値があるだろう。純生産プレイヤーやポーターに意味が生まれるこの世界では、ソロプレイで月額を払っていく価値があるかと云えば微妙なのだ。「自分が帰るべき仲間達の下」と云う空想上の言葉が、意義を持つ。

本当にResonanceAgeぐらいのグラフィック変革でもやってくれれば、日本でも流行り得るんだけどね

review: i havent played in a little bit but when i did it was on my old acc and i played this game night and day. it is a good game with a great concept. still there are many things that could be improved but still a great game. like most games the community is aweful but nothing can really be done to change that. my only other major issue is how big the game's gap between subscription paying players and none subscription playing players is. if the price did go down on the subscription more people would possibly buy it but with it being so expansive i do see why the gap is so large. still an amazing game if you can get past that and i love the skill leveling system.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993675814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 20601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4743, 'last_played': 1685849856}
review: What is this game? - Its more of a world simulation. You can pretty well do whatever you want. This is a really cool concept in it self. But it is where a lot of grief comes from. Just about everything can kill you... and yes... if you die... you can have all your stuff looted before you can get back to your body. Yes there are shittie players. I was Lucky to have someone take time and explain how crap really works. Once you have an understanding of the world... its rules... and the rules to live by, the game is really fun. Its a change from your typical MMORG. Thats what makes it great. Yes... support for the game has faded considerbly.  It could be one of the coolest MMORG out there if the Dev's actually did something to make it better. I Enjoy the game play... even the dieing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032643719', 'num_games_owned': 1210, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 2285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2280, 'last_played': 1557340405}
review:
Podchodziłem do Mortal Online z przymrużeniem oka... i powiem, że gdyby nie to, nie byłbym w stanie przychylnie spojrzeć na ten tytuł.

Trzymałem Mortal Online na liście życzeń od 2014 roku, więc nie pamiętam nawet jakie myśli towarzyszyły mi w momencie, gdy go tam dodawałem. Wiem natomiast, że dałem mu szansę na skutek przeczytanych recenzji. Czy były to recenzje pozytywne czy negatywne, wszystkie wspominały o bardzo wysokim poziomie trudności i prawdziwej dowolności.

Gra studia Star Vault należy do gatunku MMORPG. Jeżeli jednak wyobraziliście sobie rozbudowany interfejs, cukierkową grafikę, piękne postacie, wykrzykniki z questami i świat wypełniony po brzegi wszelakimi aktywnościami, to na wstępie zaznaczam, że "MMORPG" jest tutaj wstawione ze względu na spełniane kryteria gatunku. Tej grze daleko bowiem do tego, co na co dzień kojarzone jest z MMORPG.

Tym, co na starcie wyróżnia tytuł i jednocześnie tym, co mnie osobiście kupiło jest fakt, że rozgrywka prowadzona jest tutaj z perspektywy pierwszej osoby. Dla wszystkich. Bez wyjątku.
Pozwala to na większą immersję podczas eksploracji świata, walki czy kontaktów ze znajomymi. Wszystko wydaje się "bardziej namacalne" niż w przypadku innych MMORPG.

Kamera pierwszoosobowa dodatkowo pozwala na zmianę systemu walki. Jest on bardzo podobny do tego, który kojarzyć możemy z serii The Elder Scrolls, tylko bardziej drewniany. W zależności od używanej broni białej (takiej jak chociażby miecze jednoręczne, dwuręczne, topory, buławy, kije bojowe, włócznie), wyprowadzamy wolniejsze lub szybsze ciosy, o krótszym lub dłuższym zasięgu. Dzięki temu walki PVP są bardzo skillowe i dają możliwość pokonania gracza lepiej rozwiniętego czy lepiej wyposażonego. Skillowy system walki przekłada się na pojedynki pełne ataków, odskoków, parowania czy blokowania tarczą. W grze występuje również magia i bronie dystansowe, ale to walka z innymi, stalą w stal, mimo że drewniana, przynosi największą satysfakcję.

A podczas walki lepiej się postarać, ponieważ śmierć niesie ze sobą poważne konsekwencje. W grach z gatunku MMO, oprócz zdobywania kolejnych poziomów postaci i rozwijania statystyk, ważne jest zbieranie wyposażenia. Wyposażenia, które wszyscy kochamy zbierać, ulepszać, kompletować i pokazywać innym. A w tym tytule, w przypadku śmierci, nasze wszystkie przedmioty zostają wśród naszych zwłok, podatne na kradzież przez innych graczy. Z tego właśnie powodu gotów jestem śmierć w tej grze określać mianem nawet "permanentnej", bo utrata legendarnego wyposażenia, to jak strata połowy statystyk. I to jest druga rzecz, która pozytywnie wyróżnia Mortal Online.

A jeżeli mówimy o statystykach i levelowaniu postaci, również one nie są zwyczajne.
Nie grindujemy, nie wbijamy ogólnego poziomu postaci. Zamiast tego mamy do czynienia z systemem levelowania poszczególnych czynności i umiejętności, i tak o to poprzez walkę z użyciem konkretnej broni - trenujemy posługiwanie się tą bronią, poprzez używanie bandaży podnosimy wiedzę anatomiczną, bieganie poprawia atletykę, itd. itd. Jest nawet technika oddychania, którą da się rozwinąć :D
Oprócz umiejętności i czynności, blokujemy i odblokowujemy główne statystyki, jakie mają się u postaci rozwinąć. Pula tych statystyk jest ograniczona i to ona świadczy o uzyskaniu "maksymalnego poziomu postaci". System skomplikowany, ale bardzo ciekawy.

Jeżeli chodzi o fabułę, to może i jest jakieś tło fabularne, jednak osobiście żadnego nie zauważyłem. Nie skupiałem się zresztą na wykonywaniu questów, bo tych i tak jest tylko garstka. Gra nie stawia nam żadnych blokad odnośnie tego czym powinniśmy się zająć, gdzie podróżować i co zabijać. Możemy więc skupić się na farmieniu golda z mobów, możemy rozwijać się pod kątem craftingu, oswajać zwierzęta i potwory, napadać innych graczy (gra nie nakłada żadnych kar za zabójstwa poza miastem, a nawet w mieście są one możliwe, więc zawsze trzeba mieć się na baczności), czy zwyczajnie eksplorować świat.
W Mortal Online można również poświęcić się budowie własnych budynków, które możemy stawiać gdziekolwiek w świecie gry. Nie wypowiem się jednak na ten temat szerzej, bo jedyne czego doświadczyłem w tym temacie to ogromne, monstrualne zamki i forty zbudowane przez jakieś potężne gildie.

Po wymienieniu tych czterech zalet wyróżniających Mortal Online (widok fpp, permanentna śmierć, rozwój postaci, sandboxowość), przejdę teraz do tych aspektów gry, które sprawiają, że jest ona niesamowicie odpychająca.

Nie będę opisywał tutaj wysokiego poziomu trudności, bo jest on zwyczajnie założeniem gry. Jeżeli ktoś rozpoczyna przygodę z tym tytułem, raczej jest tego świadom.

Zacznę od pierwszego problemu, jakim jest świat gry. Jest on brzydki i archaiczny, jednak nie odbiega wizualnie od tego, czego mogliśmy doświadczyć w 2009 roku, czyli w roku premiery (wbrew temu co sądzi Steam). I o ile przy dobrym gameplay'u można wybaczyć brzydką oprawę graficzną, przecież wszyscy znamy takie przypadki... to sprawa komplikuje się, gdy grafika jest do tego stopnia potworna, że psuje doświadczenia płynące z samej rozgrywki.

Nie zrozumcie mnie źle, Mortal Online ma swoje momenty, lokacje potrafią wyglądać ładnie...
Niestety jednak większość miejsc jest szkaradna... i pusta. Nie wiem do końca czy jestem sprawiedliwy w ocenie, bo może to nie jest kwestia oprawy graficznej, ale świat gry jest kompletnie pusty. W całej grze prawie w ogóle nie ma detali, miasta są opustoszałe, jedynie na głównym targowisku i wokół banku możemy znaleźć jakieś ciekawsze otoczenie. W budynkach, które możemy odwiedzić nie ma nic, to po prostu duże, drewniane pudła.
Poza miastami jest jeszcze gorzej. W trakcie półtora godzinnej podróży z miasta do miasta, w 6-osobowej ekipie zaczęły latać prześmiewcze komentarze w stylu "Patrzcie! To krzak!", "O rany, kamień leży!" I wszyscy zbiegali się, by oglądać kamień.
Wynika to z tego, że poza miastem otoczenie jest tak nijakie, że nawet kamień robi wrażenie.

Nie wiem jak Wy, ale ja wolę MMO, w którym oprócz dobrze zorganizowanych systemów, jakimi kieruje się gra, czeka na mnie piękny i zachwycający świat.

Drugą rzeczą, tą która oprócz pustego świata zadecydowała o porzuceniu tytułu, był nieprzejrzysty, toporny i zbugowany interfejs. Gracz nie wie gdzie i po co kliknąć, gdzie szukać jakichkolwiek informacji. Wszystko działa ociężale. Twórcy powinni zrozumieć, że toporny i trudny interfejs nie jest dobrym sposobem, by utrzymać wysoki poziom trudności.

Na koniec przywołam moją ulubioną sytuację z gry:
Odchodząc na chwilę od komputera nieodpowiedzialnie położyłem się na środku szlaku, licząc na to, że nikt nie będzie przechodził. Gdy wróciłem, byłem martwy, z informacją o nicku mordercy. Wracając z miasta nago, przyuważyłem, że mój morderca beztrosko trenuje za miastem na słomianych manekinach. Niedługo potem podszedłem w samych gaciach w towarzystwie moich dwóch, zakutych w pełną zbroję kumpli. I jeden z nich, KrojeChlebKolanem zaczepia mojego mordercę:

- "Witaj. Słyszałem, że zabiłeś mojego kolegę. To ten tutaj, mały i nagi. Poznajesz jego nick?"
- "Zabiłem go, niech to będzie dla nιego nauczką, że nie śpi się na środku"
- "Chcemy Ci tylko powiedzieć, że jak wyjdziesz z miasta to jesteś martwy, będziemy czekać". - rzucił Chleb, odwrócił się, a my poszliśmy za nim.
- "Próbujcie!" - krzyknął morderca, ale po po chwili zza pleców usłyszeliśmy - "Dobra! Poczekajcie! Oddam Wam te itemy!"
No i rzeczywiście oddał :D Jak widać oѕяał ze strachu te swoje skórzane portki.

Podsumowywując - jeżeli chcecie doświadczać sytuacji podobnych do powyższej, chcecie zmierzyć się z tym trudnym światem i nie przeraża Was to, że jest on pusty... to szczerze polecam Wam Mortal Online.
Jednak jeżeli jesteście podatni na brzydotę, toporność i nieprzychylność - odbijecie się od tego tytułu jak od ściany.
Ta gra to jedna z tych, które albo się kocha, albo nienawidzi.

- Bunshiin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112947323', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3201, 'last_played': 1543959968}
review:
I'm quite new at this game... only 40 hours at the time of posting this, though I don't get why people hate this game.
If you were expecting pots of gold, lepricauns and rainbows from a HARDCORE PVP game, then I'm sorry to disapoint you... this is not that type of game.

You WILL get toxic players in a game like this (I mean.. hardcore pvp, you gotta have players like this).
You WILL die a lot.
You WILL have to earn back everything you had.

But... that's the point of this game. To rage at one point, and to be happy to loot a player at the other. 
A community not so big, but for everyone to be put into ONE server, the number is more than enough. 

As for the toxic community, haven't encountered almost any during my 40 hours, I definetly will in the future though.

This review was written by a F2P player, keep that in mind ;)



Put the game to download, now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998063253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 43109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39428, 'last_played': 1580078099}
review:
I’ve been playing this game since Beta Block A. I’ve enjoyed it since I enjoy PvP, I think they did a terrific job at making PvP interesting and competitive in this game but outside of PvP the game is a mess. 

Just by reading the negative review around you’ll see what comes back over and over. A terrible game design, lack of content, no real power given to players in control of their land and no real revenues for holding towns and strategical locations. So it make all the territory control mostly for locking some ressources but before everything just to set up a place to regear before going for an other fight. The economy ingame is complete garbage and so is the social and political aspect. 

Unlike others that blame the community I prefer the say « don’t blame the players, blame the game ». The game and his design are the reason why this game as been a failure since it’s release. The devs must have some money away to keep it alive since release cause with the poor population they clearly don’t make the money needed to sustain the game.

I’m not even talking about lags and bugs that have been around for 10 years.

Saddest part is that it’s still my favorite MMO of all times. It just saddens me to see that they did not manage to go the right way in so many years. I believe some little changes in gameplay here and there could have made this game a great success. If lag and bugs were gone to, but well, outside of Tindrem lag is fine and bugs are relatively rare nowdays.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071948371', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 131548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98660, 'last_played': 1617580787}
review:
The dev's and GMs are corrupt and will let players who donate or pay for subs Cheat and break rules with no backlash. It's extremely painful that I need to edit this review. Basically, don't play this game. The game has been hacked several times and people's personal information has been made public. Accounts were stolen, and screenshots of the people using the accounts were posted on their discord several times. Their response is to DO NOTHING and ban anyone making the accusations from their discord. Their chat moderator Erras is biased and likes to play god with who can or cannot speak in chat. The game is glitched and broken. Lag will cause you to die repeatedly. Basic game mechanics do not function. Hit detection is localized, so someone in Europe can hit you with a dagger from a mile away, while your long spear is out of reach when up close to them. Magic is only usable if you spend thousands of gold or real money. Whole sections of the game are completely empty. Creatures in a dungeon can walk through walls. They have an invisible Minotaur beast that can destroy a group that randomly goes invisible. The best part? The devs can be very petty. They will take control of creatures when they are angry and destroy your dungeon group out of spite if they don't like you. This sounds crazy, but it can be confirmed. 
The only way to be seriously competitive is if you pay to win by subscribing every month to unlock all your skill's potential. Even after you pay, you're info on the website is not safe and the server can be down for days with no compensation. The game has basically become Entropia Online, in that it's a money sink where you are literally buying access to a broken product that's been in beta for 10 years. As of now, they've been promising to add content for nearly three years with no progress made.  Basically, you're better off playing almost any other game. Finally, if you complain to a developer or programmer, they will change or delete your horses or mounts, then deny it ever happened. I wish I was making this all up, but you can see for yourself. NOTE: the videos shown are NOT the actual gameplay. When I first logged in, I thought I was playing old school doom or wolfenstein.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271209725', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 265855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170648, 'last_played': 1614952333}
review: 10/10 Best sandbox game there is, literally the new continent added is pure sand. The first continent is basically the same thing, you could say you barely see anyone since the map is so big. It a pain to walk everywhere on a foot fighter cuz the map is huge and it takes forever so no one roams thus creating 0 to little pvp encounters. Low population base so hurting people's feelings when you do find people outside can be easily done. Ways to hurt people consist of using pets to kill them, killing them on mounteds, killing them with a zerg, triple striking them, and many more cheesy ways. Other form of pvp you can get is sitting in front of someone's gates and hope they come out. Pretty solid game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067694334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2226, 'last_played': 1542133218}
review:
it's a really in depth MMO unlike any other, the comat is pretty skill based with more than enough PVP available. numerous amount of skills to explore and a large world to explore.

downside? it's very teamwork centric, and by that i mean, if you don't join a guild that actually cares about it's memebers the community will make your life hell, any random passerby is that might be a suscriber will theive whatever gold you have and anything available on you that's worth something within seconds of passing you. and if they won't thieve from you, they'll kill you for it.

i recommend it because i'd probably play it if my friends were willing to, but they aren't. last im touching this game, as it is practically impossible to solo.

i also highly recommend a subscription, all skills are capped at 60 until you subscribe, most of the collest things in the game (like Necromancy) require your skill for the task to be maxed out. a subscription also give you access to pickpocketing, so you too can ruin your fellow player's experience by thieving what valuables they have on them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198408237380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1521082310}
review: Veterans love it because noobs are easy to kill and they get titles and rewards for it, while noobs just start all over, and over, and over... I dont reccomend it. Most vets i ran into were vulgar talking about things they want to do with my mom. Also the devs themselves until not too long ago presented it as part of the game and told people pointing it out basically : to "git gud"

author: {'steamid': '76561198006144518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1528997343}
review: I played many years ago before they switched to Steam. It was decently good then and the community was pretty close knit. Now production has slowed and the community has dimished greatly. I've even read some reports of GM corruption. I wouldnt come back after all this time because it isnt worth it. I put a lot of time and money into the game (as you have to subscribe per character slot as far as I remember) and its just...stagnant now. It feels like it belongs back in 2009.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999796344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 13073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12669, 'last_played': 1675872913}
review:
Understand the game is ruled by hackers supported by GM's. The corruption is deep as they play and benefit from these and use most dupes, hacks etc themselves. They run map hacks to find you in pitch black, it shows them what you have on you and they know your worth the time. SV has abandoned the game no update since August as they go into the money grab Battle Royal industry with the graphics and de-sync issues from 2009. Avoid the company if you are smart I used to leave my pre-steam account all three of them active to show support in a game so developers would stop giving up on the sandbox open pvp worlds. But its not us players, its just bad developers that kill these games by thinking caitering to the griefing largest guild to maintain playerbase is smart and not corrupted and stop new player growth. 

The tutorial and tindrem was terrible... You end it being farmed in a graveyard by bored vets and you allowed it. They are twelve year old kids who joined the biggest guild leveled up and then set off on campaigns to destroy your game with downloadable hacks and GM support. It takes a lot of effort and time to manage a open sandbox PvP game.

You SV have failed this industry and couldnt even keep players information secure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134685819', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14193, 'last_played': 1541662611}
review: Well the game has alot of possabilities. The veterans of the game rule it with a murderous hand. So unless you get in a guild and let other people tell you how you have to play. your dead every five minutes, and they wont let you level your skills and become strong. Theres so much to do but again the veterans kill you before you can accomplish anything. i gave this game 3 weeks, pay to play, and wish i never would of wasted my money. i understand that murder and theivery are part of the game, but its like throwing kittens in a pool of piranahs and sayn dont cry. Veterans love it because noobs are easy to kill and they get titles and rewards for it, while noobs just start all over, and over, and over... I dont reccomend it. I also think its very low population is easy to understand. 90 percent veterans, 10 percent noobs like me who try. fail, and quit. Most vets i ran into were vulgar talking about things they want to do with my mom. help channel is a joke. you ask for help and give away your possistion, Then your dead. This game is all about people who have beem playing for several years. New people are not welcome. Atleast that is the impression i got. I feel bad because it really is awesome gameplay except for those people whos only pleasure is ruining game for all newcommers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401819784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1632415362}
review:
игра очень понравилась, играл раньшу с оффа заметил в стиме перезакачал.
из плюсов:
1. свобода выбора, делай что хочу и где хочу.
2. боёвка, особенно в пвп очень напряжённая.
3. нет такой вещи как pay2win как во многих мморпг.
4. свобода развития персонажа развивай кого хочешь.
5. отыгрывай кого хочешь, мне лично пнравилас тема с предками кода ты выбираешь из какой семьи твои предки (зайдёт для тех кто любит рп).
из минусов:
1. чтобы прокочать перса апример чисто в война надо оформить подписку.
2. высокий порог вхождения некоторые игроки стоят сто часов и тупят в первом городе.
3. я лично часто по началу встречал игроков пк меня они сильно бесили но разобравшись в боёвке проблем представлять сильно не будут.
вот я и подвёл итоги: как видно плюсов больше, но советовать всем не могу: (история из жизни) приглосил друга в игру после туториала выбрал мага, здох от первого скелета (Walker) и сказал: "Маги не рулят, значит игра не играбельна", а я продолжил играть за война и мочил свободно мертвяков.
советую любителям сожных мморпг и сложных рпг.
