author: {'steamid': '76561198178660418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 49507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14508, 'last_played': 1595131582}
review:
So I'm going to recommend this game. Why you might ask? Well I'm going to tell you a story....

So I've been playing for about a week and when i started i didn't think much of it I just wanted to try a different type of game, and I'm really glad I chose this. So when i first started me and a friend began at Tendrem one of THE MOST populated towns. This game goes so in depth, this town has a common district, the slums, and the rich district, which 50% percent of all players never go to the slums or rich district because they don't even know its there! They just stay in the common district because that's where you start off. 

So anyway back to the point, me and my friend learned that this started town is full of murderers thieves and well if there is alot of people in one area it starts to attract red players (known murderers). So after we learned this we tried to leave. when we left the safety of the city gates we checked the mountain side to make sure no reds were waiting up there. But to our dismay we didn't see the red named Archor and he killed us... 4-5 times because he could! while yes a portion of this game is pvp we didn't have the gear to take him on so we had to wait for him to leave so we can try getting our bodies back. After he finally left we got to our bodies (takes 30 min before a body to disappear). Then after that problem we finally hit the small little town called Maguli. everything was fine we got a guild invite, they showed us how to play properly, they gave us starter money, donkeys to ride, all just because we had the balls to leave tendrem.

So later in the week we are playing we finally decide to move to the guild keep in a different continent (yes its a whole other island, desert island, that you get to cross a bridge to get to, and its a player build bridge). so while we run there we see some really cool stuff, like a giant npc city called Beth Jedda, really cool new monsters to fight even the ratzar queen (this thing is like a giant spider that is 2 stories tall and at least 20-30 feet wide) which we never faught they just showed us this thing because they were gonna farm it soon once they get enough players to help. So we finally get to this city and this city is impressive its quite large with three section, the fort the resurrection area and the crafting/trade area. so after this we start breeding horses i would tame them and if they are rid-able/breed-able i would look at the stats and if it has high stregnth and dexterity i would give it to my friend and I would keep it if it has High speed and Dexterity. So after a little while i realize i have to go all the way back and buy more spell components (kind of like full metal alchemist you give some you get results) so i get my fastest horse and my friend grabs his strongest horse and we run all the way back to meduli which is like a 20 min ride since we know how to get there.as i got more materials and we were getting ready to leave a 2 reds came by and ended up killing my horse... yea i was mad... but then they left so while my friend stayed back i left to get another horse by the time i got back i forgot to feed the horse and i lost it due to low loyalty then the reds came back but this time instead of just me and my friend there were 5 fully geared blue players, 2 were from the guild hero 2 was from warden, and 1 wasn't in a guild he was just running around healing all the blues. so we were sitting there watching this huge war go on with the reds and the blues. after 15 minutes one of the reds died and the other ran away. I was happy because i actually held my own against the reds (i'm also a spell caster so it was difficult)

im not saying this is a good game but its definitely a in depth interesting game. there is something for everyone whether you want to be a red player, a pickpocket, a known hero, artisan, tamer, fighter, archer, or even magic user. Within the 172 hours I've played I've gotten 3 people to join this game and we all agree that this is a unique game and is very interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092742652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4989, 'last_played': 1523217810}
review:
I work from home so I check out random, time killing games all the time. At 1st glance, this seemed interesting....upon closer inspection....
       -only 150 players
       -Its very buggy, (especially when dismounting) you will get stuck on an urn or stuck in a roof and have to kill yourself, if someone is around, bye bye loot
       -Takes multiple character slots to be efficient @9$ a piece. plus 15$ sub a month
       -Characters are next to useless unless maxed out (which can be done in days with macroing)
       -If you are a solo player DONT EVEN THINK ABOUT IT. I was in a guild but theyre all doing high rank things bc everyone who still actually plays this are people who have invested years. Very few mentors to show you the way in a complex game...which would be fine BUT
       - As someone else has mentioned the vets are bored and kill for fun, which would be ok if it was less brutal on noobs , the same reason I don't play Ark - A game that has mechanics to allow you to lose hours and hours sometimes days of work in an instant is not fun and will only drive people away and numbers will still low and then even the vets will leave

Between the unbalanced and buggy mechanics and toxic community , this one is a skip.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041183580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7543, 'last_played': 1519965184}
review:
Alright so I just want to start with saying that this game is not for people with little patentience and a weak heart.
and by that I mean everything in this game is a time investment which is a little annoying, but the concept, combat, adventures and community is what really makes this game great. I'll explain what's so great about each

Concept -
   What I absolutely adore about this game is the idea that 90% of the game is determined by player choices, the economy is player driven, the guilds are player driven. Being in a 200 vs 200 player raid or running away from 40 people is one of the most intense feelings I think that i've ever gotten from gaming.
Combat-
   Be me
   practicing with friend who is new at the game
   thinks its a good idea to fight with tourches on my stated free to play character
   fighting, everything is going good'
   gets a parry
   [i]tourch does 80 damage[i]
   decapitates friend
   
   but for real though the game highly rewards thouse who are good at timing and fighting monsters stratigically to have heals going around and changing the agro is very stimulating and requires real teamwork in order to be very effective.

Adventures-
   I've been on numerous hour long adventures with one of my friends and they usually end up in us finding something really crazy, getting killed by something very crazy, finding people who are really crazy, drowning in a lake due to accidental macro activation in steel armour, falling of mountains, killing each other, killing each others hourses so we have to walk. Honestly its just a great way to relax and have a great time with your friends and just have a moment to talk about things ya know.

Community-
      There's alot of different people on this game, you have the bullies  rpk*cough cough* and then you have everyone else, but even though i've lost numerous precious gold coins in risar heads, axes, and steel... I still love them, because it makes the game chaotic, if the game was friendly then you wouldn't have to worry about if theres someone waiting at the entrace of risars when you leave. You don't have to worry about lossing 10 rubars

author: {'steamid': '76561198008800942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1516292844}
review:
Gib dir ein Tag Mühe und erreiche, einen Punkt, wo du glaubst es geht jetzt etwas voran, das ist dann leider auch der Moment, wenn die PKler auf dich aufmerksam werden.
Eigentlich bin ich nicht so empfindlich, aber wenn ich direkt neben dem Prister, nach dem "Auferwecken" immer wieder gekillt werde, nun, 
mein Urteil steht fest, deinstallieren, diesen Kommentar verfassen und rasch vergessen, es gibt jede Menge bessere Spiele.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050236532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1512, 'last_played': 1490194919}
review:
Overall I wouldn't recommend this game, it's got a lot of great ideas but they aren't exactly well implemented.

The system for everything is extremely hard to pick up, it takes a lot of time and effort to stop making grotesque foods even when following guides on food prep. Spent a lot of time grinding the graveyard and thankfully didn't have my coins stolen randomly by players.

Would recommend the devs rework the entirety of the pickpocket system or scrap it altogether, it's not a fun system.

The method of crafting could be improved with a handful of beginner recipes to help get players used to how the system works and then leave the rest open, I spent a lot of time and resources that amounted to nothing.

As for the pvp, it can be fun, and going into areas where there are no guards with a lot of people around leaves you on edge, especially in the deeper portion of the graveyard, I was helped by other people who went in and the monsters i found were pretty fun to fight even when underleveled.

The access to creating a house or guild seems to be pay to play only, it was a real shame because my group of friends really wanted to have the ability to use that stuff, instead we just stuck together and never did things alone.

maybe 20 hours into it my brother and his friend ended up falling into the sewers where a guy was stuck unable to leave cause the guards would kill him on sight, both of them fought and ended up killing the guy for his high level gear not too long before we quit.

All in all i'd say 5/10, there's potential but it's all poorly implemented or locked behind a pay wall that seems a bit too high for my taste

author: {'steamid': '76561198052950556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1837, 'last_played': 1607635299}
review:
[i][h1]В принципе игра неплоха[/h1]
Хардкор и всё такое, миллионы комбинаций крафта...
Но есть и НО, которое заключается в высоком пороге вхождения в игру, и конечно же отсутствии русского языка.
[/i]

У меня сложилась такая ситуация:
[code]
Прошёл я значит туториал, пошёл убивать монстров на кладбище, заработал деньги, купил мечь лучше, дорогую броню для своего статуса, пошёл снова убивать зомби, всё хорошо, качаюсь... Как вдруг, собрат по убийству НПС нападает на меня, убивает, а потом шкериться в кустах чтоб сбросить статус убийцы. 

Тогда я потерял почти всё, та как в игре фулл лут(как потом оказалось, не на особые предметы), благо в банке деньги храню.

Прихожу через время снова, всё чисто, его нет,  резкий удар в спину от другого игрока.

Тогда я потерял практичиски всё.

Ладно, бывает, я уже очухался, купил новый сет брони, подешевле. Нашёл нового друга, он помог мне зачистить городские катакомбы на выходе из которых нас убивает наш с вами первый знакомый. 

Тогда я потерял всё.[/code]

Не буду долго описывать как я встретил его в центре города, начал на него гнать, собрались люди... Всё закончилось тем что It is Russian retard, don't listen to him в мой адрес.

Вот к чему я пришёл: Да, можно снова всё накопить, улучшить навыки, купить подписку. Да, купить, ибо далше 60 очков прокачки основных* и всех остальных навыков нет смысла, они не работают. А основные прокачиваються за 2-3 часа пассивно, пока бегаешь, прыгаешь, махаешь оружием. Только нужно нe переусердствовать, на free аккаунте доступно 1100 очков навыков, а самих навыков очень-очень много. Однако я устал, и не хочу платить деньги чтоб потом вё это повторилось

author: {'steamid': '76561198039695248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 203627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24334, 'last_played': 1706120716}
review:
This game has slowly polished over the last three years that I've played. It supports alot of different play styles.

I found this game looking for crafting MMOs. This game didn't disapoint.. at least for me. Crafting can seem pretty in depth at first. Although it's pretty simple once you have some exposure, there are a ton of different ways to make a sword by its blade, core and hilt.. let alone clubs,spears,polearms,axes,bows,daggers,the 15+ different types of armor. All different weights, lengths, and mixtures of the hundreds of available materials.

This game has alot of PVE to it. It also has leaderboards that aren't hard to get onto, despite the game being out for as long as it has. Personally, I built a fortress in the middle of nowhere and I have gone the last 6 weeks without being griefed. It's great because my carebear playstyle is supported. It's a friendly environment to transport materials to trade with local guilds. If you read this, download the game, and are sick of being griefed and killed you can always PM me. I'll welcome you into my pallisade and show you how to make some gold.

Lastly, the pvp in this game is great. There is "a way" to pvp. As long as you understand what others focus on in combat, there is so much room to shine with actual skill. The community is decent sized, but its still small enough to where if you are a great pvper, people will know. I do hear alot of complaints about lack of pvp availability. This is not my experience but I thought i'd voice it so that you know what to expect.

P.S. This may be biased, but it is based of my personal experience. I have never had any trouble with the devs that made me feel they were biased. Which is something I see alot of people contradicting. I do believe there were two issues over the years that could have been handled differently, but the outcome turned out just fine. The best advice I can give regarding this is being polite to the devs and trying to work with them goes along way. 

Enjoy mortal!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046792139', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1821, 'last_played': 1514578955}
review:
Garbage game with toxic community. Everyone quit playing so the people who invested time in order to pvp, have no one to kill but newbies who log into the game. No new players are sticking with the game. Just look at steam charts. Negative 10% growth per month. Game will be dead in 6-8 months.

My first goal was to buy a mount so I could carry more loot to sell. I spent a few days training skills for domestication and creature control. Then spent several days getting gold together so I could buy a mount from the broker. Finally had all the pieces and ready to get mount. 

First I get my gold and go to broker. In the 40 secs I am looking for the mount I want to purchase. Someone comes over and picpockets me taking all my gold. The perpentrator got caught but he didn't get flagged for pvp. Guards didn't attack, and if I attacked him, the guards would kill me..... BROKEN SYSTEM

So now i go grind some more gold in the graveyard. I get murdered several times by veteran players who take my newbie gear and trash it. I report them for their murders and nothing happens. No consequences. In a few minutes they are running by the guards waving at them laughing at me. Guards just wave back like they hadn't just murdered someone several minutes ago. WTF..

Finally I get enough gold to buy a mount and train it. I wait until no one is in the auction house. Run in and buy my pet receipt. I go to stable and take out my donkey. I have the mount for 10 secs, and some jackass kills it for fun sitting in the middle of the city. Guards kill him, and he loses a little newbie weapon. While I lost the mount I had been trying to get for many days. WTF?

I played EVE, Darkfall, Albion, and a bunch of other full loot hardcore pvp games. This game is utter garbage. The rules actively encourage veteran players to kill newbies since there is NOTHING else to do in the game. It is the only way they retain their current toxic playerbase of 10 year olds.

Stay away. I strongley suggest you watch out for the release Crowfall. I am testing in alpha right now, and it seems like it could be pretty good. Crafting system is going to be the best I have ever seen. I don't suggest you run and join the alpha.. wait for the release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156639282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1534704655}
review: What a miserable experience. The game is way too glitched to do anything and the mechanics that work (sort of) are clunky as hell. Social interactions in this MMO are nonexistant outside of the help chat (where people actually do help you) and the occasional donkey rider who passes through Tindrem. I will give some examples from my 'gameplay' experience that have ruined it. The first time I played it was alone,I fell into water in the tutorial area and couldn't get out and res myself due to glitched terrain. Uninstalled. Second time was with a friend,and imagine this in an mmo: there is no party system and there is no map. Only reason we found each other was because it was the same tutorial town,but I'll add to that later. Then we actually had some fun smacking mobs around with the crappy combat and running around,until we left the town and ran to  a graveyard. There we got killed by a spider but luckily made it in time to get our loot back. Afterwards,we started walking towards an interesting looking area,near a lake,at which moment I made ONE step into the water and got pulled into the whirlpool of death (aka glitched and was forced to swim,run out of stamina and die at the bottom of the lake.) My friend died too due to the lack of stamina. Couldn't reclaim loot because it was lost to the depths. Uninstalled. Few months later...We tried again. To add to the aforementioned map-lacking system,this time we tried spawning at a guild town,and ended up in two different places. I get that its not realistic to open your map and see a dot on it symbolizing your friend's current position,but is not realistic to have a map? There is a fan-made one that helped us find each other,and then we ran,and ran some more,had some fun in a dungeon and quickly ran due to 6 skeletons rising from the ground. After that we realized the one thing good about this game: the comedic value. Two hobos with piss-poor swords walking and running like there is a cucumber up their asshole murdering pigs was funny (it was me and him in beginner robes). Afterwards we traveled for a while,through an oddly dead but kinda charming world,just looking for content,and we decided to craft,and the crafting is alright. A really cool thing was just how many skills there are,its quite impressive. Breathing,walking,running,tasting,every subsection of a major stat possible (example: agility isn't agility here,its everything movement related). The NPCs are retarded and ugly as shit,but so are all of the models basically. We did the graveyard stuff again,got bored and uninstalled. I gave this game a shot 3 times,and each time my soul got crushed a bit more. The only good things about the game aren't actually good enough to replace/compensate for all the bad ones. Give it a shot,maybe you'll enjoy it,but I think that there is little to no fun to be had here. Buy Gloria Victis instead,its much better and the premise is sorta the same-player based economy,castle sieges,skill based classless PVP,crafting,open world and such. Sorry Mortal Online,you're traaaaash

author: {'steamid': '76561198197076777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 565734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234965, 'last_played': 1671749621}
review: I have 4k hours in this game. and i have had more problems with glitches and cheater then this game is worth. dont even try it. If u encounter a problem with game mechanics. such loosing a pet becouse phase into each other and u cant drop heals on it. The Gms will tell u its a trial and error game and that u have to explore and figure things out. But when the situation seems unfair and many other players have the same problem. author: {'steamid': '76561198043111169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 11954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11494, 'last_played': 1487782778}
review:
This game... THIS GAME... 
Why is this such a frustrating and infuriating game and i like it so much?
Got disapointed over and over again with the direction it takes but... It's so unique that it deserves atention, even if you end up hating it. Though there are new releases that are similar, none of them are as harsh and crushing as this one.

Mortal Online is a highly unpolished diamond that often is cracked and slightly polished at all times. You can see the potential that lurks in every aspect of the game, but several reasons keep it from being a great MMO. 

If you decide to give it a try, keep in mind that the new player experience is not the finest and most players will eat you alive. It's supposed to be this way, as it wants to capture the harsh nature of medieval times, giving it a little sparkle of magic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992055981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1348, 'last_played': 1636322794}
review: Iv been palying this game on and off for a few years now, and it keeps on getting better. The devs are contantly working on large updates to expand upon the games already deep content. They also listen to the fans and fix and improve on experiences that we want to see. Mortal also has probably one of my favourite skill progression systems, where you get better at you skills by using them. The amount of skills is rediculous but I love all of the Options. I play as a free player and Iv had no troubles win any pay to win aspects. I also dont pvp much hower. I generally solo in this game even though its not really made for playing solo, however im always alble to find things to do and make more gold until I figure out the next thing I want to do. Keep it up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198294532049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1511002033}
review:
For those that wish to know...

This is a F2P TRIAL game, you have to subscribe to unlock all other features, such as building which is what I wanted to do, for a F2P Trial game it is still pretty good even though some of your skills will be "Completed" at skill level 60. I assume that you will be able to explore the world freely and learn more about the game as you play which, in my opinion, is still an amazing experiance, 10,000 times better than most F2P game offers in my opinion. I do recommened giving this F2P Trial game a try and if you like it then feel free to subscribe monthly to play (between 13 - 16 dollars a month) be warned that it is not an easy, typical game like WoW or Neverwinter it is much more complex especially when it come to the combat system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053861153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 238138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207392, 'last_played': 1674268827}
review: This game has the only combat mechanics that make sense with a medieval game. The developers are becoming better at understanding their sandbox. It has a steep learning curve, but once you wrapped your head around how to swing and bank you can begin your journey. The player base is old and elitest, but just like any other game with a small pop (<200) they want more people to try it out. It had 1000 people at its prime of steam release, and was ruined by constant ddos attacks and a loading que. Since then Star Vault has tried to made amends by increasing security and patching bugs slowly over time. You don't need the population to make it to the end game, but requires people for content. Bring your friends and make the population grow!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016046767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1614, 'playtime_forever': 63292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60101, 'last_played': 1513012466}
review:
Honestly this is one of the best survival role playing games on Steam. Yup, community is toxic, isn't most of Steam? Yup, it's brutal, you'll be KoS everywhere you go, like in just about every other survival game on the market. Yup, it's buggy, most are - especially survival games. Yet this game gets mad amounts of hate for it.

All that's outta the way. This game has the most in depth crafting i've ever seen, the different gear you can make and materials you can use is crazy with different appearances for every single piece that you change. You can build a castle, keep, town, fort, or just a simple house almost anywhere in the world. There are siege weapons and many different mounts to ride. Beyond mounts just about every creature in the game can be a pet. Beyond that you can summon demons and various undead with necromancy.

Become a fighter, trader, escort, mercenary, screaming peasant, whatever it is you want to be. The skill system works similarly to The Elder Scrolls in that you learn by doing. Some skills are learned from a book which your character will passively read while playing or offline. Literally any combination you can think of is possible.

Loads of dungeons and hidden areas, many hand crafted npc cities and minor camps. Tons of monsters both real and fantasy and everything has something to drop. 2 whole continents to fight over, bigger than any maps available in other survival games.

Over all it's hard to describe what all you can do with this game, since there are so many options and not everything is common knowledge, you may stumble upon a precious secret not many know of and that just doesn't happen in datamined games with overflowing wikis of information.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046929211', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 42556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15562, 'last_played': 1635265709}
review:
Mortal used to be amazing, for the last two years though its gone very downhill. There is a group of players who are known for actively cheating, lagswitching, hacking, and exploiting to get there way in the game, yet nothing is done about them due to the companies incompetance with punishing cheaters. Apparently "Temp bans" are enough in Starvaults book but they aren't especially since a few of these pieces of shit have ruined the game during whole month long swathes of time thru DDOS attacks. The game company doesn't publish rules, or a ban list, and actively snubs any talk they don't like on the forums. If you mention the cheating going on you get a forum ban. The only saving grace is Sebastion who works his tail off but the company itself is driving itself into a ditch with their reactions. 

Gameplay was pretty solid until they changed alot of features to make it safer, now everyone hides behind walls and towns are almost always empty except the capitol. 

Do not recommend until Starvault gets their shit togethor and does something about cheaters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184593342', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3833, 'last_played': 1473114648}
review:
Very very very hard Game to get into ! You dont know how to get Ingame Cash at first. And after several Hours (70) I still dont know. You really need to meet the right People Ingame and get Connections that know how to do. If youre a Fighter you better never play alone, because fighting on the massive Open World will be your Job, you need help, because you will not fight alone against this Clans. You need Rob People and get their Stuff, and get to know the Prices to know in which Town to sell the Stuff.  If youre a Crafter you need a lot of organisation Skills. You will not be able to farm all the Ressources for your Crafts by yourself, you need to buy them as cheap as possible in different Towns for the cheapest Prices, craft and sell as high as possible, sounds easy but moving between Towns is dangerous without help. You definatly need a Clan/Tribe whatso ever, otherwise you dont have chance to survive. There are alot of very nice Players you can meet. I dont got a Tribe so I stood in the first high Populated Town and played a very very very 2,10 meters Tall Fighter Char, in Voicechat I acted very very very dumb but warmly Kind, like a dumb but very nice Killermachine, no matter which Gear I had, People got into my Roleplay and we had a lot of fun. Definatly recommending the Game ! Im not playing anymore cause me: Me Rachan Dragonir, not found Tribe yet :( Rachan worry :/

Best regards, 
Karl

author: {'steamid': '76561198071165800', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 10973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7293, 'last_played': 1606081243}
review:
I've been trying to uncover the words to quite describe the experience that this game truly is, but it is something that explaining can do no justice.  To me, this is one of the greatest, deepest, most enjoyable, exciting, unique, adventurous and thrilling game I have ever played.  Seriously, the rushes and adventures that come out of a good MO day are like no other.  That being said, to enjoy the game I suggest these things:

1:  Commit at least 20 hours to really getting your toes wet with it.  
         I remember almost quiting a few times in the first hours of play because I was so overwhelmed by the complexities and was also not at first impressed by the combat.  However, given a bit more time to become fully immersed and to start to realize the mechanics behind the once daunting leveling systems, things really started to take a unique and exciting light.  After having my first major tragedy and first real success, I started to see just how far the rabbit hole goes.

2:  Bring your Creativity and Imagination into this one.
         Seriously, go back into "pretend" time when you play this.  Just use your mind!  You are given pretty much zero direction or instruction in anything, however when you think creatively, you'll find that the mechanics and answers to every question are all thoughtful, logical, and makes sound sense.  This is the part I am having the hardest time describing.... everything is intelligently, deeply, and richly designed is such a way that your imagination really becomes the limit.  So many times I've read the cliché "Open Sandbox!  Do what you want!" am regularly let down by the "freedoms" in those games, but MO has really impressed me with it's opportunities for freedom of player expression.

Leveling is something akin to Oblivion, where you can level skills even like Jumping, and do so simply by doing it.  To improve your Axe skill, just use an Axe.  Everything breaks down into ridiculous subcategories in a good way, expecially the knowledge trees, like "Zoology" breaking down into all of the proper subspecies and geni categories of the actual science.

You can fill all Secondary Skills all the way up, but only have 1100 Primary Skill Points to spend.  This is the same for P2P and F2P players, the difference being that a P2P player can assign up to  100 points on a single Primary Skill, while F2P players max out at 60 points per Primary.  You can shift these stats around even after all spent with an interesting +, -, Lock system of allocating the points.  There are just SO many Primary Skills, to be truly great at something, you will need to specialize.  I realized this most as I went into Taming, which is far more than just "Taming" = 100.
You'll want knowledge of the species to increase your ability, Taming, (Advanced) Creature Control, Domestication, Beast Mastery, etc etc.  To craft, you'll need far more than "Armoring." 
 You'll need an understanding of the ores and minerals you are infusing into your armors and weapons, how to use the Forge, the Kiln, the Armor Crafting Station, and all other stations you'll want to use, like Bow/Shield/Weapon.  

Some skills cannot be learned by engaging in it alone, but must be learned by reading a book on the subject.  Getting your first dabble into the magic schools is done in this way.  Even your Book Reading skill goes up as you read and even that has subcategories like "Skim Reading!"  Books are read in a way similar to how Elder Scrolls Online did their crafting trait learning.  Some books can take a real week or more to get through if you're not a good reader or if the subject is something dense.  Even your Running skill is broken down into things like Running Technique, Breathing Technique, and Sprinting, and Swimming has subskilled like Diving, Crawl Stroke, and more.

Full Open World PvP creates for unique rushes, stresses, planning and cooperation with others. There is also Full Open World Building Construction, both personal and for Guilds.  The Guilds actually control territory across the realm, can build entire cities, and populate those cities with NPCs.  Fully functioning cities have been built by players that are more active and thriving than the built in cities of the game.

At first I thought Combat was super sluggish, clunky, outdated, and lame. Given some time and experience though and finally getting a grasp on the Parry System, it is really addictive, rewarding, and fullfilling.  There is a ton of skill in the combat.  Attack and blocking can be done from 4 sides, depending on which way you first move your mouse as you are attacking/blocking.  All attacks can be charged for extra damage and a properly timed block will be a "Parry" which allows for a quick and powerful counterattack.

Early on I was terrified, and rightly so.  Even the lowliest of creatures and dangers about, feeling every bit of the fragility of my own Mortality.  I love how as your skill as a player increases, and not just your stats, you  really start to feel a sense of pride, power, and accomplishment as you look upon the things which once caused you such fear and woe.

The world is quite large and fully open and explorable.  At first impression, it was TOO big and overwhelming.  It seemed unmanageable, untraversable, and even though it was all "open" to be explored, it felt inaccessible.  Now, having done a good bit of traveling across the realm I think that the size is just right.   Your first terrifying hike on foot to a new city could take hours lost and wandering helplessly, searching for any sign of the vague landmarks given to you by strangers in the previous town.  Later, you'll find yourself well mounted and soaring across the plains, confident in your direction and ability to reach your destination by dawn's first light.

The world is full of dungeons, adventures, riches, and plunder for the bold to possess, but serious danger lurks too in every shadow.  There is zero forgiveness and one mistake or a surprise encounter with a squad of maurading PKers could lead to the loss of every last one of your precious possession.

I'll never forget my gf's and my first real rush.  We had just planned and successfully executed our first venture from our start town MorinKhur to the primary start town of Tindrem, which was awesome in and of itself.  Upon arriving, we were quickly met with a request from a passing player and hired on as mercenaries to gather some precious horns, which could only be found from Minotaurs in the highlands a days journey by foot.  I'll never forget the three of us venturing far into the wilderness, delving into the heart of the mountain, and battling those bullmen in the dark depths of the earth.  We successfully returned with the loot after a narrow escape from several members of a Guild of killers (PYRE) and banked more gold than we had otherwise made in the last 3 weeks of play lol.  It was so epic.... but that's what this game offers.  There is no quest giver who says "get me some horn from the minotaur."  It forces you to create your own objectives, form your own parties, make your own goal, and choose who you are in the world.

Crafting is INSANE.  The resources are numerous and an understanding of them (Skill Points spent in the Knowledge of the material) is necessary for their well use in creation.  Weapons alone have the handles, hilts, blades, etc all of which can be uniquely forged and crafted with a variety of materials, each with their own merit.

Graphics obviously are not the best and were originally the turn off for me and my excuse not to try it out for the longest time.  Now I regret not having dove in long ago!  I really recommend this one and encourage you to give it a shot~!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031434005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 58654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8669, 'last_played': 1510779063}
review:
I played this game for over 2 years when it first released (i.e. around 2010-2012) and it is a great game if you like PvP and full loot. If you do not like these things you are going to have a hard time enjoying it. I left at the time because the game was being driven in a direction of making it a medieval quake arena instead of a sandbox but I have returned recently (August 2017) to check the game out and a lot of improvements have been made that are making me fall in love with Mortal Online again

Now obviously the game is not perfect but here are some bullet points for you to digest:

- Freedom to make your build, you can make it a straight fighter, refiner, crafter or whatever but the system shines when you can find a mixed build that works 
- Full loot PvP - if you hate full loot games there is not much of a point of going with MO. This said there are areas of the game where these things don't happen as often (example, the continent of Sarducaa is usually more peaceful than Myrland) 
- The game is not F2P. Consider it instead an unlimited trial which is great for anyone wanting to try out the game but if you want to be competitive you will have subscribe at some stage.
- Free placement of structures allowing you to build your own town (guild recommended if you don't want to be driven insane) 
- Dungeons. Simply the best dungeons you will ever experience in any game - mostly because they feel like real dungeons. The echo sounds in the caves, the lighting conditions (or the pitch dark if you don't bring a torch) the real sense of discovery. The game is worth it for this alone. 
- There are bugs. It is a small team and the bugs can sometimes be annoying, especially in a full loot game but the devs seem to be actively working in the game so hopefully this will be less of an issue. 

So in conclusion, I fully recommend the game if you are tolerant to:
1 - PvP
2 - Full loot
3 - Some bugs 

If you can get past that, get ready for an experience you won't find in any other MMORPG

review:
No money = Speed of a snail and no fun. <-- May change in the future.

So within the first hour of playing I already know I'm not going to like this game so here are my reasons why.

Reason 1 I had 2 to 3 server disconnects during character creation which means I had to redo the creation every time which is annoying and a waste of time, my friend also had server disconnects during the creation process as well so it wasn't because of my connection and onto my next reason.

Reason 2 I also encountered freezing from taking my weapon out plus a couple other things which could get me killed so there's also that, Just to clarify I did not crash so it has that going for it and onto my final reason.

Reason 3 The snail like movemnt speed is just too much even with sprinting it makes little to no difference, Here's an example I could walk circles around my character in real life while he's sprinting, I mean come on I was faster back when I was a toddler and so that's basically why I wouldn't recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067528546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1523439819}
review:
Well I started off did the tutorial then ran out of the city and found a bit of loot returned after a few hours and bought myself a shiny new set of armour. Soon after I found a the graveyard in the starter town and thought that'd be a good place to farm my combat skills on undead, so as I'm walking in I see a bag of loot with a worm in it so I take it... except apparently that was illegal so without warning I suddenly am marked with a gray shield so I leave the graveyard hoping avoid the large amount of fully geared out and mounted people in the graveyard then the guard shoots me with lightning so I run then he shoots me through a wall with a second bolt killing me. After going to the priest I find out that the priest won't even help me because I picked up a worm... so after a few minutes I can finally respawn so I go back to grab my stuff and before I get to the graveyard a random naked player with a spear appears out of nowhere and stabs me and kills me immediately and the guards don't care even though I'm marked as innocent. So after having to wait another few minutes before the priest will allow me to respawn I run back to my things again and my nice set of armour is gone. I decide I'll kill a few undead to get money and also try to hunt down the naked spear man who was last heading towards the graveyard and as I walk into the graveyard a man in full armour on a fast as hell horse immediately kills me... if I enjoyed bashing my head into a brick wall I'd do it myself I don't need help, so I closed and uninstalled it and I will never be returning to it.

The moral of the story is don't bother trying to start off in this game, there's tons of assholes who sit in and around the starter cities purely just to constantly kill new players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026413543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 163868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134011, 'last_played': 1575145494}
review:
Update on review! 11/10/19


After 2.7k hours i have to state, that this game is one of a kind. 

But it goes without it flaws, sadly the community over time has slowly passed on. But the remaining hardcore/fanboys are still around and keeping the game very much alive.

Currently there's a semi-large war between a few minor parties that is kicking the population, but for how long will it last and how long will it take to silently quiet down? Who knows.

Pro's:

Great combat, u legit cannot find a better type & kind of a combat system like Mortal Online around in any other MMO.

Economy, the game's economy is solely player driven, which can at hard times make it very difficult to get your resources/items for a "Fair price" 

Dungeons, While there is a few dungeons in the game, some remain un-discovered (this was proven by one of the devs on the official forums roughly 1 year ago from this updated review) 

Other dungeons can pose a challenge if u are brand new and have no idea of the AI Monster mechanics and the boss mechanics. Understand there is no actual "Boss" in these dungeons, but rather stronger creatures that the community considers a "Boss"

Player skills, the game gives a player loads of options when it comes to being a trader, hunter or just a player looking for a fight. There's well over 20 combat skills and another additional 10 - 30 secondary skills (which is skills under the main skill, confusing at first i know)

When you first start, you will start out like a complete utter "noob" or as they call it "Fledgeling" which basicly means u have bare minimum knowledge of running & walking! 

Over time u increase your skills and become faster & stronger just like a average MMO, but the skill grinding is not as tedious as other mmo's out on the market.  


Cons:

While the game is great, with overall flow of player crafting & trading the game struggles to keep a healthy and strong community to maintain the overall Player driven economy. 

Unlike EvE Online, where they hired an actual expert team within economy to monitor the player driven economy to insure there would never be a market crash or crisis.

Player skills: While the game has great addition to the wide variety of skills, it forces you to subscribe to enjoy the full game, by full game i'm talking about having skills to 100/100 as f2p (Free to play) u are limited to 60/100 and thus must be very selective on what you actually want to do. 

Community: The community is very much a serius, and hardcore driven. Yet this tend to scare away new players, that have never in their lifetime tried a game like this, or even the game itself. The community is also at times extremely agressive and takes "Honor" (in most cases) very seriusly, and will use that as a reason to target a person/clan/alliance.

Despite the community being overly aggressive on new players coming into the game, the developers won't do anything about it, unless there's obvious evidence about personal attacks or threats towards the real life person behind the character. Besides all that, the developers very much lets its community run its course. That alone is a scary thought for a game that possible could be considered a MVP of MMO Genre of its kind.


Overall: 

The community is strong, and hardcore and does anything it can to keep this game alive. 

Yet there's still remnants of the old, and overly extremist and aggressive part that still to this day haunts the game. 

The game's developers Starvault or knows as SV, recently (4 - 5 months ago prior to this updated review) announced Mortal Online 2, and now most of the community is holding it's/his/her's breath in expectations to see how that will end up. And one of the main developers have stated, this is once in a life-time moment for him and his team to turn the game they have envisioned into THE Mortal Online.



---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Great game, you get a free for ever Trial for a restriction of 60/100 on skill point with all the skills in the game. 

I mean f2p for ever!? Ain't that freaking awsome?! 

Got well over 2k hours, and i have to say, there's always something going on in this game, are you a casual who don't got time to dedicated to much time? No problem, we got clans/guilds just for you! 

Are you a hardcore pvper and looking for guilds/clans always in conflict and always against someone? No problem! We got that as well! 

So what are you waiting for!?

World of Nave is awaiting for your arrival!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020646626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 177477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99415, 'last_played': 1644157214}
review:
Probably the best game I have ever played. The game can be as simple and as complex as you like.

The game is the most sandbox I could ever have hoped for - the grind is none existant and knowledge is power - something that no other current MMO can achieve as well as MO does in my opinion.

The best thing about MO in my opinion is the community - we have just the one server and the same names and faces will come to attention time and time again. Although the community may come across as quite Fearce and rude, it is actually a culmination of passion for, what is essentially, a form of intricate political roleplay. Do not confuse hostile conversation with a toxic community, but instead, join a guild early in your play, get involved with the politics and enjoy the unrivalled immersion that no MMO to date can give you other than MO

This game rewards those who give patience - it is, in my opinion, a perfect game

author: {'steamid': '76561198260188306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 976, 'last_played': 1503504189}
review:
Interesting game, nice premise with combat being a constant worry. Sadly though, the game is completely ruined by the player base. This game has taken prey on the new folks to a whole new level, as you have longtime vets going to low level areas to hunt new players and literally take everything from them. The sad part is, most never get to enjoy time away from cities, by the time they get a bit of gear to leave, they are murdered relentlessly back down to nothing. But, if they do make it past the gate, they are again murdered relentlessly by roving groups. The pvp is fun, even knowing the risk of losing everything. But to be constantly killed, with no real chance at getting ahead since you lose everything, add in that the player base is small, but constantly teeming with trolls and lowbie hunters and the picture is clear, this game is dead. The community is terrible, though you will admittedly find a few good people along the way. But when its such a player run game (the economy, the cities, the wilds, player created towns, ect), the viability of the game is dependant on the players, and the community of players as a whole is worse on Mortal Online than in any other game i have ever played. 

To put it in perspective, ill use a call of duty reference. Think of the pre teen kid whos swearing and calling you names, has memorized the map, and gets an instant kill shot whenever you spawn. Now take away your ability to meaningfully fight back, and now your playing with hundreds of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045050997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6674, 'last_played': 1487714488}
review:
your money and credit card info is not safe with Star Vault!

i would AVOID this game and any other product connected to Star Vault. i canceled my premium subscription to Mortal Online in the beginning of March, before my first months subscription was over, and have not signed in to my account with them since then. six months later they are still illegally withdrawing the monthly subscription fee from my credit card. i contacted their customer service department and they immediately refused to return the money they had stolen from me, and said it was against their policy to refund subscription fees for any reason, which apparently includes their company committing credit card fraud. i emailed them back, stating that i would be willing to accept other forms of compensation, to which they replied that they had finally canceled my subscription, but would not return the money they had stolen from me, or be willing to compensate me in any way.

i did have a little fun playing this game, but definitely not anywhere near the $93.65 they have charged me, which doesn't include the "international Purchase Fee" i was also charged every month.

to anyone thinking about playing this game, i would suggest staying far away from it. because even if you chose to play as a free member they will still have access to your steam account info, and might be able to figure out a way to steel from you, like they did to me.

over the next week i will be filing reports with my local police department, the MasterCard company, the branch of the US government that issued the card, and contacting Steam support to try to get this game removed so that my fellow gamers will not be tricked into having their money stolen by this company.

learn from what happened to me and save yourself the money, time, and anger of dealing with this unscrupulous company and avoid not only this game, but any product they have anything to do with in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984393631', 'num_games_owned': 15, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 30287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27313, 'last_played': 1652148814}
review:
I probably have a little over 1k hours total in this game, as I played before it reached Steam. A lot of the things you hear in the bad reviews, are true. Let me state this though. It's free to try - with level 60 skill caps you can still be decent and survive. If you become a good combatant you could even take on paying players with those skill caps. They do have an advantage.

Now on to my own review.

1. Easy to make gold, easy to lose gold.
2. You don't farm to PVP - you farm and can use the gold towards being PVP. No one has a gun to your head. (Or sword)
3. One of the best First Person swingers out there. I've played Roma-Victor, Mount&Blade, Chivalry, Xyson. Nothing compares to the adrenaline I get in PVP. I once broke into a guilds small fortress sneaking behind one of their guild members and getting in before the gate closed. I sat in there until every one else left. Killed the guy - then killed their NPCs and looted what I could. (They hunted me down for no reason, it was my revenge.)
4. Crafting is so lucrative and in-depth I can't even wrap my fking head around it. Even after hours of research. I said fk it.
5. The world is so massive, there's just no way you can safely explore all of it. Unless you rode with 20 others.
6. You make friends, and you make enemies. I mean true friends and true enemies. I see you we rolling together. I see you, you fking dying. Betrayal is all too real.


Now even though I give this a thumbs up. I have to shed light on the things I wish didn't go on.
1. Veterans preying on all the new players that arrive in Tindrem and all other places. (Really? You have a lot better opportunities than preying on some one holding maybe 5 gold.)
2. I wish they would increase Fledgling status to last a lot longer as it takes a lot longer to learn and enjoy this game.
3. Toxic Community - I mean I would rather rip my dk off than talk to most of the players. Even though I was once part of a small guild that was filled with awesome players. (God we had lots of fun.)
4. The Devs lying about things. (Why can't you just tell the truth about what you're going to fix, or what happened. We grown.)
5. The bugs/exploits that are still there and it just seems like the Devs are either too busy on other stuff like expanding the world (Which is ridiculous, there's not even enough players that play this game to expand on.) or releasing new content to even try and fix these things. I repeat, it seems.

All in all I really enjoy the time I spend in the game. I'm drunk a lot of times I play it. I wouldn't say it was a waste of money for me. I've thrown away money on worse things and terrible games. I still play it from time to time. Always drawing me back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075605938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1877, 'last_played': 1492858555}
review:
Melhor RPG online que já joguei, uma pena não ter dinheiro pra assinar ele. Mas atenção, o jogo é muito difícil e é justamente isso que o deixa tão bom, nele você vai precisar saber inglês e como não tem muitas dicas depois do tutorial, vai precisar pesquisar muito com outros players. 
 O jogo também te ''obriga''  a escolhar uma profissão se ser bom só naquilo ( você pode ser mais de uma, mas vai ser bosta nas duas ) assim o sistema de mercado do jogo é o melhor que já vi, por exemplo, um guerreiro tem tudo o que pode pro combate, então vai ser ruim em criar itens e pegar animais, assim ele faz dinheiro com a guerra e dá pra quem vende as coisas que ele precisa, e os domadores de animais fazem dinheiro vendendo pra eles e contratando serviços de outros players ( a honra é levada muito à serio nesse jogo ). Recomendo demais !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080886671', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1502553810}
review: Игра хорошая, но большие ограничения для бесплатных аккаунтов. Например, нельзя воровать, количество скиллов ограничено, есть лимит по уровню скиллов. В целом неплохо, бегаешь по хардкору, никаких тебе быстрых перемещений, никакой карты, приходится  реально читать и погружаться, чтобы поиграть. Квестов  я не встретил за 10 часов игры, может дальше будут. Если умер, нужно как в ранней вовке искать приста для воскрешения. Если случайно что-то украл или ударил, охрана тебя убивает без разбирательств, есть живые охранники, они сначала убивают, потом забирают твой лут, потом разбираются, что ты сделал, возвращают лут и советуют так больше не делать. Живенько, в общем, прикольно. Без помощи не обойтись, приходится учить английский, чтобы спросить что-то и понять, что тебе ответили. На форумах в интернете по игре инфы просто нет даже на английском языке.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040770844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 1636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1636, 'last_played': 1502773099}
review:
After playing this game for a bit more, I still think it's not worth playing. Here's some reasons.

The graphics. I have a very good computer, GTX960m, 16gigs of ram, 6th gen i7 CPU, yet, at the lowest setting, the framerate is just shit. This is is making the game unplayable because combat requires accurate aiming. And this is a game with the graphics of 10 years ago. just wtf.

Lack of content and story. I get it, it's sandbox. Minecraft don't have a story. But this ain't minecraft. There are huge cities that's pretty much empty. Buildings that are just fillers, serves no function, nobody lives in it. It's just creepy.

Lack of responsibility. Naked thieves that will pick your pocket, and if you manage to catch them, they lose ABSOLUTELY NOTHING. There are no consequence of death except dropping everything on you, which is nothing for these people. In real life, there are fines, jails, and everything. No shit in this game.

GUI. the details. Using the GUI of this game is just torture -- too much drag and drop, point and click, when it could have been a right click, a key press. It seems the people designed the GUI knows nothing about GUI designing. Not to mention the "mouse mode" idea, which is just ridiculus.

Just go play something else. This is not worth your time.


====== Review when i first played below

I really want to love this game. It have everything I wanted, but just poorly balanced, and the whole system in disrepair. 

Here's some examples why I'm giving a thumb down:
-- Sprinting feels roughly the same speed as not sprinting at low skill -- Makes no sense an adult can't sprint.
-- UI size does not scale with screen resolution -- Can't read anything at 1920x1080 because of it, not to mention the font just make the whole.
-- Buying stuff from NPC is awkward, need to "sell" your currency in exchange of items you're buying.
-- You can "train" mining or wood cutting through action (actually mining), but not without first learning that skill -- Why can't I just pick up a pickaxe and hit the rocks? Don't make sense. The idea of talking to npc to get skill makes sense, but it would fit better to increase the skill and make it more viable at low levels
-- Graveyard, an area meant for beginner to practice combat, is just not viable if you did not choose the combat skill set. How else are we supposed to practice combat?
-- Logging out require you to wait -- I understand if you quit before like 20 seconds its not safe, still, should be an option for people who don't care to not wait that long.

tl;dr the play at a beginner level seems not very interesting, I can't run at all, and the GUI is illegiable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034920830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 30953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9248, 'last_played': 1511213625}
review:
I want to start by saying this game is not easy, it has a steep learning curve, it is not a game to get because a friend has it and you want to be cool. It is a game where you learn new tricks and counters to other people each time you log in. It is a game where taking your horse (okay... maybe you ride a donkey, we've all been there) out to get some boar meat and rare spices to cook a filling meal is an epic quest. You're looking for murderers that are out there hunting people for easy loot, you're looking for dire wolves, undead minions, maybe a mercenary mage that might cross your path and eat, claw, or sacrifice you. You're making sure some group of bandits aren't sneaking through the trees with bows drawn as you close on the boar. It is intense, and the reason it is intense is because the game is harsh. You're not going to die, say, "Well I should get another level and try that again". Instead you're going to rage, remember the name of the guy that killed you, and sit at work/school tomorrow just plotting your revenge. You're also going to run in to other hunters out there, you're going to form a tense partnership and hope they don't backstab you while you both watch each other's backs on the hunt. You're going to develop alliances and guilds with those guys that have earned your trust.

This game is not for everyone. Just as everyone that has a computer is not a gamer. This game is for gamers. People who accept not planning ahead means death, and death is harsh on this game, as gamers prefer. The community is great. I have seen reviews of people raging about how toxic it is, but they claim being killed is toxic... No being killed is because you weren't a real gamer and didn't learn the lands you were walking in to. Ask for help, and everything is explained, in fact it might be over explained since there is so much to this game and it requires so much to lean. Asking how to skin a pig and sell it could lead to five paragraphs of help from people breaking it down in a sentence, to others taking the time to explain every single little thing you can do to squeeze an extra copper out of the bones of the pig you are slaughtering.


If you want to get some cool gear, not worry about the weather, time of day, recent reports of brigands, or if your character has grabbed a bite to eat and go out to win a fight against a boss with a bunch of awesome lights that make you think you have skill, this game might be to hard for you.

All in all, this game is made for gamers. If you're a gamer, and you enjoy the challege of learning a game that does not care if you cry because it is hard, this is 100% for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985787170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5347, 'last_played': 1505166148}
review:
This game is basically Eve online with swords. 

It had had a pretty steep learning curve. The tutorial isn't great but they put you in a help channel for 170 hours, and most people there are willing to help new players and respond quickly. 

This game is pretty brutal, if you die you drop everything you have. 

That being said, it's a player economy which I find very cool. There are no classes, it's up to you to allocate your skill points to create the class you want. 

There is also modular housing. A guild, if they wanted to, can create an entire town that people can even spawn in. Complete with npcs and all!

Over all I highly reccomend this game. Just be prepared for a big learning curve.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198007257896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 84828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14467, 'last_played': 1575745390}
review:
This game is one of a kind. You have complete freedom to do whatever you feel like. Explore, pvp, pve, pick pockets, engage in toxic politics and wars or become a merchant kingpin.
You can be a travelling merchant, peddling localised items from one end of the world to another. You can be a gatherer for complete strangers by using the broker buy orders system. You can be or do almost anything. You can steal from anyone anywhere.. but watch out for the guards or witnesses!

I never had so much fun in a game, as I have had in Mortal Online. 

I have played this game since the q1 of 2013. My steam hours does not show this, because I only recently started to use steam for the game.

The pros for Mortal are too numerous to list- but most important is that it is a full loot pvp mmorpg. Character creation is completely free, you make the character that you want, only limit is the amount of primary skill points.

The cons are numerous too, and you should be aware of them:
It is an old game, and you see this in the art/graphics. But hey, the weapons and armor are modelled after realistic gear and does not look like some anime cartoonish wow thing :)

There are many many bugs. You can get stuck on many things, some npcs like to move within walls of dungeons and other very annoying stuff.

There is NO official manual for the game, and the game is extremely complex. If you want to do anything more complicated than fighting, you are forced to spend hours reading guides on the official forums.

Population is old and a new player will have some difficulty convincing other players that he/she is truly new and not a spy for another guild.

The game community is slightly toxic. 

This game is not truly free to play. The f2p set a skill cap that prevent you from wearing heavy armor and from learning thievery. Dont waste your time with the f2p. As f2p you will never amount to anything but a hybrid lightweight fighter/tamer murderer in the capitol.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074197483', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1500816125}
review:
Отличная бесплатная онлайн игра!

Прочитал отзывы, решил попробовать, раз уж, тем более, бесплатная.
Скачал, установил.
Создал персонажа, человека. Очень красочные картинки, описания... В общем - вдохновлен.
При загрузке уже, непосредственно, мира - вечная загрузка.
Ну, такое бывает...
Завершаю работу через диспетчер, захожу еще раз. На этот раз уже краш.
Прошу третий раз - краш.
При попытке зайти в 4 раз - игра сообщает, что такой пользователь уже залогинен в игре.
Под хорошими впечатлениями решил удалить.
Вердикт - 4 лага и 10. Все советую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007254998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 17897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5280, 'last_played': 1510781835}
review:
I cannot recommend this game enough.

The game is a first person only MMO, if I was to describe it I would say think about a game that is like elder scrolls but done right!.

Pretty much every thing in this game is in depth and takes a long time to understand but once you get the hang of it you can get sucked into even the littlest parts of the game, such as going out into the world to find and tame animals with the right stats that you want to then use a breeding stock for your own mounts and animals or extracting raw ores from the rocks and then refining them into metals to sell or use to craft.

The game has a unlimited free trail but you are restricted to only having 60 effective skill points in any one skill, you can still level that skill up to 100 but until you sub you won't get the full skill point advantage. 

This is enough to let you understand the game and work out whether you like it or not, the game is not free to play you will not be on the same level as some one that subs.

Overall a great game and the Devs and social media team are very active in the community and answer a lot of questions quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138368819', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1542638798}
review:
Подобрал чужой лут - получил приступника. За это меня убил стражник. Пошел забирать тело и случайно опять поднял его вместе с чужим лутом. Опять убили) Пошел забирать тело увидел красный грибок. Сожрал - сдох. Пошел Забирать все свои тела - собрал 3 собственных головы + тело. Был голодный и сожрал 3 своих головы и чуток тела. Тело распотрошил и получил кожу своей расы (14шт) и кучу костей (мяса не было, походу дрыщ) Короче игра крутая))) Описаные события заняли 10 минут времени.

10 съеденых голов из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198128289800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 41771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27584, 'last_played': 1560428512}
review:
A unique game but very old and unoptimized.
I wouldn't say the game itself is bad, infact it seems to be good for exploration, content wise probably not.

The main problem is the community and the content lock until you join one of the major guilds. Basically it is incredibly hard to have any fun in this game without joining a major guild of the game, no room for solo players unless you plan to pay $40 USD to the developers for character slots and an additional fee every month for the subscription.

The game, is dying. It is dwindling on a suprisingly large loyal playerbase which I believe are really just there to troll and grief, which is fine to a certain degree. This is a game, it is meant for people to have fun in.

My problem comes with the insane amount of hours you have to dump into this game, the amount of developers who do nothing and how little control with the community there is. I understand this is a Hardcore MMO however a game which allows players to hunt a newer guy down until they get bored or the player quits is just stupid. This, is called Harassment. Back to what I said about many of the devs doing nothing, either they never log into the game or they do just to close your review and tell you to "Eff off" if you re-open an unsolved problem.
The quote has only happened once however devs have ignored me and many others numerous times even going to the point of closing every review we open on an issue.

There are obvious exploiters in this game, the anti cheat does nothing. The devs can't really do anything unless they catch them in the act, going back to 87% of the time devs say they are watching the guy when they are really cooking their food or something irl. This allows the exploiter to get away with his acts for weeks, or even months.

I specifically do not recommend this game because of the community, it seems nice at first until you leave Tindrem. Then it hits you like a brick, the combat is broken and a lot of hits do not even register, some NPCs are bugged to the point they have infinite health and the griefers who kill the games playerbase are not penalized since all they have to do is leave their computer up and their character in ghost mode for a night, then they can log in and massacre a couple people in town.
Still, I am all for losing everything on me when I die, it is when people obviously abusing the system and finding loopholes get away with it, to the point of getting dev support is when I draw the line.

The game still has potential but the dev team needs to be reformed, get people in there that know what they are doing and care about the game. I know of about 2 devs who actually do their jobs while the rest never log on or log on and close tickets randomly without viewing them.

Please comment your experiences to bring more awareness to this, all dev responses are welcome if it is a calm conversation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105901558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 61144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33527, 'last_played': 1503286406}
review:
If Skyrim was a MMORPG, and you played as an average villager, or a soldier, where your not Overpowered or a dragonborn, unless you work for it, this would be it, but it has its own brutal, game of throneish Lore.

Cross Game of Thrones + Star Wars(the force) + Skyrim + Age of Conan, and you have Mortal Online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018231874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 8943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3003, 'last_played': 1531348784}
review:
Jogo excelente, talvez o único jogo verdadeiramente hardcore em existência hoje com exceção de tibia. O jogo é feito por uma empresa indie, portanto é claro que possui alguns problemas:

- Griefing na cidade inicial (Tindrem).
- Bugs, muitos bugs. Com o tempo você acaba lidando com eles do melhor jeito que pode.
- O jogo não é amigável com iniciantes, portanto tudo se torna difícil de aprender. Horas de pesquisa na internet e ajuda de uma guild resolvem este problema.
- Gráfico e Engine desatualizados, mas que pra mim não é problema.

Apesar destes problemas é um dos melhores MMORPG que já joguei. Imersão incrível, uns pontos positivos:

+ Aprende skills de acordo com o uso.
+ Open pvp com full loot.
+ Criação de castelos no mapa com controle de guilds. 
+ Cercos a castelo de guilds.
+ Casa no mapa aberto / sem instância.
+ Sistema de reputação.
+ Clima dinâmico. (Por ex. você ve uma nuvem no céu lá longe, e naquele local estará chovendo de fato e se ela estiver a caminho de sua direção, logo choverá onde você está).
+ Sistema de sobrevivência (Sede, fome, temperatura,etc.)
+ Melhor sistema de craft que já vi em um MMORPG (Várias opções que dependem do crafter).
+ Melhor sistema de pesca que já vi (Escolha entre varas de pesca, isca, tipo de anzol, tipo de linha, profundidade do anzol).
+ Coloque uma roupa com a pele de seus inimigos.
+ Colecione cabeça dos seus inimigos.
+ ...

Entre no jogo e procure uma guild, se informe e veja como o Mortal Online é um dos melhores MMORPG que existem!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021310829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 23276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16111, 'last_played': 1503201085}
review:
Simply cant describe how awesome this game is for people that love a challenge. Theres tons of negative reviews from people that have spent little to no effort understanding or researching. This game is not newbie friendly thats the truth, but so damn rewarding when you figure out the path you want to take. 

I've been gaming for 20ish years starting with Quake, Doom, Ultima Online, EverQuest, Darkfall and about any other real PVP game out there even some FPS shooters (grab my attention for a whole 2 weeks then im over it)... This game tops all of them and honestly feels like a Mix between Ultima online and Darkfall with alot more undiscovered aspects.

I can talk about this game for hours on this review and simply not cover everything, I've played since Beta and still learning every day / trying new builds and skill combos to tweak my build.

In short you have 1100 skill pts to what you wish kinda the same set up Ultima Online had. endless racial combos for different stat attributes that all affect dmg/runspeed/stam/health. You can be anything you want Tamer, Thief, Fighter, Mage, Crafter, Fisherman, the list goes on. Amoung the Endless possiblities of crafting hundreds of different weapon types with different materials. This game is hands down unmatched by anything content/depth of knowledge it takes to "master" the game.

All i can say is try it and give it a chance, also if you see the numbers off steam... It's not accurate.. most people launch off non steam client. Just to give you a idea... Mortal Online forums have 90k+ accounts. Probably around 4-6k active accounts currently. Hope this helps, this was also my first game review that i feel needed to be posted.

Enjoy! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197986304138', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3387, 'last_played': 1521830088}
review:
Warning! -free version max level 50!

In the beginning your moving so slow that the grass grows faster than you can walk and sprint. 

And it takes some time before you get to lvl 50 where stuff is some what okey and get your speed up to/on things. like walking and runing. stil not fast but its better then it was.

jumping it still shait at lvl 50 so ceep that in minde. 

And it may take some time before you get used to the low carry 
capacity and cant carry around alot of stuff while you you wear full set of clothes/armor. 

Cooking is not a priority for my part but has maximized it for the benefit it gives. atlest i dont get 
Food poisoned by what i make.

making weapons and armor takes a long time to learn. and a good quality product you can use or sell takes alot of combined things.

magic is also a long learning curve but comes in handy when you cant or have the time to rest for more hp or stamina.

and you Learn quite quickly when you have to get your s**t and gtfo from a battle. couse the sob will chase you down and it will trow stuff afther you quite the distance if you let it... 

but its fun and you should team up when ever you can...
