author: {'steamid': '76561197999656154', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 46214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45309, 'last_played': 1513266388}
review:
Un jeu que j'aurais pu sans aucun doute recommandé mais...

Point positifs pour moi:

Bonne immersion
Pour ceux qui désirent roleplay c'est un jeu révé
Monde ouvert sans temps de chargement
Qu'un seul serveur,donc aucune instances(cool et en mème temps non j'expliquerais pourquoi)
Quand l'adversaire le permet,combat plus ou moin skilled(si il n'exploit pas,cheat pas,lag pas)
j'ai bien aimé l'ambiance dark fantasy du jeu,qui au debut me rebutait pas mal mais une fois dedans plutot cool
Les moment d'adrénaline pur qu'un bon jeu immersif peut donner
Le craft,l'aspect sandbox qui vous donnera enormement d'objectif si le coeur y est
Le fait que ca soit un Quasi oblivion online,j'ai trouve ca cool


Les points négatifs selon moi:

Trop de bug,trop d'exploit de la part de vétéran qui savent comment ca marche
Ping très mal géré en combat,dans le sens ou moi qui vient de france,bah faut qjprenne en compte qy'a des breziliens et qles breziliens ca lag et que du coup bah je le touche pas pck il lag et que lui il me touche et que c'est drole lol.(tout les combats ne sont pas comme ca evidement,mais... trop pour un jeu a abonement)
Communauté bien trop élitiste,j'entend par la que la pluspard ont leur vision du jeu bien fondé,aller a cette encontre et tu n'aura pas d'amis,deja que de base c'est difficile de trouver des "amis" sur ce jeu.
Une communauté pas si basse que ca mais,tout le monde vient a connaitre ton nom au bout d'1 mois mème pas,asser pour t'insulter en tout cas ^^.
Le support est bien trop inconstant en therme de qualité,et ne pas remboursé ma dernière transaction ou je n'est pas pu jouer du mois(bug,déco,crash) la solution a ce problème aurait été de passer par un vpn pour jouer a mortal,allé sur le deepweb avec un vpn ok,passé par un vpn pour juste jouer a un jeu... moais(ca sent a peine le pet cette histoire m'enfin,pourquoi pas x)).

au final j'ai passé de très bon moments sur ce jeu sincèrement,j'ai eu la chance de rentré dans une guilde Fr qui m'a appris les bases "essentiels" pour pouvoir comprendre un minimum le jeu,stuffs etc,ils on été globalement sympa avec moi. Mais au final je trouve ce jeu bien trop plastique,que ca soit les graphismes,les mécaniques de jeu saccadé(j'ai jamais vu un système de magie aussi réaliste et pourrie a la fois sans déconné T.T)

Bref,j'ai joué a des tas dejeu online,compétitifs,aussi pourrit soit il,mais j'ai jamais rencontré autant de bug,de gens égocentrique(j'ai joué 6 ans a lol,jamais vous verrez une video de moi sur le net,j'ai joué 6 mois a mortal,deux video de moi en train de me faire débrouissaillé l'olive,pour vous dire la mentalité du truc. pourtant lol les gens égocentrique... bref^^

Conclusion:de très bonne idées,une bonne immersion, trop d'ego,BIEN trop d'ego,un support négligé,qui n'aura comme seul initiative,répondre aux évalutions négatives sur steam. En bref,ca vaut pas 14 e par mois ou 13 e jsais plus,ca m'a gavé xD



Edit: Ayant éssayé de lancer quelques stream sur mortal,j'ai vite compris mon erreur,streamstalk tout simplement,Des mecs bien stuffs viennent te casser la guelle alors que t'essaye d'apprivoisé des vieux ânes,pas de mortal online sur twitch donc,dommage pour la communauté qui ne demande qu'a trouvé des nouveaux joueurs ^^".

author: {'steamid': '76561198150893714', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1533373108}
review:
Alright ... here we go ... : cracks fingers : 

So my experience at first was Awfull . I kept dying and dying and never realising i was doing all the stuff wrong . So i wrote a negative review about this game . Because i got killed for doing something illegal ingame . Which really sucked for me . Later on i started learning from my Mistakes and now here i am Successful butcher ! haha ..... 

Anyways ... i did find some ingame buds , and we explored some dungeons and all that classy stuff . I cant say the Game is Bad , i mean it is old . But it definetly needs Performance Setting ! My computer has R9 380X 4GB VRAM equal to GTX 960 . And Mortal ONline brings me up to 64 celsius . Which is pretty not good . Im even on medium settings .  

Anyways good job on the game please work on the Performance issues ! or as i call it GPU throttling ! And it will be great !  Maybe put cursewords chat filter for younger gamers . 

Would love the developper of this game to add me as Friend i have some recommendations !

author: {'steamid': '76561198052914441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 29059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23928, 'last_played': 1616809104}
review: I really like Mortal Online. It's a great an unforgiving MMO. It's very in depth, but also very time consuming just to even do minor things. The only real problem I have with it is the community is pretty bad. It's also very full of exploits/cheaters. I had a guy kill me only to go red for all of 5 seconds before going back blue and having no penalty for my murder. I've seen 2 guys run into a town and just kill guards and everyone else in it while taking no damage. If it actually had exploits/cheats fixed, if players weren't so toxic/hateful, and a playerbase more than 300 people, it'd be a great successor to UO. As it is now though good luck actually getting any new players to stick with it past the first month.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075776739', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1497765815}
review:
A confusing character creation system that does not give any hints that the stats you favor have any bearing on the class you want to play. For example I found out that intelligence is needed for crafting and strength is needed for bows a long time after I had created my toon.

Incredibly steep learning curve. Needed help besides the tutorial from the start. A positive thing was the help chat was useful.

I found my toon moved too slow and the combat system is very click intensive. Trying to free roam is very easy to get lost. I went into the city and wasted 30 minutes trying to find the main gate out as there is no in-game map.

The crafting and lore system looks amazing but if I move too slowly getting places to gather it's just too annoying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005584110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 46273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43319, 'last_played': 1504652201}
review:
I played this game for  more than five years allready and i can tell you way you should not pay a subscription base on my veteran experience and what i observed during this time:

-They release big content patches that are not balanced not even tested and they relay on the customers to do this testing expecting the very ppl that pays for the mothly subscription to test and report bugs. So you will end up dealing with nasty things like items desapearing from your banks/chests, loosing pets, being stucked on the map, falling through the world map and waiting for a GM for more than 30 min to get any sort of help.

-GMs dont have proper logs so when you loose an item or pet because of a bug they just give you the: "we cant do anything, have a nice day" standard SV support team answer.

-They have players working as GMs, they denay it and they erase any topic on the forums but the community knows.

-GMs very often dont know about the mechanics of the game and you may get Jailed for extended period of times just because you where using this mechanics. Try to explain to a gm how portals work.

-They have a number of bugs i personaly reported and i am prety sure others also did, some of this bugs have years there with no posible fix in the horizon.

-The crafting/prossesing materials mechanics are totaly broken and are realy boring to do. If you want high tier gear be prepared to spend your payed time watching a progress bar for hours or Alt+Tab your game to other while a macro do nasty boring tasks that no player should ever do on anygame. Want wood, ores? Be prepared to watch a three or a rock for hours with the only interaction being to switch your pickaxe.

-They introduced a very bad Territory control system that allow players to exploit it placeing structures over unreachable locations. The siege system is boring and static. The new "free house system" last patch they introduced is a bad joke in terms of quality and balance. House are easy to destroy and hard to build, doors are buged and for some desynced players they look open but for others they look closed. House chests are broken and you may loose items if you use them. 

-There is a realy sad history of hackers harrassing the allready damaged game population and the company staff cant just handle with them aparently. It is common knowlidge how easy is to cheat and how basic their anticheat mesure are. Expect ppl using speed hacks and aim bots. expect the servers going down because of DDoS attacks, runing the experience for everyone.

You may ask why I kept paying a subscription for so many years and i can tell you i did it because i expected this game to get good over the years. Sadly, i can tell you this will not happend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052973832', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1497536959}

author: {'steamid': '76561198107879743', 'num_games_owned': 10, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2174, 'last_played': 1529176712}
review:
It is horrible to see such game get all that negative crap reviews from salty players. It is a sandbox game where you are free to do whatever you want, of course you would encounter some retarded people who like to grief and shit on new players. But the thing is, that stops most of the players from explring and learning what this game really is about.

Despite most of the players never realizing this, the game has amazing overall idea, great concept, and even lore.. 
There are lots of different, complicated mechanics in the huge sandbox open world filled with mysteries. 
Pvp is just amazing (once you learn to fight and get your skills right), it is really skill based, like chivalry, but has factors that make it even more realistic, mostly because of the player freedom. You need both skilled players with different roles and thoughtful strategies to win large scale battles.

The sad truth is that 99% of the players will never get to experience the immersiveness, all the freedom and possibilities and the in-depth core system of this game, because they got killed numerous times in the graveyard of the cancerous city named Tindrem, and quit the game, having explored less than even 1% of the world and learned exactly nothing about what you can really do in the game, except dying and losing everything.

Even if they don't quit, they would become one of those players who do exactly that, because they would feel they are getting their 'justice' in doing so. 

And what happens after a while with those people?
'1/10 worse game evr, minecraft 10x better,  also i don't like dying in games '

Game has potential and one can always experience great things while playing, if he has the right mindset and does not quit or lose his ideals on the first hardship.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082052049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1497299612}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035472035', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 5893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 17, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1712098831}
review:
This game is not for everyone but I can say it gives you alot of freedom to do what you want, with the people you want. The world is a massive Openworld to share with alot of players, Its best to not start in tindrim if your new, alot of reds like to camp the gates.

Spell casing feels rewarding because it takes alot of uptime to start being a spell chucker, its better to roll out as a sword and shield/2 swords, learn how to perry/block early saves lives, eat and drink, learn how to cook, chop some wood, make a fire boil some water that kind of stuff.

If you wanted an MMORPG with skill based combat and survival aspects than this is your game.

If you also like to nerd rage at your mount getting killed somewhere in the boondocks and loosing all your hard earnd loot  and being chased for the better part of 2 hours until a blue player runs across you and helps you or Beating a player whos got better gear then you just because he couldnt block well enough, then this is also your game.

Imagin an MMO where it can feel like a singleplayer experiance but then suddenly becomes a multiplayer game on the fly. No other mmo feels quite like Mortal Online and the experiance is unique.

review: За несколько часов игры могу назвать ее уникальной, тут развитие персонажа зависит от его действий в игре, обширный крафт, вид от первого лица, мясо, обнаженка, можно блевануть от переедания или отравления если жрать все подряд :) влияние погоды, хардкор, тебя могут убить или ограбить везде, хотя в городе поспокойней, система питомцев, голода, сна, ездове животные, разнообразие классов и многое другое не могу всего перечислить еще маловато наиграл, единственный минус для меня это нет Русской локализации, поэтому поначалу тяжело во всем разобратся.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048002158', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1688003131}
review:
For me this game is epic. I love how indepth the Skill system is in the game. I actually did a review on this game on the Facebook page they have years ago. If I can I'll copy pasta my review from there to here. long story short if your into RPGs and hardcore death, with skill level systems from scratch this is the game for you. just keep in mind it's a hardcore game. not for the faint of heart.

[h1]Updated old review[/h1]

Any TRUE RPG fans out there like myself?

If you've not played Mortal Online yet you need to hand over your gamer card ASAP. If your a true fan of MMoRPG's than this game will be right up your ally.

Over 100 skills JUST in the crafting system alone. FULL open world PvP with REAL real-time combat. And HARDCORE death penalties! Non of that cheap conventional level/class system like in your everyday modern online RPG's. Rather a Skill based attribute system to REALLY TRULY build your own custom combat game style. 

Want to learn magic? Read books, want to get better at fighting with a swords or bows? Use them more often. Want to run faster and longer? Than run till you can no longer run! 

I challenge YOU to step up your game with Mortal Online. Think your a BEATER? Well beat this and see where your skills truly stack up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994167191', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1497142142}
review:
Apparently the game doesnt want to be played.


A chronological order of my "gaming" experience here:

1. Starting the game.
2. No Steam-login
3. Create an account
4. Login
5. Notice the resolution is off
6. No ingame options as it seems
7. Close the game
8. Start the launcher and change the options there.
9. Login, start character editor
10. Choose ancestry 
11. Game crashes
12. Start the game
13. Cant login. I have to wait for my account to be logged out by the system first.
14. Login
15. Create character
16. Tab out
17. Tabbing back in locks my computer with a frozen screen
18. Gotta kill the Mortal Online process without being able to access task manager
19. Start the game (Waiting for account to be logged out by the system)
20. Create character
21. Loadingscreen 
22. Tab out (Figures I can do something else while loading)
22. Try to tab back in
23. It becomes apparent that you cannot tab out of the game because it will keep locking your computer in a frozen screen.
24. Kill the process again
25. Start the game (Waiting for account to be logged out by the system)
26. Click on character and "play"
27. Wait for the loadingscreen to finish.
28. Resolution didnt get changed through the launcher.
29. Changing resolution ingame.
30. Game freezes upon applying the new resolution
31. Game locked my computer again.
32. Gotta kill the process

33. Smashes that uninstall button

34. Developers leaked personal information

Compromised data: Email addresses, Names, Passwords, Physical addresses, Usernames

author: {'steamid': '76561198021755479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1497054139}
review:
EDIT:
So the game is an unlimited trial. If you pay 15 dollars per month, you experience the full capacity of your character. Pay 2 Win is irrelevant I guess, since, as FarmerJoe says below, they are not a F2P game and they are trying to make it more clear to newer players that this is not a F2P game, but an unlimited trial.

My experience of the game was: 

- So many words when making a character. Kinda if I were to describe history to aliens and not take into account they don't understand what a Canadian or American is. "The Bashravan took the Isolana from the Katatanka and the Ulusophis caught Manacookis from Isofritz, and because the warlike Kukutana stole Hahanana" sort of thing. When I see fantasy do this I just cannot get motivated enough to read into every nook and cranny of the key-word history, so I just picked one race as my grandpa-grandpa-grandma-grandma-father-mother-self etc. My objective was to get a feel for the game anyway and not waste so much time on something I could remake later if I really was interested in the game.

- Picking attributes, I thought: Definitely one of those games you have to research a lot on first, if you want the right stuff. I would describe the entirety of character selection as unintuitive, since stats are an arbitrary language not explained in great detail to you. I just went 100% intellect and thought I would research it all later.

- Character screen glitches out on me, my age is stuck at 80 and won't go down. 

- Game seems like a fantasy Rust. Kinda interested now. Maybe I will research into the technicalities.

- Finds it's Pay 2 Win in everyway that a Free to Play game can be, except I'm corrected that it's not free to play, just free to partially experience. 

Well, I really suggest making it free to play. 50% on steam. Lots of people saying the moderators and GMs don't give a pudding about the game. I have no motivation to subscribe to an old and kind of rigid-feeling game like this. Tons of other options to pick from. If the game were like 10$ to get into and the rest non-P2W cosmetics, like how Rust can make your sweaters appear differently when you craft them, sure I would definitely give it a go.

review: so i started playing this game its very very interesting and the tutorial is just awful it doesnt actually tell you how to do anything and when you press H to get help it just brings you to a menu with a bunch of useless things to read which is dumb but the best part about it is a new player is able to get ganked [killed] by maxed out players in the starting zone like come on what kind of horse shit is that why would any game allow new players to get fucking obliterated as soon as they started playing? i made  multiple characters 1 of each race and never chose the same starting zone and always some better geared player would come along and gank me and a bunch of other new players like wooow whoever designed this game must have either been drunk or is incompetent to say the least dont waste your time getting this game not worth it i promise you unless you are into being ganked then killed by the guards when you try and defend yourself then have to walk 5 minutes to respawn then 5 more minutes to walk back to your body to get your stuff

author: {'steamid': '76561197984083203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1451073086}
review:
Amazing game with tons of potential but the devs seem rather inept and have a long history of sweeping things under the rug without fixing them. I was told by a GM that they had removed relatively all of the duped items as well as fixed all duping methods yet I still have 20+ stacks of cronite/ohgmium, a few dozen of tungsteel and 10 stacks of gold coin which my clan acquired through killing a pair of dupers in the wild. To further add insult the same fucking dupe they used to make all of those stacks I hold still works as I tested it prior to deciding whether or not I wanted to get back into this game. 


TL;DR, I sent in a video to the GM's 3-4 months back showing them that a dupe from beta is still working and they told me that I was wrong despite doing it and sending in video evidence.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995294278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 25899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16744, 'last_played': 1710297643}
review:
I pumped soo many hours into the game that it's soo goddamn addicting and it caters to MANY Playstyles, If you enjoy games like Darkfall Online, Ultima Online, Shroud of the Avatar, Rust, Chivarly and ARK than you will most definately enjoy this game.
A Hardcore Full Loot MMORPG with no loading screens and Beautiful Environments (Some areas need graphic updates)
In the past the environment/towns seemed Barren due to lack of NPCS however they have simply fixed it over the years with new weather, Voip System, New Magic Schools and a new House Revamp.

I spent most of my time playing this game as a simple crafter in the fancy town of fabernum, Once i had successfully became self sufficent with supplying myself aswell as the town i than decided to explore with others which blew my mind of what much more i had missed out on.

I can't understand why this game isn't Huge or known by much old UO fans but damn it has kept me coming back to it every now and than, Even after my subscription has run out i can still login to my characters like my thief and go around and lockpick some chests for money....like seriously what game allows you to do that.

Further more on the F2P/Free Trial aspect i do see people tend to complain about it however the game is still playable you can still level all your skills to 100 however you will notice that the skills are capped at 60, You can technically Level your guy to the "MAX" than subscribe and finish off a few additional skills like heavy armour training and you're 100% ready for combat.

What personally makes this game enjoyable more than others is the theme of a Gothic/European/Mythological world with Weird ass creatures and a Fair feeling of magic that you're not always Getting NUKED like other MMOs.

The crafting is honestly the best ive come across in any MMO, Different materials for hilts and blades and styles that they look in change the properties of the weapon which can than be used as a fast stabbing spear or slashing polesword.
Hell you can even make rediculous weapons like a Lance with a hammer head (It may not be the most efficent weapon but goddamn it gives you the freedom to do so.


Try the game really, It's crazy fun once you get past all the overwhelming amount of options you have.

review: I quit because the game became too addictive. If you liked Ultima Online Second Age days this game could be for you. Players can be toxic but hey that's life. Best thing to do is get into a decent guild which is where the fun begins. Great political game, high risk, high reward scenarios. Large scale 50 vs 50 sieges that can last hours an have the capiability of wiping out a guild entirely. Pretty well balanced, combat can take a while to get use too. Probably the most hard core mmorpg template.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021993421', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1496299954}
review:
This is a resounding no.

A friend (who is a game developer) and I started up last night, met each other in the tutorial area and laughed a bit at the interface.  Nothing awful, a little awkward to get through the menus but once we had it figured out we quickly made our way to the bunnies. He watched me tame mine and streamed the silly coercing animation.

The future looked bright as he chose animal tamer and I went with archer. Just after leaving the tutorial, he took a couple of minutes to tame a dog. Naming it, we stumbled our way around the city looking for some action. We found the graveyard. While he and I were attempting to communicate via voice chat (which is awful btw, christ) another player came up behind him and stabbed his dog. "not your dog" the player said, then handed him a corpse. I watched the guy stab it, so I know he did it. My friend gave him the benefit of the doubt, and after we discussed it on his channel, he said he was writing the player's name down. The player lingered for awhile.

We began combat with a skeleton. While still in our two hour grace period, the player stepped in front of my friend's weapon swing, I assume flagged my friend for combat and then proceeded to stab him twice - to death. I was wildly flailing at the skeleton, didn't notice that I managed to strike him as well, and he killed me also.

We came back and our corpses were looted, left with only our heads and some rags. The Pièce De Résistance for me was when I tabbed out to talk to him, the game forced my alt key to emulate being held down and I had to force restart in order to tell him that I was uninstalling this.

Visuals are good. The community is trash and this game cannot be salvaged until you either fix the grace period or ban exploiters like that guy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102460269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 85389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2541, 'last_played': 1630961154}
review:
Its not for everyone, sure. But if its for you, its seriously for you. This game is about specialisation, finding the goal of your charicter and becoming talented at a singal persuit; theiving, magic, fighting, crafting. You won't be self sufficient, you'll need otherplayers to acomplish anything and no singal player is untouchable. For that matter.. in this universe, no city, town or capital is either. 

The player based market and economy make the game feel dynamic and alive. But, its not an easy game. There is little help in just about anything, your going to stumble your ways through crafting, never really understanding exactly what combination of weight, materials and designs work best. But thats the persuit we love. If you just adventure that's fine too, but be prepared to die a lot and when you die, be prepared to accept the costly consiquences. 

My enjoyement of this game is exponential, intially i absolutely rage-hatted everything about it. But, in time, you learn to love every difficulty that made those first few hours so damm intolerable. 


Now, for the bad stuff. The graphics are fairly aweful, or at least the animations are just so terrible and that make imersion a little painful at times. That said, I dont think its why people play... but it is also 2017.  The FTP (free to play model) is a bit of a lie, while you can free to play you'll suck and be able to acomplish nothing. At least its not pay to win though, and once you subscribe you'll unlock all the higher level skills very quickly, so there's no rush, do test it out. The downside of the free to play model is that the skill growth can be trash-trash-trash-(limit of FTP)-semi-trash-epic. Which is kind of sad, but grinding skills is fairly easy and so the game becomes about fiding matterials, locations and recipeis to etablish yourself and trade.

Anyhow, give it a go. You'll be pleasently pissed off, then thrilled you pushed through.

TL:DR if you want to run around as a uber-leet-lol-cake cartoon orc in wow: this aint for you. Want something more challenging, serious and worth while where every small aspect of the world matters. Welcome, but you wont get a tutorials (or at least a useful one)

author: {'steamid': '76561198300247981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1547828829}
review:
Игра стала вторым домом и заставляет возвращаться в нее снова и снова. Баги фиксятся постоянно, новые фишки добавляются постоянно. Оптимизация на высоте, хотя и требует хорошей видео карты. 
Хамелеон в этой игре отпугивает больше 80% игроков, а еще львиную долю игроков отпугивает английский язык. 
Однако те кто остался и полюбил Мортал, застряли тут почти на вечно. Это легко прослеживается по комьюнити которое сложилось за 8 лет игры. 
10 ворн свордов из 10

review: The game itself is awesome. other then graphics due to it being an old game, the detail the creators put in to this game is amazing. it is a hard game to learn I do suggest finding guides outside MO as there is no real Beginners tutorial. it has indepth craftin everything must be learned prior to becoming successful at it. HOWEVER star Vault unfortunately has limited itself to a certain clientel, somewhat toxic. So if you ar not into a Hard Core MMO (as they call it) also known as griefing to others. this may not be the game for you, I would NOT suggest purchasing this game but INSTEAD playing the F2P first. to see if this is something you like. I hope that in the future Star Vault changes this game to include different play styles but at this point I do not see that Happening.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081224150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 65744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11226, 'last_played': 1585767621}
review:
Коротко: 
Отличная игра для тех, кому не лень включать мозг и задавать вопросы.

Подробнее: 
Если вы любите бегать от стрелочки к стрелочке, от НПС до НПС, то игра не для вас.
Если вы любите убивать 100500 ваншотных мобов в секунду, то игра не для вас.
Если вы жутко боитесь потерять горячо-обожаемый вами шмот, на который потратили пол года задротства, то игра так же, не для вас.
И даже если вы не можее терпеть серьезные баги, из за которых будете по глупому умирать, тут тоже пролет.

Если же вы любите тщательно, продуманно и осторожно подходить ко всему, от изучения мира и механик игры, до сражений, как ПвЕ, так и ПвП...
Если вас не отпугивает английский язык и вам не страшно вступить в клан, дабы разобраться, что к чему...
Если вы способны найти себе занятие в свободной игре с кучей возможностей, без притягивания за уши...
Ну и если вас не страшат различные странные, багованные, несправедливые явления в игре...
То, вероятно, игра вам может понравится.

Лично я, весьма критично относился к игре, отпугивала подписка и общая хардкорность, даже отложил начало игры до лучших времен несколько лет назад. Да и сейчас, когда я подсел на игру, все еще остаются спорные моменты (та же условная бесплатность и баги), идеальных игр, увы, не бывает и эта тому прямое подтверждение.
Но вся атмосфера и многогранность игрового процесса, которые еще нужно уметь раскрыть, пересилила возможные риски и я начал играть.
На данный момент почти безвылазно играю уже несколько недель и не перестаю узнавать для себя что-то новое: 
Интересные места, данжи, территории со своими особенностями, рандомные сокровища в различных формах и проявлениях, хоть и весьма ограниченные, но их можно открывать для себя не один день или даже неделю.
Множество профессий, требующих тщательного подхода, играя которыми, можно месяцами узнавать какие-то особенности и не терять интерес.
Не шибко продуманные, но от того не менее веселые клановые войны и простое ПвП.
А так же множество других интересных и не очень, моментов.

До этого пробовал множество различных ММОРПГ, которые цепляли в разной степени, но после всего пройденого, эта игра смогла меня зацепить, уж не знаю на сколько, но смогла.
Потому могу посоветовать просто попробовать ее и не делать поспешных выводов, не гарантирую, что игра вам понравится, но я сам ее открыл для себя не сразу, потому дайте ей шанс занять частичку вашего времени и, возможно, даже частичку вашей души :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198257509217', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 111682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1613839730}
review:
Arkadaslar öncelikle olumsuz verenler ya bilgisayarinyetersiz oldugundan oynayamayanlar yada hardcore oyunu beceremeyenlerdir. Oyjnu uzhn sure oynadım steam uzerinden oynamadim ama steam a geceli cok olmadi. 
Oyun ultima online mantığıyla birebir eslesiyor tabi 3d ve kaliteli bir grafik esliginde. 
Oyunda ne olmak istediginize siz karar veriyorsunuz ve olmak icinde cok calisiyorsunuz. Klic ustasi olmak icin klic madenci olmak icin kazma salliyorsunuz. 
Full loot olayi cok.cekici bir şey tabi loot yoyrn siz degilseniz 😆 kesunlikle sabredip oynayop gorulmesi gereken bir oyun. 
Oyumda itemler 1000 saatte bile tamamini ogrenemiyeceginiz kadar cesitli. Bunarada hic bir silah zirh vs birbirinin aynisi.degil .... bu oyun da zaten digerlerinin aynısı degil...

author: {'steamid': '76561198017658956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1494879631}
review: Нудная бегалка по пустыне с примесью отвратной графики. Единственный плюс это система крафта, делать можно всё из всего, начиная от добычи руды, до готовки еды из того, что попадётся под ногами, можно даже металл добавить в еду. Но это всё убивается лагами в бою и настолько медленным бегом, что перемещение до соседнего дома превращается в целое путешествие. Даже самые густые леса напоминают пустыню. Графика уровня Quake 3, анимации того же уровня. Игра очень на любителя.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136757031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1190, 'last_played': 1586206238}
review: In all honesty the game has potential but there's way too much BS going on in it for me to give it any kind of rating over like a 6.5/10 and that's being nice about it. While the game has decent graphics and a lot of potential it has many more downsides than up. Too many new players get slaughtered without having any kind of real chance and no real defences against PKers. You get 2 hours of fledgling which limits some thing you can do and is no where long enough to gain any kind of strength to save yourself from others who like to kill weak players. There is 0 defense against being forced into a PVP where you will drop all items you had and most likely they will be stolen also after you're dead. If you're a new player you might as well not even try to defend yourself because you will be 1 shot killed maybe 2 but unlikely you'll live that long. Even in the tutorial "Safe" town you will still get screwed over. Also, pickpocketing? Really? If you're new well too bad people will pick pocket you and take your garbage items just so you can't build yourself up out of being a noob. So, overall if you are thinking about playing this game, don't. Unless spending the next 2 or 3 months being killed and stolen from repeatedly sounds like fun to you and you are defenseless against it. Honestly now that I think about it I'd give this game like a 5/10 not even a 6.5 really. So, what these people who made this game need to do is go back an fix a lot of this trash. If nothing it give new players like a week of not being able to be killed by Red Players or stolen from by pick pockets. I mean come on, give people at least a small chance. 2 hours is no where near enough time at all. Like, it's a fucking joke honestly lol. It takes 2 hours for a new player to even figure out wtf is going on lol. Like just... no it's just stupid and it's garbage lol. Pull your heads out of your collective asses and fix your broke ass game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068193279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1494406367}
review:
Почти 7 лет назад, молодые и амбициозные ребята представили геймерам проект, который до боли напоминал Морроувинд или даже, не побоюсь этого слова - Обливион! К сожалению, на тот момент, требования к железу были очень высоки, а мой песональный проигрыватель пиратских дисков с играми - на старом АМД процессоре обещал взорваться после первой же секнунды запуска Мортал онлайн. В итоге: я со слезами на глазах, распечатал себе плакат Мортала, дописал на нем фломастером - "Я нищеброд", и стал судорожно копить и собирать деньги на новую машинку. Итак 4 года назад на 2х ядерном АМД (черт бы побрал этот теплоагрегат) я попробовал запустить игру - ЕСТЬ! но ФПС до 10, лаги и фризы...в общем пришлось удалить после 3х часов игры - ибо так играть было невозможно от фразы - "да пиZдеC, что за ...!?!?"
И вот я с ноутбуком I7 8gb оперативки, 4 видео  - запускаю снова и ....13 фпс, лаги и фризы....
7 греbbаных лет и ZHOпошная оптимизация!!!!  Да как так то!??! 

А вот так: разработчики сами увлеклись проектом настолько, что Мортал начал развиваться не "вширь" - исправление багов,  повышение оптимизации,  поддержка пользователей на уровне технических вопросов, а  в "ДАЛЬ" - Мортал оброс новыми фишками, крафтингом, скиллами, плюшками, плащиками за донаторство и пр.

У молодой команды нет времени и средств на то, чтобы разобраться с техническими проблемами игроков, поэтому они сосредоточились на тех, кто Может играть без проблем с железом.

Если пройтись по Геймплею (не смотрите на то, что в стиме у меня 8 часов наиграно, на старом аккаунте я смог высидеть 40 часов)., то есть мног плюсов:

* Нет системы уровней - качается то, чем вы сейчас занимаетесь.
Если ты разделываешь кожу - твой навык качается по мере разделки туш)
* Возможность играть бесплатно с ограничением в 60 уровень ваших скиллов (т.е. если хочешь докачать навык или скилл до 100 - плати абонентскую плату)
* Довольно таки простая возможность заработка - прокачай  любой навык  и бегай к торговцу, торгуй!
* Реализм - решил сбегать "пописать за таверну" в темный уголок - наткнулся на воров.
* Крафтинг - твори, создавай, собирай и вари, строй и украшай!
* вючные животные - купи осла, навесь сумки и иди собирать лут - мобильный завод на копытах!!!
* интересная система боя -  слишком близко ударил противника - это удар рукоятью, а не саблей - поэтому незаслуженно ударенная  кулаком в харю туша - может дать достойную обратку Вам))
* Захват замков (в том числе НПС шных городов)
* детальная обнаженка (это просто мечта юного дро44ера!!!) - но, что приятно,ее можно отключить в меню настроеек.
Получив скалкой в жбан от жены - я быстро разобрался где и как отключить эту опцию.

недостатки:

*школота (ворье и просто мракобесы с нездоровым чувством юмора и прокаченным файтингом кулачного боя)
Хочешь долго и интересно играть - вступи в гильдию! Игра явно не для Сингла.
*оптимизация  -см. выше.

Итог:  Отличная задумка, но такое ощущение, что игра делается только из-за интереса самих разработчиков, которые счастливо творят себе свой собственный фэнтезийный мир, пилят бабло на идее и не оглядываются на проблемы. Еще раз повторю - 7 лет и нерешенные вопросы с оптимизацией!!! именно поэтому ставлю 1 голую бабу из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198010741243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1494345809}
review: Начинал играть в мортал онлайн еще в 2010 году, тогда игра была платной, покупал два аакаунта, игра была сырой, постоянно крашилась, местами были легкие тормоза, но игра была интересной, хардовой, стоило ждать когда ее отладят, но чуда не случилось за первый год, тогда решил сделать перерыв и подождать когда игру доведут до ума. Прошло 2 года,  снова загрузил мортал - стало только хуже, тормоза усилились, крашится стало чаще, подождал 2016, компьютер стал намного мощнее, игра также тормозит и крашится, на дворе 2017 год, у меня на столе стоит ноут msi за хренову кучу лаве, который тянет все новые игры на максимальных настройках, но мортал по прежнему тормозит 15 фпс на низких настройках. Самый амбициозный проект оказался не по зубам ребятам из Star Vault,  с теми обещаниями что они давали и с тем, что мы имеем по факту за 7 лет игры.... Даже наши политики, на фоне Star Vault кажутся не такими бессовестными жуликами!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013171468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 180302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58002, 'last_played': 1579162321}
review:
Ill start off by noting the mixed reviews revolving this game. Many of the negative review is about getting killed or griefed within hours of starting the game. You get a 2 hour grace period of invulnerablity from players to complete the tutorial. After that, you're on your own. This is a HARDCORE mmorpg, expect to die often, lose alot and even rage at times. EVE online players will be familiar with this type of game. 

PROS:
-Very indepth crafting system, be it cooking, alchemy, weapon/armor crafting, materials are obscure and nothing is laid infront of you. Experiement and find the best combination to suit your needs.
-Lots of PVE content. Dungeons and caves scattered throughout the world, Large diversity of mobs to kill, butcher, and farm.
-Exploration, Almost none of the content is explained by the devs. you have to go out there and discover it yourself. Like finding a mysterious key on a body, or finding a hidden cave, or a locked door in a dungeon. Figure it out
-PVP, Open world pvp, need I say more? Somebody disrespected you, or has something shiny? Go kill them. There is a criminal system where you get flagged for criminal actions and city guards will attack you, but hey, if they can't see you...
-Territory control, Also part of the PVP system, guilds can build structures and control towns, other guilds can wardec.
-Combat System, 3 general styles of combat, Melee, Archery and Magic. With a mounted style for each. And with melee combat you have Direction blocking/Parrying, Directional attacks. 

CONS:
-Dated graphics if that matters to anyone. Looks a little old, but not bad.
-Griefers. Yup. There are people that will murder others just for fun. 
-High risk, everything is loss on death. Can be frustrating at times, but very profitable at others.
-Pretty complicated, not your average game sense HARDCORE. Youll need to dedicate a bit of time to look into things if you wanna avoid many problems down the road.
-Trolls. They are everywhere. Don't onesidedly listen to all the help you get. 
-The community can be toxic at times, or very nice. just gotta find the right people.

CONCLUSION:
Do you: Like EVE Online, Enjoy complicated and in depth crafting systems, Exploration, PVP with high risk high rewards,
Do not mind dying often, Enjoy a true hardcore game,  Love wars? If you said yes to any of these, well go ahead and try it. Steele yourselves because death comes to all, no matter how good you are.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113051667', 'num_games_owned': 18, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1932, 'last_played': 1494402269}

Тело распотрошил и получил кожу своей расы (14шт) и кучу костей (мяса не было, походу дрыщ) Короче игра крутая))) Описаные события заняли 10 минут времени.

10 съеденых голов из 10)

author: {'steamid': '76561198058422081', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4829, 'last_played': 1520071350}
review: Nagyon jo jatek végre egy olyan MMO ahol nyitott pvp zona van, a felszerelesednek van értéke mert, ha meghalsz akkor elveszik (el lopják) végre nincsenek questek amiket vegig kell szenvedni elobb, hogy elkezdhess jatszani a jatekkal (csak a tutorialban van 1-2 quest)Szinte egy kesz tulelos jatek nagyon bejon emellett vannak klánok az emberek a szabadban maguknak gyujtogetnek tudnak epitkezni is a szabadba a klanok varosokat epitenek.Jo kozepkori hangulata van ott vannak benne a jo stylusu fantasy elolenyek emellett megvan a jatekban a kereskedelem is csinalva, magadnak keresed ki hogy mit hova szalitsal mi hol eri meg jobban.En azt mondanam egy Reign of Kings meg egy Albion Online keverék csak ingyen.Eggyetlen hatulutoje van a jateknak az az hogy nem a legjobban van optimalizalva meg itt ottt bugos.Ja es meg egy erdekesseg a jatekban az az hogy nincs terkep vagyis neked kell megjegyezned az utakat bar az interneten van egy terkep ami kijelol mindenfele klanvarosokat nyersanyag, mob lelohelyeket.Ha valakinek meghoztam a kedvet a jatekhoz az vegyen fel steamen segitek neki a jatekban.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052454481', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 203275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95416, 'last_played': 1705816339}
review:
Mortal online is a special game, not everyone will like it, but if you look at the people who stopped playing they mostly have less than half an hour in game... thats not even enough to be out of the tutorial. You need to be able to deal with death, this game is not for the weak. Towns are "safe" but that doesnt mean you cannot be murdered in town, it means you have access to the help of guards if you are attacked, just like in real life if you are too far away from a cop and someone wants to kill you they will. If you wish to give this game a trial I personally recomend you consider weather you are able to handle death even as a new player. Changes to the game come and go but one thing that remains is player interaction, this is the best part of the game even if you are just traveling the rush of passing someone you can feel the tension between eachother, out in the wilderness of nave it is a constant standoff. This game is one of my all time favorite, its not the best designed hell its not even the best looking, but if you give up on the game before you can see its full potential and give it a real try you are missing out on a world of adventure and excitement every turn you make is a rush every decision must be carefully made. Good luck in the World of Nave.

TLDR: The game is not for everyone, give it a try longer than an hour and talk to people to understand how the game works before you give up. 

- Sincerely,
Spellsong

author: {'steamid': '76561197969387232', 'num_games_owned': 920, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1493657440}
review:
Hoped it'd be better than when I played it before (not on Steam). My re-entry was less-than-stellar.

> Log in
> Check paperdoll and inventory at the bank
> Get killed
> Log out

I now remember why I stopped playing. I remember being killed while still doing the tutorial. And getting killed in several places in town when I was still figuring out the game. Never really got much farther than that.

The community is also really awful and rather toxic. For all the "find people to work with" comment I have seen and gotten, I never met anybody who was actually inclined to help.

And getting stuck in walls. That was dumb.

Objects sometimes seem to be floating on nothing (including flora).

This game has things in it that I really, really enjoy. The crafting seems super awesome, but is completely overshadowed by the fact that you just get killed and looted so often. Yeah, not gonna invest time into a crafting system if I'm gonna just get ruined over and over. If I wanted that, I'd still play EVE Online.

The AI feels wonky too, but I'm not sure I have enough experience to say much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249838482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 13093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12770, 'last_played': 1529631477}
review:
I loved this game, I had just started learning end game stuff and being a part of the guild battles when one day the game started stuttering uncontrollably. I couldnt fix it and after a few days I gave up. Im sure Id have played 100s of more hours if this game was optimised better. Very sad that I had to leave my guild and give up my progress because of something so small.

(TL:DR) If you dont want your heart broken dont play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052365293', 'num_games_owned': 907, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1359, 'last_played': 1576114171}
review:
Put simply, it's a fun game, but it's not for everyone. You  have to go in with the mindset that almost everyone is out to kill you and take your stuff. It's survival of the fittest, and you'll do okay once you max your skills to 60. But if you want to do anything besides kill noobs or farm in the cementery for your first 20+ hours. Your going to need a subscription. This game is fun, but be prepared to lose your stuff.

If you need any help as a newb, send me a message and I will help you.
Good luck, and don't leave the starting city till you know what your doing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083255154', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 188168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58364, 'last_played': 1657526340}
review:
Yaklaşık 2000 saatlik tecrübeme göre konuşarak şunları söylüyorum:
Oyunun potansiyeli müthiş yüksek.
Oyun p2w değil, oyun tamamen tecrübe üzerine. Neden bunu diyorum çünkü: Ben mesela bu kadar zaman oynamama rağmen f2p adamlara duellolar da ölebiliyorum. Refleksleri (internet/ping e bağlı) inanılmaz kuvvetli adamlar çok başarılı oluyor. Bu dediklerim yakın dövüş/mage için geçerli. Okçulukda isabetlilik üzerine ve refleksler üzerine müthiş tecrübe gerekiyor çünkü öyle ortada cross var atıyon tam isabet vuruyor değil. Bildiğin gerçekte oku nasıl atıyorsan öyle hatta görüş açısı bilene öyle.
Craft bölümü komplike, detaylı ve gerçekçi. Oyunda pvp yapmak istemezseniz pve ve craft sistemiyle bilene oyundan çok zevk alabilirsiniz.
Ev kurma olayları kolay değil ama şuan bunun üzerine baya geliştiriyorlar.
Aslında anlatmam gereken daha çok şey var ama kısacası POTANSİYELİ ÇOK YÜKSEK, OYUNUN DEVOLOPERLARI ZANNEDİYORUMKİ ÇOK UĞRAŞMIYORLAR ÇÜNKÜ OYUNDA SÜREKLİ BUG İLE KARŞILAŞIYORSUN(tabi düzeltiyorlar ama düzeltim derken başka bug ortaya çıkarıyorlar) BUDA OYUNDA KALP KRİZİ GEÇİRMENE SEBEP VERİYOR.
AYRIMCILIK VAR OYUNDA.  (BİLDİĞİN DREDLORDS GUİLD'INA ADAMLAR TORPİL YAPIYORLAR HARBİ HARBİ)

OYUN ÇOK AMA ÇOK ZOR BU YÜZDEN TÜRKLER PEK BECEREMİYOR. İNGİLİZCEN YOKSA ÇOK BÜYÜK BİR SORUN.

YİNE SÖYLÜYORUM  OYUN ÇOK ZOR, ARKADAŞIN YOKSA BİR BOK DEĞİLSİN (arkadaş demek can demektir), P2P OLMAK ZORUNDA DEĞİLSİN, (eğer f2p olucaksan oyun içerisinde ''veteran'' oyunculardan yardım istemek zorundasın her konuda.)
RPG YE AÇIK BİR OYUN. Oyun çok kaliteli bir devoloper a satılırsa bu oyun dünyada en çok oynanan oyun olur bu kadar kesin konuşuyorum. ( bu arada yorumcu adam değilimdir ilk defa bir oyun hakkında yorum yazdım. elimden geldiğince yardımcı olmaya çalıştım.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198053222703', 'num_games_owned': 935, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4068, 'last_played': 1492898043}
review:
Hey there!

Quick disclaimer; This'll be quite the review! Head on down to the "Bottom Line" if you've not got the patience or time to read through this wall of text!

As a newbie with a little over 60 hours in the game, this'll cover my first impressions along with what I think the game does wonderfully, and what could be improved.

I highly reccomend giving this game a try for yourself if you can muster the courage to work things out on your own, or have enough of a thick skin to interact with the community and it's wonderful and not-so-wonderful members to ask for help when needed!



[h1]-- First Steps --[/h1]

As a newbie, you're dropped into Mortal Online and greeted by a familiar quest arrow pointing you to the nearest NPC, who will teach you the ropes and get you up to speed. 

However, don't think that 'up to speed' means sprinting the 100m like Usain Bolt! 'Up to speed' in this case means gently strolling accross town with a basic understanding of a part of the game's mechanics. :)

Basic swordfighting, interacting with NPCs, crafting armor and taming wild beasts -- bunnies in this case :) -- are on the menu during Mortal Online (MO)'s first few minutes. Once you have ran a few errands for NPCs to get to grips with the game, you meet the captain of the guard who opens the world of MO up to you, and you are free to go!

By free to go, I mean litterally free to go. Once the first few steps in the game are taken, you are left to your devices with a handful of good information -- accessed through the (H)elpful Information menu -- and basic gear -- rags for armor and a good ole' basic sword!

The rest is up for you to decide! Want to make the best armor possible? Want to become a renowned mage, feared by many? Want to run around naked and sing songs to the people of the land on top of your lungs? It's all possible! 

Yes. I've seen a naked dude run around singing songs -- well, it was more like screaming... Don't ask.

As a side note worth mentioning, this game does include nudity in the form of a tick box in your options, so that when someone unequips all armor, they are genuinely naked, as opposed to the usual MMORPG 'I've got no armor or anything else equipped but I still have clothes'.

I found this nudity somewhat age-gates the community to a certain level of maturity, or atleast mostly. So I'm not against it whatsoever! Plus, to some of us -- me included -- this just means a more immersive experience! :)


[h1]-- First Impression --[/h1]

Visually, the game shows it's age. From what the community has told me, it is over 10 years old, released in 2005-2006, and that is appearant in the graphics. Very reminiscent of Oblivion without the soft blur and fantasy elements to it. Very gritty, the game's color palette is quite down-to-earth -- litterally, most things are earth-colored. I quite like it, as it makes me realise that I'm not in an overly fantastic setting!

Gameplay-wise, it is very hardcore and deep. Everything you can think of besides your granny has a 'skill' related to it, which gains experience the more it is used, making your character a neverending growing and changing work of art. 

The game is also what is reffered to as a "full loot" game. Meaning that if you are slain, you drop your entire inventory; hotbars, equipped items and all. This makes the risk factor of the game skyrocket when you learn that PvP is non-restricted, making nearly the entirety of the gameworld undoubtedly dangerous, adding a kick of suspense to your expeditions and general going about your business in the Nave -- the name of the gameworld/realm you are thrust in.



[h1]-- First Issues --[/h1]

As a newbie in MO, I learned as much as possible from the tutorial, and read nearly every single article within the (H)elpful Information window and skimmed the ones that were obvious.

However, after a solid 45 minutes of doing the turotial, getting to grips with the controls and UI and reading the aptly named helpful information, I was left with one question:

"What now?"

The game does a decent job at introducing it's basic mechanics, but not it's core concepts. I was warned quite thoroughly that "it's dangerous out there, store your stuff in banks or you run the chance of losing it all", but I wasn't told much else after the tutorial, which felt quite.. unsubstantial? 

A good tutorial makes sure that whomever comes into your game gets hooked. It facilitates player retention and makes it so that newbie players are all at a certain level, it evens out the playing field by having everyone know the same basics.

However, MO's tutorial puts every newcomer at the mercy of what the community will tell them, as most of the information is found either on the official MO Forums, or shared through the in-game "/help" chat.



[h1]-- Bottom Line --[/h1]

As far as I'm concerned, the game has very very deep skill and crafting systems which I have, do and will enjoy for the forseeable future. It's neck-deep implementation of PvP mechanics along with satisfying character growth and promising player interactions make it very unique! 

However, it does still require additional polishing for it to become a *fantastic* game!

Here's a quick TL;DR of the two small additions I'd put in the game to make it into a must-play!

[list]
[*] A fuller, more explicative introduction to the game, covering a tad more bases than it currently does.
[*] Bugfixes and more polishing of the already present content (books, drawing paper and taming/pets come to mind).
[/list]

At the moment, I'd definitely consider MO to be a must-try-for-a-decent-amount-of-time, as it needs a bit to 'grow on you', but rewards you with a very satisfying experience overall, and the potential for meeting great people to form bonds with!



[h1]-- Conclusion --[/h1]

There you go! Those are the thoughts of a newbie that thoroughly enjoys the game, and wishes nothing but the best for it's future!

Feel free to discuss further in the comments of this review, I'd love to hear the opinion of other newbies and vets alike! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197982903073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 19057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8532, 'last_played': 1586982268}
review:
It's not perfect, but it never claims to be. If you're expecting a triple A MMORPG you will be dissapointed. It's gritty, it's hardcore, it has it's bugs. 76 hours in and i'm just now grasping a better understanding of the game. But i have to say, this is the best game of it's kind. No other MMORPG of this current time offers the experience Mortal Online does.

 I think some of the negative reviews are exaggerating the extent of the griefing, don't get me wrong it DOES happen but if you have common sense you can avoid most of it. As for the toxic community, yes it can get bad but for the most part they are helpful. The /help channel is very active and most people will try to assist and answer your questions but expect to learn most of the stuff out on your own through trial and error which is part of the fun and experience.

 Give the game a shot and form your own opinion of it, i'm glad i did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078055156', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 45977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41665, 'last_played': 1571384121}
review:
Mortal Online, my most played game on Steam and probably the game I have the most mixed feelings for, is a true MMORPG where, unlike almost every other proclaimed MMORPG, actually delivers in making you feel like you're guiding a believable character in a different world.  I can talk about Mortal for days on end, but for the sake of this review, I should point out some major pros and cons, as well as mention some important things you should know.

Pros:
Actually pulls off the "RPG" part of "MMORPG."
Huge map.
Massive variety in different locations and their styling.
Knowledge actually is power, there are many things you can discover and use to your advantage.
Pretty good non-hotbar oriented combat, with diverse playstyles for different character archetypes.
Your character isn't confined to classes, they are able to have freedom in allocating skills as they please.
Diverse playerbase.
Interesting territory control system allows for guild politics and conflicts to be believable and intriguing.

Cons:
Bugs.  A lot of annoying bugs.
Lag, the servers are located in the UK, if you aren't in Europe expect at least 100ms ping.
Nodelines, possibly the least intuitive loading mechanic in the history of games, not only is laggy and disconnecting from the experience, but also is the source of many annoying bugs and weird occurences.
The optimization is pretty abysmal considering how old the game is.
Graphics are, according to most, rather ugly, although I don't think they're particularly horrible.
Hard to get into for most, as the new player experience is currently very poor, although this is subject to change soon.

Conclusion:
I cannot, nor would I want to, cover all this game has to offer in a Steam review, but all I can say is this: if you have spare time, and a willingness to pick up the game and deal with bugs and other issues, this game is the very definition of a diamond in the rough.
Also, if you're new and want some guidance, feel free to contact me in game, on my main character "Horkulf."

author: {'steamid': '76561198143801334', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 34065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29601, 'last_played': 1496631247}
review:
Não leve em consideração nenhuma outra análise, entre e veja por SI MESMO!
- Ninguém tem o mesmo gosto
- Muitos entram e nem sabem oque estão fazendo
- Ou entram e morrem pra pessoas, dai param de jogar e fazem uma crítica ruim
- o Gráfico não é dos melhores, mas o tamanho do mundo e a jogabilidade compensam
- Parecido com o Ultima Online, mas muitos aspectos que fazem ser MUITO melhor além de ser 3D
- Infelizmente você precisa DOMINAR a língua inglesa para jogar

*Recomendo a análise do BLANK*

É um jogo PAGO e é NECESSÁRIO pagar a assinatura todo mês, não adianta jogar F2P, F2P é SOMENTE um "TESTE"!
 *Tem pessoas que jogam F2P e jogam bem, porém é necessário DOMINAR o jogo.*
Primeiro MAXIMIZE seu char e depois PAGUE!

Vocês não sabem oque estão perdendo Mortal é um jogo ÚNICO, e experiências que vocês NUNCA vão ter com outro jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122578954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 148669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119593, 'last_played': 1495565691}
review:
Saludos a todos!
Creo más de 2.000h de juego son suficientes recomendaros al 200% este juegazoo.

Requisitos del jugador de Mortal Online:

-PACIENCIA (los inicios son muy duros).
-RELACIONATE con los demas jugadores, buscate una Guild de tu idioma o pais y veras lo que es jugar al MO (este juego esta pensado para la interacción entre jugadores, tu solo no puedes ser todos los roles).
-NO PREJUICIOS: No judgar un libro por su portada, me muero de risa cuando leeo analisis de este juego, de jugadores con 20h o 5h de juego. En ese tiempo en Mortal Online, no has salido ni de la cuidad inicial (Tindrem), la cual es lo más Toxico que tiene este juego, ya que es donde nacen los pjs y donde más trolls hay!
-LO BUENO VALE DINERO: Querer pagar por el trabajo de otros, un juego de 7 años actualizado cada 15 dias, hay que pagar por eso! Este juego NO es free. El sistema de Free to play, es una demo que te muestra la cascarilla del iceber, un % del juego para saber si te puede o no gustar este juego. Encuentra a jugadores de tu pais y paga un mes (12€) y luego si no estas enganchado hasta las trancas, vete a jugar a otro juego (Es preferible a mi entender que pagar por un juego de 19,99€ y luego hecharle 30h de juego y no volver a jugar a él jamas).
-PVPero, no te tiene que encantar el PvP, pero si almenos toleralo, ya que la base de este juego o de un FullLoot (pierdes todo lo que llevas encima al morir) és el PvP. Si te gusta darte de ostias con los otros jugadores este juego te ofrece una infinita variedad de maneras de hacerlo.
-FARMERO, todo cuesta oro. Vas a tener que hechar bastantes horas, solo o con los colegas que hagas en el MO, matando npcs para conseguir ese oro y poderte comprar buenas armas/armaduras ( las del cementerio no sirven ni para esconderlas).

Si te has leido este toston, te lo agradezco mucho y seguramente te picara la curiosidad de probar este magnifico juego! Yo te ofrezco mi ayuda en tu inicios, pregunta en el chat de help, por Mouzor o por la Guild WEED, la unica activa de habla hispana! No te arrepentiras ;)

10/10 por Mortal Online

author: {'steamid': '76561198007098908', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 21645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18453, 'last_played': 1667514339}
review:
The negative reviews are for those who aren't used to this type of game and cannot adapt, I'll say that first.

I played the game for a long time. I honestly love the game, but it's not for everyone. It's the kind of game where you're litterally not safe anywhere. It's hardcore, and if you die you lose everything, you fall in the water you drown if you're too heavy, you eat the wrong plant, you get sick. Tons of secrets and a fanbase that does not cater to those who are looking for an easy time. If you're persistent and find unique ways to solve your problems, such as, I make a lot of friends who help me to stay alive, you'll succeded. So, to the positives of the game.

You get one character, your reputation really matters, people remember your name and your face. There's no map, you have to learn the areas by exploration or through paying others for a tour. (and it's a huge world.) There's no quests really through npcs, players make the quests and shape the world. No where is safe, take oppertunities to either become a public paragon and benevolent person who saves others, or use those same issues to your advantage for your own gain, reputation is everything. 

This game is as close as you're going to get to real life in a video game in a lot of ways.

THIS GAME WILL MAKE YOU RAGE, everything counts, everything is important, including learning when to be safe and when to take risks. Treat your life in game like real life. 

THIS GAME IS HARD, VERY HARD, you will lose and win, but expect both. Excell in the areas you're gifted in to succeed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124275076', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 6165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4042, 'last_played': 1493474742}
review:
A la vista de los analisis escritos sobre este juego, me he decidido a escribir yo uno, pues pienso que mucho de lo escrito sobre el es injusto. Normalmente los analisis negativos son de usuarios con pocas horas de juego, yo llevo alguna más de las reflejadas ya que no empleo el lanzador de Steam, cuestion de prestaciones ...Vayamos por partes....

ES cierto que el juego esta mal optimizado, tiene algun bug y que graficamente es mejorable, tambien es cierto que si no tienes una cuenta de pago las posibilidades de tus personajes estan "capadas".  Lo que algunos no se paran a pensar es que si un juego lleva funcionando tantos años por algo será.... Por otra parte tengamos en cuenta que quienes programan juegos quieren viivir de ello, en mi opinión la profundidad del juego bien mercece la cuota que pide. Pero claro queremos un juego bonito, barato, actualizado constantemente, en el que podamos ganar con facilidad y sin pagar ni un duro. Pues nada chaval, luego en tu trabajo  ves a currar 24/7 y sin cobrar, que es lo que estas pidiendole tu a los programadores, o te compras un juego de esos de 60 euros, te lo pasas en 40 horas y a criar polvo en la biblioteca, en fin...

El juego no es duro, es "muy duro", esto no es un WOW, nada de niveles, nada de "target" sobre el enemigo, y ya puedes bailar alrededor haciendo combos estupidos e irreales con un arma del tamaño de tu caballo, nada de mapa ni de flechas luminosas de neon indicandote el camino. El juego cuenta con full PVP en cualquier parte, no hay  " zonas de confort", algunos dicen que la comunidad es bastante toxica, no es cierto... La comunidad es una coleccion de bastardos malnacidos que te sacaran los ojos a la primera ocasión, vamos como en el mundo real. Encontraras gente que te robará, te explotará, te engañara, te matara, y todo ello a veces sin obtener ningun beneficio, solo por placer, solo por que "puede hacerlo"

Lo unico que no haran en sodomizarte, y creo que es solo por que el juego no esta preparado para ello, ( de momento), pero tambien encontraras gente que te ayudará, te orientará, e incluso te regalara equipo y armas, aunque solo te duren cinco minutos antes de perderlo todo... EL sistema de crafteo es profundo y complejo, mostrando un amplio abanico de posibilidades que incluyen, entre otras muchas, cocina, construcción,  doma, domesticación, alquimia, pesca y asi "ad infinitum". 

Muchas de estas habilidades son profundas y complejas, lo cual requiere un personaje dedicado en exclusiva a ellas, olvidate de tener un personaje polivalente, aqui la gente si quiere hacer algo bien se especializa, lo normal es que los personajes conozcan en profundidad un par de oficios.

Esto, unido al extendidisismo PVP del juego, ocasiona algo que le quita algo de color al juego, y es la cuestion de las razas. Hay muchas y puedes mezclarlas, ya que a la hora de generar el PJ podemos decidir sus lineas de sangre y antepasados. 

Naturalmente la gente tiene ya optimizadas las "builds a la hora de hacerse los personajes. 
¿ quieres un arquero  montado" pues para que  este totalmente optimizado tiene que ser de una raza determinada y unas habilidades concretas.

 ¿ pero bueno, es que entonces no existen arqueros humanos en este mundo por ejemplo ?, pues no... nadie los llleva simplemente porque hay razas mejores para ello. Eso a mi modo de ver le quita color al juego en su vertiente de Rol, pero todos sabemos que a la gente le gusta el Rol hasta que llega otro y le parte la cara a su personaje, entonces se olvida del Rol y saca otro clon de  " el arquero de la raza tal, totalmente optimizado y bla,bla, bla ").

Que le vamos a hacer, cosas del PVP, no obstante algunos insistimos en nuestra estupidez y contamos con personajes inutiles que lo pasan mal a la hora de sobrevivir en el juego, mi cocinero por ejemplo, matame, que solo podras robarme un taparrabos y cacharros de cocina, aun asi te matan no creais, supongo les divierte " matemos al abuelo ese que esta pescando en el puerto. "

En fin, Mortalonline o lo amas o lo odias, pero aqui sigue y todos los dias entran jugadores nuevos, nueve de cada diez se van llorando a casa a jugar a MMPORG blandos,  uno de cada diez se queda....

En el juego la mayor parte de la economia y muchos  de los recursos de crafteo, estan en manos de los jugadores, los clanes (guilds en el juego ), pueden construir casas, villas, e incluso fortalezas y ciudades en el mapa. De este modo puedes pasar por un sitio por segunda vez y encontrarte con que el paisaje a cambiado. Por cierto, aqui preparar un asedio, maquinas incluidas, es toda una odisea.

Muchas cosas en el juego son "top secret", como las recetas de alquimia. Podras encontrar Guias y ejemplos de crafteo  y recetas en ellas, estas adquieren el formato de libros escritos por jugadores que puedes comprar en el juego. Alli encontraras la manera de comenzar a caminar, pero el resto del camino lo tendras que hacer solo, la información es poder...

Concluyendo:

Este "analisis", que más bien es un apresurado resumen de mis primeras impresiones, abarca una insignificante parte de lo que supone Mortalonline, con lo cual cierro esto recordandoos que :

-El juego, y la mayor parte de los jugadores, emplean la lengua de la perfida Albion, foro del juego inlcuido.
- StarVault es una compañia pequeña, aun así el juego esta constantemente actualizado y en constante mejora.
- El Alma de este juego esta en su profundidad y en como encajes a tu PJ en esta aberrante y cruel sociedad medieval, no                 es su apartado visual, recuerda; la parte visual es susceptible de mejorarse en muchos juegos, su naturaleza, concepto y construcción ya no tanto.
- Emplea una cuenta de prueba antes de decidir si lo compras.
- Dale un vistazo a Guias, analisis y tutoriales, en video y archivos de lectura,  antes de intentar jugar.
- Dentro del juego la union hace la fuerza, busca gente con la que hacer cosas juntos.
- No hay mapa del juego, busca mapas en la red y emplea la brújula y tu orientación, cuidado a la hora de hacer turismo, aun así, te recomiendo que no dejes de intentar viajar y ver mundo.
- El juego requiere una suscripción mensual, puedes comprar "slots" para nuevos personajes, la gran mayoria de loa jugadores habituales tienen más de un pj, esto es necesario, o util por cuestiones de tiempo, debido a la naturaleza de algunos oficios, magos por ejemplo.
- Las macros son muy utiles en este juego.

Me dejo en el tintero, por olvido y desconocimiento, muchas más cosas, descubrelas tu mismo, el diablo de este juego, también vive en los detalles.

Mi analisis es positivo, ya que este juego a mi naturaleza como jugador le resulta atracivo, en ti puede ser diferente, el objetivo del analisis es invitarte a juzgar el juego por ti mismo, no pretende decirte que sea bueno a malo para ti, pues no te conozco lector.

PD: Si entras al juego pregunta en el canal de Help ( ayuda dentro del juego) por Yoruba, pulgosus o la Guild "WEED", te ayudaremos en todo lo posible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977365225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 8147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8147, 'last_played': 1491762374}
review:
Let's first ignore the toxic community.  In the help channel you're just as likely to get a smart ass answer as you are a correct one.   Next, let's ignore the fact that even in the tutorial zone, you'll get killed and/or your pets will get killed.  Then let's ignore the fact that the very first place where noobs are sent to train and level is a cess pool of random ganking by high level characters and neither the players nor the devs seem to give a shit that it only serves to chase potential players away.  The game promotes high level characters running around naked with nothing but a weapon, smashing random noobs or their pets and suffering only the loss of a cheap weapon.  If they do kill you and manage to get away from the guards, in TWO MINUTES their flag goes away and they can walk past the guards like nothing happened, with all your gear in their pocket.  Thieves are broken to the point it encourages them to run around totally naked.  You can become a criminal and be killed just for looking at another player's inventory. Mages cost an absolute fortune to get started and to be any good, you need to spend hours using autohotkey to spam damage spells on yourself in order to skill up.

But ignore all of that.

Here's the real fun.  If you own an AMD processor, you're screwed.  You'll have to reduce your audio settings to CD quality or you'll lag out immensely when you die.  Next, you'll have to turn the game's graphics down to the absolutely lowest settings, otherwise the memory leaks after an hour become so intense that you're running at 5 fps.  And then there's the random crashes with render errors.  They always take place at the most opportune moments, like when you're in a pvp fight, or you're running from something trying to eat you.  The help channel will tell you precisely why these crashes happen.  The game has not been optimized.  I think it's been out for what, 7, maybe 8 years and they still haven't optimized the graphics code?  Compared to fps games like Rust, the graphics look ancient. And when you turn the settings down in order to keep from lagging out, they look even more horrid.  Bugs abound.  Creatures falling out of the sky, rising up through the ground.  Crossing the bridge to the 'new' continent with pets and you most likely won't have any pet afterward or you'll find yourself hundreds of feet above the ground.  And that new continent came out in an expansion 2 years ago and they still haven't fixed half it's bugs.

The game really had potential once upon a time.  I really wish I COULD like this game.  But the fact that noobs are given ZERO opportunity to learn the game (there isn't even a wiki to document things) before they get swords shoved up their asses by griefers who've played for years makes this game a closed loop.  Only those who have been there will stay there.

*** Response to comments ***

I understand Mortal perfectly, and I understand it's market. It's for seal clubbers. It's for puppy kickers.  It's for people who feel better when someone else feels worse than they do.  Randomly killing player mounts in town is not PVP.  It's griefing.  Camping the area where noobs are sent to make coin with high level toons isn't PVP. It's griefing. Killing minutes old players in the tutorial area is not PVP. It's griefing. All of this is promoted because the consequences for griefing are a minor nuisance at most. If you're the type person who'd enjoy setting ants on fire with a magnifying glass, you'd love Mortal. That's the niche it fills. 

I played EVE Online. For YEARS as a matter of fact.  Yes, there is griefing in that game.  However, you're not going to grief in EVE without consequences.  You grief often enough those consequences force you into low sec or 0.0 where you have to WORK to restore your status.  In this game, just wait a few minutes and you can go griefing again.

TLDR: This game promotes and makes money off the disinhibition effect. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Online_disinhibition_effect.  

So, whether you enjoy trolling, griefing or just standing in the middle of a populated area spewing obscenities or racial slurs over voip without repurcussions, whether you're a narcissists, psychopath, or even a sadists, you'll love the fact that you can PAY a gaming company to ignore and even cater to your psychosis and the game breaking bugs will seem irrelevant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063403766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 14368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14139, 'last_played': 1507723129}
review:
This game has the most in depth and interesting crafting system I have ever experienced. The skill system is genius, you can litterally play however you imagine! 

Taming/Dominating is probably my favorite part though, I love to be exploring the world and see a crazy cool creature and be able to make almost all of them into my companion after a little work learning about it.

So much potential, lots of old players who are willing to help out. Most of the people you run into will do whatever they can to help you out in your journey, but there are some people that want to see the world burn.

Making friends is the most important part of this game. Just like in real life, you will NOT be able to do everything you want to do alone. Make friends. Work Together. Succeed Together.
