author: {'steamid': '76561198029165063', 'num_games_owned': 1516, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1567261101}
review:
Let's go over this again shall we. Mortal Online is a hardcore MMORPG which sports a diverse amount of skills, with skill based progression, full loot PvP, an interesting crafting system, housing and many other things that should in theory make it a worthwhile game. But it is not. For a game released in 2010, it is exceptionally ugly, uninspiried, poorly designed, huge and empty. 

I tried numerous times, redownloading the game, getting back onto the server, playing for a bit, and then putting it back down as it is simply an unbearable experience. The world is huge, and empty. The first city you start in is filled with empty space, poorly put together buildings, horrible render distance, outright fucked textures and clear misunderstanding of scale. Instead of making impressive, small but impactful areas, it instead goes out of it's way to make getting from place to place as tedious as humanly possible, starting you off with a snail pace to traverse the flat and empty environment. 

Now, that would be passable, if not for the constant crashing, bugs, lag spikes, and a complete lack of immersion or wonder due to poor art, lazy environments and an utter lack of a hook to ger you interested in the world. Do I want to get past the initial grind and have fun in the late game? No, not really, the game gives me no reason to want to play it. 

And it is a shame, really. It's a game for a very specific niche, if you do not mind incredibly slow and clunky early games, with some cool stuff you could do later, if you can get past the movement speed and the bland world. If the shitty artstyle and utter lazines shown by the fucked up materials present throughout the starting area alone do not sound like a huge turn off, give it a go. Maybe you'll manage to get to the actual fun portion of the game. I'd rather play something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075003089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 62490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59971, 'last_played': 1520035931}
review:
Mortal Online (MO) Is a great game, with a great concept. Think of what ESO was supposed to be and that's roughly where you're at imo. 
There is a deep crafting system that takes time and attention to detail to "master". A full loot pvp system that lets you claim the spoils of war from the corpse of your enemies after battle. A rather large open world map full of caves/dungeons to explore, materials to gather, things to build/craft, enemies to battle, NPC AND Player built cities. That's right, you can build anything from your own personal shack to an entire guild empire that controls half of a continent (that happened).
There is everything to do from fighting 50 ft bugs  and treasure hunting to just sitting around on the edge of a pond and spend the day fishing ( even fishing has it's own system to catch various fish with different baits, depths etc).

With over 1k hours on steam and an easy 3k+ before and after steam I can say the game has held my attention for a very long time. It has been a favorite that I check back in on every now and then even when I thought I have moved on and probably will continue to do so for a while to come as the devs have been on a roll with updates as of late.


I'm not going to lie... there has been a list of bugs that trailed on for a while there (silly AI and other minor bugs), but like I mentioned the devs of the game have been pretty on top of things and most of if not everything is far better than earlier days. Not to mention all sorts of new stuff being added pretty frequently. New mobs, magic types, armors, new housing and more have all been added fairly recently and in a short span of each other and that isn't even half of their planned content. 


The biggest problem I see is that it can be overwhelming for new players with everything to take in and get accustomed to (especially the full loot/open pvp aspect). If you are willing to stick around long enough to get the hang of the game you won't be dissappointed. Try bringing a friend or two, or look for a guild/friends in game as it can be 10x more fun with a buddy having your back :P.

P.s- While many players are actually pretty helpful and friendly, some are just a nuisance.Leave the city you start in immediately and head anywhere else, all the griefers and trolls live there to pick on new guys giving us all a bad rep .

author: {'steamid': '76561198078108989', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1516889781}
review:
- PT-BR

Joguei por pouquissimo tempo o jogo, mas foi o suficiente para fazer-me decidir recomendar ou não o game. 

1o. : você só pode ter um personagem, pra mim é até interessante. Imagine um cara com 10 personagens e cada um com uma habilidade especifica, ele poderia jogar sozinho sem comprar nada de ninguém e não movimentar a economia. Mas há a possibilidade de COMPRAR slots extras. O engraçado é que na pagina do site ainda informa que é melhor comprar um slot extra do que ter que lembrar de várias senhas. 

2o. :  A criação de personagem é bem interessante, cada raça com sua especialidade, árvore genealógica, customização... Não tenho do que reclamar disso.

3o. : Os primeiros passos foram um pouco complicados, prefiro jogos que não te expliquem cada coisinha do jogo e te deixem se virar, acho mais desafiadores e interessantes, gostei disso. Mas o que achei complicado foi o sistema de batalha, matar o meu primeiro porquinho foi um sofrimento já que mesmo colado nele a espada não lhe dava dano, tive que bater num porco grande pra conseguir acerta-lo (Mais pra frente no jogo, depois de passar o "tutorial", decidi ler um pouco as informações de ajuda e descobri que segurando Alt, você pode dar estocadas e assim eu consegui acertar os animais mais facilmente.).

4o. : O tamanho da cidade é interessante, achei a ideia dela ser grande e com muros altos bem interessantes, a primeiro momento parece tudo muito bonito, até você começar a andar por ela (há outra análise falando sobre essa mesma coisa). Praticamente as quase 3 horas de jogo foram resumidas em tentar sair da cidade para descobrir o que tem do lado de fora, sem contar a parte onde você começa, de um lado descobri uma cidade que aparentemente foi totalmente queimada e a partir de um certo ponto está inundada (?), por ali encontrei uns "bandits", que me deram dois hits e eu acabei morrendo. Do outro lado eu encontrei uns animais e uma floresta um pouco mais adiante. Caminhando por lá, encontrei algumas estruturas criadas por outros jogadores, continuei passeando e me deparei com um castelo de outro jogador, ao tentar passar por ele (estava a um distancia consideravelmente distante do castelo) comecei a ser alvejado por algum mercenario contratado pelo jogador, fiquei um pouco confuso do porque ele estava me acertando, afinal eu estava só tentando passar e não cheguei perto do castelo. Passado o perigo, continuei caminhando um pouco e encontrei mar. Decidi então caminhar de volta para a cidade, mas a monotomia, falta de vida naquela floresta e velocidade de corrida do personagem me fizeram deitar pra deixar o personagem descansando e desconectar. 

Outros pontos : Achei interessante poder criar casas, formar até uma cidade em volta da sua casinha... Fui atrás de entender melhor, descobri que você precisa pagar a assinatura pra poder fazer isso. Ok, até que é justo. Pra manter a casa você precisa pagar impostos. Bacana, bem real. Se alguma guilda construir uma cidade pela região e decidir cobrar impostos numa área e sua casa esteja nela, vai ter que pagar impostos pra eles também. Certo, tudo perfeito e lindo até ai, o problema vem com a informação de que pra você poder pagar os impostos você precisa sempre manter a assinatura, se deixar de pagar os impostos sua casa vai levando dano até ela ser destruida (???), seja por ter esquecido de pagar os impostos ou por não ter pago a sua assinatura pra manter a casa em pé. Então jogadores F2P não terão suas próprias casas, ou vivem nas de suas guilds e amigos com assinatura ou vivem como andarilhos. 

Conclusão : Bom, com tudo isso, eu não indicaria o jogo. Pode ser bacana jogar com os amigos, mas não vejo como algo que prenderia por muito tempo quanto jogos de sobrevivencia onde você pode construir sua casa sem pagar uma assinatura. em vários pontos que deixam a desejar e deixam o jogo cansativo.  Enfim, o jogo tinha uma idéia muito boa, mas na minha visão não funcionou tão bem. 

EN - US (Google translator helping a little)

I played for very little time in the game, but it was enough to make me decide to recommend or not to.

1o. : You can only have one character, for me it's interesting. Imagine someone with 10 characters and each with a specific skill, he can  play alone without buying anything from anyone and not moving the economy. But there is the possibility of BUYING extra slots. The funny thing is that on the site page there is the information that it is better to buy an extra slot than having multiple passwords.

2nd. : Character creation is interesting, every breed with its specialty, family tree, customization ... I do not have anything to complain about that.

3rd. : The first steps were a bit complicated, games that do not explain anything and let the player on his own, I find more challenging and interesting, I liked that. But what I found complicated is the battle system, killing my first little pig was a pain because my sword wasn't hitting it, I needed to hit a big pig to get it right (More forward in the game,after the "tutorial", I decided to read the help informations and found that holding Alt you can give thrusts and so I managed to hit the animals more easily.).

4th. : The size of the city is interesting, I found the idea of it being big and with high walls very interesting, in the first moment seems very beautiful, until you start walking through it (there is another analysis talking about this same thing). Almost 3 hours of game time I played has been summed up in trying to get out of the city to find out what's on the outside, not to mention the part where you start, on the one hand, I discovered a city that was apparently totally burned out and from a certain point flooded (?), I found some "bandits", who gave me two hits and I ended up dying. On the other side I saw some animals and a forest a little further on. Walking there, I found some constructions created by other players, I kept walking and I came across a castle of another player, trying to get through it (I was a distance far from the castle) the mercenaries started attacking me, I was a little confused because of that, I was trying to get by and I did not get near the castle. After the danger, continue walking a little and I found the sea. I then decided to walk back to  town, but a monotony, lack of life in that forest and character running so slow made me lie down to let the character rest and disconnect from the game.

Other points: I found it interesting to be able to create houses, to form even a city around your little house ... I went behind to understand better, I discovered that you have to pay the signature to be able to do this. Okay, it's fair. To keep the house you need to pay taxes. Fine, real good. If a guild builds a city in the area and decides to charge taxes in an area and their home is in it, they will have to pay taxes to them as well. All right, everything perfect and beautiful so far, the problem comes with the information that for you to be able to pay the taxes you always have to keep the signature, if you stop paying the taxes your house will take damage until it is destroyed (???) , Either because he forgot to pay the taxes or because he had not paid his subscription to keep the house standing. So F2P players will not have their own homes, or live in their guilds and signed friends or live as wanderers.

Conclusion: Well, with all this, I would not indicate the game. It may be cool to play with friends, but I do not see it as something that would hold for as long as survival games where you can build your house without paying a subscription. There are several points that leave the game tedious. Anyway, the game had a very good idea, but in my view it did not work well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032308327', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 56973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8970, 'last_played': 1504639938}
review: *Warning* This game is fairly hardcore, be prepared to learn how the games mechanics work if you want to give it a fair shot.  There is no map.  There is full loot pvp.  It will hurt when you die and lose everything you farmed.  I can't remember the last time I was afraid to leave town in an MMO!  But once you start to figure things out and make some progress the game starts to click...not many games are brave enough to give you the consequences necessary to make accomplishing something feel quite so meaningful.  If you're as tired of the same old same old in mmos as I am give this game a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286517247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1495548874}
review:
I'll be back to change this review when the game actually runs.

I'm a man of my words, so I actually came back and try it out. Unfortunately, my review remains the same. Looking at the release date, this game would have been real awesome back then. The problem is, it has not aged well. Even though the developer is still currently updating it, the updates don't provide a lot of feature that is enough to revitalize the game.

I don't blame the developer, this is a great game. It's just living in a sunset era where the concept no longer appeals to the general MMO market. That, and the appearance of numerous competitors really don't help.

I'm not going to list all the problems with the game in my review, you can easily search those up in all the other negative reviews, e.g. always-on PVP, griefing players, etc.

The thing is, the gameplay is similar to (or is being imitated by, if that makes you feel better) other games like [i]The Elder Scrolls Online[/i] and [i]Conan Exiles[/i], both of which fare better in terms of eye candy because they're new. Of course, Mortal Online is free-to-play, but if you've played the former two games, you'd feel a bit, say, "empty" inside because the pace of Mortal Online is horrendously slow.

In all good intentions I cannot recommend Mortal Online to anybody. However, don't take my words for it. If you have a friend who's asking you to join him in the game, by all means go ahead.

Edit: Also freaking toxic community, proof in comments

author: {'steamid': '76561198090144696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2331, 'last_played': 1698627358}
review:
Let me start off by saying Mortal online is a game unlike others, the community, and the gameplay. 
You start the game with creating your character, and his/her stats. Once you've completed this you choose a starting town (I feel bad for those who started in tindrem). 
Once you're in the game, you're instantly baffeled by the music.
You're left to finish the tutorial, and after you do -unlike other games- you don't continue to do quests, you may gather with some friends, or go alone, and travel, explore and make a name for yourself in the world. 
There is no doubt you will die (allot!) in the beggining, but the more skills you learn, and the more learn in general, it's a blast to play. 
inconclusion, this game might not be for everyone, but I'd strongly reccomend you give this game a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099670667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2025, 'last_played': 1488336597}
review:
LOVE THIS GAME!

When you start off, the game feels dated, ugly and just a big buggy;
But when you get into the game and start to dig, you realize that the depth that it holds compared to other MMOs out there right now is unbelievable. 

This is not a game that you can just jump in and casually play. There are no quests. You are dropped in a world and you make of it what you can. The crafting is amazing. The comunity controls the economy and the weapons you have access to. I have been playing for a week now and I've barely scratched the surface. It took me 3 days just to get comfortable enough to leave town.

I was so sick of every MMO out there being the same. You quest, quest, and quest some more. It is boring. There is no danger anymore.

EVERYTHING in this game feels dangerous; Like a challenge. If you go out with a friend it legitamtely feels like an adventure and it may take you hours or even days to find your way back to town if you are new and you get lost in the wilderness.

10/10, guys. Please keep it up. This is what an MMO should feel like when you play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971886749', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3254, 'last_played': 1600973781}
review:
I have a number more of logged hours than what steam can give me credit for but here is the thing. Mortal Online, while old and dated when it comes to the graphics has a lot of features that unfortunately not adopted by the MMO genre. There is a need to establish relationships and a lot of opportunities to help your fellow gamer. I get a lot of joy out of showing newer people the ropes of the game in hopes that they too enjoy the game as much as I do. The combat is fun and challenging especially when fighting other players, the crafting and gathering is insanely deep and involved. The game is 7 years old and still running even with its small community and I think that says something people should consider. 

If you miss the old days where you could create relationships with new people rather than hitting the queue button over and over this might be the game for you, if you want to look me up feel free to do so I am always looking to help others and show people the ropes. I'd recommend this if you are looking for a change of pace from the homogenized norm that is MMO's today.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083528880', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 243193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 792, 'playtime_at_review': 6440, 'last_played': 1712354562}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052476626', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1141, 'last_played': 1486832270}
review:
Good idea, very badly implemented,  I'm not usually one to highlight poor graphics in game but these take the piss, most of the game just takes the piss, especially the amounts your asked to pay in order to be able to do anything. Seriously? the devs think that paying over and above the price of a AAA game is fair for this, yet they are very quick to talk about "how they are a small company" when it suits...

Nothing difficult or challenging about the game but an awful lot of pointless frustrations and bugs make the experience totally unenjoyable.

I wouldn't describe the game as "F2p" you get an trial with limited skills, this is fair enough right?

Normally yeah but you litterally cannot do anything with the skills you have available, want to craft weapons? well you can craft a certain type of weapon at a skill cap, trying to explore the crafting system and advancing the skills, still unable to make anything better than the initial "worn short sword" that you get, simply because of the skill caps, It should be advertised as a limited trial because that's what it is, if you've more money than sense, then dive right in, the devs will love you.

Such a long boring grind to collect materials, to extract a material from that, in order to extract another material from that in order to, well you get the idea, but at each step you need more skill points in order to extract the next material in ever decreasing amounts. The skills race up the way very quickly, an hour or so had me at max atributes, good right? well no, totally nothing to work towards except a massive load of material gathering only to find out that you need not have bothered. You're still unable to make anything better than the rags and short sword you're able to make, unless you've got a few toons.

In order to make iron, you need to mine ore, turn that ore into something, turn what you get from that into something else, each time using a catalyst that makes no sense putting water directly into a forge for example, you just don't do it, water puts fire OUT, totally unintuative. then once you've got all of that you need to mix it in with more of the ore that you got all of that stuff from. And if you're able to do that with your one free toon then THAT IS ALL YOU WILL BE ABLE TO DO and you won't be able to do it to any extent hat can get you anywhere in the game.

It's not even a good mining and wood cutting simulator.

Let's try combat, one of the poorest AI's I have ever encountered, some mobs will happily stand and let you swing at their head, others will run past several players and attack you for no reason, you can add people to your friends list but there is no way to productively play with them as far as I can tell because anytime you try to help them fight something your weapons auto sheathe and you get the message "You cannot attack an innocent player, please click" 

Awesome eh? you try to help your friend and end up standing in the middle of battle with no weapon drawn, it's THAT poorly thought out.

So still thinking that the concept of the game is a good one, you look into the subscription options, you figure, ok it's free, you need to subscribe to get the most.

This is also the worst subscription plan I've ever encountered in a few of decades of gaming,

When you subscribe you get access to stealing and to more skill points, also the cap is removed and you can go up to 100, well that's all you get, no extra character slots, "stealing" basically you are untouchable, you can outrun any free player, you can outrun the guards, the only warning you get when you're being stolen from is a text message in a chat flooded with spam.

So you pay your £10 a month sub and you can finally maybe do one thing to a decent skill level, you then have to buy more character slots, if you don't want to be this guy who just stands in the one spot click a button repeatedly.

So for example you wanted a crafter to suport your fighter, that's £40 right out of the bat, not counting that you need to keep paying the monthly sub. Why £40? Well you need your fighter toon, your armour toon, your weaponsmith toon AND your materiel harvesting toon, allthough you will probably need two of those due to the uninspired crafting, they've tried to make it "interesting" it's not, most of it's pointless, all of it is unintuitive.

So that's £160 just for your years sub and character slots, to maybe be able to do something effectively in the game.

Not only that but it's the same for anyone you want to play with.

Do the devs HONESTLY think that's a fair price for what you get for it? well apparently, the ususal stuff about "small companies" etc, Well hows about these "small companies" only take on what they can afford rather than passing the cost onto the ever decreasing player numbers? 

How about they actually have a long good look at themselves and what they are asking people to play because for that money, I could buy a holiday in Sweden, never mind play a very poorly executed game from there.

The information about all of this is very limited as well, you go onto their wiki for information about a book and the wiki simply says the same text as the book does,

The only good thing I have to say about the game was how quickly a GM responded to a "stuck" request, it's totally possible to walk through the side of a bridge and fall into water that you can't get out of, even if you did have the skill points to put in swimming.

This is only one of many, many bugs and glitches that I have encountered in just a short while, I've had expensive skill books simply "stop reading" and vanish, I've had skill points dissapear, items dissapear, 400 skill points vanished over night, can't even be bothered opening a ticket about it, the game is just that poor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323549694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2559, 'last_played': 1486682713}

The hit boxes are a bit wonkey. the game is very realistic which i enjoyed, but at the end of the day a lot of the players are cancerous. Aimlessly trolling, because their lifes are sad. The game would be a really good for you if youre a toll and have troll friends to troll with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058794013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 331279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69719, 'last_played': 1693202834}
review:
This game is one of the most in depth i've ever played. The community controls nearly every aspect of the game world asside from developement, There are politics and wars against guilds, betrayals umong alliances, A feeling od deep satisfaction when you win a fight against another player because this game is completely skill based. Dont think that because you're good at pvp in some other popular mmos *Cough* WoW *cough* that you're going to be anything but terrible in this one. It matters what direction you swing your sword and what direction you block. It matter where you hit your opponent on their body.

This game has the most in-depth craftin gsystem i've ever seen on any "MMO". Name a matrial that you could harvest from a corpse... you can make armor or weapons from it... including skin from people you slay. You can also eat practically anything that comes from a corpse including player heads and corpses, though it'll probably make your character sick. Give it a try. if you hate it, delete it. But at least put more than 5 hours into it before you give it a bad rating just because you dont understand this incredibly in depth, rewarding game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987560744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2389, 'last_played': 1486562174}
review:
Сразу хочу сказать что эта игра весьма посредственна уже сама по себе, много ошибок весьма слабая графика. К этому ещё стоит добавить излишне усложнённую систему создания вещей и абсолютное отсутствие внутриигрвой экономики. Что и послужило основным поводом отложить данную игру. Дальше же пойдёт обьяснение чем же эта игра по настоящему больна.

Если вы хотите помогать другим, общаться, переживать приключения вместе с друзьями и получать удовольствие от игры, то есть всё то что вы обычно делаете в остальных MMORPG, то эта игра не для вас. Единственное развлечение которое можно найти на ОБШИРНЫХ просторах "Murder onlain" это убийства игроков-новичков и смерть от более злостных убийц. Если же вы, вдруг решили заняться чем либо другим в этой игре (обозначаю цифрой) то всё пойдёт по следующим сценариям (буквы):
1. Вы пошли на охоту против сильных существ чтобы продать их когти, зубы, мясо и заработать деньги на новый лук.
а) Вы преуспели и обарботав более 50 трупов существ своим ножом для разделки, потратив примерно час времени и заработать денег чтобы купить лук который нанесёт на 1 единицу урона больше. Вы решаете повторить свой заход чтобы заработать больше денег на новый лук. (Повторить вариант прибавив дополнительные параметры)
б) Вас на обратном пути встретила группа Игроков-разбойников и забрала все ваши вещи, лук, добычу и вашу жизнь. (обнуление параметров)

2. Вы решили создать хорошую оружие и броню для своего друга лучника чтобы вы вдвоём могли сразить тех разбойников и сделать мир чуточку лучше. Для этого вы выкапываете все пни, все камни которые можете найти в охраняемой NPC зонах и за два дня "игры" и потратив все свои очки развития на "Множество разннобразных" навыков создания одного лука и сделав своего персонажа абсолютно бесполезным в бою. Вы таки завершаете своё оружие мести.
а) Ваш друг лучник сумел с помощью созданых вами вещей отбиться от разбойника потому что разбойник был один и не имел такого хорошего друга. (повторить вариант с новыми параметрами)
б) Разбойник был не один. Они забрали все те вещи которые добыл твой друг и все вещи которые ты для него создал себе. Твоё оружие мести попало в руки зла. (Обнуление параметров). 

Думаю этого достаточно. Как вы видете в итоге вы всё равно прийдёте к выводу что стремиться что либо создавать бессмысленно. Легче забрать это у других приложив минимум усилий и получая прибыль ничем не рискуя. Если же вы как и я по моральным принципам не можете приять этот факт то - поздравляю, вы разумный человек, и в этой игре вам делать нечего. Оставьте эту игру маньякам и садистам, пусть пар выпускают, отрываясь друг на друге.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996522406', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1481396588}
review:
I really, really, REALLY want(ed) to like this game, but not wanting to pay the sub fee anymore renders my character useless.


Anyone who says you can play in the sense of anything other than be mediocre at a few things is lying. Even then - the skill system is annoying and overly-complicated and really promotes alts. Guess what? Extra character slots? Pull out that sweet, sweet plastic.


I really do believe the devs of this game are trying their best with what they have and it's really sad the only thing holding this game back is a severe lack of population. The game-world is simply dead... You can travel from city-to-city and not even encounter an NPC. It's almost depressing. You can tell the devs intended for non-existent players to fill up all this empty space.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083154037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 21297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10370, 'last_played': 1534018480}
review:
None of the videos you see online do this game justice anymore. The have come a very long way and almost every last thing that is complained about in the videos you see on youtube has been adressed and are no longer problems. They regularily update the game with new areas, crafting recipies, player houseing options, things to do with constant balancing and bug fixing. Getting started in this game was always the hardest for people to do because of a bad tutorial. They are completely overhauling it this year to be easy and have explainations for all aspects of the game.
If you like HARDCORE GAMING you will love this game. Don't be afraid to ask questions in game. Mortal online has one of the BEST PLAYER COMMUNITIES out there and they love to help you learn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271909842', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 18661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18445, 'last_played': 1486089354}
review:
want a buddy to play with on mo? add me, ill join you, ill not so good though :D

where do i start? well this is  guess is the new version of the review because apparenly my old one was unhelpful according to people


ok well i havent played the game in a sec, but im getting the urge to come back... i just need to get my pc fixed :D


what is this game? this game is a full loot sandbox where you can do whatever you want.

And people do what they want, run around naked taking your shit if they want too :D

why full loot? well people like a challenge, and the ultimate challenge is to be punished hard for the mistakes you make, this is where full loot multiplayer comes in.

do i like this game? oh yeah i do, and no i just hate it to the ends of the earth...
why so mixed? well its easy to rage, "this guy came in in op armor and juust one shot me and took my sword!
hahaha the times... but i met some of the best people on this game.. some of the worst, there is no global chat

its a REALISTIC hardcore game, all local chat :D. but lucky you there is a help chat to ask for help. it wont last forever though.

next is the game actually free? yes and no, its free but restricted, unless you subscibe. look at my hours, all of it has been done as f2p. just be smart. its a game of skill not who has the best stuff.

how "sandbox is it?". why what a handsome question! you can literaly do anything, feel like farming undead in tindrem to the end of days, go ahead. want to explore and get lost forever till you get back randomly? do that as well. want to craft? as f2p you are limited, but you can sell to other f2ps! want to tame and breed mounts? do that as well! 

another thing to note is this game has no official map, so itll be hard to explore without getting lost :D


did i mention everything oh and Sarducca master place ;) good night everybody!

unlike others, they didnt say WHY my review is crappy, if you can please say why this crap :) please and thankyou

author: {'steamid': '76561198083651314', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 8746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1933, 'last_played': 1489212137}
review:
I have put a nice chunk of time into this game and feel I can give it a pretty good review. I started the game with a friend that had been playing for 2 week and that sure did make the start to the game more enjoyable due to the very small tutorial. After that you start your adventures trying to figure out your way and understand the skill system but after that I can say this game has so much depth and replay value. I spent my first week killing Springboks and Urials to further my combat skills and to help me understand the blocking and parry system. 

With the 1100 points you are given to spend on skills you can only Max skills to 60 and not to 100 as a F2P account which is understandable because they need to give a reason for players to want to SUB to the game. It was no secret to the folks  watching my stream that within the first 2 days I was going to become a SUB and continue my adventures. Also I would like to add this is not a dead game at all there is plenty of players and furthermore in the last 3 weeks they have put in 2 large Patches to improve the game.

Thanks for this game and TAKE MY MONEY !!!

review:

You will die and you will lose stuff but as you learn the game you will die less and make more. you just got to remember to only travel and carry things you can replace. alot of people who try the game never leave the starter town. they die and quit. its not a easy game. the world is massive and has loads of places to explore and you can have Player to player experiences like no other game.

the Lead Programmer Sebastian is The Man

give it a try and dont just stay in the first town. explore naked. visit towns. talk to people. dont let the griefers and player killers get you down. skill up join people and practice so you can avoid and kill them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982148163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1485988382}
review:
I will preface this review with three questions, and if the answer is "Yes" to any of these questions then I suggest you give Mortal Online a long hard look; if you say "Yes" to all of these questions then stop reading this start downloading Mortal Online! 

--------------------

Questions: 

1.  Are you tired and/or burnt out on all the MMORPGs out, or coming out, on the market?

2.  Do you want to play a game where EVERYTHING you do is an accomplishment and reinvigorates that sense of discovery you had when you played your first MMORPG?

3.  Does the idea of an open loot system (you lose everything you are carrying when you die) fill you with a sense of excitement and adventure?

--------------------

Overview

Mortal Online is a Fantasy Sandbox MMORPG that takes familiar elements from games like Ultima Online and Runescape, and takes them to a whole new level.  The entire game is played in first-person, and there is no functionality to change the view to third-person.  All combat and actions within the game are based off of targeting with your reticle, so if you want to hit a boar in the head then you need to aim for it's head.  Character progression is based on skill points rather than levels, and you only have so many skill points to use.  You aren't safe anywhere, not even in cities, so always be on your guard, but don't turn into a jerk, just be wary.

--------------------

Skills

Skills are broken down into a ton of different categories that are based on Parent and Child relationships, so a player would need to learn Armor Crafting (to a certain skill level) before he/she can learn Soft Armor Crafting.  Many skills you can begin learning just by attempting to do them, such as chopping down a tree or mining for ore, but other skills will need to be learned by reading skill books.  Skill books can be obtained from Libraries (for a price) or from the Auction House, players can begin reading these (some can take 8 hours or more) and the reading timer will continue to countdown when the player logs off.  

I mentioned that you have a finite number of skill points to use, and in the beginning, you will burn through over half of these pretty quickly.  Don't panic!  You can lock skills that you don't want to increase anymore and you can even decrease skills you aren't going to use to get the skill points back to use on something else.  This can be confusing at first, but this really allows the player total freedom in choosing what their character does without letting characters become masters of everything at once.

--------------------

Combat

Combat is based on using your aiming reticle and blocking or dodging the attacks of your enemies.  I haven't done much of this yet, besides slaughtering herds of innocent pigs, but I think it is very engaging, sort of a melding between Skyrim and Mount & Blade combat, but better.

--------------------

Magic

No comment at all on this, but it is very in depth, with required components for spells.  Healing magic, for instance, can require water.

--------------------

Crafting

The crafting in this game is intense.  I repeat: the crafting in this game is INTENSE.  There are spreadsheets and emulators online that help players calculate the required components to create other components to finally (maybe) create the item they want to create.  There is more than one way to make a particular piece of armor, and some components will make the end item heavier or cooler etc.  I think this is an amazing part of the game, but it is not for the faint of heart.

--------------------

PvP

Mortal Online works on a flagging system.  Here is the breakdown:

Fledgling: Yellow
Innocent: Blue
Criminal: Grey
Murderer: Red
Hidden Criminal: Grey with Blue Stripe

Basically, if you do something negative to someone then you will be flagged Grey, unless that person was already Grey.  The flagging system is one of the most important parts of MO to understand, so check out this Beginner's Guide for more information : http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=519329793.

--------------------

Conclusion

Mortal Online is a really in-depth game, but it is most certainly not for the casual player, and I don't mean the time-casual player, but the player that is more instant gratification.  If you want your cake and eat it too then this game is not for you, but if you want to bake your cake, eat some of your cake, then sneak around to hide your cake in the bank until you can share it with your guild mates then this game is for you!  

You can try the game for free, and all F2P Accounts can use skills up to skill level 60.  What that means is that you can raise your skills above skill level 60, but you can only use the skill at skill level 60.  I highly recommend subscribing to the game if you are 8 hours in and enjoying it.  The subscription costs less than other MMORPGs, and it is well worth it to support such an awesome game.

--------------------

Grimstein's Personal Tips

1.  Buy the Reading Skill Book (yes, that's an actual skill book) and begin reading that right away.  That will allow you to read other skill books more efficiently.

2.  Find a Guild on the official MO forums.

3.  Get out of the starting city.

4.  Turn up your graphics and other options as high as you can.

5.  Only keep what you immediately need on you.  Bank your money until you need to buy something, and keep your skill books in the bank until you want to start reading them.

6.  If you are going on a long journey, such as to join up with your new guild, bring along some food and bring everything you can with you.  Banks are localized, and if you store something in Tindrem, you will have to go back to Tindrem to get it.

--------------------

I hope my review helped you make an informed decision.  There is so much more to Mortal Online than I touched upon in this review, but I hope it gives you a taste of what's in store if you play.  Good luck, and I hope to see you in Nave!

Evris Grimstein

author: {'steamid': '76561198067638895', 'num_games_owned': 12, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 42563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28465, 'last_played': 1710094372}
review:
Best MMO on the market. 

It offers freedom, exploration, PvE, PvP, world building, great graphics, open world. A true sandbox for an MMO, and the most immersive game i've played. It has a STEEP learning curve but that's what makes it great, it is not an easy game.

No levels, just a skillpool you decide how to use and the forced first person was jarring at first but it really adds to immersion and now I can't live without it.

The game does have it quirks but its much like the Elder Scrolls series in that it comes with the territory. If you like the elder scrolls and can handle the hardcore nature, you will love this game.

It can be harsh and can be frustrating but is more so rewarding and fun overcoming challenges. I've played many MMOs and this game offers a unique experience that can't be replicated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065802651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1485696892}
review:
I'm going to keep it simple for people to follow. In this games current state I was just unable to play it. And I'm going to explain why in the classic Pros And Cons format. So let's start with the pros.

+The game is clearly similar to ArcheAge where it's objective is to give the player as much freedom as possible. That includes professions, building houses, BUILDING KINGDOMS and rallying with other players. Not enough online games do this and it's instantly won my favor for this alone.

+ There's actual nudity. ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) Definitely didn't see this coming from a Free To Play game. In fact it gives you the option to toggle it in the preferences menu. This game isn't rated PG as far as I'm aware and I'm sure there's probably a sex scene somewhere in here too. 

+The character customization is basic however kinda detailed. You know how in GTA Online it has you pick a mother and a father for your base character generation? This game has something similar except it generates your base stats and race. I thought that was pretty cool and worth mentioning here.

Now for the cons. And if you've noticed, I only mentioned three pros. I'll explain why later.

-In order to play this game at a playable framerate I actually had to turn all settings down in the pop-up menu. The first time I played the game the framerate was genuinely abysmal. I thought I wasn't even going to get as far as the tutorial. This isn't right though since my PC has enough power to run Crysis at a playable speed which is a game known for pouring 90% of it's money into the graphics. (Still a good game tho.) So essentially you need a super computer to play with decent graphics. Hope that Youtube careers working out for you, Youtubers.

-The combat is... bad. Not bad in a way as when you attack someone you have to deal with a cool down on all abilities or anything giving the enemy ample time to hit you. It's like Skyrim's melee system only done poorly. I don't even know about the magic or ranged system.

-And here's why I only mentioned 3 pros. The game is honestly kind of bland. Not bland in like a Runescape sort of way where everything from the graphics to the gameplay is trying to get you to stop playing the game. I mean it's bland in a way that dissolves my interest to continue playing it. Obviously the games set in a gritty Witcher-esque world considering you encounter asshole characters in the tutorial right along side discovering this game features nudity, which under different circumstances would rope me right in to continue playing. But the problem here is that it was obviously developed by devs who probably haven't worked on an MMO before. You can tell just from looking at the detail of the tutorial stage. It's way to open and the tutorial ASSAULTS you. It doesn't really do a good job explaining things either. It pretty much just gives you the basics, pats you on the butt then expects you to figure things out from there.

Do I reccomend the game? Maybe not in it's current state but definitely as a game in itself. I genuinely wanna come back to this game once things have been sorted out and it stops being clunky and forcing me to look into a bland mess of a tutorial. I want to play this game once it's more able to handle hightened graphics and I want to see what it could turn into. It's very, VERY rare for an MMO to give you as much freedom as to see people naked which is why even known it my experience was kind of a mess I WANT this game to do good which is why it's getting a thumbs up from me.

Here's hoping this game goes places...

[b]EDIT[/b]
So I tried playing it again and I missed a few things.

+I love the Oblivion approach they took to the stats system where doing things like simply running will increase your speed and endurance. That was really neat

-The community is awful. While I was trying to grind walkers in the graveyard there was an asshole clipping into an enemy I was attacking trying to get me to hit him. And I did. And then he killed me. In town. Alright I'm going to get this right out of the way and say THIS IS A PROBLEM THAT COULD HAVE EASILY BEEN SOLVED. Simply just dedicate a server to PVE where you can't damage fellow players and dedicate another to PVP where you can. That way when an asshole player clips into an enemy I'm attacking I don't accidentally hit him. And nobody will be able to attack me. I get that their trying to make a game maybe similar to ARK or something but... no actually no I'm not forgiving this. If this game doesn't have dedicated servers for different types of vs then I'm never playing it again.

Do I still reccomend the game? Yes. But I ain't playing it anytime soon unless these issues are solved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077436278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 150585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122268, 'last_played': 1540540866}
review: This game is like no other. It requires discipline and determination. Open world, full loot, complex crafting system, first person, in depth combat, medieval armors and weapons, magic and tricks of the trade. This game is so in depth I have 2200 hours played and I'm still learning new things every day. Quick words of advice: YOU WONT ALWAYS RUN THAT SLOW, FINISH THE TUTORIAL, READ THE BULLETINS IN THE HELP TAB, READ BOOKS, LOOK UP GUIDES AND BUILDS, JOIN A GUILD TO MEET PEOPLE, DONT ATTACK THE GREY GUY, IF YOU DIE DONT USE THE NEAREST PRIEST BUTTON, RUN TO ONE OF THE RED BEAMS IN THE SKY, TRUST NO ONE, IF YOU DIE, KNOW THAT EVERYTHING YOU HAVE IS REPLACEABLE. Last but not least, give the game a chance. It still needs work and there is a huge community of players who need your help to continue to give the game life. There is a whole new world aside from what you have already experienced or are going to experience when you first log into the game. First thing you should do: learn how to play the game. Get a grasp of what skills are available. You're opportunities are endless. You just have to get out there and look for them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002376502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 81527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79685, 'last_played': 1658105065}
review:
Mortal Online.... Hmm... let me see.  It is a lot of things... good, bad, and down right frustrating, it can be one of the best times you have had and one of the most mind numbingly boring times.   But overall it is a really decent open world sandbox.  

I have played Mortal Online off and on since Block B of beta, I can say that the 1300+ hours of gameplay recorded by Steam is no where near the amount of time I have in this game.  While I would not call it a gem, it is a real find, and the original open world sandbox first person PVP full loot game.  It came out in a time when everyone was terrified of doing something different, a small group of mostly incompetent coders got together and formed Star Vault and created Mortal Online.   Which for the first year was absolute crap as SV worked tirelessly to fix the millions of problems the game had.   After 7+ years they have about 900k of those problems fixed and the game works 95% of the time.   Which is better than most games on STEAM.....    The community is mildly toxic, very PVP oriented, and not affraid of telling you where to shove it if you annoying them.  

Overall Mortal Online is at the very least worth the download and free to play perma-trial time.  Who knows you may like it... but if you dont, its free.

Hodo
Aegis Imperium.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081866855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 371924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131441, 'last_played': 1701496894}
review:
I had been looking for a very specific type of game for a long time, it needed to be:

First person
Open world (No instances)
Fantasy based 
Online Multiplayer
Realtime, directional combat
Full loot

For the longest time I could not find such a game, a quest that to me seemed strange because I thought everyone would love this experience.

One day, I found Mortal Online.

At first, I did not like the game, I only saw it with my blanketed, jaded gamer eyes. 
It took me a long time and a good group of people to really get me into the game, and even then it took another year before I started playing seriously.

I now play mortal every day, and have done for a long time. 
I only play other games when the server goes down for its daily restart.

This game is not like other games, it is a hobby. 
This game will require you to invest a large portion of your time into it, but what it will give back is something no other game that exists can offer.

If you have the patience, the time and the drive to seek adventure, you will find it in Mortal Online. 

Everywhere you look, there is complex systems hiding behind what may seem to be simple mechanics at first. 
Systems you can discover and learn, recipes and methods, secrets you can choose to share with others or keep for yourself.

The combat in this game is truley skill based, it will take a long time for you to master it. 
When you do, you will gain respect from other players, and fear from your foes.

This game is a living world, everything in it has substance. 
Choose to interact with it or not, however if you do you may find yourself lost in its vast possibilities and opportunities.



Welcome, 
to Mortal Online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004081458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 11760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1389, 'last_played': 1591553921}
review:
Mortal Online is one of the most misunderstood and underappreciated gems in the world of video gaming.

I say this because there are those who have played this game for quite a number of years now and have come to love it, and I am one of them. If you want depth, freedom and complexity in a truly hardcore and unforgiving world, there isn’t another title out there like it that I know of.

My hours played here on Steam may be few, but that's because I've only recently switched to playing the game through Steam instead of the old launcher. I first played this game way back in 2010 then left for the most part, until September 2013 when I returned for good and have been playing it ever since as my preferred MMORPG over all others.

At first glance, this game may not seem like much, but once you’ve earned a decent amount of gold, crafted a set of gear for yourself, made a few friends and seen the world outside Tindrem city, you begin to appreciate just how vast and intricate this game really is. Then you realise that you’ve only just scratched the surface; there is the player-driven economy, guilds and individual players going about their business, and much more.

You can be any character you want, and pursue whatever activity you wish. If you’ve ever played The Elder Scrolls or Ultima Online, you’ll know exactly what I’m talking about. There are no traditional quest hubs that have you moving from one region to the next as you level up. There are, however, plenty of players who may have something that needs done or need help with, and if you’re interested then you can lend your services and make your mark in the world in a meaningful way. That is just one of the myriad of ways you can keep yourself busy and occupied, all it takes is a little imagination and creative thinking. Even after playing this game for over three years, every time I login there is always something for me to do.

I could keep writing a long review but it would probably be best if I said that this game is not for the faint-hearted or those who don’t know how a sandbox game is meant to be played. If you’ve never seen this game in all its glory, you owe it to yourself to give it a try. Create a free account and play the unlimited free trial for as long as you want, then upgrade to premium if you like what you see.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972293177', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 69010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55769, 'last_played': 1596256321}

author: {'steamid': '76561198077976297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 220450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132459, 'last_played': 1573735432}
review: Aloha, Mortal Online is great game ever I played. Hardcore sandbox MMORPG, first person view and real time combat. You can build house then any kind of structures like crafting tables, walls, and NPC guards. You also can siege and destroy structures and houses! Siege system requires logisitic to success. Magic system is good, abit of to much fantasy. Mounted system has a big advantage in battlefield, it does need to fixed some ways like no stam drain while go up the hill, its just lame sometime to fight mounted as foot. Other than that, foot vs foot combat is fun and armor system is great and doing well with stam drain based on armor weight. I enjoy playing Mortal Online, because it always change everyday even when I dont play for few days, alot of things happens! Roam for pvp is somewhat boring because of walls however still get pvp activities daily basis. Crafting system is nice, so many options! Go for it, go play Mortal Online. Don't cry if you lose everything because I have lose a lot more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093440395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1485301916}
review:
Became a tamer. 
Tamed a dog. 
Got my dog to fight other dogs.
 Became overburdened with dog corpses. 
Stripped naked so I could run faster ( Nice nudity textures ). 
Ended up dying to a dog. 
Went back and picked up my old shit.. Including my corpse. 
Once more overburdened and slowly crawling through the city. 
Nibbled a little at my corpse before calmly depositing it in the bank.
Left the city to go look for deer. 
Couldn't find any.
Found and island. 
Walked to it.
Tried to swim
Couldn't swim.
Fell to the bottom of an underwater chasm and drowned. 
The bowl like structure left even my phantom trapped.

I don't wanna play this game anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051004489', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1485201314}
review:
Initially, the game concept appears to sound like a cross between skyrim and Mount & Blade, but it stops after you complete the tutorial area. At the very instant you finish the tutorial you are introduced to the wide open world that is known as Mortal Online. 

Firstly it is worth mentioning that there is a small group of players that sit outside the gates of the tutorial city waiting for new, ill-equipped players to appear so they can gang up on you, overwhelm, and kill you within seconds. I did not discover this from experience as much as I had people scream at me not to exit the city because apparently a clan regularly camps the "noob city" 
The community is helpful but at the same time rude and completely annoying. When I logged in the first thing I saw in the chatbox was about 6 people comparing the size of their character's junk, but we'll get onto that later. If you ever have the displeasure of hearing the barely functional speech option in the game, and manage to understand anything in the game aside from static, you will realize most of the players who are on this game are 12 years old or younger. Trust me, adults don't speak like the cast of Sesame street normally.

On to the real deal, game mechanics. It's a weird puzzle of interesting concepts that are executed in horrible ways. The game uses the unreal engine, which has given us rather excellent looking games such as Red Orchestra 2 and Killing Floor, among many others. Unfortunately, the graphics in this game are far more akin to one of the games I compare it to, Mount and Blade, but lack all the features that make Mount and Blade interesting. The game's combat mechanics are more similar to Chivalry and Mount and Blade, but unlike both of those games, come off as clunky and broken in many cases, with the so-called emphasis on enemy weak points being completely pointless because striking the head of the enemy always does the most damage anyway. But this is a MMORPG, surely there are better features in it than just the combat and graphics? The game has interesting movement animations, and is completely in first person, but not immersive enough to become interesting. Permadeath isn't actually permadeath, it's just generalized respawn timers and a "spirit realm" that offers absolutely nothing to do while you wait. 

How do you die? well that's simple. Steal in front of a guard and he instantly hits you with a lightning bolt which will kill you no matter what you have. I tested this theory by grinding undead corpse heads until I had the best armor available, and he still kills you in 2 hits. He hits instantly, and there is no way of blocking magic explained in the tutorial. 

RPG mechanics? You learn new skills by reading books, they give you a starter book to read after you finish the tutorial. It takes 6 days real time to read the book, and there is no way of speeding up the process. There are features that are locked including max skills for "paying" players.

I left the game before even trying to do real PvP because the PvE in the game was already so horrifyingly bad that it felt appropriate to quit. 

Never play this game, leave it to be one of the dead MMORPG games that fade into obscurity like the cancer they are.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030417802', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1483886376}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017808448', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3188, 'last_played': 1485454225}
review:
Добрый день всем тем, кто читает данный обзор.
Хочу в двух словах рассказать о такой противоречивой игре, как Mortal Online. Играл я в нее года три назад, потом забросил, сейчас что-то снова заставило в нее вернуться. Не знаю насколько затянет и затянет ли вообще.

Начну с хорошего. Игра уникальна по своему геймплею, не смотря на всю его корявость и убогость графики, игра затягивает своей свободой. Вы вольны делать все, что захотите, хотите печь пироги? пеките! Хотите убивать других игроков, убивайте! Хочется воровать? Воруйте. Мир игры огромен, я и сейчас с восторгом вспоминаю, как исследовал его, находил небывалые по красоте ущелья, бродил по горным хребтам, по колено в снегу и выживал в пустынях. Монстры на любой вкус, есть безумно сложные, которых тяжело одолеть и от которых проблематично убежать, есть слабенькие, на которых приятно качаться. Мир в игре живой, он живет своей жизнью, вы в нем обычный персонаж... От которого по началу ничего не зависит. :) 
Теперь о минусах...
Много багов, игра тормозит на моей, далеко не самом слабом ПК. Из нового особенно ничего не заметил, открыли новый континент, но зачем? В игре не так много людей, что бы открывать новый, пустой континент...
Я ожидал от игры другого развития, новых интересных скиллов из ультимы онлайн, например яд... Это была очень клевая фишка в УО. Ожидал так же, что переделают систему тайминга в игре, так как считаю что не совсем правильно, когда прирученое тобой животное при смерти пропадает навсегда и его нет возможности воскресить, даже за очень дорого. Разработчики стремятся к хардкору, но мне такое стремление не совсем понятно... Ладно фулл лут, во время ПВП, я считаю это правильным, но добавлять хардкора в интерфейс как-то глупо... Воры... Отдельная тема, в городе полным полно воров у банка, которые могут легко свиснуть все, что вы заработали... Тоже сомнительно... Игра которая на 70% в городе состоит из воров, ну как то не айс. Магия... магии в общем то нет, есть пятерочка заклинаний, которые работают через одно место. то есть лучники стреляющие как пулемет и почти не прицеливаясь, это норма для ПВП игры, а вот магия это читерство, которое надо ужимать. :)

Игра не дружелюбна к новичкам. Боль и страдания ожидают новичков везде. :)

И да, мне не нравится ПВП в игре в том виде, в каком оно есть сейчас... Бегают друг за другом два калеки, сначала один за другим, потом наоборот. Смысл отбежать в то время, когда у тебя мало ХП и отхелится, потом вернуться в бой... Посмотрите видеоролики, не впечетляет.

ПВП ниче так если только ты найдешь новичка голого, то его можно убить за 1-2 удара... Вот и все ПВП пожалуй.
Да и скорости перемещения персонажей в ПВП какие то высокие... Нет хардкора, есть экшн, который не особенно впечетляющий.

В общем какие то противоречивые мнения у меня об игре сложились, но я пожалуй скажу, что игра мне нравится. И я очень надеюсь, что игра будет развиваться и становиться интересней и красивее. Главное, что бы не было застоя и что бы разработчики игры вкладовали свои силы в действительно стоящие нововведения, а не в пустоту.

Сейчас так мало игр, похожих на старую добрую Ультиму Онлайн, а так хочется, что бы такие игры были.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978437344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1485123562}
review:
Ive played this game on two seperate occasions and both times have come to the same conclusion.

The only time you will get enjoyment out of this game is when you are with a group of friends, the rest of the game is a giant grind. 

I really wanted to enjoy this game, but it's hard when the community sucks so bad and you are limited to what you can do as a single person. 

If you really want to waste hours away trying somthing "new" (Actually Old) It's a solid game.

I'm giving it the thumbs up for surviving this long and having players still, but I can't torture myself anymore.

-Dev legit nerfed a my gold income even know I was the only one doing it and wasnt making that much off of it

*Old Review*
Mortal online is not an easy game to get into
The only reason I am suggesting people to get into it now instea of before is the fact that they are acutally now working on the game very hard
Instead of just adding new "fancy stuff" they are actually working on the game's bugs and messed up parts
It feels good that they have started to clean up the game

Now that's out of the way this game is hard for new people to get into
because most of the new people are simpled minded and try to kill whoever they can, 
Try looking at the bigger picture don't run around tindrem for your whole time playing trying to get cheap kills here and there
Try Talking to the players using help chat, learn how to make money and skill up your character. If you havent found a guild by then you could always try the forums, Which also have all the guides you neeed for pretty much everything. 

I wouldnt suggest taking advice for anyone who hasnt played this game longer then a few 100 hours because you acutally need to spend 100 hours just on learning the basics of how this game works, even with that said it's not as complex as I make it out to be, it's just the newer generation of people don't tend to understand games like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025832945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 155922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43508, 'last_played': 1606883833}
review: This is one of the last games with a living breathing community. Once you've made a real name for yourself, time and time again you'll come back and everyone will know exactly who you are and what you've done.  This game has tons of history completely forged by the players. Everyone is an actual person and what you do really matters. Its strange, it's something you can't find especially in multiplayer games. If you can manage your way to make an impact what you do feels so much more monumental. Give it a shot but remember, because this game is so realistic and intense, it's going to be incredibly difficult, other players in this game will make playing Dark Souls look like cake. Know that the difficulty only makes everything you do just that much more gratifying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028488055', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1469, 'last_played': 1442859854}
review:
Mortal Online es un juego hostil en todo los sentidos, por lo que si no tienes paciencia, tiempo y, sobre todo, dinero para pagar la suscripción, es muy probable que no te llegue a enganchar.

Pros:
-El concepto es brillante. Es el primer sandbox que veo tan completo. Un mundo en el que exploras, construyes, creas tu equipo, domesticas animales, cocinas...todo lo que puedas imaginar tiene cabida en Mortal Online.

-Absoluta libertad para hacer lo que quieras. Puedes ser un mercader si eso es lo que te motiva y recorrer el mundo con tu burro cargado de materias primas con las que comerciar. Estarías como una maldita cabra, pero podrías hacerlo.

-En cierto sentido es un survival, ya que si mueres pierdes tu equipo. Le da un toque muy interesante, aunque aumenta mucho la hostilidad, tanto del juego como de los jugadores.

-La banda sonora está muy bien.

Contras:
-Habilidades capadas para quienes no paguen suscripción. Esto afecta tanto a tus habilidades de combate como a las de crafteo. Está muy feo hacer algo así, ya que debería ser el mayor premio para quien decida meter horas en el juego siguiendo el modelo que le venga en gana, tanto si paga como si no. No apoyo para nada este modelo de negocio y creo que los adeptos de este juego, que lo hay y no son precisamente pocos, gastarían gustosament su dinero por skins y similares. No se puede abrir una brecha tan importante entre los propios jugadores.

-Es un juego tremendamente complejo. Si de verdad quieres inmersión, lo recomiendo, pero más vale que te unas a alguna guild, veas vídeos en Internet y consultes guías. Porque el juego requiere tiempo...y lo peor es que el tiempo que inviertes no tiene ninguna recompensa.

-Es absolutamente necesario que crees tu personaje dentro de unos parámetros exactos dependiendo de la raza que escojas. Algo que límita mucho la libertad que parece tener al no haber clases ni niveles. Nada más unirme a una guild me instaron a crearme un nuevo personaje, lo que puede ser una buena tocada de pelotas si ya has invertido unas horas en mejorar el que te has hecho felizmente siguiendo tus propios (y equivocados) instintos.

-Los gráficos son muy mejorables. Diría que me recuerdan a Oblivion, pero sólo en los vídeos. En el gameplay está más cerca de Morrowind.

Conclusión: al ser "free to play" no vas a perder nada por probarlo (bueno sí, tiempo). Creo que, por lo general y aunque particularmente no pueda colocarme en ninguno de los extremos, es de esos juegos que o lo amas o lo odias. Y si lo amas, puedes amarlo mucho. No es mi caso, aunque tampoco lo odio. Sencillamente considero que lo malo supera a lo bueno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153847337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1625, 'last_played': 1485709578}
review: This game is pretty bomb. And its a pretty one if you have anything approaching a classic gaming rig. It remids one of Oblivion, Achaea, and certainly Darklands, if you are old enough to know what that is. Sure the tutorial is weak, etc, etc. In an open, skill-driven world, multiplayer world it can be argued that this is an asset. If you have played similar games you will have no problem getting yourself sorted. Finish the initial tutorial to get a skill pack to suit the part of the game you are most curious about or you'll lose that opportunity for good. Your skills are capped in free mode, but there is plenty of room to master the basics. I chose a crafter skill pack and after one trash set of armor and goofing around for a few hours I went back and crafted decent entry level armor on my first try. Reading books to learn skills is VERY time consuming, so choose what to read carefully. There is even a "reading" skill. Just being able to use certain materials requires basic "lore" knowledge, so that would be a good start for crafting. A specific combat book on "avoiding knockdowns" will improve multiple skills and take forever to read, so stick with tiny gains in basic stuff so you can learn enough on your own to decide where to focus your reading time. I imagine this is a good plan for all similar games. Let me know if you have a better one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171446125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 245864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17194, 'last_played': 1706423791}
review: This game is one of the best First Person medieval combat games that I have ever played. The graphics are slightly old and not the best, but graphics don't make games bad. There are a few bugs here and there. But for the most part, this game is extremely fun. I recommend this game for hardcore MMO RPG gamers. You need to spend long hours on this game. If you are new to this game, I recommend talking to people in help chat a lot. You may need to look up a few things to understand it. The tutorial isn't the best but that's why there's help chat, full of experienced people. The game is all about PvP and PvE. There aren't any quests in this game. But there are some story lines and "quests" you can do. But the "quests" are just jobs you can do for money unlimited times. This game is made for gaming PCs. Not your school or work laptop. I don't recommend playing on those because you'll only get 10-20 FPS on lowest graphics and it's pretty much not playable then. Overall this game is entertaining, and you will love it, if you care to spend time with it. The reason it has so many bad reviews is because most of the players don't leave the first town; Tindrem. The Graveyard, where most new players go, is filled with other players who want money too. But it can sometimes turn into a huge PvP battlefield. Criminals and Murderers sometimes go in there for fun. It is extremely annoying to everyone there. So I recommend new players going on MortalOnlineMap.info and using the map to go to Fabernum. It is less populated and has an easier way to get money. It also has the better side of Mortal Online's graphics. It's way smaller and not horrible. Tindrem is full of trolls, thieves, and murderers. So leave. Go through the front gates and just RUN. DO NOT. AND I REPEAT. DO NOT LOOK BACK. 8/10 very good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171838878', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1481492968}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980003478', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 126011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98446, 'last_played': 1559386202}
review: Best in class for hardcore realism of loot and criminal guard systems. When you die in mortal you drop all your loot. All equipment has durability and is not repairable. Weapons lose damage after around 50 percent. Different portions of the body have defense separated into head left arm right arm torso legs shoulders and feet. Many races combined together under certain clades. Buildable houses/palisades/keeps with placable npc vendors brokers/auctionhouses stables with breedable pets as well. This game has progressively advanced for the better as of my recent playtime. It was hindered by lack of development in the past before I played and the start of my playtime but that past is now gone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039510129', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3583, 'last_played': 1583270667}
review:
This game has some nice mechanics, but the community in it most of the time is just unbearably hostile. If they didn't have their heads so far up each others butts, more players would probably be playing this despite the obvious issues still within the game that haven't been updated or fixed over the years. (Lag, poor performance, graphics needing updating, Combat animations are basic, etc)

If you ignore the large majority of the community who are just nothing but hostile you might find one or two decent people who will help you get use to the mechanics and maybe even get you started up. Be warned though, most of the people will just troll or kill you even when asking about simple things.

There are a few things that I do like in this though, namely the breeding animal system and the crafting of armor/weapons/buildings. They take a long time to figure out good combinations and to get better in the area you wish to be great in. I do however wish the resistance types for armor would be shown different instead of some bars that don't give much detailing at all as to what is good or bad.

review: классные картинки на загрузке, очень красивая музыка большой размер игры. сама игра конечно не сахар. графика на уровне моровинда. играть конечно в неё не стану. думаю что нужно иметь яйца в бетоне. и терпения как у дятла. это моё мнение! могу сказать что в далёком 2000 году ради этой игры, ну очень рад бы был. не крафтом единым жив игроман! но на калякать можно много. можеть не всё так шикарно как мне паказалось.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025127174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 88771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12675, 'last_played': 1643642031}
review: Игра отличная, особенно понравится фанатам ультимы и дарк соулс .  Графа на на низком уровне, но фишка игры не в графе, а менно в самом игровом процессе . Очень плохо, что если ты пишешь в хелп чате транслитом по русски то тебя банят, за то что ты пишешь не на английском, полная дискриминация русских, отсутсвует какое либо русское комьюнити, то есть если ты понимаешь английский язык то ты сможешь освоить эту игру иначе уйдешь из нее так и не поняв всех тонкостей из за отсутствия какой либо поддержки русско язычного сообщества это единственный минус очень хорошей игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036991397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 96482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38819, 'last_played': 1571127492}
review:
4 Year Old Vet here.
Just want to say, this game has improved so much over the years, it used to be clunky unoptomized with bugs out the ass, but it keeps getting better w/ each year, Star vault has really stepped up there game, def worth a look if this sort of niche genre is for you.

Recently had a full texture overhaul for player characters, and world textures.


Pros:
Massive open world
Huge map
Player Driven econemy
True Sandbox
Full Loot PvP
Extensive Crafting systems more indepth then you have likely ever seen in another MMO
Consistantly updated every few months, big content patches a few times a year
ever expanding immersive world, full of lore.
No hand holding, when they say "hardcore sandbox MMO' they mean it.
Politically Driven


Cons:
Incredibly Steep learning curve.
Huge timesink ( You will often find your self loseing 6 hours completing tasks you had set for yourself for the day.)
Unforgiving community (its hard to find the good guys in a land of cutthroats and griefers)
Still some minor bugs, but they mostly smoothed everything out in comparrison to the old days.
Not solo player friendly, expect to do a lot of networking.



In short, if your looking for a casual game this is not for you, if you are looking for an immersive hardcore rewarding gaming experience then check it out.
