author: {'steamid': '76561197972779575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1470768019}
review:
[h1]Open PVP, Full Loot, Welcome To The Salty Spitoon. How Tough Are Ya?[/h1]


UPDATE: For some reason it says I only have 0.3 hours. This is a big lie, I've played for quite some hours! It's probably a bug in some form.


Not going to use too much time with this review. You got skills that increase on use (or study, depending, but usually can be raised by both), you can get a certain amount of skills maxed, or mix it up how you wish. In this game, it's open PVP with a couple "safe" towns, full loot apart from very certain starter weapons (I think the worn shortsword's about the only weapon that doesn't drop on death, because it's that bad of a weapon). You will die, at least once, so don't be surprised when you do. Dying really isn't that bad, you lose stuff, but you still have your skills intact and you're not permanently dead, so don't get too attached to your items/mounts. Just as you can die, others can too, so there's opportunity at others expense, which is pretty much the name of the game.




Mortal Online gets a bad rap, and that's because bad things CAN happen to you, and some people don't really get that, or take it well. Losing stuff really isn't that bad, you can bank most of it, and it gives you enemies to make, maybe even friends. For those who are looking for something different and refreshing compared to the MMOs that feel like there's no consequences for anything, Mortal Online provides a great experience for those who like danger, character skills AND player skills, as all are combined that make this game what it is. Take some of the negative reviews with a grain of salt, it's very common to write a negative review when angry about something that just happened in-game, far more common than writing a positive review. Just try the game and decide for yourself, but be ready to win big, or lose it all when you roll the dice; It's a big thrill!




P.S: Your skills are capped at 60 if you are free to play and you can't use thievery skills. To get the skill cap of 100 and thief skills, you need a premium subscription. You also only get one character slot unless you purchase more. So I wouldn't really count this as a good "free to play" MMO, but it's a GREAT subscription MMO with unlimited trial!

author: {'steamid': '76561198186903630', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6770, 'last_played': 1594092216}
review:
Where to begin? Mortal online, as I'm sure many reviews will point out, is not for the faint of heart. You will die. More than you intend to, but rather than analyze the gameplay I am going to tell you my experience, because that is what MO is all about. (summary at bottom)

Day 1: Wow this game is beautiful *cue dramatic opera music* the blume is perfectly balanced to add effect but not obscure the marvelous garden before me complete with a variety of trees, flowers, and an aqueduct. The person that convinced me to play eagerly awaits my arrival, and laughs when I ask about quests. There is only one quest in the game and that is the tutorial, it teaches you the absolute survival basics and nothing more, but you get a lot of free stuff at the end so that's pretty cool (some of it actually saves you a LOT of gold).

Day 3: This crafting is amazing. No other word for it. The depth and variety of recipes you can try be it cooking, alchemy, armor or weapon crafting, simply dumbfounded me. 100h in I can barely craft any useful armor. At this point some will say "ugh 100 hours to get almost nowhere?" and stop reading, but don't. Because what I will tell you is that due to the depth of crafting, infinite possibilities, and unique difficulty of getting useful materials, every piece feels hand forged as though it is a part of me.

Day 5: My first encounter with a red. I just bought my first horse, it is a magnificent purebread desert horse, agile with high stamina. I tab out to check the map while riding my horse at half speed. Before I can tab back I am on the ground, my mount is dead and my friend is running for his life. Utter chaos. A large man on a horse the size of a car mows him down, I am desperately dodging his moves but to no avail, I die on the spot and he loots my corpse... Peasants unite! I, while hopelessly rummaging through my bank wondering how to make up my gold hear that a group of random players went out, fought and carted him to death, and that someone got my gold. They promptly returned every single piece without so much as asking for a thank you.

Day 7: Things are going pretty well, I can consistently gather materials safely and outrun most threats on my new horse. Enter someone I now consider a very close friend. We joke about rope dresses and whatever other manner of fucked up things in the help chat. You'd be amazed at how much you can come to like someone spending 40h with them in 3 days lol. I couldn't help but trust them because well... they got my jokes and seemed like a really chill person. Come to find out a bit later that this person is slow to trust and I think I'm crazy because they trusted me pretty quick. Point I'm making is, no MO does not always have the best community (I personally know how bi-polar help chat can be as I am a frequent user), but among the common rabble there are real people, with real feelings, that can actually be pretty nice. Look for the diamonds in the rough, not the sticks in the mud.

I drowned because my horse threw me into a river while I was wearing heavy armor. I have been pk'd twice (which some would call lucky). The armor I make could barely suffice for PvP. But you know what? I love this game. And it is not F2P it is unilimited trial, I should make that very clear. A lot of people say "skill caps are 60/100 for free players" but might I point out ALL players are limited to 1100 primary skill points. I am still free, and ya know what? I don't mind, if anything for the time being it allows me to have a wider variety of skills than a paying player. Do I plan on subbing? yes. I do. Do you necessarily have to? no. But that's all I have to say, decide for yourself :) and if you want free stuff from time to time, feel free to add me on steam and message me when you're on MO, I can spare some better than average gear. (This message was approved by 5 other people I was on skype with at the time of writing)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993486732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3333, 'last_played': 1498628167}
review:
Although this game gets some negative reviews, its actually a pretty good game.  Its immersive, complex, and its hard.  If you want hand holding and a quest line to drive you through the game this really isnt the game for you.  If you like more of a complex sandbox style with risk and danger, this may fit you.  It has a very complex crafting system.  The free to play option is very extensive, and you could play as a free to play player forever if you dont really care about being the best.. that said its worth the sub and you can max out your skills this way. 

When I first started there were some server issues but they have been all fixed it appears(its happenned in any mmo I have played over the years at one time or another).  More people should be really giving this game a shot.  If you try it out make sure to get yourself in a guild as soon as possible.  That will help make the difference for you as it can be a bit hard on your own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069328739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12743, 'last_played': 1471914978}
review: As I now have 200+ hours in the game I thought it would be time to write a review as there seems to be a lot of negativity towards the game. As I've been playing I have noticed a lot of people spouting nonsense about how its such a crap game because you need to sub to be the "best" while this is true and for good reason as nobody would sub if you could do all the end game stuff as f2p; you can pretty much do everything as f2p which is meant to get a feel for the game and try lots of different proffesions out. Having the end game content being locked by a subscription doesnt make a game bad, in fact i find this game quite inexpensive compared to most. Somebody also said theivery is locked by sub...it is for good reason, if every f2p character that joined was pickpocketing each other it wouldnt be very enjoyable and the vets dont use theivery at all as most people worth stealing from know how to keep their stuff from being stolen. ;) While the game is "hardcore" with dropping loot upon death and the ability to kill somebody anywhere anytime there are plenty of people in a helpchat that allow new players to get the info they need and plenty of guilds thatd love to take new people under their wing. I give the game an 8/10 overall for what it is. I suggest anybody thats reading this ignore the bad reviews and take a day to sit down and try the game out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043069277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1991, 'last_played': 1469492630}
review: A real man's MMO (Politically incorrect but it's fitting) There's going to be a time in your fututre when you tell your grandkids "Back in my day when we played video games, when you died you had to start all over from the begining". This is one of those games.  I read a lot of the negative reviews and it was mostly complaints about the game being too hard and unfair or the fact that you had to pay to play.  Well that just made up my mind to download it and give it a try and I was not disappointed.  This game will bring you back to the time of Ultima Online and Asherons Call, where playing MMO's on a PVP server took Skill, a level head a backbone to survive.  Download this game, tell your friends and happy hunting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089835770', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 100677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85697, 'last_played': 1682312671}
review:
**UPDATE** 2/13/2019:
The Mortal Online devs have stated that they are making a sequel , Mortal Online 2 , but will continue to work on MO1 until everyone is accustomed to the sequel (more info to come).

ORIGINAL REVIEW:

Mortal Online is possibly the greatest mmo of all time due to many reasons: 

• Directional based combat - swing left , right and middle to attack from all angles , do the same for blocking to create a simple yet intense combat system - in first person perspective for immersion.

• Full loot open world pvp game with 2 continents and loads of real players , monsters, and peaceful / aggressive animals alike spread across 3 different biomes .

• unique character creation class with 6+ races that takes age and lineage into account complete with attribute and skill trees to fill out (there are no item or character levels , just a pool of 1100 skill points and a huge list of skills to choose from - you make a character that's UNIQUE TO YOU !). 

•Three types of magic schools (more on the way) ; ecumenical - of this as elemental magic, fireballs , lightning strikes , healing and anti-healing magic in this branch . Spiritism - become a ghost and trap other spirits (ai and human) using them as reagents for your spells , and shoot laser beams from your frickin' hand ! Necromancy - the most new and most interesting by far , raise the undead and have them fight for you , summon a ritual abomination that can be customized depending on the dead carcass you use to create it and it can be leveled up to evolve it's attacks, summon a ghostly Shade to be a back up mage for you as well ... on top of all these creatures you can perform over 12 unique necromancer spells invlolving blood and dark magics!! Become a wizard harry !

- New patch added custom house building, over 4 different styles of architecture to choose from and the textures of your house will change depending on  the materials you use to build your house!

• Explore ruins , caves hidden underneath waterfalls , massive rope bridges above hundreds of feet of jungle , Asian-inspired cities built into the side of a mountain, and large capitol cities (one nestled into the grassy steppes , another in the wide-open insect infested desert) . Over  30 different cities , towns, hamlets and ancient wonders to visit spread across 2 different continents 

•A height/weight system that can be altered after character creation , which affect damage bonus , health pool and more .

• Ai guards protect innocent "blue" towns and the blue players within , but don't let that fool you , guards can be killed , they are not everywhere all the time and you CAN BE hurt , thieved from, and murdered anywhere in the world of Nave ! Be careful !

• Unique armor and weapon system that allows you to customize your character ANY WAY you want with mix and match armor (hair and tatoos are limited) 

• Dungeons filled with special bosses that drop legendary loot and chests filled with random and static loot , some of it very valuable making treasure hunting a real career ! 

•A large taming system allows you to tame, train and use over 4 dozen unique monsters at your disposal if you choose to be a tamer (to fight for you or to sell) . These animals /  creatures grow in size as you train / take care of them , they also adapt new attacks and some even evolve into stronger beasts !

•Mount system WITH breeding : ride horses , donkeys , mules, camels, lizard horses (lyks) , and Molva beasts (bull rhinos), with a one of a kind breeding system built into the game you will be trying to find the perfect looking mount for you and your friends to explore the dangerous world with ! 

•skill based combat system ensures that you will have an intense , first person experience in EVERY battle , wether it be fighting an AI skeleton or a player controlled Murderer . 

•create a modular house anywhere and customize the look of it using different materials , also create furniture and furnish your house !

• largely complex crafting system - craft weapons , bows , shields , armor (12 + different styles of armor and over 50 types of materials/metals to use for all crafting !)

• Meteorite drop system - watch a cosmic star fall from the skies as it actually tears through the atmosphere of Nave and crash lands randomly , leaving a defening sound which can be heard for miles .. after the meteor cools down you can mine it for precious (very valuable !) metals that normally must be refined by an experienced player controlled metal refiner 

• relic / relic weapon drop - Similar to the meteors , these relics are statues that can be placed at guild reliquaries to provide passive bonuses such as leveling pets much faster , also sometimes a temporary (sometimes not temporary) "relic weapon" drops , imbued with godly powers , it makes anyone who wields it powerful beyond imagination .

• player versus world : lots of creatures to farm for all sorts of materials , which can be simply sold, or traddd to crafters to make armor , weapons , shields and bows (soon to be houses , right now houses are created but won't change HP, color or texture with different materials)

• Raiding system : BE A VIKING ! With the newly added Ramps you too can raid like a Viking ! Free placement ramps can be built for a way into enemy palisades - be ware this is in its infancy stages

• Sieging system : build Battering rams , Manganons , fire arrows , and even trebuchets to destroy enemy fortifications , walls , palisades , really anything that you want to destroy that your neighbor has made ( NOTE : sieging is NOT EASY OR QUICK).

• one of a kind thievery system allows you to pickpocket from others and pick chests ! Be that professional thief / con artist you always wanted to be ! Complete with fall damage , the games physics make it a thieves playground , doing special jumps to get into rooftops and high ground the thief finds hidden treasure chests (some right under the average citizens nose !) and sometimes perfect opportunities to assassinate .

• open world and open ended battles mean you can be fighting one person outside of the capitol city of Tindrem one minute - and then be attacked by two lance wielding horse riders the next - the choice is yours ... and theirs .

• free to play with an optional (but preferred) subscription - unlimited free trial means you can play the game up to 60% power of all players who subscribe each month , this does not mean pay to win obviously, as you cannot buy anything that gives you an advantage , but it does mean as a free trial user you aren't expected to be able to be a master at anything .


This game has SO MUCH TO IT and all of this on 8 years , and one massive server , but yet the world still hasn't caught onto the greatness that is Mortal ONline , most likely due to its rough start (the game was very unbalanced and broken up until about a year ago when the devs furiously started bug fixing and balancing) but now the game is greatly improved and the devs are releasing patch after patch to revitalize it .

Play Mortal Online free today ! It's only getting better , and it needs more newbies like you , reader !

author: {'steamid': '76561198239307134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1467886421}
review:
I've been coming back to this game every few years here and there to see if there is ever going to be any actual improvements, and so far from what I've seen theres been only a few. As far as optimzation goes, this game has always had issues for anyone with a basic or low end PC. However before the few latest updates that where supposed to help, they seemed to have made things worse. On my basic PC that I somehow, at the lowest settings, manged to get it to run the game... until I got done making my character... again. I used to be able to play just fine on this PC without even latency issues but it seems as if with the latest updates they are more focused on giving the few players who can play something to do rather then optimize their game for the majority of players who cannot afford a high end machine to run this game.

Any time I do manage to play however I do enjoy the content to its fullest, its just a shame that they don't do more to optamize more. I'm not saying they don't try, because there is more settings to lower the quality of everything to a lower setting then there was some 3 years ago but it still doesnt do much to help the game.

Honestly I would recommend this game to anyone who has a real quality machine that can run it, if you manage to live through the grind and find a great guild to play the game with its wonderful fun. The landscapes on the higher settings are beautiful for their age and you can only wonder how a game like this can ever be so peaceful... then you get your head cut off by some guy who can run faster then your horse... its happened. a lot. 

but I'd give this game a solid 7/10 overall, even if it has some issues. It has the potential to be a great game! it's just not quite there yet though, and I can only hope that the Dev team on this will make this game as great for everyone as it has been for me throughout the years. 

Ps. THE SOUNDTRACK FOR THIS GAME IS A MASTERPIECE!!!!!!!!

Pss. this one is for the devs, please optamize the game farther, I know you guys are busy trying to make sure the servers continue to stay up but if you can optamize then I could only imagine the kind of positve feedback this game could get!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048282197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1467347074}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067973340', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 122953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118691, 'last_played': 1585539974}
review:
Played mortal on and off since 2013, lots of bugs, very small population because everybody is leaving, lots of duped items which ruin the economy, hackers and exploiters dont get banned because of how low the population is and they need the money from every subscription.

If you don't subscribe and try to pvp/pvm or do anything while free to play its impossible it should more or less be called a indefinite trial. aka: you have to be subscribed to play the game properly. 

Simple content is still unfinished from the start of the game, GameMasters dont help you and are corrupt, unfinished content is being added which can be abused and isnt fixed for months.

You can only have 4 characters per 1 account and you need to have 3-4 accounts to do most rolls e.g. Weaponsmith, armoursmith, bowcrafter and alchemist all on one account.
Mountedcombat, mountedarcher, mountedmage and slaghaller all on one account.
Footfighter, hybridfighter, dexmage and engineer all on one account.
Extractor, necromancermage, dominatormage and tamer all on one account.
You only get one free character slot per account, to unlock the other 3 its $10usd per slot so you're looking at $120usd once you unlock the other character slots you need, then you'll be paying a subscription fee of $13usd per month per account = $52usd per month.

You will die to bugs and other mechanics where you shouldn't die, ai run through walls and teleport under the floor so you cant see or attack them, the server crashes many times each week, you will lose all your items and not recieve any compensation, if the servers are down for a week straight and nobody can login you wont get any compensation.

A few months back everybodys details and payment details were breached.

This game isnt worth the money or time and is slowly dying.

Dont waste your time or money on a terrible game like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004684585', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10382, 'last_played': 1471481290}
review:
MMORPG Sandbox de estilo unico, boa mecanica de combate, um otimo sistema de craft e de Skill.
O Jogo não tem level de personagem base, porém tem level daquilo que vc mais usa em jogo, fazendo um dia seu char ser um mago no outro um guerreiro, isso se vc quiser.
Por ser Full loot o jogo sempre te deixa com uma tensão a mais, e é muito bom para jogar com amigos e fazer umas Wars na entrada da cidade ou em qualuer lugar do mapa,


O game também tem seus defeitos como bugs, ping alto, custo ao mês alto para o brasil e seu free to play é um trial. 
Se vc gosta de Skyrim pelo seu estilo de primeira pessoa, esse é um MMO que voce DEVE JOGAR!.

Mesmo com seus defeitos eu recomendo, pois está sempre tendo conteúdo novo da desenvolvedora.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163523941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1351, 'last_played': 1467243768}
review: This game ins't worth playing unless you have money to burn. Don't think it's fair to have to pay 15$ a month to be a stronger player and 9$ per extra character. You would think paying would be for guilds, or for convenience, or cool outfits or extra coins in game but not to deliberately tell you that you will never be as good as a ptp person no matter how long you play. That's 40 SKILL points more for every skill, not worth spending the money. That adds up, 60$ every 6 months, 120$ every year, ect. I'd rather play Dark Souls than this unforgiving world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100382324', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1467172384}
review:
To be completely honest, I think this game is okay, its a start but I think it need smore work on it. Starting the game was okay with the character creator, but I think that if they can put some more work into it and try and make things smoother and more understandable I think it would turn out pretty good.

I had no idea what i was doing and there is a lot of reading. If they can add voices for the NPC's I think it would  make it easier on the player. Overall out of 10 I would give this game a 6/10. Its a start but I would recommend people wait till thehy have developed the game more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112171849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1466981389}
review:
Yeah I know I didn't play long, but literally after 15 min I already was forcing myself to play and see where it was going to no avail. Even the magic i learned felt dull. It is a great concept that could have been amazing and might get better at high levels, but I do not enjoy the early game nearly enough to get there. Plus, the very first enemy I ran into killed me in two hits while i was trying to wait for my magic to finish proc-ing. I literally had no chance against the first npc enemy...like none at all.

The game is slow, feels empty most of the time, has a pretty small playerbase (seemingly), half the people are naked...like 100% naked with nothing censored (thankfully you can turn it off but still...), the combat feels like you are moving through molasses (same with movments like walking). Graphics are subpar. The music is nice.....except when it repeats continuously between the same two songs.

To sum up, slow, boring, and naked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117094221', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 15599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12947, 'last_played': 1614803109}
review:
Kesinlikle MMORPG ve RP severlerin denemesi gereken bir oyun. Oyunda devasa bir harita mevcut sırf bir şehirden diğerine gitmek 1 saatinizi alabiliyor ki bu haritanın çok küçük bir bölgesi. Oyunda istediğimiz alanda istediğimiz meslekte kendimizi geliştirebiliyoruz ticaret yapabiliyoruz dilersek savaşa biliyoruz şehirleri elegeçirebiliyor veya koruyabiliyoruz. Oyunda  Hayvan eğitebiliyoruz onlarca hatta yüzlerce hayvan çeşiti var bunlara zırh veya çanta takabiliyoruz. Zırh veya silah üreticisi olup ticaret yapabiliyoruz. Kesinlikle eşi benzeri olmayan bir oyun. Ek olarak türk olan ve oyunu oynayan arkadaşlarımızı aramıza bekleriz türk grubu kurmayı amaçlıyoruz oyunda türk oyuncu biraz olmasından dolayı böyle birşeye yöneldik.

11 Haziran 2017 oyunu oynamaya devam etmekteyim beraber oynamak isteyenler iletişime geçebilirler. :)

27.Mayıs 2018 Oyunu oynamaya hala devam ediyorum beraber oynamak isteyekler iletişime geçebilirler. :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198149365849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1466173810}
review:
The game is great and all, It has full loot on death and stuff but the game management is terrible. 
They allow players to build walls to lock out whole NPC towns, making them of their own with gates so only their guild can enter.
They build gates in the access routes to towns and no one can go in or out. Playerbase is low, plus, The game is mostly a Free to try without limit. You cannot get past 60 skill points (the cap being 100 for subbed players) If you play as a free player.
The sub costs about 15 dollars a month.
There's a "class" (if we can call thieving a class) exclusive to sub players :V
To me, the biggest issue is that if you don't sub to the game you are pretty much screwed as high level skills (such as crafting useful armor, taming strong pets/mounts, crafting good weapons) are locked behind a pay wall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064156525', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1466226274}
review:
Interesting game, I can't really say I like it much since the gameplay seems stale and beginning missions are tedious as hell.
I feel like it moves too slowly, takes ages to do anything is what I mean by that.

But this is how my beginning went:
Takes 15 minutes to make character with no explaination of any stats
Spawns in game
Fixes resolution
Mouse wont go away and cant look around
2 minutes later game gives tip saying 'z' turns it off
Goes to do Pig quest
Better player talks to me and asks if I need food
Proceeds to give me poisonus mushrooms and tells me to eat them
I eat one to make it look like I fall for it
I vomit everywhere
Guy is disapointed I didnt die from it
Takes 9 minutes to figure out how to get hide from pig bodies.
Walks for another 3 minutes and figures out doesn't have enough
Quits game

So yeah, interesting but again, very tedious so I guess I'll give it a downvote since I feel like it isn't very fair to new players. Maybe I'll change it in the future but definatly not the most enjoyable game for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177900314', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 232545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37224, 'last_played': 1627651360}
review: This game is underrated and everyone leaves because it is hard to start. Try it out with a few friends and join a guild or do something like that and you will see how easy everything gets. This is the best game on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285902423', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 78296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8858, 'last_played': 1616445897}
review:
Yeah everyone will try to brutally murder you but this game has a certain feel to it that I've never been able to get from any other game. The fact that I've quit several times since 2011 and yet come back to it non stop is what proves to me that this game is great! 

Few tips before you try it for the first time, don't expect it to be a free to play its more of an unlimited free trial and being free to play will have its draw backs such as having your armor weights limited, and for those of you who like to tame things the level your pets will be able to level to, but by no means will it make it impossible for you to kill a pay to play player or make money. Second tip, as soon as you can, get the fuck out of Tindrem (the capital) because it's really not the best place to learn the game, look for a guild that meets your game style and you'll have a great time. Finally don't ever carry anything on you that you are not prepared to loose as this is a full loot pvp, even inside the cities.

Also take a look on the official forums, the community can be very helpful and there's plenty of info on there that could be helpful to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019262689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1466076927}

author: {'steamid': '76561198091544409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2699, 'last_played': 1495999946}
review:
This game has an amazing concept to it with decent graphics. But the main reason I am writing this review is because it has many many game issues. For example I made a character then it wouldn't even load into the game, so I had to choose another map for amature player only. 

Then I re-installed everything with my updated video card, then it made things worse by not even letting me in the game. I don't know if I am doing anything wrong, I reccomend for the devs to see what the problem is becuse I know I am not the only one with this problem. 

Edit June 26th 2016 : So this game is still very horrible. The horrible lag spikes and the framrate issues, also with a combination of crashes too. This game does not earn a payed subscription option, speaking of that. To play the rest of the game, you have to pay to play. Half of the game is not letting yo play unless you pay to play. 

Then there is also the GM's, they abuse their power to BAN players who do not comply with there warnings. This game doesn't belong in steam, It's a broken game that many people  are paying for. Don't give these people your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057997914', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1465918514}
review: So i was playing a couple years ago. It was pretty nice back then. I stopped cuz i was f2p and wearing heavy armor i literally wasnt moving at all. Now i downloaded it one more time to check how much the defs improved the game. Sadly they didnt at all... Combat is still clunky as fuck, graphics still suck ass, and its still pretty much not playable for f2p players. They shouldnt put it up as "free to play". As an f2p you have no chances in pvp with a p2p. "IF YOU HAVE SKILL AND LUCK YOU CAN WIN AGAINST P2P"... Yeah sure. If you block everything and somehow menage to get him low hp, he will run away to heal. And you? You wont, cuz he is p2p, and he runs alot faster than you, and has alot more hp/ other stats. Basiclly i rate this game 2/10. It would be awesome if the right people would take care of it. Now 5 years, and its still how it was. Its a big NO from me, i do not recommend downloading! Wasting time.
developer_response:
Ya we don't call it a F2P game steam puts us in that category since we charge nothing for the client.
We knew this so in the store we wrote the following:

"Unlimited free trial!
Mortal Online offers a free-to-play mode with a skill cap at skill level 60. In order to unlock the maximum skill levels and fully master your Mortal destiny, a paid monthly subscription is needed, but unlike many other games there are no microtransactions. Unsubscribing will re-apply the skill cap, but your skills will be maxed again when you re-subscribe. Every player gets one free character slot, and you can purchase additional slots up to a maximum of four."

Trying to clarify it but ya I do understand if folks don't read that far down.
Sad you didn't give it more time, tons of stuff has changed in the last years.

Take care!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053653124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1464479954}
review:
***I played this game prior to it's launch on STEAM. I have over 50 hours into this game on my account, and only a short ammount of time on my STEAM account***

Mortal Online has A LOT of potential, that being said, it's also hindered by some strange features, aspects, and requirements. Mortal Online is a sandbox, survival, mmo, that let's you do, just about, whatever you want. You can be a merchant, a hunter, a crafter, a warrior/knight, a carpenter (builder), a tamer (horses and such), the possibilities are nearly endless! The graphics look good, but this game requires the best of computers to play efficiently. Also, it is VERY realistic, but sadly, that can be a downfall sometimes. This game has no casual elements, and requires A LOT of time and investment. 

Pro's:
Very Rewarding
VERY Realistic
Unique Setting for an MMO
So much to do!

Con's:
-Performance is not optimized and requires a top end machine to play on even the lowest settings. 
-Very difficult (not normally a Con, but in this case, it takes SEVERAL hours, just to prepare to journey out, then, it takes SEVERAL hours to make it anywhere, and there is a very high possibility that you'll die on the way, losing all of the things you gathered before leaving..resetting your progress. It is VERY possible for someone to be fully armored, and have a full load out of weapons and tools and materials and foods, only to be killed, and lose it all, and suddenly, you're starting all over..
-REALLY spotty community, in MORTAL Online, you can be killed by any player, anywhere, and any time. This is somewhat prevented by guards and bounties, but even still, the players seem hell bent on ruining the experience for new players at times. You'll be pick pocketed in towns, you'll likely be murdered in towns, you're almost guarenteed to be murdered by players met out in the world, and there is little to no way to avoid it..
-Strange controls and commands..Some things (like taming) require some VERY strange commands, like running around for 30 minutes attempting to pet a hopping bunny with your hands, in order to tame it. It's not very noob friendly, and there is a tutorial, but the tutorial leaves a lot out..

For now, I wouldn't recommend this game, however, I am intrigued by what it COULD offer, so I always come back and check up on it, and if it changes, I'll gladly update my review!

review: First of all, the game 'studders'.   I crashed multiple times.  I know it's supposed to be 'streaming' but when you get booted to log in, that's a crash.  The graphics leave a LOT to be desired. Looks like a bad 80's cartoon.   The responses to trying to harvest are not clear.  There is a help channel but the 'helpers' are not interested in helping and did not answer questions from newbies.  Even 'I don't know' would be an answer but they couldn't even bother with that much.  Everything requires a different 'skill' and there are far too many skills.  You are very limited with free to play, but this game is NOT worth a subscription.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987007303', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4205, 'last_played': 1464777420}
review:
This game is a good way to waste time. You might enjoy playing it for awhile but there's not much to do. Most of the gameplay is horribly designed. A lot of the textures look like they just paid for stock images. The combat is very clunky and attack telegraphing is ridiculously bad. Bugs bugs bugs everywhere, including hair textures that still, after 6 years, haven't been fixed. Movement is so slow that it's more fun to run around when you're dead. I'm not joking, when you're dead it's so much easier to move around that being alive feels like wading through quicksand in comparison. Generally speaking, this game is a chore and it's even worse if you play solo. If you decide to play, I highly suggest you join a guild so you actually have a community to interact with outside of the temporary help chat. This game is very much a sandbox when it comes to the question of 'wtf do I do'. Guilds help a lot with giving you a clear goal and providing a motivation for pvping.

   To be fair, the main draw is the pvp. I haven't voluntarily participated in that much yet...by which I mean I've just been randomly murdered a bunch. Oh, by the by, there is no real penalty for murder until you've reached the lvl of a serial killer which to me makes no sense whatsoever, but hey, I'm sure the murderers enjoy it. If you want to seriously get into pvp, I highly recommend a guild. In fact guilds are one of the game's few saving graces, though there are plenty of bugs and other problems going on in that respect too. Outside of pvp however, there's the crafting.

   The crafting system is passable and has some interesting aspects to it with how materials affect the appearance and stats of crafted items. However, you have to dedicate a character to crafting for it to really be worth your time. You CAN make a hybrid sure, but, because this game DOES have traditional lvling in the sense that the more you do what you do the higher your stats go, up to a cap, you will be gimped compared to a min/maxing player.

   Stats are very important. Do not let people tell you that it's skill based and your stats don\'t matter. Stat differences determine your health, stamina, and mana as well as your movement speed, attack speed, damage, combat move speed, move speed while using armor, swimming speed, mount speed, etc etc. See a trend? Your skill as a player is limited by what your character is actually capable of. AKA it doesn't matter how good the player is when your character moves like a slug in comparison and does a fraction of the damage.

   Ultimately it's your equipment that's most important in determining how much damage you actually do, but you CAN win with skill using crappier gear if your stats are comparible. Blocking/parrying is important but your gear and stats also affect how well you can do those too, so they won't save you against a character with better gear and stats. Damage potential is not nearly as important as movement ability. If your movement speed was determined soley by gear instead of stats maybe combat could be properly balanced, as of right now though, whoever's stats are higher and has better gear is usually going to win over skill. In that respect, this game is very much an RPG. There's nothing wrong with games that put character skill over player skill. The problem is that this game is not presented that way so you go in expecting something very different from what you actually get.

   All this talk of stats brings up one of this game's main issues.  MO is guilty of one of the problems F2P games are most criticized for. It is P2W. You could argue that the free to play option is actually just a trial, but that doesn't change that there is a 40% stat difference between a free and subbed player. This game is not listed as a demo on steam, it is listed as a free to play game. Unless that suddenly changes, to say it's just a 'trial' version is a fallacy. It's true that the game is free of the cash shop aspect, techinically. Instead, players receive special items and perks if they donate enough. Sounds a little sketchy right?

TL;DR
   Basically, this a fun game to dick around in if you like exploring and hardcore rping pvp, but in the long run it's not worth your time. If you join up with a guild you could definitely spend hundreds of hours pvping, rping, and exploring, but it can feel more like a job than fun times with friends. I do not recommend this game for the average gamer. It is for hardcore pvp players only. I don't mean that as a compliment. I mean that only hardcore players will be wiling to put up with all the game's crushing flaws out of desperation to find a game that provides an immersive sandbox rp/pvp environment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275598789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 227052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57407, 'last_played': 1643049897}
review:
This is going to be long so get comfy,

This game is the best game that ive ever played in my life, and im not joking.
Before i discovered mortal online, I was searcheing for an open World, free to play midevil time based game, I had no luck for about 3months of searching. then my friend told me about mortal online. I instantly fell i n love with it. Its everything I was looking for. Open world Massivley Multiplayer open World Full loot PvP and etc. You can pratiucally do whatever you wan't in the game. When I tell people about mortal I normally tell them "It's like Skyrim, but 10more content, no quests and WAY more fun, oh... and all multilplayer." You can do so much in this game and its really astonishing. But the fact that it came out in 2010 doesnt phase me, it just makes me sad that until not, the community is just stating to grow, and getting more recognishion. I feel like this game has so much potential that it will become the "best selling game of 2016". And im not joking. I love this game so much that I used to play about 6hrs every day, and me being me, not wanting to pay a dime, created not one, not two, but three Free-2-Play accounts, and for those of you that dont understand what a big deal that is, well, you can only log into one F2P account a day. But since I have 3computers its fine. If I were a new player looking for some information on how to get started in game, i'd say making a footfighter/mage first or a hybrid. That is definately the most fun way to play as a F2P. Now back to the praising, If your descision on buying a game is based on reading reviews, then get this, If you look at the reviews that have been written, just notice, just notice the amount of time they have played the game, almost everyone that has written a review on this game has probably played over 300 hrs! And if you look at the ones that are positive to be exact, some (like me) Has played over 1000hrs!!! Now why would someone play a game that sucks for 1000hrs ?? Ask yourself that question. 
THIS GAME IS A MUST DOWNLOAD!

My IGN's so far are:
XYT
Ultric
Gatorade

author: {'steamid': '76561197971637384', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 47123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24130, 'last_played': 1561303953}
review:
Mortal Online is close to everything I want in a game. You can progress in anyway you want to gain fortune and fame, from fishing, to crafting, cooking or becoming a PVP monster or PVE God for soloing a Ratzar Queen.

You level your character's skills in a classless way that determines how you want to play rather than simply getting stronger through grinding. This allows PVE and PVP to be geared towards skill and grouping with others to achieve success.

This game is first person only but it works to its advantage, to bring a game that's more immersive than any other MMORPG since Ultimate Online.

The community is small but this works to its advantage because everyone is in the same world, on the same server and your actions WILL be remembered by other players. If you start pickpocketing, players will remember your name and try to avoid you in the future. This also means interactions are more personal and political alliances in this game actually make an impact in the way you play, down to what towns you should avoid and who you feel you can trust to talk to.

This game has managed to implement concepts (player-created items only and a balanced player-driven marketplace for example) and take them to a level that other MMORPGs can only dream of achieving. This is impressive since the development team are only 3-4 man strong.

If you're a fan of Ultima Online, Runescape or other hardcore MMORPGs for their full loot-drop and criminal systems then Mortal Online is the king of them at the moment. Only time will tell if other games on the horizon will knock MO off its pedestal, such as Life is Feudal, Gloria Victis or Chronicles of Elyria.

The game isn't without its flaws though. The dev team is small so major improvements take a long time. There are bugs and exploits that you will discover once you really get into the game. Fortunately they're not quite enough to stop me from playing.

My biggest bugbears with the game at the moment are:

* Lag spikes while crossing node lines
* Mobs sitting on node lines being invincible
* Blue text exploiting (Members of another guild that you're warred against can leave their guild and attack you without you knowing they're an enemy because their name text is blue instead of orange).
* Characters or pets getting stuck in the environment. Most of the time the /stuck command will get you out though.
* Most of the GMs are unhelpful. For example, report someone for blue text exploiting and they won't get punished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148853151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 10187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1685, 'last_played': 1498656587}

Unless you're with some good friends that can fend you off until you get back on. I really recommend this game and I hope you're porting over to UE4, I would pay full game price for it. The graphics would be so much better just by upgrading the engine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000549419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 16873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15401, 'last_played': 1552576633}
review:
Gra Mortal Online jest wymagająca, co może zniechęci początkujących graczy, powolutku odkrywa swoje kart, którymi są ciekawy system craftingu, genialne pvp i pve w grze można spotkać niesamowity dreszczyk emocji, który wynika z utraty itemów po śmierci i całkowicie otwartego świata pvp, gra ta daje niesamowitą ilość zabawy, i do tego system skilli jest bardzo dobrze wykonany, zapraszam wszystkich chętnych do gry do gildii slav największej polskie gildi.

Filmik z namiarami na slav https://youtu.be/9kbCC93bCDY﻿

author: {'steamid': '76561198184219259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19591, 'last_played': 1466696088}
review:
My IGN is ShortStack!

I have been having an absolute blast playing Mortal Online! I love the game and I like how your FREE to choose what you want to do.

 The reason why there as many negative reviews as there are is because those players have been trapped in a bubble created by the other game makers. They don't know how to play these kinds of games where it takes thinking and they get frustrated and cry.

 I give this game the highest rating not because of graphics or how smooth it is or any of that stuff but because the game is a hidden gem and get to be creative and if I die in a harsh world then I get to LEARN from my mistakes and CREATE a new plan. Just the Theme of this game alone gets the highest rating.

 You want a great game with lots of choices to do? Then you will like this game. Want a game where the developers care about their game? This game has awesome developers who communicate with the players and are always trying to make it run as smooth as possible all while continuing to grow and expand not just in game size but in features and fun!

10/10 love cooking breakfast then finding a campfire and chat wih a few friends before going on my mid morning patrol :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198199457031', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1514485842}
review:
Don't let the review fool you, mortal is the game for hardcore mmo fans, like myself, who have been searching for a truely open world game. The community is great, they are willing to help you learn. 

Pros: 
-Great Concept
-Outstanding soundtrack
-Helpful Communtiy
-Wonderful Combat System and open-loot

Cons:
-Poorly optimized
-Not enough information about the beggining game
-11 year old kids who rage


Other than that, have a great time playing a "old but gold" game

author: {'steamid': '76561198078768387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 41562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8341, 'last_played': 1606060267}
review:
Можно говорить о всех ошибках игры, о ее недочетах. Говорить о лености разработчиков и прочем. Однако как бы вы не искали среди тысяч ММО и сотнях песочниц, вы не найдете и на 50% похожего геймплея. Также вы не найдете здесь доната ни в каких его проявлениях. Здесь нет читеров с радарами и ваншот випонами. Здесь нет убер брони в которой вас невозможно убить. 
Только вот игра не для детей и не для тех кто не готов терять. Здесь тебя не защитят никакие стены и укрытия, ведь все в этом мире хочет убить тебя и забрать твой лут и гир.
И да, если однажды вам надоест мортал и вы уйдете, я уверен на 90% что вернетесь в скором времени.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067729078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3991, 'last_played': 1592355481}
review:
Pros:
Player combat is solid.
Character customization is reasonable.
Fun to play.
Criminal or law-abiding citizen, you can play however you desire.
Full nudity.

Cons:
No clothes, no cosmetics, no roleplay.
Armor is the only type of clothes you will ever wear.

Conclusion:
The gameplay is combat-oriented, with all crafting and trading catering to said combat.
I am a person who enjoys dressing up my characters in classy outfits when entering the inner city.
I do not fault the game for having a single focus on combat, but I would have loved to see some nice dresses, suits, or other form of clothing to wear.

If you are like me and want a bit of extra depth and roleplay opportunity, this game is not for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033260153', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 4250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1602, 'last_played': 1471734538}
review:
Du potentiel. Aucun guide de quete , vous etes libre .
Vous pouvez autant vous faire assasinez au spawn du début du jeu que devant plein de pnj , il faut juste que les joueurs appelle les garde. Mais ils le feront souvent apres avoir pillé votre cadavre . Ce qui rend le jeu très énervant quand on se retrouve tout nu (réellement à poil) . Du potentil niveau combat et exploration , les paysages trop plat , a peine sortie de la ville on se fait exploser par des bandit hl et stuffer a mort .
Aucun guide fr sur internet pour bien débuter .
Trop de difficulté tue la difficulté . La c'est de la difficulté sur des choses basique ... ce jeu demande simplement de la patience . BEAUCOUP de patience , apres s'etre bien stuffé tout sa , beh on peut pex , mais comme j'ai dit , aucun lieu n'est sûre meme pas le spawn du debut du jeu donc . Laissez tomber si vous etes sensible à la rage .
C'est un MMORPG hardcore et réaliste par excellence mais il faut juste : etre motivé , avoir du sang froid , beaucoup de patience , aimer la nudité (XD) , mais bon .
Une bonne communauté et un gameplay qui va demander d'être attentif en permanence.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991044191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 341423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47820, 'last_played': 1588270939}
review:
Really a great game, certainly very buggy in some points still besides being available since 2010(?).

But there are not many games like this, with open PVP, and full-loot with no levels. There is a skill system where you need to specialize your character into a certain build with about 1100 possible skill points. Some skills are secondary and do not use this pool.

The game has a steep-learning curve, and the ability to be killed outside any major towns (and even within, but the person usually does not get away with it) may put new players off. But everybody dies. Money is as easy as farming NPC mobs which can be dull, but its not difficult. 

Combat is rewarding and also hard to learn, but this is not a casual's game.

There is a decent sized population of players most who have been playing the game for quite some time.

8/10 cause of bugs. The game is built by a very small team, I only hope that they can improve it more in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128559222', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 106983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47769, 'last_played': 1524042437}
review:
Mortal Online - More than a first look.

If you have the majority of reviews of this game, most are written by either users who:

1. Played for 10 minutes.
2. Played for maybe a week.
3. Complain because others are better at the game.
4. Don't understand all games have bugs (Yes this one has quite a few, however this game is so good it doesn't matter since they are not game breaking, just irritating.)
5. (Probably the worst... ) Can't handle the player community of this game.. Yes, it's probably the worst community, not going to try and ignore this.  It's a Full loot PVP hardcore sandbox... its going to bring out the worst.

Me, I've played for several years, before mortal came to steam. With steam its getting alot better, and at a much faster rate. But it's brings COD fans, idiots, and immature user's who do not understand, or even like these sort of hardcore games.  I've dealt with countless bugs, the horrific community, and sadly, terrible customer support. 
But none of this, would ever weigh heavily enough to stop me from playing this game.  

I've always wanted a game like this, and this is exactly it. No other game offers what mortal online does. 

The combat: 

Melee: You have directional attacks, directional blocking, different damage types (Blunt, peircing, slashing) And armor/resisting the same (Blunt, peircing, slashing). So not only do you have a variety of how you attack, you have a variety of damage types. Once you learn the game enough you can look at another player and seeing their armor type, and materials it's made of, knowing what its weak/strong against. The combat in this game is the MOST fun I've experienced.  And the absolute best part, It's not super gear reliant. Myself and many others have defeated players with higher end gear, while being naked with a started sword known as "worn shortsword". So your not 100% screwed if they out gear you. This combat system is skill and knowledge based, not gear reliance based.  

What is there to do in mortal? Plenty. 

You can be a crafter, weaponsmith, armorsmith, cook, alchemist, tamer/breeder, miner, woodcutter, extractor, refiner, butcher, bowcrafter, engineer, and more. 

You can be a Footfighter with swords, axes, daggers, clubs, poleswords, fistfighter, mounted combat, mounted archery, a mage, a dominator who utilizes pets to fight with/for them. 

You can build your character to be however, and whatever you want. There are no restriction besides the total skillpoint usage. 

As far as the F2P, P2P, P2Win, etc. This game is NOT F2P. It is P2P with an infinite trial. However, you can play this game as F2P.. Just not as efficiently, and with crafting no one would not recommend it since you cannot make very good items without having max skills/lores.  PVE though, you can do everything a P2P player could do, if you have the combat skill,
To experience this game the way it is designed, and meant, then purchase a subscription, it is most definitely worth it.

If you do choose to give this game a try, don't be like the majority of others and just hang out in the starter zone. You will get angry, you will be dissapointed, and you will most likely quit playing the game. I think the starter town and how you start this game should be completely redone and reworked. But in the meantime, if you hang in there, ignore the idiots around you, then you will experience the game as it really is, and when looking at these reviews feel the same way I do which lead me to write my first game review. 

No matter how bad it pisses you off, no matter how angry people make you, you will always come back to mortal online, because its just that damn good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194952734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1545873974}
review:
meh.
instead of a review,get some literature in there and read hamlet.


ACT I

SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.

FRANCISCO at his post. Enter to him BERNARDO
BERNARDO
Who's there?
FRANCISCO
Nay, answer me: stand, and unfold yourself.
BERNARDO
Long live the king!
FRANCISCO
Bernardo?
BERNARDO
He.
FRANCISCO
You come most carefully upon your hour.
BERNARDO
'Tis now struck twelve; get thee to bed, Francisco.
FRANCISCO
For this relief much thanks: 'tis bitter cold,
And I am sick at heart.
BERNARDO
Have you had quiet guard?
FRANCISCO
Not a mouse stirring.
BERNARDO
Well, good night.
If you do meet Horatio and Marcellus,
The rivals of my watch, bid them make haste.
FRANCISCO
I think I hear them. Stand, ho! Who's there?
Enter HORATIO and MARCELLUS

HORATIO
Friends to this ground.
MARCELLUS
And liegemen to the Dane.
FRANCISCO
Give you good night.
MARCELLUS
O, farewell, honest soldier:
Who hath relieved you?
FRANCISCO
Bernardo has my place.
Give you good night.
Exit

MARCELLUS
Holla! Bernardo!
BERNARDO
Say,
What, is Horatio there?
HORATIO
A piece of him.
BERNARDO
Welcome, Horatio: welcome, good Marcellus.
MARCELLUS
What, has this thing appear'd again to-night?
BERNARDO
I have seen nothing.
MARCELLUS
Horatio says 'tis but our fantasy,
And will not let belief take hold of him
Touching this dreaded sight, twice seen of us:
Therefore I have entreated him along
With us to watch the minutes of this night;
That if again this apparition come,
He may approve our eyes and speak to it.
HORATIO
Tush, tush, 'twill not appear.
BERNARDO
Sit down awhile;
And let us once again assail your ears,
That are so fortified against our story
What we have two nights seen.
HORATIO
Well, sit we down,
And let us hear Bernardo speak of this.
BERNARDO
Last night of all,
When yond same star that's westward from the pole
Had made his course to illume that part of heaven
Where now it burns, Marcellus and myself,
The bell then beating one,--
Enter Ghost

MARCELLUS
Peace, break thee off; look, where it comes again!
BERNARDO
In the same figure, like the king that's dead.
MARCELLUS
Thou art a scholar; speak to it, Horatio.
BERNARDO
Looks it not like the king? mark it, Horatio.
HORATIO
Most like: it harrows me with fear and wonder.
BERNARDO
It would be spoke to.
MARCELLUS
Question it, Horatio.
HORATIO
What art thou that usurp'st this time of night,
Together with that fair and warlike form
In which the majesty of buried Denmark
Did sometimes march? by heaven I charge thee, speak!
MARCELLUS
It is offended.
BERNARDO
See, it stalks away!
HORATIO
Stay! speak, speak! I charge thee, speak!
Exit Ghost

MARCELLUS
'Tis gone, and will not answer.
BERNARDO
How now, Horatio! you tremble and look pale:
Is not this something more than fantasy?
What think you on't?
HORATIO
Before my God, I might not this believe
Without the sensible and true avouch
Of mine own eyes.
MARCELLUS
Is it not like the king?
HORATIO
As thou art to thyself:
Such was the very armour he had on
When he the ambitious Norway combated;
So frown'd he once, when, in an angry parle,
He smote the sledded Polacks on the ice.
'Tis strange.
MARCELLUS
Thus twice before, and jump at this dead hour,
With martial stalk hath he gone by our watch.
HORATIO
In what particular thought to work I know not;
But in the gross and scope of my opinion,
This bodes some strange eruption to our state.
MARCELLUS
Good now, sit down, and tell me, he that knows,
Why this same strict and most observant watch
So nightly toils the subject of the land,
And why such daily cast of brazen cannon,
And foreign mart for implements of war;
Why such impress of shipwrights, whose sore task
Does not divide the Sunday from the week;
What might be toward, that this sweaty haste
Doth make the night joint-labourer with the day:
Who is't that can inform me?
HORATIO
That can I;
At least, the whisper goes so. Our last king,
Whose image even but now appear'd to us,
Was, as you know, by Fortinbras of Norway,
Thereto prick'd on by a most emulate pride,
Dared to the combat; in which our valiant Hamlet--
For so this side of our known world esteem'd him--
Did slay this Fortinbras; who by a seal'd compact,
Well ratified by law and heraldry,
Did forfeit, with his life, all those his lands
Which he stood seized of, to the conqueror:
Against the which, a moiety competent
Was gaged by our king; which had return'd
To the inheritance of Fortinbras,
Had he been vanquisher; as, by the same covenant,
And carriage of the article design'd,
His fell to Hamlet. Now, sir, young Fortinbras,
Of unimproved mettle hot and full,
Hath in the skirts of Norway here and there
Shark'd up a list of lawless resolutes,
For food and diet, to some enterprise
That hath a stomach in't; which is no other--
As it doth well appear unto our state--
But to recover of us, by strong hand
And terms compulsatory, those foresaid lands
So by his father lost: and this, I take it,
Is the main motive of our preparations,
The source of this our watch and the chief head
Of this post-haste and romage in the land.
BERNARDO
I think it be no other but e'en so:
Well may it sort that this portentous figure
Comes armed through our watch; so like the king
That was and is the question of these wars.
HORATIO
A mote it is to trouble the mind's eye.
In the most high and palmy state of Rome,
A little ere the mightiest Julius fell,
The graves stood tenantless and the sheeted dead
Did squeak and gibber in the Roman streets:
As stars with trains of fire and dews of blood,
Disasters in the sun; and the moist star
Upon whose influence Neptune's empire stands
Was sick almost to doomsday with eclipse:
And even the like precurse of fierce events,
As harbingers preceding still the fates
And prologue to the omen coming on,
Have heaven and earth together demonstrated
Unto our climatures and countrymen.--
But soft, behold! lo, where it comes again!
Re-enter Ghost

I'll cross it, though it blast me. Stay, illusion!
If thou hast any sound, or use of voice,
Speak to me:
If there be any good thing to be done,
That may to thee do ease and grace to me,
Speak to me:
Cock crows

If thou art privy to thy country's fate,
Which, happily, foreknowing may avoid, O, speak!
Or if thou hast uphoarded in thy life
Extorted treasure in the womb of earth,
For which, they say, you spirits oft walk in death,
Speak of it: stay, and speak! Stop it, Marcellus.
MARCELLUS
Shall I strike at it with my partisan?
HORATIO
Do, if it will not stand.
BERNARDO
'Tis here!
HORATIO
'Tis here!
MARCELLUS
'Tis gone!
Exit Ghost

We do it wrong, being so majestical,
To offer it the show of violence;
For it is, as the air, invulnerable,
And our vain blows malicious mockery.
BERNARDO
It was about to speak, when the cock crew.
HORATIO
And then it started like a guilty thing
Upon a fearful summons. I have heard,
The cock, that is the trumpet to the morn,
Doth with his lofty and shrill-sounding throat
Awake the god of day; and, at his warning,
Whether in sea or fire, in earth or air,
The extravagant and erring spirit hies
To his confine: and of the truth herein
This present object made probation.
MARCELLUS
It faded on the crowing of the cock.
Some say that ever 'gainst that season comes
Wherein our Saviour's birth is celebrated,
The bird of dawning singeth all night long:
And then, they say, no spirit dares stir abroad;
The nights are wholesome; then no planets strike,
No fairy takes, nor witch hath power to charm,
So hallow'd and so gracious is the time.
HORATIO
So have I heard and do in part believe it.
But, look, the morn, in russet mantle clad,
Walks o'er the dew of yon high eastward hill:
Break we our watch up; and by my advice,
Let us impart what we have seen to-night
Unto young Hamlet; for, upon my life,
This spirit, dumb to us, will speak to him.
Do you consent we shall acquaint him with it,
As needful in our loves, fitting our duty?
MARCELLUS
Let's do't, I pray; and I this morning know
Where we shall find him most conveniently.
Exeun

author: {'steamid': '76561198113114571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 33035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12553, 'last_played': 1467195565}
review:
I see many reviews complaining about things that are neither good od bad but simply part of the concept.
Complaining about losing everything you carry when killed in a full loot game is like down voting star wars because you find spaceships boring.

This game is a full loot, full pvp, first person fantasy sandbox.

Another regular in bad reviews is the claim that it is p2w.
It is not. It is simply p2p. Consider f2p as a kind of demo. You get to play the game and do almost everything there is in it, just nothing very well. Can you create the uber solo pvp warrior as an f2p? No, but that would be weird wouldn't it?
This game does not keep afloat offerin cosmetic micro-transactions like real f2p games but also not through micro-transactions giving real advantage like a p2w. In fact, there are no micro-transactions at all. This game makes it's money with player subscriptions and among those everyone is equal and nobody can buy an advantage.

This game is certainly unpolished, experiences lag, bugs and glitches but they are all while numerous, rather minor.

It makes up for it with the same aspects that are difficult to grasp for many new players, including me:
The players have to explore the world themselves. There is no in game map. Equiptment stats are never explicitely revealed. Players are given an approximaton of their different gear items' stats the accuracy of which depends on their skills with the various item types.
All of this plus the lack of quests telling you what to do next is frustrating to many expecting another game similar to what they have played before. You simply have to keep going and find a purpose for yourself in this world.
Join a guild and carve out your piece of it. Don't expect you and your 2 other f2p friends can just start the game and after 5 hours walk into an established guild's territory and take their stuff. If you could, something would be very wrong.

Give it a try. If you find something really wrong, write a bad review but please, don't do it simply because you'd prefer this game to be less free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050519077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 19263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18771, 'last_played': 1460839666}
review:
Превосходная задумка и ужаснейшее исполнение. Баг на баге. 
Игра с фуллутом, но в игре куча мест, где если персонажа убивают, лут остается на нем или по нему не проходит урон. К сожалению эти места статичны и все старички о них знают и активно их используют, более того построенную на этом месте крепость нельзя будет разрушить. Это только самый злобный баг. С чем еще встретился я : заклинило боевой режим( умер, не смог убежать от игрока), застрял в текстурах( многократно ), убегающий маунт через текстуры в никуда( да-да с вашим лутом), бегающие и бьющие через текстуры мобы, невидимые мобы,  прохождение через текстуры. Это только на вскидку + ознакомился с читвидео с ютубами, да-да, тут есть читаки, подкручивающие себе характеристики. Так что не удивляйтесь людям с не бесконечной стаминой. 
Как еще один минус игры - боевка, потрясающе отзывчивая, словно сердце вашей бывшей( направить удар и выставить блок нормально мышкой, практически не реально). Чаще всего вы будете бить пустое место, а противник будет лупить вас с растояния в 10 метров, вот такая вот система попаданий в этой игре. Весь бой больше похож на шоу бенни хила, все носятся туда-сюда в тяжелых доспехах, словно это тряпки. Проигрываешь - беги. Беги Форест ,через всю карту за подкреплением, а потом беги обратно, уже пытаясь догнать противника. А бой верхом - просто треш, лошадь разворачивается на 90 градусов на месте и проносится мимо вас на скорости сравнимой с ламборджини, если вы пеший, а против вас не имбецил, то можно просто остановится и стоять, пытясь блочить, один хрен он вас убьет. 

В целом игра не стоит потраченного на нее времени и денег( а без денег в нее играть НЕЛЬЗЯ, иначе вы будете слабее всех, умения персонажа будут работать только на 60%). Если вы не фанат извращений, проходите мимо. 
Итог :2 убежавших навсегда маунта из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124919739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11718, 'last_played': 1707561416}
review: Игра интересная, и механика тоже, но чего-то не хватает. Наверное, даже самой примитивной локализации нет, поэтому, все просто фанятся, бегают и тычут друг друга копьями. Есть игровой мир, но по сути он пустой, я не говорю про пещеры, монстров, перков и города. а про истории и легенды, или на худой конец былины. Возможно есть уйма квестов и к ним прилагается какая-то история, но в виду отсутствия локализаций, в полной мере им могут насладиться лишь носители английского языка. Игра в стадии раннего доступа, но игровой движок уже успел устареть в добавок к это сам принцип мортла (фулдроп, отсутствие карты и журнала квестов), сделают прохождение (игровой процесс) занудным занятием, что оставит не сладкий осадок у тех, у кого были переоценённые ожидания от игры, и многие они сойдутся во мнении что игра очень сырая и недоделанная. Моя позиция на счет этой игры следующая: дождаться даты релиза и нормальной локализации, и возможно, тогда я подумаю над тем чтобы купить игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191212223', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3270, 'last_played': 1649122135}
review:
Jogo muito bom, [b]entretanto pesado.[/b]
Jogabilidade impecavel, mapa gigantesco e extremamente bem feito, juntamente com uma liberdade imensa nas ações dos jogadores, melhor jogo enste estilo que já vi, e como penalidade por morrer é dropar todos os itens tudo fica mais interessante.
O sistema de skills coloca um limite bem ajustado de skills primárias, e secundárias ilimitadas, o que permite criar um estio de jogo unico (no meu caso tamer) e a história de fundo é bem detalhada também, se você gosta de pvp, explorar, e jogos com uma boa dificuldade somado a adrenalina Mortal Online será uma boa escolha!

author: {'steamid': '76561197967108523', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 64946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45734, 'last_played': 1516707180}
review:
First of all this game is not for feint of hearted. This is true PvP! The land of Mortal Online is harsh and violent. Even in starting city after few hours of gameplay you are vulnerable to other players. There are thiefs that try to steal your hard earned money. There are players who do anything to scam you out. And if you wander too far from the city guards you can be a victim of cold blooded murderers.

But within this hard world there is also unity and friendship. When the world is harsh you need to rely on friends and mates. Strenght comes from numbers. You can form guilds with your new or old friends or join any of the existing ones. There are guilds that do PvP battles, Crafting and trading, and even Thiefs have their own player guild for you to join. 

So you can choose any path that you want. Be it hero or villain. Mortal online offers you the chance to play as you like.

But be warned. Be prepared to lose all your har earned loot if you are not smart enough. This game definetly brings out emotions. Good and Bad.

But when you succeed the rewarding feeling is so great!

author: {'steamid': '76561198284739121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8882, 'last_played': 1460975590}
review: Love this game. You NEED to have patience and a thick skin. When other reviews talk about the abundance of player killing, they're not lying. Keep your wits about you, even when you think no ones around. With patience, it is very possible to become self sustaining in the game, but there will ALwAYS be a player better than you. I don't necessarily think you HAVE to have a guild to get anywhere (although it helps), making friends is good enough and I've found more pleasant players than not so far. Just make sure you are making the right friends. If you die, you WILL lose everything. When traveling long distances, travel lightly and with stuff you can afford to lose. Keep items in reserve at banks in every city you come to, when applicable. (Cause you never know where you're going to die. This helps you not be completely without when entering a city) For new players: stay in help chat as long as you can. It is beneficial. I believe the new update allows it to be up for a week now. Overall, positive review here. Easy to get lost and diving in for hours at a time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991744681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1459590086}
review:
Короче,игрушка торт,графика приемлемая и вполне идёт. Атмосфера игры прикольная,большой функционал и возможностей развития персонажа. Те кто в отзывах орут про оптимизацию,видимо играют на древних калькуляторах,ничего не лагает на максимальных настройках вообще. Остальные кричат о смертях и свиньях,тоесть они дальще 200 метров в игре ничего не сделали,в начале проходится обучение в 3-4 квеста простых и потом выводят за ворота в город где ты уже сам по себе,никто тебя за руку водить не будет,дальше сам. Дубовость боёвки присутствует,хитбоксы тоже не очень,но когда чуть по прокаченней будешь становится более менее. 
Посмотреть на игру в бесплатном варианте можно,но играть на постоянной основе нужно с ПОДПИСКОЙ,потому что триал версия обрезанная жёстко,в общем рекомендую для тех кому охота поиграть в игру где есть свободное пвп и фулл лут,но расчитывать на нагибаторство в первый месяц игры явно не стоит,ибо там такие папки с подпиской играют больше 2 лет,у них то явно всё раскаченно и одето в топ ))
