author: {'steamid': '76561198199399993', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1538310781}
review: Это блять вы серьезно? Вы блять меня удивляете, почему она у меня на минимальных настройках лагает? У меня железо на максимальных настройках Ведьмака 3 в 60 fps запускает. А ваша игра просто пиздец. На ее закачку только время потратил (и нервы тоже). Из-за этого я готов вам на лица нассать. Просто ахуительно вы работаете. Оптимизации ни какой. По этому я вынужден вам поставить ахуенный минус. Сидите и дальше дрочите мудаки.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072939291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1459051253}
review:
After looking up some things you need to know about this game because the game is terrible at telling you my initial thoughts on the game was its dark souls online and its amazing. I came into the game knowing if you die with things on you, you will likely never see those things again and I was fine with that. Then I found out after playing a couple hours that a single hit from a player will kill you and that was the end of that for me. This game is not skill based in the slightest simply because of that reason and it kills the fun. Hey just spent hours farming a certain area and are now overloaded so going to drop some things in your inventory and head back? Dead, without even knowing how. Going to look inside your bank to get some things out? Dead, oh but the guards killed your killer so don't mind that you lose everything on you still.

Archery gameplay is horrible, they tried to add in arrow drop to make it more "realistic' my arrow can fly a foot before it will hit the ground not to mention it doesn't even come out where the aim marker is. Taming is a really cool idea, your pets die the moment you get them so now thats gone. The world looks like shit, people can say all they want "games don't need good graphics" but hell ya mmorpg really really really do. It's not enjoyable when half of your play time is spend wandering around twiddling your thumbs looking at shit untill you get to the destination. I still don't know how to revive could look it up but the fact that they don't tell me in game just tells me they don't want me to play. Why its not automatic the world will never know.

If only these survival games would stop doing the crap you lose everything if you die and just implement a player bounty system these games would be played more often, be more enjoyable, be a lot better. Anyone that bothers to tell me "you got hit in the head" I really don't care this is a game not real life you can't sacrifice mandatory game mechanics just because you want to make it more realistic. If I am unable to react to some random stranger hitting me because I die from one shot that means I am unable to play the main part of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060549388', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1570858242}
review:
Mortal Online, A vast world full of excitement, battles, kingdom building, PVP, and everything inbetween! It really is large for a game, though I have my doubts on it being THE game I hoped it would be..

Firstly to those who hate, this is my voice of experience; so go ahead and criticise me all you like, it won't do anything, feel free to express yourselves in comments if need be.

Now then, this world is vast; yes. It holds many adventures and as well as many issues to get your adventure going. We have a large assortment of beginning stats and such; but there is a cap unless you PAY for the game stuff. (Casual P2W scenario.). Another thing to notice is there is a time limit of protection, no matter where you are, even in the safest town; there WILL be PVP, so once you run out; you're screwed basically. Don't get me started on how bad the community is as well half the time..As well it's PERMA-DEATH; which means, you died? well lose all your stuff and give it to the enemy! HARDCORE MODE does not cope well with PVP.

Next, we have common gameplay; At first, you have no idea what you are in for, firstly, you have no idea what to do, or who to trust. So if you get stuck on something you gotta look up on how it works, though there is a help menu around there. Nxt, you gotta do a LOT of running back and forth for a measly tutorial. The keys are all a mess to get control of on the top hotbar, the abilities and such are confusing at times, and well...It can be fluent if you learn to control it. As for getting out of the city; you can't simply leave if you let your timer run out; you gotta go out there with basically pimped armor and everything. So you're outta luck if you can get out at all. If you have troubles as well with some deadbeat loser assaulting you you literally have to type "Guards!" in the chat for them to help at all which is a bit of a bad feature.

Finally; Building. We all been waiting for this open world stuff right? Well this one does not really fail on it's {SANDBOX} feature. You firstly have to get a Muel, which costs a lot itself, nextly we need the materials and tools. These are what are the biggest pains to get, the tools themselves either cost a lot, or are hard to get the materials for. It can be annoying yes; but it is all worth it in the end. Once you have the proper tools, you can start building, and crafting the landscape to your needs. Though the issue is having to travel far and wide to even find the needed supplies for the most part, overall, the building feature is unique and a nice touch!


Final result?: This game is unique, and have mixed feelings, but over all, leaning towards a no, sorry to the devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154683360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 195355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160038, 'last_played': 1644173332}
review:
Its.. ok. Its nice and hardcore, my style. The environment is [strike]kinda[/strike]... no, really shitty. If you are looking for a sweet environment, this is not the game. If you are looking for some good real time pvp, this is also not the game. If you are looking to get bum busted by a bunch of jackasses with prepatched horses, this is the game for you.. This game takes alot of time and money to become powerful. Unless you have a group to play with, or plan on finding a good group (not many out there but they can be found), you may want to keep searching. 


PS. If you are thinking about building a house in a sweet ass spot on the map, this is also not the game for you.

PPS. After many hours I have come to find that the game is no longer what it was intended to be. the game is designed to have you pay for it, then get your friends to pay for it. After that, they will start banning your guildmates for nothing less then a shot at another subscription. Dont buy into this garbage. it looks good at the first sight but they are constantly trying to find ways to make you waste your time so that the next month with come around before you can get anything done.


All I have left to say is that the server wont be very much fun after all the players are gone and all that is left is the carebear guilds that try to say they are the "good guys". WHAT A JOKE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020697345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1458094620}
review: Ok so this game is fun, until you realize your skills are capped at 60/120 less you shell out 11$ a month or so. As a die hard free too play gamer I figured meh, its a skill based game Im sure I can get a foothold with low skills, long story short...NOPE, your stuck at a certain point in the game with your skills capped, either pay... or be like I dunno a peasant who others can kill in two hits, and even though your skills in taming is 60/120 you cant tame a donkey with a skill rating of 21... less you got a few hours too stand there. Uncap the Skills, make it free too play for real! and this game would be booming, its open world and combat are viscrel and real feeling it has lots of potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991553515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 67588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1645986496}
review: Since the beginning of Video Games there has not been a game equal to this open world PvP ready Medieval self motivated sand box of a game. The more you know the more you can do & this race to know & do all the aspects of this game is ever growing. Having played since 2009, the ever changing world has gone from a simple sanbox game to a complex knowledge based game that demands hard work and virtual labors  to achieve skills as well as the first game i have ever seen where reading books for knowledge lores was not only possible but had a real time aspect that allows for offline study as well. The  banking system is town based and the only real safe place to store any loot as the game is complete loot drop upon death for every player making the PvP not only interesting but a reason for bandits to hunt other players However the guild based system makes regions of land in the game player owned and can be ruled with an iron fist or a laxed bandit mentality depending on the players. No place is truely safe in the game but with strength of allies and engineering the player built fortresses can be a safe haven away from common bandits but is no means completely safe as other guilds and players can siege at any point they are able to afford the manpower and resources to  attack the structures & this is becomming easier with time to achieve for even the single players however the group aspect of this game makes most solo adventures suicide or a battle of fierce tactics & combat guile, this does not stop the veterains with all their knowledge lores from roaming and killing every player that moves in the wild & some times even in the towns where the bravest of the murderers still wonder in & kill people and ride out even with a hord of guards on their tale they still manage to evade capture & death with swift & fierce malice to others. beware the others as they are the the greatest threat & strength in this game & practice on the PVE & earn your skills to take rank in the guilds of your choosing, But remember that we are all "Mortal" Online. Live well, Work hard & Die with style. Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020571618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 5305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3969, 'last_played': 1561775648}
review:
so, it's been a... long while since I wrote my previous, scathing review on this game. about two years, I think?

I recently got back into the game, to see how it was doing out of curiosity. Honestly? It much better then it was. The devs have stepped up, putting forth some much needed effort towards updating, general playability, and perhaps most importantly, there moderation staff since I last played. the improvment is noticable in many many MANY areas. I actually found myself enjoying things.

I won't go into details on all the good as I'm not exactly experianced, but I will say, I am one for improvment and improvment has not only happened, but it's continuing to happen.
I will say I still have some issues, but things that I can look past. I write this after having several days of work ruined by having some hard earned savings pickpocketed as I was in the middle of spending it towards a loadout, and seeing as I don't have much time to play anything anymore, learning that you can just turn right around and bank it without any reprecussions or need for fear certanly had me fuming. Feels like a bit of an advantage P2Ps have that you really can't counter if your poor. Don't get me wrong, I get that playing this F2P is more akin to playing a demo then anything else in this game, but dividing your playerbase in this manner has always rubbed me the wrong way.
Nothing I can't look past though. 
I think it's worth a look if you think it might be up your ally AND you feel you'd have the money to fork over in case you enjoy what you find.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087672583', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4617, 'last_played': 1558541130}
review:
Вы приходите к старшему брату на его День Рождения, садитесь за стол, перед вами огромный (в отличии от писюнов задротов этой игры) торт. Вы тянете руку и тут же получаете по ней. Теперь по хлебалу. О, а вот теперь вас избивают ногами по почкам. И друзья вашего брата сжирают торт, а ты такой лежишь, мол: "Эх, зато торт красивый". Я к чему: народ, что донатит в эту игру уже как полгода направо и налево раскидывает все живое на своем пути. Вопрос: как играть новичкам? Я спускаюсь в подземелье, и один парень пишет: " Не трогай меня, пожалуйста, мне не нужны проблемы". Лол. Короче:
1. Выходите из города - умирание.
2. Вы в городе - умираете.
3. У вас лут лучше стартового? Сдохни и попращайся с шмотом.
4. Убиваете других - умираете.
5. Умираете? Умираете.
Какой смысл в игре, если в неё буквально невозможно играть? Это не хардкор, это тупость. Хардокором игра была, может, 5 лет назад. 

10 сломанных клавиатур из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117028205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 23069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11025, 'last_played': 1697707713}
review:
It..sort of feels like an incomplete Morrowind, Skyrim, Runescape MMO all cobbled together with duct-tape, black magic and inside swedish jokes. Its not a BAD game persay, it has two large continents and a recent large patch which I've yet to explore much. The community is mostly made of up either guild politicts and drama or just your average rampant murderers (Which are some guilds). I like this game, I really do, though it just feels, incomplete, empty, without content.
I'd really like to see some major updating to this game, some actual house decor and even perhaps minor terraforming? Please, let me make my little beach side cactii garden in Sarducaa. You're definitely going to want to team up with friends and even a guild to accomplish anything above farming some pigs and skeletans for your life in here.

Its playable mostly, it can be quite a good bit of fun at times. Its largely dependant on the adventures you go on with your friends if anything. You can play for /free/ but are limited to a cap on your skills from 100 to 60. It might not seem like that big of a deal, though when that elf mage that's running faster than the speed of light is doing 40% more damage than yours, then you'll understand. l'm recommending TRYING it for now, grab a one month sub if you find yourself in a lovely little guild like I did. Make your own goals and ever pursue them, don't become too disappointed when you get killed and lose your items.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997427399', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3441, 'last_played': 1460018317}
review: So far from playing this game I give it a 7/10 on the scale. First things first! We need more skill points and i cannot stress this enough to you...more and new weapon updates, Better updates more frequently. I do like the point system for levels in the game though it reminds me of Skyrim witch is nice and I loved that game, the "pk-ing" is nice i like to kill once in awhile and steal the items the other players drop but!!! you will become a murderer at 5 player kills meaning...anyone on site can kill you and steal everything and not get into trouble by the guards, and the guards and kill you and they will I feel Red status aka murderer status should be taken off I want to pk more but i cant. and the priest needs to revive quicker and the timer should be lessened when you commit a crime and die so you can revive and start having fun again. but yea pretty dang decent game if you stick to it and RPG and MMO games are your thing give it a try you'll like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960374843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1526042138}
review:
EDIT:

Review got falsely flagged by the developers in an attempt to censorship it:

https://i.imgur.com/IeZpLx0.png

Got muted from the help chat for asking what to do with zombie heads and got murdered about 2-3 times by different people within the timespan of an hour in a newbie zone. Worst part?

They all used loopholes that have existed in this game for years on end to both avoid guards altogether (immediate armed retaliation) and the game design intended consequences of RDMing people (flagging system) continues being an overly complicated, useless mess that does absolutely nothing but slightly spank people that go on multiple mass slaughters within a short period of time.

The community can sometimes be considered decent with a few good souls here and there but It's almost entirely made up of toxic man-children, griefers and trolls that currently flourish from doing things like I've stated above.

Combine that with some incredibly clunky combat mechanics and a horrendously deep & unexplained learning curve and you've got yourself an MMO you're better off avoiding.
developer_response:
FarmerJoe says: I'm not sure what I did to offend you here, but those comments seem unnecessary?
It's alright if you don't like the design of the flagging system, it's not a game for everyone and that's just fine.

I was simply looking for feedback on what we could do to improve the starting experience for new players.

Had to.. write this as a dev-response since you seem to be removing all my comments now?

Edit: We tried to have a conversation with you, but you call us devs "utterly retarded" and "butt-buddies", you call our game "shoddy", "jerky", "fundamentally shit", etc, you remove our comments, and then you have the gall to claim in your profile that you are the one being harassed and bullied by us? Amazing.

PS: I haven't "cussed" even once. But you keep on being a lying troll if that makes you happy. It's just curious that you act as the very same type of "toxic man-children" that you complain about in your review. Be part of the solution, not part of the problem! <3 Have a good evening, buddy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994243856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 18282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17392, 'last_played': 1469688758}
review: NOT FREE TO PLAY, All ur skills limited to 60% People want you to hit them by accident so they can murder you and take your stuff.
developer_response:
Nope, we see it as a free-trial to.
That's why we have this in the shop:

"Unlimited free trial!
Mortal Online offers a free-to-play mode with a skill cap at skill level 60. In order to unlock the maximum skill levels and fully master your Mortal destiny, a paid monthly subscription is needed, but unlike many other games there are no microtransactions. Unsubscribing will re-apply the skill cap, but your skills will be maxed again when you re-subscribe. Every player gets one free character slot, and you can purchase additional slots up to a maximum of four."

The blue blocking you are talking about will get a fix in the next patch (that's real soon!)
you can read more about it in this dev-update (at the bottom)

http://www.mortalonline.com/magic-development-update-4/

under "steam feedback"

Thanks for the feedback!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027132487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1141, 'last_played': 1485863433}
review:
Судя по всему, эта игра позволяет сделать всё, что только захочешь!
Играть только начал. Первым делом зашёл в настройки и разрешил наготу. Снял штаны и дал тёплому ветерку облизать мои яйца. Пока проходил обучение в каком-то закоулке нашёл чей-то схрон и обокрал его.  Какой-то парень не понравился стражникам, и они его убили. Я и ещё один бомж налетели на его тело словно шакалы и начали обдирать до нитки. Но мне этого было мало, и я решил отрубить ему голову и содрать кожу. После этого я бегал голышом по городу и ел кожу только что убитого стражниками человека.
10 из 10, ГОСПОДИ, 10 ИЗ 10!!!

review: Game is a really half-assed MMO with bad textures. The menus broke right away for me and I had to restart. Character gets stuck inside of things everywhere and moves slowly despite everything being spread way apart and far away from everything else. Laggy with framerate isses. Free to play limits you to lvl 60 in skills so its another case of not really free to play. Requires you to give them your home location and other personal information to play the game for free. This kind of information doesn't help them make the game better and shouldn't be asked for ever. Not worth a try. There will be a game in the future that does the "everything in the world was crafted by the players" thing eventually... that game will be worth your time. This isn't that game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008421732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1456229440}
review:
The main positives of Mortal are it's first person perspective, marginally flexable skill system(but inflexable attribute system), and full loot sandbox world. Those are the only positives. 

When originally released in 2010 this game had potential, unfortunatley this potential has been squandered by poor development prioritization and an inability to bring the game's stability and playability up to a satisfactory state. 6 years on new players will notice that mortal online feels like any other game's alpha test, riddled with critical world breaking bugs that are created almost as fast as they are solved, leaving the game in a state of perpetual brokenness. 

The developers will say, "its better than it was on release!" and while that is true in some aspects, now there is far more in-game to be broken and the same percentage of content is broken as was on release. Ultimatley the current state of the game speaks for itself, to illustrate: nearly a year on from the second continent, sarducca's, release, guilds on the other side of the world are assigned ownership of towns on the wrong continent, due to a simple oversight to add a new coordinate system for the new continent. Countless similar problems in the game's foundations sit well documented yet the developers press on with adding trivial scribing minigames that will likely be broken within a year and not be fixed for another two.

The excuse for this is always that their (contracted) artists cant fix bugs in their game, or that only some of their programmers can fix bugs, and yet here we are 6 years on and those artists sit bored diluting the game's original gritty swedish art style with ugly capes, cartoony spike armor, rams with spikes intersecting player models, lizard mounts, halloween helmets, and phallic player houses. It's long past time when they should have fixed their priotoriazation, for artists to be fired and programmers to be hired for the express purpose of fixing all the game's issues, yet this has not been done, 6 years on. Instead, excuses are proffered where applicable and otherwise only silence is heard. 

You would think in a harsh full loot game measures would be taken to ensure when you lose everything, the game intended for you to die. Instead you will find yourself dying more often to client crashes, buggy ai, and hackers than other players(hackers who are often let back into the game by starvault only to be banned twice more). There is one area of the game that is polished enough to be enjoyed, and that is foot pvp, which is currently one of the only reasons large groups play the game. Even here, balance issues, node-wide crashes that leave dozens of people's clients crashed, and various other issues are rampant. The developers of this game rarely listen to community feedback, even when there was a dedicated balance testing team, they were largely ignored and it took teeth pulling for tiny numbers changes. The rare instances where Starvault makes changes suggested by the community, they shout it from the rooftops as if to try to paint a very different picture from the reality, "We listen sometimes!" Yeah, great.

Newbies will find that their first character will likely need to be deleted and remade unless they followed a guide, as of the tens of thousands of potential race, size, and age combinations, only about 6 are viable for combat, with a bit more room given to crafting characters whos attributes simply don't matter outside of int. Most crafting characters in MO are dull to play, taking up a whole character slot just for you to sit in town yellspamming your wares, assuming you don't take the sane route and simply keep that character logged off the majority of the time until you need him. 6 is an improvement from the 2 combat races that were viable on release, but when such a huge depth of customization is available, so few choices means the race system feels arbitrary and poorly balanced. Ultimatley the game's character system does not give the flexability to players that it claims to, in fact limiting it more and more as changes such as dex tiering are made, which causes dex to only matter at arbitrary milestones (110, 93, 119, 85 etc)

To top it off, Starvault maintains immense disrespect for the small playerbase by running their official forums poorly, advising moderators to ban anyone who is negative about the game. For example, "its not worth promoting the game in it's current state" will net you a ban. The game's forums are considered extremely toxic due to moderation that shuts down legitimate discussion while allowing trolling to thrive. Website ticket support answers only once every two emails you send, and in-game support is a mixture of unhelpfulness and complete incompetence. Expect to be lied to by game masters ingame, who despite their status don't understand basic gameplay mechanics and are a nightmare to deal with. Expect to be temporarily jailed by a game master if one of their buddies complains that you must have used cheats to kill their naked character. Expect policies as amazingly stupid as asking you to "contact a gm before you kill a boss mob" just to ensure the loot your entire group worked for appears at all. 

Client performance is poor, settings menus are often nonfunctional, and keybinding is a nightmare unless you edit the .ini text files which also happens to carry the penalty of an in-game permenant ban, if you are caught. Why they think editing a text file on your computer should be bannable speaks to their incompetence, and also the lack of functioning anticheat, demonstrated (there is no information or guides on how to cheat, exploit, or hack in my link or linked from my link, just a demonstration of the hacking issues that plague the game) here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZHuS_UhTdKY


It's possible that some point in the future that these issues will be fixed and i have heard that population has been staying at  stable since the massive dropoff, and i will update my review if that ever becomes the case. I do find myself coming back to this game repeatedly as i muse about what may have been fixed since i last played and all the wonderful mechanics in the sandbox that might work, but every time it becomes a case of "reroll a character, max him out, find out some obscure bug makes my intended playstyle unplayable, get annoyed and stop playing."

author: {'steamid': '76561198077528091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 78407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1701188489}
review: My favorite game of all time. Definitely not for the casual softcore player. I've been playing for the past three years probably over 1000 hours played. For someone who finds the most enjoyment out of sandbox full-loot games with skill based PvP this game takes the cake by far. I am yet to find a game that I have ever been able to dump as much time into as Mortal Online. If you don't like full loot pvp and don't have the patience for some minor bugs (small development team with a ton of heart and dedication) then you may not like this game. This game definitely has its niche which is why it is still around today. There has always been a core group of players who love and support this game including me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262295771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1455986069}
review:
Любил Ultima Online в далёком 1998ом?
Тогда эта ммо для тебя!
Помнишь,как в Британии тебя могли убить в любом месте,даже в городе?

author: {'steamid': '76561198059642989', 'num_games_owned': 1180, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 5245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5095, 'last_played': 1559399015}
review:
Mortal Online - пожалуй лучшая MMO RPG. 

- Вам надоели f2p, с донатом разной степени навязчивости?

- Вам надоел шаблонный геймплей, с небольшими вариациями качующий из игры в игру? 

- Вам надоело деление на зоны, постоянные загрузки локаций? 

- Устали от однообразной боевой механики в форме "соло на клавиатуре"?

- Надоели искусственный ограничения - сейф-зоны, невозможность облутать поверженного противника, отсутствие возможности разбиться или утонуть? 

- Вас всегда удивляло, почему из крыс и волков падают деньги или оружие? 

- Достали GPS и вездесущие телепорты?

________________________________________________________________

- Хочется большого бесшовного мира, который можно исследовать пешком или на животном?

- Хочется нетаргетированной боевки, со значительной долей экшн-составляющей? 

- Соскучились по реалистичной, глубокой и сложной ролевой системе, на манер Ultima Online и серии The Elder Scrolls?

- Хотите чувствовать постоянную опасность и адреналин, ведь вас в любой момент могут убить и забрать все ваше имущество?

- Желаете разветвленной и очень детализированной системы крафта, в которой трудно, но интересно, совершенствоваться?

- Не отказались бы от мрачного сеттинга, на манер раннего средневековья, в котором нет места бездумному буйству фантазии, где сдержанность и реализм определяют стиль?

- Являетесь сторонником модели p2p, когда каждый из игроков платит равную сумму ежемесячно, и получает одинаково равный доступ ко всем внутриигровым возможностям?

Тогда попробуйте Mortal Online. 

ПС: баги, глитчи, недоработки, пустоватость ландшафтов - все это присутствует, но, на мой взгляд, нивелируется достоинствами данной игры.

UPD: ребята за прошедший год сделали массу улучшений и дополнений, играть теперь еще более интересно, так что вперед, за подпиской!
UPD2: печалит, что разработчики занялись MO: Arena... И на основной проект то времени не хватало

author: {'steamid': '76561198031713642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1454702916}
review:
First Impression: Fun game, great concept, no levels, allows players to be super powerful by how much time they put into it, but; there are some downsides. 

First of all its F2P so players who pay obviously get the advantage. Also the combat system is a little wacky, and the tutorial is little to none. The world is vast and amazing, but only players who pay are allowed to explore it, since F2P players cant even get strong enough to kill the things outside the castle. Overall the game was a fun experience, i LOVE the concept of no levels and being able to get as strong as you want to be, but i just dont think the game is worth the subscription price. If you made the game pay once, and no subscription, and fixed the combat bugs and added more divercity and better terrain design, then it would be a game worth buying.

I do not recomment this game because it is a waste of time, unless you are willing to spend the money on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051503499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 8823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5243, 'last_played': 1535997579}
review:
Started playing this game after reading a story about a Spingbok named "NotaBear" and the perilous adventure of his master.
well... not exactly... it had been a few months, as i had read the reviews and alot of them were negative, and cried wolf alot...
Such as issues with hackers and etc.
So anyways, here is the viewpoint of a fresh player, whom wanted the "good old days" of MMoRPG's back but could not find it...

Seemingly, this game is all about PVP, anyone can kill you, anywhere, besides guarded zones. (they can still kill you just they will call forth the wrath of the GAURDS!)
Though, if you actually get past the beginning phase, (you are very low level, so your movement and various other skills are low so things take ages. though, you level up very rapidly just by walking/sprinting etc) you will notice, that outside of the towns is very sparse, there are player made castles scattered throughout the landscape, and most players you meet in the wild are just there to do their business, and avoid you....

This game brings back how MMO's used to feel, killing a mob was an accomplishment, getting that new skill to max level excited you, as you could now focus on more cool stuffs, and exploring the game didn't auto level you to the current zones levels automatically...
If you go too far too fast, a wolf will kill you, a spider queen will eat you, etc.
Also, just as with MMo's of the past, if you were skilled enough, you could do things that were insane.... 
Such as parrying every blow to previous spider queen, and manage to get some good stuffs instead of with a party etc.

This game emphasizes stats and skills, but it also promotes personal player skill aswell, if you suck, no weapon in the game will help you agains that newb in rags that can parry your attacks. 

Yes, its a challenge, Yes its painful, But why would you want to play if it was easy?

author: {'steamid': '76561198057986065', 'num_games_owned': 657, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1458446080}
review:
TL;DR
Good Game.
Shittier Community than most internets.
---------
That being said, the base game and idea behind it are quite good, if buggy at times. However, in the few years I have played and been a part of this community (Pre-Steam) I have yet to see any guild or players with good intentions last long. Combining exploitable mechanics such as "Blue-Blocking" to kill players without repercussion and, at least for awhile, corrupt moderators that would largely help their guild with said powers, and some donation bias, it is easy to see why this general attitude could have sprung up in the community. However, if you can find a solid group of people and deal with the sometimes....rather incompitent developers, this is one unique MMO I would suggest to anyone. It's PvP is fun, and over the patches can be either well balanced to entertainingly broken. (I'm looking at you mounted archery) The crafting system and player driven economy have the potential to be amazing, with flexibility in the materials and styles allowing players to make the epic items most other MMO's have premade. Again, the biggest thing inhibiting all this is the community, though. It is quite popular to keep the best weapon recipes a secert from the general public, and much of the robbery and attacks on the guilds in the game happen when the guild is largey offline. (In the style of Ark: Survival Evolved, Rust, etc.) Overall, it is worth a try, but you need a strong resiliance to bullshit to make it anywhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097260514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1459755990}
review: I can definetly reccomend this game to anyone who can pay the subscription. Mortal Online is first and formost a fantasy life-sim, and it's fucking awsome. But, without subscription you don't get access to the life-sim aspects of the game, that to my mind could make the game one of the best ever. There is no story, and no real quests, you can find a few odd jobs to do for NPC's but the game both pushes the idea of, and makes it extremely easy to join/make a guild, and use them to make money, and really just Role-play your life as a character in this world. Currently, I'm playing a mercenary who's traveling with a group of players who, Instead of going the combat rout, decided to become a caravan of traveling merchants, and it's fucking cool. If you can pay the subscription, you can build a guild, a home, and even a town if you feel the need to, and it's an increadable adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001612567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1454212446}
review:
After finding this offer online for free and giving it a shot for a straight run of seven hours I can summarize that this MMORP is a compromise. The game elements are easily identifieble and like any other MMORPG this one is 'pay to win' with the free accounts serving as a permanant trial, being unable to progress into a situation where your character has any chance against: guilded players marauding the countryside, lone horsemen murdurers, pick pockets, 'low level' griefers, fatigue free hostile animals and many more, I find it difficult to find the positive in a 'full loot' environment where 4+ hours of grinding can be erased with a stroke of another player's hand (or a mouse click rather)

The combat system is clunky. The animations are delayed on both attacking and defending making the victor 'he who has a lower ping' combined with 'he who has managed to attain a powerful weapon'. Stamina is easily depleted and forces the player to stop and stand in place, or submit to a static animation (sleep or sit) and 'ranking' it up requires well thrice more investment in time spent training one specific skill. (or multiple skills) and similar goes for the majority of the other 'skills' that I've learned about. Certain portion of the 'skill tree' seem redundant- for example, the multiple different kinds of anatomy studies acquired when skinning different animals, or the variation of wood type lore which all feel like a weighted shackle on the road to adventure.

This MMO failed to deliver me with a unique immersion and like other similar (LIFYO for example) it funnels down to a grinding game, which completely beats the notion of Role Playing to me and leaves me questioning the purpose of an anarchy situation. Are they hoping that the players create the story? And if so, how could they if they are always busy killing each other? - With guilds involved I was speculating this might be the answer but to my disappointment the guild scene is a closed clique party with most guild towns being locked under passowrd or a sassy toll.

If you are expecting an immersive story where you might create your character and bring it into a story based adventure, this is not your stop. - If you are, however, just looking for a grinding & power building game, this is it!

As far as the technicalities go;
The game world is detailed compared to other MMOs i've seen recently. It is however not as large as I've hoped it would be. (in 7 hours i've explored most of the main continent) The tutorial which grants you some basic items and skill knowledge is very to the point and fluid making it easy for everyone to understand. The time divisiion is quite fair, with night time not being too dark and day time not being too bright and the over-all scenery is very nice with how the moon is possibly the planet and the game world being the moon in this setup (speculation only). 

In short, I feel that this game focuses too much on statistics, attirbutes and other red tape rather than the immersion of adventure and discovery which is why I feel it's less RPG and more MMO and I would not recommend it at this point of writing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013307137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 52915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51017, 'last_played': 1449947997}
review:
Cons- 1.CRAZY GRIND, like crazy grind...to get anything you need to quit life and live on your computer.
          2.Dost thou like pvp? Great!, deal with rubberbanding and horrendous hit detection. Oh and archery is basically shooting a gun with bullet drop.
          3.Water= So broken it hard resets my computer, only game to ever do it. I don't own a potato.(It is so poorly                      introduced swimming and water should be removed.
          4. All 400 of the active community have aids. Greedy pricks.
          5. Some GM's abuse their huge e-peen. Much violation, such gape.
          6. Back to point 1, most of my hours logged were spent mining. Manual mining, getting my donks greifed.
          7. Broken Blue/Red murder system. Not enough consequence so everyone is KoS.
          8. "What m8, I Hit your head but combat log says I hit you in the foot?" <----point number 2.
          9. Travelling in this game is a joke. you need to spend primary points to be able to ride a horse quickly. lowering your combat build should you choose to NOT be a mounted combat char. Thus leaving you to walk around like a peasant.
          10. DISMOUNT AXES? really. not..like.....spears????.....halberds? axes.double axes dismount calvary.MUCH CLARITY. But dismount axes some flatline bullshit chance to dismount based on how expensive the weapon is.Recently MAGES can now 100% auto dismount with earthquake (earthquake is an AoE) 
          11. Community is aids so you need to make 4 accounts just to get any sort of production going.1 char to be a butcher, 1 to be a foot soldier, 1 to be a mage, 1 to be a fatmage,1 to be an armorcrafter, 1 to be a weaponcrafter, 1 to be a cook...its actually genius how they force you to create so many ugly characters.
          12. Personal oppinion, but the Roman theme is ugly as sin. Horribly implimented, ugly ugly ugly.
          13. AI is dumb as shit. Sh*t is smarter than this AI. I apologize to sh*t.

Pro`s
           1. They spent way too much time on the sky, its amazing.. weather system is in too..but its broken and extremely lacking in organic performance. You see no clouds but its raining...FOG and clouds but no rain...silly. lots of stars.
           2. At least they let you AFK macro to level up skills. Unfortunately alot of people have trainers and hacks too...Mostly  the russian players...scrubs hack with infinite stamina and abuse lag switching.


Even the pro`s have con`s, Basically... to get anywhere in this game I gave up my personal life, my gym time, brushing my teeth, eating, all so i could get more time to bang rocks to turn into metals to make armor and weapons. Then find out there is like no more fights. When there is a fight its a fucking zerg fest. 1 month later i realize they are full of false promiises and gave up. Fanboys have been playing since release and wont let this bowl of d1cks die. NOT WORTH AAA SUBSCRIPTION PRICE. honestly... i focking hate world of warcraft, i would rather play world of warcraft.

Die mortal online, die.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038179579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5621, 'last_played': 1482805534}
review:
Mortal Online will have momments where you smile a smile of peer joy, just to have that smile wiped of your face by a random player who saw you heading towards town. They will attack you and probably kill you for no reason other than to see what loot you had or just to prove their better then someone new to the game i guess.
     While the Game itself has one of the best concepts and a decent excution of a full loot sandbox many players will find it to frustrating to  really enjoy. The community is aweful, the worst i have ever experienced in any game i have ever played. Just look at the forumns and youll get an idea of what im talking about. Thats not to say everyone playing mortal is aweful, but 60%of players will kill you just to kill you and 85% will kill you if they think it will get them good loot. 
   I have come to enjoy the game over all for the momments when that player that attacked you bit of more then they can chew or when you stumble on a robbery in progress just in time to turn the battle into a win for the innocent. This game isnt for everyone. Heck, its not going to be for most but few hardcore games are. 
PROS
*Combat system is both fun and "skill" really can help.
*Every interaction with a player is exciting.
*Player driven economy/world
*Really cool and refreshing skills gaining mechanic( you have to use it to get better)
*Havent done much crafting myself but there is really awesome depth to it.
CONS
*Full loot means a death can set you back hours..
*The Community is aweful
*There are still exploits
*Blue blocking ( This is when a player jumps infront of your attack so you hit them, now they can kill you with out being a murder.)

Overall
This game is fun but its def not for everyone but its free to try and if you like it Sub because your not gonna make it if you dont.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017510528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1452413507}
review: Поддержки Русского языка нет и не планируется. Возможность играть появляется только после оплаты подписки, до этого доступно только 60% контента. Оплатить подписку и прочее возможно только кредитной картой в системе, приготовьтесь, PayPal, в этой системе воруют как дышат, вернуть средства у них не возможно, запрашиваются все данные, в плоть до свидетельства о рождении, требуют приписки кредитной карты.Вывод не утешителен, эта игра не для Русско язычного сегмента интернета и никогда таковой не станет.Графика слабая, багов море, концепция игры просто изумительная, это единственное что в ней привлекло.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109834051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1453647615}
review:
Do not bother with this game.

Poor graphics quality aside, as a new player you will have your stuff stolen repeatedly by players runnign in front of you whilst you are trying fight enemies. This will then turn you criminal when you accidentally hit them allowing them to kill you without consequence and steal all your stuff. 

You can always file a support ticket though right? Not unles you are willing to wait hours whilst being in game. What a joke.

Definately do not recomend this game. This is not a steep learning curve, it is players using exploits to steal your things.
developer_response:
Stay tuned!
We have a fix for this coming in the next patch. It's one of the most common complaints we get from new users.
Thanks to feedback like this we can however make changes to sort it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035155827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 62946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23284, 'last_played': 1691495172}
review:
Очень интересная игра с богатым набором возможностей и игровыми трудностями, в хорошем смысле этого слова, которые делают эту игру «хардкорной». «Нон таргетовая» система требующая прохождение вашего меча именно через текстуру врага, промахнулся – значит промахнулся. Упор боевой системы делается не на то какое у вас оружие либо броня, хотя тоже играет роль, и не на то на сколько прокачан ваш персонаж, прокачать которого может любой за 1-2 недели, а главным образом на вашу личную тактику ведения боя. Как вы двигаетесь, когда бежите, когда прыгаете, куда бьете и как. 
Очень глубоко проработанная система крафта: оружие, броня, зелья, еда. Громадный выбор материалов. И только найдя баланс между вложением ресурсов и рецептом, который нужно самому вывести – есть счастье. 
Из сложностей, из-за которых за годы моей игры люди уходили из игры могу выделить:
- Песочница, нет квестов, нет заданий ты сам ищешь себе занятие, если не можешь и не хочешь играть в месте скоро наскучит.
- необходимость покупки подписки для любителей пвп, очень серьезный перевес между проплаченным аккаунтом и не проплаченным в пвп и крафте. 60% эффективности всех скилов.
- фул лут. При вашей смерти с вас выпадает абсолютно все: броня, оружие все содержание карманов, деньги и даже ваша голова и тело =) И врагу достается все 100% что у вас было.
- отсутствие безопасной зоны, вас могут убить где угодно.
- отсутствие в игре карты, из навигации есть только компас.
- чат работает только на английском языке. Локальный в паре метров вокруг вас, гильдейский и чат помощи в котором можно писать только по-английски никакого русского английскими буквами – бан в чате.
Из общий наблюдений новички которые с самого начала не прислушиваются к старичкам и наступают на теже грабли что до них другие вскоре уходят.
Есть такое высказывание что в игру играют либо 1-2 месяца либо все время, и потом не могут найти замену. На мой счет игра стоит того чтобы занять достойное место на вашей полке активно юзаемых игр. 

http://steamcommunity.com/app/287920/guides/#scrollTop=194 В гайдах можно прочитать более подробный обзор.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013728473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1453060108}
review:
This game is not worth the time even though it's sort of free. It took me an hour to get out of the tutorial and that was not because I couldn't understand it. It was because of three things:

1) The confusing skill/interface system. I was supposed to gather leather from skinned pigs, right? Well, clicking the skill icon in the skills pane and trying to drag them to my hotbar worked half the time. Sometimes it would just drop the icon. It just wasn't clear on what I was supposed to do with it.

2) Walking and running are SLOW. Even though you're supposed to train yourself over time, you walk at the same pace you'd crouchwalk in other games. Running is not even noticeably faster and drains your stamina. It's useless.

3) The arrow that tells you where to go for quests misleads you. It pointed me in a zig zag pattern. One moment, it said go to this area. I'd go there, then it'd jerk to the left and say go that way. Then again to a different area.

This game is designed for hardcore MMO lovers. It is not meant for someone looking to relax. Any minor activity takes an excruciating amount of time. Players can kill you and take everything you have. It's not fun. If you're into getting punished, go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075068721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 76309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59845, 'last_played': 1506381428}
review:
I played almost 1000 hours. The positive side is this game is amazing except bugs and crashes. The idea is same with ultima online. 

But, i had 2 subbed char 5 slots so i played almost with full efficiency. I built my first town, my banker got lost every 10 minutes couldnt use bank i had to call gm 10 times in a day because they said you built on a node line. Why there is a house spot on a node line? it is not my fault please move bank because we didnt know. They said no you have to deal with that problem we dont give a shit. 

So i built another town in another continent name sarducca. Again a node line. Can not build any shit in our territory because they say they blocked it. wasted like 3000 gold. they say they wont help. So why put house spots just near the node lines? 

I dont even talk about rotten community. ***If you are newbie and just started the game, you will get blue blocked in first 30 minutes in graveyard trying to kill walking dead.*** THEY MADE AN UPDATE THAT YOU CAN NOT ATTACK BLUE TAGGED PEOPLE IN OPTIONS. LIKE 5 YEARS LATER. THANK YOU. Because this is how human being is. they are all rotten. 

Just dont waste your time with that game. They dont give a shit about their customers. 

By the way every old player of that game, they know all exploits and they will use exploit on you. i got killed inside my house because if you push from door of house you are able to see through door and you can aim with magic and they can kill you like this. they can log off near the wall and login, when they go log in they will login top of the wall. 

So dont make that mistake. 

Play something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154228320', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1452987992}
review:
Started the game. Got some loot after grinding then went to gather some water and my toe hit the water and it sucked me right in and I drowned then I went to a priest to revive and after that I went to get my loot back and water had sucked my loot into a void and I couldnt get them back. The community is pretty toxic aswell. My friend got blueblocked then killed and I asked: "Why did you have to do that?" and he replied with "Because he deserves it so do you fag". 

Its a okay game if you have no life and just want to grind and grind after dying and dying.
Not a game for me but maybe you will find it interesting. Afterall its a free game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060592373', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2203, 'last_played': 1453579562}
review:
玩的了EVE、MC、EQ这种一死回到解放前的游戏，玩凡间在线就轻松自如了。
大陆玩家必须得挂VPN，这个比较烦，但是挂上VPN之后，一切都很好。
从贴吧进了个群，进了个华人军团，来自宇宙各个角落的华人在TS里欢聚一堂，太温馨不能忍，聊天都像过年一样……
马来西亚的呀、香港、台湾、美国啥啥的哪儿都有，聊天聊着聊着就聊到吃的喝的大宝剑了。
可惜的是这个游戏跟每一款不容易上手的游戏都一样，那就是没有女玩家。别说你能接受可爱的人妖，女性角色都并不好看。。。满屏幕的几乎都是彪形大汉。。。
游戏中战斗、光线、武器护甲都很赞，但是也没有百科里说的那么邪乎。。。据说不会刷新的、杀了就没了的飞龙啊什么的，早就被老玩家杀光了绝种了，现在只能养养马溜溜狗，不过也有不少很酷炫的魔物可以做坐骑。
现在华人军团准备造城堡来着，创造自己的历史吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198006902565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 17160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3202, 'last_played': 1625199949}
review:
BEST MMORPG i've played since Shadowbane.   Was tired of the world of warcraft EZ mode...i wanted something real.
Well, put 10 hours into this, and LEARN/STUDY and you will NOT walk away from this.  Its brutal, hardcore...and you will get lost beyond lost in dungeons/the world around you.

2 BIG thumbs up!!! MORTAL 4 LIFE!!! Adults only!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024029689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 52689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18343, 'last_played': 1455572073}
review:
This game had a lot of potential but destroyed by the poor developers and GMs who dont support their players. You will spend hours farming materials only to walk out of an area to have your pet carrying your loot disapear into the ground or walls of random objects and then randomly start dieing. When you put in a support ticket they say they dont deal with dead pets...as if that is the real issue. GMs don't respond 1/2 the time and just automatically close support requests. 

Plain and simple this game has been out for years and yet 1/2 the time u cant even walk up stairs u have to jump they havent even got the basics corrected and they have the nerve to have players pay to play and not even support them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095905123', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1452763250}
review:
Начитался отзывов, вдохновился, скачал игру. Запускаю. На экране ввода логина и пароля уже лагает. Окей, логинюсь, с мучениями и матами создаю персонажа, захожу в игру. И тут же охреневаю. Графика 2003 года, прорисовка персонажей времен Морровинда, но фпс просел аж до 5-ти. Захожу в настройки, убираю все эффекты, все ползунки сдвигаю в левый край. Ничего не изменилось. Скидываю разрешение на самый минимум. +2 фпс. Смачно сплевываю и закрываю игру. Полез в интернеты пошарить по форумам. Везде жалобы на оптимизацию. Точнее, на её отсутствие. 
З.Ы.  Комп не топовый, но новые игрушки тянет на средняках. А тут такое. Фу.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991696484', 'num_games_owned': 2166, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1452487545}
review:

This is the kind of game that rewards players who want to spend many hours getting strong so they can camp newb areas to get easy kills.

I got killed in a starting area town by someone with full armor who could run ~3 times as fast as me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210821837', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 16906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5223, 'last_played': 1641553408}
review: MORTAL ONLINE ? Что я могу сказать о ней в двух словах . В 2000 г . я познакомился с удивительной игрой Ultima Online. На мой взгляд , все ММО вышедшие после , во многих аспектах были далеки от нее . Такого геймплея и проработанности я больше не увидел, ни в одной игре . И вот достойная наследница UO . MORTAL ONLINE лучшая игра  из всех , что я видел за последние 15 лет , даже не смотря на все ее баги и недоработки . Это сугубо мое мнение !

author: {'steamid': '76561198141320245', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 41374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26202, 'last_played': 1616732763}
review:
Completely rewriting review.

Although it's been months since i've played, it's a game I do miss. It's not for the faint of heart, and you will die. But I've had many hours of entertainment throughout my time. I was never the greatest at PVP, but I could hold my own long enough to either escape or get an alliance member there to provide backup. Thieves are amazing, but once people learn your username it's time to move out of that town. In this game there is no honor among thieves, they will push you hoping you're hidden grey. I believe shortly before I quit they revamped the stolen item system though. People camping Tindrem gates for new players is moreso a myth, unless it's picked up the past few months. I didn't kill anyone unless they became a threat, our alliances were at war, or they'd personally wronged a friend/ally. However people typically attacked my Mounted Archer on sight because he was a sp00ky red character.

This map to my knowledge still needs exploring. A high ranking member of my alliance had found a hidden dungeon which we had never encountered anyone else at. I believe only around 9 players in our alliance had stepped foot in it by the time I'd quit. The boss room took all 9 of us to do and due to the large number of spellcasters we'd still suffered 2 casualties our first few times through.

I will return when I have the money to subscribe again, as I've begun to miss one of the few games which doesn't baby its players.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198067082266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1504860766}
review:
Lag Simulator 2016


In comparison to TERA and Planetside 2, I can run both at 50 fps with Medium / Low Settings when surrounded by numerous players. MO just simply won't run without stuttering on Awful settings. Its just not playable for some people.

Furthermore, the open pk system will restrict player's progress. I never made it through graveyard, towns without getting killed. I tried to speed run the process buts it's nearly impossible.




Developers say that blueblocking is a mechanic that can be avoided, but what happens when a group of griefers surrounds you and the mob you are attacking? If you push too much against other players, you get flagged as a criminal, if you hit any of the players surounding you , you get flagged as a criminal.  

I don't see how blueblocking can be avoided when you get surrounded by 6 ~ 7 players intent on fucking your day over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021640215', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 79750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47943, 'last_played': 1627824613}
review:
I've probably played a total of 2500-5000 hours, the majority of them pre-steam.

So much unused potential.

One only has to go as far as check the reviews and steamcharts of this game to see the sucess of the steam release.

http://steamcharts.com/app/287920

For the past one to two years they've been progressing backwards in development effectively removing features from the game.

The game lacks sufficient funding and competent developers in order for the game to be developed at an acceptable phase. A certain stubborn CEO made sure the steam release wouldn't succeed.

There's so many placeholders in the game of content that hasn't been released yet being added into the game over three years ago.

A proper magic system,Tailoring,Fletching,Sarduccan papyrus,pottery and the list goes on.

A toxic and stubborn community. Granted the game was released back in 2010 and a big portion of the people that still play the game have been since release.

Anything negative posted about the game on the forums will end in a swift locked thread and anything too critical will be terminated. The Mortal Online Forums has a no tolerance policy for negative criticism. The Forums are regulated in a similar fashion of an oppressive regime.

Are you willing to play a game which is basically in a pre-alpha stage with various bugs such as items in your inventory becoming invisible same for your bank, pets getting stuck,enemies being invulnerable to damage and mind you all of these issues exist in a full loot pvp game. And getting help usually takes a very long time.Aswell as having to deal with a support team that's terrible.

Overall the game suffers from lack of funding,incompetent develeopment,support team and the CEO has personally interfered with the game disregarding what's best for the game in order to fulfill his ''vision''.

Also.. The game's lore is supposedly written in 'Advanced Swedish' a language unknown to myself and being a swede myself that's rather odd. Appearently they haven't been able to find a person to translate it for the past 5 years.

The game lost roughly 81% of the steam population during the first 4 months of it being released.
The population of the game is not large enough to support the ingame economy that it is designed to have forcing everyone to be self sufficient, subscribe 1-2 accounts and have 4 character slots each and you have to pay.



[table]
    [tr]
        [th]This Game is[/th]
        [th]poop[/th]
    [/tr]

author: {'steamid': '76561198007308888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1451372592}
review:
I've played just about every MMO out there and have several thousand hours invested in playing them (Over 2000+ hrs in Rift + ArcheAge on Steam alone) and this one is just painful..

A couple of my major gripes..

1) Graphics look like they are from the Everquest days. However, the inexusable part is the terrible modeling done by the designers. The textures/models  are so heavily reused.. they need some variety and stop painting the world with the same generic rock terrains. 

A simple example was the frill grass poking up from the starting towns fountain.. just raise the base height to hide the frill. That's just lazy modeling by the developers. It looks terrible to have the grass poking out of the middle of a stone fountain.. (Which used the same stone texture without any shaders.. Very ugly to look at - Ingame is far uglier than the screenshots)

2) Combat was ok.. The fact that archery hits are calculated client side on the archer's machine is a bit annoying. It doesn't account for leading or latency. 

I admit that I didn't give it much time to get into deeper aspects of combat, but I can't get past how ugly the game is.. 

3) Min/Max builds only - It seems the game has only a few viable builds, though it offers numerous skills. So, this leaves most people with a cookie cutter planner for maxing their toon.. It seems you end up with a minimum of three characters to experience the full gameplay  - One PvP, and two crafters.  

This was off putting for me.. I have a full schedule, so leveling / managing three characters is not appealing. I prefer to have one character that I can spend building up.. I really don't want to waste time switching characters just to keep the cash flowing - that seems like just a time sink to avoid creating content. 

If you enjoy hardcore pain.. (Such as drowning in a fountain, lol) You might like this one, but if you are like me and want to play a game that is less work and more entertainment, then stay away. The full loot and heavy PvP lured me in to give it a try.. but ultimately, it was just too ugly to give it much of a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006687640', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3548, 'last_played': 1543436936}
review:
Good Concept. Bad execution.

The game's concept of doing what you want with massive freedom sounds great. 

But in the end you're limited by a constant grind for levels that take days to train, and people that can take it all away from you in a matter of seconds. The idea is good, but there is no way on earth people are willing to spend so much time on somthing and then be back to square one. 

The game does a good idea of being harsh on the player, and that's okay. but when it nullifys 30 hours of gameplay, that's when it starts to become total bullshit.

Please, spend some time on this game to fix it's beginners expereance, this game could do well, but it's community is the worst and a lot of the execution is poor.

Bad game all in all right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073262970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3003, 'last_played': 1450839258}
review:
I am actually enjoying this game but I don't understand why monster/animal animations are so bad, they do not match the hit, feels like it's laggy or bugged, some people told me it's been like that for 4 years+ and it doesn't look like it's going to get fixed. 

Don't get me wrong, I love combat system, it requires skill and timing, punishes you for trying to spam attacks or not blocking properly, but honestly when it comes to kill monsters most of them have animations that don't match the hits, you get hit and then the attack animation shows up, or the opposite, you see the animation is coming so you try to block and you get hit right after.

Everything else looks great tho, exploring is amazing, the game actually looks good (do not trust youtube videos, it looks better than that), skill system is amazing, crafting is great. 

PS: If you are new to the game (like me) play safe in Tindrem, level some skills, earn some money and read some books, make friends in there, try to join a guild and then leave that city, it is full of griefers and most people quit the game because they don't know where else to go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070198354', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2325, 'last_played': 1450896197}
review:
Mortal Online é um jogo diferente de qualquer MMO e apesar do visual um pouco antigo, tem potencial pra impressionar. É sandbox, mundo aberto e hardcore.

Uma característica marcante do jogo é a liberdade, não há necessariamente uma escolha de classes. Ao terminar o tutorial, você pode escolher uma " profissão " como Domador, com foco no controle dos animais, que vão desde cavalo até montarias impressionantes, Ferreiro que tem foco no crafiting, entre outras. Não significa que você passará o resto do jogo com elas, é apenas uma ajuda no início pra facilitar um pouco sua vida. O que vai definir o quão bom você será em tal profissão é o nível da suas skills, que aumentam conforme você pratica elas ou lê livros em segundo plano com assuntos relacionados as skills em foco. Por isso, não ache que vai começar o jogo domando uma montaria de guerra ou fabricando espadas com alto dano, é necessário tempo e prática para tal.  

Ao terminar o tutorial e escolher a " profissão " o jogo é livre e você pode fazer o que você quiser. Normalmente, você vai querer matar alguns zombies no cemitério de Tindrem, colher o loot deles e fazer algum dinheiro com isso, comprar uma armadura simples, uma boa arma e até uma montaria. Quando se cansar disso, sinta-se livre para sair de Tindrem. Eistem várias cidades, como Meduli e Vadda, que apresentam mais variedade de recursos que Tindrem. Você pode ainda ir para Sarducca, um deserto com alguns cidades e, segundo os jogadores, com bastante oportunidades para fazer dinheiro. Juntar-se a uma guild e participar de guerras e disputas por territórios também é uma opção. Se quiser ganhar a vida matando outros players, mesmo que inocentes, tem total liberdade para isso. Existem várias formas de se jogar Mortal Online, basta explorar o jogo e elas apareceram. 

Vou deixar algumas dicas que podem ajudar caso esteja começando a jogar:

Cuidado com os jogadores de nome vermelho, são chamados de Reds e costumam matar com frequência pessoas inocentes.
Deixe tudo de valor no banco da cidade. Você pode morrer com facilidade e perder tudo que produziu.
Guia Complete Beginners Guide to Mortal Online: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=519329793
Mapa do jogo ( não há um mapa dentro do jogo, apenas uma bússola ): http://www.mortalonlinemap.info/
Outro guia: http://guidescroll.com/2013/03/mortal-oanline-nave-beginners-guide/

Boa sorte!

author: {'steamid': '76561198137079189', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1223, 'last_played': 1517436454}
review:
Ive never seen elf vagene before until I played this.. Like wtf..

I recommend it for these reasons as a newbie who has no idea what he is doing after spending a fair few hours into the game.

+ You can tame a horse,
+ You can run around naked
+ You can go where ever you please,
+ You can kill any player you like in town center but then you have to suffer the consequences of all the guards attacking you,
+ Being Dead is kinda cool,
+ VOIP in an mmorpg? Awesome
+ Combat is decent,
+ It is like skyrim gameplay but more hardcore
+ It is very hardcore and may be a bit too hard for some as there is few basic tutorial but no hand holding and nothing to really guide you or anything this is good for people who are sick of games that are like only tell you what to do and basically you end up playing the game following what the game wants you to do rather than what you want to do. In this game you do what you want to do
+ You feel so free in this game, you dont feel held back
+ Graphics are pretty nice when turned up (if you can run it)
+ This game feels truly massive, as in you feel like you need a horse just to get any where it feels like your off on an adventure
+ Soundboards in town is fun you can make a party with other players happen
+ So much crafting and learning
So much to do. 
You can eat yourself
+ Swords, Magic, bow.. 
+ Its sorta like lord of the rings esque type of game in a way like open world and swords and magic and stuff..
+ Feels so free, you don't feel held back freedom is nice

Cons: Stuff you may not like
- Graphics do look a bit dated
- It is a resource hog this game, requires lots of rams and gpu memory
- Its a little too hardcore and i dont understand quests or anything
- You need to pay subscription if you play a lot so you dont feel held back when it comes to some parts of the game such as the building thing and erm levels
- It is a little too easy to get lost even in town
- Game is maybe a bit too big in some ways it feels overwhelming when you starting to realize how much you do in this game and how much you need to do just to get started.
-After a few basic tutorials game is like.. kk hav fun m8.. No guidance or anything.
-Lack of tutorials and walkthrough on youtube its so hard to get going in this game
- Maybe a bit too time consuming and your like oh shizwak i gotta go to bed because im working soon and i havent slept
- Solo is overwhelming, best off with a friend
- Lack of enterable places like in town your pretty much always outside. Apart from the bank but thats pretty much it
- Even cutting trees down for logs in this game can be a tough thing to figure out
- Help chat doesn't give you enough time - usage for getting going in this game you have so many questions to ask but yet this game refuses to really give you help with that
- How the hell does magic work in this game?

I need to play this again soon.. Hopefully i will be doing when i get some pc upgrades.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961650401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1445731133}
review:
I installed this game two times, created three characters, and have unistalled for the last time.  I wanted to love this game, I really did.  I love sandbox style playing but this was so unbearably painful, I wasted hours just wandering and accomplishing anything.

I installed in initially and found out my computer was not capable of playing with good FPS but I tried.  After dying once, it took my 30 minutes to make it to the resurrection priest due to the video lag.  Once I upgraded my computer, I had great FPS, not that the graphics are that good, but I wanted to love this game so I overlooked it.

I was invited to a guild/clan whatever and was given basic instructions on how to get to their town.  I was killed so many times that I decided to walk for hours as a ghost so that I wouldn't die so much.  I walked in the world for 2 days, real days, about 4 hours each day searching for this town and got so lost, I deleted the character and started over again. 

This time I was determined to like this game by not leaving the town I started in and level up going into the graveyard.  This is where the irritation set in.  You need to kill zombies and skeletons and then hurry as fast as possible to collect your loot because people just stand around you waiting and then steal it.  When they are not doing that, they purposely jump in from of you trying to make you hit them so you become wanted and the town guards kill you.  Once you die in the graveyard, good luck walking around finding the closest resurrection priest, there isn't one very close, then you have to go back.

Man I wanted to love this game, but alas I cannot.  Even as I write this, I want to redownload and try again, but I guess I'm too old now to have 15 hours a day to put into gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967594816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6158, 'last_played': 1443890451}
review: Mortal Online is a great overall game. At first it may seem very hard to get into due to most other games giving less freedom such as giving classes while Mortal doesn't. The major problem is even though Mortal is free to play whithout paying for a sub you will never be good at anything because you can't max out skills with out a sub. So if you are a competitive gamer and want to get into Mortal you should expect to pay around $20.USD and an extra $15.USD every month for a sub. Another thing is mostly everyone in Motal are dicks so unless you have other friends to play with or you get lucky like me and find a guild with lots of vetern players to help you and try to recruit you, your not going to have a good time. Lastly Mortal online requires an insane amount of in game time to get good, so inless your looking for a game to put all your time into Mortal isn't for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019156634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2625, 'last_played': 1494402076}
review:
Put a fair amount of time into the game and this is what I got out of it.

Free to play accounts or "unlimited trial accounts" are a gimped feature. If you aren't going to pay for the game don't bother playing it you won't be strong enough to kill most mobs, and you definitely won't be able to kill most players.

Griefing is incredibly serious, the only hardcore part of it is blue blocking. If you plan on trying to grind up gold as a noob you'll be in the tindrem graveyard, if you're there there are always players trying to grief you. They will run at max pay2win speed and stand in front of you or attempt to sprint into your swing from the side so they can then kill you, steal all your shit and receive no penalty for doing this. I realize it says it's a hardcore game but this isn't something that should be allowed, gm's should ban for this but they refuse to take any kind of action for it and instead the community just says "STOP CRYING GET GOOD." This isn't how you bring players into a game that is clearly dying, this isn't how you introduce new gamers into a great genre of games. If the admins/gm's don't wise up and start banning people for blue blocking this game is dead in 1-2 years tops.


Would not reccomend to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003965048', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1520630677}
review:
>Start game
>Everything chugs like it's on max settings (HINT for Game Devs: you have graphics settings for a reason. Please let us have them sooner.)
>Attempt to create character
>Takes 3 times as long as it needs because of lag and mouse jumpiness
>Finally give up and throw something together so I can get in game and lower settings
>Go back to character select screen because why would I want to play the character I just made?
>Finally press play
>Oh, god, loading times
>Wait for tutorial popup to register that I have closed it
>Wait for ESC menu to register that I have opened it
>Click on Preferences
>Click on Graphics
>Game freezes
>Sigh
>Uninstall game
developer_response:
You can set the graphics in the launcher before starting the game.
Click the options button.
