author: {'steamid': '76561198085584364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1448326290}
review:
This game is fun! I been getting into sandboxes recently and for a Free game, this is by far one of the better ones.
You literally need other players to help you out in this game. You CAN solo, but to get that Bow that is better, you need someone to make you it. For better armor? Have someone make it. Yeah, you can by them at Brokers and some low level stuff. But you are best getting it from players.

I am no Veteran to this game however. I only played it for a few days, and so far, my only concern with it is...

My FPS, no matter what, is ALWAYS low. It does not start off that way, it just randomly happens over time. Like 20-40 minutes into the game. I will go from running smoothly to can even move because I get .58-5.00 FPS Its ALWAYS in red.
After the first two times that happen, it never goes about 24 now. The game became unplayable. I figured my computer is not good enough for it. BUT that is my only bad thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961221844', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1185, 'last_played': 1450843929}
review:
Please be advised of the time I've spent playing this game. This is by no means a final word or even opinion. I have plenty to learn and plenty to dig into with this game still so if my opinions change then I'll update.

With that all said... As someone who was around for Ultima Online during the Felucca golden age, this scratches that itch. It scratches it in risk vs reward, in depth and complexity of both world and mechanics, and it scratches that old wild west itch with perceived earnestness. 

If any of you reading this even understands what I just wrote then you should just give it a shot. I'm so glad that I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999916745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1441818805}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005818722', 'num_games_owned': 1579, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1207, 'last_played': 1453940759}
review:
This review is not going to be about the game so much. The game is old, but parts of it are interesting despite this, the skill system, the combat system, this is all fine.

What ruins it are the people.

DM's who actively support the abuse of their flag system to allow high end players to gank new players with no reprecussions.

A HELP community, who also actively supports this.

No way for a new character to leave the main town without being killed, the guild ROT tends to hang out outside it and murders any players who leave.

There might be some good players, somewhere, but if they are there they have been ineffecitve at stemming the tide. This game actively promotes griefing against new players, and deserves to die. Help it do so.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962138623', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1449057230}
review:
I know it says I played for 1.2 hours, and frankly I'm shocked it kept my attention for that long.  I've long known the Unreal Engine was trash, almost akin to the horrid Arma engine the bug-infested, clunky tragedy known as DayZ is built upon.  I thought, "Well these people have made a game that some speak highly of, it seems to be riddled with awesome features and I love the freedom described.  Maybe they actually made something good out of UE!"

...  Nope.  At first it wasn't bad... although running felt like walking, and sprinting felt like... walking.  According to the built-in "GPS" arrow navigation... "thing", I calculated my full-on sprint speed at about 1.3m/s.  Iunno about you guys, but my 5 year old can sprint faster than that.  

But I got over the twelve minutes to get to the first "quest" giver and was finally able to draw my sword and try my hand at the combat.  Wasn't bad, I gotta say.  Killed a few piggies.  Actually put a little faith back in me... so I did another 12 minute "sprint" to the town gates and was given a bow for returning captain whats-his-name's dagger. (Actually wanted the dagger, damnit...).

I equipped the bow and 25 nub arrows, thought to myself "Awhhhhh this is gonna be sweet!", took aim at a tree about 25 meters in front of me for a nice practice shot, and as I held the LMB to draw the bow, my characters arm did some wierd bending backwards thing like he was trying to grab his elbow.  Just looked downright goofy.  I thought, "Oh god, really?"...  I released the LMB to fire my arrow at full draw...  It went about 10 meteres and hit the dirt at a 90 degree angle..  That's right...  Either gravity is excessive in this midieval world, or the bow and arrow I was given as my starting weapon is basically a twig with a rubber band drawstring.  

Not to mention the noob help chat (Nifty feature btw) was literally OVERRUN with people complaining about the high level, veteran players slaughtering them everywhere.  Between the horrid graphics, absolute lack of detail in the character animations, overcomplicated interface and what I feel is simply a lack of effort on the part of the developers making this game, I honestly don't understand how they can sell subscriptions for $14 a month with a straight face, nor can I understand why anyone actually buys it.

To each is own...  If ya like it, ya like it... but if you're thinking about trying it, just know this is basically a shining example of how bad Unreal Engine really is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067399388', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 21543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4964, 'last_played': 1687439985}
review:
Alright, I previously had a bad review on this game.

What can I say? The first impressions were less than great, especially when I couldn't log in the game for any apparent reason for months.
Oddly enough, the next day after posting that review, suddenly I'm able to log on. Coincidence? 



So, after actually getting to play and experience the game, here's what I have to say:

First, I'm sincerely glad I gave it another try. The experience of this game is like none other, that's the truth.

The world of Nave is a bittersweet landscape, a twist of beauty and terror. You can explore EVERYTHING, you can FIGHT everything. However, EVERYTHING is DANGEROUS.

Swimming is dangerous, pvp is hell, standing in a desert or blizzard is deadly, your friends are deadly, the city guards are out to get you if you aren't careful.      This game should be titled:  50000 ways to die in an MMO.

The enivronment is gorgeous.  The land is huge, the water is breath-taking (literally), the sky is awespiring, the cities are quite regal (Though I wish we could enter more buildings than a bank.) The Music is very attractive and helps you connect to the game.

The combat system is an amazement. Some people say it's basic and boring,  I say it's quite tactical.  In WoW you can macro everything you want to do to a single key-press and spam it.   In Mortal Online, you have to AIM for weak spots with your weapon.   The combat of this game is more engaging than ANY I have encountered, even in console single-player games.

The major downside of this game is that the community is very, very toxic. I recommend finding a guild as soon as possible to help remedy this. (Shout out to my HERO friends!) After joining the HERO guild, they immediately took me under-wing, taught me more about the game and have been very patient with me. 


There are some limitations to the game for free to play players.  However with enough skill, know-how, and knowledge of the game itself and what gear it has to offer, a F2p can go toe-to-toe with a P2p any day. It's all about reaction time and accuracy. 

Soon I will begin toying around with construction, we'll see how that goes.

Apologies to the developers for my harsh words on my first review of this game, (frankly it was deserved with 2 months of unavailable play.)  But it's okay. The game speaks for itself, and I'm glad I get to be a part of it. 

Keep doing what you do, StarVault.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087859504', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 204991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144894, 'last_played': 1629221623}
review:
Updated review
Still negitive but not as much...
Mortal is going "In Opinion" is going downhill yet again...
with mortal royal and seb working on his cat game theres no time put in to updates..
so the community's pvp side is stuck waiting for royal release and a good amount of th community's pve side is stuck playing a game that may or maynot continue updating let alone being kept a-float.

theres definitly a great number of things that can save the community.
I truely doubt that the staff will take into consideration my ideals.

1. A full wikipidia page with all possible information on the game. (For New Players, because i for a fact know Veteran Players I being one with-hold alot of information)
2. more pve content, dungeons, craftables, ect... (Potions for example Mana/stamina) (Different styles of fishing) (More Creatures, hoping some sub humanoids Dom/tameables...)
3. Adding spells that being the placeholders in the game! (this one ive been waiting for... at this point idk if ill ever see that...)
4. Things new players can do! (Alot of new players come into the game and have issues building up due to lack of being in a guild or even them wanting to play solo... not alot of early game content... tons of endgame content...)

I truely dont wanna see this game die and i also want to see how this royal game plays out...
but i also think hynrech needs to reach out for help at this point cause this game could take a leap into a spikepit at a blink of an eye.
2 actual programmers atleast from what I've heard from people that know the staff... is not enough, atleast to dish out content for your current playerbase as small as it is...

real quick i dont mind being in bits in peices because the game is equal to my review bahaha but jokes aside putting a "Tutorial Island" isnt adding content for new players... its updating a perfictly fine tutorial and defeats the purpose of yellow flagging!

90% factual

You guys are losing the vision trying to keep new players but looking streight threw them.
that being said 80% of the time the staff are pretty down to earth i am speaking of Farmer Joe (Seb) and Discord (not the app) reasonable guys respond quickly on discord "the app this time" and through email.
Henriech not so much have yet to have a convorsation and ive been playing early alpha release (Sad life for me)

Love this game and the staff i have spoken with are good people!

Come back playerbase from 2014!

review: OK so I've been playing mmo's since the age of 14 and I love them I've been looking around for a hard one based around skill and I thought no levels, no classes, and its based around skill I thought perfect. So after the surprisingly short wait I go throught a semi-unique character creation set and choose a tutorial level. It took well over 10 minuites for me to kill my first pig. Slowly I got better at it but I had no clue how to make it into the leather needed. The help chat is on a limit and then your on your own. I spent about half an hour trying to recover gear due the terrible swimming mechanics so if anyone wants extreamly basic gear and thinks they can get it look under one of the bridges in the starting area. Over all good game but the mechanics are very wonkey and the community is dumped in toxic sludge. Ign would rate 8.5/10 moderate ammount of drowinging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005196214', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 210256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144831, 'last_played': 1586408355}
review:
And you refuse to implement proper coding, or support from your GM to notice when player's pets die due to them getting stuck on a nodeline?

There's no point in playing this game.

Because at any point in time, my pet can die with thousands of gold worth of mats on it due to a bug, and if I don't record it, ALL mytime. All my gains are lost.

And when I contact YOUR GM's, to get assistance, their response is:

"I cannot resurrect dead pets."

'Can you at least check the logs to see what happened to it? I'm telling u it was stuck on a nodeline, and I was down the hill when it got killed by mobs due to being stuck.'

"I cannot check what happened. I cannot resurrect dead pets."

This is UN-FAIR. I shouldn't have to deal w/ this. What are you charging me 13 bucks a month for? What kind of customer service, is this?

It's not the lack of content that drives your players away.

It's your complete lack of understanding that the QUALITY of your game, is more important than the amount of CONTENT you put into the game. You release another continent, but completely forget about the fact that your game is plagued with more bugs than Egypt during Exodus.

:rolleyes:


You got pets in MoKi spider cave, they BOUNCE up into another room. Aggro the mobs up there, and then bounce down, and start getting killed by mobs THROUGH the walls, and you can't even attack them because - IN THE WALLS.

Like... What is this?!

This isn't some "steam noob", either Henrik / Seb.

This is a player that's been subbing 10 accounts for over 3 years. I've played this game extensively and this isn't some player that quits when the population is low. I've played almost consecutively beside breaks for up to a month.

From a player that actually LIKES the game?

Fix your game. I rarely get mad at your bugs, but this one REALLY got to me. How do I lose all my stuff, and I can't get it back, due to GM's not having the proper tools to know what went down in the damned game.

After spending all this time saying the same stuff over and over again, when, oh WHEN are you gonna pull your heads out of your butts and start polishing the damn game, and not leaving us in the dark like you're not providing a PRODUCT?!

Warn me, ban me, I don't give a crap. I'm right and you know it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245745784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23323, 'last_played': 1448515187}
review:
[u]For final score scroll down[/u]
unlimited trial need to sub for competitive playin... what can i say about MO?? well... its a certain type of mmo that caters to those that like to work for their own gear and have the freedom to become a "good" or "badguy". there are alot of negative reviews because to go from noob ----> pro or atleast average is a giant leap. the learning curve is steep and unless you seek help from a guild will be a long journey of being ganked/robbed/eaten/zerged and my all favourite blueblocked. i myself am currently a solo player that gets mercyless killed at the drop of a hat from many players but that is to be expected from being solo. Ive met some other solo players that join longstanding guilds to quitting and making a tempory new guild. This game has very intense moment to some very dull moments. atm the population from steam release has dropped to a sweet spot of 300 to 500 and all the problems from server restarts and long queue join times is nonexistant. there are many bugs that need addressing from random character animations (on horse mainly) and npcs being able to walk through walls and shoot you from inside of them.
Pros: hard and gritty
great community(with a couple of griefers)
full loot drop
many variations character classes(build to your playstyle)
playerskilled based
roleplay friendly
can eat own head

Cons:needs some rebalancing 
steep learning curve(though i liked it)
old engine
glitches
the random and occasional griefers(when i say griefers i mean priest spawn killers or vets prerying in GY)

i give this game 7/10 
its my type of game but many wont/cant appreciate the hard and grittyness of this game.
TLDR; darksouls mmo but with glitches and a economy system

author: {'steamid': '76561197990532342', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 21630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10568, 'last_played': 1616885243}
review:
So, let me start by saying this game is not fore everyone. It is a hardcore game with a strong focus on player skill and pvp. Were you good at pvp is WoW? Well, almost none of those skills will transfer over.

This game's is best described as the old ultima online but in 3d (before the felucia tram split). You can be attacked ANYWHERE!!!! In towns you do have guards that will save/avenge you but it is always a risk. There is a thieving system so getting you pockets picked is a real risk. There are tamers, mages, dominators, warriors and any combination thereof. You get to decide what skills you train and what you dont.

Pro's
Very hard gameplay
Very in depth mechanics
visually on par with most games out now,
Does not take massive ammounts of hours to do anything fun,
Excellent combat system 

Con's
Bugs. Some of which have been around for a while from what i understand
Very Hard Gameplay (belonged in both because it limits who joins the game)


That about wraps it up. I've been playing for about 1 week and already have 92 hours into it. 

Cheers
Jander

author: {'steamid': '76561198052459005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1477691231}
review:
Короче. Эта игра выходит за рамки типичных MMORPG. На этом можно закончить, но я продолжу. 

Игру создавали кучка вдохновленных людей. Получилось с душой и огромной тучей багов, которые медленно но фиксят. 

Это настоящая песочница. Никто вас за руку водить не будет. Никто не скажет, что делать. Это жестокий мир, в котором вас может убить всё и все. И везде. Тут нет безопасных зон. Ты вытащил оружие и сломал кому-нибудь лицо. Или тебе. А потом можно взять голову врага и СОЖРАТЬ СЫРОЙ или сварить с солью... А потом ты берешь тело павшего врага и содрав с него кожу делаешь себе обмотку на меч. Или плащик. 

Свободная экономика. Никаких телепортов. Почти сто киломертов квадратных площади. Строить можно везде и что угодно. Рушить так же. 

Все персонажи стремные. Смиритесь. 

Дизайна локиций нет и не могло быть. Хотя когда ты забираешься на возвышенность и видишь огромную степь с озером по середине это захватывает. 

Делать в игре можно что угодно. Но в вашим основным занятием станет мордобой. Это однозначно. Это игра про кровь и убийства. Целиком и полностью. 

При попадании меча по доспехам отлетают искорки. 

Все войны между гильдиями начинаются с того, что кто-то не лицеприятно высказался про чью-то мамку. 

Глобальный чат носит пометку "Help" и автоматически выключается через 48 часов игры. 

В игре нет никаких карт, кроме как нарисованных игроками. 



Заключение: игра состоялась. Она играбельна и притягательна. Она для тех, кто не боится АБСОЛЮТНОЙ свободы. У неё высокий порог входимости и не простая боёвка. Она жестока и по своему красива. И не прощает ошибок и не поощряет одиночек. Я однозначно советую её русскому хардкорному комьюнити. Мы давно ждали такие вещи, а нас всё кормили приторной, казуальной корейщиной.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049011274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 16710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10579, 'last_played': 1449109339}
review:
I have been playing Mortal Online now for approximately 4 months now, 200+ hours, and can say this game has the raw hardcore feeling I havent fealt since vanilla WoW. (not saying this game is anything like WoW mind you)
Now here is what i have to say about the game.

This game is not for casual gaming, this game is very time consuming lots of grinding, to be efficient/competitive you need to have a subscription and possibly multiple characters. Ya i know "free to play" The free to play aspect of the game lets you play but with limited skills. Which its meant that you play the game to see if you like it or not. 

I give this game a Positive review because its what I want out of an MMO. Its hardcore takes time but is rewarding when you do accomplish your goals (much like how Vanilla WoW was.) There isnt handholding from the game its a steep learning curve. On my list the Cons do out number the Pros but the Cons are very rewarding. 



Pros:
Hardcore game/loot (If you die you drop all your loot on the ground)
Open world
PvP
Guilds
Territory control
Resource control


Cons:
Slow updates (The development team is really small so updates are far and few between but they do happen)
Small player base (steam release helped game a little but lack of handholding for new players made a lot quit)
Guild politics (most major guilds are allied and at stand stills so it limits guild PvP)
Greifing new players
Low skill point system (you wont be able to do multiple classes on one character to maximum efficiency forcing you to have multiple character slots)
Known bugs not being fixed
Not new user friendly (took me a couple days to figure it out)

author: {'steamid': '76561198047256448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1941, 'last_played': 1488300286}
review: I played mortal before steam.so i have many more hours then it says here... anyways.. Mortal Online is a fun game, its super hardcore game to play though. It has a decent learning curve to get over, you will find yourself spending a lot of time researching many many questions on the web. I enjoy playing games that require thinking personally and its that much more rewarding when you do get good. I am just coming back after a year and the population has got a lott better,which def makes things more fun. This game isnt for the "rage quit" type lol, you will find yourself getting killed and loosing all the gear u have on u and whatever is in inventory, but you just have to be smart about things, like keeping a extra set of armor and weps in your bank, dont travel with coin,stay away from popular routes,etc.. it takes smarts. Find friends to play with and help out, find a guild, find a set of skills that makes u happy, and your golden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043171260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 78107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37367, 'last_played': 1588323094}
review:
I wouldnt take most of these steam reviews seriously. Most of these steam players joined. played in the main town for 2 weeks. got pk'd in graveyard. tried some totally unviable build they thought up in their head. got pk'd some more. Came to steam after uninstalling to give their totally expert/ opinionated review. 

The only review ive read that wasnt non-sensical scrub gibberish was from "CDXX". makes sense since he calls fights for one of the best pvp guilds in the game. 

[my credibility] played since 2010. took a break. came back harder then ever. You'll never experience another game like this. If youre a person who oftens puts his fists through the screen when playing COD this isnt for you. If you're mature ,as the game is rated, and can put up with some bullshit you might just make it yet.

As far as the bugs go. I do read the bug subforum on the main site too often but its alot better then what it used to be and for fucks sake you steam punks have it easier then ever with the option of Palisade walls and player cities but around a house spot. .....FUCK you all

author: {'steamid': '76561198067593168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 30807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1530489510}
review:
So I downloaded the game, made a character, picked a starting place, and pressed play. It won't get past that first loading screen after I press play. Anyone know what to do?

***EDIT***
Thanks to FarmerJoe I was able to get the game to work! If anyone else is having this issue, try this:
go to your Steam library, right click on 'Mortal Online' on your list, click on 'Properties', click 'VERIFY INTEGRITY OF GAME CACHE...' under the 'LOCAL FILES' tab, and then try to launch the game again. This worked for me. It said one thing was missing and it got fixed. Thank you FarmerJoe!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198111924193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 275869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27983, 'last_played': 1592577285}
review:
Absolutely my favorite game, been addicted to this for several years now. And im happy to say i still having fun in this game.


It's all about the learning curve, as soon you have this done, you are good to go.

There can be very hard times in this game, but none that cant be worked out in a better way. It is easy to say bad things about this game, but think about the freedom you have to do whatever you want in Mortal Online. Not many other games has what this can give you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065544746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 2152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1358, 'last_played': 1545787697}
review:
11/11/2015
Love this game and I would give this a thumbs up if it weren't for the pay model.
Max skill lvl for skills is 100 unless you pay the monthly.(Roughly 12$ a month, weird price because it's in euros.)
But if you cancel your subscription you go back down to 60!!  So you have to perpetually pay just to play the game you already paid for last month.  These kinds of pay models goes against my gamer code of ethics.  It's a scammy way to run your business, you don't really get to keep what you pay for.  But if you don't mind supporting dev's who keep supporting these pay models, then by all means perpetuate the problem. There is one other thing that made me wary of this game is that the experienced players will literally tell you not to talk about bans, or the banning of your friend or really anything to do with banning, because if you do you will get banned yourself.  Just thought it was really weird and got the feeling the dev's have mistreated players.  But it really is a great game and I was really enjoying it but after finding out the pay model I decided against it, due to principle.
developer_response:
Just want to clarify that your skills doesn't go down to 60 if you stop subbing.
They stay at 100 but are used as if they where 60 so if you sub again they will still be 100.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119344962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1404, 'last_played': 1447695056}
review:
Mortal online is not a game for everyone, It hard to learn. There is nothing to do if you have no imagination, But if you have imagination and can set your own goals it will be very fun to play, My occupation is a tamer, I choose to tame donkeys to horses. Allkinds of horses. My occupations takes alot of time traveling in the lands , While my side occupation is pretty okey. I kill walking deads for a living meanwhile waiting to get sold my horses / donkeys.

There is so much to do with so much time to be spent. Build your houses , team up with friends and go in dungeons with no loading screens. Build castles and raise an army? Go merchanting and transport gods from city to city and risk getting killed on the way to the city. In the lands of Mortal Online , There is plenty of criminals. You can get killed anywhere in the game , So stay guarded.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999074784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9433, 'last_played': 1450381011}
review: With Theivery rapant in this game, and no ability to save your possessions, nothing is safe. It breaks the game economy making this a pointless game to spend money on. The game is far from balanced, even though it tries to suggest it is. Archery attacks are crap at best and not accurate at all for damage, speed, or accuracy. their version of mages must be bogged down with having to carry all these encumbering items, so that you fall easy pray to melee characters, and magics must be charged like a Dragonball z  where everyone is annoyed it took 2 epsiodes to charge a attack. The game, due to players and mechanics, revolves around stealing and killing each other, and considering it takes most 30 minutes to a hour to make 1-5 gold, even though there is alot of pve to earn said gold, ( pay players, and only pay players have the ability to steal), steal it from you waiting in droves around the banks so you can not save it,  and bank it, and if you don't bank it, they kill you and run off the moment your not visible to a guard. Making it so players are too scared to leave cities, and keep them in a eternal loop of being robbed, and killed over and over, to generate money for subscribers, bascially if your not paying, it's not worth playing, and it's not worth paying for, cause they can just take what you pay for too. horriable player community. IF you attack them, the guards will kill you, and then the vultures descend on your items. Every crime is punished by death. Without having a paid account your skills will never get high enough to defend against them and run away in time. The only part I liked was the melee combat which is much like Chivilary. Too bad you can't keep gold to get decent items, like melee weapons, armor etc, and if you get lucky enough to keep it, they do soemthing that occurs so much it has it's on nick name, dubbed blue blocking, where they run infront of your attacks on pve to make you hit them, to get the guards to kill you so they can legally steal your stuff. No other language other then english is allowed in their so called help chat either, which isn't even Gm's its the players I just mentioned, help chat is only 48 hours long, and there is a ednless amount of long time players who create alternate characters just to ploy new players into being gulliable so they can take your stuff as well.  They need hcanges and help if they want this to go anywehre and become mainstream. I can not forsee any future in which this game will make the company alot of money since the desgin itself of the economy structure is self deficating, probabaly why most never heard of this 6 year old game, till it came to steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257286999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1527245071}
review:
i played this game for 2 years before i got it on steam

this game is one of the most accurate first person combat games i have ever found, combat can be extremely difficult against another player, it is based on skill above all else, your survivability is increased due to armour and weapons but it wont make you powerful if you suck. thank god. there seems to be an unlimited amount of things to do from fishing to bounty hunting other players, you can make an empire without ever lifting a blade or you can stand atop a heap of corpses with your battleaxe in hand and faithful donkey by your side. 

if you die you lose all the stuff you are holding, also clans can be destroyed and you are never safe, like it should be. 
this is one of the harder games so if you arent a little girl you should love it. 

be aware of guild spies

every skill you use in the world needs to be advanced, at first you can hardly even walk, jump, run or swim, if you make a character that uses axes, you wont be able to kill another player with a sword unless you have trained with one. also the direction of your swing is important, as well as hitting armour, sheilds, weapon hilts or even other weapons. for e.g. if you hit a piece of armour that protrudes from someones shoulder you are hitting their armour and will do massivley reduced damage, it is very accurate.

all in all an extremely enjoyable first person combat game with indepth clans, trading, crafting, hitboxes and armourments

author: {'steamid': '76561198050962740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1450758001}
review:
c 4гб оперативной памяти просто начать играть невозможно - игра сразу съедает 3гб, и, видимо, не против бы еще... комп тормозит, музыка постоянно прерывается, на экране слайд-шоу. core2duo e8400, win7 x64.

update: после добавления памяти до 8гб оно таки смогло запуститься, скушав 3,8гб. хотел даже поиграться, но после одной ночи игры понял, что не чувствую персонажа. не понимаю, куда он бьет в бою, куда целится. ходьба как у подстреленного на костылях. плюс к этому ужасная вырвиглазная графика (было выставлено разрешение 1900х1200 и остальные настройки далеко не минимальные).

была надежда, что все эти дефекты передвижений исправятся в процессе прокачки (мало ли, вдруг так задумано разрабами), но углядев, что персонаж ни за что не достигнет максимальных уровней прокачки без финансовых вливаний (подписка на месяц - 11,5 евро, без подписки - вы ограничены 60-м уровнем скиллов, с подпиской - 100 уровней), решил забить и не мучиться.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073411359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1446737851}
review:
http://imgur.com/a/oEPGZ (Boxed version, 2009 account.)

It's truly a 'sandbox' experience unlike any other. Skills work like they do in Oblivion, and it's incredibly satisfying watching yourself progress. 

Game looks beautiful, it plays (mostly) well except combat which is a little touch and go. I wish there was a 'neutral' review as after conversing with a Dev. on the forums they seem very reasonable; so I have no choice but to sway slightly positive. What started off as a giant rant by myself about the game, turned around to a civil conversation which I assume neither of us imagined. Overall the game would be much more positive with a different community.

The game has potential, unfortunately I've been saying that for well over 6 years now. Some things need to be changed drastically to improve gameplay, and the primary reason the game is failing is due to the community.

It is plagued by elitists and trolls. People who believe because they can dupe, exploit, and min/max whatever mechanic is broken at the time that they have the right to treat people however they want. Wander somewhere a clan deems as 'theirs' and try to gather? Have fun getting spawn killed for hours at a time until you give up and log out.

The crafting system is absolutely stunning, but again the elitists have full control over the market. There are no 'recipes' so everything is trial and error unless someone else tells you what is required. This leads to game breaking potions and other items only a select few know about and will hold onto their secret like it's "the one ring".

People are so scared of challenge, so terrified of someone being on their level they will do everything they can to prevent you from accomplishing anything in the game.

You will be 'blue blocked' and killed by guards, I imagine more times than you can count in your first days in the game.

It's free, so it can't hurt to try. It's the only full loot, FPS combat MMO worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960557968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7852, 'last_played': 1506379537}
review:
I previously gave this game a positive review just to draw in new blood from Steam, but heres the truth.

1. There is nothing to do. PvE is a Joke, NPC's are completely boinked. To counter this they gave them the ability to knock you down and render you unable to defend yourself for a few seconds. Unless of course you drop 100 points into a skill that has no use to you besides defending against those knockdowns.

2. Obtaining gear is a huge grind. You need 3 characters to support 1 combat character of your own. Characters that a new player doesn't even know how to build without help from others or extensive research through the forums.

3. Gathering the resources needed to make those characters is mindblowingly tedious for a new player. You will be killed on site by the majority of other players who will also kill your mount(required for gathering) and delete your haul because they themselves probably can't carry it.

4. Min/Max builds, nearly everyone aside from roleplayers are the exact same race/skill build. This varies from month to month as they change aspects of how skills affect things like damage bonus and combat speed. So If you want to stay truely competitive prepare to reroll that character you spent hundreds of gold & hours on every couple of months.

5. Two vastly empty continents, aside from the rediculousness that is Terrority Control. Ride across a wasteland of randomly placed AI that yield nothing of value to you, unless of course you dedicated an entire character to butchering their carcass. Wow look at that huge palisade a player has built, lets see if they are inside, nope! No incentive to login for these players at this point, they are gathering safely while offline thanks to Territory Control.

6. How is your ping? 100, no that will never do. Connect through your phone's wifi or start some torrent downloads as some packetloss and 400 ping will serve you better(Yes people really do this). Watch as your opponent seemingly stands in place attempting to hit you, while you run circles about him with your polesword dispatching him and his friends.

7. Broken weapons, better be packing a polesword(reinging champ) or flanged mace or you are about to get your shit pushed in.

8. In-Game staff & forum moderation. These "helpful" fellows are pulled directly from the sesspool that is the Mortal Online community itself. Be careful who you decide to interact with, because chances are they have a friend in high places.

9. Henrik, the CEO. For years we have pleaded with this guy. The entire community is up in arms about the above listed issues, yet he acts on none of them. He is either blind deaf or dumb. Maybe all three.

Thank god for steam, otherwise this would have been another deleted post in the MO forums.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131696898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1446690555}
review:
when you first fire it up, yea the graphics look pretty lame. but i thought i can look past it. so i started building my first character. i read all the details of each race, picked my grandparents bloodline carefully, and spent some time with physical appearance...even though like i said, the graphics are pretty remedial. then i got to the name...oh joy.

i tried my first "go to" names. the ones i really want...all taken. no problem, surely one of my obscure names will be available....nope. ok how about really odd names? in other languages? misspelled? taken, taken, and taken. so i went the comical route with "Allnames Aretaken" and "Isthis Nametaken"...both were...guess what....taken. at this point i thought there was something wrong, there was a glitch...surely...right? again, nope. to test this glitch theory i basically could have thrown cats at my keyboard to come up with the name...and of course that worked. my name is now "cfjoladfedolxc Nametaken"...cool, huh?

so i finally load into the game with my super cool name that really allows me to get attached to this character and immerse myself in this world. it's like the graphics got worse. ya know maybe if you're blind, you'll enjoy this game. or maybe if you just woke up from a coma and super mario brothers on nintendo (the original one) was the last thing you played...you might be able to stomach the cheap, rotten eye candy this game serves up. for me though...i need to connect with a game, especially a rpg, and this just doesn't allow me to get into it...at all.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198005103837', 'num_games_owned': 702, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1446513842}
review:
It's kind of like the Dwarf Fortress of MMORPGs from what i've seen playing so far. It is hard to learn, but once you get the hang of it, it is very enjoyable! I think if this game continues to expand and the developers work hard to keep adding new and exciting stuff to the game, anyone with a decent amount of time to invest in it and a love for both MMORPGs and games like Rust or ARK: Survival Evolved could easily spare a few moments to check this game out. The fact that it lacks microtransactions entirely (if you don't count being able to pay for additional character slots as microtransactions) and only requires you to pay if you want your characters skills to reach their full potential (something you won't have to bother with unless you've actually decided you want to spend some time playing this game).

I like it, i hope it keeps evolving, and that maybe one day it has a server for all the casuals and noobs as well in case i decide this is too hard a game for me and stop playing for a while until i undoubtedly check back in a while later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082439076', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1446274958}
review:
IT.Pieno di bug e i lag sono frequenti...grande potenziale ma sto gioco sta in circolazione da anni e sono parecchio indietro...sembra una beta...il sistema delle magie è orribile...il panorama le mappe e le città principali sono state fatte con i piedi...si a Tindrem c'è una bella statua ma poi per il resto ci sono tantissimi edifici inutili ...di scena si però il design 3D sembra fatto da un bambino...prevede un piano free e un piano con una sottoscrizione mensile...se non paghi sta beta orribile non puoi arrivare a 100 con le abilità ma ti fermi a 60...e la differenza si sente...le opzioni si modificano da launcher...cioè io voglio modificare al momento le ombre per esempio perchè mi va a scatti...no non posso farlo!!! devo prima chiudere il gioco!!! è ridicolo...tempi di caricameno per l'avvio del gioco troppo lunghi...veramente poteva essere un bel gioco...peccato
ENG.Buggy and laggy...great potential for a beta but this game is not a beta! it' s around for 4 years or more!!Magic sistem awful...town scenes are a punch in the eye...for fully unlock the skill system you have to pay a subscriprtion...i'm not paying a cent for this beta like crap...setting management is terrible...

author: {'steamid': '76561198147853074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 8759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1479231061}
review: Повелся на положительные отзывы об игре . На деле сложна регистрация и установка . Как только вошел в игру сразу в - идет что нет оптимизации на руссий язык и графика . Ну да хрен бы с ней , с этой графикой . Физики в игре вообще нет . Да она атмосферная , но система крафта совершенно непоянтна . Застрял на том что нужно убить свиней и снять с них шкуру , убивал свиней 30 минут , пока не надоело . Оставил игру в покое . Да и если нечайно задеть кого то мечом , то вас начнут атаковать стражники . После смерти нужно будет искать священника , чтобы он исцелил вас и вы отправились в путь дальше , все бы ничего , но от места спавна до священника идти минимум 10-15 минут , что конечно же немного напрягает . Вообщем была бы игра на русском , думаю проблем бы не было , а если вылезать из игры в google переводчик,  то моя 4 ядерная система не всегда даже тянет эту задачу , так как игра очень требовательна к производительности и интернету .

author: {'steamid': '76561198057522688', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1239, 'last_played': 1589857710}
review:
So, far, it has been an absolute blast and a refreshing change of pace from our typical MMO. The only issue is that new players must realized this is an ANYTHING GOES sever. Unless there is hacking involved, pretty much everything is fair game. 

Which means you can make a living however you want. Whether its farming NPCs, being a bandit, soldier, baker, blacksmith, tamer, and just about anything you can think of. Even a thief or a mugger. Which, for me, is simply perfect.

I also love the lack of 'classes' and 'levels'. It feels dynamic and realistic in how your skills work. Even in when creating your character, your age is a factor in what your starting stats are. 

If you are tired of all the WoW clones out there and ready to try something new, even if it is hardcore, then simply give this game a try. It is free after all ;P

author: {'steamid': '76561198131257913', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 150786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4474, 'last_played': 1641897954}
review:
Okay, I was going to wait until I put in 100 hours to judge this game, thus I have put in only 36 hours in five days. This is not a traditional MMO. If you want quest bubbles and some hermit telling you to gather 100 carrots so you can feed a donkey, and then expect to do this a thousand more times, in a thousand different ways until you level to 60, please don't download this game. Mortal Online is not for children nor is it for the faint of heart. This game feels like an RPG with a devoted community. If you loved Morrowind: The Elder Scrolls, then you will remember what a game like that feels like. If you want epic challenge, free romaing adventure, gore, crafting, hunting, taming, PVP, cooking, combat mastery and uniqueness in character; and might I mention some of the deepest lore ever written, then you must try this game. The lore in MO is on the level of the Elder Scrolls; in fact I wish ESO did their game sandbox style like this; if they did maybe people would have stayed.

The game is older so the graphics are not in today's standard, yet the world is beautifully crafted. The combat system works, it is intriguing and while it is challenging it is also fun. Even riding a mount takes skill, so you can't just hop on a horse or donkey and go; you need to learn how to ride, make sure you are not too fat or you will fall on your face in front of everyone. The economy in this system is unique in a sense, that even though you can see everything in the realm at the broker, you can only buy stuff in the city you are in, so it makes things challenging: if you want that armor or weapon you need to travel to the desert lands to retrieve it, from that particular broker, if you can survive the bandit players.

I think open world PVP in 1rst person, is the most feared, yet realistc experience in fantasy gaming.

Many of us got spoiled with 3rd person and I was one of them. At first, I was not sure I wanted to play a game in 1rst person, but as I got into it, I found myself 36 hours in. Then there are those who are afraid of getting killed and losing everything. I will say this, fear is good sometimes, it keeps you on the edge. Once you get killed and lose everything you will be smarter, wiser and learn to only carry the things you really need. And if you need to gather more things, keep a good relationship in the local cities so you can visit your bank; and always have back up resources so you can be prepared for the monster/creatures, theives and red players who have nothing better to do but make your life miserable.  All we need now is more Roleplayers to stop fearing PVP and come to this world. The opportunity to do what you want, go where you please and build a house, village or city, anywhere is well worth the risk. Or you can play ESO and waste your life in a tavern. I rather be rping with friends who want that edge, knowing that they can die in this dangerous world, but gaining strength, will, intelligence, dexterity, constitution and valor; to defend ourselves and the weak. We need more good players in this game. 

WE need more Roleplayers, who are up to facing this challenge. 

Why don't you join us!

For help or guild information join this community

http://www.mortalonline.com/forums/

For guides see this wiki

http://www.mortaldata.com/wiki/index.php?title=Main_Page

For a map which you can use in game at any time by pressing Tab+Shift see this link

http://www.mortalonlinemap.info/

As always, Characters Welcomed. ~Serverus

review: honestly this game has alot of bugs but its still very enjoyable, the bugs are worked on constantly and this game is the only game i have found that really makes me feel like im in control of my own fate i can be anything i want from a blacksmith to a cook to a bloody tamer/fighter. graghics are a bit old and if you dont have a good computer it may lag alot if you try playing on high graghics but all in all i enjoy this game and im a f2p so i would suggest giving it a try, its not everyones cup of tea tho.     8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198205891820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5055, 'last_played': 1466268231}
review:
First of all let me stay by saying I am NOT a new steam player. My ingame name was Lexorn , I have played mortal for 4.5 years and am one of the most recognisable Names in the game after starting many wars , being the leader of FATE and AIM and building the largest player city ever seen called Magna Astu.

My advice is this: DO NOT PLAY MORTAL ONLINE EVER

Mortal online has alway had a charm about it and many of us have played for a long time living on the promise that "things will get fixed" or "it will be ready soon" but unfortunatly none of these things ever materialise. Mortal online as a game had great potential and many of us have done our best to support it over the years by subbing accounts for friends , donating etc etc but again all of this has been taken and nothing given back.

They had/have a policy where if you dontate enough you can name an npc, or get an armour set made or some other rubbish infact some people have donated $1000 and 2 years later have still not seen the results of their donation....

Also they have unbanned several prominant hackers/dupers AFTER the donated which is a really bad way to manage a game.

Mortal online is a game full of empty promises , corruption and lies. Hell they even had/have GM's activly playing in guilds and giving unfair advantages to certain players.

Recently we discovered a bug with the extracting system completly legitimate and nothing but in game mecanics however because of a few high status players we had attached to our guild and the overwhelming corruption of the Starvault GM team they Instabanned over a dozen players, destroyed our keep and destroyed the largest open player city ever built cause not only us to lose everything but also causing over 60 new steam release players who used the city to lose everything and a large number have now quit.


Mortal Online Is a waste of your money and time, they have lost over 50% of their steam release playerbase since it launched here and the reasons for that are:

CORRUPTION
LACK OF VALUE FOR MONEY
BROKEN MECANICS
BIAS
LYING TO THEIR PLAYERBASE

My advice to anyone thinking of playing this game is to avoid it like the plague and spend you money elsewhere and I would also like for STEAM to look inot the way this game is run and consider removing it from their system.

I hope anyone thinking of playing this game heeds my warning

Thanks

Lexorn

x-LEADER OF FATE
x-LEADER OF AIM
developer_response:
Lexorn you where legitimately banned for exploiting a dupe in the game.
I do not understand how you can think that is "GM corruption".

I can however understand that it makes you angry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114750286', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1445765596}
review:
The game looks really decent. I loved the character creation, and the lore behind all the races.
However... My PC is too s**t to be able to handle this game, so I could play it normally.
I tried to play it, as I got addicted from what I saw in Youtube videos for this game, but unfortunately I will never be able to play, if I don't a new PC anytime soon...
The game really does look cool, I recommend it to people who can actually play it on their computer.
Its a heavy game, however... 10 GB only from Download files, and its about 20 - 30 from installing it.
This game has future, if they make it light enough for people who don't have the needed haracteristics.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975507884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1445673142}
review:
There is nothing simple about this game, but that's not a bad thing. Fighting, crafting, and even running around has a very old school MMORPG element to it that is very niche. If you like games that have a very deep crafting system and battle that needs to be precise you should check this out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999823037', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1516359129}
review: Ставлю лайк кредитом. Эта игра Морровинд онлайн. Недоработанная. Но всё же та о которой мечтали все игроки морровинда. author: {'steamid': '76561198073372238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8348, 'last_played': 1472187792}
review:
In short, a fantastic game. Pay to win? No. It's Pay to play. I started off believing I would never buy a subscription for the game and continue as a F2P like I have many other games but this one is special. It's basically what ESO should have been. It's an MMO with first person only and enough stuff to do that some players have been playing for years and never been bored. You can tame numerous creatures. Build your own city. Band together all your friends and go murder wanderers or even guards if you're brave.

TL;DR amazing game. Amazing environment. Feel free to add me if you're have trouble starting the game as a noob

 -Curson

author: {'steamid': '76561198125563201', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1442097041}
review:
Better mmos out there than this. Plus, with skills capped for free players, makes the "free to play" part of it total bull.

You're better off playing Rift than this.
developer_response:
We don't decide that it's in the f2p section, steam does that for us since we charge nothing for the client.

So instead we have this on the store page:

"Unlimited free trial!
Mortal Online offers a free-to-play mode with a skill cap at skill level 60. In order to unlock the maximum skill levels and fully master your Mortal destiny, a paid monthly subscription is needed, but unlike many other games there are no microtransactions. Unsubscribing will re-apply the skill cap, but your skills will be maxed again when you re-subscribe. Every player gets one free character slot, and you can purchase additional slots up to a maximum of four."

author: {'steamid': '76561197970838694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1326, 'last_played': 1445475848}
review:
Ok I will write this review for the average gamer but as its Free to play no money would be wasted for trying it out just time.

Out of a group of four that entered the game I was the only one left that may have subbed I probably wont now after learning more about the game

I knew full well I was getting into a hardcore full loot game , I expected to die alot granted but the community was dreadfully toxic , on mentioning the high level moutned guys preventing new players from leaving the starter towns could be negative for the game I was told "uninstall leave the game" . Most of these guys have macros to don full armour and mount up before one shotting you , its un realistick and the ganking and griefing not to mention blue blocking is counter productive.

This is the only mmo I know of that has no group mode , if you accidentally hit your mate you become a criminal for all to gank kill and loot with no repurcussions , dumb just dumb.

The jungle area is jsut a horror story you can get trapped for hours becuase guilds have walled it off , some rivers do not work many areas are empty and the game just looks dreary , its not all about looks right? well sounds glitch and feel like your in the old ultima underworld if your old enough to remember that.

Sub price 14 euros ?  sorry guys too much for a game thats years old but feels early access.

In my mind due to the toxic community this game will fizzle out and die , steam F2P model was the last twitch of a headless chicken before it dies , good idea for a game jsut too many flaws and a horrible communiity , well 95% of them

author: {'steamid': '76561198008083000', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 2133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1984, 'last_played': 1523743036}
review:
Empecemos
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Bueno

Buenos graficos
En su totalidad free play asta 60 de abilidad y asta 100 necesitas pagar una cuota de 15 e mes
Muchisimos cafteos
Vida medieval real
Mapa enorme
Muchisimas cosas para comercio
en primera persona
Duelos de caballeros a caballo o bien a pie
pvp,pve,rvr 
mapa abierto
controles simples
No tienes niveles es todo por abilidad
puedes construir o comprar viviendas o casas o castillos o clamarlos
armas totalmente presonalizables el material de construpcion y el nombre
Bariedad de razas asta 4

Malo

No tiene misiones
Pueden atacar los jugadores cuando quieran a quien quieran en el mapa escepto si hay guardias vijilando
Hay mucho bandidos y cara duras jugadores en el juego .Lo mejor es ponerte el dinero y lo importante en el almacen o banco 
Solo tiene un idioma y es el ingles
no puedes invitar a jugadores a un grupo
Despues del tutorial no hay nada mas .Es como en la edad media  Real .Te vas de aventuras con amigos o con desnocidos a mazmorras y demas sectores .Tienes que hacerte un hueco entre los jugadores y buscarte la vida dentro del juego
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Recomiendo el juego a un que hay una idea contradictoria .Pero los jugadores de normal van a su bola y si no les fastidias en el terreno de juego no suelen atacarte .El juego es totalmente real de la vida medieval .Lo malo es que si tienes todo equipado y te matan pueden quedarse con tus cosas .Por eso la mejor opcion es dejarte las cosas importantes como el dinero de juego en el banco o almacen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157364278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21250, 'last_played': 1450397935}
review:
This is a really great game. I generally don't write reviews on steam, but this one I just had to take the time to write one out even if no one cares to read my review or doesn't agree, I don't really care.  

Somehow I hadn't heard of this game till the steam release came out and was told just a little bit about the game, downloaded and started playing. I must admit I was one of those people at the beginning that was like "Hey, how do you form a party?" "Where's the map?" and then it dawned on me, this is not your typical game that's out now which is all just a carbon copy of itself with slightly differing graphics, plots and systems. 

After WoW ruined gaming for those of us that were around for the beginning of console gaming, MUDs, etc, I remember for years I searched for a game that let you do what you wanted to, be who you wanted to be... a game that actually deserved the "RPG" behind the "MMO" genre, but I gave up. I long awaited, searched, tried everything that looked promising and then got used to all these games that came out that held your hand through every process of your adventure and forced you take paths you yourself did not want your character to take.

Mortal Online does not have quests. There is the beginning tutorial quests if you start off in the city of Tindrem, but that is all. It's a few quests and then you are dropped off into the world and left on your own to figure things out. Some say you need to be in a guild to experience this game or to even like it, but I disagree. Sure, I see the pros and the cons of joining one, but so far I have not joined a guild and I have figured things out myself with a bit of help by asking in help chat when I'm really stuck or lurking the forums a bit, but mostly I ventured out on my own and discovered new areas, mobs, guild keeps, etc. To me that is half the fun. I don't know that I want people that have been playing for years to tell me exactly where to go and give me all the items I could possibly want.  Discovery to me is the most fun part of this game. I end up getting killed more than I probably should because of the play style I choose, but it doesn't upset me as that's what I choose to do right now.

Beauty of this game is that it's not beautiful in any aspect. And though that sounds like an insult, it's not. There are thieves trying to pickpocket you while you're trying to buy new armor after you lost your gear and mounts to murderers coming back from a taming journey. Then you gear up, go back out to go on an adventure, look away for a second and oops you ran into a pack of cougars and they just put you down to 10% life. Now you have to rest for a while to get your HP back and then you hear the clopping of horses nearing you and oh no, murderers again. But you know what? To most of gamers these days, that might sound like a nightmare, but this is what I missed through the years. The danger, the excitement, the unknown. 

People complain about the graphics, but I don't understand why. For this game, I think it is hugely fitting. I don't want to see a bunch of pretty girly blonde elf men riding on unicorns fighting with some translucent sword that has some spinning hieroglyphics on it and all wearing the same high end purple gear head to toe. No thanks. 

The crafting system is something that is really unique in this game compared to many in games these days and some of those recipes are a secret kept to themselves. Not everything is just out in the open even after so many years and I like that about this game that there may be things I may never discover. You can't just get to an point where you know it all in a week. But do not expect people to share their secrets with you that have played this game for years prior to the steam release. 

I think older gamers like me will definitely appreciate this game. People that want their hand held, all the guides you ever want on the forums, an in-game map, a cursor to let you know where you want to go at the top of your screen, this is probably not the game for you, but I can hope that maybe even among those players, there might be some that want to experience something different. If you do, try this game out for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004620875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 161597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26284, 'last_played': 1658316663}
review:
El MO es posiblemente uno de los mejores juegos de la historia. Es gracioso que realmente haya fracasado en steam y poca gente lo juegue, porque aunque han pasado los años y no ha envejecido especialmente bien sigue siendo el útlimo y autentico sandbox que queda (a parte del minecraft xd)
la gente llama sandbox a todo. Sandbox significa libertad total, sin historia (no significa que no pueda haber lore) la gente hace la historia. En el MO es asi, tiene una rica historia de reyes, señores de la guerra grandes batallas y mil cosas mas. 
Lo mejor:

- EXTREMADAMENTE ADICTIVO (cuidado si te haces jugador del MO aprovisionate de porno suficiente porque jamas volveras a tener sexo. es una droga)
- Autentico espíritu Sandbox. Full loot, sin reglas. Solo mata o murre, roba o se robado, el fuerte mata al debil. Bienvenido al medievo.
- trabajo en equipo. Este juego se basa en el trabajo en equipo, puedes jugarlo solo pero estaras muy limitado, estar en una guild tener tu ciudad, luchar en guerras, es una experiencia inolvidable.
- PVP. Quien ha vivido una gran guerra en el MO y ha luchadno en una gran batalla jamas lo olvida, es una locura, armas por todos lados, brillo de armaduras, caballos, muy epico.
- Economia. La economica es extremadamente compleja. la extracion de metales el tradeo, todo es complejo y muy rico.
LO PEOR
- La comunidad del MO esta formada por megalómanos y sociopatas xd
- El lore, (su ausencia) el lore del juego es pesimo y los jugadores tampoco han ayudado a mejorarlo, el foro es territorio comanche y la senccion de ROL una patata.
- El estado social de Myrland es casi de la baja edad media, no hay reinos, jerarquia nada, toda organizacion social compleja es imposible. Todos los jugadores queiren ser emperadores.
- Las polladas de starvault. No lo hacen mal pero a veces pueden cagarla mucho con sus ideas o su inactividad.
- Bugs. Noo son muchos pero son recurrentes y los jugadores veteranos a veces loquean. 
- Este juego arruinara tu existencia. xd

author: {'steamid': '76561198123489447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 46390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43022, 'last_played': 1485339767}
review:
This game shows the best parts of people and of course the worst. Through the freedoms that are given you almost have a reflection of the world we see today. 

Yes this game is hard, but once you get the hang of it and you know the way of the land you will have an amazing time. This world is so big and the sights to see almost grab you like you are truly in the game. 

You ride your horse through the wild and the sun shines through the trees, you almsot have the feeling you are sitting on that horse yourself. 

Yes, you will lose your things but the more you play the better you get at keeping them. 



Some advice:
-Leave the main cities,  if you die leave again. 
-Plan your charecter 
-Be nice to people, through this you meet many simular people
-Get the riding skill and buy a mount
-Join a guild
-Roam in a team if you can 
-Find the mortal online map 
-Stop an attack with Ctrl (you will know why soon)
-Get to know which guilds have what agenda
-Make use of the buy orders on the broker this will make farming a lot easier.
-If you think you going to die just fight and let them know it. 
-Ask people where to go and what to do

author: {'steamid': '76561198186616467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 69031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7017, 'last_played': 1579075676}
review:
ive played this game for a month or two. and i have died countless times, lost items ive worked hard for and bought with blood(because i butcher) and tears(of the animals i killed to butcher their corpses) and at first i was actually really angry. its not fair that these vets are picking on new people who barely know the functions and mechanics of the game. but then i kept playing, i presevered and i didnt want these aholes to win by forcing me out for their own lil amusement. and you know what. i love playing now. i found myself a nice town at magna astu to make my base of operations. i go out and explore with things i made myself, saves the loss when i die. and yno there are so much more things i can find out.

YES. there are going to be players who will kill you, take your stuff and kill your mount. there are going to be things you wont know at first and lose out on. BUT thats not all there is to this game. its not all about pvp, even if many people feels that way. i personally love crafting. i still havent gone into the dungeons but i want to, there are special monsters around that are uncommon, boss monsters even. i was actually suprised to know that there are actually equipment that you can only get from drops (previously thought everything was only crafted) 

you dont get everything handed to you in the beginnning. there are ALOT to learn. but go into the forums and search abit. there are guides for new players, for crafting, for building certain builds. there are people that just feels like sharing what they learned that day. there are alot of nice people playing as well. many people who have faced the problems with red and grew to be able to fight them. they know some tricks and they have resources to help. find some guilds to join, there are a quite a bit of players willing to help. because it will benefit them if there are more players too. more people to play with, adventure with. slay monsters and hunt bosses with.

the hardest thing i found in this game is the fact that it really is up to you to learn, grown and develop your character and play style. you cant stay ignorant in this game, that is what kills you.  

im no vet, but im up to help new players. because its a nice dream of mine to lead a hunting group around, fight off some reds, go dungeoneering. bring a nice fresh air to this game that has staled because people keeps getting scared off.

try it. got nothing to lose, its not like you HAVE to suscribe. im f2p player and im enjoying myself. xP

author: {'steamid': '76561198068320725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5222, 'last_played': 1597369336}
review:
Abi oyun tamam hardcore de bu kadarda olmasın anasını satayım Ultimanın evrim geçirmis hali sanırım, birazda abartılmıs oyunun içinde map falan bulunmuyor tamamen gerçek hayat gibi oyun, ama zevkten dört köse oluyorsunuz, 100 kere ölüp 1 kisi öldürseniz bile, ohhh siktim sonunda birini hissiyle mest oluyorsun resmen, tabi sonra bi 100 kere daha ölüyorsun falan filan, hardcore oynayabilen/seven herkese tavsiye ederim mükemmel bir ortamı var.
Oyunda bulunanları yazmaya geçeyim ben genel özetten sonra,
Ölünce herseyinizi yere düsürürsünüz, suçsuz iken ölürseniz baska birisi esyalarınızı toplarsa suçlu durumuna düser, sehirde dahil öldürülebilir hale gelir(bir süre için)
Oyun içinde söylediğim gibi map bulunmamakta hersey bir süre ezberinize gitmekte (taa ki mortal map info adlı siteyle tanısana kadar)
Oyunda bir çok sehir / kanunsuz sehir bulunmakta, muhtemelen bir sehirden sehire giderken 4 5 saatlik kaybolma süreleri yasayacaksınız ve bu yüzden oyunu bırakacaksınız, simdiden kolay gelsin 
Oyunda guildler istediği herhangi bir bölgeyi ele geçirip istediği bir alana guild kalesi/evi/ahırı/tarlası vb vb kurabiliyor, tahmin edebiliceğiniz gibi bunlar da saldırılar sonucu yıkılıyor
Guild  v Guildler efsane, hele ki kaleniz siege altındaysa, olum dısarı  çıkamıyorsunuz surun üstüne çıkıp adamlara büyü ok ne varsa atıyorsunuz Minas Tirith canlandırıyorsunuz resmen ;D
Oyunda ok kullanıyorsanız her hangi bir amlem ile nisan almıyorsunuz, sadece okun ucunun baktığı yöne gitmekte falan filan filan oyun acayiiiiiiip detaylı, herseyiyle gerçek hayatı yansıtmaya çalısmıslar eh buraya kadar okuduysanız zaten oynama niyeti içinde günes gibi doğmus olması gerekiyor, doğmadıysa da siktir olun gidin abi böyle bir oyunu oynamak her baba yiğitin harcı değil açıkcası ;D

Oynamak isteyenlere iyi eğlenceler diyip burda bitiriyorum~

author: {'steamid': '76561198053281770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 27244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24200, 'last_played': 1597018007}
review:
Mortal Online is a first-person MMORPG in a fantasy setting.

Mortal Online is a next generation PC MMORPG both in terms of graphics and gameplay. There are no PvP zones, only an open realistic world where you are free to choose your own path. Experience true real-time combat where you decide every move your character makes and where your personal skill really matters.

Build your own house, or set up a guild to build a keep. With enough power, violence or diplomacy, you and your allies will be able to rule an entire nation.

Choose from many different races and professions. You decide your own style of playing and whether to focus on PvP or PvE, both sharing the same game world. Devote your life to crafting, combat, magic or trading. Discover new skills, tools and resources. Or be the first to explore new areas to put your name on the map.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093175722', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 22836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8311, 'last_played': 1481230136}
review:
A Medieval fantasy game with a freaking lots of stuffs to focus on.
The game is sandbox, and it tries to be as realistic as possible, including that there will be hunger, no starting maps, no global banks(town banks doesn't connect with other town's banks), stealing, securities, housing, etc etc etc.

Combat is pretty much skyrim, you have your stamina, you adjust your distance at your enemy, you strike with either swinging or thrusting, and of course they will have durabilities, you can parry and block, and there are also magics, and Full looting system.
There is no level system in this game, so you have full skill points and attribute points ready to be allocated by doing stuffs(reading skill books, activities that corresponds said skill, etc).
Skill points are limited, there are 2 types of skill, primary and secondary, primary spends skill points, secondary spends none.
You can hit people in towns and even killing them, but hitting innocents will cause you to be a criminal and be chased by op guards capable of 360 noscoping you with magics and arrows

--EDIT--
After putting in few more dozens of hour into the game, i want to add something new here, the game suffers from crashing issues, and it doesn't tolerate disconnection, you got disconnected? your characters will have to wait either 10 or 40 seconds before logging out following you, will the same thing happen if you crashed? well... yeah.

Anyways, my experience with the game has been both good and bad, i found new way to make money, got excited, got to live in a man made guild base, seeing my tamed mounts sell, killing and finding new monsters, realizing that the monster's loot is a fortune to sell, etc.
being a f2p dude, i decided to make my character a hybrid to spend those unused skill points, i decided to become a hybrid fighter and a tamer, and it worked well, i might not fight as good as my other guild mates, but i still had fun coordinating with my good teammates.

The starting town(mainly Tindrem) is but a one's place to suffer and grow before finally deciding to venture outside for an adventure, as i've said before, this game got no map, but they gave you compass, a working one, you should hone your pathfinding and exploration skill, or you could roleplay as a hireable bodyguard, there are people actually people looking for an escort from one town to the other.

--EDIT--
Pros and Cons

---Pros---

-Multiple ways to gain currency, tamer(selling pets), crafter(Selling eqs), Extractors(Selling extracted / advanced resources), PK-ers (Spoils of w-, player killing). Thief(stealing stuffs)
-Combat is not typical.
-Great crafting system.
-Broad selection of creatures to be tamed.
-Broad skills and career selections.
-Open world, vast areas to be explored.
-Guilds.
-etc.
---Cons---
-Not newbie friendly(Punishing deaths, blueblocking, returning alive is a bit troublesome, Sandbox Confusions, etc), most newbies decided to stop playing this game after experiencing that the game is too punishing and confusing for them.
-Stucks, jumping to some location might result on you getting stuck forever.
-Cooldown on /stuck, a command which helps stuck players.
-f2p limitations, the max points to be allocated on one skill for f2p players are 60, subscriptions players have no limitations
-f2p tamers can't tame dem' cool minotaurs ;_;
-f2p players can't steal.
-crashes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098185867', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 47305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31466, 'last_played': 1536782443}
review:
I have been playing this game since prior to steam release, I have approximately 1000 hours logged in this game.  I will say if you can get past the starting area and join a guild.  This will be one the best gaming experiences of your life.  The game is very hardcore, there are a LOT of people griefing new players.  There is a reason for this though, the idea of the game is that you arent safe anywhere.  You may get killed and you might get griefed but the fact is if you manage to play the game for 30 hours or longer you will be well established enough that you will have multiple sets of gear.

Pros of the game:
-True Sandbox
-Open-World PvP
-Crafting system is very in-depth
-PvP is skill based
-PvE is skill based
-Game is actively being improved by developers

Cons of the game:
-Trolls trolling new players
-Has some bugs and glitches, but none game-breaking
-Game is virtually unplayable solo
-Development team can be a bit slow on releasing patch notes

I hope all of you manage to get past the beginning zone and start enjoying this game.  Join a guild, fight together and this game will be the most enjoyable game you've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099431317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 641316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29716, 'last_played': 1620600761}
review:
Great Game, would recomend to anyone and everyone.

The game does have a very tought start, especialy if you're new, but if you can get past the first month, you should know enough to be able to work your way up. Your best option is to join a guild right away. The GY farming is 100 useless, it's just something to do, but you need to do a little reseach, and figure out better ways to make you gold. 

The game does take time to learn the mechanics, and the whole system from crafting, extracting, butchering, etc... Almost all the information you need is a simple google search, so if you find yourself stuck, just do a little reading, and then do your own testing, because not everything is 100% accurate, but it will give you an idea and head start.

My first month, I lost everything I farmed in 30 seconds. This is when I learned, I need to find a guild, and I need to learn better ways to make gold. Get past this part of the game, and the game with be very enjoyable...

What I dislike, is how NPC Guards work... thank for the lictor SV
