author: {'steamid': '76561198081213877', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 16446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12104, 'last_played': 1503345338}
review: Расскажу для тех, кто все же читает эти обзоры. Если вам кажется, по скринам, по видео, что игра не стоит вашего внимания, то я спешу разубедить вас. Игра очень интересная и захватывающая для тех, кто любит выживание в средневековье. Для тех кому интересен крафт предметов, в этой игре огромная возможность реализовать себя. Профессий куча, даже не просто куча а целый ЭВЕРЕСТ возможностей. Вы можете быть: повором, бутчером, инженером, крафтером луков, брони и просто не знаю кем. Кем хотите. Можете разделывать человечину и готовить из нее всякие блюда, или приручать всяческих животных и верхом на них изучать огромный игровой мир. А можете стать доминатором и взять под контроль минотавра, который будет ломать и крушить ваших врагов. И для любителей магии тоже найдется местечко в этой игре. Скилов в этой игре так много, и  все они влияют на вашего персонажа. Очень много параметров, включая вес самого персонажа, температура тела и окружающей среды, голод и жажда. ВСего просто не описать. Будте готовы умереть и потерять весь ваш лут. Или убить и забрать все пожидки бедняги. Вступите в гильдию, и развивайтесь совместно. В общем не пожалеете.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083875519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1443987949}
review:
F&$K this game really, you spend so much time trying to do things and you just end up dead - killed for no reason or purpose.  So imagine if you are noob how frustrating it is.  Thats apparently the games biggest selling point...

Pay to win as well.  If you can run at a movespeed of only 60 while premium can at 100 - thats fair.  On all skills this is a possibility.

Don't waste your time, something better will come up eventually.
developer_response:
We actually see it as a infinite trial rather then a free to play.
That's why we have this on the store page:

"Unlimited free trial!
Mortal Online offers a free-to-play mode with a skill cap at skill level 60. In order to unlock the maximum skill levels and fully master your Mortal destiny, a paid monthly subscription is needed, but unlike many other games there are no microtransactions. Unsubscribing will re-apply the skill cap, but your skills will be maxed again when you re-subscribe. Every player gets one free character slot, and you can purchase additional slots up to a maximum of four."

author: {'steamid': '76561198118204753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10884, 'last_played': 1608689288}
review: Been playing this game since Block B beta off and on. Most of the things people talk about are completely avoidable by being clever and doing things at the right time. Sometimes you won't be able to leave that city exactly when you want, or have to take a longer route. Sometimes you will lose a days progress or more. It's a game you've got to put some time into your first play through. Bank everything, get your money in silver and join a guild. These three lessons will save you tons of time and frustration. All in all, it is a great game that deserves the mixed reviews.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007242274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2238, 'last_played': 1446236973}
review:
Well, I've given it a try, and decided that this is not the game for me.

While I don't normally play PvP games, I do occassionally like to raise my blood pressure a little by playing some.  Was fully prepared to give this a good strong effort, and accepted that I'd get killed quite a bit.   However, what I've come to discover, is that this game seems geared more towards the griefer than the PvPer.  In my 9 hours of play, not once was I killed by a player, but I was guard killed Many Many times by little 'traps' left behind by players, things that use game mechanics or deception to allow players to get other players (expecially newer players who don't KNOW all the little mechanics) killed without penalty to themselves.

While this might be the game for some, the learning curve and ease with which a player can be tricked into dying and losing all their gear, simply puts this game outside of my interest.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994000771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 760, 'last_played': 1463785259}
review:
Blueblocking.  It's the new griefing and this game is full of it.  Don't let everyone full you.  It'll be days, maybe weeks before you see any actual PVP action.  This game is all about Blueblocking, which is when you swing at a pig, skeleton, etc but a player jumps in your way at the last second and you end up hitting them, oops!  My bad bro, but no then you find out they actually did that on purpose because now you've just been labeled a criminal and EVERYONE will instantly gank you and take everything on your body, including your body (to butcher, eat, craft, whatever), which is funny the first few times it happens, but the humor doesn't last.  Usually the person blueblocking you doesn't even need your stuff.  They just want to grief low level players for no good reason (makes them feel big I guess).  

Anyway, until the game finds some way to remove the worst form of griefing I've ever seen I'm not playing it and won't recommend anyone else to either.  All you're going to do is end up a blueblocker yourself.  Played for about a week and had 0 PVP action, lots of blueblocking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134548978', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 56489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51984, 'last_played': 1452151348}
review:
With a couple of hundred more hours played then it shows, I also played pre Steam release for a short amount of time.

The Positives: 

Mortal Online has alot of things hardcore players will love to have. Its steep learning curve. unforgiving pvp, Those nerves that tingle when your most precious items and your guilds assets are on the line. 

It has an amazing crafting system that I have yet to see in any other MMO.  The combat system takes some time to get used to it but feels rather clunky at first. Mounted combat was really fun to me.

The taming and breeding systems are pretty decent.

The Negatives:

Some of the systems in the game are broken and incomplete for a title that has been out for 5 years. For example spear stance, the backstab mechanic, the akward hitboxes for certain melee weapons, the ranged combat with bows is very erratic. There are virtually no combat encounters that do not involve hit and run. Unless you include Seige mechanics, that involves players destroying your assets when your peak players are offline. No different then Ark Survival.   

The UI is very simplistic for a game that has been out for so long. So many Inventory bugs happen daily that  doing /droploot to check your gear for invisible items is a thing. Many lores for creatures that are not even in the game are still cluttered in the players skill list, making it even more diffcult for players who already have a hard time learning the game.

The community is so secretive about everything that its hard for new players to even thrive. You can barely even get someone in your guild to tell you the correct recipe for weapons and armor to make them worthwhile. Sadly it is because most of the players in the community are on a huge powertrip. They are afraid to be on an equal level of playing as newcomers. It is also why you find very few guides about the game. The official reddit for MO has less then one thousand registered people. I am sure this pushes players away from the game.

if you ever really want to know how full of themselves these kids are just take a walk over to the offical mortal online forums in the media section and watch the videos and the trash talking that these guys do on a daily basis. Soon after check the guild politics section and just read the constant pe nis wagging that happens.

The last thing I am going to say about this game is the community is downright TOXIC, There are a few players that exist to try and make the game a better place. But overall the game is filled with either present or past hacks / hackers. Undercover gold and asset selling for real cash money.  GM's that abuse power by not hearing out two sides to story or warning you about things before punishing you. Veterans who think that you have to respect them because they have mastered the combat system and therefore will even grief thier own guildmates. (Msg me if you want twitch recordings) and the WORST OF ALL.

A community of players that will use DDOS programs constantly on each others Communications during times of war. Or just for any kind of revenge they deem necessary. Abuse of TS adresses. IP adresses, to anyone in thier own guilds and to other guilds. 

Alot of the functions of the game are client side and can be exploited very easily. Its why duping of items has and more then likely is still is a problem that is reoccuring and hard to track and ban people for.

I think thats about enough. I just unsubscribed and will take another year long break from the game and check once again if they have fixed any of these issues or the community has changed. 

Sad thing is I dont really hold up my hopes. =(

As a side note, the pet pathing is the absolute worst I have ever seen. Three to four tickets to a GM a day just to have them returned to you after they dissapear through the world.

Edited for grammar, because I am a scrub.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054059831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 4242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4047, 'last_played': 1444772629}
review:
Has potential but it's rife with griefing which can often kill any joy you can get from the game. The veterans in this game seem to not have much to do so they've decided to kill their time by making life for new players as difficult as possible.

Other than that, the combat is clunky, it's like Chivalry with none of the polish, mobs can hit you whilst they are facing away from you, animations and movement look very awkward as well, blocking controls are rigid... Generally the combat revolves around "parrying" (blocking just before the mob attacks absorbing most of the damage and allowing you to unleash a counter attack) after 10 minutes you are able to easily predict their strike patterns/timings and the combat just becomes a bore. 

Graphics are bad, mostly because of really awful looking textures and the game is very buggy too, it feels like an Early Access and it is 5 years old already. There's a DX11 option for example but it's so unstable it's pretty much unplayable (Constant CTDs, lag etc). DX9 mode is a lot better in that regard but there's still many in-game related bugs that plague the game. Optimization is poor, even with a very good system I cannot run this game at full settings.

Community is annoying (other than griefers), no criticism towards the game is accepted (fanboys), any criticism will be met with "Go back to WoW", "Carebear" et cetera. 

The game is often described as hardcore but honestly it doesn't take much thought or skill (in fact it takes almost none), the only thing "hardcore" thing about the game is the constant hurdling you'll get from griefers/PKers and how much of your time will be wasted because of it, it's just a timesink/grind really. Either way, if you like those kind of games and can overlook many flaws and rough edges, you might like it, I play it and do get some enjoyment out of it but I'm not foolish about what this game is and isn't as well.

If you're looking at this game you probably already have some interest in these type of games so for that reason I'll recommend to try it given that it has an unlimited trial.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010274419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1552775393}
review:
Dying is unforgiving, and so is the game's community. Hitboxes are a bit weird, I feel (wielding an axe). T&A everywhere near the graveyards because of PKers (you literally drop everything when you die).

Still a fun game nontheless. I wanted to play something different, and tonight, I finally succeeded in doing just that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104198267', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1444704201}
review:
It feels like I'm playing the early beta to the greatest Ultima-clone ever made. And thats what bother me the most about it, how the game feels like it's still very early in development despite the fact it's been around for years. That, and the fact it's virtually impossible to level up skills in the starting zones because people will immediately rush up to stand between you and whatever youre trying to hit, causing the guards to come after you and get you killed so they can take all your shit.

I can see soooo much potential in this game, and yet just like a lot of MMOs lately, fails to become what they could be. And it's essentially paywalling you from ever experiencing the full game, especially since free accounts have a maximum skill level of 60, meaning that paying players will always have an advantage over free players...which is the very definition of "pay 2 win".

It's worth a try, but I can't recommend this game to somebody who is looking for a time investment. It's fun to dick around in for a while but not much more than that, and don't let the fanboys bully you in to it with their "You're just not hard-core enough" schtick. I love me a good hardcore RPG...i just don't love THIS hardcore rpg.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031987528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 26199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3391, 'last_played': 1449108249}
review:
First of all, if you never played a sandbox MMO you might not like this game, its an entire different genre from the most common themepark MMO you see everyday, for those who love a good sandbox this is the game for you.

This game has incredible deep crafting systems, creating items is not just following a recipe, you can experiment with different materials and designs, cooking and alchemy can use up to 14 ingredients at once

There are several player towns, and if you manage to form a big guild you can as well build your own

Enconomy and politics are controlled by players

The world is merciless and so are the players, if you like high risk high reward situations you will find plenty here

author: {'steamid': '76561198041985973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1444101395}
review: One of the mechanics of the game is that you can attack anyone anywhere. Not bad in its own respect but if you attack someone who isnt a criminal you become a criminal. Everyone will then murder you and take your stuff. Now say I start attacking a creature. Someone then walks close enough for you to hit them while you are in combat. You hit him > you turn into a criminal > he then kills you and takes your stuff. In game it is called Blueblocking. It is extremely popular because there is no penalty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040642203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2831, 'last_played': 1444095014}
review:
This game has some potential in its skill and progression system, but the world is sloppy, there is no lore, there is frequent waits to log in, and a lot of lag. 

the mechanics are solid and I found the learning curve not to hard but challenging. 

The biggest problem is only subscryption players have thief skills, and all players are fair game at all times. while this could seem like small things, without any real restraint structure this means you have an uncontrolable infestation of greafers and people just looking to puff up there own egoes.

this is a digital fight club, NOT a fantasy MMO

Death is the only thing that has no value, meaning this is more like Immortal online, you will quickly find yourself gripping about your loss of copper (Sorry Cuprum) or a weapon when you die, rather than actual death.

If that sounds fun to you have at it, but it's not for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071401676', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 9610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9245, 'last_played': 1527203739}
review:
Oyun Hakkında + - "ler
+++++++++++++++++
Türünüde eşi benzeri olmayan 3D bir oyun oyunun benzeri
Haritası çok büyük farklı canlıları keşif edip onları eğitebilme şansı 
Sistemleri çok iyi craft sistemi baya bir geniş 
Oyundaki herşeyi insanlar yapıyor neredeyse spawn noktaları bile yapabiliyorsunuz (Oyuna başlarken oyuncuların spawn olabileceği bir yer Mesele türk oyuncular için bir spawn noktası kurulabilir)
Oyundaki class sistemi skyrimdeki ile aynı sayılır neye ağırlık verirseniz o class olabilirsiniz mesela hybrid mage warrior (gandalf tarzı kılıç + büyü)
-----------------------------
Grafikler yetersiz
P2W var oyunda bir şeyde ustalaşmak için %100 gelişemiyorsunuz aylık ödeme ile %100 e kadar çıkabiliyorsunuz free2play ile %60 tamamlanabiliyor
Buglar var
Grup halinde oynanmalı yoksa oyundan hızlıca soğuyabilirsiniz

(  NOT  )

author: {'steamid': '76561198137760051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 117793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1580573958}
review:
STEAM前からやっている復帰者です
基本無料プレイだが月額課金することによってスキルの上限値が解放されます。
今から始めてもカンストはそんなに大変ではないと思います。
なんでもありの主観視点のMMORPG
広大なマップ、様々なMOB、PKやPKK、奥深いクラフティングシステム、トレハン要素、狩人プレイ、馬やモンスターなどのペットの育成
これ以外にも様々なコンテンツが存在
今までやってきたMMOでは味わえない緊張感とワクワク感がこのゲームにはあります
全フィールドPK可能で街の中でも殺されたりしちゃいます。
当然持ち物は全ドロップ何度も心が折れました
また武器や鎧などのクラフティングの自由度は圧倒的です
バグは多めだがそれ以上に楽しませてくれるゲームだと思います
まずは無料で遊んでみてはどうでしょうか？

日本人ユーザー？殆どいません僕と友達になってください！
グループもありますので気軽にフレンド送ってくださいね

author: {'steamid': '76561198021481372', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1668, 'last_played': 1471255198}
review:
This game has potential, you look at it and want to play it.

The reality is it shares the same sort of potential as Wayne Rooney, yeah they are good but do not live up to their potential. It says you can do what you want and grow attributes how you like but you cannot leave or open the gate without choosing a class and limiting your attributes.

I wanted to be self-sufficient and make my own weapons and fight using the sword I made but thats not possible. You can't cook because you not been taught and that goes with a lot of skills, you have to wait to be taught it before you can do it, did my parents not teach me anything?

It looks a good game but you just feel annoyed by it. No official game map so if you're lost, you are up the creek without a paddle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001289486', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 809, 'last_played': 1443879403}
review:
For all of you that run into the following 2 issues:

1. Steam install is only 348Mb

2. Launcher error: "Unable to start. This version is 1% incompatible.....etc"


Solutions:
1. You can download directly from MO site and install into SteamApps>common (it will work)

2. Mortal Requires 64Bit OS!!

This is not readily shown and often taken for granted that people will look at the requirements.
developer_response:
Yes we do assume people look at the requirements before downloading the game.
As for the issue with the missing exe this is a steam issue and here's a solution for it:

https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=8676-EFLX-7453

author: {'steamid': '76561197995983417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1443866720}
review: Jag kan inte ens starta spelet, det bara fryser ihop helt. Synd, för ville verkligen testa det. Vet inte om det är någon bugg eller vad det är men det går inte att starta helt enkelt. Får bara upp Mortal Online loggan i hundra år tills det står att spelet har stött på ett allvarligt fel typ. När jag precis hade installerat det så kom jag in på det, kunde göra en gubbe, men det laggade satan. Sen när jag valde gubben och skulle börja spela då började det frysa helt. Sen dess har det aldrig gått att starta.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995051622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1585352502}
review:
Seemed like a great game when I ran it on Windows 10, but when I went back to Windows 7, it started saying I had to run as administrator in order to log in. That would be great, if there was an option for it. I've right clicked the launcher icon and it doesn't have the option like every other game to run in administration mode and there is no compatibility tab in the properties which is the tick-mark for running in administration mode all the time.
Really wish I could play this game, but seems to me at least this version is NOT compatible with Windows 7. If someone would like to help me fix this instead of sending me to a FAQ page that doesn't even remotely cover this topic, I'll play some more and decide if the review deserves a change in recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001580691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1443815352}
review: So, the game is fun, but a bit buggy.... And a total PTW... The subscription amount, even with the discounts included is really too expensive to be worth it. The combat system is like the love child of Morrowind and Chivalry, Challenging, but fun. The let down here really is that so much of this game is locked off unless you are willing to pay the horrendous subscription fee. Skills cap off at 60 as opposed to 100 for paying players, and you cant use things like heavy armor or more than basic mounts, or really any of the thieving skillset..... When asking for 14 bucks a month to just make it worth persuing the game in depth and really standing any chance of combat against paying players... I consider that a ripoff. I would subscribe, say if it were like maybe 8 bucks a month or something reasonable. Its not really like the ideas they use for gameplay are anything you havent actually seen before (again its like Chivalry with magic). Until they rebalance the value of this product, and make it actually worth putting the time in before subscribing I dont see any real  reason to throw your money away on the subscription. Fun to tool around with, but totally unworth the asking price, or even the massive disadvantage you stand to deal with by not wasting your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052198682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1443794128}
review:
Коротко для тех кому лень читать: Игрушка не стоит затраченого на нее времени.
Теперь немного анализа.
Задумка шикарна. Жестокий мир, фентези, сиськи и письки (в игре есть режим полной обнаженки когда у голых персов видно органы) полная потеря лута после смерти и т.д. Если описать игру коротко - то это попытка реинкарнировать Ультиму Онлайн (олдфаги поймут) в теле анриаловского трехмерного движка.
К сожаления, по моему мнению попытка провалилась.
Графика, физика, движок и сам мир вызывают отвращение и являются полнейшим зашкваром. Вырвиглазные текстуры, убогие города из 2001 года, абсолютно неудобная боевая система. Все это говно, которое никак не способствует игровому процессу сопровождается полным слизыванием механик Ультимы, вплоть до команды "guardians". Уровень дружелюбности и интуитивной понятности в районе нуля. Кроме того, не смотря на то что игра спокойно пошла на моем компе на качестве графики ультра, кроме вырвиглазного мыла и размытия всего изображения, графона там как такового нету. Ужасная цветовая гамма. НЕРЕАЛЬНО ДОЛГАЯ ЗАГРУЗКА. Это реально писец, господа, загрузка в игровой мир идет где-то около 5-7 минут. Разлогинившись, желание перезайти пропадает мгновенно. Открытый мир ужасен и скучен. Со времен Линяги разрабы ничего особо придумать видимо не смогли. Вместо яркого и интересного проекта получилось кислое, цвета говна чудовище, мутант от скрещивания Ультимы и Линейки на зашкварном движке Унриала. 
Все кто хочет открытого мира, крафта, сурвайвала и полного дропа лута играйте лучше в Раст, АРК, Х1З1 или во что-то подобное, ибо Мортал получился полной парашей!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087645710', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1443776631}
review: This game is awful, things like no maps and forced first person perspective. I really, really wanted to get into it and I even had gone into it with a group of friends. The combat system seems dull and the graphics really aren't very good. There's no guides I couldn't even figure out the basics of building up a character, it seems like there's just random skills that are randomly leveled up and you have a maximum number of skills so things like being good at armorcrafting reduce your combat effectiveness. The last time someone tried something like this was SWG, but SWG was way, way, way more intuitive about the costs and what benefits of various playstyles. Maybe it's just too open? Maybe I've been spoonfed by other games since forever and only like the idea of an open world MMO? But either way this was an awful experience and if I had paid money for it I'd want it back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084416650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1205, 'last_played': 1443847289}
review:
I started downloading this game with visions of a sprawling medieval land, where I was free to forge my own path. As I watched gigabytes tick away, I dreamed of my homestead. I knew it would be hard, but I was ready for the challenge.

Boy, was I disappointed. I started playing the game as a "fledgling." During that time, nobody could attack me and I couldn't attack them. I used the time to gather resources. I found a bank, made some deposits. I was disappointed immediately that the only quests in the game were the tutorials, which were an absolute mess, but I kept going. I bought armor, managed to craft a few things but kept feeling like the work was going to far outweigh the fun had in-game. The graphics were sub-par, the UI was reminiscent of Ultima Online's, terribly outdated, the servers were fairly laggy at times, the controls themselves were less than responsive, the items in-game were somewhat cryptic and disjointed and the help system looked like someone just put some filler text in and moved on.

A messaged popped up, "You are no longer a fledgling!" "Woo-hoo," I thought, "Now it's time to conquer." No such luck. Within a minute of getting my upgraded status, I was murdered. I figured, "Oh, well. It's a survival game. I like those." I shook off the fact that I lost all my inventory and set to respawning. I found the priest, told him to bring my back and was on my way. I grabbed only what I needed this time and decided to flee to a quieter area. Just outside of town, I was murdered again. This happened over and over. I gave up for the day.

I came back to the game the next day and set out, only to accidentally target what was apparently someone's pig. The game punished me and the guard killed me. I set out again. I found a quiet area, it was nice. I was murdered again. I was way out this time, far from a priest. I asked the game to send me to the priest, which takes 60 seconds. I patiently waited, "20 seconds... 10 seconds." To my dismay, the game popped up with its message that I had been transported, but, guess what? I hadn't been. I tried again, "I'm not walking that far." Same thing happened.

I started hoofing it only to come across priest after priest that would only service their guild, with no distinction between the ones I could use and couldn't. This meant walking endlessly, going to priest after priest, just hoping. I thought, "I could make a new character. That would be easier." If it's easier to create a new character in a game, and go through the leveling process again, than to simply respawn, it has problems. That realization brought me full circle and I gladly exited. Of course, it made me wait 10 seconds. I ALT+F4'd just to show them I wasn't going to be their plaything anymore.

The concept of the game is great, but it is poorly executed, poorly supported and lacks direction. This feels like a college project, not a game meant for production. For anyone wanting to proceed, despite these words of warning, I only say to you, "I bet you're going to be disappointed."

UPDATE - 10/3/2015
------------------------------

I still wanted to like this game after my review so I popped back in to give it my full effort before I uninstalled it. I was pleased to find that my spawn issue was corrected (probably due to the server reboot occurring when I logged on) and I set off to a new town. I found that town less "murdery" and was able to setup a haul near a banker as to quickly deposit my funds. Although the murders came less frequently, they were still of great impact. Unless you want to run back and forth constantly, you need to amass a decent amount of resources to make the time worth the effort. The murders wipe out tens of minutes of work and are really disheartening.

Now, don't get me wrong; I know it's a survival game, but it shouldn't also be work. A murder shouldn't necessarily come with less impact, but should definitely be less frequent. There needs to be a greater penalty for murders, just as is the case in the real world. They provide guards, but that doesn't introduce any real preventive measure, and players are apparently allowed one murder of an innocent before the murdered player can call guards (I'm not sure of the cooldown). I understand what they're going for, but, unless there is some sort of policing when it comes to other players ruining others' experience with the game, these types of reviews will keep coming.

So, unfortunately, I still can't recommend the game. What would it take for me to change my mind? Stricter penalties for murdering other players, such as a jail period that equates to actual time lost in-game. I'm sure the problem would decrease drastically. The survival aspect would still be intact, but players would be able to somewhat comfortably navigate the world. If you want to create a pure survival game, then do that, developers, but if you want to create a game players will come back to and can take pride in what they've accomplished, make the question of their survival one that can be answered, not one led by the whims of a murder bound five-year-old with an itchy finger.

Developers: Make this Moral Online by doing what any responsible government does: protect its citizens. I won't uninstall the game just yet. I'll ensure I continue to check release notes for these types of changes. If I see a similar dynamic has been introduced, I'll come back and give it another go, consider a subscription and, of course, update my review. The game has potential, and I would love to see it all come together, but I must admit, I won't be holding out hope considering how long the game has been in development. Please, consider the value of a wider player base. Simply satisfying the relatively small group of existing subscribers isn't the best route for funding your development.

UPDATE - 5/5/2016
------------------------------

I just realized I hadn't provided another update. The game never got better and, after seeing how the developers responded to the community, I just got rid of it. Don't hitch your wagon to this horse. It's an asshole and will just call you names.

UPDATE - 7/25/2016
------------------------------
Go $%@% figure:

You Were Compromised In The MortalOnline.com Breach

review:
First off, let me mention that this isn't a beautiful game, nor a smooth running one


However, it is one of the few MMO's in english that have free style combat (not cycling your attacks like WoW, Guild wars, runescape) and alongside this have Collision based mesh combat (your weapon actually has to hit the persons charecter) AND you lose everything when you die (well, close to) Now most people see this as a negative, however this is exactly what i've been looking for.

enjoying this game even though it's a little laggy :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198163258151', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2218, 'last_played': 1444059341}
review: pay 2 win. Not really, but monthly suscription in 2018 is too much
developer_response:
We think of it as a free trial.
From the store page:

Unlimited free trial!
Mortal Online offers a free-to-play mode with a skill cap at skill level 60. In order to unlock the maximum skill levels and fully master your Mortal destiny, a paid monthly subscription is needed, but unlike many other games there are no microtransactions. Unsubscribing will re-apply the skill cap, but your skills will be maxed again when you re-subscribe. Every player gets one free character slot, and you can purchase additional slots up to a maximum of four.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975997669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4462, 'last_played': 1547164700}
review:
What is Mortal Online?

A community driven (FPS Only) Hardcore Openworld Sandbox game.   

Era: Medieval
Level Cap: There are no levels in MO, only SP
Do people still play?: The server is crowded!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968278885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 51649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1476487611}
review:
Robert getting in your face? Drop that motherfucker!

THIS IS A FULL LOOT FULL PVP GAME! There are not many games out there that fit this niche. 99% of all gear you see players wear are the product of rock being mined and refined and crafted by players, yet when you die it ALL drops! This is what makes the game such a thrill. 

NO REAL CLASSES! Your skills level based on your own actions! Want to be a melee sword fighter? Hit shit with a sword man. Want to also cast some magic? Read a fucking book. If you are tired of how your characters skills are, just hit the minus key and train up something else! It's an ever-evolving character!

I have played this game for a few years now (pre-steam release) and it is simply epic. The politics are insane, the battles are adrenaline filled, and the dungeons are gorgeous! 

It is FREE to play. Yes your skills are capped at 60 (instead of 100) if you do not subscribe, but I played as a free2play for a few weeks before finally deciding to sub. I currently have 3 subscribed accounts with 4 characters on each. This shit gets THAT serious.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988695905', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 7488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6939, 'last_played': 1477191391}
review:
Mortal Online:
Water will kill you
Creatures will kill you 
Glitches will kill you
People will kill you
They can cook you and eat you
They can wear your skin

author: {'steamid': '76561198042184047', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1443673063}
review: I've played more of this game than my steam hours, so disregard that. The crafting system is great, interesting. Combat is much better than other alternatives to hardcore medieval survival player-made RPGs, like Wurm online. The only problem is the way it brings in new people. The tutorial is okay, but it shows you a very small amount of things to do in the game. It doesn't really go over even a fourth of the basics of the game. There are tutors around the starting city, but you have to seek them out, and they aren't really obvious unless you look around a lot. It has a skill system similar to EVE, where you have to get skill books to actually attain a skill. The biggest problem with it is that after you leave the tutorial area, you're told to go collect some undead heads. You can collect as many as you want, and you'll get paid pretty well for each of them. In the area you kill these undead, there are at most 10 individual undead "spawns", but there are about 20 people there, so everyone is competing for their heads. There is no loot protection, so if you kill one, someone can just come up and yank it from the small package that drops onto the floor, for everyone to see. There are no penalties for doing this whatsoever, and nothing to discourage you from doing it. Also, the arena these undead are in is so small, and there are so few of them, it's very easy to hit another player when you are actually trying to kill an undead as that player is walking past. When you do inevitably hit another player, you are "tagged", your name turns grey to other people, and they are allowed to attack you, penalty-free. I never intentionally attacked anyone else, I was only trying to kill undead, but at least 5 times i was tagged, and immediately one-hit by the guy with the biggest weapon around. Since this is immediately put on the players when they leave the tutorial, this is the only guidance they are given at the beginning of their play. So they go, kill a couple skeletons, then accidentally hit a player, and get ganked by the first person who notices their name is grey, and lose everything but the starting weapons. Then, because doing that is the best way to make money for a very low level character, they go back, and it happens again. It's a vicious catch-22, and it's super easy to fix. I'm positive that a lot of new players are warded off of this title because they can't get a good start in an area that advertises itself as the safest place in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095917598', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 1813, 'playtime_forever': 4177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1630307664}
review:
Mortal online can be a great game if you sarround yourself with the right ppl.
This game is a true sandbox mmo which is very hard to comeby now a days with a skill system similar to the elderscrolls series.
I personally have had a blast with my guild through the highs and lows that this game can bring. 

To adress some of the negative comments i have been reading here are some tips to get the most out of mortal.

1. Get out of the starting cities Morin khur and tindrem as fast as possible. This is where you will find the most thieves and the most griefers who come there to take advantage of your inexperience. Avoid toxai as well since there is a well known guild that gets off at killing newbies there.

2. You are going to die and lose stuff at some point. This can be frustrating but it is a pvp full loot game so become smart about banking stuff you dont need to carry around.

3. This game is meant to be played with a guild. You will have a really hard time without guidance and help from vets in the guilds. This isnt like any other mmo where you can just look up a guide from newbie to vet and be fine. A good place to look for guilds is the mortal online forums guild recruitment section where guilds display their playstyle and tell you a little bit about themselves. Join a helpful guild as soon as possible but do your homework on what kind of an outfit you are getting yourselves into.

Most of all have fun with the group you play with. In any game its the quality people that i laugh in teamspeak with that keep me coming back.
Good luck ingame

Edited review after 20+ hours in game.

I'm a transitioning carebear. I *never* played PVP games because of the fear-mongering of other carebears on various MMO forums and blogs. I didn't want to be 'ganked' or 'camped' and all my precious loot stolen. 

I tried this game and found out that while it is hardcore and you "will" die, it is still fun. Join a guild, hunt/gather with friends in a group, bank often. Also, if someone is camping you...just respawn somewhere else. There's tons of places to farm.

I said in my last review that the suspense of the game wasn't fun. Actually, I lied. I was out in the wild scavenging. I completed geared up, plus some, from some dead adventurers. I don't know who killed them or if they were coming back for their gear. I stole their stuff, turned gray and it was odd feeling knowing they or someone else could come back and kill me to take their stuff back.

Later, I had full mount bags and inventory of caresses and other things worth many, many gold (well to me). It was my biggest, most expensive, hunting trip yet and it was a long way back to town.

This is just the tip of the iceburg, but I don't know if my poor carebear heart can handle all this...

Crafting is amazing. I hear that there are several potions and food combos that haven't been discovered my players yet. That was one of the things that drew me to the game. I've read many, many "Looking For Game" threads on various MMO forums looking for deep crafting systems and this is it. People want to make a name for themselves for being *the* weaponsmith, chef, etc. You can do that here. There are players who have found really good recipes and guard them fiercely, since they are making a killing on the market or keeping it for their guild's use only.

I really get a kick out of the fact that you kill people hard enough that their carcasses fly out of their skin. Also, I skinned a player, made a robe out of him. Then, fried his head with some mushrooms and rice. I was disturbed for a moment and subbed shortly after.

8/10. Will cannibalize again.

This is the best game i've played in a while. Once you get the just of it, it's really not bad, but it's the complexity of it that makes this game so fun and difficult at the same time. Of course you have the trolls who wait at the newbie spots and try to scare you away from the game, so yes it does require some patience but once you join a guild and learn how to play they won't be a problem. 

i strongly recommend this game and feel the "mixed" reviews for this game is unjust

Mortal online is the only true sandbox left. Mortal is your game. If you cant stand hardcore gameplay, dont touch it. 
Combat is verry similar to chivalry and due to no global banking the economy is realistic and alive. 
Graphics are great for the game. 
I reccomend this game to all true sandbox fans, give the game a few days and you'll be addicted ,-,

Came back after 4 months of a break (played before the steam release) and can say the game improved a little. They are still clunky, but at least the DDOS attacks have been sorted out :P

And seriously - I had tons of fun in this game. Due to some problems that made me waste 2 weeks of a paid subscription (had to work, couldn't play, right after paying) I lost interest since it got me really disappointed. I came back solely to recommend this game, since it's scores on steam a soaring. 

It's a clunky, niche, small-team developed mmo, but you're gonna have tons of fun with it if you are already bored with the AAA titles (or - the title :P). Other mmos are more polished, but all of them have the same gameplay. As a former wow raider I cannot bring myself to play the clones or go thru the same (only reskinned) dungeon to see the same set of bosses' moves I saw 2 years before. 

It's just that simple guys - bored with everything else? At least try Mortal - it can be enjoyable! You died? People die in wow too. Look at this exactly the same way. 

Will the game improve further? I sure hope so. If I didn't I wouldn't recommend the game as it is now. There's hope for me because the steam release is still fresh, which means the devs can still reforge this money into more development. 

If you, for some reason, want to visit my blog from the time I played mortal regularly (will hope to be able to do it): https://mortalonlineandme.wordpress.com/ is the web page. Enjoy. I tried to be funny despite my broken english. 

Try the game out with an open mind. What's out there to loose but time? There are countless ♥♥♥♥♥♥, bland games that will take plenty of that from you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985866195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 5406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1236, 'last_played': 1475310394}
review:
Don't let the rating decieve you. This game is spectacular, but it sure as hell isn't for everyone. I've played this game for 5 years since beta, and I have seen all kinds of players: they either try it and drop it, or they play it and stay forever.  If you're the first kind, you're probably going to hate the game with a passion and wonder why on earth people play it in the first place. If you're the second, however, you will be hooked. Possibly forever (like me). There is nothing out on the market that fills the niche like Mortal. Below are some more details about the game.

PROS AND CONS:

+ Open world action RPG with real-time directional combat.
    + Combat is easy to learn, difficult to master. 
    - Mechanics can be dodgy and frustrating at times.

+ Interesting race system and a sprawling skill tree with multiple branches a la Morrowind on drugs
    + Palpable sense of progression. 
    + Skill up by doing (like in the Elder Scrolls Series) and by reading skill books (like EvE).
    -  Can be slow and grindy.
    -  While you can make very diverse builds, only a few are typically accepted as competent, with the rest being 'gimped.'

+ PvP is exciting.
    + Can give you shivers and make your palms sweat when you enter your first large scale battle.
    + (or -) While there are no traditional 'classes' in the game, there are distinct roles that can be filled such as 'footfighter,' 'mounted combat,' 'mage' or 'hybrid mage.' 
    - There are some issues with balance and lag.

+ Crafting system is neat and intuitive.
    + Combine many different materials and parts to make new and customized armor and weapons. 
    -  Proper crafting requires maxed skills, material lores and a subscription. 
    -  Can take a long time and a lot of gold/materials to become a competent crafter (depending on the profession).

+ PvE can be fun and unique. 
    + Action based combat with timed blocks and aiming. 
     - Timing can be wonky.
     - Can get repetitive quickly if you don't like it. 
    + Some interesting mechanics in the tougher enemies such as Demons, Minos and half the mobs in Sarducca. 
    - (or +) First time you get jumped by a monster in Sarducca, you might poop a little.

+ The game requires extensive  interaction with the community for the full experience.
     - It's an awful community.
     + It's a wonderful awful community.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977692783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 114263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5465, 'last_played': 1509970736}
review:
Quickly addicting if you are smart and don't easily die or fall victim to self pity and butt hurt of PVP and full loot drop mechanics.

Deal with loss well you can survive things here very well.

Make no mistake, this is a game of Survival as much as it is combat, crafting, and exploration.

Everything is waiting to kill or steal your shit if you don't pay attention or fail to be careful.

Which makes sucess a wonderful high, and failure such a crash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004614254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1445373664}
review: It's a nice idea but poorly implemented. The full loot pvp looks fun at first but in reality there are too many ways to circumvent the rules (like blueblocking, wich i really hope is not an intended feature) leaving griefers free to do whatever they want while the players who actually follow the rules get punished. If you want to compete with the other players you need to buy a subscripton, and the 15$ per month  they ask is ridiculous considered the overall sub-par experience (both in gameplay and from a technical standpoint) that the game offers. would only reccomend to play if it was completely free, and even then only because there's really no other game like this (but after playing this, i can see why).

If they change that aspect if the game I may try it again, but I probably won't follow it to see if they change it. I like the hardcore type of game, although I haven't played one in a while. However, this one has terrible flagging rules which I can't look past.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216673936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 58816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1725, 'last_played': 1511630536}
review:
Amazing game, I played many hours before the steam release and it's one of the only MMO's I have found to fit the immersive 1st Person, Fantasy, Sandbox criteria I have so desired. A mind-boggling quantity of things to do anywhere from pickpocketing and taming creatures to crafting a weapon by selecting each material its made of from the core out. Don't even get me started on cooking and alchemy, hundreds upon hundreds of ingredients to choose from with the quantity of each altering the outcome of your recipes....
With one massive and persistent game world, the immersion is intense not only from the game world created by the developers but also by the social and economic world created by the players. Kingdoms rise and fall, territorial borders expand or dissapear, and great warriors or mages make their names known with their skill in combat not some invisible calculation played out by the computer after you press a bunch of hotkeys. You must aim both your attack and block, with several other factors such as character speed and weapon type making dramatic changes to combat styles and tactics.
Yes this game does have some bugs, it is unfortunately the price to pay for a pioneer MMO sandbox game with real time virtual world interactions such as hit box based combat for each body part as well as constructable keeps, houses and cities. Mortal is constantly being refined and Starvault is determined to satisfy this game genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008500620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1443401120}
review: As a game saying it is free to play, but can upgrade is fine. I don't mind paying for a game. I like to play it a bit before actually commiting to it. This game lacks the servers it needs to be effective. I waited for over 15 mins twice to login, and each time it told me to relog and try again. My suggestion is this, if you say it is free to play you should have the abilities to actually take on the amount of people who are going to log on just to try it. If not then keep it subscription only.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044767270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1443542853}
review:
Genuienly a great, well-done, fun game with almost limitless freedom and customization. It's so frikkin' immersive you'll forget yourself and your real life obligations. You won't eat, and neither will your babes (because you'll be too busy being someone else in this game). Your children will expire before the flowers in their caps, dying or ere they sicken, but you'll have a great time in this virtual world! 

Yes, to address some of the complaints about this game, the community CAN BE pretty shitty and fond of griefing. But that doesn't diminish the quality of the game itself. It can't be faulted for the fact it's populated largely by dickheads. Much like the real world, the world of Mortal Online is DANGEROUS, and you need to surround yourself with companions to survive. You CAN go it alone, just be prepared for a much more frustrating journey if you do. 

Basically: don't expect an easy, stream-lined, mindless MMO experience, and you'll love this game. I personally don't believe it deserves the sub-par rating it's been given on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075536144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1443320458}
review:
Tem que dar os créditos para o game, pois é o mais proximo de um "Skyrim online" que já vi. É um game duro, que o jogador precisa ter paciência, pricipalmente no começo. Tem bons gráficos, bem detalhados. Boa jogabilidade também.

Os contras ficam por conta do servidor que é ruim (se você tem um jogo online pesado, seus servidores devem ser melhores do que são atualmente), do fato de que para chegar ao nível máximo você deve pagar, aliás, de quase tudo de bom no jogo você ter que pagar ou fazer uma doação, e de os guardas não saberem te dar nenhuma informação.

No geral, recomedo sim o jogo, mas torço por melhorias e mudanças na "política" do jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195132973', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1445273614}
review:
Okay. This is not a review, It is a question Why is this like 10 fps in my computer when it has the following specs:

author: {'steamid': '76561198063964432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 17800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1624238371}
review:
You'll die, you'll lose everything.
Then you'll die and lose everything to intentional aspects of the game.
Then you'll piss off someone who knows a gm.(good luck).
Then you'll quit for any of five thousand reasons.
Then you'll come back because this game has no proper substitute.

Mortal online is probably the greatest game I have ever played, but the people in charge lack the maturity and professional approach necessary to really cash out on their golden ticket. It's honestly pretty sad...

With that being said, play the game. Experience true freedom and all the pain and glory that goes hand in hand with it.
Just don't love it, because the people at SV aren't the type of people that will conquer this type of niche game.
Those people are yet to be seen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999533395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 372334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1547162587}
review:
Totally unique sandbox mmorpg with full loot and pvp.
There is simply nothing like it on the market and this has depth like no other mmo.
Build your own city with your own laws!
More features than any other mmorpg out there so far!
This game wont hold your hands so be ready to use your player skills and brain a lot!
First person only!
Unlimited FREE trial
Premium model to have full efficency in the game.
Its not Pay to win.
Player skill dependent
Player driven economy

Its a hardcore beast for sure!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992567233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 353056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11659, 'last_played': 1674261701}
review: ok iv been playing this game very thropughly for the past 2 weeks since the steam launch release of this game and i was intruegued by it sinceits a mmo and a hardcore mmorpg , iv played mmorpgs for over 18 years , this game has a lot of amazing qualitys such ass the pvp stuckture and the free roaming world, but heres where i have to say a few tings negitive. this game is subsctribe to win theres no questioning that, you cant build a house or own a castle or even be in your own guild if you dont subscribe, nextly you are only 60% of the power a subscriber is, the pvp is great but its a cluster in the graveyards and there are always people ganking in there , can be fun but majority of the time its rage central. would i recomend this game to a friend ? hell no ! the game has way to many bugs and there are much better games to be played such as elder scrolls or camelot unchained , have a wonderful day and thanks for reading this lousy rant =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198063499307', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1443283294}
review: So Uhh, I played it, it looked ugly, it felt awful, and I felt really bored the whole time. The idea of the game sounds great, you live in a fantasy world, doing basic quest, that so far have no sign to show you they're quests. When you first play, you're kind like in a safe mode, where you can't hurt anybody or steal anything, and nobody can do the same to you. But you'll see other players who don't have safe mode, and they just get killed over and over by Higher geared players. You'll read it's a dog eat dog world, but really it's more of, you make a character, you get so far in it till the timer runs out, and then anybody can kill you. If the game worked more like DayZ where you were just tossed into this world and you make your own path, I could understand that, but it doesn't do that very well in this. I give it a 4/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084866178', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3226, 'last_played': 1445392231}
review: I was absolutely lost at first, but now, five days later, I'm still lost, but not as badly.   This is the most challenging MMORPG I've ever played.  Once you're done with the turtorial, there are no quets.  You can go where you want, do what you want without restriction, which is both a blessing and a curse, depending on how you handle yourself.  This is a hardcore gakme for those who like the freedom to act as they wish, be it skinning pigs, killing monsters, or murdering other players to take their goods.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005540172', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 4847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3164, 'last_played': 1463177765}
review:
Experience TRUE sandbox by these easy steps:
1. Skip tutorial
2. Wander around until gear
3. Tame a rabbit
4. Find some players who aint gonna fok you up and still get killed anyway
5. Fresh start
6. Wander around until dead again
7. Learn something from the game until basics are familiar
8. Read a book about swimming and then drown
9. Turn full nudity on from options
10. Do some serious sandbox things until dead again


5/5 would go pick my gear from cold dead body again.
ps. you can name your eguipment and even food, literally you could go eat a bag of sh1t. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197980841079', 'num_games_owned': 1876, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7224, 'last_played': 1442689312}
review:
If you like an empty husk of a game world with broken mechanics and god-awful combat, this is the game for you. The state you see the game in now is the same way it was in 2010 when I first gave this mess a try. The devs ofcourse are the same as ever, giving excuses instead of trying fix issues with the game.

If you do decide to give this one a shot, the free version is a time-killer and a good one at that. But to pay a subscription for the game? Not from me atleast. For that to happen the devs really need to start acting like devs. 
You don´t really have to look far to see what I´m talking about. Check out Tindrem for instance, the plaza looks okay-ish but get to the rich area and you will see floating staircases, staircases without any stairs, buildings with doors facing into the wall, huge seams in the ground, etc. What a sorry state it is in. 

If someone tells you it gets better outside the starter cities, that is because it gets emptier. Gameplay feature right there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055616866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1443216302}
review: This game is not easy to understand first of all. The entire system is pretty much based on the fact that you have to rely on the help of others to do anything, or figure things out on your own. Not 15 minutes into the game was I killed by a player(s) because I hit another player for stealing from me. There is a mechanic to call a guard, and many times did I try and no guard came. I could not figure out the issue so I hit the player away from me, he ran away and I was immediately swarmmed and killed, losing all I had, and therefore making me never want to play Mortal Online again. If this was my fault in the end for doing something wrong, I would at least like to know how to do it properly next time, yet the help features available were no help at all. The game is long, drawn out, and not friendly to new players, even in the starting town. I think the game could be good, but they have not done enough to make it good, nor have they fixed what seems to be broken. Not a fun game unless you like grinding resources for hours at a time only to die because someone out in the world finds you and kills you. And you won't get your items back. The most fun I had with my time was the character creation, and that's pretty sad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041686787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1443289101}
review:
Came back after 4 months of a break (played before the steam release) and can say the game improved a little. They are still clunky, but at least the DDOS attacks have been sorted out :P

And seriously - I had tons of fun in this game. Due to some problems that made me waste 2 weeks of a paid subscription (had to work, couldn't play, right after paying) I lost interest since it got me really disappointed. I came back solely to recommend this game, since it's scores on steam a soaring. 

It's a clunky, niche, small-team developed mmo, but you're gonna have tons of fun with it if you are already bored with the AAA titles (or - the title :P). Other mmos are more polished, but all of them have the same gameplay. As a former wow raider I cannot bring myself to play the clones or go thru the same (only reskinned) dungeon to see the same set of bosses' moves I saw 2 years before. 

It's just that simple guys - bored with everything else? At least try Mortal - it can be enjoyable! You died? People die in wow too. Look at this exactly the same way. 

Will the game improve further? I sure hope so. If I didn't I wouldn't recommend the game as it is now. There's hope for me because the steam release is still fresh, which means the devs can still reforge this money into more development. 

If you, for some reason, want to visit my blog from the time I played mortal regularly (will hope to be able to do it): https://mortalonlineandme.wordpress.com/ is the web page. Enjoy. I tried to be funny despite my broken english. 

Try the game out with an open mind. What's out there to loose but time? There are countless shitty, bland games that will take plenty of that from you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054428937', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 16672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2974, 'last_played': 1504483726}
review:
The free version is basically a trial. 
i am still f2p, but i will be subbing very soon, ive been playing 3 DAYS, and have killed p2p players. 
IT IS SKILL BASED, the only advantage p2p has is skill cap is up too 100 as opposed to 60,
attributes are the same for both. 
Heavy armor training is not available for f2p, but you can still wear the same armor (you will move slower) only because your skills are capped at 60 (though trainable to 100 still) and you need 100 armor training to learn heavy armor (but not to wear it)

REDS will try to kill you, but if you cant dodge them, its really your fault unless its a full blown zerg (rareish)
I have only died by a red once in three days.... dont keep touching the hot pan and expect it to not burn you..
this game is a pvp game, its open, its everywhere, stop crying about it please. 

GEAR HELPS ALOT
ATTRIBUTES HELP ALOT
SKILLS POINTS HELP
BUT ACTUAL SKILL WINS EVERYTIME 

if you are similarly geared to a p2p, and you have your skill points at 60, with proper attributes, YOU WILL STAND A CHANCE depending on your actual level of skill irl. 
TRUST ME. 
Im going p2p JUST SO I CAN CRAFT and because i know that when i get my skills unlocked to 100 (im at cap for f2p), ill be a monster. 

THIS GAME IS NOT FOR WEAK MINDS, you will be killed, you will have to think and learn, but it IS worth it. You will be helped, but not handheld and guided through repetitive quests. 
You can do whatever you want in this game. Seriously. 

Think of it as midevil DayZ or Wasteland mod, you can have better gear, but you can still die to someone. You will eventually lose your shit. 

THERE IS NO MAP, but that adds to the fun and value of knowledge. 
THERE ARE NO QUESTS, but that adds to your own adventure and you lose the restrictions of the linear progression type of mmo. 

Stick with it, trust noone (at first), and be smart and know what your getting into.
this is the most fun i have had in a game, regardless of graphics or trolls. its fun. 
Its risky, and its not a calculator tab target mindless mmo yall seem to be used too. 

if you were content with the cookie cutter grindy mmo, go for those and dont spam help chat with your QQ. We dont care. We all have died and lost FAR more than you will ever have gotten in the game, and loved it. 
if you want your skill and knowledge to matter, to feel like your actually in a player driven world (its completely player driven and awesome), if you want insane crafting and combat that gives you a rush like no other, this is for you.

DONT PLAY A HARDCORE GAME AND EXPECT IT NOT TO BE HARDCORE

author: {'steamid': '76561198085124131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1441661010}
review:
problems with lag is very sever i live in the us and the only server they have is in france so most people outside that area will have will have problems also login in is an issue.
 now for me the lagg was so bad i couldnt kill even the simplist creatures os for me this game is unplayable but from what i saw it wasnt to bad just geting used to the crafting system takes time and i didnt have too much trouble with most players.

other issues is no map u will get lost very easily espeacially at frist or in new areas but as long as u have good memory skills and take it slow u shouldnt have too much problems.

also help chat isnt used for help??
mostly people are just ranting on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969076232', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1442347583}
review:
Great MMO with complex and deep gameplay elements. It requires some teamwork and some homework at start...
Read guides and watch videos to increase your knowledge of the game, then seek an active clan/guild that suits your gameplay, schedule and way of thinking and you can then expect a lot of fun !

Beware, this is not a themepark but a true old school sandbox. Very rewarding once you get to know the game better though. Somewhat similar to EvE Online and Darkfall Unholy Wars in its freedom of gameplay and harsh universe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012593380', 'num_games_owned': 1751, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1443035874}
review:
Also schlechster gehts bald nichmehr. 
Das Setting is super und sieht auch an sich passabel aus.
Nun aber das Gameplay das ist schlecht und unter aller sau.
Die erste aufgabe ein Schwein zu töten war noch nie so schwer.
Ihr wollt zuschlagen ein anderer Spieler stellt sich vor euer schwert, nun seit ihr ein Verbrecher und dürft gejagt werden.
Zack erster Tot, nun auf auf einen Priester suchen der dumm in der Ecke steht.
Ihr erkennt solche an einer Lichtsäule über ihren Köpfen.
Allerdings werden erst die Lichsäulen geladen die Kilometer weit entfernt sind und erst nach guten 5 Minuten werden Priester in eurer nähe angezeigt. 
Wiederbelebt, also auf auf ein schwein Töten ein spieler stellt sich euch in den weg ihr seit ein wiederholungstäter und ihr sterbt sofort an schlechten Gewissen.
Spiel beendet und deinstalliert, nun tot für immer.

Fazit: Super Death Simulator ansonsten für nichts zu gebrauchen, bin nichtmal aus dem ersten Dorf gekommen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045363620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1442972448}
review:
If you are a Dark souls enthusiast, you'll be quite at home, welcome to wonderland :D.

Otherwise.
Avoid like the plague.
Terrible explained mechanics and interface.
Painfully slow gameplay, get home from work to work a little more.
Atrocious comunity behaviour (save a few player who found nirvana and now shoud be canonized as saints for their pacience)
Complete developer disregard towards cheap griefing. A simple "/criminal" toggling agression against grey would prevent a lot of "blue blocking". (That is, throwing yourself in front of a player attack so it seens like he tried to kill you, like a medieval form of insurance fraud i guess.)
As the descripion says, really not for the faint of heart.
Consider carefully before playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090920425', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 20950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1666219581}
review:
ok to bigd your post makes completely no sense the game isnt meant to be played by yourself the only way to survive the harsh world is to find a guild 


this game is fun i have over 400 hours off record before the game was released to steam.

there are plenty of ways to make money and for a fact you choose to do combat, and at that SOLO Combat to attempt to make money, there are so many ways to make money.

this game is based off what you choose to do. if you want to tame animals then that will become your proffession. you cannot have multiple proffessions on one charactor, i mean this isnt runescape or world of warcraft. 

i love the fact that the game has been out for years and i can say ive been looking for a game to the exact specifics for years..... and for the fact i have never found it before this past year is beyond me but i can truly say it is the only AND I MEAN ONLY AUTHENTIC GAME of its kind.

if you are going to build a town then expect it to be as hard as real life your going to have to work your lazy fat a$$ off to achive that goal.

if you want a kingdom then you want to recruit those who would be loyal to your cause. you will need to gain followers and learn to work togeather.

all i can say is add the wiki page to your fav's or desktop aswell as any proffessional guidesman on youtube if your going to try to solo play.

FOR THIS IS THE DARK AGES AND ALL BLOOD SHALL BE SHED TO INDURE VICTORY.........

  THIS
    IS
MEDEVIL

author: {'steamid': '76561198122819054', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1600086732}
review:
Эта игра является по сути очень продвинутой 3Д версией легенды всех ММОРПГ Ультимы онлайн. Полная свобода действий, города построенные игроками не уступающие по функционалу городам НПС, массовые зарубы и прочее.

Отдельного упоминания стоит система боя. На видео этого не видно но при игре понимаешь насколько сильно рулят РУКИ, поскольку фехтование тут настоящее исскуство и иногда даже один боец может перебить отряд противника, если этот боец займет более выгодную позицию и использует ровные руки как надо :)

Никаких уровней и классов. Ваши действия зависят от билда и прокачки.

И Самое вкусное- это фуллут, что делает игру воистину хардкорной, ведь нельзя склепать супер-меч и всех крушить. Вопервых из за озвученного ранее требования к кривизне рук, во-вторых - его все равно рано или поздно отожмут, когда вы окажетесь в тактически невыгодном положении :)

В общем рекоменду.

П.С. Игра ОЧЕНЬ требовательна по ресурсам. В описании игры- её оптимальные требования по технике на самом деле минимальные, при хар-ках машины ниже можно даже не пытася запустить- мегалаги и невозможность играть вам гарантированно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010106212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1459125217}
review:
This is quite possible the worst community i have ever met in the history of gaming. From the very first day i logged in and for 5 days straight, a group of old elitist players who dosen't want new people from steam, decided to target me for constant Verbald and ingame trolling. They kept greifing me and then telling everyone in global that i was griefing them, basicly turning the entire community against me, so i had the whole server coming after me. No matter how many times i tried to log out and come back in the hopes of these people being gone. They never were, every single time i was met with griefing, trolling and verbal assault. 

If you do not funcion with a retarded community build up around 10 year olds then DO NOT DOWLOAD THIS GAME. THIS IS THE WORST COMMUNITY I HAVE EVER ENCOUNTERED IN ME ENTIRE 21 YEAR LIFE!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992897288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 7563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5824, 'last_played': 1471256450}
review:
Its a shame it was never finished, its filled with glitches that the game's elitist calls mechanics, like people running in the air, equipping gear sometimes makes them disappear and other shit. I have really fun but to actually get somewhere you have to be a subscriber which costs 15€ a month, and I would only pay max 20€ for this game one time.

It has the best pvp mechanic since oldschool Tibia, its just a damn shame they aint fixing it.

So I guess I can not really recommend this game, I would if they got their asses outta the chairs and did some work, but now I will not do it.


Try it out yourself and see wether you like it or not, but do not commit too much time since you will be limited.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053725473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2715, 'last_played': 1478053543}
review:
Edited review after 20+ hours in game.

I'm a transitioning carebear.  I *never* played PVP games because of the fear-mongering of other carebears on various MMO forums and blogs. I didn't want to be 'ganked' or 'camped'  and all my precious loot stolen.  

I tried this game and found out that while it is hardcore and you "will" die, it is still fun.  Join a guild, hunt/gather with friends in a group, bank often. Also, if someone is camping you...just respawn somewhere else. There's tons of places to farm.

I said in my last review that the suspense of the game wasn't fun.  Actually, I lied. I was out in the wild scavenging. I completed geared up, plus some, from some dead adventurers. I don't know who killed them or if they were coming back for their gear. I stole their stuff, turned gray and it was odd feeling knowing they or someone else could come back and kill me to take their stuff back.

Later, I had full mount bags and inventory of caresses and other things worth many, many gold (well to me). It was my biggest, most expensive, hunting trip yet and it was a long way back to town.

This is just the tip of the iceburg, but I don't know if my poor carebear heart can handle all this...

Crafting is amazing. I hear that there are several potions and food combos that haven't been discovered my players yet. That was one of the things that drew me to the game.  I've read many, many "Looking For Game" threads on various MMO forums looking for deep crafting systems and this is it.  People want to make a name for themselves for being *the* weaponsmith, chef, etc.  You can do that here. There are players who have found really good recipes and guard them fiercely, since they are making a killing on the market or keeping it for their guild's use only.

I really get a kick out of the fact that you kill people hard enough that their carcasses fly out of their skin. Also, I skinned a player, made a robe out of him. Then, fried his head with some mushrooms and rice. I was disturbed for a moment and subbed shortly after.

8/10. Will cannibalize again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039874120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1442925403}
review: Not a real free to play.
developer_response:
We agree, so on the store page we have this:

"Unlimited free trial!
Mortal Online offers a free-to-play mode with a skill cap at skill level 60. In order to unlock the maximum skill levels and fully master your Mortal destiny, a paid monthly subscription is needed, but unlike many other games there are no microtransactions. Unsubscribing will re-apply the skill cap, but your skills will be maxed again when you re-subscribe. Every player gets one free character slot, and you can purchase additional slots up to a maximum of four."
