author: {'steamid': '76561198020223228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1540160214}
review:
Mortal online can be a great game if you sarround yourself with the right ppl.
This game is a true sandbox mmo which is very hard to comeby now a days with a skill system similar to the elderscrolls series.
I personally have had a blast with my guild through the highs and lows that this game can bring. 

To adress some of the negative comments i have been reading here are some tips to get the most out of mortal.

1. Get out of the starting cities Morin khur and tindrem as fast as possible. This is where you will find the most thieves and the most griefers who come there to take advantage of your inexperience. Avoid toxai as well since there is a well known guild that gets off at killing newbies there.

2. You are going to die and lose stuff at some point. This can be frustrating but it is a pvp full loot game so become smart about banking stuff you dont need to carry around.

3. This game is meant to be played with a guild. You will have a really hard time without guidance and help from vets in the guilds. This isnt like any other mmo where you can just look up a guide from newbie to vet and be fine. A good place to look for guilds is the mortal online forums guild recruitment section where guilds  display their playstyle and tell you a little bit about themselves. Join a helpful guild as soon as possible but do your homework on what kind of an outfit you are getting yourselves into.

Most of all have fun with the group you play with. In any game its the quality people that i laugh in teamspeak with that keep me coming back.
Good luck ingame

author: {'steamid': '76561197980991076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 4616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2233, 'last_played': 1445323114}
review:
Really enjoy mortal online, it is a sandbox at heart and is not trying to impress those who are afraid to die and lose their donkey, Tired of seeing people cry about the game doing exactly what it is intended to do, create a hardcore, unforgiving, progressive and fun experience. Mortal isn't intended to appeal to the masses, it is niche, it is awesome.

If you like these games you will probably find some enjoyment in Mortal Online:

Star Wars Galaxies
DayZ
H1Z1
Eve Online
Rust
ARK
Face of Mankind

Personally I will be subscribing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198179356070', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1564, 'last_played': 1447207997}
review:

3)There's only one server. I don't need to even bother going further that explains it all.
4) Did I mention the fanbase was shit? It's shit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075253197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1442870005}
review:
The game is very badly optimized hopefully with the steam release the developers will get money to actully update the engine and diffrent aspects of the game so it becomes more stable..

All in all its a hardcore game and ive played it before steam and loved the freedom back then today i can say this.
Steps.
1.Get a guild before even trying to leave a safe city(thats not safe either hrhrhr)
2.Farm the graveyard get skulls
3.Dont play unless u ghonna sub or are unable to do so after a bit(this will be a killjoy)

author: {'steamid': '76561198028157209', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 43107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2869, 'last_played': 1572776900}
review:
Mortal Online. 

It is no suprise to me that this game has around a 50% approval rating because that is exactly what it endeavors itself to receive. Really it is the perfect score. Not because its bad but because of the world of Mortal Online it self. The world is full of freedom, oprtunities and most of all merciless DEATH. With a full loot system so it is very taxing and difficult to get into at first. But if you stay strong and realize the freedom, fun and adventure this game has got to offer that possibly no other game does, you may find what you were looking for. But it can definately be to much to take for alot of people. So 50% approval is 100% of what the game and its community is intending to recieve and they got what they were after.

Now for my review.

(I played the game for about 6 months straight in 2014)
 
Well first off I love that the world and the quests and the storys are not told by NPC's but by the players them selves. If you think moral decisions really mean alot in games like Fable or Fallout then you have not tasted Mortal Online. Everything you do matters to someone else. Every good thing you do for someone and every nasty wicked thing you do means ALOT to another person. When you get into a guild, make friends, get involved in the politics of the world it self; you are fighting for what ever you are for, evil or good, money or power and everything you do matters and effects someone else. And passions and tensions definately rise all of the time. Theres really no other game that i have ever played before that really felt like a 2nd life like the experience that Mortal Online gives you. So I absolutely love that.

The combat system is pretty good. Not the best ive ever seen and but definately not the worst. It is skill based and you can not target your oppenent like in other mmo's. Im not a big fan of the way you fire off magic spells in this game but eh, alot of people make it work for them and I suppose if you can you may enjoy that too. But the combat is more like Chivalry.

The crafting system and the skill leveling system really shine the brightest. There is so much depth and originality in both of these 2 systems that Mortal Online really made it their own and no other game has before or sense done anything like it and I really admire them alot. So epic. Quite possibly the best part.

The bad. The bugs and glitches can be a real pain in the a$$ sometimes. I mean really. I know the community told the dev's they should have focused on fixing the bugs and glitchs before they focused on saraducaa but they did not listen. Honostly as much as I love the game it self for what it is the bugs and glitchs kill it for actually making it on the list of my most favorite games of all time. But it is still top 10.

Overall I would give this game and 8.4 out of 10. It loses .2 points for the community being alittle to a-holey to noobs but at the same time Mortal Needs those a-holes in endgame to make the world go round so hard to balance the a-holeness and it loses the other -1.2 because of the bugs and glitches. The dev team needs to stop focusing on growth and expansion and focus on pest control. The bugs need a fix for real. But other then that I ABSOLUTELY recomend this game. It is as if Ultima Online and The Elder Scrolls (not online) series had a baby with its own sense of identity and flare. And those 2 games are my favorite of all time. So for that I love Mortal Online.

<3

author: {'steamid': '76561198031160389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1442803213}
review: Usability is horrendous, tutorials are easily missed, combat system is "learn how [not to suck] and camera swipe" per a GM in game.  The community in-game is about as bad as the game itself (i usually don't post this much negativity on a game ever).  It's a major P2W style game .......even though they mask it very well.  The ancestory character builder is it probably the only thing interesting in the entire systems.  There are better, more stable games out there that provide players a much more enjoyable, overall experience.  The game needs to go through many, MANY usability studies before allowing this many players to run around and harass GMs in chat on how to do stuff.  3/10 score.  No one should have to go to google to figure out how to start playing a game - ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962932459', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1587830769}
review: J'étais vraiment excité de voir ce qui selon moi pouvait être un sucesseur légitime a Ultima Online. Souvenons nous de UO2 qui a été abandonné je comparerais ce jeux a ce bébé avorté. Steam dit que j'ai joué trois heures a ce jeu, en fait j'ai joué 40 minutes, en trois temps. Une fois connecté on a du plaisir, il est effectivement risqué de s'aventurer seul on se fait éclaté comme promis. C'est ce risque qui rend le jeu attirant. Attendre 25 minutes pour "essayer" un jeu en-ligne en 2015 très ordinaire... Mon opinion est qu'ils ont besoin comme UO de subdiviser leurs serveur. Donc un en amérique un en europe etc... Donc Oui ce jeux a du potentiel mais ils ont besoin clairement de plus de fonds... Malgré tout je le reccomande parceque je crois que le future sera meilleur.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003885897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1441677100}
review:
EDIT:
One of the long-time players has contacted me and mentioned that there are player cities that exist that are much safer than the starting cities.  Their guild would be happy to move me to a safe city if I recreate a character.   The game mechanics and abilities were fun so I'm going to give it another shot and see if it works better.  More to come in a few weeks.....

-------------------------

The mechanics are a nod back to traditional skill based mmos, graphics are nice and I had a decent time in the tutorial zone.

However, it has the typical toxic player base that prefers to grief using PvP mechancis and exploits to actually playing the PvE portion of the game.  

In fact, the rules that are in place to stop player killing in towns actually raises griefing to an artform in Mortal Online.  

My first experience with a griefer was when they charmed an animal then then left it standing alone in a field of other animals of the same type.  Waiting until a newbie player like me attacks it (not knowing that it counts as an attack on a player if you attack their pets).  And thus I was KOS by the guards, quickly murdered and then taunted for my "newb" mistake.

My second experience with griefing came when I left the newbie zone.   There's always a "welcoming committee" of PKers waiting just a little ways outside the zone entrance to make sure you get welcome-murdered.  From talking to higher level players, it doesn't get better, just make sure you travel in groups if you want to explore the countryside OR you are exceptionally powerful.

If you want a similar game but without the PvP / Grief aspect, I recommend checking out Project Gorgon.   Won't be free-to-play, but frankly I'm tired of the model that allows a rotating door of toxic players to get banned and then just recreate accounts to come back in again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989739309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 35716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8156, 'last_played': 1570654369}
review:
There's a lot of mixed reviews and there's very good reasons for this, the game is not everyone's cup of tea and you can tell when first logging in that it's a very difficult game to get into. I feel like if more people gave the game the time it deserved and didn't judge based on first impressions it wouldn't have anywhere near as many negative reviews. 

Pros
Be anything you want
Awesome combat
Hugely diverse playstyles
Full loot PvP
Meainingful alignment system
Territorial control
World building
Creature control via taming/domination
Tons of things to discover
F2P, try it and if you don't like it who cares?

Cons
Sub is an absolute requirement to play the game effectively
Extremely steep learning curve
Very difficult barrier of entry
Small amounts of information available(is a pro if you enjoy learning things yourself)
Creating a gimped character can affect how effective you are in which role you choose(google templates for whatever you plan to play)
Lots of griefing in main cities(blue blocking etc to make you flag criminal)
Game is open world so you get "lag" once you hit server loading lines, since you have to load the area of the world and all creatures/players/structures that are there

I have played MO on and off for a few years and never stuck around longer than a week, the game has improved massively and I'm having trouble logging out since I started playing a few days ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128524245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1442186437}
review:
Muy buen juego, el heredero de Ultima Online, exelente sistema de craft y la vista en primera persona es genial... pero.....

Tener que pagar por mes para que los skills de crafteo funcionen 100% no es bueno, muchos no podemos gastar tanto dinero en un juego mensualmente, y estamos hablando de que, con este sistema, no es F2P, ya que mutilan las habilidades de tu personaje (al que le pones muchas horas para hacerlo llegar a 100% en un skill) al dejar solo un 60% activo si jugas en modo free.

La idea de un F2P, es que puedas jugar normalmente, y quienes quieran donar o pagar mensualidad, tengan cosas que hagan una leve diferencia entre free y pago. Con este sistema, un free player, jamas podria competir con un suscriptor.

Lo desinstalo hasta que cambien las cosas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965741937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1442593831}
review:
Mortal Online, ein Spiel wie ich es mir schon lange gewünscht habe. open world,absolute  handlungsfreiheit was skills betrifft, kein Klassensystem - die eigene Spielweise entscheidet welche Fähigkeiten man erhält/meistert ... aber leider ein Musterbeispiel dafür wie free2play manchmal vollkommen pay2win sein kann ... denn : Mit dem "gratiscontent" sind die skills auf 60 von 100 punkten beschränkt, was sich nicht nach einem grossen unterschied anhört, jedoch ein gewaltiger ist. Viele Fähigkeiten sind so total nutzlos da sie erst ab Skillstufe 60+ sinnvoll/effektiv werden. das hat zur folge dass man in den leichten Gegenden mit dutzenden anderen "free2playern" rumgammelt und sich entweder um die paar vorhandenen gegner prügelt oder von abonnenten zur schlachtbank geführt wird (respawnen in so einem fall meistens sinnlos da der/die am nächsten liegenden Wiederbelebungspunkte durch spawncamping blockiert wird). bewegt man sich von besagten "leichten" Zonen weg, erwartet einen oft schnell der Tot durch deutlich stärkere NPC-gegner, meistens wird man jedoch spätestens an einem der viel zu engen übergänge in eine andere Zone von anderen Spielern (i.d.R. abonnenten, welchen man als f2p´er grundsätzlich nur als besser punchingball dient) weggenatzt. Man hat praktisch keine chance ohne abo. Kommunikation fehlanzeige, Kill on sight grundprinzip (könnte an fehlendem voicechat liegen). 

Fazit: 
Die free2play version von Mortal online ist als Demo zu gebrauchen, man kann mal in das Spiel reinschnuppern und sich grob mit Spielprinzip und Mechaniken vertraut machen, ein wirkliches Spielerlebnis bekommt man ohne das abo für monatlich ~14€ jedoch nicht geboten. Da ich den Eindruck hatte dass selbst mit einem Abo der Spielspass für mich nicht wirklich mehr wird (weltgrösse eher medium, soloplay i.d.R. aussichtlos und frustierend, community im helpchat zwar nett, jedoch verlief jede Spielerbegegnung ausserhalb der sicheren Stadt tödlich für mich) habe ich keinen monat bezahlt und kann zum vollen Umfang des Spiels keine genauen Angaben machen. 

Die kostenlose Version erhält von mir eine negative Bewertung, da es sich um eine Demo handelt, das komplette Spiel kostet ca. 14€ monatlich.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000994874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1443149612}
review:
log in. crash on character creation. still logged in for several minuets. log back in. crash on chracter creation. rinse repeat. would crash again/10

Howeeeeeever, when I did start getting into the game I felt very rewarded by just exploring the world trying to see what I could interact with and started to get a sence of wonder just what I was collecting could be used for. 

Right now at the time of this review the community is overwhelmed with questions on how to get into the game and I gotta give props to those trying to help the fellow players out. 

At first I thought the Tutorial was woefully inadequate but again through exploring the world I was taught more about the game little by little rather than having to digest everything in one big dump of knowledge which lead me to wanting to explore even more giving me the idea that starting out I'm nothing more than peasant material and need to get out there and do something if I want to puzzle out what makes a simple character into their goal.

So far the game gave me a hook and I hope it delivers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068443723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 10917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9195, 'last_played': 1511942211}
review:
ФАРМИ 10 ГОЛДЫ ДЕТКА. ПОКУПАЙ ОФИГЕННЫЙ ШМОТ И ИДИ ЕЩЕ ФАРМИТЬ. ЧТО? 3 ПКШНИКА В ОПИЗДОХУЕВШЕЙ ШИПАСТОЙ БРОНЕ? О НЕТ, КТО ЭТО ТУТ ЗА 5 СЕКУНД СДОХ? КАК ЖАЛЬ, ВСЕ НАФАРМЛЕННОЕ ЗА ДЕНЬ В ТОПКУ БЛ*ДЬ.

Если серьезно - игра суперская. Ждал такую свою свою жизнь, жаль что вот узнал только в 2015 году. Есть баги, лаги, графика деьмовая, даже самые низкие настройки лагают на машиназ за over9000$. Плюсов в миллионы раз больше. Умер - все вещи выпали. Пошел куда-то за город? Лови 55-ти метровый топор ПКшника в морду. Решил покормить коня за миллион голды мухоморами? Лол, удачи. 
НАсчет доната - серьезно поиграть без подписки не получится. Если будете драться с кем-то в КВ то вы будете сосать. Это как 20 триальных уровней в ВОВе.
__________________________________________

АХАХА ПРИШЕЛ НА НУБО ЛОКУ, С ПЛОХИМ КУПЛЕННЫМ МЕЧЕМ, ВЫРЕЗАЛ ТУТОРА, 10 НУБОВ НАЛУТАЛ ОКОЛО 6 ГОЛДЫ, ПЕРЕДАЛ ЧУВАКУ С ГИЛЬДИИ И ТЕПЕРЬ СИЖУ В КУСТАХ, БОЮСЬ ДОЛБАННОГО ЛИКТОРА ПОСРЕДИ ПОЛЯНЫ! А ЛИКТОР ЭТО ЧУДАК С МАГИЕЙ ПО 99999999999999 УРОНА!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! ШО ДЕЛАТЬ

__________________________________________

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=519420580

__________________________________________

Играя 2-ую неделю, ставши жестким ПКашером нубов и набрав 35 убийств я задумался: "Я очень сильно выхватываю у чуваков с проплаченым аккаунтом, он имогут носить броню круче кости без перевеса, они могут быстрее бегать, они могут наносить на 50% и больше урона больше." Я конкретно задумался над тем что-бы проплатить аккаунт, объязательно конного гоп-стопера, так-как они высекают всех и вся на своем пути.

__________________________________________

Выбор из конных героев невелик: Конный толсто-маг, Кавалериец с большим топором, Конный лучник. На мой выбор повлиял второй континент. Называется он Сардука, там ОЧЕНЬ-ОЧЕНЬ жарко. Ходить пешком нет смысла, т.к. из-за горячего песка вы будете очень грется. Так-что места жестяным банкам в стальной броне по 25 кг делать там нечего. Они заживо сваряться там. Решил создавать проплаченого Маунтед Арчера (Конного Лучника), увидим что из этого получится.

__________________________________________

Сардукка:  

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=534959690

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=534959759

P.S: DOOM Распался, я с новичками строим поселение в Дикой Пустоши. Присоеденяйтесь, помогайте!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074097441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1442724105}
review:
Hello, Corrupted games,  from support, to ingame staff, and even forums moderators.

Heres a short story, i been baned 7x by a power tripping gm, i ended up duping to ruin their economy 3 yrs ago.
I been pardoned by support team and they allowed me back ingame and on forums, as a new player with no history.
They PROMISED ME, i could be safe, and sub my account, and never have a probleme if i followed the rules, which i did.

Heres a link to one of my conversation with their staff team : http://imgur.com/a/2btYa

On these screenshot, you can see that i am asking, to be unbaned, because they perma banned me, on 1st offense, for spamming, which is clearly not the apropriate consequence.

Then you see this power tripping staff, who totaly says what support decided, doesnt matter to him, and hes the king and he decide.

Then he changes the terms of the deal i had with the support.
He threatens me.
He says if i use another account, than blackmage 111 or this one (cartel666)  i will be banned.
I understand, that i can use both.

blackmage111 account been perma banned, because i posted negative stuff about Mortal online, here, on the steam forums.
The account cartel666, been banned today, for Forum Rules Violations.
The rule i violated, is using an alternate account, to contact them, to see why my first account, been perma banned, for the most dumb reason i ever heard.

Their answer?  ban this account too. and threaten to ban my ingame account, if i ask for a forum unban again.

They have zero respect for their own rules and policies.

Other than that, The game is very unique. You'll never find as much bugs on 1 game at once. Its unique. This game have this little something other games dont have. Corruption and Bugs.

This is just a little bit, or all the coruption i been victim of, But i decided to show this one, cus this is post steam release.For anyone who state there is no more corruption since steam release.

my favorite sentence from Lead GM Discord ever :  im starvault, im mortal online, im the law, (your account has been banned for 24.000 hours)

Open  support tickets. get deleted.
go on forums and pm a staff to talk. Account banned.
Log 2nd account to talk to staff. Get banned, for ban evading.
Contact henrik. he got no time.
Contact sebastian, He dont care.


I dream of a game that has people that could look at the logs, (correctly)  and answer support ticket questions,   But ingame staff, should have no power, beside  Res, and un-stuck

I paged a gm 4 days ago, cus i fell down a hill, and my lootbag was stuck on the side *unreachable*  and  i tell the gm  my loot cant be looted.  and he refuse to help me,   someone jump down the cliff and close his client to dodge the fall dmg (exploit)  and the gm do nothing, i tell him about it, he says nothing, *i cant help you*
i get friends to come chase the guy and kill him. he ran to a nodeline, and no loot appear. the gm goes and  *this is a very very rare bug, unfortunatly nothing can be done to retrieve the lootbag, im sorry.
im like wtf, this guy exploit to loot my shit u do nothing, now he exploit to not lose his shit u do nothing?  am i supose to camp nodelines with my buddy so if i get zerg i can never lose my loot?
gm answer : fine.
GG  
so my question now is,  why do a gm i page for help, refuse to help, ignore someone who is exploiting in his face,  and then i make a joke about ima go exploit that bug too, he goes fine,  

why are we paying for this?
Game should be 100% free to play up to 100% skill & stats.  no one should be paying for this.
unless they fix the bugs, and give a training to the gm  to explain them, whats logical and whats not, whats legal and whats not, whats an exploit and whats not.


PS : i keep reading the rules over and over and over, and i cant find where it says if i post negative review and trash talk about the game ON STEAM FORUMS, ill be perma ban from MO forums.
anyone got a link for that specefic rule please?

author: {'steamid': '76561198000045052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1514245505}
review:
As with many other reviews in games that have existed long before steam release Don't Be fooled by my hours played. I have over the 6 years played Mortal Periodically for around 2 years in total. I will to the best of my ability express why you should or shouldnt Play this game. 

 First I'm going to adress the Cons

- Buggy Glitchy and  still Unpolished ( Not nearly as bad as it used to be.)
- Community is a mixed bag, sadly with more rotten candy than I'd like.
-It can be frustrating, especially when losing your stuff due to cons 1 or 2.
-Slow Developement
- Despite the plethora of available options, there are only a few tried and true methods that fit the "flavor of the month" meta/late game.
- Difficult to play solo, group orriented
- Sizable Learning Curve
- Can suck away your life.
- PvP focused ( There is lot's of PvE content, however in the end it all fuels the endless PvP war machine.) 
- One server means latency issues. ( To a degree)

 This is a sizable and honest List, many people will get hung up on these issues and I don't blame you, though before you cast your hammer down in judgement, just hear me out.

The Pros:
-Sandbox - Freedom is Nice
-Crafting Is incredibly complex ( Some Professions more than others)
-The PvP is intense and a blast. ( Full loot adds that adrenaline, you really feel that risk of losing your hard work during the fight)
- No Levels, just skills that are trained through use or passively by reading.
-Interesting politcal scene. (Large groups of people, limited resources, open PvP, all makes Server wars a common thing.)
-One server ( Diverse fun playerbase despite the bad fruit, I havent met a more interesting smathering of players. Does -playing with Aussies, Germans, Swedes, Brits, Spaniards, Brazilians, Irishmen, and Canadians all in the same Team speak sound fun. Does to me)
-A dedicated developer who keeps chugging away ( The little Starvault that could)
- Being a trader and crafter is completely viable (Though you'd be missing a sizable portion of the game)
- No other game quite like it. (It's why I keep returning)
- In the end the Games world is shaped by the players. 
- Game lore is pretty decent.

 Despite the games shortcomings, I've had some of my fondest gaming memories on here and have met some of the coolest people too. Sure being a new player is harsh and I reccomend you find a good honest group of people to help you learn. There are many people in the game who will make your life hell, you will cuss and scream but in the end if you work hard enough,  play smart  and make quality friends, you can accomplish some pretty neat things.

TL;DR
Games is mediocre, The expereinces you'll have playing it, Priceless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011848336', 'num_games_owned': 1877, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 6942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6091, 'last_played': 1448728095}
review:
Na wstępie muszę zaznaczyć, że nie jest to gra dla każdego. Osoby wychowane na WoW i innych cukierkowych, casualowych MMORPG nie mają tu czego szukać.
W przeciwieństwie do wyżej wymienionych gier, tutaj nie jesteś cudownym wybrańcem (jak wszyscy inni gracze, lol), na którego czekają setki epickich questów. Tutaj mamy do czynienia z sandboxem pełną gębą. Twórcy dają nam do dyspozycji zabawki, a to jak będziemy się nimi bawili zależy tylko od nas.

Teraz co nieco o samej rozgrywce- mamy tu grę z otwartym światem, widokiem z pierwszej osoby, walką podobną do serii The Elder Scrolls, pełnym PvP (ograniczanym tylko w miastach obecnością strażników, którzy za przewinienia nie zawahają się ubić delikwenta), z pełnym lootowaniem ekwipunku. TAK! Jak zginiesz, wszystko ci miałeś przy sobie zostaje przy twoich zwłokach, podatne na kradzież przez innych ludzi (dlatego cenne przedmioty, walutę trzeba zostawiać w banku). A gracze znaleźli wiele sposobów na uprzykrzanie życia innym, nawet w zdawałoby się bezpiecznych miastach (np. niesławne „blueblocking” czyli celowe wskakiwanie komuś pod miecz, żeby ten w chwili trafienia został oznaczony jako rozbójnik i mógł zostać bezkarnie zabity). Nie ma taryfy ulgowej, trzeba pilnować własnych pleców.

Jednak poza próbami przetrwania w tym bezwzględnym świecie jest masa innych rzeczy do roboty. Od rozwiniętego craftingu, gotowania, oswajania zwierząt, budowania domostw i innych budowli, przez ekonomię napędzaną przez graczy (u vendorów kupimy tylko podstawowe, najsłabsze przedmioty- wszystko lepsze musi zostać wytworzone przez graczy), po karierę złodziejską i wiele innych rzeczy.

Ogólnie jest to najbliższa rzecz kultowej Ultimie Online z jaką się spotkałem w chwili pisania tej recenzji. Również system płatności jest niczym z tamtej epoki, gdyż… darmowość gry to tak naprawdę wersja próbna. Nasze skille ograniczone są do 60 poziomu, nie możemy bawić się w złodziejstwo czy stawiać bardziej złożonych budynków. Te ograniczenia ściąga z nas abonament. Mnie pasuje, bo dzięki temu nie ma w grze głupot typowych dla gier free-to-play, czyli bzdetnych mikrotransakcji na każdym kroku.

Czy polecam? Na liczniku mam 63h, a gra wciąż mi się nie znudziła. Choć daleko jej do doskonałości, to jednak wytrwałym graczom potrafi dostarczyć naprawdę świetnej rozrywki. W końcu MMORPG, gdzie interakcje z innymi graczami (te pozytywne i negatywne) są kluczowym aspektem gry, gdyż w dzisiejszych tytułach ten element jest strasznie wykastrowany i z powodzeniem można by z nich wyciąć elementy multiplayerowe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079607473', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 5652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2707, 'last_played': 1459011814}
review: Its a dog eat dog world. The game is pretty buggy and laggy but it runs fine for me. The problem is it gives a bad first impression because the main starting city (Tindrem) is just very populated so it lags more than anywhere else. It is a game where you will run into many hard learned lessons but it is extremely fun to progress and get stronger. It is a hard and unforgiving game at the beginning, but give it a few hours and once you start getting up to speed and properly understanding mechanics, you will discover how much content there is and how much fun there is to be had. I played the original client in 2012 and I have to say, the game hasn't come super far in regards to content (Sarducaa is a big one though), but hundreds of bugs have been squashed and Mortal is much more stable and reliable than I remember. I recommend it for anyone who likes open world, sandbox, hardcore-ish, and open playstyle games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044850748', 'num_games_owned': 582, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1442637247}
review: The menu was cool. You can tell the graphics are not exactly stellar, but the gameplay could make up for that. Entering the game for the first time, you can tell right away that the controls are a bit clunky. First mission is to kill some pigs. Had to go to Help menu to figure out the keys. Punching a pig seemed like a game of latency tag. Trying to match up your clunky strikes to the clunky movement of the NPC. Gaveup after a few minutes of this. The interface and the clunky nature of this game got to me way to fast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007401363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2009, 'last_played': 1442041167}
review: I hear a lot about Pay 2 Win. Let's be clear, this is a subscription game. The F2P aspect is an infinite trial. You're welcome to play for free as long as you desire. If you truly enjoy the game, you can subscribe. If you're broke, you can play for free. It's a great system and very forgiving to its players. Everyone can enjoy MO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159223946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1442630870}
review:
This game rather baited me in with the prospect of a free world to just do whatever in, but it boils down to going solo and pouring all your points and skills into what you need to SUPPORT the skill you want to focus on. God forbid you want to swing swords but don't want to learn how to make armor, swords, and how to fight, along with cooking, mining, and wood cutting. NOT TO MENTION FREE2PLAY is actually just a trial. You can't get a skill above 60 and some skills are just simply unavailable. I consider the free to play version to be nothing more than a trial, like on WoW.

The way the game is designed makes it almost impossible to figure out for a new player, take my advice and don't even download this headache, look elsewhere.

By the way, by hardcore, they mean people who exist for PvP and ganking. Especially those weaker than themselves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052361779', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1386, 'last_played': 1443911605}
review:
I initially had reservations about this game and only gave it a shot because my brother plays it. After giving it a few days on a free account I have to recommend the game to anyone who likes the basic game mechanics of a zombie survival game; that you can kill or be killed almost anywhere and the "story" is up to you to make up. If you like to be kept mainly on rails and given quests you will not like the game, but if you like to just wander off and do what ever you want you will have a blast. 
It is not however perfect, there is some lag in places (if you can cache the game in the options window), there are PKers everywhere and there is NO hand holding. Other than a very basic tutorial on how to move, tame, kill, and craft a robe you are on your own. I would suggest to anyone starting out that you read some basic guides on game mechanics so you have a better starting grasp of the game. Other than that there is not much more to tell from how little I have played, I will edit if anything changes or comes up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153733780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1442810865}
review:
***READ THE EDIT ON THE BOTTOM FIRST***

To be honest, the majority of negative reviews about this game should be ignored. Not because they are wrong as much as because most (even some of the valid complaints) stem from the words of those who simply just cannot handle playing Mortal Online. I have played (at the time of writeing this) nearly 15 hours and so far I love it. I will even go as far as to say that this game is what "Elder Scrolls: Online" should have been...

Before I go on with my moderately lengthy review, lemme be honest as far as where my complaints are concerned. The things I feel could be better are as follows: 

1. Buildings we can actually enter that aren't just there for show.
2. Better guard A.I.
3. A little more lore.
4. Some minor bug fixes, mostly collision.

And that is litterally the extent of my complaints... Minor aren't they? I mean, even if the DEV ignores those four things, I will still play because they aren't really so important as to stop me from enjoying myself. So now that I have made my complaints, lemme go into what it is I enjoy about it:

1. Total open world.
2. Absolute freedom.
3. No fetch quests or quests of any sort, except the 5-10 minute tutorial.
4. Nudity.
5. Descent graphics. Deffinately not bad, better than WOW.
6. No "Level-Up" system, as you improve your skills you also improve your attributes.
7. PvP servers only.
8. When you die, you lose your loot, like in real life.
9. The game doesn't hold your hand.
10. No world map.
11. You must eat/drink/sleep to survive.
12. You can build your own home.
13. The difference between Subscribing and Free-To-Play is minor compared to other MMOs.
14. Very, VERY large world.
15. In first person mode only.
16. The fact you can write a book and freakin' sell it for coin.

With all that said, the game is for the extremist, if you want anything other than an extreme game that will give you a fun experience and yet remain as close to real life realism as possible then this is not the game for you. This game is crazy realistic in many ways and I am willing to bet that nine out of every ten people who complain about this game only do so because of that very fact. My advice, try it.... Its free. If you don't like it, be honest, don't make up crap while using steam as a catalyst for your nonsensical bull crap. Enjoy.

EDIT: After getting booted off the server due to an admin Blue Blocking (that is standing in front of a player as they attack something causing the attacking player to get attacked by everyone as a result) I can no longer reccomend this game. It is a cheap tactic and something that should be fixed but isn't. It corrupts the game, considering everone does it so they can get your s**t. After arguing with an admin about how he was a f**khead for doing that, especially since he had much better stuff than I and then he booted me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037289941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 994, 'last_played': 1576584865}
review:
Been playing this game for 3 weeks and still cant successfully do anything without being murdered by reds at city gates, theives taking everything i own, blue blocking players, and being killed at vendors my criminals. 
This game is filled with nothing but griefers that will pray on new players making sure they wont leave their starting cities by killing them and taking their stuff. I had to keep on starting from scratch and back up to where I was just to be killed by a vet on horses who armor are almost indestructible and whose weapons can cut right through your armor and kill you with one blow. Even 2 AI guards has a hard time killing them and the guards are powerful. Thats how strong these players are. They even camp the graveyards in the cities where noobs go to make money.

Also other players will keep on killing your horse/donkey, the ones you bought with your gold that takes you a couple of days to make, just for the heck of it anywhere even infront of guards just to watch you rant. Most vets in this game are murderers which are worst than criminals. They prey on noobs and gets a kick out of killing them while they're trying to learn the game. They do this because they know they have years and years exp in this game before it came out on steam. You will barely get to explore the world alive because they are also patrolling the lands outside the city to track and kill you. The only way to explore the lands is as a ghost. Be warn, when you revive at a priest, there will be a vet with their name in bold red letters which signals they are murders and they will kill you. Do not download this game because this game is made to support griefers. Im ending my subscription and hanging this game up. I was so excited to see a game like this but once you exp it, you will be let down. Nothing but bad community and too many criminal RP. Today was my last day. What did it was, I bought a horse which cost 4 gold and 50 silver. Went to go buy equipment for it. Had a large bag equiped on my horse so I can carry items to trade. Bought a 1000 food for the horse which cost 1 gold for the journey. I put on my armor and equiped myself with my shield and weapon. got on the horse and was ready to explore. Soon as I stepped out the city gates i made it 100 yards away from the gate. All the sudden POW get hit by a powerful mace and my guy feel off the horse and died. Then I watched my horse fall from one blow. 

A screen popped up with the murderer name saying report murderer. For what? He is already red and enjoys killing! So far I died more than 30 times in within 16.6 hrs from blue blockers, murderers, and criminals. I lost 4 donkeys and 2 horses from criminals. 10 of those deaths was me trying to leave the city and 2 of those 10 deaths was from me reviving at a priest in a town i traveled to as a ghost just to die from a murderer patrolling the town buildings. For those that dont know what blueblockers are, they are players jumping infront of you while you are swinging your weapon to kill a animal or the dead just for you to accidentally hit them so you can turn grey which grants everybody to kill you and take all your stuff because your now a criminal. Until this game is fixed and im done. Good luck to anybody who decides to download this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107218790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 19543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7303, 'last_played': 1492146934}
review: If you want to be able to explore and defend yourself you need to build your character for combat. Once you have a character built for combat you have very limited ways to get equipment. You can’t do anything else effectively if you focus on more than one thing.  Nobody wants to pay a subscription fee to be a miner. Seriously who is playing this game and saying “wow the mining is so bad as*. I hope I can join a guild and mine for them.” What really pisses me off is I like this game, but when the easiest thing to do is build a fighter and kill people for their shi*, well you’re going to have a world full of people who wonder around killing people for their shi*. I get you have to work together; a miner gets materials for an armorer etc.  That’s cool, but if you do not master fighting you will just die. All the red assho*les in the world are not miners and waiting for a knight in shining armor to log on and protect you while you mine is as fun as it sounds. I don’t think you should be able to solo the game and acquire every skill, but if I am a master weaponsmith and a spider comes along I should be able to do more than say “eeeeee spider somebody save me!”

author: {'steamid': '76561198014746664', 'num_games_owned': 812, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2719, 'last_played': 1442557690}
review: Great Hardcore MMO, not a game to play if your going to cry about RPK's. If you want to know somthing look it up and figure it out, plenty of help on the forums. Without a sub, you can get skill effectivness at 60, however you still train that skill over 60 and up to 100 if you decide you would like to sub. Having only 60 points does not seem like that large of a drawback to me. you can still have all the gear you want just like the sub's get. Graphics to me do seem a little dated and bland, overall gameplay is fun, crafting classes actually matter, and things you get off animals and creatures in the game have a use to make great money when your a butcher. The guild scene seems very political and all about who the guild make friends with. You can make player created towns, and guilds can claim in game towns and controll if it has gaurds or not. Great gameplay at least for me, you can get allot out of it as free to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003223847', 'num_games_owned': 956, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 4880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4646, 'last_played': 1443952719}
review:
Шикарная ММО для меня! Лучшая из всех, в которые я играл. 
+Приятная графика, пусть и старовата уже.
+Нормальное wsad-управление.
+Полная свобода действий: Фул-лут мертвых игроков, гвардов; наказание за криминал от стражи; воровство прямо из инвентаря игроков при соответствующих скилах и еще масса плюсов.
-Очень печалит техническое состояние игры, довольно много багов.
-Есть не работающий скил fletchery, без этого скила не скрафтить стрел, для меня это самый весомый минус пока что.
-Не очень стабильная работа сервера.
Все минусы поправимы и надеюсь будут в скором времени исправлены.
P.s. Для "отцов нагибаторов" в этой игре не место, тут нагнут вас с самого начала игры, а учитывая фул-лут, у вас бомбанет так, что возможно вашей маме придется купить вам новый ПК. Если вы "Отэц" Ла2 или какого-нибудь Archage, то сюда лучше не суйтесь xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198053509094', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1442468958}
review:
This seems like a game that might be nice. But there is absolutely no help for beginners.


You start by getting a mission to skin and kill pigs. But no information about HOW to do it. After a while you find out that you should right click to get carcass after killing the pig. Ok fine. But then? You kill 8 of them and you cant walk. First you think it is a bug. But then you realize that everything has a weight. Ok.. They did not inform me about that. You want to trow them away but happens to eat some raw pig by mistake (oh, fine there you discovered the eating function in the game) You throw them all away and start collecting anew.

And then?

What?

Well in the chat you find out you should skin them with the skinning knife. But ok, fine. You click inventory and find no such knife in inventory.

You ask again. And after asking 5 minutes in chat without anyone caring about you, you find out that you should use L and the butchers buttom. The knife is a skill. Ah, ok, fine... I did not know that I am a butcher. But there is still NO information in the tutorial whatsoever about how to do it. You scroll the help and find nothing useful there.

In the chat one person says drag the carcass into the box that pops up when you click the buttom. What box? You cant see any box popping up.

Then suddenly you cant do more than look in the ground. You wonder if it is a bug. Until you try pressing Z and are able to do it walk normal again.Ok nice feature. It was really fun staring down on the ground for some minutes.

you still try to collect skin for some minutes while asking in the chat how to do it?

After 4 minutes without an answer you freak out and consider ragequitting. You are all stuffed because you have eaten so much pig by mistake. 

You see a knight killing some freshspawns so you quit. Uninstall.

------------------

That is my story. Wasted a lot of time. With proper information about what to do I could have killed the pigs easily.

And who came up with he brilliant idea to let 20 freshspawns kill pigs at the same time while allowing other players to kill the freshspawns?

So... How did the company think when they creaed a game without ANY information about how to even start playing the game and accomplish the first mission?

I cant recommend it as of now. There is NO way one can learn ingame how to even start playing.

review: Terrible. In game it says "Hitting someone is not illegal." I accidentally hit someone with my sword, and they can kill me back????? Almost every game mechanic is broken, and the animations are terrible. The combat system is way off, and ranges of weapons suck. Way too laggy aswell.
developer_response:
I'm afraid you must have misunderstood something. Hitting someone [b]who is gray or red[/b] is not illegal, but hitting someone who is blue (i.e. innocent) is a crime.

I'm sorry you didn't have a good experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975494374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 7343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6251, 'last_played': 1444245926}
review:
You'll either love Mortal Online, or hate it.  It belongs to a very niche genre that will NOT appeal to all (or even many) gamers. But you'll find some neat and UNIQUE elements.

In what other (current, 3D) MMORPG can you pickpocket other players?

What other online games have mystery left in the world, with yet unexplored areas (Sarducca), and rare, powerful potions with recipes that nobody knows, a whole five years after release?

In Mortal Online, with enough work, you can build a CITY with NPC guards that follow the laws that you set, even where new players spawn.

In Mortal Online, you can tame GIANT, fierce, exotic animals.

You want to run around and solo everything? Not the game for you. You'll have to team up with other players and work together if you want to take out the strongest creatures and delve the deepest dungeons.

You want to be able to be completely self-sufficient, mastering all crafts? Too bad. Mortal Online encourages players to specialize in specific areas (Fighter, Tamer, Mage, Archer, Architect, Armor crafter, Weapon craft...) and then work together.

Mortal Online a realistic fantasy game. First-person locked, with no in-game map with GPS functionality. The far majority of the game is not explained to you, and you are forced to (shock!) interact with other players to figure out things.

It's a little bit EVE Online, a little bit Elder Scrolls, and a little bit Mount and Blade Warband. Don't come for the graphics, don't come if you're casual... but if you give it a chance, and can get past its challenges, you'll find a game that is truly special.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994231677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1317, 'last_played': 1441501566}
review:
A waste of your time, a waste of your money. This game needs 5 more years in development.
Now don't get me wrong, the ideea is great, but the implementation is lackluster and geared towards a harsh time for the new player (just hell for the f2p player), everityng is centered towards the ideea that this game is hardcore and not for everyone witch btw is a weak excuse for a developer and community.

No microtranzactions just the plain old subscription trap. No map, you will spend more time on Google/web than exploring the game itself. Territory/influence without a real impact on the game, no npc guards/patrols on controled area. 
No endgame content, YOU are the endgame content or "entertainment" for the vet's.
Game OST is "Rage Against The NooB - Evil Empire", Full Album 0996

author: {'steamid': '76561198029334549', 'num_games_owned': 642, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1600745027}
review:
Игра странная. С одной стороны - это отличная песочница с полнейшей свободой действий, а с другой - это что-то ужасное, слепленое словно на коленке, несмотря на годы разработки (реально, мне кажется, что первые арты  видел лет эдак 10 назад, а в википедию лезть лень).

Что же получилось у разрабов? Ну... замороченный и навороченный крафт, удобная, простая в начальном освоении боевая система. Хардкор, свободное ПВЕ и фулл-лут. Все круто и в стиле УО, НО, тут вылезает большое НО. Про ультиму до сих пор шутят, что "из таверны вышел голый мужик и убил меня". Тут то же самое. Прокачанный персонаж бегает голышом, ибо на броню денег жалко (фулл-лут помним). Это вызывает стойкое отторжение, тем более, что голозадых персонажей уйма (а если в клиенте разрешить полную обнаженку, то это вообще превращается в сюр - даже пенисы прорисовыаны, выглядит довольно мерзко). Но пойдем дальше. Дальше у нас крафт. Он прекрасен и ужасен одновременно. 
Прекрасен, поскольку каждый предмет можно скрафтить из различных сочетаний материалов - это круто. Но вот узнать что получится заранее, невозможно даже приблизительно. Даже если это сочетание вы уже крафтили, хотя и можно записать рецепт на бумажку (не знаю что это даст, но можно, факт). Далее, если вы решите добывать руду и выплавлять из нее металлы, то вам останется только закрыться в келье и познавать дзен. Ибо рецептов нет, и даже найденные вами не сохраняются. К слову, логично, что для выплавки руды нужна руда и катализаторы (уголь там и тому подобное), но здесь еще нужно подбирать соотношение руда:катализатор1:катализатор2. И получиться могут самые разные вещи. В общем крафт кожаной брони - это великолепно, а крафт металлической брони и оружия натыкается на вот такие приколы. И да, на рынке готовых металлов я так и не увидел, а так купил бы за любую сумму.

Засем тут нужны деньги вообще непонятно. Ну то есть кое-что продается у торговцев NPC, но это кое-что стоит копейки и большей частью элементарно добывается с мобов за каких-то пол-часа в любых количествах. Экономика тут в состоянии противозачаточном, как и интерфейс.

Отсутствие карты я могу понять - хардкор же, спасибо хоть компас оставили. Но хотя бы возможность купить карту, без указания места персонажа на ней, стоило бы сделать (это даже в майнкрафте есть).

Итого:
Плюсы:
Хардкор.
Фулллут.
Куча возможностей, просто огроменная куча.
Невероятное количество навыков (серьезно, вы не сможете даже ходить, не прокачав какой-то скилл).
Крафт, навороченный и крутой.
Боевая система, скучноватая но реалистичная и неплохая.
Реализм во всем и везде.

Минусы:
Голые ПК. Тысячи их.
Интерфейс.
Интерфейс.
Интерфейс. Он просто ужасен.
Экономика в глубокой заднице.
Слишком быстрая прокачка (за неделю можно свой "класс" раскачать на максимум по, играя по 2 часа в день).
Ограничение максимума скиллов (учитывая их количество - это ужасно). Вы не можете быть крафтером оружия и щитов сразу. 2 разных перса нужны на это. И майнером и крафтером не можете - в ограничение упретесь.
Интерфейс.
Куча голых персов, которым жалко своего лута.

Итог: взглянуть на игру стоит. И даже возможно вам понравится, если вам не влом питаться камнями и спать одним глазом, опасаясь и за себя и за петов и за лут. И даже когда-нибудь она сможет стать ИГРОЙ, а не перфомансом, странным и малоиграбельным. Но взглянуть стоит.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024237823', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 74304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38374, 'last_played': 1618758546}
review:
Though the game has it's issues it's still pretty fun to play. I did a review a few years back and the main issues i had then have been addressed and have gone on to play the game alot since then.  Found a nice large guild to play with.Doing PVP and PVE content. 

PROS:
Hours of diverse gameplay
Guilds are very tight knit groups and helpful
Large range of character builds to try/master
Rare/Difficult skills to master/obtain
Excellent crafting system
Viable being a non combat character
Guild town/keep system is well done
Guild sieges/wars
Large world  


CONS:
No pve zones
Some large troll/ganking guilds
Sub paywall limits casuals from learning some skills
Dated graphics
Starter towns aren't new player friendly (tutorialwise & playerwise)

In the end playing this solo can be tough since there is a high chance of being killed by guilds if your not in one. Form your own guild or join one. Most guilds have a keep which is your home away from home surrounded by friendlies. Be wary of unknown people passing you by in the world. Have fun with your friends doing pve content/crafting/learning magic/pvp.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160776342', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1679, 'last_played': 1508507745}
review:
Don't let the negative complains of this game turn you away from it , this MMO allot to offer and requires veterans MMO RPG gameplay if your new to this genre i do  NOT recommend you this game. But its definetely a game you can enjoy.
Very complicated very open and very challenging. There is only 2 things i dislike about this game for the rest its a great game.
1:
The guard system is handy for protection , but i died twice attacking accidentally a guard because he was in my way it would be a good idea to allow them to use ONLY ranged attacks
2:
The fact that F2P'ers cant own a house is a little irritating for me because i was looking forward to making my little hut and starting a shop. Guess i have to be a traveling merchant.



You can pretty much do anything in this game to make money.
Mining , weapon crafting , trading , cooking , even being a bounty hunter (Bounty hunting is known as 'Advanced pvp' so i recommend it mostly to P2P'ers).
If you want a challenge than i can assure this game has it.
Good luck :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198011739609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1824, 'last_played': 1456194070}
review: This game is not for the faint of heart. You will die and lose items. You will be murdered in cold blood, and often on accident by other noobs. You will get lost. You will have to discover every single thing through your own research. Nothing in this game is handed out, and that is why it's great! Crafters are just as important and Fighters, Mages are just as important as Tamers. No skill is "completely" useless. Every skill has a purpose, even if the purpose is unlocking more skills. I do recomend this game, but if your the type of player who begs chat for help and gets frustrated from PKs or your own deaths, then gl m8 this aint for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067708370', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1276, 'last_played': 1445136352}
review: This game is so vastly complex and requires so much of your time to understand. There are so many fresh, innovative concepts in this game that you WILL NOT find in any other game. If you want a game challenge that is unlike any other, play this game. If you want your hand to be held like in any other MMO, this is not the game for you. I would venture to say that most of the negative reviews about this game are from people who did not spend very much time in game. While some of the community can be very toxic, a lot of the community is extremely nice and willing to help. Yes, there are grave campers, but those are in any MMO or other game you have ever played. I have only just started in this game and I love the sheer amount of options for things you can do. This game is not for the faint of heart....safe travels my friends!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056605358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 34512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8960, 'last_played': 1448329547}
review:
I have been playing Mortal now for two weeks.  I am enjoying it.  It is like playing UO (Ultima Online) but with current graphics.   The game is beautiful, and I believe well thought out.   It is player driven.  This is PVP everywhere.  No place is safe.    You are accountable for your actions within the game too.

There is much to learn in MO.  This game is hard!     You have to explore and figure out for yourself how you want your character to be.   Which is not easy as there are so many choices.    Note:  One character can NOT be all things.   You have to decide what best suits you.   Not an easy task.

There are problems, it does have glitches.  But nothing that game stopping to me.   The GM's are friendly and helpful and have had no problems with long ques waiting for help.   I find it refreshing to play a game that does not bore me with in a short time.   Most games do cause they are just too easy.

When you fight, you have to aim.  No just clicking a button and the game taking over.   You must be sure the foe is in your range and sight.    Learn how to handle the weapon, fighting stance, parry, blocking, etc..  Again, this game is difficult.   

If you are looking for an easy game.  This is not for you.   

If you are looking for a challenge.  Want to explore.  Want to feel like every little goal is a great accomplishment when you succeed, then this is the game for you.
 
I see myself playing MO for a very long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975372183', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 18836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4617, 'last_played': 1448870327}
review:
OK so i have recently found and tried this game, i do not normally review games at all and i felt for the first time at liberty to do it some justice.

there are A LOT of negative posts on reviews but do not let that put you off, it is a game that does have a harsh learning curve, full of scoundrels that will pick on the weak and will leave you scratching you head for more then a few hours, because of this it is not for the weak willed or non adventurous type.

this game literally has me hooked, i spent the first 5 hours running around the starter city picking flowers and selling them, browsing the forums for guilds and finally found one that suited me, i will admit due to my carefulness and knowing what people are like in full loot drop games i managed to stay alive the whole time without many issues whilst i saw post after post of people being murdered in the help chat or complaining that they hit someone and the guards blew them up.

it quickly became apparent people had no clue or are unused to the game, warnings are there on the screen but people do not see them or ignore them and complain after.

i joint a guild, left whatever i had there and went to Moh ki, i died on the way by slipping down a mountain, it was bound to happen, i was a ghost and continued to make my way to Moh ki where i spawned at the priest, joined up with my fellow comrades and have been farming the area to amass my fortune.

this game is really fun, can be a grind but there are ways around it, you can be anything you want but have to create characters specific to what you want to be any good, it takes some time to get used to the skill system but reading up on things is essential unless you have a group of people to fire questions at.

not everyone is a murderer, there are traders and the such also and friendly people you just need to get away from the starter towns that is a must you cant stop morons hanging around Noob areas praying on the weak but can be avoided if you think on your feet.

there are definitely still a few bugs, but can be worked around and not too annoying or game breaking that i can see.

there is a ton to do and i can bet if you get into it you will not stick to one character or if you do you will have to specialize even for pay to play as you have a limit of 1100 skill point and a max soft limit of 100 for each primary skill so choose wisely.

overall, its a good mix, lots to do, good community when you get past the initial stages and the game has plenty to offer and is unlike any other MMORPG i have personally played.

give it a go even on free to play like i am now, play past the initial stages, join a group that suites you and give it a proper go, it takes longer then 2 hours to get past this stage i would say.

All the best.

Flash

author: {'steamid': '76561198025378664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 2792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2662, 'last_played': 1442211341}
review:
Nur für Hardcore Sanboxer.

Da ich nach fast 20 Jahren OnlineSpielen genug Mobs gekillt habe, habe ich mich mal nur ans Rostoffe abbauen gemacht und der Steamversion nochmal ein neue Chance gegeben.
Das Spiel ist auch ganz nett, will man weiter kommen, muss man aber die Stargebiete schon bald verlassen, um an höherwertige Resourcen zu kommen und da fängt der Ärger an. Zuerst stößt man auf massig Gildenfestungen, die scheinbar wahllos in der Gegend stehen, gefühlte Quadrakilometer groß sind und viele wichtige Rohstoffe blockieren. Hat man dann mal einen Spot gefunden, wird man ständig von PKs gegankt, die einem scheinbar die sauer verienten Silberlinge nicht gönnen und solche Spots regelrecht abklappern um harmlose Arbeiter zu killen. Ich kann schon nicht mehr zählen, wie oft ich gekillt wurde und wie viele Esel ich verloren habe (Pets kann man auch töten und sind permanent tot).
Auch ist DER Server (ja nur ein Server für alle) seit dem Steamrelease vollkommen überlaufen, selbst mit einem Premiumaccount muss man während der Hauptzeiten mit Wartescheifen rechnen. 
Die Community ist bunt gemischt, von den letzten Deppen, die denken mit Capslock kriegt man eher eine Antwort, bis hin zu absolut netten Leuten, alles da.
Skills gibt es wirklich massig und zu tun hat man auch genug, daran solls nicht liegen, aber insgesamt wirkt das Spiel sehr unprofessionell.
Gestern hatte ich ein Problem und habe den Support angeschrieben, der GM war zwar hilfreich, aber auf formelle Sachen muss man dabei verzichten.
Das Spiel hat viel Potential, welches teilweise auch genutzt wird, aber es ist einfach schlecht umgesetzt.
Für jemand, der gute Nerven hat und über das eine oder andere hinweg sehen kann, ist das Spiel sicher OK, sonst sollte man es lieber lassen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007746778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1194, 'last_played': 1452731386}
review:
I want to like this game and play it.  I really do.  It has semi-retro graphics which I actually like, the progression of skills isn't handed out easily, and it really makes you figure things out (which can be a little annoying at times).  For me the game really captured the feeling of open world exploration as danger is around every single blade of grass and tree however it has been spoiled by the, in my opinion, overly amount of PKing going on.  I know it is a Hardcore PK type game.  I get that entirely and I tried to embrace it.  But the amount of blue blocking and zerg mentality in the game make it hard to believe that this is a truly believeable breathing world.  It's hard enough to time your attacks with the way enemies seem to move through your character and sometimes possess the same space, making it extremely difficult to even get a kill in without having to run and rest.  I witnessed a group of people enter a crypt only to have them get jumped by several undead (which was truly cool to witness in the retro way it is delivered).  Instead of rallying together two fought side by side while the third attempted to kill the other two in an attempt to fully loot them, while the forth ran past me outside.  And it is contagious, even I would jump on a helpless player due to the extreme lifestyle the game provides.  I even bought a second character slot for a crafting type toon to support my warrior.  So your option is to buy skill books and wait several days of real life time to pass (which does pass while logged off as well).  But I want to PLAY the game not log in, click a book, log off and wait.  It's almost like you need to wait a month offline until your toon is done reading an entire library of crap in order to stand a chance.  Guess it's back to waiting for me.



TLDR version:  Awesome game, challenging and fun.  Wish the game had a PvE server for players who wished to explore the game without having to fear of high end players running them down on horseback.  The only real option to level up your skills is to purchase books and log off while your character reads them.  Really takes the "skill" out of skilling up. Combat needs improvement.  It's been out 5 years now.  It is what it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009069605', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1442192622}
review:
Selten ein Einsteiger unfreundlicheres Spiel gesehen . Das Zaubersystem ist ein Witz . Nur Serverwarteschlangen und die Anzeigen dabei gaukeln einem was vor : unter 1 Minuten dann 2 Minuten dann unter 1 Minute und so weiter nach ca 15 Minuten konnte ich endlich einloggen und dann bekommt der nen timeout und versucht es nochmal . Die Tastenbelegungen sind Fast garnicht zu ändern . Genauer kann man sie ändern aber das ist dem Spiel egal . Ich versuchte Sprint auf Strg Rechts zu legen die Taste kennt er nicht . Die selber auswählen Taste macht garnichts . Wenn ich ne Tastenbelegung mit Backspace lösche kann ich da plötzlich garnichts mehr auswählen und es nichtmal mehr anklicken . Die Gegner Treffen dich mit einem Nahkampfangriff manchmal nur ganz nah oder aus 5 meter immernoch unbewaffnet . 

Erspart euch den Stress mit diesem Witz von einem Spiel die kann man besser mit allen anderen arten von Tätigkeit verbrauchen . Es hat sicher potential aber dafür muss man den Spieler auch mal Sagen was man machen muss . Wenigstens am Anfang damit man da wenigstens durchsteigen kann .

author: {'steamid': '76561198023924330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 8686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7676, 'last_played': 1451911489}
review:
I used to have a badish review and not reccomended for this game due to a bad login system and que where alot of the time you couldnt acutually get in the game. Since then they have fixed the que and the system actually gets you in immediatly usually if you are subbed, and within 5-10 min if you are ftp.

This game although oldish for an MMO, has been refreshed by steam and is now seemingly getting updates with future plans in the works for more. 

I don't reccomend this game if you want rules and classes and quests and levels but if you want an anarchy do what you want play style where you do what you want somewhat remminicent of Eve Online then this is the game for you. I like it as an alternative to games where you are overly restricted to levels and classes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002438074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8682, 'last_played': 1442606118}
review:
In a nutshell, MO is a 3D version of Ultima Online. They both have identical features and contents- A LOT MORE and enhanced contents in MO per se. 

 Most negative reviews are mostly due to poor server stability, which caused by rapid increase of new player base via steam lanuch. That said, I haven't crashed a single time since the previous patch. So, I guess the stability is improving!

 The game has a very deep learning curves, If you never ever played UO or similar games, you'd probably find this game hella hardcore and difficult. Thus, my best advice would be to look for a good guild and go from there! (YOU SHOULD GET OUTTA THE NEWBIE TOWN ASAP, THE TOWN IS JUST ONE DANG MESS)

 If you're one of those old folks who enjoyed UO back in the day, then this game is definitely for ya!! Conversely, If you're expecting to see the game as H1Z1, Dayz or other fast paced survival games, well... I'm sorry!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000784563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1442151444}
review:
Hi,

Take into account this is a "first hour" review. I havent spent 400 hours in the game, explored hlvl content, etc..
I just created a toon, and tested the game a bit...
And already, I can feel it wont be on my HDD much longer.

1) Its ugly. Graphics are dated, thats a given. But thats just "technical". Here, its dated, but its also not very appealing. Art direction is just... Well... Meh. I guess it was all the "Medieval is supposed to look dirty and ragged" trend. But it fails at that.
2) Its unstable. Crashed already 3 times. Lags, freezes.
3) Two minutes in game and I already have a moron stealing my loot repeatedly (dont worry, I'll follow you too and steal your loot... well I would have if the game hadnt crashed :p ).
4) Gameplay... Well, it feels clunky. I'm just swinging a sword at pigs, and it feels like... Well, like my character doesnt know the pointy end from the other, for one (but that would actually be nice if it was a feature... except I fear its not). And like I'm clicking a mouse. Charging a hit doesnt feel like anything. It all feels hollow and clunky.

There's some good too.
I like the idea of raising stats by doing things (run and your stamina increases, hit and your strength goes up, etc.). I liked it in Dungeon Siege too.
I like the character creation and how ascendance and things like age affect your stats. Even if its not always very clear.

Basically... I'll try again, to see if its just the first hour that feels like that... If the city looks better... etc.. But I still feel like theres much better in the F2P world...

author: {'steamid': '76561198008159965', 'num_games_owned': 762, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1442065012}
review:
Aos fãs de ultima online, tá aí o UO em primeira pessoa.

Entretanto, como é primeira pessoa, o alvo do hit é aquilo que está na sua frente, se vc por engano acerta um não-pk vc fica criminal e os outros players te matam.

Em geral o conceito do jogo é excelente, sem level, só skill, ultra hardcore, mas o sistema de target poderia ser alvo único, travado em um único player, não acertando o que vê na frente... por isso não recomendo.

Se futuramente o target for arrumado eu mudo o review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042387970', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 30912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8130, 'last_played': 1444924992}
review:
When I saw free to play that kind of deterred me but I'm really glad I tried it.

If you liked Ultima Online before the facet split - this might be for you. :)

-People can murder you at any time and take everything you have on you

-They can steal your things (from your inventory)

-They can make armor out of your skin


To a lot of people that might be frustrating and at times it can be but at other times it turns such occurances into epic tales of survival and triumph when you live through an attack despite overwhelming odds or recovering your belongings from your corpse before other people get their greedy mits on them.

Plus points:

-Very interesting crafting system with no (very few) fixed item recipes

-Taming, magic, archery, mount breeding, the works

-Incredible degree of freedom with according penalties (you can eat leather but dont complain if it gives you problems :P)

-Interesting weight system if you work out a lot like running or fighting or whatever and only eat shitty food with low sustenance values you will waste away to a skinny twig (with penalties to your strength etc) - the opposite is also true if you only eat fatty food all the time and rarely move because you stay in town all the time crafting you will get fat ^^

-Be what you want to be, a thief, a feared murderer, trader, crafter, adventurer, tamer you name it

This game is not for you if you like:

-brainafk farming in the same spot without any awareness of your surroundings (you WILL die if you don't stay vigilant)

-keeping everything on your character or at least way more things than you are prepared to lose

-the idea that people can pickpocket you and steal stuff from your inventory

-questing sprees or any type of themepark-like game experience - you make your own adventure 


If you give this a go never keep anything on you you're not prepared to lose - even in town.

A lot of the negative comments mention Blueblocking which is annoying but this mainly happens in the starting town and the graveyard but this once again comes down to situational awareness, always keep track of your surroundings if people lurk around you behaving suspiciously without actually doing something themselves they ARE probably out to get you in some way or another.
Keep enough distance from others so that if you swing your weapon they wont have enough time to run in front of your swing and generally don't swing your weapon around like a madman especially in the graveyard where lots of players are in a small space trying to get the spawning mobs.
Or leave town altogether and try to find your luck there where blueblocking is generally not an issue (but player killers are more prevalent so watch out)

Long story short I love this game so far it is strongly influenced by ultima online and the degree of freedom is fairly unparalleled. And while that of course opens the door to thieves and spawn killers and other things like that, it also enables you to have a very rewarding experience if you can weather the storm.
I enjoy the rush of knowing that training a skill outside of town or gathering things or whatever can turn into a fierce battle at any time - the risk is what makes things that happen in this game memorable, death has an impact.
Also beheading someone who killed you before and then making soup from their head or feeding it to your dog is incredibly satisfying :P

TLDR; Very rewarding experience if you don't let deaths and loss of items get to you. It is a hostile environment but that just increases the impact random acts of kindness have when a stranger passing by saves your life or hands you a suit of armor because you seem to have lost it all. (Dont beg for things it's unbecoming and everybody hates it ^^)

Strongly recommended but don't say I didn't warn you ;)

Cheers Wes

author: {'steamid': '76561198192618849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 37777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10636, 'last_played': 1571359567}
review: A great game so far. Most of the bad reveiws are from people who didnt go out of the start city which is full of lag and griefers. The world outside is huge and I havnt even explored half of the old continent let alone the new one. The game takes a lot of time (not as much as life is fuedal), but is also very rewarding for that time. My recomendation is you find some friends or a guild to play with. A guild with some old vets is ideal. This is a open world medieval fantasy sandbox full loot pvp hardcore game. It is honestly amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052989880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2, 'last_played': 1442069722}
review: OK I put in a good 5+ hours, killed 10 pigs made armor went to graveyard got murdered went to graveyard got murdered rinse and repeat for hours, The veteran players dont seem to want new players and are showing it. So I left the starter town in search of greener pasture. got murdered. walk for 20mins find nothing get murdered, walk for 20 more mins get murdered. Huge game no map. Try to learn the game mechanics which are difficult but enjoyable from what i did manage to accomplish, but try to figure out how to play and u get veteran players killing u or one of their alts jumping between you and your target making u a free kill. I cannot give a full review of the game because i am not able to experience the full game.  In simple terms a game is supposed to be fun, and until you learn a game you cannot really play. Above that it is the players who make any game fun or ruin a game and from my minimal experience the core base of players are hateful, spiteful and toxic to the extreme. The developers of this game obviously want new players which equates to new money(business is businees). On the other hand the old players have made it blatantly obvious they will do anything they can to put people off the game. The only way i would recommend this game is if there was a new server which would be more inviting to new players, yes old players would have a knowledge edge but not the ability to ruin the experience everyone else. Sadly a big thumbs downs not to the game but to the community, The community makes or breaks a game, this game is shattered.
