author: {'steamid': '76561198073348470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1542, 'last_played': 1442696639}
review:
Meurtre, vol, sans but, sans quête, sans honneur.

Il était une fois un jeune guerrier qui marchait jusqu'au cimetière pour ce faire des amis et tuer des zombies. Tout à coup durant un combat acharnée,(Virgule) un chevalier en quête d'argent et de perversion, (Il était nu..) ce met en travert du combat recherchant la douleur de la lance du jeune guerrier. Le coup lancé, le guerrier frappa le chevalier sans réellement le vouloir. Le chevallier, prit d'une exitation exaltent, créa le statut du jeune guerrier en criminel, et voilà que tout ceux présent le flagellère de coup tranchant. Violé et dépouillé, le jeune guerrier perdit tout. Honneur et équipement.


Pensez-y.. Vous voulez être qui ? Rejoignez l'univert de Mortal Online et vous verrez.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032027705', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 4660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4660, 'last_played': 1497511751}
review: After paying a month for the subscription, putting a good chunk of time into it and generally trying to actually play the game I just cannot recommend it at it's current state. It's full of toxic players who kill any new players they see and take every little thing from their shattered corpses to and fro their guild bases they build so close to the starter towns (or even inside them, somehow) when you're just trying to learn the game. If anything this game teaches you is to not waste your time trying to get lost in this world the developers want you to experience and just become fresh meat for players who already have a leg up in the game and just want to keep new players out. This is how you stifle your player base and stunt it's growth. Even the trolls will get bored and you'll end up with a dead game in no time. Especially if nothing is done about it which usually is the case. The devs say that "that's just part of the hardcore realism we want to show players" when really that's just a half baked excuse to not fix the problems that have plagued this game for 5 years in a row. You're only hope to actually play the game is to just run straight out of the starters towns and hope you don't get ganked by some "Ser Douche" with his battle axe of raping from a tiger mount and just make a living in the wilderness for a while. Even then, it's just really boring being by yourself in a world full of would-be players. STAY AWAY!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011173228', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1441520978}
review: Don't let my 0.2 hours fool you. I've had this game for years before it got its steam release... that was supposed to happen years ago. That's this game in a nutshell. This is the worst game with the worst community on any MMO. Yeah it is for hardcore players, meaning you have to be a scum lord IRL and in game. Save yourself the time and effort to commit to this game. Let me give you a long story short... There isn't anything community related in game, EVER.  The game itself is ran by egotistical veteran players with hankerings to ruin the game for new players and ruin the game as a whole (yet they think its just part of the game). The devs also do their own part in ruining the game by never promoting community events, get togethers, or boss events.. This is the epitome of a great game gone all the wrong ways. Let me blow your mind though, THE DEVELOPERS FIRED THE COMMUNITY MOD BECAUSE HE WAS HAVING FUN WITH ALL THE OTHERS HAVING FUN; "He wasn't taking his job serious enough." ... and that was the last thread of hope this game had. Don't forget PvP will never be fair, you will be zerged, the beginner zone is the only place where you'll see players. Everywhere else is a barren wasteland of nothing and they'll never focus on player experience. Final thoughts: This game has potential to be the greatest mmofps sandbox ever, but sadly it will never be because the community and devs have united to ruin it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999613264', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1442373609}

But the griefing and blue blocking are enough to make me not want to play.  It's a bit ridiculous.  If the game didn't have such a toxic community, it'd be something to absolutely check out.

review:
I Found a dog and tammed him, I named him fuckface, me and fuckface where best friends!
We went to the graveyard to kill skeletons and some random noob acidently killed my dog, so I murdered him with my starter sword and took all of his loot and his 3 friends tried to kill me and they all got flagged as criminals and died to a roaming guard, then i looted all of them and made 3 gold and got tons of gear for a noob, Will play again

author: {'steamid': '76561198008675908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 21466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17430, 'last_played': 1492214925}
review:
Turn on this game knowing you will be killed. Everything you own will be taken from you.

This is a game of survival. You can be killed in the middle of the starting town if the murderer is smart about where they do it considering guard distance. Players can pickpocket items out of your inventory just about anywhere in the world. 


This is not a WoW grindfest. This is a MMO of survival. And once you've survived long enough, you will be stronger than many of the players who can't adapt. 

Being skilled in directional attacks and parrying is key. You can demolish a veteran player as a newer player if you're skilled enough to do so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059820547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1442111513}
review: Before you play this game watch it on Youtube. It is not a fun experience; You will fear for your life and DIE ALOT. Store anything of value In the bank, watch you back and use the help chat religiously (It wont last forever).

author: {'steamid': '76561198115280036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6652, 'last_played': 1483941566}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013136169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4668, 'last_played': 1442054562}
review:
Hey guys, after playing MO for a bit I thought I'd give my 2-cents in on it.  I made multiple free accounts to  try almost every character build so I have a very good idea of what is possible and what isnt.  
Pros:  Not very grindy, Lots of things to do, Benefits from grouping as opposed to solo.  
Cons:  Pay-To-Win(Very much so), Servers go down just about every day, Log in queue time usually around 2-15 mins, f2p accounts are literally about 50% of what membership accounts can become(pvp/crafting/gathering) very large difference in every aspect.  
tldr: Dont waste ur time unless you want to pay membership.
developer_response:
Thank you for your review.

I'd like to address two of your points:

Mortal Online is a subscription based game that offers an unlimited free trial, or a "free to play mode", which is essentially the same model as World of Warcraft but with much less restrictions for free accounts. This does not mean "pay to win".

Our servers are deliberately restarted once daily at 14:00 CEST to keep the database fresh. We are constantly working to improve the server queue system and it is a lot easier to get into the server at peak hours now than it was a week or two ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064661193', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 7819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7388, 'last_played': 1442976524}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008064371', 'num_games_owned': 607, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 73947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3993, 'last_played': 1647638716}

author: {'steamid': '76561198213913703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1442033426}
review: This game probably is good. My crappy computer made it crash 24/7 but then again the servers where down for maintainence. I dont know about you guys but this looks awfully familiar like Elder Scrolls 4 Oblivion. I'll probably reinstall when I can but for now its crap to me. >:(.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159501040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2164, 'last_played': 1442753490}
review:
This game was full of bug, exploit, dupe bugs, gm corruption,  at release.   It was like that 1 year after release.
was still like that 2 and 3 years after release.
It is still like this now, after steam release.  About 6 years after their Official Mortal online launch.

In reality, i been a fan and a subscriber of this game since its release.  But i think its time now, after they confirmed that arent abble to update anything properly, even with MONTHS of preparation, if not Year, for the steam release.

I spent over 400 dollards, subing different account, since Mo official release.   I wish i never heard about this game.

with 400 dollards, i would have so many and so better games.

I recently bought few ALPHA and Beta games, that are under production.  6 of them, and i promise, tfuckhat all 6 are WAYYY better, have WAYYYY more content, have WAYYYYY less bug, and zero gm corruption.


If you want to spend a 15-20 bucks well. Instead of this crappy piece of shit MO game, you should buy ANY alpha/beta that comes out, and i promise you itll be better, than Mortal online. 





Thanks for reading my review, i know its very negative and maybe sound like hater... but i never hated this game,  I quited it a year ago cus i was bored of spending money on it. and with the steam release, i had hope for it again, and after 2 days playing it, and encountering about 50 different bug, even a duplicate one. I hate it now.


Even if u take a shit game like Darkfall, or a beta/alpha like reign of king, or ARK.
There is like 400x more content, on the loading screen of those game, than in whole MO game.
and whats surprising, compared to MO, is that when i use the word content, im talking about stuff that actually works, as intented.
which you'll never find in MO.

Also, for anyone interested, If you swap stuff from your horse, to your inventory, while crossing a node line,  your stuff will duplicate.  Because this game sucks, and after 6 years + , they still bring OLD duplicate bugs back, with every patch.
There are some bugs, that are ingame since release. 

and no, instead of fixing the already existing bugs, thats been fucking their game up, and making their subscriber quit, they keep trying to make it bigger bigger more content more stuff more continent  more animals  more monsters......more bugs.  without fixing the previous ones.

Everywhere you will walk, you will encounter a bug,
Everythiing you touch will end up buging,
anyways, games released on steam 2 weeks ago, theres what?  400 negative review for 100-150 positive ones...

This review here, is from a player, who played, spent time, money, since Alpha one test, and played thru release, till, 1 year ago when i quited cus game was total bullshit.I just came back for steam release, and i see no difference, beside fact they addded that shitty buggy continent that everyone avoid going on.
developer_response:
Thank you for your feedback, I'm sorry you didn't enjoy your time in Mortal Online.

Just to be clear, though:

- We do not have GM corruption in our game. That accusation is based on the fact that we had some bad experiences with volunteer GMs at one point, but that was over two years ago and we do not have any more volunteer GMs precisely because we do absolutely not tolerate anyone abusing their priviliges.

- There are no duplicate bugs like you describe in the game. We take duplication and reports of duplication very seriously. Sometimes server lag might appear like temporary duplication, but I assure you that we keep track of this and we do absolutely not allow any actual duplication.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051500995', 'num_games_owned': 968, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1441327367}
review:
Kesinlikle değişik bir oyun olduğunu söylemem lazım. Bir çok kişi efsanevi bir dünyası olduğunu ve kaliteli olcağını söylemiş. Unreal ile yapıldığı içinde çok fazla beklenti vardı. Bu yüzden muhtemelen hayal kırıklığı yaşattı. Oyun güzel ve diğer RPG lerden farklı olduğunu söylemem lazım. Fakat beklentiniz üst düzeyse beğenmeyeceğinizi düşünüyorum. Grafikleri low da ne yazıkki kötü oluyor iyi bir sisteminiz varsa high ayarlarda belki hoşunuza gidebilir. Oyun için low ayarlarda bir video çektim çünkü sistemimi baya zorluyordu ciddi bir sistem istiyor ve biraz optimizasyon sıkıntısı olduğunu söylemem gerek. Daha fazla uzatmadan sizi ilk bakış videom ile baş başa bırakıyorum. İyi Seyirler.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7lhu-bAOOYU

author: {'steamid': '76561198116697980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 41384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1706, 'last_played': 1507130783}
review:
This game is not for everyone. Please approach with patience and an open mind. 

The game has been out for some 6 years or so. New content and mechanics have been continuously added (for better or worse). Game devs do not generally explain the mechanics (which is now we want it) so most of the things have had to be figured out by players. 

If you are starting playing now you can:

a) Ignore forums, youtube etc and experiment yourself. This is ridiculously hardcore. 

b) Stand on the shoulders of players before you and enjoy the published knowledge. Maybe contribute with new knowledge (there are still systems not fully understood and/or preciously garded knowledge.).

c) Anything between a) and b)

Prepare to die. Prepare to experience the human nature at it's best and worse. Remember it is just a game. LEAVE THE BIG CITIES!

PS. This is made by a very small dev team. There are bugs. There are problems. But their achievement is nothing short of amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006267507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1441852642}
review:
What the devs have to say about this game?

"MO is a resource hog" 

"The game is not finished" (over 5 years into it's release)

"It is not as optimized as we would like" (over 5 years since it's release)

http://steamcommunity.com/app/287920/discussions/0/527274698152481038/#p1


Other things you'll find in this discussion?

Mods ignoring users attacking those with criticism because they are defending their game.(many people flinging mud and insults)
The person giving criticism being offered a job. (really damn suspicious to offer someone a job who is speaking out about your games problems)

Over all, the forums are kind of a shit show, and the mods and devs do not carry themselves like professionals.

This game has been out for 5 years now, and is currently on steam as a Free Trial.
Free trial in the sense that this game only allows free to play players to get slightly over half as strong as those who pay a monthly fee.

It runs like shit, on even the lowest settings for an average PC like mine which can run most other mmos (star trek online, Tera, Guild Wars 2. Champions online, Stardrive, Defiance. ect ect) on mid to high settings.
But this one runs terribly, and doesn't even look that fantastic whilst doing so.
Even people with high end systems in the forums can attest to log, stuttering, frame rate drops, and other issues.

The game is 10 gigs, it is not huge, but it's not small either.
Save yourself the download time and wait till the devs fix up the lag issues, optimize the game for ANY pc to run it properly, and till they possibly decide to drop this pay to win model and take it into actual F2P.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094548288', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1114, 'last_played': 1492302969}
review:
I'm loving this game. I don't understand why everyone isn't playing. Really, what gives?

If you love the sandbox, complexity, and attention to detail then this game is for you. 

Last night I ran away from skeletons and griefers. Looted my friends body. Gave him half his coin back (finders fee). Made a nice garment from his corpse (eww). Watched someone get blueblocked and his friends defend him as they backed away. Took cat naps in the graveyard. Terrifying! You can't see anything... and the sounds. Made a wooden war hammer because I had no ore. It broke. Killed a zombie, accidentally looted its corpse, which was heavy, and I nearly died because I was encumbered and couldn't get away. I had so much fun!

Besides open PvP there are some crucial sandbox points that StarVault  slam dunks with this game.
- No global bank
- Eve style auction house
- Gear needs to be continually replaced driving a real economy!
- No levels
- Craft anything from any reasonable material! Brilliant!

The list really goes on with some really bold divergences from your standard MMO, like no party system (when was it declared that adventurers shall number five?), friendly fire, no levels, and build anywhere.

I can't believe I didn't know about this game. I'm smitten. I'm posting here because the other commenters made hesitant to even install. Luckily the GMs are replying and unwavering unapologetic. "Sorry your experience was bad. This game may not be for everyone." So many games, seeking mass appeal, become more accessible and less interesting the longer you play.

In my experience as an EVE player full-loot-pvp-everywhere creates an environment that really necessitates the social aspects of an MMO. So make friends! Don't carry too much. Your losses will never be irrecoverable, and you will learn something from every death.

As to the griefers, They were there, but also vets healing and protecting newbies. This kind of emergent game play is what you can expect from a sandbox. There are plenty of games you can AFK gather/craft/dungeon/raid in. This isn't one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029243448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1535079201}
review:
I played this game when it came out. I played it again half a year later and then again and then again(it was ever improving mind you). I always played a month and took a break, mainly because of the subscription that is needed to not be handicapped compared to other players(at least now that it is free to play).

Give it a try and remember: It is HARDCORE, it truly is. you will be punished for every little mistake you make, like for example wandering out in the wild without the proper equipment or knowledge of your position. There are many players who will kill you just for the fun of it. It happened to me(not that often, but I am pretty cautious), it has been this way when it was released and it always will be. There are people like me, who will protect you from criminal scum, but they are few.

Now I have to point out, you CAN make it alone, you know. I did. I have a butcher, a armor crafter, a weapon crafter and a hunter/warrior. I did that all by my lonesome(I gathered intel from the forums and a few other guys tho), so I still got coin and can make all the equipment I need and buy mounts too. Many will tell you, you can not make it to anything alone in this game. It's not true you can, but it takes much time, much caution and even more planning and organization. To know when and where to hunt safely and when and where to travel to another hub to trade. Get the proper crafting experience, how to build your characters and so on and so forth. It is soooo damn hard. But it is possible.

Where this game probably most shines is guilds. Being in a guild that holds territory is quite fun and kewl. I haven't been in a big one, just minor ones. But I have been in a big battle about 3-4 years ago. A siege. It was amazing. 

So go ahead and give it a try, don't get scared away by the negative reviews. You can find out if this game is for you, you will not need a subscription, all it changes is the maximum skill lvl.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069812707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 28874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2355, 'last_played': 1595057890}
review:
Well ive played this game a while and its grown on me a lot, its not a game most will get and instantly love as the steep learning curve, open world, danger around every corner and challenging UI make this game a grower rather than a show'r.  Anyway its free so if you loved Skyrim but wished it was an MMO or you thought UO was the best thing ever if only it was a seamless 3d world then start downloading and jump in.

REMEMBER: Before you build your first char, read the guides, read the mortal online forums and learn as much as you can then a few days in after learning what you can, contact a new player friendly guild and then the real game begins.

Enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005073789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1248, 'last_played': 1441466979}
review:
game would be nice exept its pay to win: 
-you get limit to skill levels which you can't get higher than 60 while everyone paying get 100
-you can't craft heavy armor

that means you will be cannon fodder playing free
-running is also skill meaning everyone will outrun you
-items you make will be shit and noone will pay for them
-animals you tame will be shit 
-damage you make will be shit (max 25% more instead of 50)
-everything you do will be a waste untill you realise there are better titles you can play.
developer_response:
Ya we don't see it as a F2P title.
Steam puts us in that category since we charge nothing for the client so we tried to make this clear on the store page:

"Unlimited free trial!
Mortal Online offers a free-to-play mode with a skill cap at skill level 60. In order to unlock the maximum skill levels and fully master your Mortal destiny, a paid monthly subscription is needed, but unlike many other games there are no microtransactions. Unsubscribing will re-apply the skill cap, but your skills will be maxed again when you re-subscribe. Every player gets one free character slot, and you can purchase additional slots up to a maximum of four."

If you missed it maybe we should put it higher up on the page?

author: {'steamid': '76561198072153716', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1048, 'last_played': 1498350916}
review:
The game might seem great at first glance, but it really took a downhill turn for me.

You gotta pay for a monthly subscription to even access what some say is endgame, but in reality half the skills are locked because of it, players kill on sight, making you drop your inventory, which they could care less about, and the GMs aren't even helpful most of the time. The servers are still under stress testing, the hit boxes on weaponry are poorly made (I had to get right on top of anything I wanted to hit, leaving no room for jesus if you get my meaning), and you die from practically anything and everything. I mean, even the magic needs resources you can't gather from the city, so that's no alternative to melee. I know, it's meant to be hardcore, but I refuse to pay money to increase skills so I can stand a bit of a chance against people who keep players from exiting the city.

TL;DR

subscription to access skills
bad hitboxes
still stress testing servers
too much player killing for starters/noobs to get anywhere
magic seems awesome but is ridiculously difficult to utilize
developer_response:
Ya we don't see it as a F2P title.
Steam puts us in that category since we charge nothing for the client so we tried to make this clear on the store page:

"Unlimited free trial!
Mortal Online offers a free-to-play mode with a skill cap at skill level 60. In order to unlock the maximum skill levels and fully master your Mortal destiny, a paid monthly subscription is needed, but unlike many other games there are no microtransactions. Unsubscribing will re-apply the skill cap, but your skills will be maxed again when you re-subscribe. Every player gets one free character slot, and you can purchase additional slots up to a maximum of four."

If you missed it maybe we should put it higher up on the page?
We are currently investigating if we should maybe change it since so many people seem to miss it.
Would be nice to get some feedback on it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063485931', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1441900756}
review:
I take back anything positive I ever said about this game.

Why? Not because it's hardcore, or because it forces you to compete against other players. I take it back because the system itself tries to screw you over, more so than the players.

An example: I went to the graveyard, avoiding the red players (the ones that murder players on purpose), and farmed the walkers. After a while, I got a lot of money from walker heads alone and got myself good gear. I decided to keep going back and forth between graveyard and head vendor to make cash; good idea, right? Well, that ended abruptly when a swarm of guards were lead into the graveyard and they proceeded to kill all the walkers. Once one respawned, I hurried to jump on it and secure the loot, but one guard walked through me from behind and my attack hit the guard instead.

The guard then killed me and all my loot was permanently gone, all because the guard was able to walk right through me and absorb my attack that wasn't meant for the guard.

So, the players did much less damage than the system did and ruined the game for me. Just FYI, once you die, you respawn 100% naked and have to restart from the beginning (yes, that means going all the way to the starter area and killing pigs, except this time with fists and not weapons).

P.S. Asked the GM about this problem and they said it's 100% my fault, even though guards aren't supposed to be in the graveyard.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994936928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1511667866}
review:
I've played Mortal Online since Beta Block A, meaning I'm one of the first that bought this game. I've quit and came back to this game at least 10 times. I hate it but I also love it, it is a strange relationship i have with this piece of software to be honest. Now that I do not have a proper internet connection service, I can't really play but I'm trying to solve that problem and jump right back in.

Now this game is full of bugs, unstable server issues, a griefing population in cities, unfair flagging system and many other issues but let me explain what this game is offering, why is it different from other games?

-The most important thing is the players' influence over the world. This is not a semi-mmo with 100s of servers with only 40 people in it. This is a real breathing world with people who have different goals. There are political conflicts, rpk guilds playing the role of bandits, hire swords, trading guilds, player made cities for new players and sometimes even world wars that changes the whole game for everyone.
This being said MO is not a very solo friendly game. Even if you have all the characters you need, sustaining yourself while having fun turns into a job more than a game. You might follow this path, dont get me wrong it is entirely possible however I would not recommend it especially to a newbie.

-Exploration is a great aspect of this game. You have a wast land to wonder around and experience. You do not have a map in game so learning the terrain is important. Learning the safe routes, hidden places and farming areas would give you an advantage. Also there are different things that you can explore than the terrain and the world. There are tons of combinations that you can try in alchemy, crafting, cooking.. etc. There is no stamina or mana potion still in the game as far as I know, you could be the first one to invent them and make a fortune out of it!

-Combat is different than you would find in other mmos. First person view changes everything, I might be biased in this are because I love FPS it gives the most realistic feeling, forces you to be more careful about your surroundings and to me FPS helps me bond with the game by putting me right inside of the world. 

-Mortal Online might not be the first game with the open world combat, without battlegrounds or instances but this game has a more tactical fight or flee type of combat once you get into it. For example having the high ground might change everything or herding your enemy to an open area with mounted fighters can change the course of battle. So the terrain is an important aspect in combat, knowing your way around it might save your life. This is not much of a difference you to other games you might think but with the full loot, knowing that you will lose something and hurt your/your guilds reputation if you die makes a whole a lot difference.

I'd say try it for yourself. As most of the people say here, it is not a game for everyone. But if you like it chances are you will not be able to quit it entirely as long as there is no other game like MO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092318124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1441650934}
review:
Duas coisas que tornam o jogo foda: 1° Gente pelada; 2° Free2Play
Pode baixar que o jogo é muito bom. Traz uma proposta totalmente diferente dos outros MMORPG's coxinhas que vocês, provavelmente, estão acostumados.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999439508', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 11869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6969, 'last_played': 1583968131}
review:
This game is Ultima Online - 3D , they just couldn't name it that. 

If you are under 20 years old you will more than likely not enjoy this game, some of you will really enjoy it though, you just have to see past the "bad" graphics and the "bugs" (they become mechanics) 

If you remember the good old days, the golden age of mmos, UO, EQ, EQ2 (vanilla), WoW (vanilla)

This is what you are looking for.

The game is 5 years old and there are some already established guilds, but the influx of new steam players is insanse.

More players have started playing this game in 3 days, than Mortal Online has seen in 5 years, this is more like their true launch. 

Come join the fun, if you aren't a total carebear!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032201673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1441971845}
review: Mortal Online - идейный наследник Ultima Online и серии The Elder Scrolls, то есть это осовремененный, но более хардкорный и мрачный вариант Ультимы, при этом в визуальном плане сильно напоминающий какой-нибудь Обливион или Скайрим. Вобще по части хардкора и мрачности равных Морталу нет. Вцелом же проект, особенно для жанра MMO игр, просто уникальный.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109708848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2752, 'last_played': 1600537495}
review:
Игра Мега Хардкорная, интересная и не знаю почему все ноют но графон на Ультрах очень симпотичный.
Куча дргих обзоров тут уже есть не буду повторяться.
одписка за 200 с копейками (если брать сразу на полгода) это вообще копейки. Где вы видели подписку на ММОРПГ дешевле?
Главный косяк игры заключается в том что есть ограничение скилл поинтов.
то есть специализация очень узкая. Вам нужен крафтер оружи, броника, щитов (Это все разные ремесленники а не три в одном) Мясник, приручатель, лесоруб, рудокоп, строитель, и всякияе всякие прочие. 
но чтобы открыть слот на аккаунте (Второго персонажа) надо купить его. все бы ничего если бы 1 сраный слот не стоил 9баксов. вот в этом печаль. было бы дешевле я бы с радостью и премиум проплатил и слоты пооткрывал. Жх рублик рублик чтож ты такой деревянный 

НО игру советую попробовать на F2P хотя бы для ознакомления, очень хардкорно.

9 из 10 мертвых ослов прирученных между Тиндремом и медули


ЗЫЫ а ещё там членоголовые ПК гоняют, возле городов. Почему членоголовые ? Да потому что они фанятся на новичках как раз. Это придает ещё больший хардкор и суровость реальности. Игра ппц как не приветлива, а тут ещё и Головочлены эти ссаные мокрят всех подряд (Там есть даже гильдии которые специально изживают новичков - так сказать фогготы которые не довольны свежей кровью)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042662818', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1441878378}
review: Great ideas horrible execution. Just got killed in the starter zone by a grey play who is going around killing a bunch of noobies for fun. No map even though you have a compass and huge confusing cities. No party system and tons of trolls forcing pvp on you. Loss of everything you own upon death as the entire community will take all of your stuff no matter how you die. I love the level up system but thats kind of all i like about it. You cant even fight things effectively as a group because everyone helping you has an equal chance of causing your death. This isn't a good game, it's online masochism so if you're into that have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035012500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1441856260}
review:
A great idea for a game, but poorly executed.   The world outside of the main cities is pretty lifeless.  You can run for 20 minutes and come across the same trees and rocks you find in the city, which the city is in theory safer.  In reality you are more likely to be murdered in the PvE graveyard within the city than out in the wild.  Most likely this is because the murderers are so bored in the open, empty world the only place to kill is the starter zone.

The combat is clunky, and feels extremely out of date.  Movement is horrid.  Eventually developers may realize that only making sprint feel like a decent speed to move at, and then adding a stamina bar to limit sprint, is not very fun.  I found myself sprinting until out of stamina, resting for 5 seconds to refill the stamina, and then running again.  Overall it would probably be just as fast to go at walking speed, but that just feels too slow.

The skill system at first seemed interesting and deep.  Then you realize how pointlessly deep it is.  I'm not sure much is added to the game by having a skill for each of the following Zoology>Arthropoda>Chelicerata>Arachnida>Scorpiones, just to know about scorpions.  And unless you want to pay the monthly subscription, you're going to be capped at 60% compared to those who do pay anyway.

Save yourself the 10+gig download and skip this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127390987', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1441856237}
review:
Ok first off I have not been able to actually get into the game to play it period!

Second off this game keeps tripping the Norton firewall I have so if you have Norton you may as well just not even try to play this game as it'll keep tripping your firewall and giving you bullshit. So unless you want to have that headache of having your firewall just turned off the entire time you play then good luck.

Last off the game won't fucking close. Everytime I open it to try to play and actually get in and play it #2 keeps happening and the launcher won't actually open so I can play it and when I try to close it from my task manager it will not close.

They have a lot of things to fix on this game starting at the basics, such as the issues I'm having as well as adding at minimum another server to cut down on the lag that you get when your actually able to get to the starting screen for the game. This game just has too many problems right now to be fully successful on the steam platform.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132104710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2253, 'last_played': 1442382264}
review:
Edito: Bien, cuando estás dentro de la ciudad y empiezas a hacer evolucionar tu personaje el juego te da esa sensación de complejidad, de un mundo vivo, basto, lleno de posibilidades y quehaceres, ves a una gran cantidad de personas como tu, intentando ganarse las monedas para poder equiparse bien e irse de viaje a lo que de momento parece un basto mundo lleno de aventuras, todo ésto promete y te emociona el hecho de poder ir a lugares místicos con tus compañeros, pero cuando sales no te encuentras nada más que un mundo vacío y con un ambiente muy soso, con cero posibilidades, parece un "simulador de caminar" y si te encuentras con un enemigo el encuentro no es tan emocionante, el sin sabor que te queda es bastante decepcionante.

El potencial está allí, pero es solo eso, potencial, y difícilmente podrá ser mejorado, el juego lo amas al principio, pero al darte cuenta realmente lo desaliñado que es, dejas de prestarse si quiera interés, ni siquiera llegas a odiarlo, solo verlo como un producto sumamente aburrido, sumale a ésto una comunidad llena de malnacidos que te matan for the Lulz.

No deja de darme impotencia el hecho de encontrar un juego que Casi, casi da con el tipo de juego que mucha gente estamos esperando, un MMORPG con sistema de combate basado en la habilidad del jugador, gran mapa, largas aventuras PVE, crafting variado, buenas gráficas e inmersión total.

review: И того у нас есть игра с устаревшей графикой, совершенно неудобным и неюзабельным интерфейсом. Первые минут 15 вы будете думать какого черта вы вообще установили эту игру. Дальше, вас отпустят в открытый мир и вы начнете попросту охуевать. Например вы будете несколько часов адски потеть ради нескольких золотых для нового меча и тут на вас набросяться 5 абсолютно голых типов и забьют кулакаи досмерти, отобрав у тебя и твой многострадальный меч и золотишко.

review:
Was soll man sagen?! Grottenhässliche Grafik, Server total überlastet, es hackt an allen Ecken und das Spiel ist allgemein noch sehr rohr. 
Aber es macht wahnsinnig Spaß!! Die Atmosphäre erinnert zum Teil an das alte Gothic gemischt mit Morrorwind. Das full PvP vermittelt einem das Gefühl, welches ich nur aus DayZ kenne. Es ist einfach geil Spieler aus einem Busch aufzulauern und nacktzumachen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046584434', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1441806315}
review:
Смесь Morrowind (атмосфера, графика) + Rust (возможности, пвп с потерей лута, открытый мир) + Chivalry (система боя). 

+ Открытое пвп, смерть с полной потерей лута. Одним словом - настоящий хардкор!

+ Песочница. Строй где хочешь и что хочешь.

+ Атмосфера здесь просто волшебная! Прямо за душу берет и не отпускает.

+ Огромный мир.

+ Уникальная система боссов. Она заключается в том что каждый босс - уникален в своём роде! Если его убить, он больше не появится. Но за то в мире появляются новые уникальные боссы.

+ Реалистичность. Я говорю не про физику и графику, я говорю про механику. Приведу пару примеров:

1) Пытаясь плыть в тяжелых доспехах, если вы недостаточно сильны - доспехи потянут вас ко дну. Если ваш инвентарь весит 15 кг - он также потянет вас ко дну. 

2) Вы не можете спрятать вашего питомца или маунта в рюкзак, он не исчезнит волшебным образом. Все ваши прирученые животные будут всегда бегать с вами, их нужно кормить, они могут отстать от вас и потеряться.  
Кстати о маунтах. Ваше ездовое животное сможет помогать вам нести ваш груз, для этого на него надо навешать кучу мешков и заполнить их вещами. Выглядит это прикольно. =)

 3) Нет волшебного общего чата. Новичкам в начале дают доступ в Help чат на несколько суток, и всё.

+ 4) Система боя. Вы не сможете ударить врага своим мечом если приблизитесь к нему в плотную. Максимум что у вас получится - это ударить его рукояткой. Вам нужно расчитывать расстояние с которого бить. Также вы должны целиться по слабым местам: если у врага доспех на правой руке слабее чем на левой - попав по правой  руке, вы нанесете больше урона. Также нужно стараться целиться в голову. Систему боя можно отдельно вынести в +.

+ Система крафта. Здесь можно скрафтить всё что угодно и из чего угодно. Вы можете скрафтить уникальный предмет, который не крафтил ещё ни кто. 


- Без знания английского в игре придется туго. 

- Без подписки особо не поиграешь, в игре есть ограничения. Но я не думаю что 300р в месяц - это много.


Игра с самого начала может показаться деревянной, после запуска её сразу хочется закрыть. Но не спешите этого делать. Пройдите цепочку начальных квестов, потратив на это ~ пол часа/час, После этого идите на кладбище, и встретьте там своих первых врагов - зомби и игроков. Только тогда вы сможете прочувствовать боевую систему и атмосферу!

Минигайд:

Чтобы сделать игру во всеь экран, нажмите F11.

В игре существует система пвп флагов. Суть её проста: 
Есть бомжи (их ник подсвечивается желтым цветом), граждане (голубой), преступники (серый), серийные убийцы (красный).  
Изначально вы бомж, затем после прохождения начальных квестов становитесь гражданином. Разницы почти нет.
Если вы ударите, убьете или залутаете труп желтого/синего игрока, то вы временно (2мин) становитесь серым - тогда вас может безнаказанно убить и залутать любой игрок, и цвет его ника не изменится. В городе вас за это убьет стража. Если вы будете делать это постоянно - то ваш ник станет красным на очень продолжительное время, и вас будут убивать все кому не лень. Так что поаккуратнее с грабежами.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105868586', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1441731443}
review:
Итак, что я хочу сказать: эта игра посвящается любителям покопаться в говне, чтобы найти в нём мочу. Как бы эта фраза странно не звучала - оно так и есть и вы её не поймёте, пока не поиграете.
Начнём с тех субъектов, которые пишут, что игра просто пиздецки невъебенна и она подойдёт фанатам серии Свитков. Не слушайте данные высказывания, у их авторов явно проблемы с адекватным восприятием. 
Начнём с минусов, т.к. их очень много:
1) Клиент весит около 20 гб. Я считаю, что необходим стартовый демо клиент, для ознокомления с миром MO. 
2) Нету русского языка. Для полного ознакомления в аспектах игры нужно запасаться терпением, жать заветную кнопочку "H" и открывать гугл переводчик.
3) Убогая стартовая локация. Я, лично, не являюсь любителем всяческих ММОРПГ онлайн игр и играю в них довольно редко. И в каждой из этих игр была интересная стартовая локация, которая могла зацепить игрока теми или иными аспектами. А тут всё очень плоско и некрасиво. 
4) Убогий, пизданутый интерфейс, который делал даун австралопитек долбя по клавиатуре булыжником.
5) Графон, кудаж без него, родимого?! Графон тут, мягко говоря, - шлак, если сравнивать его с тремя братьями, то графон тут, который был "И так и сяк". Единственное, что мне в нём понравилось, дак это лица персонажей, над лицами они хорошо поработали, но на всё остальное смотреть отвратительно.
6) БАГИ!
7) Нудные квесты. Ты появляешься и видишь какого-то нпс, который что-то там тебе рассказывает и отправляет побить свинюшек, потом, когда ты побьёшь свинюшек, он отправит тебя к другому нпс, который отправит тебя, внимание, побить свинюшек! Но, на этот раз тебе нужно выбить с этих свинюшек 16 кожи, каким хером ты это сделаешь - разбирайся сам. Потом нас отправили делать броню. Далее, нас отправили к какому-то другому нпс, который заставил нас, внимание, убивать кроликов -_- 
8) Подписка. Подписка тут осуществляется таким образом: когда игра вышла в стим, её сделали Free 2 Play, но, не всё так радужно, как кажется. В F2P версии игры перед нами закрыта возможность подбирания особо редких вещей, на которые я, кстати говоря, натыкался на стартовой локации. Как минимум, это огорчает, но и платить за ЭТО 300 рублей в месяц - нет, спасибо, обойдуся!
9) Боёвка и вид от первого лица уровень Reign of Kings. Короче говоря, всё очень деревянно.  

Перейдём к плюсам данной игры: 
1)Невъебенный, мать его, хардкор.
2) Пиздецки огроменный в мир, в которым можно потеряться нахуй и невернуться, и никакая мамка вас не найдёт, и не поможет вам песенка про Мамонтёнка. 
3) Интересная реализация городских фракций. Типа стражников и т.п. Когда нас конкретно эта игра заебала мы решили пиздить всё живое, в конце концов прибежали два стражника с мечами-гладунцами и насадили нас на них по самое не хочу. Также и с ворвством, но, воровство есть, опять же, в платной версии игры. Спалили - пизда. Не спалили - ноги в руки и в перёд, ну или наоборот, хуй знает, я заебался уже эту поеботу писать. 
4) Постройка своего города, которую ввели совсем недавно. 
Ну и больше плюсов я не нашёл. Вполне возможно, что это всё из-за того, что я очень мало поиграл в эту игру, но и тратить на неё время я не собираюсь. 

ЕСЛИ ЭТО ЧИТАЕТ РУССКОЕ КОМЬЮНИТИ РАЗРАБОТЧИКОВ (да кого я обманываю, нету у них его) СДЕЛАЙТЕ РУССКИЙ ЯЗЫК, ЗАПИЛИТЕ ГРАФОН, ЗАПИЛИТЕ БОЁВОЧКУ, НОРМАЛЬНЫЙ ВИД ОТ 1-ГО ЛИЦА, ПОПРАВЬТЕ БАГИ И НАЙМИТЕ НОРМАЛЬНОГО МАППЕРА, А ТОГО БОМЖА ВАЛЕРУ, КОТОРЫЙ ДЕЛАЛ НАЧАЛЬНУЮ ЛОКУ, ВЫКИНЬТЕ ОБРАТНО НА ПОМОЙКУ! ВОТ ВАМ И ВЕСЬ ПРОФИТ! 

ЕСЛИ ВЫ ВСЁ ЕЩЁ ЗАИНТЕРЕСОВАНЫ ЭТОЙ ИГРОЙ, ПОЗДРАВЛЯЮ, ВЫ, БЛЯДЬ, МАЗАХИСТ! ИДИТЕ ЛИЧИТЕСЬ, БОЛЬНЫЕ УБЛЮДКИ! 

16 ИЗ 16 КОЖИ СВИНЬИ, 1 ИЗ 2 СТРАЖНИКОВ С МЕЧОМ-ГЛАДУНЦОМ И 1 ИЗ 1 ПОЛИГОНА! АВЕ!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028907841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2529, 'last_played': 1444272971}
review:
Ignoring all the idiots who think that just because they cannot log in the first few days after steam release the game is horrible and do not recommend it, this game is great. For the small company that Star Vault is, they did a great job fixing the server issues. Everyone expects perfection from Star Vault in everything that happens, not realizing it is not a huge company like Blizzard is or other MMO with all the money that comes with being that big. All of that instant gratification ruining the population. 

Now to the real part of why I recommend this. This game is great in so many ways that it is unexplainable here. Everything they have implemented, from the mining aspect to the breeding your tamed animals YES I said breeding for the specific stats that fit YOU. Everything in this game is in great depth and I honestly couldnt recommend it more. The start may be a bit difficult but that really weeds out those who have no patience to build themselves up. If you have no patience, dont play MMO's that are all about patience in leveling. Try it out for yourself, it is free to play anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989848643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 71690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6891, 'last_played': 1449860338}
review:
I can honestly say I am loving this game. I can also understand if there is a lot of players who will not enjoy it.
The game is hard, it is not a game for the new generation of gamers. There is some bugs and glitches, and plenty of people will take advantage of you if you make a mistake. All in all, it is unforgiving, complex and rough... and I am loving it.

I dont know how to describe the game itself, it is like a weird mix of games such as UO, EQ, Eve Online and Mount and Blade. The community is fairly kind and helpful, although as with all games you have bad apples.

So to make a long story short, if you enjoy games that are challenging, I would strongly advice you to try this one out.
If you belong to the "WoW"- generation, that expect everything to be handed to you on a silverplatter and instructions ala-follow-the-red-line, you will probably become frustrated and not enjoy it.


Hope to see you online, and anyone have questions feel free to ask here. I am fairly new but always happy to help when I can.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970511727', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1521, 'last_played': 1441845112}
review:
I love every aspect of Mortal Online. I love that there's no true safety. I love the reward for the hardwork. I don't mind having to repeat 15 minutes of labor because I was murdered. BECAUSE I WAS FUCKING MURDERED. I was cutting wood in a populated area, went to make some tea, came back; DEAD. Boom, wake up call. This isn't a game you can walk away from. This isn't a game you can mindlessly farm. There are penalties for inattention and they're player enforced. Your first death will enrage you because you'll think you've come so far. But it's literally 15 minutes tops to replace everything you lost. And then what do you do? You throw it in the bank and fearlessly venture forth until you run into something bigger and badder than you.  If you're foolish enough to roll around with a full inventory with 2 hours worth of farming mats... 

And the community is wonderful once you finally get away from the help chat which is laden with angry children hellbent on refusing to figure any portion of this game out for themselves(even when a volunteer spends hours answering questions). 

I was so stoked when I was pickpocketed for the first time, it was hilarious chasing the guy down as the gaurds filled him with arrows and I promptly took my 2silver back. 

I can't wait to find a guild.

This is what MMORPG's should have been all along. 

Mortal Online inspires a true sense of adventure in a thrilling and engaging world. (WITHOUT A STORY/DIALOGUE(Outside of the tutorial of course))

You make your own story, you carve your own path, you create your own sanctuary.
This is a gem of a game and I cannot wait to see what else Star Vault has in store for us.

10/10 would get murdered again

author: {'steamid': '76561198051437649', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1441766969}
review:
Tutti quelli che hanno dato una recensione negativa sono solo rosiconi che non hanno capito a cosa stanno giocando e sono troppo scarsi per un gioco di questo livello.

Leggete bene e stampatevelo in testa: Questo è HARDCORE
Non ci sono livelli ma una lunghissima serie di statistiche e abilità che vanno sviluppate attraverso l'uso delle suddette compiendo le relative azioni. Esempio: Tagliare legna per aumentare la forza. Picchiare per aumentare l'uso delle armi, eccetera.

La morte è HARDCORE, se crepi rinasci alla shrine piu vicina nudo come un verme e tutto quello che avevi ora è in un fagotto nel punto in cui sei morto e chiunque lo trovi se lo porterà via. Non vuoi perdere mesi di lavoro? Portati solo l'essenziale e non crepare. 

Chi scrive che il gioco è P2W non ha capito cosa significhi. L'unica differenza tra un account Free e uno abbonato è il cap delle skill. Ovvero mentre il punteggio massimo di ogni abilità è normalmente 100 gli account gratuiti sono limitati a sfruttare solo un massimo di 60 punti per skill, questo significa che anche giocando gratuitamente le vostre abilità saliranno fino a 100 ma finché non pagherete sarà come se fossero a 60. Dal momento che l'uso gratuito è inteso come PROVA del gioco questo metodo è perfetto e non concede critiche. In questo gioco NON è presente alcuna forma di shop e non esistono quindi privilegi speciali per chi sborsa piu soldi.

Per quanto riguarda i bug questo gioco è nato come progetto amatoriale indipendente finanziato prima di tutto dai suoi creatori e poi dai guadagni degli abbonamenti mensili dei giocatori, inoltre viene portato avanti da un pugno di persone che si impegnano da anni a migliorarlo e a creare ciò che i grandi publisher non hanno il coraggio di fare: Un gioco LIBERO dove puoi fare quel cavolo che ti pare e dove paghi realisticamente le conseguenze delle tue azioni. Perciò qualche bug ogni tanto e un minimo di lagg si puo perdonare.

In Mortal Online ogni cosa che avrai dovrai guadagnartela col sudore. Pertanto è da sempre un ambiente estremamente selettivo, da astenersi casual gamers e chiunque cerchi un gioco dove puo rapidamente diventare forte e sentirsi un super eroe. Qui morirete tanto, vi incazzerete un macello e sputerete sangue. Ma se siete giocatori seri e saprete imparare dai vostri errori riceverete soddisfazioni che nessun altro gioco sa dare. 

Vitale anche il sociale, da soli siete carne da macello, con una gilda potete combattere guerre e assedi EPICI. Potete essere grandi guerrieri come commercianti, artigiani o allevatori e potete stare certi che verrete riconosciuti a vista dagli altri giocatori.

Insomma, fatevi avanti se ne avete il coraggio e astenetevi dal dare giudizi penosi se non siete all'altezza della sfida.

PS: Ho giocato per mesi molto prima della release su Steam. Per chi si chiedesse come mai ho così poche ore di gioco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066292838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2147, 'last_played': 1482722100}
review:
(Edited) The game is fun and not for everyone. It's very hardcore. It's what you'd go to after you finish Skyrim, after you ran out of NPC's to kill (only everyone's doing it still). F2P isn't bad. No pay to win problems I can see. Imagine DayZ Elder Scrolls of Warcraft. That's this. Like damn, hardcore much?
Only way to possibly get out of town is to join a guild. Friendly guilds weren't on the main continent when I played, so the forums are kinda mandatory if want to play... forces you to be social kinda. Unless you're really... good?

author: {'steamid': '76561198052374180', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1041, 'last_played': 1571087419}
review:
A very refreshing game in this age of quests with sparkly trails, automatic combat and all reward with no-risk.
Mortal Online is none of these things. It's brutal, it's unforgiving, it's frustrating and it's a tremendous amount of fun and excitement!

If you like a game like EVE Online, this is for you. It's EVE Online gone medevial.

Give it a try but don't say I didn't warn you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960672654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1442269609}
review:
Server status says its up, but I cannot connect, too bad. I was hoping to try this game out, but I'm not going to wait in a 20 minute queue, just to get put back in queue because it timed out.

Decided to give the game another shot today, still can't connect, I sit in queue for 3-4 minutes, then some error I don't have time to read flashes on the screen and then I'm back in queue. I can log into the website with my account just fine.

I was finally able to connect to this game today, what a disapointment, the game looks and runs like crap, there was a 'toturial' where I was instructed to kill some pigs and skin them, zero explaination on how to do this btw, after taking nearly 10 minutes to kill a pig, which was hard because there doesn't seem to be a way to lock a target that's easy to find in the UI and the hit boxes and attack boxes are all kinds of wonky, and on top of that the other playets kept swooping in and killing my pigs if I got them low, good community, I spent another 10 minutes trying to figure out how to skin the thing once i finally managed to kill one and then gave up, what a sad waste of my time. 15 years ago this game would maybe have been good, but too many better modern MMO's exist to bother with this crap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068811715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1441139798}
review:
OVERALL, I'd say give the game a try. It's free so fuck it. I was unfortunate enought to try on a day that the 1 server they have was shit. Then my friend unfortunately ran into every bug you can experience in the first 5 minutes of the game. Hopefully it was just for us.

*Queue Time Kinda Fixed, Skip This Part & Read The 2nd Attempt*

Installed and registered.

Game started running and I'll admit, it was beautiful from the second it launched.

Logging in required me to wait a full 15 minutes, which I assumed was a queue of players. A little annoying but when I enter a game, I'm on for a solid streak. 15 minutes is nothing compared to the grinding session I'm about to begin.

I begin creating my character. While the customization isn't very extensive, it still offers a few unique mechanics that you won't find anywhere else.

While struggling to find a worthy name for my champion, the game suddenly sends me back to the Log In screen, informing me that I've lost connection. I check my internet and find nothing wrong. I had a stream running at the same time which was not interrupting, reassuring me that the error was not on my end.

I log back in.

15 minute Queue.

I'm a bit frusturated at this point.

This time I fly through the character creation. I no longer care about the toon because I just want to play the game after this unproductive 45 minute session.

I enter the the tutorial.

The game is running great. My movement feels smooth. A little different but smooth. I run through the first couple tasks and I'm about to make my first set of armor when I see a notification in chat that the server will be resetting. This is instantly followed by the complaints of other players.

Server goes down. I lose connection. 

15 minute queue.

I have now spent 45 minutes of my 1st hour ingame WAITING to play a tutorial.

Game looks great. But somehow as someone who loves to grind hours away with stupid ingame tasks, I've lost patience.



*UPDATE* 

Watched my friend play. He logged in after a 13 minute queue and experienced no server issues. He then experienced a few glitches I did not. 

The tutorial mission stalled on him. When you're supposed to butcher the animal parts for its leather/hide, you drag the parts over to the butcher skill. He did this and received nothing but "Work Bench is not available" or something along those lines. Don't quote me on that.

I knew this wasn't supposed to happen because I personally had passed this part of the tutorial before being disconnected. 

Before he could log out and endure another queue just to complete the first step of the tutorial, he found that he was rooted to the ground. Unable to move, jump, or rest. We sat there laughing about it until he lost his "fledgling" status. At this point another player approached him and started attacking him.

I watched as he calmly exited and uninstalled the game.


MORAL OF THE STORY? 

Gave the game a second try, and the queue time was a bit shorter... But then the game glitched out.

4/10 still can't play through the tutorial without having to relog whether it be because of glitches or server restarts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068834010', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1441953426}
review:
DISAPPOINTED!!
I downloaded this game because most of the reviews are good.
here's my experience with Mortal Online.
after i downloaded the game, and open the game client, it says something like could not connect to server.
so i restart my modem, restart computer, restart the game, and spam on launching the game, FINALLY got the game running.
Creating character, it kept on saying my surname is chosen, and ask me try another surname...after trying for almost 1 hour, the forum says It was my NAME, NOT SURNAME...
YES, finally got into the game!!
the graphic is off, the resolution is off, i tried to adjust everything but the damn compass thing is stuck at the MIDDLE of my damn screen... the damn chat window is stuck under my screen, my damn mouse cursor won't go off...
i restart the game again.
login and it says im a damn F2P player, so i have to QUEUE.
estimated wait time: 2 minutes
for hours, it kept on looping connect, 2min queue, connect, 2min queue, connect, 2min queue.... why won't you just let me play :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198010204554', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 64923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20935, 'last_played': 1609680618}
review:
You have to be willing to play a game with harsh ruleset.

This game will not hold your hand. You are in-charge of your destiny and can do what ever you want, from crafting, exploring and building. You pursue war, trade, or adventure. You could be a Mercenary ,King, Tyrant, Rebel or/and (yes you literally can be them all) Thief. 

But also that means others can, and they will, even if it means stealing from you or killing you when you feel safe! You have to learn to survive and flourish but when you do, you feel like you are actually achieving something rather than just ticking a quest box...

Mortal is much more than a game. Its a community with "REAL" diplomatic ramifications. You don't like that someone just killed your pet? then get 15 of your mates and go blow up there village! Think that's a tad unfair and an over-reaction! then gear up and help the defenders! Don't like that a guild just butted into a third parties battles, then war dec them and kick them out of the town they live in...

This game is so powerful, addictive and brilliant that even the haters keep coming back for more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061049439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 30658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1537, 'last_played': 1700587551}
review:
Highly recommend this game for anyone who is either tired or not interested in the keyboard smashing MMO's. It's hard to beat the thrill, enjoyment and immersion given by the First Person View and Combat given to you in Mortal Online.

Two large continents, and more on the way, together with enough crafting possibilities to make you vomit, makes Mortal a game to be enjoyed now aswell as a promising future to look forward to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118689310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1441732132}
review:
One of the worst games I have ever tried. Not even "good for being free".

Hardly no tutorial/information texts in how to do anything.

No map

No quest log 

Compass in the middle of the screen.

Movement and interaction with the world are really bad and sluggish.

Crafting is really ????. Collected wood and stone and can't do anything with it in any of the working places. They all just disappear cause you can't use it there.

My pickaxe just randomly disappered too. Then I felt, NOPE. No more time for me in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023941593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1444148641}
review:
Amazing game,

It is harsh, it is hard, it is unforgiving, it has flaws but it still is the ONLY game like it currently available. Nothing else really comes close in terms of hardcore mechanics (full pvp, full loot, open world, thieving, component specific crafting, breeding, territorial conquest etc)

The kind of mechanics available (kill a player-killer huting newbies in the graveyard and cook his head and body in a stew) or skin a buffalo and make armor from its bones and hide) simply fantastic! the level of freedom that exists in this game is astounding.

Yes, there are villians, plenty of them, but there are also heroes and kind people willing to help.

- If you want to experience something truely unique and you have lots of patience then give this game an honest go.

- If you are an impatient person who wants intant gratification, hates being killed and you cannot handle "losing" game items/pixels then give it a miss.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969375923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5724, 'last_played': 1442837150}
review:
DAS IST KEIN SPIEL FÜR KINDER
Du glaubst ein Spiel ist dann toll wenn es dir das Gefühl gibt, du bist mächtig und stark und die Welt liegt dir zu Füßen.
Dann suchst du dir besser ein anderes, ein einfaches Spiel.

Hier wirst du nicht glücklich, denn Mortal Online ist Hardcore! Keine Ingame Karte, nur einen Kompass! Nur 1st Person! Full Loot! Und du wirst sterben und deine Ausrüstung verlieren für die du zum Teil Stunden gearbeitet hast! 
Und du wirst anderen Spielern das Leben und die Ausrüstung nehmen, für die sie Stunden lang gearbeitet haben...
Du kannst natürlich einen weissen, edlen Ritter spielen... Dann hast du es doppelt schwer!



Ein sehr schönen Spiel, kaum startet man, stirbt man auch schon auf die ein oder andere Weise. Aber sobald man einmal vertraut ist mit dem System. Dann gibt es kein Spiel wo man so viel Freiheit, Risiko und Spaß hat. Das auch nicht nur wenn man raus in die Welt zieht. Man kann jederzeit alles verlieren was man am Leibe trägt, oder ausgeraubt werden wenn man mal kurz nicht aufpasst. 

Man kann alles und jeden Angreifen. Jedoch wird man, wenn man Unschuldige (das gilt auch für Haustiere von anderen Spielern) angreift zum Verbrecher (nach 5 Morden auch zum Mörder). Und als solcher ist man innerhalb der Stadt innerhalb sekunden Tot! (Sofern man nicht extrem gute Ausrüstung und entsprechende Kampfskills hat) Außerhalb der Städte trachten NPC oder andere Spieler nach deinen Leben und Ausrüstung.

Beginnt man erstmal zu begreifen wie komplex das Crafting System ist. Und wie gefährlich es ist in der Wildnis Ressourcen zu sammeln. Dann ist klar, man sollte sich Freunde machen. Alleine spielen macht zwar auch sehr viel Spaß, jedoch wird man als Solo Spieler noch häufiger sterben als andere. Doch auch eine Gruppe schützt dich nicht, REDs (Spieler die andere Spieler töten und meist darin erfolg haben) machen auch vor größeren Gruppen nicht halt, wenn sie sich im Vorteil sehen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030594312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1441726237}
review: ITS a fucking terrible game people. sure it looks ok from the beginning; but its not, i can see why they opened it to steam. in my opinion it should be left to rot. it has some very serious problems that they dont seem to care about... if they did the problems would have been resolved long ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079060765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4056, 'last_played': 1442018551}
review:
Ok so I Started when this game came to steam, This game has many bugs, some of them very annoying, but there is no game like this. If you enjoy a game like mount and blade or chivalry with a completely open world and full looting system then this is the game for you. This game is incredibly frustrating. You will die, you will lose everything, and if this is the game for you, you will rebuild and try again. This game should easily be a 70 but due to a poor steam launch and server issues it is not getting the recognition it deserves. 
Pros; Open world/ Complete freedom
Skilled based combat (real time) you can block, parry dodge ect
Its free, yes there is a subscription and you could call this ptw but really think of it as a trial. 
Cons: Lots of bugs, getting stuck in walls, items dissapearing, server reboots ect.
This game is unforgving. You will die,

author: {'steamid': '76561197993019438', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4849, 'last_played': 1446551680}
review:
Lets start simple.
This game is hard, really hard.
Its unforgiving and brutal, the crafting is complex and in depth, with multiple ways to gather some of the necesary resources.

Combatively it is skill and equipment based, someone with better armour and weapons has a large advantage but is not necesarily unbeatable.

Though there is one place where the game falls down, but at the same time this is the games greatest strength.
The world. There is no quest system, the game will not tell you where to go or what to do.
It is up to the players to create the content, to start the wars and build great cities to set quests for newer players to help  kingdoms grow.
The world is populated with NPC animals and monsters, and in the town's and cities there are guards and merchants, but they sell only the most basic equipment and provide only so much protection.
Should you need a sword, you must find a player to make you one.
A helmet? find a friendly armour smith.

This game does not hold your hand, and it expects a certain amount of intelect from its players, you cannot come into this game and expect to be taken on a tour of the world and to see all the coolest parts just because you followed a line of exclimation marks on your minimap that has an arrow pointing to the next destination.

In this game you decide who you are.
Are you a brave adventurer? traveling between towns and seeking out the most fearsome beasts and the darkest caverns.
Are you a reclusive smith? only emerging from your work to gather more crafting supplies.
Are you a great mage? honing your mind into the weapon it is.
Perhaps you bandit? demanding payment for the lives of those you meet and taking both should they resist.

Or are you simply a poor pleb? stalking a graveyard full of the mindless dead who you almost seem to disopear amongst.

Those are but a few of the things you can do in this game, but it will now show you how, you must carve that path yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075038805', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2389, 'last_played': 1465042959}
review:
Esse é um MMORPG bem diferente dos que estamos acostumados.

Primeiro, aqui você precisa aprender a não se apegar aos bens materiais pois você provavelmente perderá com freqüência.

O mais importante são as habilidades que você adquiri treinando ou lendo livros. Lembra daquela frase que vivem dizendo: "Estude pois conhecimento ninguém tira de você". Pois é....aqui o que conta é isso.

O jogo dá total liberdade para você e qualquer outra pessoa, o que garante sérios riscos em sua aventura e isso apesar de um fardo, pode ser uma boa recompensa.

Quando você cometer um crime, seu nome (e escudo perto do nome) fica cinza e todo mundo pode te matar a vontade para pegar suas coisas. Por isso tome cuidado ao tentar matar algum monstro pois alguns engraçadinhos entram na frente de sua arma para você atingi-los e tornar-se fora-da-lei por 2 minutos....dois longos minutos.

No jogo você precisa comer para sobreviver. Se não comer perde peso. E se perder muito peso perde força...comendo muito fica obeso e perde a velocidade para correr, andar etc...Uma mecânica no mínimo incomum. 

Infelizmente para muitas pessoas da nova geração o jogo não agrada (e é por isso que você tantas análises negativas...realmente é um jogo para poucos...normalmente o pessoal que joga tem idade superior à 18 anos).

O jogo não tem mapa...apenas uma bússola e NPCs que dão breves informações sobre locais. A Exploração solitária pode ser bem perigosa!

Sistema de montarias e pets: Você pode adestrar ou dominar (se for mago) qualquer criatura no jogo se tiver habilidade alta o suficiente.

O misticismo e a magia existe de forma bem sucinta no jogo...nada de fantasioso demais. A coisa mais incrível de se ver é realmente a capacidade dos jogadores, que podem construir cidades para qualquer um viver ou destruir e aniquilar tudo o que virem pela frente, ou seja, o mais incrível é o poder das decisões nobres ou sombrias de nós, humanos por trás de um jogo e o que a obsessão pelo poder pode fazer conosco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145521220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 27168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2428, 'last_played': 1446802445}

review: Glitchy Graphics, terrible interface, horrible tutorial. This game is one of the worste I've tried, I will give it some points for creativity on the scale of slaughtering animals, gaining leather specific to that animal, bones, meat, Tallow. Absolutely wonderful ideas, but the game around the thoughts is just not worth it. Mortal Online is the worste MMORPG I've played thus far. It wouldn't even save my resolution, there is no "none" windowed mode. It lagged and froze in multiple spots. I had to learn everyone from google and youtube on how to play this game. There is only first person mode, and it froze up and died on me 3 times. I've never had such problems with an Online MMO before, positively the worste, waste of space on your drive. DO NOT DOWNLOAD! I'm warning you! It's terribad!

review:
Besides being a pain graphic wise-you can tweak it till its tollorable but then when you die and believe me someone who mysteriously has all the best items in the game yet still isnt satisfied will Kill you and steal your gear espscially if your a newbe. When your dead the graphics turn back to crap The Lagging is so Bad you can't move or even Logout.
Fix your Graphic so that if you can play the game then dying shouldn't wipe your settings out.
The general concept was great I liked the crafted skills...but it does no good when someone robs you constantly..the playing field should be evened out at least till you can level up once. Like I said its the graphics that make this unplayable though....I spent all of my time tweaking only to have to die just to see if I could respawn somewhere. Let us know when you've made the game playable with the machine specs you recommend and maybe if you find away to clear out the cheaters I would give it another try..otherwise why bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991322772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 15941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6173, 'last_played': 1506196090}
review:
Mortal Online will kick your ass
- Hand holding? Hah..
- Ingame map? Good F'ing luck
- Quest's? Wtf are those

Does it have a single server, open world, full loot pvp, full crafting, and an easily griefable flagging system? You bet your ass it does.

Forge your own adventure by becoming a Tamer (mounts/pets/battlepets), Crafter, Fighter, Architect, Butcher/Cook and more. Not newb friendly, and defiantly not solo friendly. You will die, You'll die f'in bad. You'll die so hard you'll relog into Runescape.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007748364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 34700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10821, 'last_played': 1705086190}
review:
Mortal online позволит вам погрузиться в хардкорное онлайн фэнтези.
1. Вам расказывают только основы после чего вас отправляют в открытый мир где нет уровней есть только ваш личный опыт
2. только первое лицо
3.практически полная свобода действий
5. возможность постройки городов
6. разведение животных
7. отсутствие классов
8. свободное пвп и фулл дроп (вас убили с вас выпало все что на вас было одето)
9. хардкор пве (в котором вы можете умереть даже от маленькой группы волков будучи закованым в доспехи)
10. возможность полноценного боя на ездовых животных.(как дальнего так и ближнего)
11. сложная система алхимии (в игре есть алхимики хранящие секреты уникальных зелий)
12 Без таргетавая система (речь идет не о псевдо нон таргете а реально о том что при атаке как выпопали лезвием туда вы и попали)
13. уникальная система крафта
Все выше перечисленое этов всеголишь верхушка айсберга эта игра даст вам уникальный опыт который вы не получите даже в новых проектов из живых аналогов есть только Ultima Onlinу
Рекомендую всем зайти и попробовать на личном опыте эту игру не обращая внимания на негативные коментарии практически все они написаны спантанно игроки даже не пытались оценить игру в полной мере.

П.С
не смотря на то что прект существует уже 6 лет в нем не иследован весь контент.

MO es un juego con mucho potencial. Se sale del clásico sistema de clases y niveles permitiendo no solo hacer el pj que quieras en cuanto a clase, si no que también puedes elegir qué ser dentro del juego. 
Si te gusta el pvp, las siegues y la aventura no dudes en probarlo! Si bien no es apto para todos los gustos debido, entre otros aspectos, a la larga curva de aprendizaje k presenta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093527438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2281, 'last_played': 1602551298}
review: The game is very innovative. I really like what they did with the mini game, which is the first thing you see after purchasing Mortal Online. Its called logging in. You can do it single player, or cooperative in a teamspeak, where you see who can get past the dreaded "gathering character data" MOB. This boss took me over an hour to beat but eventually we were able to log in. We were greated with real time interactive words accross the screen. These were actually the second boss in the game, that attacked immediately after log in and yelled "Server will be restarting in 45 minutes." If you lost to this boss it sent you back to the original minigame. I have yet to get past that one so I have no news on the rest of the content, but I will be sure to post again as soon as I see it.
