author: {'steamid': '76561198112693451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 17068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3743, 'last_played': 1620578764}
review:
This makes me sad, because the game itself is so much fun. Too bad that the rest of it is so inexcusably amateur and poorly planned/executed. 

There are many valid points being made below for and against this game, and a few of them are actually true.  The main problem with this title is that it is so difficult to log into the game. Whether you are a p2p or f2p player, you will not be able to play whenever you want, Period. Every session is a gamble. One day you can log on and the next day you can't.

All of this boils down to an amateur dev team and amateur leadership directing them. I just can't believe some people are actually paying subscriptions to this. I would never pay for a game that only lets me log in 3-4 times a week. 

I didn't even go into bugs and issues with the game itself yet, of which there are PLENTY. Mortal Online is literally, the first clear example of a game concept so good that it didn't matter if the execution missed every single develpment target. 

You will definitely enjoy this game if you like spending more than an hour trying to log in 5+ times EVERY SINGLE WEEK. Today is a US national holiday, so don't even think about trying to log in. It's 6PM and everyone trying to log-in after 10AM still can't get in. 

NOTE TO OTHER DEVELOPERS: THIS GAME CONCEPT IS A PLATINUM SELLER, BUT THIS COMPANY FUMBLED IT HORRIBLY. PLEASE PICK UP THIS BALL AND RUN WITH IT.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975382145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 172260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159111, 'last_played': 1558889050}
review:
THE 1 MINUTE REVIEW OF THE GAME:

Skyrim Online.  You can be a warrior, a thief, a mage, a do-gooder, or a murderous prick.  You can also be a crafter and make armor, weapons, potions, food, and tame animals and rideable mounts.  You can build houses, castles, entire towns and cities.  The game is first person only.  The combat is a hit based detection system, the melee has directional attacks and blocks that must be correctly timed.  

Now remove the NPC quests.  Also toss in some resurrection priests for when you die.  Now make the game online only, with one server for the entire community to play on.
   
That's pretty much it.  What to do?  Kill eachother!  Imagine running around in Skyrim trying to kill mobs for loot, then having another dude sneak up on you and murder you.  Just like in Skyrim, you would lose everything you had on you.  You're in a town, and a thief steals your money--same as in Skyrim, but now its another player doing it to you.  The entire drama and story of this game is player created, which means it doesn't end, and everything you do can have real consequences in the form of alliances, wars, etc.

It's made by a small developer, and therefore can be quite buggy at times (they still haven't fixed many spots where you can become stuck to the point only a GM can help you, and if you get killed in the meantime, tough luck), and slow to update.

So, although in some ways it's just a polished 8 year-old beta, in other ways its the best that a persistent full loot fantasy MMO offers.

Given it's contrasting excellence and face-palming problems, I rate it a:

7.5/10


THE LONGER REVIEW OF THE GAME:

Ok, so here's a much more detailed review.  I've played this game subscribed on and off for close to 2 years (since fall 2013).  I have multiple accounts, am in one of the larger guilds in the game, but busy life/work schedule keep me from playing much these days.  With that said, here's a non-rage, experienced review by someone who has tried just about every profession, and tried much of what can be done in this game.

This first person MMO is the closest thing to ultima online out there, and for being committed to that level of freedom, full loot, sandbox experience, in itself separates this game from everything else out there.  

Those same things that make this game great also make it difficult to learn, and often frustrating.  The learning curve is steep, and level of time required to become proficient and competitive (in the PvP sense) is high.  I honestly would say it takes a couple months just to really figure the game out.  But I appreciate a challenge, and the combat system is more skill based than most other MMO I've played, which I find far more exciting and rewarding when you win (especially when you nab a kill on someone with good gear or transporting gold--no farming needed today!).  There are very detailed crafting systems, in which discovery and experimentation is incredibly important.  For example, there are NO pre-set recipes for alchemy or food, you just start extracting and refining ingredients from foods (or crazy materials you would never imagine putting into a potion or food) and start mixing and mashing things together and see what happens.   The best weapons, armors, potions, etc, are all tested and figured out by the player community.  There are some things which people have kept secret and even I don't know how something is made / done after playing for years.  The creativity from the game community is impressive.  The politics in this game are also incredible (and sometimes hilarious) to witness, as there is no active PvE story or questline.  Instead, the conflict and story of this game is constantly created due to nothing other than the butting heads of the egos and personalities of the players--sometimes leading to an entire server war lasting weeks or months long.

My only advice -- group up, get in a guild, or play with a group of friends.  In my experience, this game is not for those who like to go solo.  You will become bored, usually get chased down by roaming bands of veterans looking for easy kills if wandering on your own, or just be outnumbered in most cases.  Even though it's a harsh game, being friendly and meeting others is how this game is best played.  I warn you though, with a full loot sandbox like this, there is a strong troll presence.

I would only recommend this game to those who are patient, mature (can handle murderous griefers trying to ruin your day) and want a challenge - this game will not hold your hand, and neither will I. If you enjoy a complex, full loot persistent world that can be incredibly rewarding.  Whether you want to rush into battles involving dozens (or even hundreds) of actual players trying to bash each others skulls, or discover new alchemy potions that no one else in the world knows, or set up as a merchant and crafter trying to obtain wealth, you get the complete freedom to choose how you want to play the game.  The game mostly revolves around fighting, which is fine by me, but those looking for a deep PvE experience should head elsewhere.  

Also, I would recommend subscribing to the game.  I think the only viable free to play characters would be foot warriors or foot mages, you will be gimped on mounts, and crafting is crap on free to play accounts due to the skill cap.

As for bugs, over my time in this game they seem to be improving, but you can still have the the occasional glitch that drops you through the world, only to kill your mount and lose your gear, or your mount will suddenly stop following you and run off into the game world.  Or you will be riding along and get stuck on a cactus and someone sees you and kills you, and you can't do anything but watch.  At least they have a very active admin system that can respawn you and your gear and mount for most instances where the game screw you.  Post-steam launch the admins almost always respond to me within 5 minutes or less, which is far better than other MMOs I've played.  Remember, this is an independently developed game comprising a small team.

So I think this game deserves high praise for everything it has done right, especially given the small team and the limited resources.  They also deserve praise for not selling out and becoming another boring, safe MMO for the sake of trying to bring in more revenue.  I would recommend Mortal Online to anyone who enjoyes a challenging and persistant world MMO.   But, if you just want to jump into some action, and the full loot system just causes you more stress than enjoyment, I would move on to something that provides more immediate action and entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012885246', 'num_games_owned': 13, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1441559445}
review: Graphics? Kinda suck... even running everything on max, details only show when your right up to something. Optimization needed. Gameplay? Not bad really. There is a lot I want to so badly love about this game. Here are my main complaints: everything is so spread out you spend hours just trying to get to the other of a town. The terrain and world itself is just plain boring. Combat is fresh and unique. The game mechanics are great, just crippled by everything else. The F2P is nerfed pretty badly and the community is largely against new players. Veterans will literally go to new zones and kill new players out of sheer boredom I would assume. Combine that with the full loot system means they will kill you, destroy what you've spent hours obtaining for no reason at all until they run out of newbs and finally move on. Just so another one can come in. And all that is yours to experience IF you can get logged on in the first place. For something thats been around since 2009 you think they would at least have figured out a stable launcher. Seems like is a lot to offer if you ever get there, but I doubt it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038102448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1441657062}
review:
Played this game about 6 hours, this game had a good potential.
The first problem is this game is not a real free2play but more like a mmo with subscription with a trial edition which end when you reach the 60 level skillcap (just like WoW with the max level 20 but easier in MO).
Second thing, the level design of the world is very cheap, buildings are like big cube even at max graphical settings.
Third thing, informations are hard to reach, for example, the servers were unaccessible yesterday night and there was nowhere to check their status.
Here come the worst part of the game, the griefers. Before I explain what happened, I have to say how the criminal system works, if someone attacks another player, he will be targeted as a criminal, if a guard is near the area, the guard will kill the criminal. Other players will be able to attack the criminal without being flaged as criminal. Of course some people will abuse of this system.
While I was killing some skeletons at the 'safest' capital to buy the last part of my armor set from the auction house (which were sold by players), a random player put himself between me and the skeleton (which was dealing a lot of damages). So to not be targeted as a criminal, I had to aim to nothing which was successful. Funny thing is, npc are not attacking with skillshot like players but simply deal damage when in range to its target. So while this griefer was standing between me and the skeleton, the skeleton was continuing to attack me. Of course as expected, I tried to kill fast enough the skeleton to don't have to deal with the griefer, but I touched the other player when he was beside the skeleton and the attack touched the player when I wasn't even seeing him. To be short, I was then killed by the player. Ironny here you come, when I checked the auction house after, my items which I bought from the same auction house were in store.

The main counter-argument is "yeah but it's a hardcore pvp mmo, blabla", problem is, the mechanics of the game encourage griefing, and bad manners. Just look at this post on the official forums which is tolerated: http://www.mortalonline.com/forums/threads/rpk-vs-noobs.123362/

Anyway, the game was launched in 2009 and some flash mmorpg back in 2004 had better graphics than this shit.

10/10 I will never touch this garbage again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960533135', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1622759490}
review:
Hey, it's finally on Steam

This is the worst and best game I've ever played. Best music, best atmosphere, best challenge, best immersion, best free to play trial. If you've got no job, a good imagination, and you want a game to get into hardcore while you neglect the rest of your life, this might be it. It's mysterious, some things can't be googled, some things you'll just have to learn for yourself. There are probably areas of the game that nobody has ever made it to.

First person is a pretty cool thing. I have memories of being stoned, and getting on to play, running around in the harsh world, my heart pumping because I know I'm in danger no matter where I am. The music is beautiful. The best way I can describe this game in a word, is "carnal". It's the only MMO where I've felt total freedom to play the character I want to play.

It's also complete crap. And it takes some imagination if you want to have objectives, because it doesn't quite have the shimmering path to follow like Neverwinter does, or queues to join for instant satisfaction like WoW.

It's my 10/10 and probably most peoples 1/10. You can min/max all you want, you're still gonna get shit on. You've been warned.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992784889', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1456089806}
review:
I would recommend this game to anyone who likes open world sandbox games, I play this having gotten bored of EVE and It is amazing the scope of the game is broad and you can essentially do whatever you like within a fantasy setting, the graphics have held up over the time and the gameplay is engaging.

I understand this game isnt for everyone and there are a few bad reviews but understand that this is a niche game and I have yet to come across a truer sandbox so bearing that in mind give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045738164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2668, 'last_played': 1444822900}
review:
I will start this review by first stating that I am a new player (since the steam release), and I must say....
I AM ABSOLUTELY LOVING IT!!!
This game is amazing in so many ways... It's basically SAO / Morrowind / Rust. It's the game I've always wanted.

Everyone who is being deterred by the negative reviews, please take some things into consideration before making your decision at face value.

1 - have a look at the hours played by most of the negative reviewers. This is a hardcore sandbox game, can you really have any right to post a negative review after only playing a few hours? They've probably seen 0.001% of the game...

2 - To the negative reviewers who have played it a bit more, please notice that they are complaining primarily about the freedom allowed to the "toxic" players. Let's think about that for a moment. They decided to play a open world sandbox mmo... and they want less freedom... Logic?

3 - You control your experience in this game, in true sandbox fashion.

Now, let's talk about number 3 for a moment. 

My MO experience has been a rollercoaster of emotions. From developing PTSD brought about by the presence of possibly murderous surrounding players, to being given a full kit of armour by a kindly knight, this game is always smacking me in the face with surprises. 

I once partied with a fellow in the crypts underneath the Tindrum graveyard, and spent the entire time wondering if he was going to turn around and stab me in the back. Lo and behold, he actually saved me numerous times, and protected my loot when I had a clumsy death. I felt like I made a real connection with this dude. In a sea of murderers and vagabonds, I found a buddy to help weather the storm. This wasn't some random idiot who I had been forced to party with for some dumb dungeon quest for some dumb storyline that I don't give a crap about, this was a mateship bonded in a need to survive, and forged with our skills as players. There are plenty of other great experiences I've had, and the good ones far outweigh the bad.


TLDR:
YOU CONTROL YOUR EXPERIENCE. This game is your opportunity to play the way you've always wanted. The best part is, the game doesn't just give it to you... You must earn your right to thrive, and damn, it's satisfying when you do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2587, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1441593300}
review: I played a little bit of Mortal Online and overall it seems decent. There are not nearly as many PvP MMOs around as there should be and I for one am happy to see this one. Overall from what I played in the tutorial the game is decent, even if the ui is pretty clunky. Once you get outside of the tutorial you will probably need to look for help from other players as this is full PvP chances are you are minutes, if not seconds away from being brutally murdered as a new player.  If the hardcore PvP MMO environment is something you are looking for, take a look here, you might just like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960942798', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 17055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14781, 'last_played': 1604862709}
review:
Mortal Online вышла в 2009 году и с тех пор постепенно дорабатывается и развивается. Могу ли я её рекомендовать всем? Конечно нет. Игра рассчитана прежде всего на старых поклонников Ultima Online, Darkfall и схожими по концепции хардкорных ММОРПГ, где присутствует полный лут (когда при смерти с игрока падает вся экипировка и вещи из рюкзака), где есть свободное ПвП, где есть большая социальная составляющая, которая подталкивает как отдельные формирования игроков, так и одиночек к взаимодействию друг с другом.

Уникальные отличия от остальных ММО еще заключаются и в том, что это пожалуй одна из немногих игр, где нет инстансов и зеркал, а мир игры располагается на одном шарде, без разделений на сервера. То есть все игроки находятся в едином мире и могут свободно взаимодействовать друг с другом без каких либо технических ограничений.

Сеттинг Mortal Online выдержан в мрачных тонах средневекового фентези, поэтому здесь вы не увидите радужных единорогов и красочных фей. Мир игры расположился на двух больших континентах - Nave, где преобладает умеренный климат и Sarduuca, которая представляет собой огромную и беспощадную пустыню. Путешествовать по миру вам предстоит как на своих двоих, так и с помощью приручаемых животных, которых сейчас большое разнообразие. Телепортов и мгновенного перемещения в игре нет. Так же как и нет карты, поэтому вам придётся ориентироваться в этом суровом мире исключительно с помощью компаса и ориентиров. Это добавляет в игру еще больше приключений и интересных воспоминаний о путешествиях по миру игры.

Запомните одно, в мире Mortal Online нет безопасных зон. Даже в городе, который патрулируют стражи, вас могут либо убить, либо просто обокрасть.
Боевая система в игре представляет собой честный нон-таргет с системой хит боксов. Закликать врага здесь не выйдет лишь потому, что в бою вам нужно постоянно поддерживать определенную дистанцию, зависящего от оружия, выбирать моменты для атаки и зоны поражения противника. Если вы будете слишком близко к цели, то вы можете ударить не лезвием меча, а рукоятью к примеру. Стрельба из лука так же требует определённых навыков и спамить одну кнопку, как в других ММОРПГ, здесь не выйдет.

Помимо ПвП, в игре есть множество других занятий, таких как интересный и проработанный крафт, строительство, приручение и разведение животных, торговля и множество различных профессий, таких как мясник, рудокоп, повар, алхимик, архитектор, вор... Кстати о воровстве, Mortal Online пожалуй единственная на сегодняшний день ММОРПГ, где реализована полноценная система воровства. Вы можете не просто вскрывать сундуки, которые разбросаны в различных местах по миру, но и в буквальном смысле воровать вещи у других игроков, прямо из рюкзаков.

Система развития персонажа напоминает аналогичную систему из Ultima Online, где навыки прокачиваются по мере их использования. В игре есть скилл кап, по достижению которого, вы больше не сможете ни чего изучить, поэтому следует продумать свой билд наперёд. Но даже если вы захотели что то изменить в билде, то достаточно отнять необходимое значение очков и распределить их повторно на своё усмотрение. Характеристики персонажа и скиллы можно запросто заминусить и перераспределить в любой момент.
На бесплатном аккаунте, скиллы ограничены в 60 очков, вместо 100 у платных и так же нет возможности выучить определенные навыки, такие как воровство. Помимо прочего у бесплатных аккаунтов есть ограничения на торговлю.

Подведём итог.
Плюсы:
1. Старый, добрый хардкор по которому думаю многие успели соскучиться.
2. Песочница, где разработчики стараются по минимуму вмешиваться в происходящее.
3. Интересный крафт.
4. Реалистичная система боя.
5. Строительство.
6. Множество различных занятий.
7. Неплохая графика.
8. Хорошие возможности для ролеплееров.
9. Нет инстансов, зеркал и других шардов.
10. Отличное погружение в игру, благодаря виду от первого лица.
11. Интересная система магии.

А теперь пожалуй о минусах:
1. Игра просто изобилует багами.
2. Высокий порог вхождения.
3. Слабая техническая поддержка игры.
4. Слабый левел и гейм дизайн.

Но даже не смотря на эти минусы, Mortal Online занял уже давно свою нишу и пережил не одну современную  MMO.
Игра сформировала вокруг себя преданных фанатов, которые активно поддерживают её на протяжении этих лет и верят в дальнейшее развитие этого уникального инди проекта.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980214908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1473539171}
review:
Intriguing concept.
Would be even more intriguing if the game was functional.
When it's possible to actually play the game advertised, [i]maybe[/i] I'll recommend.
For the time being, it's a waste of space on your HD/SSD.

P.S.  I've yet to speak to a single player who hasn't admitted that the game is absolutely polluted with griefers.  This isn't part of my consideration in not recommending it, but it's a warning to those who might not be interested in the hostile-Minecraft-server style of gameplay currently offered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101764107', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1441817337}
review:
Oyuna bir girebilsem daha detaylı inceleme yazacağım fakat nasip olmadı daha oyunu görmek.

Giriş yaptım karakter oluşturdum. "Finish"'e bastöım herhangi bir tepki vermedi. Bende ismi silip tekrar yazdım, bu seferde "Bu isim kullanılıyor" dedi. Acaba oluşturdumu diye ana bölüme döndüm hiçbirşey yok.

Daha sonra oyunu kapatıp açtım. Giriş yapıyorum bekletiyor bir süre. Sonrasında "Zaten oturum açık" diyor. Aktivasyon mailide gelmedi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000569478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 11705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5547, 'last_played': 1609701753}
review:
10/10 coming from a A-block beta tester that loved but hated the game with a passion.

Loved the concept of the game so much, I bought one of the early packs back in 08 if i remeber correctly. Played through all of the beta, played at launch like it was my religion, then it hit me. MO sucks-at the time. We have all been there, buy something the regret it down the road.

Skip ahead a few years like any other gamer....I still have the drive for this kind of game, only other outlet has been Eve Online, but since Incarna my hard on for that game has really took a dive for the floor. Back to Mortal Online, again ...<-----A mama mia thing, for those not so cultured. lol

Were was I? Oh ya...   Mortal Online after years of not playing, steam release!!!!!!!! What could go wrong, well shit login's. Wtf I just want to play! Let me in!...Alright calm down this could be good, PPL to maybe play with... wait...wait...wait. 

I got in!!!! Crash, wtf. Wait...Wait...Wait...

Skip ahead a few week, I dont give up. MY<--------perfect MMO might be ready for me?

Log in, works the first time, yup! lucK!!! suckers i am playing, relog on a alt? yup fuck u suckers again I am in!!!!!! 

Play like tommarow is never going to come, loving every second of grinding, trolling, being ganked, ganking, getting my Ipooped pushed in by some noob. Well how could this game get any better?
Lets knock it down a notch to keep my may years of a pipe dream in check---twitch? Ya that will do it, so many shit lords there crapping on games, what do I find? let me tell you....<----

Few channels,but! Awsome channels. Gamers who have never played the game, completly loving it. What else did i find, game devs there hanging out answering question with the same passion I remember almost 7 years ago when i first found the game. Too boot!! Henrick was in the chat channels talking with us, being one of the dudes. 

My dream game is finaly here, wish I could say I supported the game as long as it has been around, wish I could say I had faith in SV, wish I could say i was right. But I can tell you I have never been so extatic to be be proven so wrong. MO did it!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198077030562', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2899, 'last_played': 1473105343}
review:
Hardcore Full loot MMO. Pretty awesome.

If you liked Ultima Online this is the closest thing to it. If you're used to carebear MMOs that hold your hand through everything this is probably not for you. You will die...alot. You have to carve your own path in MO, unlike other mmos on the market. 

In depth crafting, open world pvp, taming, player housing, and the list goes on. A lot to offer but a bit tough to get started if you're not used to this type of game. I personally love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136614605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1441563831}
review: I would not recommend this game, as a new player you face a steep learning curve with no protection, you are completely at the mercy of those who have been playing this game for the past two year it's been out before it's steam release. game play is not rewarding enough to justify the months one would have to put in in order to stand on somewhat equal footing

author: {'steamid': '76561197982870901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 12412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4021, 'last_played': 1445646149}
review:
As one can see with a quick glance at its rating, definitively not for everyone.

As far as I am concerned... one of the greatest games i've played, if not the best MMO imo hands down. Exactly what I was looking for in this genre: difficult, gritty, slow paced and incredibly vast; all contributing to an almost realish quality of gameplay.

Supported by an active developmet team, I've enjoyed watching the developers as well as many seasoned players actively helping newbies in-game during what I like to refer to as the "steam-rush from hell."
I would like to send my apreciation to the immense amount of work this small development team has put into the |piece of art| that is Mortal Online.

Love it.

Will continue to play MO for time to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990665176', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1615658359}
review:
The game was fun in the beginning, you feel like you can do anything, by anything I mean something along the lines of sit in the new player zone where pigs are and command guards to attack the pigs while another is simply trying to do the tutorial or grind leather for crafting. When the guards come up and attack the pig while you're attacking you attack the guard by mistake, thus making you a criminal and the guards kill you. Not to mention the game is still extremely buggy, if you're game doesn't crash when you die, you'll wish it did, being stuck in eating animations, I mean the list can go on and on and on. FOR HEAVENS SAKE DO NOT GET A SUBSCRIPTION UNTIL YOU'VE PLAYED ENOUGH TO KNOW WHAT THIS GAME REALLY IS. until they update this what could be a incredible game, I will not be playing.

-drops mic

author: {'steamid': '76561198021663090', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2812, 'last_played': 1607088239}
review:
I've been playing mortal for quite a good few years, and i can honestly say there is no game like it out there.  Yes its a bit buggy here and there, but with a devolpment team of 5 people what can you expect?

I remember when i first started playing, and i convinced a friend to come try it with me. We were riding along a bridge, near bakti over the top of the jungle, and my friends donkey decided it didnt like him. I remember laughing hyserically as i watched his now flailing body fly over the rail of the bridge, off the cliff into the deep dark jungle.
Then began the quest to recover his body, we got him rezzed and got his donkey back, and ventured off.

I felt honest to god fear, navigating my way through the jungle in the depths of night, torch in hand and sword in other. and the excitment we got finding his bag. We picked it all up and celebrated...right before we were jumped on by a Terror Bird...Lost it all.

There is NO game out there you can expirence that sort of situatuion in. This game dosent hold your hand, and newer gamers dont like that. If your expecting quests, an easy leveling expirence, being told where to go and what to do...this game is not for you. If you want a hardcore sanbox expirence, with unlimited crafting, and so many options it isnt funny...And can look past a few bugs...this game is for you

author: {'steamid': '76561198025110148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 18506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3509, 'last_played': 1474270067}
review:
OK, First things First: Yes there is full frontal nudity, and it's fairly well done! I mean none of the player models are overly... cookie Cutter psudo-hot, and it's not overly sexualised it just exists... so yeah... Also I have seen more dicks than the female equivilent. It's not a bad thing but this does deserve a pat on the back.

Back to the review:

This game is Quite good, Take Minecraft, Morrowind and Mount and Blade and you'd get this.

The Graphics are dated, blocky and not... up to date. But the art style is good, I realy like the look of this world, which helps with the Exploration aspect.
Game does look a bit... Choppy from time to time, Lag exists and you will face some issues logging in and such...

As for gameplay, It's fun, Once you know what you're doing and have an idea of what you are doing, you will be fine! Granted Grinding resources isn't for everyone, I admit that but it is an... Interesting game to play, I'd like to learn more about this world, it's history, it's culture and so on!

In closing, Yes, this game is not that good, BUT it needs love, not just from normal people but also from the developers, If this game made them a decent amount of cash, and they invest it in this game, then we'd get a great game in future. I hope...

author: {'steamid': '76561198014279927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1145, 'last_played': 1442062678}
review:
This is a game that im unsure about, While it can  be fun selling shields/weapons that you make to other players and leveling a wide variety of skills, it also can be extremely annoying to play.

An example of this is my first Life (first death) so to speak. 

Keep in mind that when you die you lose everything so you MUST put your items into the bank.

So after some research into builds i decided to play as a mage as i thought it would be fun casting spells in first person.
So i comnplete the tutorial and purchase my books and go to the graveyard to make some money and get some experience playing as a mage.

So i am healing all of these different people fighting the undead and i also cast a few spells to hit the walkers, but then a player decides to run infront of my spell on purpose and due to that everyone is able to kill me without consequence and loot all my stuff (which is called blue blocking) which happens quite a lot in the graveyard.

I should also mention that mages need reagents to cast their spells and you get a few of them from the starter pack you get from the captain. So after i died i had no money, no reagents and all i could do was scavenge from the undead corpses. 

One thing that made the best experience of the game so far was that i joined a group of people traveling to a city (one of them was streaming the journey) and then i got mauled by a dog and then the dog mauled everyone else.

So yes it can be a lot of fun but it can be one of the most frustrating and annoying games that you might ever play, but with a game like this its all a part of the experience and it is free after all so i would reccomend getting a few of your friends to download it with you and start playing as a group. :D Because it can be one of the best games you will play and will be a memorable experience


Pros:

+Freeform sandbox gameplay - The game is what you make of it

+Wide variety of skills to train (Up to 60 for free to play players)

+Player driven Economy

+Ability to craft a unique weapon out of so many different materials

+Requires dedication to learning how to play the game

Cons:

-May be confusing for new players at first

-can be extremely frustrating due to griefers

-Alot of planning must go into your character builds to get the most out of your character (you only get one as a free to play)

Important Note - The game is an unlimited trial rather than a true free to play experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126908292', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 17215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4634, 'last_played': 1448780040}
review:
Just started this when it came to Steam (no idea it existed until then, despite searching for an MMO with this kind of combat system for a long time). It's good. It's damn good. It's a bit like Wurm Online (the game Notch made before Minecraft for those unaware) but has active combat and not a block/grid-based environment.

First person only can be a little bit of an issue for some people especially when it comes to trying to hit with the proper part of your weapon - if you have a hard time with this use swords and you will be fine, axes and spears can be more difficult to strike with their heads. If anyone's ever played Mount & Blade in first person before, you can expect about the same experience here.

However the Steam launch has been a little bit much for their server and during peak hours there have been several crashes and periods of downtime. Give the devs time to sort these out and come back to this gem. Be prepared to subscribe after a couple days trying it out though because the free to play restrictions are geared more toward being a demo than anything else. Nothing wrong with that in my books.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007994644', 'num_games_owned': 1414, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 6050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2722, 'last_played': 1638609478}
review:
This game is a sandbox game....that means you are put in a world and left to work out and discover your path. It is a harsh world and you need to learn fast to survive.... it is a full loot pvp game so expect to die a lot. Personally, I love it but can see why others may not. If you enjoy crafting, the system is deep and requires patience to craft well. If what I have said interests you, then try it out as you can pretty much play the "trial" for as long as you want. If you decide you like the game, then you can struggle along with the "trial" account but really if you want to get the most out of it a sub is required.

This game is the anti- themepark MMO...it can be a slow burner but when you get into the world it can be so addictive and rewarding. Of course, it is an indie MMO made by a small team, so expect bugs. I have spent many hours in this world...its not perfect but it is one of the few true sandbox mmo experiences out there.

This game brings all that I want, in regards to it being  full loot open world kill anyone anywhere you want!!!. Simply a master peice of a game, you think you have what it takes to survive in the world of Mortal Online? are you Hardcore enough?  if yes come come give it a try and I promise you wont regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112461691', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1443347939}
review:
Уважаемые разработчики, умоляю вас, сделайте ее на руском. Я конечно знаю английский, но тек так хорошо. Сама по себе игра очень реалистичная и довольно таки затягивающая. Она заставляет тебя двигаться вперед. Геймплей хороший, графика вполне приемлимая, реализм максимальный, звуковое сопровождение всегда в тему, хардкор ощущается всем телом.
Итог 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032584382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2162, 'last_played': 1448561263}
review:
[list]

author: {'steamid': '76561197972878981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 39887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5388, 'last_played': 1530533793}
review:
The main difference between people who didnt want to play this kind of game in the first place and those who did?
First one has 10.0 hours in game time and is still able to talk only about starting city graveyard or has 0,4 hours in game time and complains that the game is bad becouse there is apparently no way to press esc and check your keybindings. While the second one either spent max 2 hours at the graveyard or actually never saw it, as they left the starting city and are experiencing the real game right now.

Sadly its that first group of players who have filled the steam review page, with some salty ex-players. 

The world of Mortal Online is harsh and brutal, theres no denying that as you will die, and I mean alot. But why would anyone try to deny it? Its the beauty of the game. Alot of people exaggerate things in their reviews. Like "The whole community is toxic, they all hate you and kill people at the tutorial areas all the time", while reality is pretty much the opposite. Theres one, yes I mean ONE, guild in the entire community that openly kills only new players around the starting cities. Rest of this "toxic" community has teamed up together to protect the areas. Some people cant handle the crashing which is happening few times a day right now, and while I can see how it irritates, I dont see how it does any real damage. You dont need to sub to play the game, and with each crash they get more information about the cause which then makes it easier to fix it and further increase the amount of players they can let in, making the queue even shorter. 

I have played the game on and off since beta. I have lived through the most horrible bugs and the game breaking issues. Yet I have stayed. Why? There is simply no other game that make me feel like Mortal Online does. To expect the unexpected. Is that person in the horizon trying to kill you or not? Or are you planning to kill him but is he alone? Is the keep owner in this area friendly or not? Can you survive this transport or not? Will you survive this dungeon? You fell into a hole and find yourself in almost pitch black dungeon, how can you make it out alive? No matter what you do in this game, gather, pve, explore... theres always danger around. To tell you about the politics would require a whole article alone. Wth new blood its just going to get more interesting, as new blood is what the politics have needed for a while now.

Make a favor for youself and join a guild as soon as you get past the starting tutorial gates. Theres plenty of guilds advertising on the official forums, in game chat and in game boards, so you can surely find one to fit in. If you have a group of players who instead want to create a guild, then make a post to the forums that you are looking for temporary mentor/teacher. Theres also alot of people willing to guide new players in the official IRC channel and the (un)official teamspeak server.

In MO you learn by trial and error, and this is something many people do not seem to accept, they want everything handed to them. The beginning is only as hard as you make it, see some effort before you start and its wholly different experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996089634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 3872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1568395943}
review:
it's just as flawed as when I played it 5 years ago, except it managed to get even laggier and less responsive.

they've still not budged on their p2w model either, which basically means that if you play as a f2p member you are 40% weaker in every single way, in a game where you can be killed and lose your gear at any moment.

edit: I was going to check it out again to see how little has changed
but it took over a week for their account recovery system to give me my accounts name or my password, which is something that would have been considered unacceptable 20 years ago.
They have announced plans for a Mortal 2, and please for the love of all that is holy, avoid it as well.

edit:
I tried to see if problems had been fixed, but I was unable to even get onto the servers after downloading and reinstalling the game.
Make of that what you will

author: {'steamid': '76561198050381131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1441507367}
review:
This game isn't for everyone.  The world pvp with full loot may not appeal to everyone.  The MMO is gritty and it's a  lot harder to get into like many of the other MMOs available.  If you're looking for a MMO that doesn't hold you hand and you want a challenge, then this is the one to play.

Pros.

Decent graphics
Open World
Old school combat like Morrowind
No classes
Very Mature
Deep crafting system

Cons.

Confusing at startup
Very slow to get started
Slow combat at start
Slow gameplay at start
Kinda buggy
Lots of nude players running around acting childish
Lots of time required for training
Huge city but very little going on
Needs a lot of polish

author: {'steamid': '76561198035696041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1441496718}
review:
Alright. It says I played this game for 40 minutes, but it was actually closer to 10. Why? Because I spent the first 5 minutes making my character, and the next 20 or so minutes rebooting the client until I was able to -log in- to my character. Forum posts seemed to indicate that this has been going on for about 5 years, and the most recent thread I found also warned me of two things: there is no free-to-play model for this game, just an unlimited "free trial", and the game has suffered for years from an awful starting experience chasing new players away ("I don't know why they didn't fix that before launching to Steam", one player wrote. Uh oh.)

When I finally got in, I was presented with instructions to run 120m and talk to an NPC (standard stuff). My character's "sprint" speed, however, was scarcely faster than his "walk" speed, and I'd have to stop every 20 paces to let his stamina recover. I am given to understand that run speed and stamina both increase with use, like in an Elder Scrolls game. That's fine, but it started out a little extreme. Strike two against MO.

The NPC told me to kill pigs for leather, and the game taught me to equip and brandish my sword. Cool beans.

After [strike]slogging[/strike] running over to the pigs, I did a big ol' Elder Scrolls-style wind-up, swung... and missed, even though the pig was standing motionless in the center of my screen, with the reticle right on its back.

I decided to settle for chopping away, and after it took 6 hits (10 swings) to kill a pig, I was done. Strike three.

Here's the thing: I'm sure this game is -great-, if you can get past the oppressive introduction. However, if the game is going to -require- a monthly subscription for the full experience (and not even present a way for other players to sell me my subscription for in-game currency), I should not need to "bear with" the game to start enjoying the experience. In 40 short minutes, only a few of which were even proper game time, this title has managed to chase me away for good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011731420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 59851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3260, 'last_played': 1688955875}
review:
This game is one of a kind. Yes it is hardcore and many people don't like that, they are more into farmville and such but if you are ready for a challenge with actual reprocutions if you fail and fame, fortune, and power if you suceed.

I would describe this game as elderscrolls but more emersive and without quests, maybe a little rust and minecraft mixed in there as well. This game to me is the epitimy of emmersion as you cannot get out of first person view, there are no quests or hand holding. This goes down even to the dungeons which are awseome by the way, but no npc tells you where they are or what to do with what you find in them. For example there is a hidden cave up in the mountains if you fight your way down to the bottom of it there is a nice chest and loot but the boss also dropps a key to another dungeon and there are jewles that drop randomly that an npc across the map will trade for a book of unique armor that you can craft after you trade him.... that's right you unlock new crafting and armors and such for your guild by exploring to find hidden dungeons.

The pvp is amazing! there was a 200 man vs 200 man battle on the last server war and the game is set up so it can be way more especially with it's release on steam! The melee is very skill based as it is instant react directional parrying combined with stam managment and character combinations make everyone able to fight their way. Magic is planning to expand to 17 circles of different unique spells but right now it is still epic as if you miss a heal you may heal the enemy and if you miss lightning or fire you may hit a friend. Arrows are simular as it lands in friend or foe or dirt all depending on your accuracy! This isn't even including mounted which is a whole new itricate fighting system. Above all though there is that these battles matter, if you die you lose all your gear not banked and if your fighting to defend the castel you built and you die.... not good. But in the same note if some jerks start stuff (there is actual politics in this game) you can go and blow up everything they built and take all they own.

Now to how customizable your character is. you have 1100 points to spend and so you can end up having 12 different skills not inclusing secondary skills and there is no limit to how you customize them. Thief mage, full fighter with multiple weapons including a bow, mage beastmaster, the sky is the limit. This can be further customized by the amazing crafting system, wana be a quick fighter, have someone craft you a really light weapon out of a light metal and wood want to be a heavy fighter make heavy armor out of some secret metal with wolf fur for the backing. You can combine anything in any way you want, may not work but you can do it. In fact one of the most common bows is spider leg and rare wood combined to a sweet bow. you can have a maul on the tip of a lance if you so please!

To expand on what I was saying before your fighting actually matters. There is politics in this game, everyone uses teamspeak and you can go hop in the teamspeak of the guild next to you and talk over if your going to share the wolf spawn or fight over it! Sometimes the game makers hop in teamspeak and hang out and see how we think the game should be improved. People become well known, for good or bad. For instance there is a thief, greyfox known by all for how skilled he is at thieving, there is a politician lexorn known for his silky words and for starting a war with them, there is a crafter galgotha known for being the best and most knowledgable for all his crafting, and there are many fighters known for their unique skills, the list goes on. So not only are you fighting for whatever you have built or are wearing and worked hard to make you are fighting for legit honor that everyone acknoledges in game.

This game is so deep and there is so much to explore I could never explain it all so I will just cut myself off there but I will finish to say the community of the game is very connected. You cannot fight or hang out every day and be able to hop in the other guilds teamspeak and say good fight or whatever and not get connected. I hope you try it out and if you need help join a guild they will help you and teach you and usually gear you up as well, good luck on your travels!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046865724', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 61973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1555520770}
review: It's a game like no other, and it is hard to get in to it cause it is so unique. Because of this steep learning curve the game is misunderstood and has a lot of negative reviews from new players who dont see what the game offers. The thing I like about the game the most is that you can have any profession you want, from a hardcore adventurer to a simple merchant or a weapon smith. There is a place for everyone. Personally I like to find a quiet town near the sea and go fishing. Then at the end of the day I sell what I caught and cooked to other players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078702691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1486864389}
review:
A critical review by experienced player

WHY I WOULD RECOMMEND MORTAL ONLINE AND TO WHOM?

Simply, because it is the only MMO on the market that effectively delivers next features without making compromises: true sandbox, realtime FPV The Elder Scrolls style combat, non-instanced open-world, full-loot, complex crafting system, taming and pet owning, true player driven economy and finally a true free to place guild asset building like castles, own army of NPCs, walls etc. On the other side, Mortal Online has many downsides, it lacks a lot of polishing and more bugfixing, which I cower later in text. I would recommend this game exclusively to players who seek before mentioned features and are ready to master its mechanics with minimum of handholding. Its gameplay shall make much greater challenge than in any other MMO and accepting great chance of being killed by other players or mobs and losing some of the belongings in the process, but with much greater reward at the end when one masters the play. I note that to be competitive one must be ready to buy a subscription. 

WHY KEEP ON PLAYING MORTAL ONLINE?

Despite all the flaws and issues, all the sandbox features creates vast choice for overall fun gameplay. One can choose to participate in PvP where combat system is truly skillbased and fun most of the time. During group fights, teamwork and personal skill plays a keyrole, outweighting gear quality, unllike in other MMOs. On the other side, personally I enjoy being a crafter, since crafting system gives great variety of item types to be crafted and competing with other crafters in selling weapons to players is fun personal challenge. I could not find any other MMO that offers so many crafting and trading possibilities. Other activities like refining materials, alchemy, taming and trading the vast choice of items is fun to do since player can devise different strategies to get rich out of it. Finally, to explore huge open non-instanced seamless game open world brings its own kind of excitement and immersive experience unlike any MMO that I played, since there are no loading screens or artificial limitations. Game features various environment types like forests, planes, mountains, deserts, jungles etc. Across the world goodies are distributed in form of locked chests and free to loot urns/crates. 

GENERAL PLAYING EXPERIENCE

Player can choose to start playing through Tutorial which will make introduction to basic game mechanics like basic combat, taming creatures and crafting armor. When finished, player can choose a starting item kit for desired class archetype. Character does not have classes, instead player just levels skills where the total limitation is 1100 for primary skills which can be redistributed any time freely. For mid-game, Mortal Online has no quests, but the main goal is to advance your personal and character skills, make your own material wealth (gain best items, build a house etc.) and participate in community (in guild or solo).

Pickpocketing other players is possible, but there is a way to counter it easily. Game forces first person view, which creates strong sense of immersion. Player can try to attack anyone anywhere, but most of the NPC towns have NPC guards that can kill any criminal really fast, but a strong group of players can kill these guards. To regulate criminal activity, there is a flagging system. Outside of towns any player can attack any other player, especially if there are no guards to help. When a player dies, all the stuff that one currently carries is dropped on a ground, being lootable by anyone, friends, foes or by returning to own corps. Still, all the valuable stuff can be banked for free in NPC or Guild towns for 100% safe keeping.

Player can engage in PvP and PvE. Combat system is realtime where player has to aim a swing or an arrow to hit other player with realtime blocking also. This system is a true aim based realtime system without autotargeting, same as in The Elderscroolls serial. Practically, players personal skill really matters and often happens that unleveled skilled player can defeat fully leveled players that lacks PvP skills. Still, combat system is not without flaws where network lag can lead to undesired unfair outcomes, but overall the system works well. As for PvE, there are dozens of dungeons to explore which all are uninstanced. World AI still could get some improvement, so PvE is one of the worst aspects of Mortal Online. On the ground level, many challenging mobs exist, but dungeons are more rewarding and challenging.

Crafting and trading is one of Mortal's strongest points, where players can craft almost all the items in Mortal's world, all except skillbooks and mount equipment. On the other side, 90% of available viable weapons and armor are player made. Variety of possible versions of item type to craft is vast, but in practice a few are viable, a few but enough for a rich market. Besides direct player to player trade, all the items and resources can be sold through the trade broker NPC which serves as a stock market, only locally with buyout and buyorder sections. To get required resources for crafting players can mine and refine materials to get metals or other minerals. To get animal materials, there is a butchery skill (one of most boring trade in Mortal), to get potions there is alchemy and to get food there is cooking skill. To get pets and mounts, there is taming skill, but animals can also be bred at NPCs to get better offspring of already tamed animals.

Finally, building territory structure is one of most impressive features of Mortal. A single player can build their own various type of houses in predefined spots. But guilds can build other structures wherever they like. They can build many types of structures, like keeps, barracks, banks, market stands, mines, taverns, libraries... and walls to protect themselves. Overall, guilds can create their own fully functional town wherever the like in the world.


DOWNSIDES

Mortal Online features serious issue experienced from the start of playing. UI is overall a bit clunky and design is lagging behind modern MMO titles. Handling core game mechanics like extracting and crafting can be clunky and quite time consuming to work with, with some minor irritating bugs like items are not placed into slots, or item stacks won't split as expected. Game overall lacks ingame guidance, so the learning curve for new players is just too steep. Due to thievery feature and free to hit combat, starting experience can be just too harsh for new players, leading to many griefing attempts. Further, trade broker user interface features huge technical lag which adds to frustration (screen freezes when loading item entries). Pet and mob AI is not good enough to avoid really strange behaviour during PvE (mobs hit and shoot through walls. Even when traversing the world with pets carrying mined materials following, they could just disappear with valuables due to a bug. Crossing server areas on the world (nodelines), can lead to unfair situation during combats due to a lag or just a bug. Considering crafitng, overall mechanics are not designed to be fluent and lead to many time consuming actions e.g. to butcher a full stack of carcass it takes 45 seconds of just standing at the butcher table. Similar is for extracting rocks, refining etc. Weapon and Armor Crafting UI is also impractical. List of these small but frustrating issues goes on. At last, there is no mid-game and even end-game content that can drive a player to keep playing. There are no ingame challenges to beat, besides personal challenge of getting overall better ingame.

CONCLUSION

Unique and truly functional vast sandbox featuers of Mortal Online that are unique on market barely outweight the vast issues. For a player seeking a true open-world sandbox MMO, Mortal Online is more than good enough to enjoy. At least until a closely similar MMO title appears.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046218396', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3778, 'last_played': 1571128382}
review:
I've only just started playing the game with Steam release but i'm really enjoying it so far. Huge open world (plus a continent that hasn't been fully explored), fun combat, complex skill/crafting system, loot dropping on death which makes dying scary, thievery system, and awesome tameable creatures are my biggest likes about this game. I've also personally run into hardly any bugs at all, one of which has been fixed since I first started. One thing I'm not a fan of though is requiring books for some skills which require you to wait long periods of time. 

Overall I definitely recommend the game to fans of this genre. Although the game can seem kind of overwhelming at first with the small amount of info they give you when first starting out, if you give it some patience it becomes very fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961644230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1441444680}
review:
Wanted to get into this game because there are supposedly some elements that are really appealing to me.... However, I spent all my time in this game just trying to learn the very basics only to be killed over and over, and over, and over..... All of this in the first area you spawn as a new player. Many times I had no clue why guards were attacking and killing me. Then there is an obvious culture of existing players who do nothing but target the newest players in the only areas that are immediately available upon spawn.... Its also apparent that this is an intended and acceptable practice. Basic functions are tedious and strange at best and learning many of them will take a lot of time and patients. Just about the time you think your accomplishing something, someone kills you and they are allowed to take everything you have. 

 Having said all that, it is a free game so give it a try but i cant recommend this game to anybody in its current state. Since this game has been around for at least several years it hard to be optimistic that there will be any improvement in these areas. The current state of affairs in this game will just drive new players away.... unfortunate...

review:
In all honesty, the game is cool and all but it lacks too much to make it worth wild.

1: The combat is too clunky and unresponsive in my opinion for "skill" to really play in.

2: The game drops you in and says good luck. No explaination, no base skills, no help really at all.

3: Players are trolls, all be it its a sandbox, but people are dicks with no force protecting newcomers. 

4: In general it just doesn't feel right and I feel like it hasn't changed at all since I last played it (which was way back in 2010).


If you want a hardcore sandbox sim, go to Eve Online. 

10x better. More polished. New player friendly. 

I've played Eve on and off for 3 years. Probably will go back. Nothing like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098988434', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1441416601}
review:
Trailer is great. But guess what? It totally sidetracks you.

I thought this game would be stunning, of course. I saw the trailer, thought it was real neat (mostly). Description made it sound like a fantasy. Well, it is indeed a fantasy, and one that isn't a real thing. The reviews were absolutely correct. The game is bull, for the most part. For combat, the cursor is either too low or high, I can't even fking tell. Second, the graphics are horrible; my guy has stubby flat toe ends. Animations are messed up, give or take. Honestly, I'd rate this a 3/10. Sure, it's a game that's "okay". If it was to seem good, go ahead and go back to the past in maybe the 90's, maybe early 00's. But for July, 2015? No thank you, this game could've had a MUCH better system. AND they want people to have a subscription plan. Only good part about this? I'd say the trailer. I bet they put more effort into the trailer than anything, and tried to rush it for "quick money". Nuh-uh, this is a fail game. Steam, don't even allow them on your site and program and platform or anything.

review:
This game is not for everyone, if you love grinding & teaming with others just to survive whilst building your empire then this game is for you!

You will die repeatedly on your own and must travel in groups that are well equiped!

The game is hard to understand at first but once you make some gold, gear up & find friends you will really enjoy your time spent playing this game!


7.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197314738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1469092113}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998990419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1441393690}
review:
[b] Disclaimer:[/b]  This game been released for six years. After this time, you no longer get a free pass on bugs for being indie so quit with the excuses.

I’ve been along the ride from the start till about half a year ago, when I quit even playing casually because of the blatant GM corruption and forum censorship. So let’s get this going. On paper, the concept sounds amazing. Open world, free PvP, full loot, skill based progression. What is there not to like? The implementation of all those grand ideas, apparently. MO puts you into a car with a broken steering wheel, no dashboard, gear in reverse by default and then smirks at you saying "lol what, you can't figure it out?! I'm not holding your hand, how cool is that!".

It feels like the devs equal "annoying" and "time consuming" to "challenging", something that is seen throughout most of the game's mechanics. In their strive for realism they made the crafting system vast and imho unnecessarily complicated, but ended up with only a few dozen viable recipes out of thousands combinations. This approach of adding unnecessary complexity (or depth, as some may argue) in an attempt to simulate realism goes through the entire game and all its mechanics, making every task more difficult than it really needs to be. Not more challenging, mind you, as many players would argue, but simply more awkward and time consuming. Every UI interaction is awkward. Every other mechanic feels awkward. This is a small company and indie company, but again, after 6 years.. I expected more. 

This quote from another player sums up the problematic dev attitude that doesn't differentiate between challenging and annoying imho: "It's a VERY annoying start, and someone in /h suggested that I just go afk chopping wood to raise my attributes. I did just that and it helped."

Then there are GMs. Being on limited budget, devs recruited some players as volunteers to act as GMs in the game. Some of them were underage and most of them had ties to guilds. That went pretty much as expected – favoritism and corruptions ran rampant and any discussion about GMs’ actions such as choosing to restore a destroyed asset, or spawn assets, were censored from the forums. And that is in a PvP game. Devs showed little interest in addressing the situation, but instead, according to many, had a hand in it. According to some it got a bit better, but it already made many including me quit and I would still hold devs accountable that it even got that bad in the first place.

That being said, the concept itself is interesting. The open world and almost free building, aim based combat, rather complex skill trees. I really enjoyed the first months in the game until the novelty wore off, and my time with others. The combat is probably the only thing that is as complex as it should be, and is actually skill based (bugs aside). But the rest just feels so.. clumsy and unnecessarily complex, instead of actually challenging your skill as a player. The majority of the challenge in MO comes from how awkward everything is, rather than player skill.  

You will find fans defending the game as being too "hardcore" for critics, but it's not hardcore, it's simply badly designed, unbalanced and buggy. Dark Souls is hardcore. DayZ is hardcore. People love those, but for some reason not MO. 

Even after six years, the game is not ready for Steam release.. The launcher options did not apply to my game, I had to rescale from within game settings. I couldn’t even log in, after seeing queue ticking down to 0 it just vanished and I was left staring at the login screen once again. After two days of trying, I finally got in, only to realize the node lag is still an issue, after six years of development, and the server can’t even handle 1k players currently playing (according to steamcharts). It’s ridiculous.

The concept itself, again, sounds very promising. But its implementation falls short and I honestly can’t recommend it. It’s just awkward and annoying instead of challenging. But if you are desperate for a full loot PvP game and love the challenge of trying to navigate the UI – go ahead and give it a try. It’s free after all, although capped at a skill limit. You’ll make a nice cannon fodder for the players camping newbie areas.
developer_response:
Thank you for your review, we really do appreciate your honest and calmly argued feedback and critiques!

Opinions and tastes aside, I would just like to adress two important things:

- Our GMs are most assuredly not corrupt.
We have not had volunteer GMs in our game for the past two years, and it is very important to us that we do not get involved in player politics or play favorites.

- Our server is now much more stable and it is much easier to log in!
Seb has been working tirelessly to improve our server software and has solved the major issues we experienced due to all of the new Steam players coming into the game. We are constantly working on improving any and all aspects of Mortal Online, including making the server more stable and making the UI less "challenging"!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991160211', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 33605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 947, 'last_played': 1448595478}
review:
Enter noob wearing some leather as a robe and leggings, with a helmet which may or may not be metal and equipped with the METAL SHORTSWORD OF UNMANLYNESS and WORN SHEILD OF LIFE.

I was so overloaded with dead animals that my run speed was comparable to a fast ant. I needed to get to a vendor, who's entrance was over a hill, far along the wall to the city I had to circumvent. I was going to be rich.

Yet at the same time, I knew it would look suspicious to be seen moving at such a slow speed while running. Enter my adorable deer like pet I called NotaBear who I would stop and turn to whenever another person was in sight.

As I neared the arena I had to pass before closing in on the city gates, I knew encounters would become more frequent. By this time my daughter was cheering me on! 

I made it past the arena, only stopping to socialize with NotaBear 3 times, the end was in sight! And then it happened. 

Enter a man in silver robes covering his body. Blinding me and filling me with fear, he asked what I was doing. How much gold I had. What I was carrying. He told me the command to type that would drop all the loot in my bags, and he would let me live if I dumped my gear. 

I told him I only had meat. He told me to dump my gear. My daughter told me to dump my gear. I continue to back up with my shield out, hoping to stall for 20 minutes as I walk backwards to the city. You have no idea how slow going this is... 

I am losing all hope. He is telling me he going to kill me. The end is near. 

Behind him I see a man on a horse with the largest bow I have seen in the game. I yell out that I am being robbed. He stops. My robber turns and greets the man by name with humility and fear!!

My Savior asks what is transpiring, and I repeat that he is trying to steal all my meat. My Savior retorts with a funny meat joke and we all laugh. 

However my robber still attempts to get me to drop my gear. My crawling backpeddle to the gates looks more hopeful, as my Savior tells me to continue into the city and that this man will leave me alone. I offer my thanks. 

And then the robbers horse attacks me! Shield up I quickly learn to parry this magnificent creatures attacks. Life is dropping, at 60% life my Savior notices what is happening and runs to the rescue. 

The robber runs. The horse runs. The Savior gives chase. Moments later, my robber lays dead, and I am free to head into the city, proudly displaying the wounds I earned to keep my treasure!

Best 43 silver I ever made.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032214709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1441548391}
review:
Замечательная игра, очень понравился процесс создания персонажа, почти все видно, довольно необычная анимация при рождении перса. И вот чудо уже третий день захожу и играю!! Смог убить трех поросят!! поговорить с одним неписем. Наиграл аж 81 минуту. Весь процесс очень увлекает: запустил - увидел загрузчик - нажал плэй - запустил - увидел загрузчик - нажал плэй - ...ввел пароль- запустил- увидел загрузчик- нажал плэй-... ну и так далее. Очень вставляет, мозг работет на пределе, фантазии так и прут и распирают! Столько не реализованных возможностей! Как много еще можно сделать ( запуск и даже чистка кэша и конечно же перзагрузка компа.. это впечатляет и сподвигает стремится вперед).
Какое счастье что все это можно делать бесплатно!!!!!
Пожалуй я смогу еще неделю этим позаниматься после работы, вот только грушу боксерскую не помешало бы.
Оччень напоминает Седьмого Волка.. Всех благ разработчикам!!!!
