author: {'steamid': '76561197996152888', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1441174393}
review:
Let me begin by saying that I've followed Mortal Online since its conception and that I have always been madly in love with the potential/concept of what the game could have been. 

Meager Proof: http://i.imgur.com/SyuxQpd.png 

Key Overview of Mortal Online:

- Firstly, Mortal Online was released OVER FIVE YEARS ago. So anyone trying to call out a negative review based off of the playtime shown on Steam is completely misguided.

-The fact that it was created five years ago also stands as a testimony to how horribly, horribly directed the game has been this entire time. 

- It began under the development of a small group of Swedish guys who created their little independent company Star Vault, and because I have not been following it that closely, I'm not entirely sure how much they've grown since then. I'm relatively positive that the dev team is still quite diminutive especially given the scope of the game and its current state. Again, that is speculation. 

This game was a project loaded with potential, but got corrupted by a small, dedicated playerbase who refused to acknowledge the actual problems with the game and kept feeding the egos of blind, prideful developers. Five years into this virulent cycle, the independent company gets to release their game on Steam to a wave of people who are unfamiliar with the long standing unhealthy cycle that has been going on for ages.

So, in good conscience, I cannot recommend this game. They need to learn a lesson. This type of independent company behavior is not okay and should not be encouraged.

------THIS IS THE END OF THE CORE OVERVIEW STOP HERE BEFORE TL;DR REVIEW BELOW------

I'm going to do a LOOSE FORM of a pros and cons list to come off as unbiased as I can towards this game, because, as mentioned above, I really did have the highest of hopes for it fulfilling my wildest MMO fantasies. It, unfortunately, clearly has no intentions of ever rising up to meet its potential or making the required changes to fulfill said fantasies.

That being said, expect a more descriptive list of cons as this is still a NEGATIVE review.

This WILL NOT be comprehensive at the time of writing, because I simply don't have the time and I could go on endlessly about the good ideas and the horrible implementations that this game suffers from.

Pros:

- The world's big, fascinating, and a mystery for every new player to discover with minimal guidance. 

- The game's mechanics are hardcore and there is no hand-holding going on here. It's really an amazing design philosophy that I love to embrace.

- The idea of a true open sandbox where you can literally be whatever you want to be is there. Trader by day, highwayman by night. Valiant defender of justice, or rapscallion rogue pickpocketing in the streets. You decide.

- The concept of real time combat with responsive and individual body-part hitboxes in an MMO is astounding.

Cons:

- Several of the systems, the mechanics, are still as severely flawed as they were five years ago at release. For instance, the flagging system. (Which indicates whether you've been a good or naughty person in the game world recently. Blue flag means innocent, grey flag means you've done something bad and you're free game, red flag means you're murderous scum and can be killed on sight) It was never refined to a logical point and I'll give the roughest example for people who haven't played the game yet. Let's say I'm killing some NPC creatures and I'm flagged blue. A person can, literally, run like a madman in between the monster and me so that I accidentally hit them. When I accidentally hit them, the game flags me grey and I become free game for that person and anyone else around to attack me since I'm now considered a criminal. I don't know the timer on it, which brings me to my next point.

- There is no consistent, well documented data for... Anything really. Monsters, towns, maps, items, basic functionality. In game, it's almost nonexistent except for some vague descriptions here and some weak tutorials that are pretty much only presented within the first thirty minutes of the game. The playerbase is so small and tight-knit that you can't even find reliable, recent online documentation for things. The TWO Wiki resources have blank pages or pages that haven't been updated in years. This ties into the next point. 

- The game's mechanics are hardcore and there is no hand-holding going on here. While it's a really amazing design philosophy, it's not an excuse to justify lazy, badly executed design. That seems to be a go-to argument for the game's supporters. What they fail to realize is that peoples' qualms lie less so in the game being "hardcore" and moreso in it feeling unpolished or just... lazy. An example in my next point.

- This is supposed to be an established fantasy world with a lore and history, but... You don't even have access to ANY in-game map? You're telling me that the inhabitants of this massive world, these people who built countless intricate cities... Never drew up maps? I'm not even asking for a marker on the map of where I'm at. I'm asking for just a simple map alone for reference. Even a map that fills in as you explore it would make more sense than this. The lack of systems, the lack of designs for these systems. It's blatant and people who defend it using the, "You just can't handle how hardcore the game is" allow the developers to get away with bad design choices.

- The idea of "Free To Play" is extremely misguiding here. All the skills in the game have a cap of 100. If you're a FTP player, however, you can only level up any skill to 60. Explaining this in the simplest of math, it makes you effectively 40% less efficient than any subscriber and bars you off from doing a great many things in the game or reaching high level content. That should be absolutely all I need to say about this. 

- 14 dollars for a month's subscription? That's ludicrous. World of Warcraft/Blizzard earned the right to charge people 15 bucks a month. Absolutely ludicrous, especially when Star Vault's idea of "Free To Play" really means "Unlimited Trial period".

- The bugs and glitches this far along... Are unforgivable. Items jumping back from your bank to your inventory when you log off. Items disappearing from the bank altogether. Cumbersome rubberbanding when fighting NPC monsters. The list goes on infinitely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118355753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1601972995}
review:
Mortal Online это полный хардкор, тебя могут убить везде(даже в охраняемых NPC городах) и забрать все. Все, что ты мог зарабатывать целый месяц, а вещи тут зарабатываются довольно не легко. Здесь можно построить дом, но он вас не спасет, неважно какой он огромный, его снесут. А теперь поговорим о прокачке, уровней нет, характеристики качаются в результате ваших действий(упали с высоты и выжили? поздравляю, вы прокачали атлетику и так далее), навыки же прокачиваются когда вы их используете. Классы в игре присутствуют, но вы вольны их мешать как душе угодно. Кстати если вы уведите за территорией города бомжа в обносках, то не стоит кидаться на него, он может оказаться сильнее вас.(даже если вы в железе и с мощным оружием...) Чтобы восстановить здоровье, нужно поесть, а потом поспать. В этой игре все(ну или почти все) логично и последовательно, поэтому не стоит плавать в железе, вы просто умрете и потеряете вещи... (проверенно на горьком опыте). После смерти проснувшись в серых тонах, не стоит пугаться, вы стали духом, что бы воскреснуть найдите священника к нему ведет белый луч( их кстати несколько и некоторые ведут на пустыри или еще куда, пока не знаю почему). Всегда держите свою жадность в узде, иначе вас загонят в ловушку(люди тут умные и хитрые). Сейчас я поиграл всего ничего, но горького опыта уже хватает, хотя и положительного тоже много. Еще можно добавить, что одному лучше не играть, не выживете(98%), стоит поискать компаньонов и желательно побольше, здесь нужно брать числом. Гильдии тут так же присутствуют(в ММО без них никуда) и развернутся им тоже места хватает(даже при том что сервер один на весь мир, вроде), тут можно построить огромный замок, неприступную крепость или город для своей гильдии, а затем пойти на какого нибудь мега монстра, но его еще нужно будет найти, да и убив его он больше не появится(не знаю именно с именными монстрами так или со всеми кто ближе к классу босс), ах да, с монстров или животных не упадут золото или оружие(все продуманно) только мясо кости и так по мелочи ингредиентов. Самое главное забыл, квесты, вас не будут поровозить по бесконечной линейки квестов, так покажут основы в начали и на этом все, вам придется самим что то искать. Можно было бы бесконечно описывать эту игру(потому что здесь очень много всего), но стоит остановится, иначе будет не так интересно открывать что тоновое, так ведь?
P.S. Это мой первый обзор, так что не судите строго)

author: {'steamid': '76561198057459801', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1524226928}
review:
I spent many long hours playing this game and I gone through terrible bugs and even terrible gameplay, but Mortal is still amazing to me and offends more than you can imagine. 

The PvP in this game is like none others, It offers skill and understanding of what you're using to complete your object. The PvP takes time to be astounding at and able to fent on your own.  The social interaction and population is fun at times, but at other times, the community can be toxic and annoying. The PvE in this game has wide-variety to different animals, or creatures, but lacks fundamental ideas of challenging an experienced opponent. PvE can take time to get use and understand it completely, but once you master PvE it can be a walk in the park.

This game will not hold your hand and spoon feed you gameplay. This game will make you get on your knees and pick the wolf brush you so badly need.

If I had to give you honestly decision whether to play this game, or not. I would recommend to try this game until you completely understand the game mechanics and gain somewhat of foot holding in Mortal Online. Trust me, There is no chance of you just hopping right into the game and being amazing at Mortal Online. This game takes time to understand and I barely gave much information on what to experience when playing Mortal Online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024744203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 58139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1643247225}
review:
One of the greatest, most unique and most bug filled mmos you'll ever play. 

If you don't look at any guides you could get lost in one of the crafting systems for months and months. There's detail and depth everywhere no matter how you choose to live. Besides crafting(armor/weapon), gathering, hunting, butchering, alchemy, cooking, fishing, mining, woodcutting, extraction, refining.... There are also players that deal in politics, transportation, gambling, or trading guilds and vast empires. You will build up from nothing and possibly be beaten back down to poverty at times. It's a rule of life in Mortal, death can be around every corner and if you die, you will drop everything. 

The most beautiful part is that it's almost entirely player driven. Any guide, map, or help you get will be from other players who were there first and put in the time to learn these crazy systems. The devs/GMs do very little except to give you some sand and a box. What you can do with it is awesome.

It is a niche game and not everyone will love it but if you enjoy this type of mmo then you'll see how amazing it truely is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137818055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 41956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1622844971}
review:
I have played this game for about a month now and while I like the game I really cannot recommend the game at the state it is in right now.

 I was able to actually play the game before the steam release and enjoyed the game. It has alot to offer and is different than most of the othere mmo's that i have played. I feel that the developers rushed the game and it was not ready for steam.  They have only one server and if they have problems with it then no one plays. Right now it is overloaded and they cannot handle all the new players and I feel that they will in the long run ruin this game. I hope that I am wrong and that they can turn this around.

 I stupidly subscribed a day before I found out that it was released on steam still thinking it was going to still be a while. I now find myself at a login screen that puts me in a queue and when it finally attempts to connect it say lost connection leaving me attempting to connect again. 

I do know  I am in this for a month(since i paid a month, thank goodness only a month) and if things do not drastically change in that month then starvault can be assured that I will not be paying to play a game that I cannot login.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081730391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 24966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3544, 'last_played': 1496500898}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996244206', 'num_games_owned': 4445, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1441332289}
review:
Game has a fun concept, a sandbox, open world, full PVP, hardcore, full loot on death MMORPG. However it is no fun and does not work.

Servers crash often, game crashes often and its been out many years, no excuse for this. Game feels like something out of 2000-2002. Not optimized, clunky controls, clunky menus, horrible tutorial and so on.

The game is also not free. It is only a trial where they limit your progress unless you pay money, so people playing "free" will never be able to do well againt paying players.

I cannot recommend this game at all. Many newer and better sandbox MMORPGs are coming out now and in beta and so on, they deserve your money and time more than this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989878030', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1441392012}
review:
EDIT: After playing for a longer period of time, I can no longer reccomend this game.
The monetisation on this game is far too steep, and the game becomes essentially unplayable without subscribing, AND buying an additional character slot.

You do NOT get an additional slot when you subscribe.
You have to pay more to do so.

To play the game effectively, virtually every class requires resources in the form of reagents and materials, usually metals.

There is a cap on your OVERALL skill distribution, so you can be a good miner, or a good fighter, but NOT BOTH. This means that, to play effectively, you need a seperate character to gather resources, then a seperate character to use those resources.

Effectively, this is a demo, because it's 100% impossible to engage in PvP properly in this game without having those additional sources of resources.

Additionally, to play a mage, you need a constant source of metals, so mages spells just WILL NOT CAST without a consistent source of metals.

All this wouldn't be so bad if they charged a reasonable price for things like slots and sub time, but it's 15EUR for a single month!

Long story short, the game is not only inferior and more grindy than most MMOs, but also considerably more expensive to play.

Don't waste your time, it took hours for the veil to be lifted and for it to be made clear the time and money you need to invest in this game to function.



(OLD REVIEW)
This game does not have a learning curve.
This game does not have a learning cliff.
This game has a learning mobius strip.

It will punish, and tease, and grind you to the bone, but if you invest the time and effort to explore and learn, even for a small period, you'll find a game with depth beyond depth. Think Skyrim meets Dwarf Fortress.

Sadly, this has hurt it's review score, but I honestly think that the learning curve is the only real reason for negative reviews, as on the whole this game has great production values and quite frankly, an awesome development team. Having worked with Unreal Engine, I have some inkling of the effort they've gone to to make this work.

If you think you've got the patience and control, I beg you to give this a go. It's as close to Sword Art Online as we're ever going to get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031154708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1441441933}
review:
This game was great. I played a while ago and am very happy to see it on steam. Although some of the negative reviews are true it does not change that the game is still at least worth you trying it out. I'll give you the TLDR: First.

Pros:
   Nearly infinite freedom
   Can play however you want to play
   Lots of nice players willing to help new players
   The trailer doesn't portray anything that the game is not
   Extremely complex pvp system
   Payment is optional

Cons:
   Extremely complex pvp system
   Not a jump in and run style game
   Everything takes lots of time to do and train
   High system spec requirements
   Payment allows user to train skills from 60 to 100 (only viable f2p build is hybrid)
   You find yourself very lost as soon as you leave the city

To play the game to its fullest you must have a good computer and a subscription. Being solo is very difficult unless you have an extensive knowlege of the combat system and great timing. That being said with a small group or a lot of training this game can be among the best you have played since (for many of you) UO. Same skill type system, you can do everything yourself. Nearly everything is player made. Trial and error will be your friend when crafting.

I never take the time to write reviews, but I feel like this game was unjustly charged a "mixed" rating. If you like the feel of the elder scrolls and the openness of a sandbox game. Give this a shot (computer allowing). Most issues players report for negative reviews are because they play on toasters that cannot support anything beyond the dated requirements World of Warcraft still supports. To those people (I appologize in advance) WoW is not a standard for MMO's anymore, it is time for an upgrade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125146792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1062, 'last_played': 1588570025}
review:
First off its been a bit since i last played and this time around im having the same feelings as i did when the game launched"A New Hope" a while back i pre-ordered the game played alot in the beginning befor my computer had optimization issues with Mortal online and other games now this time around my computer can handle Mortal online alot better then befor.

Now lets get into the game play its a real time action based combat system MMO in third person view it's Ultima Onlines Successor It has pretty decent graphics depending on what setting your playing on even on the lowest setting it still is pretty decent.The characters/ environment and mounts buildings and terrain all look amazing for being 4-5 years old.

Combat System 10/10*
-----------------
Real time action based
*WARNING* There is no carebear mechanics in combat meaning noones there to hold your hand.

The combat system is "REALISTIC" you actually have to "AIM" and "CHARGE" your attacks the longer your attacks are charged the more damage youll deal or lets say your a archer you have your bow and arrows and you see a enemy you actually have to aim your target cursor to where your enemy is and charge it depending on how far or how much damage you want to deal.
-----------------


Crafting  9/10*
---------
Similar to Ultima onlines crafting

The crafting is pretty cool sorta similar to Ultima online you have a forge and crafting tables theres various ores or marterials to be collected to be crafted into something unusual and unique.I havnt tested the crafting out fully so i cant really say much else.

----------

PVE
---------
Various Npc's to be farmed and harvested for materials or for trade to other players wish there were dragons though been wanting to see them in game for quit some time.

---------

PVP
---------
In my honest opinion one of the best PVP mechanics ive seen in a while it takes skill and tactical plans to defeat someone not for hand holding.

Overall i rate Mortal online 10/10 for for its diverse unique third person MMO combat/skilling/crafting/pve/and pvp

author: {'steamid': '76561197988531761', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 141525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2362, 'last_played': 1567626319}
review:
There is nothing like it out there. It has its problems, but its the only mmo i've been able to stay with.
The PvP is really great for an MMO, it really gets your heart racing the first times you fight. There's also a pretty high skill cap which means it takes a while to get really good at it. The crafting is fun, and there is really alot to experiment with.
If you do try this game out be prepared to get lost alot, and being confused, the learning curve is really steep. 
GL HF to those who try it out, try not to rage too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081106451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1441320227}
review: Have been waiting a while now to play this. The load screen seems to crash a bit, but patience is a virtue. The character selection screen comes up and you can choose your character, what they look like, their heritage, and finally put points into a character sheet style player board. So, the game starts up and I notice I can move about clunkily, with just w,a,s, and d. This is not anything other then whatever position you are in you remain facing this way until you gain a few levels to level your movement points. Oh, but wait it appears like a friendly player in a shield to help me.... cannot wait till they reach me. Um.... they seem to be fast approaching, and I think they might be brandishing a shank or dagge....... OH MY GAWD, I just got stabbed to death by a naked mugger-lady from the ditches and underbrush. What the hell just happened??? All this wait and jesus I got stabbed and didnt do a thing, well I will track that jerkface down and repay the.... OH MY GAWD it is resetting.... hmmmm closed for maintenance come back in 20 minutes. Well, I think I got that account information for Hello Kitty Island Adventure kicking around somewhere. Maybe not a bad game, just not the game for right now, hoping the dev is aware of this craziness. Good lord.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006786901', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 46748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1294, 'last_played': 1607125660}
review: Потрясающая игра. Лучшая ММОРПГ. Это Морровинд+Обливион+Скайрим в одном флаконе! Это хардкор и море адреналина! В какой еще ММО можно потерять весь свой лут (включая броню,деньги и оружие) после смерти? Здесь бои скайримоподобные, такая же и прокачка. Открытый и жесткий мир, без глупых загружаемых локаций. Островами спокойствия могут быть лишь города, которые охраняются НПСишными солдатами, но это не убережет игрока от попыток обворовать его и прирезать в темной подворотни. Это не слюняво-добрая, розовая ММО о пандах и кореских спасителей мира, это хардкор в прямом понимании этого слова. Игрок брошен в жестоком мире на "съедение" более опытными жуликами и хулиганами. Морталонлайн это поистине вызов. Выбор профессий безграничен, выбор путей развития не счесть. Здесь можно ВСЕ!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076833208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1291, 'last_played': 1442495846}
review:
Жесткость по отношению к игроку (отвечать приходиться за любую ошибку, расслабленно играть нельзя, накажут быстро...) и свобода - главные черты, которые меня привлекают в МО. В другие ММОРПГ (фэнтезийной направленности) после МО не могу играть :). Все они кажутся несерьезными, с искусственными "игрушечными" целями и поощрениями. Попытка поиграть в них после МО это - как будто после "взрослой" жизни снова предлагают заняться "делами" в "детском саду". Можно, конечно, для развлечения..., но скучно. 
Эти слова об игре я написал ещё в 2011 году http://forums.goha.ru/showthread.php?t=639570 и они для меня по-прежнему актуальны.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067036070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 114255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1679782988}
review:
This game can only be explained by using the comparison to a child who does not apply himself in school. This game has vast amounts of potential but just like the student, they are going nowhere. Mortal Online has to be one of the most nostalgic games I have ever encountered and it has tons of pros but not enough to outweigh the crippling numbers of cons. I wish this game would succeed but sadly I do not think it will

Pros: 
-Innovative crafting
-Taming/breeding
-Large open world
-in depth combat system
-mounted fighting
Cons:
-Shitty server stability
-extremely toxic community
-huge discrepency between vets and noobs
-buggy
-etc

author: {'steamid': '76561198204356241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1441324967}
review:
Not worth playing as F2P, you will not be pvp viable. Quickly becoming nothing more than a target for others to slaughter and no way to really fight back. Thus, making it very difficult to  learn all of the aspects of the game.

Not worth the Sub. At least not until the Dev's work out the server issues from the influx of new players due to steam release. In the short time that I have tried this game, I have spent more time trying to log in, than I have been able to play. There is no way I will pay for that.

Otherwise, it looks to be a great game. A game that would take an unGodly amount of time to learn, and advance a character through. Huge skill tree with innumerable options.

I could see countless hours being spent in this game creating characters, deleting characters, trying new approaches each time.
However, In my humble opinion. I cant recommend this game without doing it with Sub. I cannot recommend a sub, until they have a better log in rate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083188383', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 344540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2479, 'last_played': 1633641122}
review: Mortal Online, el juego que lo tiene todo. Que quieres ser? que quieres hacer? en que quieres ganarte la vida? Haz lo que quieras como quieras !. No hay niveles, cuanto mas usas la espada mejor usas la espada, cuanto mas corras mas corres, cuanto mas cortes carne mas carnicero te haras, cuanto mas pesques mas pescador seras, eres libre para todo, haz el personaje que quieras, lucha con los españoles en las guerras y politica del juego , comercia humildemente y hazte rico , vivie al dia de lo que robas a los que matas por el mundo, se un ladron y roba los objetos y oro de los bolsilllos de la gente y huye saltando por los edificios para irte con el botin, se un carnicero y pon un anuncio para qu ete cazen carne y vender los huesos, cuernos o pieles que puedas sacar, se cazador para ganar dinero vendiendo las piezas a los carniceros, se pescador y consigue peces muy valiosos para cocineros , se cocinero y abastece a ciudades de alimentos especiales para recuperar vida estamina o mana, se armero o creador de armas para venderlas a los guerreros, se miinero y saca metales y m,ateriales preciosos para vender a armeros y weaponcrafters para que hagan armas. Se Guerrero perteneciente a una milicia para defender de asesinos una ciudad , se ingeniero y construye casaas murallas y muchos edificios, se alquimista y crea pociones que tienes que descubrir para que las compren los guerreros, se tamer  o dominador para  coger  y domesticar animales que van desde un conejito o un ciervo hasta un Minotauro o una araña gigante , lobos , osos, pumas , cocodriloss, bisontes ... de todo, viaja por el enorme mundo de myrland y cruza desierto montañas nevadas, bosques , estepas con sus climas, crea un clan y construye una ciudad para vosotros desde cero a tu manera, donde quieras y como quieras con todos los sservicios que puedas encontrar en una ciudad npc. Se me escapan mil millones de cosas porque este juego tiene todo . Sin duda es el mejor juego mmorpg . Somos una gran comunidad de hispanos en MOrtal que algunos llevamos mucho tiempo haciendo guerras por aqui, estamos encantados de que vengais y no os preocupeis por el ingles pues aqui estamos para ayudaros. Contactad conmigo y os pasamos el team speak!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000959677', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5753, 'last_played': 1473318536}
review:
Final review after 50 hours.

in this review ill talk about the different aspects of the game and the positives and negatives of these aspects. Keep in mind that as a F2P player this is my experience. I cant discuss every aspect but here are some that really got to me and made my impression of the game.

PvP: lets start with PvP since its at the core of the game. If you dont like PvP, dont even bother. you cant avoid it.

+ you can kill anyone and anyone can kill you. Its exciting to murder someone and take all their stuff and then hide so other players dont kill you. There is a criminal system in the game. if you hit somebody you are flagged as a criminal and the guards will kill you. The players are encouraged to kill the criminals for their loot as looting an innocent makes you a criminal. Killing criminals is fun.

i havent experience group fights so i dont know how that works.

- as a F2P player, its GG. P2P murderers come around kill you instantly and there is nothing you can do about it. As a F2P, your skills are capped at 60/100 which is incredibly weak.

- The game claims the combat is skill based. Its not true AT ALL. The game lags so much people hit you from 10 meters away with their back turned. Timing your blocks is almost impossible as the lag makes it so you always block too late.

- Exploitable. Everyone is "blueblocking" which is to run in front of somebody as he is swinging his weapon to be hit by accident, turning the victim into a criminal. the blueblocker can now freely kill the victim and take all his stuff. This is a really easy way to get gear early on. i found that almost everyone is doing it.

- The rich players are some of the most rotten people ive ever met in-game, especially subscribers that you find in the beginner areas. These hypocrites will gladly defend victims of blueblocking yet the same people turn around and kill you for no reason. Avoid the geared players like the plague. Leave the beginner town as soon as you can. These asshole ruin all the fun.

PvE: the pvp is bad, surely the PvE is better right?... right?

+ You can train your skills by killing pigs.

- The PvE is so bad. So so bad. Monsters will hit you from 10 meters away, follow you to the other side of the map and will even swim through a river to get you. You cannot evade attacks. Monsters will always hit you no matter what you do. All you can do is attack and block the best you can. Boring and difficult. No skill involved.

Open World:

+ This game has an epic open world. No loading screen, nothing. While dated, the graphics look really good and you can spend alot of time just admiring the landscape and the environment. Creatures are scattered around the world for you to discover. The world is also filled with player made cities which is really cool since it makes the world feel alive. I didnt get to explore the new desert continent, but ive heard its cool too.

- i cant really think of anything bad about the game world really other that it has no map. it has that old feel to it like those weird games where you never knew where you were going because you were too young to understand how a compass works. Im kind of mixed on this one.

Crafting:

+ its really cool. I love that everything is player made. The beginner gear can be bought at the merchant but its kind of crap anyways. For those who like the hardcore experience, the crafting system is very complicated. just to make an armor, you need a few materials and its not clear how to obtain them.

+ while getting the materials you need to craft good gear is really hard judging by the amount of campers and killers around, it really gives you a goal, something to do in the game. You want to go get your epic armor and brag about it. maybe kill a few people you know.

- Good luck getting the good materials on your own. you have to find the materials which are not close to town and come back with it hoping you dont get killed.

General experience: 

This game has a great potential. Its actually fun when you meet a bunch of people and go on an adventure. I went with a group to a different town and some guy gave all of us some really cool armor. We rode horses and overall was really fun. But these experiences are limited. you wont always find friends to do stuff. And the items you get, youll lose them to a pker or a random dude will jump in front of your sword.

While the idea and the mechanics are really cool, this game is one of the most unpolished mmos ive ever played. The UI is awkward and buggy. The server disconnects you often and you die. People often walk through walls or walk on water. you can hit people offscreen due to lag or weird animations.

I know this is a really small dev team, but this is no excuse for having a game so buggy and unpolished as this.

Final verdict: TL;DR dont subscribe.

i like this game. it really has alot of potential. I tried my best to have fun and do stuff, but its really had and the F2P limitations and overall gameplay and quality this game offers is bad. Even if i were a subscribed player, the game is a mess and there is nothing to do other than kill F2P noobs.

Overall this game feels like its in Beta. It was released 5 years ago and the state the game is does not warrant a 15$ monthly subscription.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044854705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1441305010}
review:
So ignore whats under the dashes unless you wanna read my first experience. After about an hour of connecting i finally played the game. The tutorial is very short and you quickly get thrust into questing. The running at low levels seems a bit far and stamina drains very quickly(you need this to sprint). As a scout you are given 25 arrows, these arrows do not seem to be retrievable after you shoot them and do not do much damage. After killing maybe 3 "walkers" which were the first true enemy (excluding pigs) i was already out of arrows and had to revert back to the sword i was given. I might try to go back into the game with a new character and reset and not go scout. but atm the game is very difficult and didnt seem to be that much fun. Its free so if you want try it, but i dont recommend it.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------If you see my play time, that is the amount of time i have spent trying to connect to the game.
I would love to speak about what is actually in the game but due to not being able to log in i cant.
Each time i log in it tells me i have a 3 minute queue. so i wait. then it goes to 5 minutes. so i wait. then it goes to 4 minutes. so i wait. 30 seconds later it decides to close that menu and leaves me on the login page and i have to press login for the next attempt at playing. 

Worst queue simulater 2012

author: {'steamid': '76561198049003006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 57391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 915, 'last_played': 1586753982}
review:
Um dos melhores jogos que já joguei. Full loot, sandbox e com um bom combate.

Como um bom sandbox ele te da uma liberdade gigantesca, é possivel matar qualquer um em qualquer lugar, sem frescura de "lugar seguro". Existe um único servidor, e por ser um jogo com o combate Client Sided o famoso lag que os brasileiros tem não importa (na verdade até pode ajudar).

Os sistemas de craft são completos e complexos, assim como os pets/montarias que além de ser possível domesticar ou dominar também tem como cruzar espécies a fim de gerar uma montaria melhor.

O combate usa um sistema ótimo de Action Combat, onde você tem que mirar em alguma parte do corpo de seu adversário. Mirar na cabeça da mais dano, armaduras também são variaveis importantes durante o combate, se você perceber que seu inimigo está usando calças ruins então mire nas pernas.

O jogo possui um time pequeno mas que está sempre trabalhando pra melhorar o jogo. Diferente de jogos de empresas gigantes esses desenvolvedores são bem mais acessíveis e ativos na comunidade.

9.9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197991310379', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 8375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1602977614}
review:
This is some next level bleepbloop.
Its pretty hardcore, its not for everyone.
You will find yourself bashing your face into your monitor trying to find what the frack half the skills mean, or where to get what book, or why you keep getting killed by NPCs for seemingly doing nothing wrong.
If you can get past that, and ever figure out what you are doing, it can be a brilliant game..
There is a subscription element, which increased skill maxes to 60/100, but even premium accounts only get the same 1100 skills as free players, so free players end up having more skills, than premium players, being a jack of all trades- Able to wear decent armor, do decent damage, ride a decent horse- But if you want to breed horses, make armor, etc, you will HAVE to subscribe- Its pretty damn ethical, there is no item shop, and I don't see the subscription as pay to win, I see it as playing for free is really an unlimited demo, if you enjoy the game and actually want to play it, then subscribe, but like I said before, its totally possible to play without subscribing, as long as you dont want to craft/breed/be uber.

Not for the faint of heart.. Its like in 300 when that guy makes love with that guys wife.. "your not going to enjoy this".. But if you can get past that, it still counts heyooo, no I take that back, that's rude, too soon.

8/10 if you can handle full loot pvp
2/10 if you play on pve servers

author: {'steamid': '76561198069163689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1455547802}
review:
This is a game...

First off, I'd like to start off by saying this is my first review.

This game has some of the most intersting content I have ever seen in a MMORPG. Mortal Online is the most true to genre hard-core, sandbox MMORPG's I have ever played. 

Now I have played many RPG's, you could probably name any game and I have played it. This is a first in what I hope to be more games like this. 
 
Now to start listing qualities:
MUSIC:
The music in Mortal Online is really inriguing. As a musician myself I always like to listen to the music in a game and think of the time and effort put in to making it. Now I don't know if they hired an orchestra or simply used midi files but it sounds pretty good.

GRAPHICS:
The graphics aren't too shabby. Although not comparable to a game like GW2, or Skyrim, they are more comparable to RoK. Although the graphics are not the best of the best, they do their job and show the in game content and crafting system, (which is the strongest part of the game).

CONTENT:
The most exciting part about this game is its content. The publishers really mean this game has a great crafting system. Since there are no real questing in this game, you the player has to create all of your gear from scratch. This truly sets everyone at the same level from start to finish. This also makes the game more based on skill and amount of time spent creating your character. Mortal Online also supports a subscribing system, since the game doesn't have 2 types of in game currencies, the only way to support the game financially is to have a sub system. This DOES NOT BREAK THE GAME. No one subscriber gets insanely amazing benefits from subbing. Subscribers get a few more skills they can enhance and a few other things. This makes it fun and playable for f2p gamers.
BONUS CONTENT: They have a nude setting which I find to be hilarious...

GAMEPLAY:
The overall game play isn't too bad. The mouse settings though are either TOO sensitive or TOO slow, there just doesn't seem to be an in between. Movement is alright and everything seems timed just right. Draw back, there is only first person viewing while playing the game. This goes hand-in-hand with the "hard-core" aspect of game play. 

Overall I give this game a 12/10 for nude setting

author: {'steamid': '76561198121066809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1441308281}
review:
Have tried for three days to get this game to do something besides splash screen.

No luck.

Edit: I did evantually get the game to load. A little tip for anybody who tries to play this game. The first thing you should do when this game loads is turn off the sound. You spend the first hour or so listening screaming pigs. You're supposed to collect up some skins or something, I dont know, I never could get it to work.

To be honest, after reading the description, getting me to like this game was going to be an uphill battle anyway. I've never understood the movement MMO's have made away from classes and races. Its all skill trees now, so the world is always full of healer-knights. The game only has four races... light-skinned humans with or without pointy ears & dark-skinned humans with or without pointy ears. Theres a couple of paragraphs about each one, but they all looked the same to me. The game attempts to make up for this by letting you cover your toon in tattoos. bleh.

The game does give you a ton of options about the background of your tattooed healer-knight though. You can choose which countries your grandparents came from & this somehow affects your stats in ways that will probably be hugely important later on. The free account only includes one character slot though, so as soon as you figure out which stats are important you'll be deleting your character & starting a new one.

The descriptions for this game go on & on about how important crafting is... indeed the tutorial zone seems to offer little else except an explanation of their crafting system... which makes it all the more puzzling when the in-game tips remind you of how important it is to buy a -campfire- from the local NPC vendor before you go off into the wilderness.

Maybe its a great game once you get into it... i got tired of chasing pigs & uninstalled it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024046398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2540, 'last_played': 1445906179}
review:
Mortal Online is one of the most Diverse Sandbox MMORPGS you will ever come across. Although its a tough learning curve from the start, once you get the hang of the basics and start grouping up with people and making relationships with people ingame and seeing what they know and how they can help you along the way it opens up into a world of discovery and adventure... oh and also killing many many many people along the way.

Pros:
- Full loot PvP/PvE system with no items that stay on death (Hardcore)
- Diverse crafting systems.
- Large world to pillage and explore
- Communicative and friendly Dev and Moderation Staff
- Localised Banking/Mailing
- Client Side Combat
- Skill Based Progression
- First Person ONLY
- Territory Control Asset Based System
- Diverse character creation
- Infinite Free Trial
- One persistent server (8 years and counting)

Cons:
- Some minor bugs here and there (OPEN MIND PEOPLE)
- Graphics are not Triple A, but get over it kids, this game is not all about glits and glammor, its about blood and gore.
(And IMO they're pretty bloody good graphics.)

I've played the game for 2 years now on and off and every time i come back its been for longer and its always a blast every time, i discover new things i didn't know before and go through a new path every time. Hell i havent even explored half of the world yet and still have so many places and things i want to do and discover about the game that there is endless content to be had.

My first peice of advice for anyone coming to play the game is to have an open mind, and dont shut it when you come across something you dont really understand, get some help and ask around, youll find an answer somewhere wether it be ingame of from forums which by the way are found at www.mortalonline.com/forums. (most useful place for information while getting started).

One other thing is that nothing is really handed to you which is really what drives the games discovery factor and sandbox nature, but as i said previously dont give up on it, you will find an answer, you just have to look for it, ask around or experiment yourself.

Oh and this game is not "Free to play" persay, its more "Free to try" infinitely, But even then, you can still do fine on a free account and ive seen many a player do so with flying colors, so dont listen to all the people who say its a bad model blah blah blah, because they just dont understand it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003276029', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1441271678}
review:
Salut a tous.
Je pense que ce jeu est très prometteur, malheureusement je ne peux y jouer que par accoups car viré très régulièrement...dés le début, on peut fabriquer des armures de cuir, et de façon super simple, le jeu reste intégralement en anglais celà dit... 
Le systeme de combat est "à la slayer" pour les connaîsseurs, en premiere personne, aprés avoir dégainé son arme, on la dirige à la souris, on peut apprendre des sorts, moyennant finances (ingame) mais pour les free to play, on ne pourra pas posséder de maison, il faudra sortir la CB... 
Une banque est dispo, gratuitement.
l'encombrement est compté, en terme de poids, mais premiere belle surprise: quand on tue un cochon (par exemple) on peut le dépiter de façon à récupérer viande, cuir, os etc, ce qui pourra servir plus tard...
En résumé : jeu intéressant, à tester pour les curieux :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198004159550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 81417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23883, 'last_played': 1590598591}
review:
A great game with minor flaws to turn away the faint of heart. But for those willing to stick through the rough beginning, there is a wealth of enjoyment to be garnered that is hard pressed to be found in another current MMO. A truly unique experience in a land of run of the mill MMOs.

Update Jan. 31st

Game is getting better and better. The developers are working hard to release features many players have anxiously waited for. The patches are consistent with both fixes and additions. Free house placement is coming soon along with furniture/customization! Looking very forward to having a house that fits my lore background.

Please, if you have not tried MO yet and are searching through the 'Free to Play' section of steam, give it a chance!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984529520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1441349835}
review:
HELL NO! 

Now hear me out. I gave this game a good hour and a half. I like the concept of the game. That being said, that is all I like about the game. Where to begin.

GM's, you would think they would be helpful, but they are not. I asked for help on how to craft a robe (because the tut is total garbage) After the 4th time of asking in help I was banned from help chat, for asking for help (GM said I was spamming) But I only re asked the question because no one would answer in help, they were all too busy fighting over weather or not the game was worth 15 dollars a month (Its not)...... 

Gameplay, well, once you've tried to run around for 10 minutes, you will quickly recognize something is amiss.. You feel like you are running through a field of molases weighed down by 100lbs... FPS is good, but it feels like you are lagging when you really arent.

Community, toxic to say the least. And thats putting it nicely. And GM's do try to stem the tide of complaints and fights, but they arent effective in the least. 

Basically, this is a game from 2010, that they are asking 15 dollars a month for. Yea you can play for free, but lets be realistic here, the perks you get form subbing make this very close to a p2w game if not completely. 

Moral of the story, stay away from this game, and its greedy devs, who obviously only released this to steam in an attempt to milk some money out of the community.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016152495', 'num_games_owned': 1645, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1150, 'last_played': 1489036494}
review:
I'm really enjoying the game. But let me get something straight, this game just isn't for everyone. It's hard, people kill you, monsters kill you either way someone will probably loot your corpse and take all your stuff. I really enjoy it like that. Also I don't think you can get a house unless you sub. But I really don't think that it is that bad. Look at World of Warcraft, They have the same cost subscription but you also have to spend alot just buying the game for somethng that repetitive. 

My stat side of the review
Graphics 6/10. It's better than Half Life but not as good as Half Life 2 graphics.
Gameplay 9/10. It plays alot like Mount & Blade and there is just so much freedom.
Community 8/10. Only thing that annoys me about the community are the people who bitch about it, Like I said it doesn't suit everyone, if you don't like it don't bitch about it to everyone who likes it just log off and go play something else.
Crafting 7/10. I like the crafting but I think it can look a little hard when you first start.
Overall I give this game 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198057236288', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1441268563}
review:
Log in.
Completes tutorial and leaves town gates.

Recieves a quest requiring that I find some undead heads to bring back to a guy.

Finds undead.

Gets ass whooped by said undead.

Goes into a state called "Mercy Mode" whereby I am helpless and on my knees awaiting the final blow from undead.

The blow never comes.

Come out of Mercy Mode and turn to see another player decked out in some cool looking armor and a dead-undead lying next to him.

I say thanks.

He walks up real close to me and points both arms at me, thumbs up and smiles. 

Suddenly I don't even recieve Mercy Mode.

Die.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198094126690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1441266962}
review:
As much as I enjoy MMORPGs, this one has just thrown me away hard, I have barely any time played but don't let that push you away from my Review.

While I was in game I talked to some players familiar with the game:

Benefits of F2P

- None, it's just a trial, steer clear of this game.

Benefits of P2P

- Well as usual, you unlock everything. No skill caps, house creation, etc,.

It doesn't seem like much, but for a first person sandbox mmo, to declare itself as free2play, it should have all features unlocked, with some features limited in what they do.

Example - House creation should be unlocked for EVERYONE. HOWEVER, you can't be allowed to put up banners or paintings, or make fireplaces. AND you should also have a limit on how big your house can be and the materials used in it.

As it stands right now, they want you to pay to try out a feature, which you really shouldn't have to do if its saying free2play, if something big(and for a sandbox mmo, housing is a BIG feature cause it adds immersion.) Its literally saying "hey, we know you want this and we said its free, but its really not, pay up."

4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198102474375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1441318481}
review:
Just awesome.  Has Everything..
Just too expensive per month, and can't get too far without paying really..
And a number of ppl will steal from you, or try to kill you, even something called blue blocking.
On the other hand, u can play in any way, and most skills and stats directly or indirectly help others, making it easy to get the type of character you want. Can easily play it safe too, mine, or just hunt, train animals, and crafting etc. Most things you can do in the safety of the guards too..  
Anyone can steal any money off you any time, and if you leave the town, anyone can kill you and take your stuff. 
Doesn't mean this will happen often or at all if you play smart, read up on the game and watch youtube, it's not an easy game, no quick way to get better anf no easy large ammounts of money right away..
Makes it the perfect game, if it was cheaper and more people had the chance fo fully play it.
Can still spend a few days making a character specifically the way you want, the fighting is fun, scenery is nice, and a range of few annoying people amongst many friendly and helpull people.
Either way, havn't played a lot yet, might subscribe cause i like it, but that is way too much to play a game for a year..

author: {'steamid': '76561198027814652', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1441427365}
review:
I pushed a guy off a ledge with a shield and he came back up and flipped me off.

REAL REVIEW:

Another reason to not believe Steam reviews. This game is unlike other MMOs in that it DOES NOT HOLD YOUR HAND AT ALL. You wanna learn how to craft armor and weaponry? Well, go do it then! You don't know how? Well find the trainers! You don't know where the trainers are because the game doesn't have a map? Well look around then!

People are getting massively butthurt because the game is not supposed to be easy and simplified for idiots. It's meant as a spiritual successor to Ultima Online, and so far it is in the sandbox elements at least. The game almost entirely lacks quests, too, and that is also pissing people off.

It's a sandbox MMO. I thought people like sandbox games? Oh wait, they do if they're simplified to the point that children can pick them up and play them like a master. This is not that kind of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989019430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1537159641}
review:
I think it's a little bit sad how lame the internet has become.  This gem of a game is pretty much the only MMO worth playing these days.  Sure, it has bugs... nothing game breaking, but little irritants... and it does take a little time to set it up properly.  The learning curve isn't horribly bad, but it's there.  That's where all the bad reviews come from.

In reality though, the game is one of a kind.  A well-designed world focused on allowing strategic aquisition of resources by guilds.  These resources are fought over.  Once you gain access to them, you will defend them.  The amount of freedom and different ways to play the game is it's biggest strength.

It's not just a game focused on PvP... It's a game that allows for MEANINGFUL PvP.  The game has a deep crafting system... and this system requires resources which are not always easy to aquire.   Good armor is easy for most anyone to make, but great armor?  Great armor will require you to work for it.  Most likely, you or your friends will have to fight to get you the things you need.  Towns will be built around important areas within the world, and people will attack them.

I can't think of another MMO I'd recomend right now.  Not one.  In a time of stale MMOs where I endlessly wander through virtual landscapes only to find day after day that I am bored... it's really nice to run into a game like MO.

Despite it's flaws... IT IS AWESOME!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031545039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1441307164}
review:
Alrite here are some noob tips from a noob.
Read the words in the tutorial.
If you sleep in an inn, you can restore your max HP and stamina
Remember to eat food.
If you notice yourself moving slow, look at the bottom right corner. If you see a little weight icon, you are carrying too much stuff or wearing too much armor.

DONT GO EXPLORING without saving some money, tools, armor, weapons, etc in your bank. You will most likely die, and if you have nothing saved you're kinda screwed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025617551', 'num_games_owned': 616, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1468352960}
review:
I've played Mortal Online a bit before it came to Steam and this game has a wealth of good ideas. Alas, there are far too many problems with the game, the hardware backing the game, the devs, and the community for any of those good ideas to shine through. 
 
Here are a few of those good ideas and why they don't work. 
 
+[b]Mortal is now on Steam [/b] with all the benefits that come with it. For the game and the playerbase, I think this is sorely needed, but I'll get back to that. 
 
-Unfortunately, [b]the servers simply cannot handle the influx of new players[/b]. Multiple tries are required to log in and gameplay in general is laggy and unresponsive compared to how the game used to run. Especially with Mortal's dynamic combat system, this can make the game almost unplayable. 
 
+[b]The character customization is very unique.[/b] Your character is generated by choosing your heritage. The not often seen feature of having your age and height affect your stats is an interesting addition as well.  
 
-However, [b]the distribution of stats can be rather confusing[/b], as there are no tooltips that tell you exactly how each stat point affects your character, forcing you to just guess which stats will match your playstyle. 
 
+[b]The game has open survival-esque PvP in all areas[/b], only limited to how long you think you can last without getting killed yourself. 
 
-[b]This is poorly implemented,[/b] however. You will find yourself accidentally taking swings at players, especially in the densely populated starting zones, labeling you a criminal and being killed shortly after. The combat itself is very clunky and slow compared to the speed people can move. Most PvP battles consist of bouncing at your opponent, hoping your attack will connect first or being assaulted from behind while your attacker flees. 
 
+[b]The game has a rewarding loot and crafting system [/b] and you can even loot the items of dead players. 
 
-[b]The latter being inappropriate for this type of game.[/b] Mortal is supposed to play like an RPG, not a survival game. You can spend hours amassing materials and crafting items as a simple craftsman with no intent of combat, only to be slain and lose all of your items rather unceremoniously.  
 
+[b]The economy is entirely player run.[/b] Most items are made for players, by players. This game may be the only MMORPG I've seen that actually has honest to goodness crafting guilds that function like a real business. 
 
-[b]The economy is broken as hell.[/b] Unlike games that have a player run economy that is gently shifted by the judgment of the developers for maximum fun, this one was just left to its own devices. Low level gear is oversaturated and difficult to sell, making the early game merchant completely implausible without first having a high level beefstick to harvest better materials.  
Just as well, high level market is cornered to the point of it being cheaper simply to spend the time and effort to make it yourself. Since there is such a high risk of losing all of your items upon death, it makes you question why you'd want to put in the effort at all. 
 
Now that I've covered most of the 'good' aspects of the game, here are some of the purely negative ones. 
 
-[b]The playerbase is horrible.[/b] As I hinted at before, I'm hoping Steam will make this game's community a bit more bearable. Almost all high level characters will kill lower levels to grief them. Most are unhelpful and others are downright caustic. Of course that doesn't go for every player, but the sheer number of simply mean spirited people are scarily high. 
 
-[b]The developers don't care[/b] about the game at all. I must admit that it has improved a small amount since the last time I played. Unfortunately the game still seems to be in a constant state of neglect. Bugs and issues are everywhere and some are still present since I last played [i]in 2011[/i]. 
 
-[b]Most of the GMs are unhelpful.[/b] Again, this doesn't go for every mod, but there have been recorded cases of GMs repeatedly scamming players for real world money. On a smaller scale, GMs will constantly 'play' with their privileges in ways that actively disrupt the game, such as spawning bosses in low level areas or even verbally attacking specific players in global chats. 
 
-The game has some [b]very seedy business practices[/b]. Not limited to: Capping player skills at a ridiculously low value unless they have a subscription, asking for weirdly personal information such as your address and full name unless you are a subscriber, and lifting any ban if you donate. 
 
-If you are a subscriber, [b]you are allowed to take items from other player's inventories.[/b] Plain and simple. You just... take stuff. Like... What the hell, right? 
 
That about wraps up what's wrong with this game. In this state, I absolutely cannot recommend it. The game has some great potential and fun gameplay, but a hardcore reorganization is in order before this game becomes anything that's worth your time. 
 
+++[b]You can also see some top notch elf dick.[/b]
developer_response:
Thank you for your honest review of pros and cons with our game.

I would like to address a few of the points you make:

- Our server performance has been improved greatly since the Steam launch, and it is now much easier to log in than it was just a few days ago.

- We have changed the registering process so that private information is no longer needed to create a free account.

- We DO NOT "lift any ban if you donate". I can't emphasize this enough.

- We developers absolutely care about our game! We work hard every single day to fix bugs, make improvements, and add new content and features, but since we are a very tiny team of indie developers we simply don't always have the resources to do all the things we want to do as quickly as we would like to do them.

- Sure there are griefers, but there are also plenty of very friendly and helpful people in our community who help newbies with questions, give them free starter gear, show them around the world, and even protect them from griefers near the starter areas.

- Regarding GMs: A few years ago we had a program for volunteer GMs which didn't turn out so well, and therefore we do not use volunteer GMs anymore since a couple of years back. If our GMs are ever "unhelpful" nowadays, it is only because we have a very small team and we don't always have time to help everyone as quickly as we would like.

- Regarding "seedy business practices": Mortal Online is a subscription based game, but we also offer an unlimited free trial where players can play as much as they want with a skill cap at 60 (out of 100). On top of that, all updates and content expansions are all free and availible to both subscribers and non-subscribers.

- Regarding taking items from other players' inventories: Yes, we do have a thievery mechanic in this game, and access to this mechanic is limited to subscribers. This however does NOT mean that subscribers simply "are allowed to take items from other players". It takes training, skill, patience and finesse to be an effective thief in our game, and if a thief is not careful he/she will be prompty and justly killed by NPC guards. Thievery is a very risky but potentially rewarding profession.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046294315', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1441238743}
review:
Edited Review: (Deleted comments pertaining to the previous version, as the dev changed the system. The comments were no longer relevant.)

Alright. I reinstalled the game after the dev modified the account creation.
Your information is only needed if you're getting the subscription outside of Steam.

Now, onto the game itself.

First loading it up, and the game...looked rather poor, despite my World and Character settings being as high as they go. There is a horrible head-bob that I did not see a way to turn off.

I did the tutorial (unlike 50% of the people in help chat), and found it lacking. It told you the BARE essentials to playing the game. Walk, kill stuff, craft basic thing, tame little animal. After the tutorial, you are left on your own devices to wander around wherever you started. And when I say wander, I mean wander aimlessly, lost, as there is no map system, and very few landmarks to use as orientation.

Skills require you to learn them from tutors, but good luck actually finding them. They have no indicators showing you can learn from them.

Now, the combat. While trying to kill the pigs in the tutorial, I felt rather motion sick. The camera swings wildly when you attack. It didn't help that I was experiencing mouse and input lag (I would press a key, and about 1/2 second later the game accepts the input.)

The community, at least in the help chat, are either people screwing around, or people who didn't do the tutorial.

Also, if you don't want to die, don't jump off ledges, don't kill things with blue names...and after one hour of play, avoid all players. The game is focused around PvP, so strong players can murder anyone they so feel like, and when they do, you lose ALL of your items and hard work.

Overall, it feels like this game was made very long ago, and so I must say no, I don't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027786099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1441310242}
review:
This game is absolutely terrible. Even for RPG fans like me it's just pretty badly made.

My gameplay experience in a nutshell:

- waited over 2 hours to create a character.
- played a bit.
- accidently hit another player while I tried to kill a pig.
- got killed by guards.
- twice.
- respawned where somewhere, couldn't return to the tutorial area.
- deleted my character.
- 4 times in a row.
- created a new one.
- completed his tutorial and that's it.
- game throws you into open water and says "swim"
- you have no idea where to go.
- you have no idea how to do.
- the fighting feels like I am an old fart with hurting bones.
- "sprinting" feels like a slow stroll.
- I died out of nothing.
- I'm done.

The game works not like it should do...

All that worked was the uninstall button.

Overall gameplay: 2/10
Graphics: 7/10
UI: 3/10
HUD: 3/10
Newbie friendly: -1/10

Final verdict: 3/10 Do not play this game. Even as an RPG fan. Not even because it's F2P... Just  don't DO IT

author: {'steamid': '76561198022828134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1441232519}
review:
This game sadly is unplayable.

Technical Aspects!

First you have to create a account / the buttons are not responsive so it can be that the game itself doesnt notice that you pressed the button. A browser pops up and you type it in manually.
After youve done that, you log in your account. The serverstructure is unknown,you join a server after you created a character.
As i mentioned before, the buttons are not responsive. I created the character and pressed the button to finalize, but it didnt let me.
Going back,i found my character suddenly standing there.
After 3 attempts of login-errors, the game started. It loaded very slowly,took about 5 minutes.
The game wasnt taking any graphic-settings that i set in the settings of it before starting the game.
Ingame the framerate dropped after a few seconds to 1 picture in 5 seconds. I put everything on the lowest settings, still nothing (and this game is old unreal engine)
I exited the settings, and suddenly my mousepointer of the menu was still in the game. I was disabled to look left and right.

Gameplay Aspects!

While creating the looks of your character (a few hairs, a few colours, nothing adjustable, all preset)
you can also select your race beforehand. (they all have the same player model, one is a little thiner, one got a beard, one has some more skin details, one got a scar over his eye).
4 Races total.
Then you pick what your grandfather and grandmother were, to get some additional stats. Theres huge lore about it, but not really straight up what it does in the game.

Nice for a f2p. but only as a fun-mod i suppose. Some people create that for other games in their freetime.
Not worth the effort.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047163743', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1441174195}
review:
It's a Free To Play game with a skill cap for free players(a SIGNIFICANT skill cap comapred to players that subscribe) and an open loot system that more or less allows anyone and everyone to club you over the head and take your stuff just for the hell of it. NOT only that starting out you have ZERO means of making money because it's a "player driven economy" and not a SINGLE GODDAMN NPC will buy ANYTHING you try to sell to them. You could spend HOURS crafting gear that the ONLY thing it'll do is raise your skill and have 0 means of making money for yourself but have to spend money to get materials. Sure you can sell materials you gather, but their worth is miniscule and this is a 100 copper = 100 silver = 100 gold, ergo it takes 1,000 copper to equal 1 gold. Which you you'll have to keep in a bank unless you don't mind getting pick-pocketed by thieves in rags. Combat is also awkward with a clumsy version of Mount and Blade's directional based combat(it doesn't work half the time) and no option for a 3rd person view(but at least it has an FoV slider...to bad it's set at 90 degrees and you have VERY limited peripheal vision). And to be honest there are actually TOO many skills, your character doesn't even know how to throw a chunk of Pig Meat over a fire to make roasted meat, probably one of the most basic things possible. Oh and the basic Mafioso tactic of strongarming players into Guilds for "protection". 

This game's character creation and wealth of skills is REALLY impressive but it's execution basically spits in the face of everything any gamer has ever seen in a game.

Pros:
-Huge skill list and more "life-like" world compared to other worlds, involved character creation and the ability to make a character you want.

Cons:
-Graphics are lackluster and stutter.
-Controls for combat are slow and clunky.
-Making items early in the game serves no purpose beyond grinding it's related crafting skill as it can only be sold to players. And no player is going to buy low tier gear.
-Good chance of getting griefed at all times once you're outside the safety of the cities.
-Skills are capped at barely above 50% proficiency unless you pay money, giving subbers an innate advantage in a game that is VERY MUCH about player versus player.
-Game supports toxic, non-social behaviour in the "elite" towards new players.
-Game is VERY vague about values such as how much armor protects you, how many items you're using in crafting something and the damage you do/take.
-The amount of skills is actually overwhelming as it seems like EVERYTHING is tied to a skill from gathering plants to RESTING. Yes, you can get better at resting, by resting a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978576227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1695221807}
review: I still love this game. It's not for the casual care bear MMO player. It's pure sandbox similar to UO. There are no tutorials; no nothing just like UO. You guide your own path. Seek out help whatever way you want. Leave town solo and you will die and lose everything. At the same time, it is very rewarding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066946121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1488158500}
review:
Not impressed at all... but I will give a bit of time...

Was excited to try it... But not only were they not ready for the influx of people from steam but the login screen is like playing "WHEEL OF ERRORS". It would be one thing if I was given a simple message saying the servers are full or over capacity or what ever... But it is literally a different error everytime... 

Sometimes one window pops up saying its logging in while another will pop up behind it saying login failed... And if you press the cancel button on the window in the forefront, it will bring you to the other one, when you press that... the first one comes back... like wtf.

I had successfully logged in 3 times. And every session ended with a crash. Twice the game crashed when I clicked on "Right Glove" when crafting. The third time the game just stopped working while in combat with a skeleton....

Not impressed at all...

author: {'steamid': '76561198076176291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1441228016}
review:
Minha historia nesse jogo;

Baixei
Instalei
criei uma conta
loguei no jogo
criei um char (ja incomodado por não ter a menor ideia de qual classe era aquilo)
Entrei no jogo (apos uma espera de 3 a 5 minutos)
Olhei o jogo
Vi que não tinha como por em modo 3ª pessoa 
Vi que os graficos lembravam um pouco quake ou doom
Fui em configurações
Não estava no maximo
Topei o que podia da parte grafica e pensei; agora vai!
E foi mesmo....
Foi pra pqp!
Que grafico horroroso
Meus olhos sangraram....
Desinstalei saporra

O que eu vi, nunca mais poderá ser "desvisto" mas você pode salvar as suas vistas.  #ficaadica

author: {'steamid': '76561198041417450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1441230450}
review:
Видел эту игру лет наверное 5 еще назад в тестовой стадии. Потом она была платной в релизе. Теперь она добралась до стима. И что... Парни за все эти годы не смогли ни оптимизировать примитивный движок Unreal к игре. Все дергает и тормозит и сдвигает текстуры до сих пор. А компы то уже совсем другие не то что 5 лет назад. Сервер вас будет не пускать в игру часами. Хардкор в игре конечно есть. Но только пожалуй в первоначальной идее которая видимо была во время ее зародышевого еще состояния. Но равивать эту хардкорность похоже у разработчиков не хватило ни ума ни сил. Очень жаль. Задумка была неплохая.
Не рекомендую.
З.Ы. И без того примитивные меню не смогли даже перевести на разные языки, включая русский. Убожество.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009725385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1441313891}
review:
PROS:
+ refreshing skill and crafting mechanics
+ friendly devs, often in game talking in the chat
+ sometimes friendly players, that dont kill you as soon as they see you, despite the full PvP loot system (if You get killed they can they everything You had, only the items in the bank are safe)
+ no global bank, well this seems realistic

CONS:
- the world is BIG and often appears to be empty
- game has severe performance issues (low FPS, stuttering or even freezing), and the problem is not on my end, my computer runs games with higher system requirements than this game flawlessly
- bad bussiness model, at least for my taste, with monthly subscription fees in the range of 14 - 12 euros per month, it is too much even for an AAA title (take a look at how Elder Scrolls Online went from subscribtions to a Buy to Play model), if that monthly fee, they want, would be a one time payment I might reconsider it
- severely limited F2P, skill cap for free players for all skills at 60 / 100 skillpoints is almost halving the skills of the free players, THAT is really not what a F2P game does (I am okay with the guild stuff and the land owning being only for premiums)

VERDICT:
I dont care about the graphics, I would gladly play it with completely crappy graphics like if it was 15 years old, But the technical state of the game (severe performance issues) and the current bussiness model (14 - 12 euros per month subscribtion, or play for free with all skills capped at 60/100) is killing it. The devs should be right now grateful to players playing it, reporting bugs and helping to polish, such an unpolished game.

review: Sitting here looking at all these negative reviews from people with .2 hours on the game lol...  I realize that it isn't the most graphically intensive (believe me I know, I have a gtx 690 so i always prefer higher graphics settings) and the gameplay isn't the crispest ever, but you have to admit that it does have a ton of strengths and the opportunity for hours of fun.  The game literally in every sense is a limitless sandbox mmo and you are encouraged in it to do what ever the hell you want!  I find that more appealing than some extremely scripted, higher-end graphics games with restricted gameplay.  Just my honest opinion.
