author: {'steamid': '76561197966374293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1441221574}
review:
La verdad es que el juego se ve bastante completo y con un amplio abanico de posibilidades. Puedes craftear el equipo, puedes tamear animales y tenerlos como mascotas pero hay una cosa que me mata sobremanera, y es que para alcanzar el nivel máximo tienes que pagar subscripción, cosa que me parece de los más sucio que se peude hacer.

Se trata de un juego dificil de jugar debido a la cantidad de contenido y al idioma que está en inglés ( para los que no tengáis ni papa podéis ir olvidándoos de lo bonito que es el juego, y de hecho lo es, es uno de los que mas me han gustado, pero aún así reniego de todos aquellos juegos que hay que pagarlos todos los meses para jugar.

13 auros al mes x 12 meses = 156 euros que pagas por año más o menos, el sentido común me indica que esto es impensable, prefiero pagar 50 pavos de juego y jugar toda la vida, eso si tiene sentido común,

Sin más señores me digno a NO RECOMENDAR este juego a nadie nunca jamás en la vida.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995869521', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1441218216}
review:
Installed the game files. Ran the program and selected "Create Account".  

Was sent to the Game's official website.  Set up my account. Tried to login several times. Kept ending up in a Queue telling me to wait 2 Min (Which was in reality 10-15 min each time) 

*LOOKS* like a cool game (I was a huge fan of Ultima Online back in the day and I've heard it compared to that several times)

While waiting in the queue looked over the site and account info and realized that this "Free to Play" game is actually a "Pay to Win" game.  Extortion in gaming doesn't sit well with me so it no longer resides on my HDD.

If you're going to do F2P do it RIGHT.  Look at games like STO (Star Trek Online) or PWI (Perfect World International) Where it is actually FREE to play. and not "PAY to win"  but rather "PATIENCE to Win" -- you don't NEED to cash shop in those games to get uber gear. You just need to WORK for it (Remember doing that?  "WORKING" for your rewards? -- Yeah... that's the way to fo F2P IMO)

author: {'steamid': '76561198022817376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 326643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2623, 'last_played': 1595552011}
review:
A MUST TRY BY VETERAN GAMERS AND NEW PLAYERS ALIKE!
A+A+A+ rating...this game makes you have to think and learn by doing..no point and click auto-attack..no click to auto-travel on its own crap here..you need to do it yourself..everything is about "doing" the experience you get out of this game is what you put into it..excellent copncept. author: {'steamid': '76561197992836699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 15145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1586095490}
review:
I've been playing Mortal since early beta, 7 or 8 years ago, coming from WoW, I was looking for a MMORPG closer to what I would find on an elder scroll game and Mortal is definately the closest you will get to chivalry or elder scrolls in the MMORPG genre. 

Seamless large open world
Open pvp
Full loot
Deep crafting and territory control system
Supports battles of 100+ peoples
Real action combat in first person view

These are the main features that got me totally hooked in Mortal and I believe no other MMORPG can compete with it. The graphics are sadly getting sa little old considering it released 5 years ago already but the gameplay is unique and challenging, a true hardcore experience that will keep your adrenaline pumping years into the game at every battle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164882077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1534710287}
review:
Mortal Online / Dark Souls / Mount and Blade

Those are the only games I have ever played for more than 100+ hours, they are the only games I have played for nearly as long as I remember playing games and they are masterpeices, yet they are all flawed masterpeices.

Mortal Online is a dark and masochistic world where other players can greatly impact your life, they can siege every building you make, they can try to kill you anywhere you are and they can steal anything you have. It's bleak, frustrating and difficult, the same way life in a medieval era would have been.

The weak are meat and the strong do eat, it's a true philosophy in this game but if your smart enough, possess the strength of character and have just a dash of insanity in you this game will become a second life. Where you know nearly all the members of it's community and what they have accomplished, you know the land, you know the flaws and you know you love it all anyways.

When starting your journey in Mortal it will be very rough and mundane until you are strong and educated enough to explore the world and decide what interests you, just like when you first started minecraft. There is little to guide you but your own imagination.

If you cannot handle countless setbacks, lack of direction and no parental guidance from uncle developer dudes then this game will be a horrible experience for you, and you should probably kill yourself for not liking it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970779854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1444156487}
review:
Pour donner un avis sur un jeu, il faudrait déjà pouvoir entrer dedans. Les erveurs ne sont visiblement pas à la hauteur! Vous créez votre profil, votre personnage, vous jouez, vous sortez quand vous en avez assez , vous disant que vous vous reconnecterez plus tard, hé bien non! car j'en suis a mon deuxieme compte créé, et a chaque fois, impossible de revenir dans le jeu... donc soit vous faitez le jeu d'une traite (ce qui semble assez ardue) soit vous tuez 2 cochons dans la prairie et voila...
Pour le changement de mot de passe( je pensez naivement que ce serait simple..) hé bien non non plus, vous saisissez votre nom de perso, votre mail , vous validez et.....rien, pas de mail. vous recommencez plein d'espoir, vous disant que vous avez fait une erreur ou oubliez de valider, et.... rien! pas de mail pour vous donner un nouveau mot de passe... ah si! j'ai fait 4 tests , j'ai reçu les 4 mails ...24 heures plus tard! 
Bon, sinon pour di trés peu que j'en ai vu, le mappage du clavier est assez terrible, je recommande de passer par des touches intermétiares pou faire votre mappage de touche (exemple; pour "Avancer, si vous voulez prendre "Z", ne taper pas "Z", taper "M" valider et modifier ensuite l'action déja inscrite à "Z" par une autre lettre "W" par exemple et enfin taper "Z" pour l'action d'avancer"
Graphiquement ça utilise DirectX9 et 11 au choix, j'ai une config moyenne, ca rame un peu mais ça va.
Le perso n'est jouable qu'a la première personne, pas de vue externe....bigre! 
La zone de départ est trés populeuse -ça va se passer car c'est un jeu semble t il exgigeant (déjà rien que pour se connecter c'est déjà un jeu dans le jeu!) mais bon pour le moment il ya 1 cochon a tuer pour 95 perso avec un repop de cochon plutot lent. ETce n'est que la 2eme quéte du jeu. Donc je recommande d'attendre un peu, que ce soit plus calme.
Je ne recommande pas le jeu en l'état, connexion prise de tête, serveurs à la ramasse (reboot fréquent des serveurs). Je pense que l'afflut massif dû à Steam à pris l'équipe de court. Wait and see

author: {'steamid': '76561197981138431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1441205898}
review:
La optimización de este juego es lamentable. Mi PC no es ninguna maravilla, pero cumple con los (supuestos) requisitos mínimos. No puedo dar dos pasos seguidos. Una pena, teniendo en cuenta que puedo jugar a juegos con bastantes mejores gráficos que este en calidad alta, como Skyrim, por lo que deduzco que es por un pésimo trabajo de los desarrolladores.

EDIT: Mi PC es un Quad Core a 2,4 GHz y 4 Gb de RAM. La gráfica es una GeForce GT 630. Lo dicho, ninguna maravilla, y antes de que alguien me lo diga ya se que se está quedando antiguo. 
Lo que no se entiende es que haya podido jugar a juegos como Assassin's Creed 4, Hitman Absolution, Dishonored o Skyrim a una calidad bastante decente sin ningún problema y que en este juego, que tiene peores gráficos que todos los mencionados, no pueda dar dos pasos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037991789', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 2177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2059, 'last_played': 1488395416}
review:
Melhor nem jogar, Jogo é muito ruim. Tem uma ideia boa mas de resto é um lixo msmo. Inclusive atualmente se encotra injogavel, existe crashs a todo momento e vc morre e perde tudo, itens que vc levou horas craftando que desaparecem do seu inventario ou do banco. Esta totalmente mal feito, só masoquista para curti o jogo msmo.

Além disso o jogo é pay to win se tu não pagar mensalidade vc não faz nada no jogo fica preso eternamente na primeira cidade mantando porco, se vc for se aventurar fora da cidade ta ferrado pq existem varios matadores na porta da cidade só esperando vc sair para te matar por nada, esse é o exemplo de bela comunidade que vc vai encontrar no jogo para te prejudicar mais ainda, recomendo manter esse jogo no seu lugar ou seja ignore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086097956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 149779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2608, 'last_played': 1577941082}
review:
Ive played this game for the past 3+ years, it has its downfalls for sure but the game has alot going for it, its improving with every patch, there is alot of sand in the box you do as you please you only get what you put into the game the more effort put into the better a reward you get. 

if you check out the forums there is a ton of guides to help new players which will help with the steep learning curve.
http://www.mortalonline.com/forums/forums/noblemans-wisdom.130/

there is no map ingame but there is a map online @
http://www.mortalonlinemap.info/

this game really isnt for the faint hearted 

as for f2p its an unlimited trial to show you the game before purchasing a subscription, a good fighter can easily kill p2p players if you are skilled enough.

f2p cant wear heavy armors but can wear upto 14 weight and can still have a chance of dealing max damage when fighting, the skill level only caps your lowest you can hit for.

here is a guide for f2p an easy build/ and money maker
http://www.mortalonline.com/forums/threads/how-to-get-the-most-out-of-your-f2p-character-new-player-guide.110528/

author: {'steamid': '76561197963335961', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 14949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1031, 'last_played': 1694018900}
review:
Very deep game, rough around the edges with a very small dev team. But still worth trying if you like first person fantasy games that has depth to crafting and allows for building of your very own town with the freedom that comes with it.

Cons are obviously that the dev team is small and so it only gets updated every so often.
Its only as grindy as you make it.
Playing as a f2p is possible but you rely more on a group than someone who is subscribed.


World is big, there are a lot of dungeons and cool things to explore, sadly there is also a lot of empty locations with no reward for exploring. Sad face.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986985015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 27406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1577745304}
review:
I once had a quest to find me an mmorpg that I would keep playing. 
Now I don't have any quests at all and I love it!

I started playing Mortal years ago and it still hasn't lost any of it's feeling. You can even make a break and when you start again, you only realise you've been gone a while because the territory map doesn't show any familiar guild names anymore.

What I especially love about this game:
* The broad possibilities of character configuration. 
I have a fighter, a cook, a tamer/breeder, a fatmage (my favourite :3), my friend has a butcher, an armor crafter, a dexmage (that's a fast footed mage while the fat mage can't really move without a horse under his feet)
and then there are a few experimental characters, too, where we try different skillsets, weapon specializations
* The thin spezializations. 
You have 1100 skillpoints with means you can max 11 primary skills to 100. 
11 sounds like a lot at first. But a fighter for example needs like 3 primaries in movement, 2 in defensive skills, another 3 in offensive skills, every weapon type is a primary, riding is a primary, armor training so you can wear heavier armor, mounted combat is a primary and handling weapons on a horse as well.
The skills include primaries and secondaries. You can have as many secondaries as you like but to get to most of them, you need a primary. Like you can know anything you want about weasels, horses, molvas, rabbits, wisents, camals, and all the endless different kinds of mammals there are, you need to invest points into mammalia first.
* The diversity of the world.
There is jungle, desert, snowy mountains. And the creatures are endless, from cute little rabbits to monstrous minotaurs! You can find very different materials, different woods, metals, minerals, flowers. There even is honey :D
* The payment system.
Free-to-play chars have a skill maximum of 60 instead of 100. Man, they can't do anything right, you might think. Yeah, somehow. Fighting in Mortal is heavily player-skill based. If you can't hit the enemy right, it doesn't matter what fat armor you have or how high your weapon skill is. You still lose!
F2P-Fighter even have an advantage: They can max 1100/60=18,3 primaries! 

Uhh, let's... move on...

What I don't like about Mortal:
* Bugs, bugs everywhere! 
Everywhere you go, everywhere you look, there are these little things that just aren't right. Flying plants, items vanishing from your inventory, getting stuck, pet movement (Letting your pet follow you along player made structures can lead to spontanous death to lil ol' pony T-T (okay, it wasn't the structures but the aggressive mobs behind the walls my pony felt running into) )
I got used to most of the bugs. I know which ways to avoid or how I can make my items appear again or on which spots I shouldn't kill mobs because the lootbag spawns underground.
* The very, VERY big bugs!
There was/is this bug, where the client crashes when I get hit on a horse. No fun with my fatmage! Hasn't occured when I left the new continent Sarducaa. Don't know if the bug still exists but I don't dare going there anymore. 
* The very thin possibilities for f2p.
F2P crafter are useless. Completely useless. If you don't pay, you have to fight.
* A certain uncomfortable part of the community.
The ones complaining about every little change and about how overpowered a certain weapon is, which is not true most of the time, or that this or that race is useless, which isn't true either or that there are cheater or star vault prefers a certain guild or bla bla blaaah.
And the ones saying "we don't want new players" camping in the starting cities ruining every new players start.

A lot of text. But, please, one final thing.

What others might not like:
* You can lose everything.
Full pvp, free loot. You leave the safety of the guards in town: you have to expect being killed and robbed. Say goodbye to your horsie. Bye to your new sparkling armor set. Bye to the 100 gold you wanted to transport to another town because banks are not linked and the only postal service you have is you. Or hiring another player. Which I maybe wouldn't do because... trust noone! 
But i can ensure you: Making a save delivery under this circumstances is even more rewarding! Everthing you do successfully makes you happy as hell.
* No questies. Nothing to do?!
I, myself, back in the days when I first started MO, I found it hard to set myself goals to reach, to find things to do. 
Today I don't think I'm really over this, but when I don't know what to do, I don't just quit the game anymore but say "Eh, could kill some more megnatons" and with this jouney new unforseen adventures begin :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198043793309', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 605019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3055, 'last_played': 1677871665}

It's not fully story/quest driven game. There is full loot on death, yes meaning you'll lose your most precious gears if you die and the chances of dying I would say about 75%.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986961674', 'num_games_owned': 1149, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1484247270}
review:
Welcome to Mortal a Pay2Win game.
In this game if you don't pay you can't kill other who have payed. 60% dmg VS 100% dmg is like u play wow and try to kill a player lvl 100 and you are lvl 60.
You need a 6 party not "Subscribers" to try kill a 1 "Subscriber" member.
And don't try to leave running because he have 100% in run speed and you 60%.
Of course if a paying member see a 6 people party, he can leave, and don't try to catch it because he run fastter.
And yes he can wear best armor than you because he have 100% in armor prof and you 60%only and same for the weapon.
He can carry a 200Tons armor and you only a 10g Leather armor because he paid and you not.
But no problem u can try to kill it!

If you love to be a punching bag this is your game!

Have fun dying. OR PAY

author: {'steamid': '76561198046796302', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1442220188}
review:
This is one of the best Free2Play games on Steam... BUT it's still last gen. By last gen I mean non-linear, open-world, classless, PvP enabled nearly everywhere, legitimately challenging, player-driven, and every part of the game must be DISCOVERED yet is highly complex, but at the same time it's a 2009 game that has 2005 graphics, has a terrible, snotty, and Steam-hating community, is in ONLY First-Person, has terrible controls and limited keybind capabilities, and gives you absolutely no idea what to do once the tutorial is over.

In other words, it's an Ultima/Everquest/ES Arena style game that is not worth the $15/month subs to unlock skill points that you'll never use because you can spend atleast a year in this game without needing them. Don't worry, though, you'll get bored of the game before then since the devs have shown absolutely no desire to upgrade the game to the level of other MMOs in the market and Mortal's veteran community is actively opposing any chance for those upgrades.

The game is good but it will die within the year, period. F2P it while it still exists.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095651754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 67219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63504, 'last_played': 1536090669}
review:
This has always been a niche game and I loved it for years, ive played since about 2013 / 2014, ive put so much time into this game even before it came onto steam. Its always had major bugs but the devs actually put time into fixing alot of them and improving the game, it took time but they slowly and slowly improved. But some things are just too bad to overlook, some major bugs and mechanics that have been in the game for very long time and although more rare now, the prevalance of cheatears and bug abusers and how inconsistent the admin / gm's are. 

I would still overlook all this if i didnt one day get banne don both my accounts for cheating, this is already bad enough as it is but after messaging many people on the forums, on their discord and on facebook they wouldnt give me any other information other than  we detected 3rd party software, our system is 100% and there is no chance for a false positive, i begged for more information for a good week before a guild member messaged them and he recieved more information on MY ban than I did within a day. 

I love the game and wish I could still play but some things are just too rediculous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103269713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1441188115}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995448717', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1441186602}
review:
Allein schon das einloggen auf dem Server hatte mich nen Tag gekostet, bis es endlich ging.

Charaktererstellung einfach und zu wenig Details der Attribute
- Grafik billiger als bei WoW
- Steuerung umständlich und kompliziert
- Tutorial fehlerhaft (Starb und kam nicht mehr wieder rein)

+ Musik ok
+ Viele Skills

Also meine Empfehlung ist das Spiel nicht. Außer jemand steht auf alte Grafikschinken und billige Steuerung, wo es noch nicht einmal eine Karte von der Spielwelt gibt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980477430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 106729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1587895434}
review:
Ich spiele Mortal nun schon seit einigen Jahren.
Empfehlen kann ich es nur Menschen mit einer gewissen schmerzresistenz. Man muss davon ausgehen immer mal wieder alles zu verlieren was man gerade dabei hat. Sein Pony, sein Gold, seine neue schicke Rüstung die man sich besorgt hat.

Gerade als Anfänger sehr frustrierend ist es später der Reiz der jede Reise spannend macht. Jeden Transport von Waren von Ort A nach Ort B wird dadurch deutlich spannender. Hinter jeder Ecke könnte jemand lauern der einen töten und einem die Waren stehlen will.

Das Crafting System ist sehr sehr breit und tief.
Der großteil aller Items muss von spielern gesammelt oder hergestellt werden.

Es gibt eine große von den spielern getriebene Wirtschaft.

Einzige mankos sind einige Bugs, aber die hat jedes MMO...

Für mich persönlich ist es jedenfalls DAS MMORPG und alles andere ist nur für Kinder die nicht mit Integralhelm und Rückenprotektor im Garten Dreirad fahren dürfen weil das viel zu gefährlich ist :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198024151546', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1441184665}
review:
Created a character,  completed the tutorial. On a suggestion from a NPC guard right inside the city, I went to the graveyard to kill undead for gold. I killed 3 walkers and accidentally looted a player's body right next to the walker's corpse because I thought it was the walker's corpse. I looted fast because of Full Loot mechanics and thieves everywhere. Became a criminal for having a player's head in my inventory and get immediately cut down by a player in blue steel armor and wings on his back.

11/10 would spend more time installing game then actually playing and dying to a runescape wannabe player again.

Serious post-humor EDIT: After spending 30 minutes trying log into the game and only recieving 'Contacting server. Verifying...'  and then nothing happens, I probably should have given up. After attempting to create a character and getting stuck not being able to click out of reading ancestry bios because I have no way of changing my resolution or windowed;full windowed mode, I should of given up. After spending 10 minutes running from one tutorial quest NPC to the next and then getting stuck on a rock on the ground the size of a small turtle, I should of given up. After spending another 10 minutes running through the city asking for directions to the graveyard and looking for signs to it listening to old-school morrowind-ripoff-esque music and looking at bland morrowind-looking graphics, I should of gave up.

After getting killed in a well known noob area of the game outside of the starting city to toxic, dickhead veteran players, I gave up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104293045', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1576847837}
review: best mmo i've actually played, idk why the negatives... it's literally meant to be a hardcore mmo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024601861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 124952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1125, 'last_played': 1595193679}
review:
現状サンドボックスの最高峰MMORPGであり、PvPer、クラフター、テイマー、泥棒、トレジャーハンター、冒険家など様々なスタイルでのプレイが可能。何をするかはあなた次第。このゲームの醍醐味は広大なNaveの世界を舞台に、この乱世を生き抜くことだ！

以下、特色
・フルルート、町の外では常に死が待っているスリルある世界
プレイヤは町の外ならいつでも相手を攻撃可能。死ねばアイテムを全て奪われる。死ぬのが嫌？死の意味が重いからこそ生が際立ち、戦闘も必然的に白熱したものになる。死が重いからこそ生きているのが楽しいゲーム。

・スキル制による自由なキャラクタービルド
歩兵、騎兵、騎上メイジ、魔法戦士、テイマーメイジなど自分にあったスキルビルドによるプレイが可能。それぞれのビルドは一長一短であり、非常によくバランスがとれるようになっている。どれが最強という事はなく、状況に応じて適切に操作する事で活躍が可能。

・中世の戦闘を疑似体験できるアクションコンバットシステム
ターゲット制でもFPSでもなく、実際に武器を振り回し、敵の頭や胴体、足などを狙って斬るリアルな戦闘システム。クラウドコントロール？そんな意味不明のものは存在しない。また相手の攻撃を受け流したりする事も可能で、そこに熱い攻防が生まれる。戦闘では剣技と立ち位置、攻め際、引き際などを見極めて戦い、スキル制ゲームのように回避不能なダメージを受け、理不尽に死を迎えるような事もない。すべては君の技術にかかっている！

・自由に建築可能なプレイヤーの砦
Naveの世界では自由にプレイヤーシティを建築可能。そこには城壁や商人、生産器具、農場、ブリーディング場などを配置でき、プレイヤはそこで生活する事が可能。ギルドメンバーと協力して砦を守りぬけ！

・斬新なクラフターシステム
定番の武器職人、鎧職人、アルケミスト、弓職人など様々な生産スキルが存在し、全てのアイテムは動物からとれる素材や鉱石から性能が決定する。例えば振りは速いがダメージが低い、ダメージはあるが振りが遅い武器など、プレイヤの用途に応じた様々な武器が生成可能。最高のレシピを自ら探しだせ！また生産したアイテムに自由に名前をつける事が可能。

・交配システム
馬などの動物は交配が可能。交配により様々な動物を生み出せる。交配した動物を売ってブリーダーとして生活も可能。自分だけの最強の動物を作り出せ！

・ギルド戦争システム
ギルド間では戦争が可能。戦争中は町の中でもガードを無視して相手ギルドと戦闘ができる。相手ギルドの砦を壊したりも可能。倒した相手からはもちろんアイテムを奪うことが可能。

以上、システム的にもこれほど色々できるMMORPGゲームは他にないのだが、全てはプレイヤ任せ、プレイヤの同意無しに殺され全てのアイテムを奪われるなどネガティブな面もあり、いまいち知名度が少ないゲーム。しかしながらポテンシャルのある商品であり筆者は１年以上プレイしておりハマっている。

既存のMMORPGに飽きた方におすすめ。Free to playだし、一度プレイしてみては？ 人は少ないけど日本人コミュニティもあるよ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198110074203', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1540633574}
review: Идея игры любопытна, но реализация безграмотная и  небрежная. Баги это одна из составляющих этой игры, и в какой-то момент ты перестаешь понимать это новый баг или введенный игровой момент. Отсутствие какого-либо тестирования перед вводом любых новшеств или исправлений, постоянно передергивает механику и экономику игры.  При этом поддержка игроков работает из рук вон плохо: время реагирования, качество помощи, а главное разработчики не делают никаких выводов и работы над ошибками. Следующая проблема плохая защита от хакеров, DoS атаки. Большое разнообразие ресурсов, брони и оружия из которых используются единицы, большие пустые территории. Осады из-за разного прайм-тайма и количества игроков на сервере скучны и не рациональны. Мобы забагованны, неотбалансированы.  Не рекомендую тратить время.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986691199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 14902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1447099048}
review:
Llevo jugando desde hace casi 2 años y es un sandbox magnifico, a pesar de sus bugs que tienen casi todos los juegos.

De verdad puedes ser y hacer lo que quieras, de hecho la historia del Mortal, no solo la hacen los desarrolladores si no que tambien la hace la gente que juega.

Politica entre jugadores genial y muy interesante, crafting muy bueno con miles de variaciones, combate apasionante y has de tener manos manos, aunque sea full pvp full loot no tardas nada en volver a equiparte y salir a matar jeje, comercio excepcional, obtención de recursos... me encanta jeje estuve mucho tiempo ganandome la vida vendiendo recursos, refinandolos, etc. Ahhh exploración!! Genial sin lugar a dudas, meterte en una cueva a oscuras y encontrarte.... Genial!

Aun siguen refianndo y añadiendo cosas pero merece la pena. Dejo unos pocos videos mios y del clan ES que es al que pertenezco.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TixDfRR3ZmA
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XUkvAwiE46w
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2FgcPsH8PY4

Este es grabado contra nosotros jeje
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W_ykCeNqU7o

Pues esto es lo que encontrareis en Mortal Online y muchas más cosas.

Si quieres unnirte a nosotros, probar el juego y no estar solo esta es nuestra web de contacto http://escuadrondelassombras.enjin.com/

Otra opcion es gritar por el canal help!!! jajaja
Suerte y espero que os guste

author: {'steamid': '76561198051637934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 102962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1539884352}
review:
This game has captivated my attention for 4 years. I am involved in a tight niche of this game where you kill for your stuff. It has the greatest player envolvement in the landscaping of any MMO. The grudges are held eternally, and your reputation is notorious in this community. 

There is something for everyone but the game is very hardcore. Death is brutal, items have actual value, and the grind is merely surviving the world and its denizens. 

The bugs and the indy dev company can be frustrating at times, but the satisfaction of accomplishment is bar to none in any other MMO. This is more hardcore than Darkfall. In MO you don't kill someone, you murder them. You cause them grief, and killing is a political, ecnomical, and tactical action. 

Good luck on your endeavors in Mortal Online, I will have my crew ready to murder everyone that joins in. Such is the freedom RPK! has in this game. Such is the freedom of Mortal Online.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964155697', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1442984446}
review:
Played MO Heavily from Beta and the only reason I stopped playing was because the playebase had gotten really small

I have to say since 2009 I have not found a game as good as MO, I keep going back to it but the low playerbase has made it impossible to stay when im a PVPer.

Glad its finally on steam and looking forward to being a part of the new communuity.

This is a game for Hardcore PVP players as well as casual PVE, hard learing curve but once you get the grip of it you will love it.

Its as close as I have come to UO since 1997

Onwards and upwards and seeyou all on the battlefield

author: {'steamid': '76561198007018604', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 73030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1194, 'last_played': 1677944047}
review:
Immersive and addictive.  Drives you to move forward, aquire and explore.  So many unknowns to learn and things to discover.  

Steep learning curve, but a strong vet community with whom are willing to help.  Seek the game forums http://www.mortalonline.com/forums/   for help and guides to get deeper into the systems, and to find groups/guilds looking for players from every timezone.

With the new island, Haven, released for new players... it's a lot easier to get into the game.  Noobie protections and the island itself make the start a bit easier on those who join into MO.

Welcome, and safe travels.

Glorious Lord Beord.

review: This game has a lot of potential, The prolbem right now is that the servers have been crashing like crazy due to the Steam support influx of new players. The Vetran players are pisses about this and are now griefing new players so much to the point its unplayable for newbies. Let me explain more the sytem is that is you attack someone you are flagged as a criminal for 2 min. Sounds ok in theory. But what is happening now is vetrans are harrassing new players buy running into them when they are attacking creatures....flagging the newbie as a criminal then slaughtering them just to make them frustrated so they quit and free up server space. This is a huge issue...considering all loot is dropped on death. Something has to change....any ideas?

review:
I would love to play this game BUT!

Got to finish 'i think' the tutorial and got to where you can pick your starter set or not then the game acted like I got disconnected but it didn't kick me or anything. Logged out then couldn't log back in. So.  It seems like it has some good ideas but I wouldn't know. Game jerks when running around loading new areas even with a constant 61fps. The Titties are nice though. Character models are great but the building and things are blocky

author: {'steamid': '76561198062202641', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1443299179}
review:
This is a great mmo that you will spend alot of time on because it's so good!
You won't be trying to skill up your character for long. It only takes a few days to reach maximum potential. So you'll always be able to help your guild out of even if you want to be a solo rogue who lives off loot. The limits of this game is based on the skills you have. This is no point and click type game. It's a game which actually takes skill, not as in skillpoints or levels, but actual know how of the game. It's great actually feeling equal to the opposing force even if you are out numbered. This game is not quantity over quality like every other MMO you play now-a-days. It's more of the quality of the player. PVE doesn't feel like a grind. PVE is actually something trivial.
 Overall, this game doesn't lack complexity. Actually not having to worry about catching up to the best in your guild is no issue. You can actually take part in the big wars within an hour or two of gameplay rather than playing for months in order to be the best. I'd give this game an 8/10 
  There's no MMO that can compete with the complexity and raw skill it takes to PVP and the community is awesome!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036732977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1682313696}

Shoutout to Gatha/Blueblock and Lui Kang/ Lord Negan for the inspiration. May there legendary legacy continue always.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011843901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1441163095}
review:
Pros:

Has some cool idea that I had really wanted to check out.
Guild run territories
housing
a lot of freedome
varied skills

Cons:

Gameplay feels sluggish and dated
Total pay-to-win
Skills cannot be increased past 60 on a free account
sub based
Many areas are over-camped by higher level players killing off new characters (with what I read in chat)
Older Graphics

Overall, I wouldn't recommend the game until the sub-based premium is dropped and they adopt a GW2 style payment method. 

Increase in area size for the tutorial zones would help alleviate the horde of players swinging like freaks at the same 2 pigs. 

Finally the graphics could be overlooked but the game still feels sluggish.

So it has potential but the starter zone was full of people killing the same 2-3 pigs that actually spawned. After mentioning in "help chat" that i wasn't sure i was keen on the pay-to-win model, i get lagged out. Check the forums to find i've been IP banned. So that was neat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000061984', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1441157052}
review:
The graphics are good in this game and the idea of the game is good but as for the Games stability it can only be compared to a baby deer trying to walk for the first time, The starting tutorial is dumb and a waste of time as you will have to wait for 5 pigs to spawn while 10000 other players wait for the same pigs because no one thought to make a field of them instead of only 5 pigs in the noob town. the players are what you would expect a 50/50 mix of good and bad people the game also needs a cartography skill added so you can map the game instead of having to wander around aimlessly or have another webpage open to show a map of the game. needs some changes but its not that bad as long as your internet isn't crapping out .

basically this game is every mmo and survival game mixed into one.

First person only

Rough around the edges, ie, a lot of small annoying bugs and some bigger noticeable ones, but much of it can be avoided or ignored if you learn to. Game is not for the light hearted.

review: This game is a difficult pvp based game, no matter who good you are how long you have been playing you WILL die no matter what death is a major part of this game. It is VERY difficult to learn everything when starting out I would find a guild that can teach you the basis of this game, it may take days even months to be good at the game, but its fun and worth it when starting out you have an option of a couple cities I would reccomend Tindrem or Mohrin Khur, in tindrem you have to deal with trolls and cowards in Mohrin Khur you have to deal with guilds/RPK that kill a lot. But if you dont like a game that requires you to be active and learn then DO NOT play this game this is the wrong thing game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134116220', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1441153554}
review:
As of Sept 1, 2015, getting connected is a huge pain (likely due to a large influx of people for this game's debut on Steam).  The usual out-of-the-gate hiccups for an unprepared development/server management team are prevalent.  Likely 2-3 weeks before stability issues are resolved - an average estimate for this increasingly common problem with games nowadays.  Early Access, I can understand, but this game has been available for some time even prior to the Steam Release

In its current state:

Pros:

1) Some veteran players are genuinely helpful (kudos to those who are answering the seemingly endless requests for help on the very first newbie quest.)  Admittedly, it took me a few minutes to figure out what to do, This is one game where reading the quest text as it is given is crucial.

2) Decent graphics.  Unreal Engine always offers a good bang for the buck in graphics capabilities.

3) Free to Play - although, skill levels are capped at 60 (out of 100) and there are skills that are not accessible to F2P players (Thievery)

Cons:

1) Getting connected successfully is (at best) random; might be better late at night when player base decreases

2) Widespread reports on logging out, then attempting to login only to receive a message stating "you are already logged in"; research on the game's forums indicate this issue only goes away after a server restart - lovely

3) Murdering is pretty rampant - higher level players are genuinely bored enough to travel all the way to the cities where the new influx of players are spawing just to kill low level characters just outside the city limits (that's actually a pretty good indication of how boring end-game must be, as there's absolutely no material benefit in doing this other than to just be a PK'er)

4) Latency issues; again, indicative of poor initial scalability on the server-end of things, but will iron itself out over time (in the short term, because of player loss; new players are very likely to lose interest from not being able to advance their characters without getting murdered constantly by high level players)

I will update this review once I re-test after a couple of weeks to see if the server issues have been ironed out.  If you want to check it out to see for youself, go for it.  It has some interesting concepts.  There's no way I'd recommend it right now - there's some things they need to get under control fast before this influx of Steam players makes their decision on whether or not to invest time (and perhaps a subscription) to this game.

[Updated: Spelling corrections]

author: {'steamid': '76561198080561800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1441221751}
review: Ok so i got quite excited to play this game. Seemed like something new and fun. spent a few minutes creating the account (because of the frankly bad account fields i need to fill in. Why would they need my address?) and got to the login screen. Typed in my deets and then i got a "connecting to Mortal Online Servers" for about 5-10 minutes to which it suddenly disappeared without anything happening. Keeping me at the login screen. So pressed login again, which came out with a different message. This is where it got bloody annoying as I had to spam the "cancel" and "login" button about 243 times before i got a new (exciting) message saying "loading character data". I was actually ready to play the game! but then i woke up and realised that i had spent 2 hours repeatedly clicking login to get to this one message WHICH BROUGHT ME BACK TO THE LOG IN SCREEN. so i quit after a while and came back to it. This time i logged in and it was all dandy and i quite enjoyed the character creation (although the character faces look strange) and the edition of this Ancestry thingy-majig where i can decide what my character will look like through my grandparents and parents race. After this I finalised my character AND THE GAME SENT ME BACK TO THE F***ING LOGIN SCREEN. 2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198057779802', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1468970296}
review:
Es un juego fantástico, llevo meses jugándolo y nunca me canso. Su mundo abierto es increible, y nunca te cansas por mucho que te maten, puesto que conseguir equipamiento es relativamente fácil. Tanto su banda sonora como su apartado gráfico son sorprendentes, ambientan bien cada situación, cada momento. Sin tiempos de carga, también. Un pvp y pve amplio y adaptado a cada jugador, sin embargo requiere práctica cogerle el tranquillo. Por otra parte existe una gran diversidad de clases y puedes adaptarla a tu gusto: ¿Ser un gran mago o un formidable guerrero? ¿Por qué no un híbrido que rebane cabezas y al mismo tiempo haga explotar a sus enemigos con enormes bolas de fuego o terremotos que destruyan ciudades enteras?. El sistema de soporte es genial también, puedes escribir tu problema vía juego y en unos minutos, ellos te responderán y solucionarán rápida y eficazmente cualquier bug que pudiese tener este hermoso juego.
En resumen, un gran juego, sin embargo algunos bugs llegan a ser pedantes hasta el punto de arruinar la jugabilidad por completo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118333568', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1441149472}
review:
Right from the start, it becomes clear that the community is not going to be your friend.  People getting in your way when you are trying to kill even a pig so that you become a criminal just because that person was flagged as blue.  Not a one time thing it was a lot of people doing this.  The game is laggy even on a 50mb internet connection, with only one instance and everyone crowded in one area there is nowhere to go to get less lag.  You only get two options for a spawn point in the beginning so get ready to feel like cattle,  with 90 other people working to the same first goal as you and only 2 pigs spawn.

Might be a lag issue but the hotkey buttons don't seem to be working or they are not productive, 50 creatures and not one time could i get the skin.

This is my personal experience yours might be different so it will be up to you to decide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085988184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 19792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1509091632}
review:
Highly recommended one of a kind game.  One of the great things is the customer relation with the few devs that work on this game, I think you can count them on one hand. Its an Open world Sandbox with Full Loot, Indepth crafting systems, Awesome Teritory Control system (building houses and empires and stuff). My personal Favorite thing, is you can be whatever you want to be. So when you come and play, remember the shadows are always watching.

This game does have bugs, this game is not perfect, it's an indie game with a limited crew, but they work really really hard. The newest dev Jonas, has brought with him an increase in the communication, and effectiveness of each and every patch, So if you come on the forums make sure to say hi to him if you see him.

In game staff is very helpful thats a bonus too.

So if you want a game where you can do and be just about any thing you want to be, give mortal a try 

I've enjoyed the game for almost three years now, and even though i have left multiple times, i always find a reason and a want to return and keep playing, theres not really any other MMORPG full loot Sandbox games that bring it together like mortal does.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065975173', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1441211852}
review:
I start off by saying this: YOU NEED FRIENDS
Use "Skype" or "Teamspeak" to chat. Friends will give you an advantage over solo players.
But will also add a new experience to the game like basebuilding as a team =)

The game has decent graphics and awesome gameplay.
The combat is really nice and the crafting is very unique.
I like the idea of no classes or level to push players to get better by loot.

My first impression was already great because of the caracter creation menu.
Choosing my ancestors?! This is the first time I have seen this in a game.

I highly recommend this game to everyone who likes <full loot> games!
(Full loot = when you kill a player, he drops all his items and thus lose everything)

review:
Хардкор. Нет карты, недружелюбный интерфейс, но так ли это плохо? Хотели открытого мира? Да пожалуйста. Свободы действий? Она во плоти. Только не жалуйтесь, что после смерти вы остались с носом, а неблагодарный священник вас еще и не собирается воскрешать. Украл что-то и рядом стража - умри. Сразу и на месте. Выйдя за ворота знакомого городка запомни дорогу, иначе рискуешь не вернуться обратно. Баги? Покажите мне святое место, где их нет? Игра огромная. Приятная графика, режим только от первого лица и шикарный огромный мир с неплохо проработанными локациями. И нет, я не фанат игры. Вижу ее в превый раз

author: {'steamid': '76561198062381094', 'num_games_owned': 751, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1442335828}
review:
I've only just gotten past the tutorial so this is very much first impressions.

This game won't be for everyone, especially as the F2P model is somewhat limiting, as in more of a generous infinite trial with a lower level cap than subscribers. That being said some still do well in the game even with those limitations.

From what I've seen so far this is like a spiritual successor to Ultima Online. I am very excited to see further into the game and to learn more.

Also so far the graphics are incredibly amateur in appearance which is not apparent on the videos. so if you need your graphics sublime you will likely not enjoy MO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045002932', 'num_games_owned': 1069, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1441152288}
review:
Microsoft Email and Server Load and Verification System 2015

I'm a Libertarian, so don't get me started on the fact that I bought a game on Steam and now I have to create an account with my phone number and address on it, and they are required. You don't need that. This is 2015. The glory of Steam is to buy a game and play it, not jump through hoops (and scary ones at that). These guys can't even get their email or server systems working, you mean to tell me I don't have to worry about a hack when they want all my personal information?

Took 12 hours to get verified to play their game via email. To their credit, they finally fixed it, however, today it took an hour to get on the server and once I finally created a character, it kicked me and said it would be another 15 minutes.

I will update my review once I can actually play the game, but right now the review is based on technical issues because you CAN'T play the game.

I understand a metric @*%@$ ton of people are playing right now, but if the servers weren't ready for Stream or that kind of load, it shouldn't have been released yet. And I can say that, because I actually DO work in the gaming industry on shipped titles.

Thus far, this has been my experience:

1. Can't get email verified
2. Verified 12 hours later
3. Can't log in for an hour
4. Finally am told server will be up in 15 minutes
5. 17 minutes later server still doesn't want to let people on
6. Finally get on, create a character
7. Server crashes
8. Get back on get a quest
9. Turn in Quest
10. Server crashes
11. Down for another 15 (I mean 30) minutes

I promise the review will be better once I can play, but for the last day, I can't.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962033615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 740, 'last_played': 1445203389}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963290484', 'num_games_owned': 1153, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 20741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3165, 'last_played': 1448179262}
review:
Hard core mmoRPG reminiscent of the good old days. If you enjoyed SWG you will enjoy this. 

 This is a fantasy rpg that plays like a survival like ARK or Dayz. There are deep systems that encompass everything from crafting to your characters height and weight.  There is a certain sense of discovery as there is still tons of unexplored content. With a great support team and community Mortal Online really stands out. 

PROS
A deep taming and breeding system
No levels, only  skills
Local Economies. 
No fast travel
Full loot
Open pvp
In depth crafting system
Immersive and beautiful world.

Cons
Graphics may seem dated to some. 
Still a few bugs but the devs are working through these

Other thoughts
The free to play can be misleading. Its more like a free trial as skills are capped. It's definatly a subscription game. IT'S not pay to WIN. It's just in order to have full access to skills you will need sub


I say, try the game. I did at launch and hated. I played again a week ago and fell in love. It reminds me of so many of my favorite games of the past, EQ1, SWG to name a couple. Its worth a shot and a bit of your time if you enjoyed any MMOs from the late 90's to the early 2000s,

author: {'steamid': '76561198124929150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 26283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3030, 'last_played': 1574041943}
review:
Since tons of reviews tell you what the game is about, I won't waste your time with all that. 

Suffice it to say that this is an excellent game, well worth your time and definitely worth a sub. I've played for over 2 years and am still playing. I'm glad it was released on Steam and I hope everyone will give it a chance! Best MMO Sandbox hardcore pvp game ever. Extremely in-depth crafting and gathering and refining and alchemy. You can even write notes or draw things in the game. Want to be a cartographer? Go for it. Draw your maps and sell them on the broker to other players! Want to be the next great artist? Well you have many masterful drawings of d**kbutts that preceede you so you'd better be a good artist to compete with work like that! Haha. :D

Best thing about Mortal Online? The memories and friendships you make playing this game are epic.

review: Amazing game. There's definitely a learning curve but don't be discouraged. It's awesome! Gather resources and sell shit to make some silver. author: {'steamid': '76561198009131327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 32702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1127, 'last_played': 1499326928}
review:
I have been playing Mortal since 2010.

It is hard.
You will die... A lot.
You will have many epic experiences. Both good and bad.
You can build cities.
You can destroy cities.
You will rage quit.
You will always come back. Because...

Mortal has no competitors on the market. It is truly a one of a kind game that will keep drawing you back into it. It has transformed my gaming experience from a 1 to 10 scale, to a 1 to Mortal scale.

EDIT: Also, be prepared to endure through some "Indie-Developer" issues. Server down time is not common, but it can happen. With this huge release of steam, it is proving to be more than they anticipated.

Be patient, it is worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010708470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1441288549}
review:
This game was absolutely dreadful. I understand it's been out for like...a day on steam but there's no excuse for how much shit I have to give this game. The tutorials are crap, garbage. The community is toxic as !SHIT! This game ALSO has a subscription base, which I failed to see before downloading but 
$15.00/month.....

WAY TOO MUCH. THIS GAME IS NOT WORTH IT AT ALL. W

Wurm Online is much more worth it than this game. Much more fun, very friendly community(pve) and it's "subscription" can easily be paid for through in-game trading. People are very willing to give up $30 for a huge shipment of bricks in Wurm. 

I could not believe how unorganized and trashy the game felt. The devs are working in Social Communications....helping new players with stupid questions and keeping people "in check"  This is something they could of easily avoided, if they had more servers and better tutorials. There are NO NORTH AMERICAN servers at all right now. 

the mechanics are anything but flawless, combat is strictly based on a person's connection to the server...... flat out bullshit if you ask me. 


To those who love this game, I say...enjoy wasting money on this. The only reason it's mixed reviews is because the people who started playing this game before it came to steam are "loving" it because they got such a headstart in the game for #1...But I haven't played enough to see how THEY...the people who've been here since 2010  like the fact that it's on steam for free now...

It's attracting a lot of US players.  But all I see so far is them saying they hate it. So.....


GG - Was a nice try getting $15/month from me again, but games like WoW made me realize how stupid I was.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025409491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1441580378}
review:
Hardcore, full loot, sem instancia, sandbox, pvp é emocionante e muito recompensador caso sobreviva!
O modo free é mais para testar, conhecer o jogo sem antes ter q comprar pois se for levar a sério precisa sim pagar a mensalidade para ser competitivo no jogo pois no modo free tem cap nas skills.
Jogar sozinho é loucura e desanimador, entre numa guilda, evolua teu char e vá para o PvP, daí sim vc conhecerá o potencial deste game!
Avaliar este jogo negativamente sem ter feito isso antes é como dar um tiro no pé. Este jogo é UNICO no mercado, não há nada igual ou parecido, então se vc está cansado de quests, xp, grind de itens em dungeons, trocar item roxinho por laranjinha, etc, vai gostar do MO.
Joguei muito no passado (antes de sair na steam) hj porém não tenho mais tempo para este tipo de jogo (full loot, farm e tempo de deslocamento).
Dica de veterano: cuidado com seu bolso na cidade e até mesmo com a bag do seu cavalo xD

Dont see how much shit they get to do... 5+ years of content. 2 continets to play on! game still being worked on. Not like other AAA titles where they make a new game every  year to rip you off... example cod.....battlefield... also the combat to this game is pure skill based.... not clicking buttons. lame as fuck

author: {'steamid': '76561198062114835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1441124399}
review:
The only positive in the short time I tried it was the sandbox aspect, the rest is just too bad for 2015, poor poor graphics (yes that is important for me, this day and age there is available tech to have good mechanics together with great graphics), they ask for address during the registration (fake name and address coming out), the pace was slow, not meaning the learning the game or time it takes to learn a skill I am fine with that, I mean the whole atmosfere just looks empty, slow, meaningless.

The ideas are there but this is still far far from the mmo I am looking for.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961559781', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 14419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2207, 'last_played': 1496830910}
review:
Tough game to love. It's a bit ugly, it's a bit clunky, and there's really nothing holding your hand, showing you what you could enjoy in this game.

However this is a rare kind of mmo where freedom trully exists. The game offers you tools, and it's up to you to carve yourself a life with these. It is an unforgiving sandbox where everyone starts a hobo, and only a few get to become any better than that.

My one advice is: look past the rough edges of this game. The sense of freedom and adventure you will get out of it are really worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090188383', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1551460192}
review: I've been playing much longer than the hours say. I've been playing before the steam release. But, I think the game is good and heading in a good direction. I've been frustrated at times but there's really no other game like it. The PVP is great in my opinion. It's an open world where you can kill anyone anywhere, loot people's equipment, you can PVE, the map is huge, you can make your own city, and you can siege other player's guilds. It's good stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019339719', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1441120555}
review:
The game looks awesome and everything, but I wish the game uses your steam account to log in instead of asking to make a new account and ask you for personal information about where the fuck do you live, what is your first name and how people calls you and your zip code, I was really interested to this game and the need of giving that info just lost my interest to the game and devs projects.

Edit: I have found out that the game had a breach and personal information was released sometimes after I posted this review, I did a good call by staying away from that game once I saw all that it was asking. Security is low on that game, peoples living place, zip code and names where left open like a book to the hackers.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968152858', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1536135583}
review:
Mortal Online is truly a unique game that delivers a hardcore sandbox MMO like no other.

I have played Mortal for several years before Steam release so ignore my low hours played, it's more like a few hundred or more. Subscribing to this game is worth every penny!

What about Mortal do I love? Why you might like this game!

-Forced first person skill based MMO (When you swing you can hit the arms, legs, head etc.) Combat is not simple like most other games, there is no aim assist or TAB and button mash. A skilled player with less player attributes and worse gear can truly destroy a lesser skilled player with better attributes and gear.

-Sandbox. There IS a brief intro quest and that's it. You are free to explore, hunt, craft, learn. You are not bound by a quest system. There is no need to grind quests.

-The crafting! Never have I seen a game with more in depth crafting. You don't just go out and find iron, bring it to a bench and craft a weapon. You must go mine rocks, (they are everywhere) bring them to an extractor (crusher etc) which gives some basic parts, burn them in a forge, and refine them with other parts, this is the most realistic type of crafting I have seen in a game, ever. I could go on and on about the complexity and how rewarding it is but you get what I'm saying hopefully.

-FULL LOOT and NOWHERE IS SAFE! This is awesome. Are you the "good" guy that strives to kill only red (murderer) players and defend the peace? Are you a "bad" guy that wishes to kill everyone they see and take what they have on them? Either way this game caters to it. Yea there are blue cities that the guards kill red players but even so anyone can attack, they will turn grey and the guards may kill them but it's not truly safe even in the big cities.

In a nutshell, I love this game.  It's not going to hold your hand, it will test your patience at times. The rewards are great, nothing beats that feeling of knowing you could die, but you made a long trek to the next city with your valuables, ETC. 

The game is not perfect, but for an indie development team they have made a hidden gem of a game. They are not going away and they are always improving the game.

After Mortal Online, other games feel tame and useless. (Other games have little or no penalty for death and therefore are not rewarding to me).

Thumbs up if this review was helpful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042349208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1441119883}
review:
Mortal online should be called Potential: The Game.  It is a game full of unlimited potential, from its elder scrolls-esque combat system to its open world.  Unfortunately, after years of playing, I found myself constantly waiting for it to meet that potential.  From constant bugs, terrible combat balancing, to staff corruption, it is one thing after another with this train-wreck of a game.  

First things first, the CEO, Henrik Nystrom has no clue what goes on in his own game.  Having dealt with the guy in regards to the testing of new mechanics and game bugs, he is clueless.  There are mechanics in the game from years ago that do not work and he still has no idea whether or not they do, requiring him to hear such feedback from the playerbase and sometimes getting quite indignant when faced with the problems of his game resorting to calling those who bring them up trolls even if the feedback is provided in a respectful manner.  When assisting on the test team, he would blatantly ignore feedback regarding bugs, pvp mechanics, etc and simply to whatever he liked.  He does give the appearance of interacting with the community, though this isn't hard when they remove any type of criticism from the public view.  

He is also blind to the corruption of the game, allowing players (of low moral character) to perform GM duties for his game.  One of the previous counselors is actually well known for monetarily scamming money from other players multiple times via various schemes.  This player-based GM system ends up being a major issue in a full-loot game where assets and the element of surprise actually matter.  GMs scout locations for other players, spawn demons and other monsters on top of other players in an attempt to soften them up for their personal friends and major game decisions in terms of cheating, hacking, etc are made by players who have and hold obvious bias.  This is greatly apparent after the donation system where some of the largest backers have experienced some of the greatest success by having relics (items that provide guild specific buffs) dropped in their backyard the day after losing them to other guilds.  I've also seen players with high donations who were banned from their forums for breaking the rules immediately unbanned afterward.  It is pretty safe to say this occurs in game as well.  

But that aside, let us get to the game.  The game's graphics look like something from 2010.  Textures are recycled unreal engine 3 type fluff.  It was excusable for a time, but not for a game attempting to make it big on steam.  I'd give them a six out of ten as the game can look beautiful at times, lighting-wise, but any close look is a mess.  It isn't unheard of to get stuck in the mesh as the whole thing is a mess and you can get stuck on something in the middle of a fight and end up losing the equipment you worked hard to get.  Thankfully, they did some work a year or so ago and this improved it in some areas, but made it worst in others.  UI is your typical fare and is reminiscent of an elder scrolls game/clone.  

I won't even go into mechanics deeply as it is a very touchy subject.  The game favors large numbers and zergs as they call it.  There was a long period when skill mattered and it was possible to consistently go against the odds, but those days are gone after large donators constantly complained as well as week old players.  If you play now, then combat is simple enough with directional swings and blocks, but you're best finding a guild with a decent amount of players as you'll just end up getting zerged.  If you have grand aspirations as a new group, be prepared to merge or ally into another as that seems to be the norm for newer players.  Once again, this is a full-loot pvp game.  

Murder system is iffy.  Five kills and you turn red which means you can't go into a town.  Some feel that is harsh, some feel it isn't harsh enough.  You burn murder counts every 8 hours.  Get under 5 and you're back to blue.  Taken from another review to give you a newer player's idea of the game, "A thief can steal from you and if you attack him he is able to kill you without getting a murder score.  There are some people on this game with over 1000 murders that have been free from murder score and they walk around in the cities all day.  This is hardly justice at all and any new player will see this as a troll game and quit once educated to this process."  Take from that what you will.  

The community...Well this game features one of the most toxic and destructive communities that I've ever seen.  It is very small and includes those who would lie, cheat, and blackmail using out of game information.  Many will grief you, attempt to badtalk or insult you or even accuse you of cheating while having a recorded history of using cheatengine within the game.  Of course these players still play, which brings me to another point; bans.  Bans do not matter in this game, players who have used cheatengine, players who have duped items/gold, and players who lagswitch still play this game.  They may get caught and receive a short ban, but you usually see them again, typically after making hefty donations.  Some just because they have close associations with the higher ups.  Very sad state of affairs.  Most of these guys are so nasty, I'm sure I will be attacked by name in their reviews for posting mine.  This is the worst part of mortal online.  If you're prepared for all of this then enjoy.  

The game is worth a try, but I just can't recommend it.  Even worst, these players, most of who I know, agree that they hate this game, and that if a decent replacement released, they would leave in a minute, but due to some weird stockholm syndrome type deal, they just keep putting up with it.

Quick update for those attacking me in the comments (which I expected).  This game has been out for years (standalone) before being released to steam, this is why my playtime is so low.  I played mortal actively on and off for years constantly telling myself it would get better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977259741', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1452376385}
review:
Played around and watched streams last night.  This reminds me of AC darktide. I am already in love.  Will update when I get more hours!!

UPDATE - EDIT

Wow...  What a learning curve this game will have.  As a player who has played hardcore MMO's like Asheron's Call, I welcome this type of game.  The sky is the limit and there are enough time sink's for people to lose their grip on real life.  One thing I recommend if anyone is serious about playing this game, is to find a group or guild that can help you with learning the basics.  This game can feel pretty lonely if you are left to figure out yourself.  This also helps create a mystical feel to this game.  I am extremely excited to learn and grow my character.  This game DOES look good despite what people say.  Some amazing views and scenery as I have explored.

TIPS if you cannot get the game to run smoothly (this helped for me).
Open mortal online -> open settings in launcher -> take everything off epic and knock down the settings until they fit your needs...

Pros
-Amazing views/scenery
-Sounds are captivating and strike your senses when you experience new things
-Combat is exactly what I am looking for (dodging arrows, melee swings can miss if you do not do it right, can break LOS against casters.)
-Seiging/raiding
-HUGE and INTRICATE player built/owned cities/structures/territories
-Insane amount of things to put time/effort in to.  If you don't like a TON of options, this game may not be for your.
-Mounted riding!?  They did a really good job on this from what I have experienced so far.

Cons
-Overwhelming at first
-Be prepared to be killed on site!  (Found a group of 3 yesterday, I was chatting with them and checking out their armor/mounts, tell them goodbye and i'll see them around.  Next thing you know 3-4 minutes later as I travel down the beaten path, one runs up and starts swinging wildly while on his mount and kills me.)  I don't mind these encounters but some might.
-Not having a group is do-able but might not be enjoyable for most (solo players beware).
-Can easily gimp yourself depending on how you create your character (apparently this has gotten better since the last big update).
-No hand holding (some could see this as a con, not me)
-Servers have been unstable since released on steam (I expect this to be ironed out sooner than later, this is pretty normal for most MMO releases anyways).

If you have any questions I would be happy to answer :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198063056172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1535836286}
review:
This game is unlike any other game out there at the moment.  I have seen many mmo's claim to be a sandbox, but fall way short of the claim.  MMO is a true sandbox and provides and amazing level of complexity and options to the players.  I have not seen a game with this level of depth since I played EVE.

The game has some bugs and seems to be a work in progress, but in it's current state it seems more polished than most new game releases over the last 2 years. It is a very harsh environment and will remind you violently every time you get careless or lazy.  Make some friends early and give it a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000618222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 948, 'last_played': 1441662072}
review:
Started playing 2012, played in periods since. 

I can start off by saying that this game is not recommended for kids under 15. 
Heres a list of my tips for new players:
1. You need to be social (for guilds, friends ,foes etc.)
2. If u are a ragequitter, this game is NOT for you. 
You will die, you will lose stuff. But you will also kill and loot from others.

3. It has a steep learning curve. But dont let that fear you, give it some time and you will get it. 
4. Start by seeking up someone to play with from the beginning.
5. Do NOT start in sarducca.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003293522', 'num_games_owned': 620, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 23204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1135, 'last_played': 1608691871}
review:
I played this game since Open Beta.

You can kill everyone, you can be killed by everyone, you can loot their stuff, they can loot your stuff. You can tame stuff, you can build stuff, you can destroy stuff, you can get naked around campfire with people. You can go to dungeons and get rekt by AI. You can swim in the sea. You can ride a donkey. You can also ride a big version of a pig. You can kill elephants and even tame them. You can tame a rabbit, you can level up the rabbit and you can eat the rabbit. You can also eat the head of your enemies. You can skin them also then make robes out of their skin. You can cook human heads and even eat the human heads. You can send people heads though the mail system (which is local) the banking is local as well. You can get killed by guards, you can kill the guards, you can kill everyone, the possibilities are endless.

So play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185965125', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 4829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1504, 'last_played': 1463178426}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978326957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1441114854}
review:
Nur eine kurze Einschätzung. 

Bisher das langweiligste Spiel, dass es auf meine Festplatte geschafft hat. Der Start ist so unfassbar zäh, langweilig und pure Zeitververschwendung, dass ich es gar nicht einordnen kann. Zuvor hatte ich viel darüber gelesen, welche Gefahren auf einen Neuling warten. Playerkills, Itemdiebstahl etc. Nichts dergleichen ist passiert und auch sonst nix. Die meiste Zeit geht man von A nach B. Dabei hat man das Gefühl einen Rollator mit drei anderen Omas vor sich herzuschieben. Man bewegt sich laaaaaangsam. Und selbst das Sprinten ist nur wenig weniger laaaangsam. Das Aufregendste war ein Schwein zu töten. Das sich nicht wehrt... *Gähn* Nach dem Tutorial wurde ich nochmals vor den schlimmen Gefahren gewarnt und danach bin ich *laaaangsaaam* durch die Stadt geschlichen auf der Suche nach Abenteuern und Aufregung. Gefunden habe ich leere Straßen, leere Straßen, einen eingefrorenen Angler und keine Möglichkeit diese Stadt wieder zu verlassen. Dazu einen Sound, der irgendwie nach leerer Lagerhalle klingt, nur das leise Radio der einsamen Putzfrau im Ohr... Meine Klassenwahl fiel auf den Tamer, der allerdings bereits zu schwach ist, um wenigstens einen Hund zu zähmen. Soll mein erstes Pet ein Kaninchen sein und weitere Schweine anfallen? 

Fazit: Mortale Langeweile und Entschleunigung pur. Wem Angelsimulationen und Landwirtschaftsimulatoren zu nervenaufreibend sind, sollte sofort hier anfangen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985658018', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1513016594}
review: The mmorpg with the most player freedom out there. Definetly worth a try played this game for two years now (almost) and I love it. Full loot and lots of pvp to be had, if you're a pvper, crafting and trading is a very viable career choice if u want to get rich. A very unique mmorpg.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029587508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1441411762}
review:
It's an interesting concept. A game with no rails to guide you. No world-saving/destroying/modifying plot to spur you on to the next set of increasingly harder goals to clear. 

An interesting concept that falls flat pretty much right out the gate. The tutorial section is a poorly designed mess. Reading and following the instructions scratches at a surface that promises fascinating depths, but penetrating the UI to find the specific thing you're looking for is an exercise in frustration. 

Learning new skills requires your character reading a book... the very first book I got had an 18 hour timer, and the act of standing there, watching that timer tick down improved my skill in 'reading' and after half an hour brought it down to fifteen hours. Whoop-dee-doo. 

I'm never one to rail on a game's graphics, for their own sake. But as dated as this game looks, it should at least boast a more stable frame rate. Instead, I had to tone the options down, and get used to the idea that "playable" would have to suffice. 

Finally, wandering the lands on a quest to do whatever thing you wanted to go set out to do might have been enjoyable... if you could move at a speed other than "shamble". 

My experience can be best described as "Poor, with moderate hope of something better buried beneath the wreckage." a more patient player may derive hours of joy from the experience. I forsee only hours of tedium.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019585021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 782, 'last_played': 1587406783}
review:
It has bugs, lots of bugs. It also has heart, LOTS of heart! It's the only game of its kind, having survived its own (almost) death several times.
It's a brilliant game at times, but it will test your sanity and skill, on all levels. Combat is fast, yet feels oddly slow. Politics run through almost everything in game.
If you want to feel free to do anythingand everything, this is the game for you.

Been playing since November 2009.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961666578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1441111868}
review:
놀랍게도 이 게임은 17년전 출시된 울티마온라인과 그 이후에 나온 에버퀘스트의 미개함을 절묘하게 섞어놓은 듯한 게임이다.

무슨 말인가 하면 이 게임은 17년전 나온 게임보다 게임성이 비교불가능 할 만큼 썩어 빠졌고 그래픽은 인류의 발전을 똥구멍으로 거슬러 쳐먹은듯한 수준이며 인터페이스는 조악하고 편의성과 직관성 따윈 개나 줘버리라고 자신있게 외치는듯한 형태로 구성되어있다. 특히나 전체적인 시스템은 멍청하고 게임은 지루한데다가 아무짝에도 쓸모없는 불편함을 강요하고있기 까지 하다.

상인과 아이템을 거래하는 과정을 예로들자면 물건을 고르고 구매버튼을 누르면 거래가 이루어지는게 아니라 내가 구매한 물건의 값을 지불하기위해 자신의 아이템 창을 열어서 그에 맞는 금액을 거래창에다 올려놓고 오케이를 눌러도 동일한 물건을 한번에 2개 이상 못 구매한다는 에러 메시지를 보게한다는 뜻이다.

게다가 가장 중요한 MMO 적인 요소는 거의 제로에 불과하며 양키들조차 제일 첫 튜토리얼인 돼지잡고 가죽 벗기는걸 하지못해서 이리저리 헤맨덕분에 수많은 병신들이 똑같은 내용의 질문들을 반복적으로 올리고있고 이 때문에 똑같은 내용을 끊임없이 반복해서 대답해주는 친절하고 불쌍한 플레이어들의 help 메시지가 모든 채팅창을 가득 메우고 있을 뿐이다.

만약 이 게임을 하고싶은 흥미가 조금이라도 있거나 아주 올드한 스타일의 MMO 를 좋아하는 인간이 있다면 시간낭비하지말고 그냥 울티마온라인 프리서버를 혼자 돌려서 한 손으로는 딸을 치며 옛 향수에 푹 젖어들기를 추천하는바이다.
