author: {'steamid': '76561198044347906', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 58221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 923, 'last_played': 1677884244}
review:
This game is amazing I have played this game for 3 years and everyday I logged in was always diffrent. Yes, I know the game kinda has a high system requirerment but that shouldn't know you from trying. If you really wanna get a feel for the game you need to first find a guild that has played for a while to help you get a better grip of the game. This is a sandbox type of game so there is no sense of direction cause you make your own quests and adventures. There are bugs but if you can get around it, It is a great game with awesome potential to be the best game. They are little to no games like mortal cause it is a First person only MMO that takes skill to get anywhere. People who are sub have an advantage but I have seen F2P that have beat pay to plays to the ground cause they have more skill than others. It has good graphics and amazing places if you step out of town you can find, For example the sator dungeoun or Mino, demon circle and risar dungeoun it is all one of a kind. The small dev team has done an outstanding job at this game.
So Remember or things to know:
-Find a guild to get a good stand point from the game and get expereince to build your own guild one day.
-There are grifers at all towns so don't be discouraged if you do get ganked, Its mortal guys xD
-Grind is hard but satisfactory when you reach your goal.
-Everyday will always be new.
-Last is a hardcore full loot PvP open game, You can be killed anywhere and I mean anywhere.
I may have missed some things but check out Jaseace's review cause it gets into more depth but this is all that I can say from playing for 3+ years So come on in you plebs and have some fun!
So do you have what it takes to be a Mortal or will you fall?

author: {'steamid': '76561198008765268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1445086563}
review: I definitely recommend you playing this game! Mortal Online has incredible features that no other MMOs on the market have. An open world without instances in a low fantasy setting, Full loot and player housing, a really deep crafting system where you have to mine ore and extract the materials from there. You even got a dynamic skill-based combat system with first-person view. If you like games like Skyrim, I would definitely try this game out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061886625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 48239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44586, 'last_played': 1596943597}
review:
Been playing this game for a while and while it can be a steep learning curve it is like no other game on the market.  It takes a while to experience things and even after years I am still finding new things in this game.  The combat system is on point and the crafting system is the deepest and best I have ever seen in a game.  It's that good guys.

Now when you start there will be deaths and griefers will hunt you mercilessly at the starting towns because they find ruining your experience amusing.  Just tough through it, this game is not for the light of heart but staying with it opens one of the greatest worlds in gaming with so many possibilities.  Walk around town and talk to people.  I have been walking around Mohrin Khur helping new players out since it released.  So while a lot of people may want to kill you there are tons willing to help as well.  Best of luck and see all of you in game.


UPDATE:  I loved this game and put thousands of hours into it before it was ever on steam but I have to say at this point just stay away.  The community is toxic, it's turned into one clan running over anyone who tries to do something productive.  Star Vault itself caters to the complainers and drastically shifts the game for no apparent reason.  Constantly making whatever you are working towards obsolete.  Their customer support is horrible and their security even worse.  On June 17th, 2018, the entire game was hacked and every single account was compromised.  If this was first or second time this happened but major hacks have occurred on multiple occasions and they obviously don't care as they continue to happen. 

Save yourself the heartache and just pass on this game.  I feel cheated out of my time and this game ruined MMO's for me.  I could write for hours on all the problems, this update is just the tip of the iceberg.  I sincerely hope you never give a dollar to these people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017129552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1441110817}
review:
The game itself is 5 years old it is inspired by Ultima Online & Darkfall Unholy Wars. Mortal Onlione has an open world PvP FFA (Free for All) and real time combat. Choosing a peaceful life of PvE, crafting, and exploration or head out into a world with bloody PvP where there are real consequences to death (if you die you loose everything). Discover new skills, tools, resources, and areas – put your name on the map or etch a legacy all your own. MO Had lots of potential, but it was ruined with a relatively amateurish dev team, which created plenty of issues in the early life of the game. In the games present state it is more of a Pay-2-fully-play-MMORPG.

[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
[*]+ Completely Open World (you can explore everything in the game)
[*]+ High level of customization (construct your own house, high resolution character skins, seasonal gear, etc.)
[*]+ First-person action combat (you get up close and personal in most of your fights)
[*]+ Skill and attributes system (Strength, Dexterity, Intelligence, Health, Mana, Stamina, Movement, etc.)
[*]+ Nudity, gore and brutality...Oh My!!! (Expect to see boobies and dongs, Yes, yes there is a lot of blood, there are cannibalistic instances in the game, your flesh can be used to craft clothes and if you're a well-known player then you might see your head forsale on the forums)
[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*]- Slow progression (everything in the game is super slow unless you have a Premium Account or are a Donator)
[*]- Players can loot your items (if you die from PvP you're fucked, you can loose anything in the games PvP system)
[*]- No sense of direction (the game lacks purpose unless you're in a guild, you can get lost)
[*]- Free players are capped on skills at 60 and must Walk (players that have a Premium Account get +40 to All Skills a total of 100 and can Run)
[*]- PvP is Pay to Win (it's a simple statement, if you plan to PvP you need to have a Premium Account)
[*]- Expensive Objects are Restricted (You can't loot or trade anything over 5g to a vendor unless you have a Premium Account)
[*]- Housing System (You can't own a house unless you have a Premium Account)
[/list]

Dispite the con's you should at least give the game a try, for yourself and see if you like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020078146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 54296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1533, 'last_played': 1501853672}

If you mind dying then play something else, if you don't enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009262080', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1441750497}
review:
The game is old but it is nice. The P2P is present but that is really only if you want to be all in for PVP which is fine, the F2P part of the game is more than enough content for awhile. There is obviously a discrepency between veteran players and newbies where you see vets ganking and scamming newbies at the starting areas, but this is a full loot game so it is bound to happen, you just need to educate yourself and get with a good group of players typically a good newb friendly guild which there are plenty. 

The stability of the connection is mediocre it does ahve some lag sometimes but it isnt too terrible.
The graphics arent the best but they are far from the worst. 
Gameplay has a shit ton of content to learn, however it is pretty straight forward.

I'd honestly reccommend this to anyone looking for a good open-world sandbox type mmo that is F2P and Sub to master :) It is a very social oriented game imho. Enjoy!

Good guild: PYRE

Tip[s: dont go to the graveyards at spawn cities they are infested by troll veterans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031040366', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 31020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1543, 'last_played': 1465235421}
review:
I have played this game for 5 years and only game that keep my intrest for this long.I tried other mmorpg and quit on average one month after since how boring and linear they are.

It has everything you can build your own city and empire and go destroy someone elses.Epic battles that consist from 5v5 to 50v50(Even more with steam).Anything a person builds can be destroyed by another person.

Or you can go chill out route and focus on crafting and PvE which is possible now with brand new Continent.Anything possible to fit all playstyles.

You can be mage,warrior,Mounted combat,Mounted archer,Beastmaster,Thief and more .

The game is 100% better when you find a guild you fit in and highly recommend going to mortal online forums :http://www.mortalonline.com/forums/categories/guild-section.144/

But keep in mind this game is not perfect it does have it bugs and it is hard game to play especially alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068474998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2418, 'last_played': 1521048307}
review:
[h1]Your experience may vary, but you MUST try it[/h1]
[b]TL;DR;[/b]
I have been playing Mortal Online for over a week before it came out on Steam. The short version: If you're into MMOs, this game is definitely something you should give a go, if only for its uniqueness. It plays like an Elder Scrolls game with a feudal Eve Online twist. As objectively as I can, I'd rate this game 85/100.

[b]The Game-play[/b]
This is where Mortal Online shines.  The best Genre Tag to describe the game would be Hardcore MMO RPG. You can be killed anywhere by anyone. You'll drop everything you have on you when you die. And the best part? There is almost no hand holding for the entire experience. Mortal forces players to learn everything by trial and error. And I'm not only talking about game mechanics like how to fight or gather resources. I'm talking about things like crafting recipes and interaction with the game world. For one thing, there [i]are no crafting recipes like you would expect in other games.[/i] There is no giant icon that tells you what item you will get for what resources. Not only can you craft the same thing with different materials, but you can use different amounts of those materials. And both of those things affect the final item stats and looks. That is to say of course, if your character even has the ability to tell the quality of your craft goods... Which brings me to my next point.

[b]Character Progression[/b]
There are no set classes or character levels in Mortal Online. The experience of your character is defined by the skills that he has learned. There are several hundred skills in the game. Skills are generally graded anywhere from 0 to 100 and they're also classified as primary and secondary. Every character has a maximum of 1100 skill points to use for primary skills. Secondary skills don't cost any points. Now the skills themselves influence everything you do. Your ability to run, to fight, to block and jump. Your ability to comprehend how good some armor or sword is. What the affects of a potion are. What nutrition a food item has. How much you can carry while swimming and still not drown. What animal you can manage to keep under control. The list goes on. There are literally HUNDREDS of skills. Your character even has a skill for breathing. No joke. And you can train all of them! If you can find a combination of skills that works for you, congratulations, you have your own "class".

[b]World and Game Content[/b]
Mortal Online has been out and available for several years. Its only had one expansion in that time. And yet its had a consistent and solid player-base the whole time. Do you want to know why? I think one of the main reasons is because nobody has "finished" it. That's right. In the years that the game has been out, not one person has gone through all the content the game has to offer. That's a very refreshing thing to hear, considering [i]that other MMO that shall not be named[/i] has to keep releasing expansions every year just so its players have things to do. I can guess what you're thinking. "Oh, its probably a horrible grind-fest". No. Almost any one skill can be leveled to max in a day or so. The secret is that Mortal Online relies heavily on player knowledge and skill. Your own skill, not your characters. Did you ever read or watch a show about some magician or alchemist, that spends years locked away somewhere researching potent new potions that the world has never seen? Well, now is your chance to do exactly that. And please please, if you figure out how to get mana potions that don't kill the mages, I'll pay you everything I own for the recipe.

[b]The negatives[/b]
[list]
[*] Outdated payment method. The game runs on an "forever trial" with a possible monthly subscription fee. F2P is only good to check the game out. The limitation is that skills are capped at 60 instead of 100. This is a [b]huge[/b] limitation. You hit the ceiling after about a single day, and this prevents you from playing the game competitively. Otherwise, you are completely free to see and do anything you want. Skills caps don't stop you from doing anything, it's just that other players will be better at it.
[*] Bugs. The game is too complex for its own good. The sheer amount of intricacy makes it near impossible to not have issues pop up here and there. Fear not, the bug report forums are quite active and the developers are, in general, responding to player issues.
[*]Steep learning curve. This is an enjoyable part of the game for me personally. There is something nostalgic about the game telling you very little and you having to figure stuff out by trial and error. However, the "modern player" might not see it this way, and thus the lack of things like minimaps and directional arrows on the screen will be seen as a negative for people.
[*]Slightly dated graphics. Once again, this is only from the perspective of your average current day player. Many people don't realize that when you can literally [i]look around for miles[/i], you can't expect to have photo realism. Having said that, the game doesn't look ugly. Its retro. Embrace it.
[/list]

Not to finish on a low note, I'd just like to make it perfectly clear for everyone: given the chance, Mortal Online will raise your bar for all MMO's you play after it. It's completely unsurprising that there are people who haven't played anything else since. And I'm really upset with myself that I didn't find out about it sooner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059398152', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2284, 'last_played': 1586422719}
review:
My review for Russian players. :)

Супер песочница. Убивай людей, грабь караваны. Игра под лозунгом - воруй убивай. Кроме ПВП контента в последних патчах было добавленно море ПВЕ контента. Пещеры, пустыни, джунгли. И везде есть шанс когото встретить и поживится. Единственна игра на которую забив - через месяц возвращаешься , потому что аналогов нет. Реальное скил бейзед ПВП, в игре нету такого понятия как айтем молл и заточка шмота. Рулит тока твой собственный скилл.

Спасибо за внимание. Игра стоит того чтобы в неё играть. Тем более для тех кто не уверен есть фри акаунты.

пара полезных ссылок: http://www.mortalonlinemap.info/   - карта ресурсов и територий + пвп события
http://www.mortaldata.com/calculators/weapon-calculator/   калькуляторы + пара полезных статей.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036576863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1590324609}
review:
Баганая недоделанная поделка  с абсолютно недружелюбными и бесполезными ГМ-мами. Не ведитесь на положительные отзывы - они оставлены немногочисленными фанатами, которые терпели все это годами и готовы терпеть дальше. 
Основные положительные моменты – открытый мир,  фулл лут, уникальное пвп от первого лица, можно строить что угодно и где угодно, достаточно обширная система ремесленничества.  Но как говориться – не бывает худа без добра. Все положительные моменты с лихвой перекрываются отрицательными.
Если бы каждая игра была бы рыцарем и герб на щите, который этот благородный воин понесет в бой, отражал бы ее сущность, то на щите Мортала Онлайн яркими огненными росчерками выгравировался герб дома багов. Багов, с большой буквы. Могу вас уверить, что не было бы более преданного, честного и самоотверженного подданного этого дома, чем Мортал. Мортал это квинтэссенция бага, чистая незамутненная энергия говнокодинга и разгильдяйства. В Мортале забагано абсолютно все, начиная от интерфейса и кончая балансом.  Баги это сущность этой игры, ее единственное неразлучное Я, бережно пронесенное сквозь время, кризисы и невзгоды. 
Поговорим о багах:  
NPC персонажи.  Забаганы от и до. Как союзные NPC, так и агрессивные. Если в больших городах они ведут себя более-менее вменяемо, то в других местах у них могут меняться точки спауна, они зацикливаются, пропадают, проваливаются, улетают в потолки, ходят сквозь вас.  К примеру, не удивляйтесь, если вас атакует невидимый моб, скрывающийся под текстурами земли. Разработчики уже, который год не могут, настроить интеллект NPC, в результате бой с агрессивным мобом превращается в пляску со скачущем по кругу  противником, который периодически, то заходит в вас, то проваливается под землю.
(продолжение в комментариях)

author: {'steamid': '76561198072755962', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 42433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41835, 'last_played': 1504856200}
review:
Так как полноценный обзор здесь к сожалению не написать, сильно ограниченно количество символов предлагаю прочитать мою полную рецензию по этой [url=http://www.strategium.ru/forum/index.php?showtopic=74527]ссылке[/url]
Сразу говорю я фанат MO и этот обзор не является объективным.

Про все особенности вы можете узнать в официальном описании и других рецензиях и обзорах, я же расскажу как реально обстоят дела с моей конечно же точки зрения.
Во-первых вам нужно осознать, что игра имеет очень высокий порог вхождения и после того как вы насмотрелись трейлеров, скачали клиент и с трепетом запускаете игру, уже готовитесь отправиться в путешетвие по этому открытому и свободному миру, при запуске вы будете Г...думали Героем? Нет! Вы будете Гavnom! Вы появляетесь в совершенно диком и жестоком мире, в котором на вас всем nasratь. Дальше калитки нубского сада тебя никто не поведет, тут нет практически подсказок, нормального введения в игру, интерфейс очень грубо сделан, где что посмотреть не понятно, есть хелп чат, но и им можно пользоваться только 48 часов, затем он пропадает, да да, в игре нет глобал или трейд чата и всех подобных удобств из других ммо, здесь даже нет карты! Есть только компас и твоя башка, в которой надо запоминать места, в которых ты побывал и как туда забрался, люди просто теряются уходя за ворота в непонятной глуши и там же подыхают! Ты не знаешь, что где купить, как туда добраться, привыкай! С тобой тут никто не будет нянчиться, а вот снести тебе башку за милую душу! Тебя не спросят есть ли у тебя золото для оплаты чего-либо, его просто заберут с твоего трупа или украдут когда будешь разглядывать достопримечательности. После смерти тебе нужно будет добраться до священника, который тебя воскресит, при чем их бывает не так просто найти и ты, не зная карты, будешь блуждать во мраке часами, очнувшись в новом теле, тебе захочется жрать, но у тебя нет ни крошки в инвентаре, кроме дефолтного меча, на тебе не будет ничего и ты голожопый нуб бегающий по лесу начнешь понимать, что ты попал в ад! Многие на этом этапе и бросают игру. Но вот те кто так просто не сдаются, начинают заниматься мазахизмом, прежде чем вы сможете хоть кому-нибудь дать сдачи, даже самой захудалой дворняге или бомжу вроде вас, не говоря уже о прокачанных игроках в плейтовых доспехах и на бронированных булхорсах наперевес, вы умрете десятки раз и все потеряете. Вас будут убивать, насиловать, грабить, оскорблять, заставлять вас нюхать задницу в режиме мёрси, когда вы в полуживом состоянии стоите на коленях перед побившим вас. Вы будете ругаться на интерфейс и кучи багов, страшную графику и анимацию, но все продолжать разбираться, когда вы начнете понимать, что это просто ужас какой то, за которой вам еще предлагают заплатить, тут отсеивается вторая волна игроков. После нескольких месяцев игры отсеиваются еще люди, которые наивно посчитали, что будут грабить кОрОваны и строить империи как только прокачают персонажа и оплатят подписку. Но вот те единицы, которые все же остаются в МО несмотря ни на что ощущают всю грандиозность, хардкорность и свободу, которую предлагает игра, эти ребята из мазохистской части игры переходят в садистскую. Начинают десятками вырезать несчастных нубов, при этом издавая дьявольский смех, начинают развязывать межклановые войны, вплоть до тотальных, в них просыпаются амбиции, которые готовы нисвергнуть самих богов и залезть в красный топ PKшеров (player killers). Уахахаххаха!!! Мне нужны еще головы маленьких детей!!! 

P.S. Фух...вообщем ребята не упускайте свой шанс, такого больше не предлагает, ни один проект на просторах интернета, даже ЕВА тут рядом не стояла, только великая Ультима может пойти в сравнение, но она уже технически совсем мертва. Игра настолько уникальна и специфична, что даже в таком убогом виде и низком техническом состоянии, стоит затраченных на нее часов и денег. К тому же платить вас не принуждают, всегда можно побегать на FTP акке и попробовать большую часть PVE контента, ну и PVP ощущений тоже, по большей части печальных :)
При выходе в Steam стоимость подписки в странах СНГ резко упала с 700р до 250р, спс Гейбу
Если вы хардкорщик Даркфола, Евы или Ультимы здесь вы найдете себе пристанище среди океана мейнтсримового гovna выпускаемого в стим. Надесюь вам понравился мой мрачный обзор.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970842394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 187706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3817, 'last_played': 1677937245}
review:
The full PvP aspect gives this game a horror/survival feeling that I dont get from other MMOs with hundreds or thousands of players on the same server. The PvP is aim-based and even tho gear plays its part, a skilled veteran will outplay a group of beginners, not because of superior gear or higher level, but from pure skill.

I love how there are no levels or classes. You choose what skills to learn by actually doing them or by reading books and you can choose between hundreds of skills to build a unique character.

The crafting system is absolutly huge. You can combine almost any weaponhead on any handletype and craft it out of any material you find. Players constantly discover new weapons and armors to counter whatever is the currently most popular gear. You just might find a way to craft a better armor or weapon then anyone else has found yet.

The Full loot aspect can be frustrating if you die transporting valuables, but that means you can also find good loot from killing other players. As a veteran player I have learned a few tricks to stay safe when I want to.

Mortal Online is by far the best MMO Ive ever played and I recommend it to everyone. Just remember that its a hardcore game and you will need to stay on your toes every second of it.

PS, Did I mention it has full nudity?

author: {'steamid': '76561198005369385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 135227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3865, 'last_played': 1487151076}
review:
I will keep it short and real. This is an 8/10 game. If you liked Ultima Online before trammel, if you like Eve Online,  and if you like and could handle darktide Ac, then you will love this game.  

It is an old school mmo, which I have missed so much. Actions have consequences, death hurts, player politics impacts the world and you! You can be more or less anything you want, BUT you cannot be everything you want. You must choose what paths to follow. You want to be a great swordsmen? You can do that, you want to be a master smith? Sure thing, but you wont be both on the same character.

The game offers tons of freedom, and with such there will be childish griefers that camp the noob spawns and pick the pockets of the unaware in main cities etc, but the freedom to do so is what makes this great. You can be a total tool, OR you can walk a more noble path and help defend the innocent from the griefers of the land. Join a guild or form one, build a house, or a tower, or a town. Change the face of Nave!... yes you can do this if you work at it.

I have now been playing for several weeks and as a mmo vet of most that have been released, I find this game so refreshing.

Why then is it not a 10?..... Bugs. The game is still not 100%. There are mesh holes across the map. Getting stuck or losing a pet into such is not uncommon, though the gms are quick and helpful in fixing this. Pathing issuse occur, some of the features are not fully enabled ( like dynamic weather).   There is also a painful lack of knowledge available where I feel it should be readily available. Guild interactions, wars, Housing placement etc are all far more difficult than they should be. 

I also think the newb experience is very painful. Enough so that it likely scares off a lot more than it should. Players are given a short grace period of peace, but they often find themselves targets as soon as this runs out. They are given the impression that THIS is the game, and sadly quit before they can get out into the world and realize what a wealth of adventure awaits them.

These issues aside it is a fantastic game with enormous potential. If you are new, Stick with it!  Start in Tindrem as advised, it is a safer city.. and DO not let the morons that seek to scare you away suceed.
Learn what you can, bank often, and seek friends. There are many villains out there but there are also tons of very nice and helpful players.

Last thing. I was shocked and pleased to find out that there is a very decent role-play community out there. Good luck all and have fun!

(feel free to message me if you have questions or leave a reply/question and I will check back now and again)
Galiswyn Ta'Kier 
Order of the Grifffin

author: {'steamid': '76561198044052080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 38926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2098, 'last_played': 1497930971}
review:
I've played this game for years prior to Steam Release, and it's honestly one of the deepest MMOs I've ever played. Every system in-game, from the crafting, extraction, combat, cooking, alchemy, taming, etc etc is incredibly fleshed out, with TONS of room for experimentation along the way.

All the best gear and items are player-crafted, resulting in a player-run economy. The Crafting is incredibly dynamic, with countless options. The world is harsh and unforgiving, where you always need to watch your back, and any other player coming across you could be your doom...

No other game has scratched the itch that Mortal does, and I'm glad to see it finally release on Steam. 

The free-trial is never ending, so if you'd like to get a taste of the game, download and try it! Just be aware that as a trial-account, you won't be competetive in PVP or crafting against people with Full-accounts. You can try almost everything, though, so there is that. People will whine that's Pay2Win, but it's far from it. It's just a classic Sub-based MMO, with a free trial that DOESN'T end after a week or two, it goes forever.

I definitely recommend trying it out, it's a very unique game, and the dev team deserves all the attention they can get! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198051308780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 482635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2086, 'last_played': 1643356202}
review:
Death Comes for Us All

Mortal Online is a game that stays true to it's name by reminding you how Mortal you are.  This is an exciting, open, challenging and dangerous game where you are free to make your own path.  You decide what you want to do, how to play the game.  You can become a lowly beggar or the king of a nation.  It's all in your hands.

The game emphasizes freedom, but also there's a harsh level of responsibility.  Attack a creature that's too hard? Start a fight against a player?  Better be ready to lose what you're carrying if they kill you.  The world is large enough to easily get lost, and that's an awesome thing.

All in all, this is a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995865107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 357364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1523782834}
review:
公式版ではダウンロードに何十時間もかかったりシステム言語の問題で遊ぶまでの敷居がめちゃくちゃ高かったけどsteam版は１時間位でセットアップが完了した。これはすごい。

ゲーム内容は一言でいうとフリーダム、自由です。
決まった職業等はなく、上限のあるポイントを割り振ることで（行動等により変化）かなり自由度の高いキャラクターに育てるかんじ
空腹等による体型変化システムあります。
犯罪等を犯した時のフラグシステムも完備。
お金システムもちゃんとあるのでプレイヤー間の取引も活発。
どこでも自由にPvPできる、倒せばもちろん全部奪える。
guardの居る町の中なら比較的安心して過ごすことも可能。でもスリがいたりする。
ペットのブリードシステムあります。
ポーション作れます。
武器、鎧作れます。
家建てれます、壊せます。

さあ、いますぐインストールだっ！

author: {'steamid': '76561198004840382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 99906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1914, 'last_played': 1574982151}
review:
Mortal Online is a unique sandbox MMO for adult audience.
There are no preset factions, the players form them on their own.
This allows for a "Game Of Thrones" style conflict over terretorry, ressources and power.

pros

[list]
    [*]player factions
    [*]full loot, Once you have gotten used to the risk of full loot PvP you wont want to play anything else anymore because normal PvP will seem dull and completely pointless.
    [*]politics
    [*]player conflicts
    [*]sieges
[/list]

cons

[list]
    [*]small dev team, big patches take a while
[/list]

Do not expect instant gratification, as a new player there are alot of things to learn and explore in this harsh game world.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960403640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 28819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25422, 'last_played': 1593093683}
review:
Ultima Online vets will get this game. You don't start with much in the way of guidance and you are pretty much left to figure it out after the (admittedly terrible) starter quest and introduction. Those who can make it past the slow start are rewarded with a much deeper game that really is very solid despite it's many little bugs and quirks.

If you are looking for a wow clone, this is not it, stop and turn around. If you are looking for a sandbox style mmo with full loot pvp that plays very similar to UO pre Tram (in 3D ofc) then you will likely enjoy your time in Mortal. Not for the impatient! Don't play the starter quest and quit or you'll really miss out on the meat of the game.

Edit 8/8/18: Game is not too lively, population spread too thin with sarducca and walls. Roll back to no sarducca and get rid of walls and bring the glory back to MO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087571489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 55960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54658, 'last_played': 1570508055}
review:
I once had a good review, to try help during steam release, but years later since then - Star Vault has this bad rut of 1 step forward and 2 steps back.

Bugs, glitches and half done unpolished content from 5+ years ago, still exist today. Instead of much needed fixes of things from the past, we get a few tweaks or band-aid fixes and  instead get new systems & mechanics that are half done or plagued by older systems that weren't fixed.

SV every so often have a good patch, but the honey moon phase wares off and the old bugs and unfinished content sticks out like a sore thumb.

On top of this, major security breaches for years, accounts, emails etc are hacked. Players losing accounts, years worth of materials and wealth, and some not  getting their accounts, let alone years worth of investments back. Another thing, if a cheater is banned, they're back not long after with a fresh account, blatantly cheating again, exploiting, even using variations of their original toons names that were banned. SV just turns a blind eye.

I've had hopes for this games success for over 7 years, I hoped SV would smarten up after steam release, but unfortunately they didn't.

review:
One of the best hardcore MMO's out there.

However, there is a warning. This game is not free to play. To have access to any significant gameplay features and to not be severely gimped in almost every way; you need to pay the monthly fee. Otherwise the game is just a glorified chat room.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080026808', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 77308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2095, 'last_played': 1541665186}
review:
iv been playing Mortal Online since beta and have been an active player in the community since than and till now havent quiet the game. Since i found Mortal Online i havent realy played any other Online games, maybe tryed them out for a bit but nothing held my attention as long as this game.

What is Mortal Online?
its an mmorpg full loot true real open world sandbox game. you can do whatever you want. you have no classes you make your own class with the skill points that are provided. 
think of it as Ultima Online but in 3d (Henrik the CEO is acctualy a real fan of Ultima Online and you will see alot of similarities towrds Ultima Online)

you are nowhere safe even in town with guards its possible if your smart to kill you, or yes steal stuff from people what they have in there inventory. you got free house placement in the world. no instances just one huge world!!!!

this is not your typical theme-world game where you point click bash your keyboard and hit nrs to win. your skill truly matters, you need to block, and acctualy hit the person with your weapon. 

so kinda like skyrim if ultima online doesnt ring a bell.

i want to point out they are a indie company, so it does have bugs but trust me since iv played it alot of people who might have quiet came back because there is truly no other game out there like this. 

another thing is please do not say its pay to win, this is a game where you have to have an subscription, but it gives you the option to TRY THE GAME OUT FOR FREE FOR AN UNLIMITED TIME!!!!! 

you are a bit restricted when it comes to skilling your toon so instead getting 100 in a skill you can only get 60, while once your pay to play it will go up to 100. if you decide to take a break its no problem, once you resub all your skills go back to 100. 

if you want a true skill game where you can do whatever you want, acctualy aim and fight like in skyrim and dont mind full loot (whatever you have on you when the person kills you its theres) than this is the game for you.

i also want to point out to people who might think ehhhhhhhhh what?!!! i will loose everything i have one me?!!!!?!? nooooooo, never!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

stuff to get in this game is not as hard like in other games for example World of Warcraft where you have to grind hrs just to get 1 certain armor part. once you have your gold its no big deal if you loose stuff, just remember take with you only what you need.

its really a game you havent seen before try it!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005776407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 18518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3580, 'last_played': 1517160167}
review:
Mortal Online is unlike any other MMORPG out there. It is a truly hardcore game akin to the glory days of Ultima Online. It is the only game I have found that makes me feel the way UO did so long ago. There are real consequences to your actions in game and, while this may be seen as a negative by some, I feel it is the only thing that makes an MMO worth playing. The world of Nave is constantly changing as politics and large scale server conflicts radically alter the game world around you. Your allegiances and your behavior truly matter in this game and the people you play with will not forget. 

If you are the kind of player who enjoys a challenge and can withstand a little punishment, Mortal Online is the game for you. It has a steep learning curve at first and can be a little discouraging when you lose your hard-earned posessions, but it is a truly rewarding experience once you figure out what you're doing. I highly recommend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982221433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1441119092}
review:
Okay so I got to try this game.
Mortal Online is a sandbox MMO that requires a subscription fee, it's hardly F2P as you only have a trial account basically. This game allows for a lot of actions, and is great for people heavy into roleplaying.

The type of MMO that this game is, has HUGE pros, and HUGE cons because of it. I have to say just try the game yourself with the trial account for a few weeks and then decide, because this game is a love or hate thing, I highly doubt many people will be in the middleground on that.

The only real complaint I have, beyond small things, that is not really to do with the game desing and such- is the graphics are incredibly outdated. This can really mess with immersion for me personally. While the nostalgia value is great, having it rain indoors because ceilings don't stop rain, or your head clipping through your body, or objects being so pixelated you cannot tell what they are, these things can be distracting.

All that being said, give it a try and decide for yourself. I don't think I will be able to get into it, but only due to the fact it drops you into an open sandbox game, and I need instruction to be able to get into things, without it I am helpless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045214333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 45978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40296, 'last_played': 1486017356}
review:
Sandbox is a strange term many companies throw around these days. Used mostly to gain popularity, most people don't really understand what true freedom is in a sandbox game. Mortal Online is one of the few examples of what a Sandbox is suppose to be.

-The Entire Economy is player based. Everything in the game, is run by the players, from the crafting of armor, to the price of cotton, the player determines everything. It is a rare concept in a video game, as, if players so chose, they could easily ruin the entire game economy, but Mortal Online throws caution to the wind and allows players to run the entire economy alone. This has been an amazing feature in the game, and has developed entire proffessions and guilds in the game, dedicated to selling and crafting items to keep the economy solid. There is even a player owned bank in the game that manages players money in return for them being able to use that money on "Credit".

-Towns are local. Be scared, if you go to Tindrem, the games largest town, and wish to trasnsport your items to another town...you are dead out of luck with the mailbox. The mailbox/postman only sends the mail to other players inside the SAME town. This is a unique feature as it forces players who wish to trade to actively grab the items they want to trade, and transport them to the town of their choice.

-Full Loot...Yes, that's right, the entire game is open world, hardcore, PvP with full loot. That transporter bring items from Tindrem to the next town is fair game to kill and take everything he owns...however, all of your gear and items/hardwork are also at stake.

Unique Game Features:
-Housing
-Fishing
-Pet Taming
-Mounted Combat
-Full Loot
-Free Placement Housing
-Keeps
-City Building
-Largest Crafting System in any game to date
-Friendly Community (After you dig past the handful of true scum)
-Realism
-Religion
-Player Driven Economy
-90% of in-game items are player crafted
-First Person Warfare

Cons (Yeah, I'm not all gung ho for the game):

-Bugs...Not even game breaking bugs, just silly things every once in a while. Nothing that crashes my game/pc...but floating plants every once in a while...
-Agressive PvP (Players will openly hunt down weaker players for fun)
-Long Term Community Memory (The community will remember the bad actions you took for years to come)
-Lacking City Protection (Guards will do a piss poor job of protecting you, hire/ask players to assist/protect you)
-Sudden Skill Curves (PvP and high tier PvE require advanced teamwork and large amounts of game knowledge, compared to other game features that simply require you have common sense.)
-Griefing...The game has serious griefing issues, and, although it is a small ammount of the community that does indeed grief (around .2%), it is very noticible as they stalk around the starter cities and are relentless in their tactics.

All and all, it is a wonderful game, however, the cons are very restrictive to the player base.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109724124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 223073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1681214119}
review:
Mortal Online is an incredible game, albiet very moody and covered in little bugs. I have never encountered a game with as much potential and freedom. 

Spend hours living the life:
Of a simple gatherer, tending to your pet dog every now and again as he follows you around.
Of a politican, traveling town to town ushering people to join guilds, making friends, mending fences or breaking them.
Of a craftsmen, hammering down and creating your very own unique recipes for armor and weapons.
Of a warrior, slaying countless monsters, or people. Defend the weak, or destroy them.
Of a wildsmen, living the land and taming all sorts of wild creatures to accompany you, or to sell.
Of a mage, sending arcs of electricity and balls of flame into your enemies, or healing wounded allies.
Of a chef, a sparse profession, sweating as you struggle to find the perfect amount of salt to season your 14 part dish.
Of a dominator, using magic and intimidation to force great, great beasts under your control.
Of a glassblower, making vials to sell.
Of an alchemist, concocting potions to heal, or kill. Become renown for your potency, or keep humble.
Of a racist human woman who robs and kills all non-humans.
Of a thick, righteous half-breed who protects their home at all costs, otherwise docile.
Of a maniac axe murderer, unable to resist killing all they meet.

Of... just about anything or anyone you can imagine! Create your own builds, take some skills from different tree's and blend, suit your character to your own playstyle, whatever that may be.

If you're content playing alone, you can kill hours on this game, doing your own modest thing.
If you're into grouping up and having fun, you can kill days on this game with a nice guild.
If you're into politics, drama and war, you can kill months on this game with a big guild.

This game has something for everyone.

TL;DR:
Give the game an hour or two to hook you and adjust you to the small bugs and imperfections, and you'll never need another game again. Do what you want, when you want, however you want. I've been doing just that for three years now.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197964366461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 83108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2571, 'last_played': 1588948340}
review:
The only thing easy in this game is dying.

I've been playing Mortal for almost a month now, and I have to say, I'm hooked. Full loot open world HARDCORE game. Not for the feint of heart, or the easily frustrated. So far I've died to random mobs and lost all my stuff, been ganked several times and lost all my stuff, had my mount killed and lost all my stuff, and I attacked someone by accident and got owned by the guards and lost all my stuff. The only thing that's easy in this game is dying, and that's what makes it so much fun to me.  It's like that ex-girlfriend who treats you like crap, sleeps with your friends, and disappears for days, but she's always a blast to be with when she's there.

For those wanting to give it a try, I challenge you to play it for a few hours. Once you get your running skills up, and learn to ride, and get passed the gankers in the graveyards, the game is huge open world with zero safe spots. You can die at any time anywhere and it's EXCITING. Specialization is the key. Join a guild that's helpful to new players, there are vets that like helping new players out. Sure there are douchenozzles in every game, but it really feels to me like there's less of them in Mortal Online than other hardcore full loot pvp games I've played. For every one of the former there are 10 vets who will take time out to help you if you ask.

The free to play aspect of the game makes it really easy for new players to decide what to spend their skill points on with hardly any limiting factors other then effictively capping the skills at 60. Your points still go up to the 100 cap, but need to be unlocked with a subscription plan. 

The combat is feels similar to Mount & Blade to me, but with a little less reliance on being mounted all the time. The creatures are plentiful, and better still, very dangerous if you don't know what you're doing. Plenty of adventures abound, and exploring is massive fun.

I reccommend this game fully.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009892017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 10939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1841, 'last_played': 1497296397}
review:
Mortal Online is the best Sandbox MMORPG I have ever played.
You are free to do whatever you want, be a thief, a crafter, a butcher, a cook, warrior, hunter, you can be whatever you want and everyone is different from the other, there is no class in this game, you choose what skills you want to level up.
You choose what you are going to do, there is no pre-made quests, people make "quests", someone want to buy pig carcass, then if you want, you can go kill some pigs and sell it's carcass to the player. You can put a price in someone head, YOU can do whatever you want to do, be whatever you want to be.
There is some bugs, and things like that, but you get used to some things and its nothing game breaking.
About PVP, is totally Skill based, more than any other medieval game, like chivalry or mount and blade warband. I have seen things like a naked man with only a steel sword beat an heavy armored man (then like 4 guys killed him xD). It is totally skill based, you need to defend in the right direction in the right time, you need to watch your stamina, be careful to not make some friend fire and more...
Crafting (armor, weapons, shields and bows), alchemy, gathering, mining, you will see all these thins in MO and more, in MO world every piece of information is gold, if you want to make steel you need information, if you want to make potions or something like that you need information and this information can be really expensive. All these things where discovered by players during this years of mortal online. The Devs said that there is a lot of things undiscovered yet.
And there is a lot of things that I didn't mention, like house building, base, castles, dungeons, horse breeding, taming, engineering, sieges, beast domination...

If you like to play a true Sandbox MMORPG I recommend you Mortal Online.

OBS: English is not my primary language XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198101059365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 87850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1833, 'last_played': 1594754416}
review:
This is one game that stands out from all the rest. To me it seems to include the best from several genres:

1) It's an action game revolving around skill. In order for your character to do something, you as a player must perform an action with sufficient skill. No tab-targeting or anything of the sort. Just you, your knowledge of the game and your skills as a player.

2) It's a role-playing game. Even if you don't like RPGs, Mortal Online has a way of naturally leading you to assume a role. It could be the role of a fledgling player afraid of the seasoned murderers, or the role of the avenger who musters friends and acquaintances to deal with said murderers, or maybe even the role of the thief snooping around other people's pockets and coming up with plans to break into their homes and rob them of their hard-earned currency. From the moment that you start playing, you will also be role-playing, possibly without even realizing it.

3) It's a strategy game. While one well trained person can be a formidable opponent, the combined force of many men who have developed not only their personal fighting skills, but also a common way of conducting themselves during a battle, can be game-changing. Strength lies in numbers. Those who know this and use it to their advantage may very well become the next rulers of the land.

4) This game is about choice. You have an amazing level of freedom regarding your playstyle. You may want to become the best warrior Nave has seen. In that case, one option would be to work on your fighting skills, then work on building up a stock of quality armor and weapons, and finally join a guild renowned for its combat prowess in order to become even better at what you do. On the other hand, you may want to live in the wilderness by yourself, hunting game and exploring the vast expanses of this rich world. If that is the case, you could start by learning how to tame animals and to cook basic dishes, then riding your horse into the unknown until you find the right spot and decide to call it your home.

The game does have its drawbacks. You may feel that certain gear or attribute combinations are too powerful in certain conditions. You may feel that there are a few bugs too many. You may also feel that customer support isn't the fastest around. But you must also consider that this incredibly complex game has been hand-crafted by just a few individuals working in an indie company. You must realize that these devs are constantly browsing the game's forums, sifting through players' feedback and trying to tweak every little detail so that it can work completely as intended.

Having played this game for more than two and a half years, I'm confident that it can be a huge success, should enough people give it a chance. This will also allow the devs to continue with their planned new features and their ongoing mission to polish the player experience as much as possible.

If you value the freedom of making your own choices about every single thing in a game world, then Mortal Online is your ultimate playground. Give it a try and you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033675559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1441067194}
review:
2/10

Concept is cool/interested but the way its implimented is horrible. Dubbed "Mortal Offline" for the first year. That should tell you something. Common to joke that its still a beta(even amoungst staff). Prices are way off balance, they charge you as if its a AAA game, when really its not great. Should charge 5$ maybe / month for sub. 

Staff- 99% volunteer, if you have a issue(like being stuck on terrian) while they're not online, you may sit stuck for 3hrs. You needed your character? Welp too bad. "He who cries loudest gets the most help" remember this when interacting with them. They dont have strict policies, so if you complain enough you'll get more than your neighbor.(I was a Senior high counselor trust me, I know lol). 

Bugs- Often riddled with bugs, it becomes a thing where you must know the bugs in order to try to make them impact your gameplay less. (example: logging out after war decs, thats been like that for 2 years? ) 

Issues- they sweep issues under the rug until they become a problem. Their speed has a fundemental flaw right now in the way its calculated, as do the hitboxes(hint some settings on your game/computer effect both). They wont address it until it becomes a glaring issue

devolopment- While they try hard, they often care more for what sounds good on paper, than what would meanigfully impact gameplay(lets look at the huge awakening patch that took a year and a half to come out). 

community - trolls mainly. Some gems in the rough, but in general its a lot of 'hey look how much better I am than you!' or 'Get owned' or people who religiously defend SV because they want the game to succeed. The fact is they had money, and lots of devs at one time. They just simply failed, and now are trying to patch up a sunk ship. Instead of patching holes though they sometimes paint the outside a new color to make players feel like the ship is awesome. 

Balance - horrible at balancing. They'll adjust something that is rediciously over powered/wrong a year later. Like great swords, butchery, etc. They simply dont play enough or have the game devolopment experience to properly balance things in a meaniglful way. Its like a construction worker trying to be a ballerina. 

Enforcement  - they let cheaters back in the game all the time. A guy jumped over your keep wall stole the stuff out of your house? Banned for a week. Did it again + showed some friends? Still playing, no problem. (both times with hard evidence, from the perspective of a GM, pm for link if you like). Dupers, and people who accepted obviously duped gold/matterials are still in game. A lot of the materials also are still laying around.  

Welp, go see for yourself if you like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002540126', 'num_games_owned': 665, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1576391536}
review: This game is awesome big learning curve and very little direction but once you get used to the game you will understand why. The game is very open and leaves alot up to the player. THERE ARE NO QUEST IN THIS GAME. I want to make that clear for any new players that try to enter this as a normal MMo everything is player driven. Even some cites are player controled. This is an open loot game like Elder scrolls or Fallout, so when you die anyone can loot everything you have in your bags. The one thing this game lacks is PvE but StarVault has been adding more and more PvE. I have been enjoying some of the duingeons in the game and can't wait to see more. The game map is massive and the banks are not linked to each other so if you have gear in one city you will have to go to that city to get it. There is just so much in thius game that gets over looked and I say give it a try I highly recommand it for anyone that is looking for a hardcore first person MMO. There is also gore and full nudity that adds to the overall feel of the game, which is overlooked and many games like this. Thius game is free to play but I like to call it an unlimited trial for the simple fact that your skills are limited to 60, granted you can lvl them to 100 but only 60 will be used until you sub.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066746468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1493876921}
review:
An unpolished and very unrefined game with alot of bugs and gamebreaking issues. 
But also one of the games with alot of potential due to the large sandbox character and freedom presented to the people playing it. 

Lets start with the positive things. 

-The game has an large world with no instances where everyone plays together and can also block each other if he wants to. 
- The game has an extensive and very free crafting system which allows crafters to actually distuingish themselves from others by improving their crafted and extracted materials by knowing techniques and recipes other dont know and wont find out. 
- The game uses an realtime, first person combat system. You swing a sword block an enemys sword or take other actions like in an First Person Shooter game.
- Sandbox. You build, you craft, you gather and you steal whatever you can. No campaign and no level limits. If your an veteran of the game you can have yourself usable within 2 days.  Because aside from the skills learning which is very annoying sometimes. Everything else depends on you yourself. 


Now for the Cons. 

- The devs are very stubborn. Opinions from players are pretty much never listened to and they are not welcome either. So if your complaining too much you can be banned pretty fast and pretty long without even being told a reason. 
- The game has alot of bugs. Yes really alot of bugs. From floating objects to falling through the ground or getting stuck in walls which will result in your death and loss of everything you carried with no chance to get it back because support does not reinburse losses from bugs or anything else. 
- The game systems are very easy to circumvent which is not against the rules and thus allowing to kill others and plunder them within the city with the guards not taking any action as well as moving your mounts into safe positions where they cannot be attacked but still be loaded with stuff.  The game offers an list where the systems your not allowed to circumvent are listed. Anything not listed there is allowed. 
- The community is very bad. As the game has been around for several years before it was released on steam. And has done a very poor job on bugfixing and improvements. The most people which stayed are the guys who are used to use these bugs and systems to their advantage. This also leads to them not liking the idea of more people joining the game which results in new players being killed everywhere and anywhere alot. 
- Very very veeery slow patching and bugfixing. Importand patches only come around once or twice a year. And even hotifxes dont come faster than one or two months after an problem occured. Alot of bugs still accurate today have been there even in the closed beta. 
- Not playable with older computers or slow internet connections. While you may still login and play. You will notice very fast that you will lag around alot. Monsters attack you despite being miles away from you. And things you want to gather will tell you they dont exist because your position in the world is different from where your client tells you you should be. 
This can be so bad that your moved back over 1km because you hit an stone or wall somewhere on the server while you client just traveled all the way to another city. 
- Freedom comes at an price. Castles and fortifications are build all around the world. Blocking content of the game or and looking very stupid where they are standing.
- Advertised as Free to Play title. This game is an free trial. And without Premium you are useless as crafter as well as an fighter or whatever because whatever you do will be worth next to nothing. 
- Macros.... Better have some ready, they are legal in the game and the game design is laid out for their use. So if you do not use them you will be highly disadvantaged. (Pls make sure to check the list for prohibited macros first since some macros like automatic healing bots etc are NOT ALLOWED) 

My advice. Get the Game for free. Take a good look for at least 2 weeks. And only after that decide wether its worth investing money or not. Because the game looks very good at start and in videos. But once you get into the actual game and start understanding whats going on around you. The illusions fades very fast and the game becomes very annoying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067176329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 70233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2911, 'last_played': 1545625280}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060362547', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 21308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1430, 'last_played': 1560016132}
review:
Don't let this steam playtime fool you, I have played Mortal Online off and on for years.  I have probably hundreds if not thousands of hours on it... After the great game Star Wars Galaxies shut down I had searched for a sandbox game, with a unique crafting system in an open-world sandbox.  I found it here.  Mortal Online is an AMAZING Medieval Hardcore Sandbox MMORPG and will show you that not all mmorpgs are WoW-copies.  Great combat system, the greatest crafting system I have EVER seen.  A beautiful open world filled with endless adventures.  Played in first-person mode, it uses a skill-based melee combat system, block left/right/center, attack left/right/center, or use magic or bows.  If you have the attention span of an adult, you will not find a game better than this anywhere.  

Pros: Open World | Best Crafting System Ever | Taming and COUNTLESS other features that will keep you playing for very long periods of time |  Great player economy | Great Pve | Great PvP | Territory control | City/keep building | And so much more.

Cons: Typically bad community.. it's best to play this with friends because many people are assholes on this game (this is what has ruined it for me in the past). | There used to be alot of bugs in this game but they have made absolutely amazing progress in fixing the vast majority of them, however of course some still remain such as the Trade Broker being stuttery which is quite annoying to me | Steep learning curve, but if you look at sandbox survival games like Rust, alot of people enjoy that type of thing | Free to play model disadvantages free players |

All in all, Mortal Online is an amazing game that is totally free to try.  You have no excuse for not trying it! Give it a try! See if you like it!  I sure do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065685414', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 35469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1415, 'last_played': 1624204123}
review: Simply the best MMO i have played, its the only one i have been able to play as a matter of fact, and I have played EQ, EQII, WoW, DAoC, PoC, PotBS, and other titles I dont really remember.  To me its more like what ESO should have been like.  If you enjoyed the elderscrolls games, but didnt really pay attention to the quests then I think you may enjoy this game a lot.  If you need quests to drive your motive then forget about as there are no real quests here.  Good luck, have fun, and I hope to see you in the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004736310', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 73406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1587419904}
review:
Listen boys, this game has had some real growing pains. This game launched back in to 2010 with many bugs and a new dev team with wide eyes. A lot of mistakes were made and a lot of players were lost, but this mistakes were the result of growing pains, brand new developers trying to understand the industry.

As time has gone on the game has gotten better, now we are at the point where the game is a finished product. Saying that now compared to 3 years ago would of been a joke, but SV stepped up to the plate, grinded out countless night and have made quite an addictive game.

Just be careful, this game is potent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004815337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1479647841}
review:
Make no mistake- the game is subscription based, not really F2P.
You will have a permanent free to play account; Just bare in mind it will not be as good in any aspect of the game as the premium one (your skills will be locked at lvl 60 instead of 100)and some functions (IE thievery) will be simple disabled for you.
Other than that it is worth a try.
Things worth noting:
-a small team, and that is reflected in the speed stuff changes/improves in the game.
-full loot ffa pvp with no real safe zones (enter at your own risk)
-twitch based combat
-no classic levels. Instead a skill system reminiscent of games like Morrowind or Ultima Online.
-quite a few interesting things to do, from taming and thievery, to building player towns.
-FPV only and with good reasons.
-Quite a few small glitches and bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970023722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1251, 'last_played': 1532679465}
review:
To me, it is currently the best MMORPG available and here is why.

What I value in a mmorpg is a combination of 'Sandbox', 'Fantasy-setting' and 'Immersion' and this game meets those demands. It is unique to me because while I'm an altoholic in most other mmorpg's I'm still currently playing the character I created during initial launch. I made a name for myself as a experienced tamer and mount breeder, selling high quality mounts (mount attributes system) and sticked with it since I enjoyed it so much.

In this game you will not become just another "hero" wearing the same end-game equipment as the others spamming the same skills. Instead you can become a unique personality known to others whether it's due to your unique fighting skills (think mount & blade style of combat), knowledge (guild politics, secrets and exploration) or professions (creating the highest quality potions or equipment).

Pro's:
- Open sandbox world
- Skill based combat
- Full loot (adding risk)
- Territory control (own keeps, earn taxes)
- Player housing
- First person (adds to immersion - personal opinion)
- Realistic art style
- Breeding system & Mount attributes
- Player Economy (all worthwile armor and weapons made by players)
- In-Depth Crafting systems (Armor/Weapon Crafting, Alchemy, Bowyery, etc.)

Con's:
- The (current) focus on PvP and Territory Control (which is a pro to others)
- Slow development (small dev team)
- Subscription pretty much required if you want to compete with others
- Lack of meaningful PvE
- Bugs and glitches (though declining in numbers)

A review from an active player since 2010, which alone is reason enough to give it a positive recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006475560', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 101136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78177, 'last_played': 1587490019}
review:
Game is in a trash state.

Overpowered pets, low population, people just sit behind their walls doing nothing or mining the rocks they walled off, sieging is junk theres no way to defend a siege weapon unless the people who are being sieged are offline, fire arrows and invisble guards take down a mang in half a minute. TC guards are too strong and literally replace player skill for a static thunderbolt turret, mounted is a skillless whoever has the better horse and gear wins buttcheese fest.

Devs won't listen to balance suggestions and continue every patch to unbalance the game even further.

The melee PvP is still one of the best I've encountered in any game, it's a shame that foot pvp is so few and far between.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066258459', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 157952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4115, 'last_played': 1575219737}
review:
Been playing this game for a while now (despite steam hours) and it's exactly everything I look for in an mmo.
 
Sandbox with full loot? Check.
Detailed crafting system that can encompass an entire character build? Check.
Skill based pvp/pve combat with many many varied builds? Check.
Player on Player looting and thieving? I'll kill you if you steal my gold.
Mounts? Pets? Taming giant 2 ton bears? exploding heads with your fists? 

This is not a game for everyone, that's plain and simple. It is very hardcore, you WILL die MANY times to both the environment and other players. This is how you learn, this is how you flourish. Mortal Online is a game that will not hold your hand and coddle you. It is brutal and unforgiving, and this is why I play it, not many other games will give you an actual thrill for adventuring, or pure excitement when you finally battle down that mob the 2 shotted you. No game but Dark Souls (on launch week for the 360 when no one had any clue what was going on) gave me the same feels as this game.

Imagine Mount and Blade meets Ultima Online, hardcore sandbox MMo fans you have found your home.

Edit: Just to add, this game IS free to play, but I would say the f2p is more of a trial than anything else. Your skills will cap at 60 (albiet they will continue to level regardless so if you do go p2p you will level to those skills automatically to wherever you capped as f2p). The game is not p2w but there is a sub wall. I urge you to try it, and if it's your style you'll see why the people who play this are subbed. No other game, especially an MMo, gives you the freedom that Mortal Online gives you.
